Revision 1.2 2004/12/02 23:29:11 packel added key attributes to compound verb entries
Revision 1.1 2004/11/22 17:07:40 packel converted to P4/XML
Revision 1.20 2004/10/18 18:17:47 packel added div0s; changed orth ʼa)da/mas,ʼ to a)da/mas
Revision 1.19 2004/10/07 14:18:11 packel removed *s in entry keys
Revision 1.18 2004/10/05 21:34:13 packel Aligned dictionary entries with the LSJ.
Revision 1.17 2004/09/08 15:49:42 packel Changed doctype to TEI P4
Revision 1.16 2004/09/01 15:44:25 packel Fixed thirty-odd words that had multiple entries but no number afterward to differentiate the entries (e.g., si=gma, si=gma is now si=gma1, si=gma2).
Revision 1.15 2004/06/15 19:31:34 lcerrato changed nothwithstanding to notwithstanding
Revision 1.14 2003/02/04 21:21:51 lcerrato fixed typo kuma entry swoln to swollen
Revision 1.13 2001/12/05 15:15:58 gcrane shifted the lemma for "pa/nth" to be "pa/nth|"
Revision 1.12 2001/04/20 21:58:57 dasmith Added funder.
Revision 1.11 2001/04/05 18:26:02 lcerrato added trans tags to noeo^ entry where missing
Revision 1.10 2000/10/06 23:20:04 dasmith Tagged inflectional info as Greek.
Revision 1.9 2000/10/06 21:44:13 dasmith Added author and ISBN to head. Use new DTD subset. Explicitly tag lemmata and cross references as Greek.
Revision 1.8 2000/03/04 20:25:11 dasmith Standardized language IDs. Added key attribute to entry.
Revision 1.7 1998/08/24 19:15:31 jrydberg finished trans tags and added new prep. defs.
Revision 1.6 1998/08/20 17:12:45 jrydberg Included greek words within trans tags where appropriate
Revision 1.5 1998/08/19 20:50:08 jrydberg Replaced all "(trans) or (/trans)" with " or "
Revision 1.4 1998/08/19 18:23:58 jrydberg Corrected trans tagging for short defs. through a)mfote/rwqen.
Revision 1.3 1998/08/17 20:24:43 jrydberg *** empty log message ***

Revision 1.1 1998/08/14 15:38:33 textgod Added to repository.

div0.head: Ε

div1.head: ἑανός
div1.sense: fit for wearing, ἑᾱνῷ λιτί with linen good for wear, i. e. fine and white, Il.; πέπλος ἑᾱνός a fine, light, veil, Il.; ἑᾱνοῦ κασσιτέροιο tin beat out and so made fit for wear, Il.
as Subst., ἑανός, ὁ, a fine robe, fit for the wear of goddesses and great ladies, Hom.

div1.head: ἐάν
div1.etym: ἐᾱν contracts into ἤν and ἄν
div1.sense: if haply, if, followed by subj. (whereas εἰ is foll. by ind. or opt.), Epic εἴ κε, αἴ κε.
in NTest. ἐάν is used just like the adverb ἄν after relative Pronouns and Conjunctions, as ὃς ἐάν whosoever, ὅσος ἐάν, ὅστις ἐάν, ὅπου ἐάν, etc.

div1.head: ἔα
div1.sense: exclam. of surprise or displeasure, ha! oho! Lat. vah! esp. before a question, ἔα, τί χρῆμα; Aesch.; ἔα, τίς οὗτος . . ; Eur.

div1.head: ἐαρίζω
div1.sense: to pass the spring, Xen.

div1.head: ἐαρινός
div1.sense: Lat. vernus, of spring, εἰαρινὴ ὥρη spring- time, Il., etc.:—neut. ἠρινόν, -νά, as adv., in spring-time, Eur.; ἠρινὰ κελαδεῖν, of the swallow, Ar.

div1.head: ἐαροτρεφής
div1.sense: flourishing in spring, Mosch.

div1.head: ἔαρ
div1.sense: Lat. ver, spring, ἔαρος νέον ἱσταμένοιο in time of early spring, Od.; ἅμα τῷ ἔαρι at the beginning of spring, Hdt.; ἐξ ἦρος εἰς Ἀρκτοῦρον Soph.:—metaph. of the prime or flower of anything, Hdt., etc.; ἔαρ ὁρᾶν to look fresh and bright, Theocr.; γενύων ἔαρ, i. e. the first down on a youthʼs face, Anth.

div1.head: ἐατέος
div1.sense: to be suffered, Hdt., Eur.
ἐατέον, one must suffer, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἑαυτοῦ
div1.sense: reflex. Pron. of 3rd pers., Lat. sui, sibi, se, of himself, herself, itself, etc.; first in Hdt. and Attic; Hom. has ἕο αὐτοῦ, οἷ αὐτῷ, ἑ αὐτόν:—αὐτὸ ἐφʼ ἑαυτό itself by itself, absolutely, Plat.; so τὸ ἐφʼ ἑαυτόν Thuc.; αὐτὸ καθʼ αὑτό Plat.;— ἀφʼ ἑαυτοῦ of himself, Thuc., etc.; ἐν ἑαυτοῦ, ἐντὸς ἑαυτοῦ, Lat. sui compos:— παρʼ ἑαυτῷ at his own house, Xen.; often with comp. and Sup., ἐγένοντο ἀμείνονες αὐτοὶ ἑωυτῶν they surpassed themselves, Hdt.; πλουσιώτεροι ἑαυτῶν, i. e. continually richer, Thuc.
in Attic αὑτοῦ, sometimes for 1st or 2nd pers., Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἑάφθη
div1.sense: prob. Epic for ἥφθη, aor1 pass. of ἅπτω ἐπʼ αὐτῶι ἀσπὶς ἑάφθη upon him his shield was fastened upon or clung to him, i. e. they fell together, Il.

div1.head: ἐάω
div1.sense: to let, suffer, allow, permit, Lat. sinere, c. acc. pers. et inf., Hom., Attic:—Pass. to be given up, Soph.
οὐκ ἐᾶν not to suffer, and then to forbid, hinder, prevent, c. acc. et. inf., Hom., etc.: often an inf. may be supplied, οὐκ ἐάσει σε τοῦτο will not allow thee [to do] this, Soph.
to let alone, let be, c. acc., Hom., etc.;—absol., ἔασον let be, Aesch.:—Pass., ἡ δʼ οὖν ἐάσθω Soph.
in same sense, c. inf., κλέψαι μὲν ἐάσομεν we will have done with stealing, Il.; θεὸς τὸ μὲν δώσει, τὸ δʼ ἐάσει sc. δοῦναι he will give one thing, the other he will let alone, Od.; v. χαίρω fin.

div1.head: ἑβδομαγέτης
div1.sense: name of Apollo, to whom the Spartans sacrificed on the 7th of every month, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑβδομαῖος
div1.sense: on the seventh day, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἑβδομάς
div1.sense: the number seven or a number of seven, Anth.
a period of seven days, a week Arist.: also of seven years, a septenary, Arist.

div1.head: ἑβδόματος
div1.sense: the seventh, Il.

div1.head: ἑβδομήκοντα
div1.sense: indecl. seventy, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑβδομηκοντούτης
div1.sense: seventy years old: fem. -οῦτις, Luc.

div1.head: ἕβδομος
div1.sense: seventh, Lat. septimus, Hom., etc.; ἡ ἑβδόμη the seventh day, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔβενος
div1.sense: the ebony-tree, ebony, Hdt., Theocr.

div1.head: Ἑβραϊκός
div1.sense: Hebrew, NTest.

div1.head: Ἑβραῖος
div1.sense: a Hebrew, NTest.

div1.head: Ἑβραϊστί
div1.sense: in the Hebrew tongue, NTest.

div1.head: ἔγγαιος
div1.sense: in or of the land, native, Lat. indigena, Aesch.
of property, in land, consisting of land, Dem., etc.
in or of the earth, Plat.

div1.head: ἐγγείνωνται
div1.etym: ἐγ-γείνωνται is 3rd pl. aor1 subj. in causal sense
div1.sense: μὴ μυῖαι εὐλὰς ἐγγείνωνται lest the flies breed maggots in [the wounds], Il.

div1.head: ἐγγελαστής
div1.sense: a mocker, scorner, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγγελάω
div1.sense: to laugh at, mock, Lat. irridere, τινί Soph., Eur.; κατά τινος Soph.

div1.head: ἐγγενής
div1.sense: inborn, native, Lat. indigena, Hdt., Attic; θεοὶ ἐγγενεῖς gods of the race or country, Aesch.
born of the same race, kindred, Soph.: —adv. -νῶς, like kinsmen, Soph.
of qualities, inborn, innate, Trag.

div1.head: ἐγγήραμα
div1.sense: a comfort for old age, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγγηράσκω
div1.sense: to grow old in one, decay, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγγίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to be born or bred in a place, c. dat., Hom., Hdt.
of qualities, to be inborn, innate, Hdt., Eur.
of events and the like, to happen in or among, τισι Hdt.
to come in, intervene, pass, of Time, Hdt., Thuc.
ἐγγίγνεται, impers., it is allowed or possible, c. inf., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐγγίων
div1.etym: comp. and Sup. adj., from adv. ἐγγύς,
div1.sense: nearer, nearest: neut. ἔγγῑον, ἔγγιστα, as adv., Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἐγγλύσσω
div1.sense: to have a sweet taste, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγγλύφω
div1.sense: to cut in, carve, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγγλωττογάστωρ
div1.sense: one who lives by his tongue, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγγλωττοτυπέω
div1.sense: to talk loudly of, Ar.

div1.head: ἔγγονος
div1.sense: a grandson, granddaughter, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγγραφή
div1.sense: a registering, registration, Dem.

div1.head: ἐγγράφω
div1.sense: to mark in or on, to paint on, Hdt.
to inscribe, write in or on, Hdt.:—Pass., ἐγγεγραμμένος τι having something written on it, Soph.; so Virgil flores inscripti nomina.
to enter in the public register, ἐγγρ. τὸν υἱὸν εἰς ἄνδρας Dem.:—Pass., εἰς τοὺς δημότας ἐγγραφῆναι Dem.
to enter on the judgeʼs list, to indict, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: ἐγγυαλίζω
div1.sense: properly, to put into the palm of the hand, put into oneʼs hand, Hom.

div1.head: ἐγγυάω
div1.etym: the forms ἐν-εγύων, ἐν-εγύησα, ἐγ-γεγύηκα (as if the Verb were a compd. with prep. ἐν or ἐγ) are erroneous:
div1.sense: to give or hand over as a pledge, Lat. spondere, and in Mid. to have a thing pledged to one, accept as a surety, Od., Plat.
of a father to give his daughter in marriage, to plight, betroth, Hdt., Eur.:—Mid. to have a woman betrothed to one, Dem.
Mid. also to pledge oneself, give security, Plat., etc.: c. acc. et inf. fut. to promise or engage that . . , Ar., Xen.
c. acc. rei, to answer for, Dem.

div1.head: ἐγγύη
div1.sense: a pledge put into the hand: surety, security, Lat. vadimonium, Od., Attic

div1.head: ἐγγύησις
div1.sense: betrothed, Isae.

div1.head: ἐγγυητής
div1.sense: one who gives security, a surety, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐγγυητός
div1.sense: of a wife, wedded, Dem.

div1.head: ἐγγύθεν
div1.sense: from nigh at hand, Il., Attic
with Verbs of rest, hard by, nigh at hand, Hom.
c. dat., ἐγγύθεν τινί hard by him, Il.; also c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἐγγύθι
div1.sense: hard by, near, c. gen., Il.; also c. dat., Il.
of Time, nigh at hand, Il.

div1.head: ἐγγυμνάζω
div1.sense: to exercise a person in a thing, c. dat., Luc.:—Mid. to practise oneself in, Plut.

div1.head: ἔγγυος
div1.sense: giving security, Theogn., Xen.

div1.head: ἐγγύς
div1.sense: of Place, near, nigh, at hand, Hom.; c. gen. hard by, near to, Hom., Soph.; also c. dat., Eur.
of Time, nigh at hand, Hom., Xen.
of Numbers, etc., nearly, Thuc., Xen.; οὐδʼ ἐγγύς i. e. not by a great deal, nothing like it, Plat., Dem.; ἐγγὺς τοῦ τεθνάναι very nearly dead, Plat.
of Relationship, akin to, Aesch., Plat.
div1.etym: From the same Root as ἄγχι, cf. ἄγχιστος, ἔγγιστος.

div1.head: ἐγγώνιος
div1.sense: forming an angle, esp. a right angle, λίθοι ἐν τομῇ ἐγγώνιοι cut square, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγείρω
div1.etym: ἐγρήγορα used as pres, the pluperfect serves as an imperfect.
div1.sense: Act. to awaken, wake up, rouse, Il., Trag.
to rouse, stir up, ἐγείρειν Ἄρηα to stir the fight, Il., etc.
to raise from the dead, NTest.; or from a sick bed, NTest.
to raise or erect a building, NTest.
Pass., with perf. act. ἐγρήγορα, to awake, Od., Hdt., etc.: in aor2 also to keep watch or vigil, Il.:—in perf. to be awake, Hom., Attic
to rouse or stir oneself, be excited by passion, Hes., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγερσιγέλως
div1.sense: laughter-stirring, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγερσιθέατρος
div1.sense: exciting the theatre, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγερσιμάχας
div1.sense: battle-stirring, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγέρσιμος
div1.sense: from which one wakes, ὕπνος ἐγ., opp. to the sleep of death, Theocr.

div1.head: ἔγερσις
div1.sense: a waking from sleep, Plat.:— awaking from death, NTest.

div1.head: ἐγερσιφαής
div1.sense: light-stirring, ἐγ. λίθος the flint, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγερτέος
div1.sense: one must raise, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγερτικός
div1.sense: waking, stirring, τινος Plat.

div1.head: ἐγκαθέζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sit or settle oneself in a place, εἰς θᾶκον Ar.:— to encamp in a place, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκαθηβάω
div1.sense: to pass oneʼs youth in, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγκάθημαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sit in or on, Xen.: to lie in ambush, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκαθιδρύω
div1.sense: to erect or set up in, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγκαθίζω
div1.sense: to seat in or upon, Plat.:—so in aor1 mid., ναὸν ἐγκαθείσατο founded a temple there, Eur.
Mid. to take oneʼs seat on, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγκαθίημι
div1.sense: to let down: to send in as a garrison, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκαθίστημι
div1.sense: to place or establish in a place, as king or chief, Eur., Thuc.: to place as a garrison in a place, Dem.
Pass., with aor2, perf. and plup. act., to be established in a place, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκαθοράω
div1.sense: to look closely into, Plut.
to remark something in a person or thing, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκαθορμίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to run into harbour, come to anchor, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκαθυβρίζω
div1.sense: to riot or revel in a thing, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγερτί
div1.sense: adv. eagerly, busily, Soph.: wakefully, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγκαίνια
div1.sense: a feast of renovation, esp. that established by Judas Macc. at the re-consecration of the Temple, NTest.

div1.head: ἐγκαινίζω
div1.sense: to renovate, consecrate:—Pass., NTest.

div1.head: ἐγκαίω
div1.sense: to burn or heat in fire, Eur.
to make a fire in a place, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκακέω
div1.sense: to lose heart, grow weary, NTest.

div1.head: ἐγκαλέω
div1.sense: to call in a debt, Xen., etc.
to bring a charge against a person, φόνον ἐγκαλεῖν τινι to bring a charge of murder against one, Soph., Plat.:— to accuse, τινί Thuc., etc.:— ἐγκ. τι to bring as a charge, Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκαλλωπίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to take pride or pleasure in a thing, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκαλλώπισμα
div1.sense: an ornament, decoration, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκαλυμμός
div1.sense: a covering, wrapping up, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκαλύπτω
div1.sense: to veil in a thing, to wrap up, Ar.: —Pass. to be veiled or enwrapt, Ar., Xen.
Mid. to hide oneself, hide oneʼs face, Ar., etc.; of persons at the point of death, Xen., Plat.; as a mark of shame, Plat.

div1.head: ἐγκάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend in, bend, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκανάσσω
div1.sense: to pour in wine, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκαναχάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make a sound in a thing, ἐγκ. κόχλῳ to blow on a conch, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐγκάπτω
div1.sense: to gulp in greedily, snap up, Ar.

div1.head: ἔγκαρος
div1.sense: the brain, Anth.

div1.head: ἔγκαρπος
div1.sense: containing fruit, Soph.

div1.head: ἐγκάρσιος
div1.sense: athwart, oblique, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκαρτερέω
div1.sense: to persevere or persist in a thing, c. dat., Thuc., Xen.
c. acc. to await stedfastly, Eur.
absol. to hold out, remain firm, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκατάληψις
div1.sense: a being caught in a place, a being hemmed in, interception, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκαταλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to reckon in or among, Isae.

div1.head: ἐγκαταμείγνυμι
div1.sense: to mix in or with, c. dat., Isocr.

div1.head: ἐγκαταπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to thrust firmly in or into, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: ἐγκαταπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall in or upon, c. dat., Anth.

div1.head: ἐγκαταπλέκω
div1.sense: to interweave, entwine, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκαταρράπτω
div1.sense: to sew in, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκατασκήπτω
div1.sense: to fall upon, like lightning: of epidemics, to break out among, Thuc.
trans. to hurl down among or upon, properly of a thunderbolt, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐγκατασπείρω
div1.sense: to disperse in or among, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκαταστοιχειόομαι
div1.sense: to be implanted as a principle in, τί τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκατασφάττω
div1.sense: to slaughter in a place, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκατατέμνω
div1.sense: to cut up among a number, Plat.

div1.head: ἐγκατατίθημι
div1.sense: Mid., ἱμάντα τέῳ ἐγκάτθεο κόλπῳ (Epic aor2 imperat.) put the band upon or round thy waist, Il.; ἄτην ἑῷ ἐγκάτθετο θυμῷ stored up, devised mischief in his heart, Od.; τελαμῶνα ἑῇ ἐγκάτθετο τέχνῃ designed the belt by his art, Od.

div1.head: ἐγκαταχέω
div1.sense: to pour in besides, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγκατιλλώπτω
div1.sense: to scoff at, τινί Aesch.

div1.head: ἐγκατοικέω
div1.sense: to dwell in a place, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγκατοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build in a place, Thuc.
to immure, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἔγκατα
div1.sense: the inwards, entrails, bowels, Lat. intestina, Hom.

div1.head: ἐγκαταγηράσκω
div1.sense: to grow old in, ἐν πενίᾳ Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκαταδέω
div1.sense: to bind fast in, Plat.

div1.head: ἐγκαταδύνω
div1.sense: sink beneath, ὕδασιν Anth.

div1.head: ἐγκαταζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to adapt to, τί τινι Soph.

div1.head: ἐγκατακαίω
div1.sense: to burn in, Luc.

div1.head: ἐγκατάκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie in, c. dat., Theogn.
to lie in bed, sleep, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκατακλίνω
div1.sense: to put to bed in a place, Ar.:—Pass. to lie down in, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκατακοιμάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie down to sleep in a place, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγκατακρούω
div1.sense: to hammer in: ἐγκ. χορείαν τοῖς μύσταις to tread a measure among the mystae, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκαταλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to catch in a place, to hem in, Thuc.; ἐγκ. τινὰ ὅρκοις to trammel by oaths, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐγκαταλέγω
div1.sense: to build in: Pass., 3rd pl. aor2 ἐγκατελέγησαν were built into the wall, Thuc.
to count among, Luc.: to enlist soldiers, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγκαταλείπω
div1.sense: to leave behind, Hes., Thuc., etc.
to leave in the lurch, Thuc., etc.
to leave out, omit, Hdt.
Pass. to be left behind in a race, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔγκαυμα
div1.sense: a sore from burning, Luc.

div1.head: ἔγκειμαι
div1.sense: to lie in, be wrapped in clothes, Il., Hdt.
ἔγκεισθαί τινι to be involved in a thing, Eur.
to press upon, of troops pressing upon the enemy, Thuc.:—with an adj. or adv., πολλὸς ἐνέκειτο was very urgent, Hdt.; πολὺς ἔγκειται he insists much upon a thing, c. dat., Dem.
to be devoted to one, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐγκείρω
div1.sense: only in perf. pass. part., ἐγκεκαρμένῳ κάρᾳ with shorn head, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγκέλευμα
div1.sense: an encouragement, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκέλευστος
div1.sense: urged on, bidden, commanded, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκελεύω
div1.sense: fut. -σω, to urge on, cheer on, Aesch.; c. dat., Xen.; to sound a charge, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκεντρίς
div1.sense: a sting, Ar.: a goad, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκεράννυμι
div1.sense: to mix in, mix, esp. wine, Il.:—Mid. to mix for oneself: metaph. to concoct, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγκερτομέω
div1.sense: to abuse, mock at, τινί Eur.

div1.head: ἐγκέφαλος
div1.sense: that which is within the head, the brain, Hom., etc.
the edible pith of young palm-shoots, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκιθαρίζω
div1.sense: to play the harp among, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐγκλείω
div1.sense: to shut in, close gates, Hdt., Plat.
to shut or confine within: Pass., ἑρκέων ἐγκεκλῃμένος (for ἐντὸς ἑρκέων κεκλῃμένος), Soph.; δόμοις ἐγκεκλῃμένος Soph.
generally to confine, γλῶσσαν ἐγκλῄσας Soph.
Mid. to shut oneself up in, Xen.

div1.head: ἔγκλημα
div1.sense: an accusation, charge, complaint, Soph., etc.; ἐγκλήματα ἔχειν τινός ἐγκαλεῖν τινι, Thuc.; ἔγκλημα διαλύεσθαι Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκληματικός
div1.sense: litigious, Arist.

div1.head: ἔγκληρος
div1.sense: having a lot or share in a thing, c. gen., Soph.; λαχεῖν ἔγκληρά τινι to have an equal share with another, Soph.
having a share of an inheritance, an heir, heiress, Eur.
ἔγκληρος εὐνή a marriage which brings wealth, Eur.; ἔγκ. πεδία land possessed as an inheritance, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγκλιδόν
div1.sense: leaning, bent down, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐγκλίνω
div1.sense: to bend in or inwards, Xen.
Pass. to lean on, rest or weigh upon one, Xen.; metaph., πόνος ὔμμι ἐγκέκλιται labour lies upon you, Il.
ἐγκλίνειν νῶτόν τινι to turn oneʼs back towards another, Eur.
intr. to give way, flee, Lat. inclinari, Xen., etc.
to decline, become worse, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκοιλαίνω
div1.sense: to hollow or scoop out, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔγκοιλος
div1.sense: sinking in hollows, hollow, Plat.

div1.head: ἐγκοιμίζω
div1.sense: to lull to sleep in a place, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγκοισυρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be luxurious as Coesyra (A woman of the Alcmaeonid family), ἐγκεκοισυρωμένη Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκοιτάς
div1.sense: serving for a bed, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγκολάπτω
div1.sense: to cut or carve upon stone, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγκοληβάζω
div1.sense: to fall heavily upon, or to gulp down, swallow up, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκολπίζω
div1.sense: to form a bay, Strab.

div1.head: ἐγκομβόομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to bind a thing on oneself, gird oneself, NTest.

div1.head: ἐγκονέω
div1.sense: to be quick and active, make haste, hasten, Hom., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐγκονίομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to sprinkle sand over oneself before wrestling, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκοπεύς
div1.sense: a tool for cutting stone, chisel, Luc.

div1.head: ἐγκοπή
div1.sense: a hindrance, NTest.

div1.head: ἔγκοπος
div1.sense: wearied, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγκόπτω
div1.sense: to hinder, thwart, NTest.

div1.head: ἐγκορδυλέω
div1.sense: to wrap up in coverlets: Pass., ἐγκεκορδυλημένη Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκοσμέω
div1.sense: to arrange in a place, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: ἐγκοτέω
div1.sense: to be indignant at, τινί Aesch.

div1.head: ἔγκοτος
div1.sense: bearing a grudge, spiteful, malignant, Aesch.
as Subst., a grudge, ἔγκοτον ἔχειν τινί to bear a grudge against one, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγκράζω
div1.sense: to cry aloud at one, τινί Ar.; ἐπί τινα Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκράτεια
div1.sense: mastery over a person or thing, ἐγκρ. ἑαυτοῦ self- control, Plat.
absol. self-control, Lat. continentia, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκρατής
div1.sense: in possession of power, Soph.
holding fast, stout, strong, Aesch., Soph.
c. gen. rei, having possession of a thing, master of it, Lat. compos rei, Hdt., Soph.; ναὸς ἐγκρατῆ πόδα the sheet that controls the ship, Soph.; ἐγκρατὴς ἑαυτοῦ master of oneself, Plat.
adv. -τῶς, with a strong hand, by force, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκρίνω
div1.sense: to admit as elected, εἰς τὴν γερουσίαν Dem.: generally, to admit, accept, Plat.

div1.head: ἔγκρισις
div1.sense: admission to the contest, Luc.

div1.head: ἐγκριτέος
div1.sense: one must admit, Plat.

div1.head: ἐγκροτέω
div1.sense: to strike on the ground, to beat time, Theocr.:—Mid. to dash one against the other, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγκρούω
div1.sense: to knock or hammer in, Ar.: to strike, Anth.
to dance, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκρύπτω
div1.sense: to hide or conceal in a place, c. dat., Od.
to keep concealed, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκρυφιάζω
div1.sense: intr. to keep oneself hidden, act underhand, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκρυφίας
div1.sense: a loaf baked in the ashes, Luc.

div1.head: ἐγκτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to acquire possessions in a foreign country, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: ἔγκτημα
div1.sense: land held in a district by a person not belonging to it, Dem.

div1.head: ἔγκτησις
div1.sense: tenure of land in a place by a stranger, Xen.:— the right of holding such land, granted to foreigners, Decret. ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἐγκυκάω
div1.sense: to mix up in, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκυκλέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to rotate in the sockets: metaph. to turn in, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγκύκλιος
div1.sense: circular, rounded, round, Eur., Aeschin.
revolving in a cycle, periodical, Dem.:— ordinary, Lat. quotidianus, Isocr., etc.

div1.head: ἐγκυκλόω
div1.sense: to move round in a circle, τι Eur.
Pass. to encircle, φωνή μέ τις ἐγκεκύκλωται a voice has echoed around me, Ar.
Mid. to roam about a place, c. acc., Plut.

div1.head: ἐγκύκλωσις
div1.sense: a surrounding, Strab.

div1.head: ἐγκυλίνδω
div1.sense: to roll up in: metaph. in Pass. to be involved in, εἴς τι Xen.

div1.head: ἐγκύμων
div1.sense: pregnant, Xen.; ἐγκύμων τευχέων big with arms, of the Trojan horse, Eur.

div1.head: ἐγκύπτω
div1.sense: to stoop down and peep in, Plat.; ἐγκ. εἴς τι to look closely into, Hdt.:—absol., ἐγκεκῡφότες stooping to the ground, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγκύρω
div1.sense: to fall in with, light upon, meet with, c. dat., Il., Hes., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγκωμιάζω
div1.etym: the augmented tenses are formed as if the Verb were a compound of ἐν and κῶμος, not a deriv. from ἐγκώμιον
div1.sense: to praise, laud, extol one, ἐπί τινι for a thing, Plat.:—Pass. to be praised, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγκώμιος
div1.sense: (κώμη) in or of the same village, native, Hes.
(κῶμος) of or belonging to a Bacchic revel, in which the victor was led home in procession with music and dancing:—hence
ἐγκώμιον, ου, τό, a song in honour of a conqueror, an eulogy, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἐγρεκύδοιμος
div1.sense: rousing the din of war, Hes.

div1.head: ἐγρεμάχης
div1.sense: rousing the fight, Soph.

div1.head: ἐγρεσίκωμος
div1.sense: stirring up to revelry, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγρηγορόων
div1.etym: Epic part., as if from a pres. ἐγρηγοράω = ἐγείρομαι
div1.sense: watching, waking, Od.

div1.head: ἐγρηγορτί
div1.sense: adv. awake, watching, Il.

div1.head: ἐγρήσσω
div1.sense: to be awake or watchful, Hom.

div1.head: ἐγχαλινόω
div1.sense: to put a bit in the mouth of a horse, c. acc., Babr.:—Pass. of horses, to have the bit in their mouths, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἔγχαλκος
div1.sense: in or with brass: moneyed, rich, Anth.

div1.head: ἐγχαράσσω
div1.sense: to engrave upon a thing, Plut.

div1.head: ἐγχάσκω
div1.sense: to gape, Luc.
to grin or scoff at one, c. dat., Ar.

div1.head: ἐγχέζω
div1.sense: Lat. incacare, Ar.: c. acc. to be in a horrid fright at one, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγχείη
div1.sense: Epic form of ἔγχος, a spear, lance, Hom.; gen. pl. ἐγχειάων, dat. ἐγχείῃσι.

div1.head: ἐγχειρέω
div1.sense: to put oneʼs hand in or to a thing, to attempt it, c. dat. rei, Eur., Thuc.; c. inf., Xen., etc.: absol. to make an attempt or beginning, Soph., Thuc.
to lay hands on, attack, assail, τινι Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐγχείρημα
div1.sense: an undertaking, attempt, Soph., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἐγχείρησις
div1.sense: a taking in hand, undertaking, Thuc., Plut.

div1.head: ἐγχειρητέος
div1.sense: one must undertake, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγχειρητής
div1.sense: an undertaker, an adventurer, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγχειρητικός
div1.sense: enterprising, adventurous, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγχειρίδιος
div1.sense: in the hand, Aesch.
as Subst., ἐγχειρίδιον, ου, τό, a hand-knife, dagger, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγχειρίζω
div1.sense: to put into oneʼs hands, entrust, τί or τινά τινι Hdt., Thuc., etc.: —Pass., ἐγχειρίζεσθαί τι to be entrusted with a thing, Luc.
Mid. to take in hand, encounter, κινδύνους Thuc.

div1.head: ἐγχειρίθετος
div1.sense: put into oneʼs hands, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγχέλειος
div1.sense: of an eel, τἀγχέλεια (sub. κρέα) eelʼs flesh, Ar.

div1.head: ἔγχελυς
div1.sense: an eel, Lat. anguilla, Il., Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἐγχελυωπός
div1.sense: eel-faced, Luc.

div1.head: ἐγχεσίμωρος
div1.sense: eager with the spear, Hom.
div1.etym: The deriv. of -μωρος is uncertain, cf. ἰόμωρος, ὑλακόμωρος.

div1.head: ἐγχέσπαλος
div1.sense: wielding the spear, Il.

div1.head: ἐγχέω
div1.sense: to pour in, μέθυ ἐγχ. δεπάεσσι Od.; οἶνον ἐς κύλικα Hdt.; ἐγχεῖν alone, to pour in wine, to fill the cup, Xen., etc.: —Mid. to fill oneʼs cup, Ar.
of dry things, to pour in, shoot in, Od.
with acc. of the cup, to fill by pouring in, Xen.
ἐγχεῖν ὕδωρ τινί, i. e. to fill the κλεψύδρα (q. v.), Dem.

div1.head: ἐγχθόνιος
div1.sense: in or of the country, Anth.

div1.head: ἔγχος
div1.sense: a spear, lance, often in Hom., consisting of two parts, αἰχμή and δόρυ, head and shaft, Il.
iI. any weapon, a sword, Soph., Eur.:—metaph., φροντίδος ἔγχος Soph.
div1.etym: Prob. akin to Root !ακ, in ἀκή, ἀκών.

div1.head: ἔγχουσα
div1.sense: the plant alkanet, the root of which yields a red dye, Xen.

div1.head: ἐγχράω
div1.sense: to dash against, Lat. impingere, Hdt.:—perf. part. pass., ἔσαν ἐγκεχρημένοι (sc. πόλεμοι) there were wars urged on, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐγχρέμπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to expectorate, Luc.

div1.head: ἐγχρῄζω
div1.sense: to have need: ἐγχρῄζοντα necessaries, Luc.

div1.head: ἐγχρίμπτω
div1.sense: to bring near to, τῷ τέρματι ἐγχρίμψας so as almost to touch the post, Il.; ἐγχρ. τὴν βᾶριν τῇ γῇ to bring the boat close to land, Hdt.

intr. to come near, approach, τινί Soph.:—so in Pass., ἐγχριμφθεὶς πύλῃσιν Il.; αἰχμὴ ὀστέῳ ἐγχριμφθεῖσα the point driven to the very bone, Il.; ἀσπίδʼ (i.e. ἀσπίδι) ἐνιχριμφθείς dashed against his shield, Il.

div1.head: ἔγχριστος
div1.sense: rubbed in as an ointment, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐγχρίω
div1.sense: to rub, anoint, τινί with a thing, Anth.
to sting, prick, τινί Plat.

div1.head: ἐγχρονίζω
div1.sense: to be long about a thing, to delay, Thuc.:—Pass. to become chronic, Plat.

div1.head: ἐγχρῴζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be engrained: — metaph. to be amalgamated with, c. dat., Arist.

div1.head: ἐγχυτρίζω
div1.sense: to expose children in an earthenware vessel: hence, to make an end of, Ar.

div1.head: ἐγχωρέω
div1.sense: to give room for doing a thing, to allow, permit, Hdt., Xen.:— ἐγχωρεῖ, impers. it is possible or allowable, c. dat. pers. et inf., Plat., Xen., etc.: absol., ἔτι ἐγχωρεῖ there is yet time, Plat.

div1.head: ἐγχώριος
div1.sense: in or of the country, Hdt., Attic
as Subst. a dweller in the land, inhabitant, Soph., Eur.
τὸ ἐγχώριον as adv. according to the custom of the country, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔγωγε
div1.sense: strengthd. form of ἐγώ, Lat. equidem, I at least, for my part, for myself,

div1.head: ἐγώ
div1.sense: pron. of the first person, Lat ego

div1.head: ἐδανός
div1.sense: eatable: ἐδανόν, food, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑδανός
div1.sense: sweet, delicious, Il.

div1.head: ἐδαφίζω
div1.sense: to dash to the ground, NTest.

div1.head: ἔδαφος
div1.etym: prob. from same Root as ὀδός, οὖδας
div1.sense: the bottom, foundation, base of anything, Thuc.; ἔδαφος νηός the bottom, hold of a ship, Od.; ἔδ. ποταμοῦ Xen.
the ground-floor, pavement, οἴκου Hdt.; καθαιρεῖν εἰς τὸ ἔδαφος to rase to the ground, Thuc.
ground, soil, land, Aeschin., Dem.

div1.head: ἔδεθλον
div1.sense: a seat, abode, Aesch.

div1.head: ἔδεσμα
div1.sense: meat: pl. meats, Batr., Plat.

div1.head: ἐδεστέος
div1.sense: one must eat, Plat.

div1.head: ἐδεστής
div1.sense: an eater, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐδεστός
div1.sense: eatable: eaten, consumed, Soph.

div1.head: ἐδητύς
div1.sense: meat, food, (ἔδω) Hom.

div1.head: ἕδνον
div1.sense: mostly in pl. ἕδνα, Epic ἔεδνα, a wedding-gift, presented by the suitor to the bride or her parents (φερνή being the brideʼs portion), Hom., Aesch.
of wedding-gifts made to the bride by those of her own household, Od., Eur.

div1.head: ἑδνόω
div1.sense: to promise for wedding-presents, to betroth oneʼs daughter, Theocr.:—so in Mid., Od.
in Mid. also, to marry, Anth.

div1.head: ἑδνωτής
div1.sense: a betrother, Il.

div1.head: ἕδος
div1.sense: a sitting-place:
a seat, chair, stool, bench, Il.
a seat, abode, dwelling place, Hom., etc.:— a temple, Plat., Xen., etc.
a foundation, base, Hes., Anth.
the act of sitting, οὐχ ἕδος ἐστί ʼtis no time to sit still, Il.

div1.head: ἑδράζω
div1.sense: to make to sit, place, Anth.

div1.head: ἑδραῖος
div1.sense: sitting, sedentary, Xen., Plat.
ἑδραία ῥάχις the horseʼs back on which the rider sits, Eur.
sitting fast, steady, steadfast, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἑδραίωμα
div1.sense: a foundation, base, NTest.

div1.head: ἕδρανον
div1.sense: a seat, abode, Aesch., Soph.
a stay, support, of an anchor, Anth.

div1.head: ἕδρα
div1.sense: a sitting-place:
a seat, chair, stool, bench, Hom.: a seat of honour, Il., Xen.
a seat, of the gods, a sanctuary, temple, Pind., Trag.
the seat or place of anything, Hdt.; ἐξ ἕδρας out of its right place, Eur.:— a foundation, base, Plut.
ἡ ἕδρα τοῦ ἵππου the back of the horse, on which the rider sits, Xen.
ἕδραι are the quarters of the sky in which omens appear, Aesch., Eur.
a sitting, Aesch., Soph.: of a position, γονυπετεῖς ἕδραι kneeling, Eur.
a sitting still, inactivity, delay, Hdt., Thuc.; οὐχ ἕδρας ἀκμή ʼtis not the season for sitting still, Soph.
the sitting of a council, Soph.
the seat, breech, fundament, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑδριάω
div1.sense: to seat or set:—Pass. to sit, in Epic forms 3rd pl. pres. and imperf. ἑδριόωνται, ἑδριόωντο, Hom., Hes.; inf. ἑδριάασθαι, Hes.
intr. in Act. to sit, Theocr.

div1.head: ἑδροστρόφος
div1.sense: a wrestler who throws his adversary by a cross-buttock, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐδωδή
div1.sense: food, meat, victuals, Hom., Plat.
fodder for cattle, Il.
a bait for fish, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐδώδιμος
div1.sense: eatable, Hdt., Thuc., etc.: ἐδώδιμα, τά, eatables, provisions, Thuc.

div1.head: ἑδώλιον
div1.sense: a seat, mostly in pl., abodes, Aesch., Soph.
in a ship, ἑδώλια are the rowingbenches, or rather a half-deck, Hdt., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἔδω
div1.etym: old Epic pres. for Attic ἐσθίω
div1.sense: to eat, Hom.: of beasts, to eat, devour, Hom.; of worms, to gnaw, Hom.
to eat up, devour, consume, βίοτον, κτήματα Od.: also, ἄλγεσι θυμὸν ἔδοντες Od.

div1.head: ἕε
div1.sense: him, acc. of οὗ.

div1.head: ἕζομαι
div1.sense: to seat oneself, sit, ἐν λέκτρωι, ἐπὶ δίφρωι, κατὰ κλισμούς Hom.; ἐπὶ χθονὶ ἑζέσθην they sank to the earth, of a pair of scales, Il.:—cf καθέζομαι.
there is no act. pres., ἕζω, to set, place; though, as if from it, we have trans. tenses εἷσα, mid. εἱσάμην, fut. mid. εἵσομαι, perf. pass. εἷμαι; v. εἷσα.

div1.head: ἐή
div1.sense: exclam., like ἔ or ἔ ἔ.

div1.head: ἐθάς
div1.sense: customary, accustomed to a thing, c. gen., Thuc., Plut.

div1.head: ἐθειράζω
div1.sense: to have long hair, Theocr. once in Hom., to tend, take care of a field.

div1.head: ἔθειρα
div1.sense: hair, used by Hom. in pl., either of a horseʼs mane, or of the horsehair crest on helmets:—later in sg. and pl. of the hair of the head, Aesch., Eur., etc.; of a lionʼs mane, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐθελημός
div1.sense: willing, voluntary, Hes.

div1.head: ἐθελοδουλεία
div1.sense: willing slavery, Plat.

div1.head: ἐθελόδουλος
div1.sense: a willing slave, Plat.

div1.head: ἐθελοθρησκεία
div1.sense: will-worship, NTest.

div1.head: ἐθελοκακέω
div1.sense: to be slack in duty, play the coward purposely, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐθελοντηδόν
div1.sense: adv. voluntarily, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐθελοντήν
div1.sense: Adv. voluntarily, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐθελοντήρ
div1.sense: a volunteer, Od.

div1.head: ἐθελοντής
div1.etym: later form of ἐθελοντήρ, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐθελόπονος
div1.sense: willing to work, Xen.

div1.head: ἐθελοπρόξενος
div1.sense: one who voluntarily charges himself with the office of πρόξενος (q. v.), Thuc.

div1.head: ἐθελουργός
div1.sense: willing to work, Xen.

div1.head: ἐθελούσιος
div1.sense: voluntary, Xen.
of things, optional, matter of free choice, Xen.

div1.head: ἐθέλω
div1.sense: to will, wish, purpose; c. acc. et inf. to wish that . . , c. inf. to wish to do, Hom., Attic; c. acc., inf. being omitted, τί θέλων (sc. πρᾶξαι) Aesch.
with a negat., almost = δύναμαι, μίμνειν οὐκ ἐθέλεσκον they cared not to make a stand, i. e. they were unable, Il.
of things,
much like μέλλω, merely to express a future event, εἰ θελήσει ἀναβῆναι ἡ τυραννίς if the monarchy will revert, Hdt.
to be wont or accustomed, c. inf., Hdt., Thuc.
to mean, purport, τί ἐθέλει τὸ ἔπος Lat. quid sibi vult? French que veut-il dire? Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐθημολογέω
div1.sense: to gather customarily, Anth.

div1.head: ἐθίζω
div1.sense: to accustom, use, ἐθ. τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Plat., Xen.:—Pass. to be or become accustomed or used to do, c. inf., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐθιστέος
div1.sense: one must accustom, Xen.

div1.head: ἐθιστός
div1.sense: to be acquired by habit, Arist.

div1.head: ἐθνάρχης
div1.sense: an ethnarch, NTest., Luc.

div1.head: ἐθνικός
div1.sense: foreign, heathen, gentile, NTest.: adv. -νικῶς, NTest.

div1.head: ἔθνος
div1.sense: a number of people accustomed to live together, a company, body of men, Il., etc.; ἔθνος λαῶν a host of men, Il.; also of animals, swarms, flocks, Il., Soph.
after Hom., a nation, people, Hdt., etc.:—in NTest. τὰ ἔθνη the nations, Gentiles, i. e. all but Jews and Christians.
a special class of men, a caste, tribe, Plat., Xen.
sex, Xen.

div1.head: ἔθος
div1.sense: custom, habit, Aesch., etc.; ἐν ἔθει εἶναι to be in the habit, Thuc.; ἔθει habitually, Arist.

div1.head: ἔθω
div1.sense: to be accustomed: the pres. only in partic., κακὰ πόλλʼ ἔρδεσκεν ἔθων much ill he wrought by custom, i. e. was accustomed to work, Il.; otherwise, perf. εἴωθα, Ionic ἔωθα is used as a pres., and plup. εἰώθειν, Ionic ἐώθεα, as imperf.:— to be wont or accustomed, be in the habit, c. inf., Il., Hdt., etc.:—in part. absol. accustomed, customary, usual, Il., Soph., etc.; in neut., κατὰ τὸ εἰωθός according to custom, παρὰ τὸ εἰωθός contrary to custom, Thuc.

div1.head: εἴωθα
div1.sense: to be accustomed: the pres. ἔθω associated with it by grammarians only in partic., κακὰ πόλλʼ ἔρδεσκεν ἔθων much ill he wrought by custom, i. e. was accustomed to work, Il.; otherwise, perf. εἴωθα, Ionic ἔωθα is used as a pres., and plup. εἰώθειν, Ionic ἐώθεα, as imperf.:— to be wont or accustomed, be in the habit, c. inf., Il., Hdt., etc.:—in part. absol. accustomed, customary, usual, Il., Soph., etc.; in neut., κατὰ τὸ εἰωθός according to custom, παρὰ τὸ εἰωθός contrary to custom, Thuc.

div1.head: εἱαμενή
div1.sense: a river-side pasture, meadow, ἐν εἰαμενῇ ἕλεος in a marshy meadow, Il.

div1.head: εἶα
div1.sense: Lat. eia, Interj. on! up! away! with imperat., Trag.; εἶα δή come then! Aesch.; εἶα νῦν well now! Ar., etc.

div1.head: εἰαρόμασθος
div1.sense: with youthful breasts, Anth.

div1.head: εἴβω
div1.sense: to drop, let fall in drops, Hom.:—Pass. to trickle down, Hes.

div1.head: εἰδάλιμος
div1.sense: shapely, comely, Od.
like, looking like, Anth.

div1.head: εἶδαρ
div1.sense: food, and of horses, fodder, Hom.

div1.head: εἰδήμων
div1.sense: knowing or expert in a thing, τινός Anth.

div1.head: εἰδοί
div1.sense: the Roman Idus, Plut.

div1.head: εἴδομαι
div1.sense: Lat. videor, to be seen, appear, εἴδεται ἄστρα they are visible, appear Il.
c. inf. to appear or seem to be, τοῦτό μοι κάλλιστον εἴδεται εἶναι Od.; also with inf. omitted, τόγε κέρδιον εἴσατο Od.; also, εἴσατʼ ἴμεν he made a show of going, Od.
in strictly middle sense, c. dat., ἐείσατο φθογγὴν Πολίτηι she made herself like Polites in voice, Il.:—also to be like, Il.

div1.head: εἶδον
div1.etym: not used in act. pres., ὁράω being used instead; but pres. is used in Mid., v. εἴδομαι; aor2 εἶδον retains the proper sense of to see: but perf. οἶδα, (I have seen) means I know, and is used as a pres. The form ὄψομαι is used as fut., ἑόρᾱκα or ἑώρᾱκα as perf.
div1.sense: to see, perceive, behold, Hom., etc.; after a Noun, θαῦμα ἰδέσθαι a marvel to behold, Il.; οἰκτρὸς ἰδεῖν Aesch.
to look at, εἰς ὦπα ἰδέσθαι to look him in the face, Il., etc.
to look so and so, ἀχρεῖον ἰδών looking helpless, Il.
to see mentally, ἰδέσθαι ἐν φρεσίν "to see in his mindʼs eye, " Hom.

div1.head: εἰδοποιέω
div1.sense: to make an image of a thing, to mould, Plut.

div1.head: εἰδοποιία
div1.sense: the specific nature of a thing, Strab.

div1.head: εἰδοποιός
div1.sense: forming a species, specific, Arist.

div1.head: εἶδος
div1.sense: that which is seen, form, shape, figure, Lat. species, forma, Hom.; absol. in acc., εἶδος ἄριστος, etc.
a form, sort, particular kind or nature, Hdt., etc.
a particular state of things or course of action, Thuc.
a class, kind, sort, whether genus or species, Plat., etc.

div1.head: εἰδότως
div1.sense: knowingly, Aeschin.

div1.head: εἰδύλλιον
div1.sense: Dim. of εἶδος: a short descriptive poem, mostly on pastoral subjects, an idyll, Theocr., etc.

div1.head: εἰδωλεῖον
div1.sense: an idolʼs temple, NTest.

div1.head: εἰδωλόθυτος
div1.sense: sacrificed to idols: εἰδωλόθυτα, τά, meats offered to idols, NTest.

div1.head: εἰδωλολατρεία
div1.sense: idolatry, NTest.

div1.head: εἰδωλολάτρης
div1.sense: an idol-worshipper, idolater, NTest.

div1.head: εἴδωλον
div1.sense: an image, a phantom, Hom., Hdt.; βροτῶν εἴδωλα καμόντων phantoms of dead men, Od.; of any unsubstantial form, σκιᾶς εἴδωλον Aesch.; οὐδὲν ἄλλο πλὴν εἴδωλα Soph.
an image in the mind, idea, Xen.:—also a fancy, Plat.
an image, likeness, Hdt.
an image, idol, NTest.

div1.head: εἰδωλοποιέω
div1.sense: to form an image in the mind, Plat.

div1.head: εἰδωλοποιία
div1.sense: formation of images, as in a mirror, Plat.

div1.head: εἰδωλοποιός
div1.sense: an image-maker, Plat.

div1.head: εἶἑν
div1.etym: Particle, only used in Attic dialogue,
div1.sense: well! Lat. esto! be it so! εἶεν· τί δῆτα; Soph.; εἶεν· καὶ δὴ τεθνᾶσι Eur.

div1.head: εἶθαρ
div1.sense: at once, forthwith, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: εἴθε
div1.sense: would that! Lat. utinam: v. εἰ A. II. 1.

div1.head: εἰκάζω
div1.sense: to make like to, represent by a likeness, portray, Xen.; εἰκὼν γραφῆι εἰκασμένη a figure painted to the life, Hdt.; αἰετὸς εἰκασμένος a figure like an eagle, Hdt.
to liken, compare, τί τινι Aesch., Ar.; εἰκ. τι καί τι Hdt.: to describe by a comparison, Hdt.:—Pass. to resemble, τινι Eur.

to infer from comparison, form a conjecture, Hdt., Soph.; ὡς εἰκάσαι, so far as one can guess, Hdt.:—c. acc. et inf. to guess that it is so, guess it to be, Hdt., Thuc.: —εἰκ. τι ἔκ τινος Aesch., Thuc.; ἀπό τινος Thuc.; εἰκ. τι to make a guess about it, Aesch.

div1.head: εἰκαῖος
div1.sense: random, purposeless, Luc.

div1.head: εἰκασία
div1.sense: a likeness, image, Xen.
a comparison, a conjecture, Plat.

div1.head: εἴκασμα
div1.sense: a likeness, image, Aesch.

div1.head: εἰκασμός
div1.sense: a conjecturing, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: εἰκάς
div1.sense: the twentieth day of the month (sub. ἡμέρα), Hes.: the days from 21 to 30 were called αἱ εἰκάδες Ar.
the sixth day of the Eleusinian mysteries, Eur.

div1.head: εἰκαστής
div1.sense: one who conjectures, a diviner, τῶν μελλόντων Thuc.

div1.head: εἰκαστικός
div1.sense: able to represent or conjecture: τὸ εἰκαστικόν the faculty of conjecturing, Luc.

div1.head: εἰκαστός
div1.sense: comparable, similar, Soph.

div1.head: εἰκελόνειρος
div1.sense: dream-like, Ar.

div1.head: εἴκελος
div1.sense: like, Lat. similis, τινι Hom., Hdt.

div1.head: εἰκελόφωνος
div1.sense: of like voice, Anth.

div1.head: εἰκῇ
div1.sense: without plan or purpose, heedlessly, rashly, at random, at a venture, Lat. temere, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: εἰκονικός
div1.sense: counterfeited, pretended, Anth.

div1.head: εἰκοσάβοιος
div1.sense: worth twenty oxen, Od.

div1.head: εἰκοσαετής
div1.sense: of twenty years, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰκοσάκις
div1.sense: twenty times, Il.

div1.head: εἰκοσάμηνος
div1.sense: twenty months old, Anth.

div1.head: εἰκοσινήριτος
div1.sense: twenty-fold without dispute, Il.

div1.head: εἴκοσι
div1.sense: indecl., twenty, Lat. viginti, Il., etc.; also in Epic form ἐείκοσι, before a vowel ἐείκοσιν, Il.

div1.head: εἰκοσίπηχυς
div1.sense: of twenty cubits, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰκόσορος
div1.sense: with twenty oars, Od.

div1.head: εἰκός
div1.etym: neut. partic. of εἶκα or ἔοικα,
div1.sense: like truth, i. e. likely, probable, reasonable, Lat. verisimile, Trag.
as Subst. εἰκός, τό, a likelihood or probability, τὰ οἰκότα likelihoods, Hdt.; κατὰ τὸ εἰκός in all likelihood, Thuc.; ἐκ τοῦ εἰκότος Thuc.; ἤν γʼ ἐρωτᾷς εἰκότʼ, εἰκότα κλύεις Eur.
reasonable, fair, equitable, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰκοστολόγος
div1.sense: one who collects the twentieth, a tax or toll collector, Ar.

div1.head: εἰκοστός
div1.sense: the twentieth, Od.; Epic also ἐεικοστός, Il.
εἰκοστή, ἡ, a tax of a twentieth, Lat. vicesima, levied by the Athenians on imports and exports from the allies in lieu of tribute, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰκοσώρυγος
div1.sense: of 20 fathoms, Xen.

div1.head: εἰκότως
div1.etym: adverb of εἰκώς, Attic perf. part. of ἔοικα,
div1.sense: in all likelihood, suitably, fairly, reasonably, naturally, Aesch., etc.; εἰκότως ἔχει ʼtis reasonable, Eur.; οὐκ εἰκότως un reasonably, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰκών
div1.sense: a likeness, image, portrait, Hdt., Aesch.
an image in a mirror, Eur., Plat.
a semblance, phantom, Eur., Plat., etc.: an image in the mind, Plat.
a similitude, simile, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: εἴκω
div1.etym: Root !ϝικ, cf. Lat. vito for victo ; cf. εἰκαθεῖν
div1.sense: to yield, give way, draw back, retire, Il.
c. dat. pers. et gen. loci, μηδʼ εἴκετε χάρμης Ἀργείοις shrink not from the fight for them, Il.; εἴκειν τινὶ τῆς ὁδοῦ, Lat. concedere alicui de via, Hdt.

with dat. pers. only, to yield to, give way to, either in battle or a mark of honour, Hom.:—then, to give way to any passion or impulse, ὧι θυμῶι εἴξας Il.; αἰδοῖ Od.:—also of circumstances, πενίηι εἴκων Il.; κακοῖς, ἀνάγκηι Aesch.
εἴκειν τινί τι, where the acc. is adverbial, μένος οὐδενὶ εἴκων yielding to none in force, Hom.; c. acc. cogn., εἴξαντας ἃ δεῖ yielding in . . , Soph.
trans. to yield up, give up, εἶξαί τέ οἱ ἡνία give the horse the rein, Il.:— to grant, allow, Lat. concedere, ὁπηνίκʼ ἂν θεὸς πλοῦν ἡμὶν εἴκηι Soph.
impers., like παρείκει, it is allowable or possible, Il.

div1.head: εἰλαπινάζω
div1.sense: to revel in a large company, Od.

div1.head: εἰλαπιναστής
div1.sense: a feaster, quest, boon-companion, Il.

div1.head: εἰλαπίνη
div1.sense: a feast or banquet, given by a single host, opp. to ἔρανος (q. v.), Hom., Eur.

div1.head: εἶλαρ
div1.etym: only in nom. and acc. sg.
div1.sense: a close covering, shelter, defence, εἶλαρ νηῶν τε καὶ αὐτῶν shelter for ship and crew, Il.; εἶλαρ κύματος a fence against the waves, Od.

div1.head: ἰλάρχης
div1.sense: a commander of a troop of horse, esp. at Thebes, Plut.

div1.head: Εἰλείθυια
div1.etym: A quasiparticipial form, as if ἐληλυθυῖα, the readycomer
div1.sense: Ilithyia, the goddess who comes to aid women in child-birth, Lat. Lucina, Il.:

div1.head: εἰλεός
div1.sense: a lurking-place, den, hole, Theocr.

div1.head: εἰληδόν
div1.sense: by twisting round, Anth.

div1.head: εἱληθερέω
div1.sense: Mid. to bask in the sun, Luc.

div1.head: εἵλη
div1.sense: the sunʼs heat or warmth, Ar.

div1.head: εἴλη
div1.sense: κατʼ εἴλας in troops, Hdt.

div1.head: εἵλησις
div1.sense: sun-heat, heat, Plat.

div1.head: εἰλικρινής
div1.sense: unmixed, without alloy, pure, Lat. sincerus, Xen., Plat.; εἰλικρινεῖ τῇ διανοίᾳ χρώμενος using pure intellect, Plat.; εἰλ. ἀδικία sheer in justice, Xen.
adv. -νῶς, without mixture, of itself, simply, absolutely, Plat.
div1.etym: The origin of εἰλι- is uncertain.

div1.head: εἰλίπους
div1.sense: rolling in their gait, with rolling walk, Hom.

div1.head: εἰλιτενής
div1.sense: epith. of the plant ἄγρωστις, Theocr., prob. from ἕλος, τείνω spreading through marshes.

div1.head: εἴλυμα
div1.sense: a wrapper, Od.

div1.head: εἰλυός
div1.sense: a lurking place, den, Xen.

div1.head: εἰλυφάζω
div1.sense: to roll along (trans.), Il.
intr. to roll or whirl about, of a torch, Hes.

div1.head: εἰλύω
div1.sense: to enfold, enwrap, Il.:—Pass. to be wrapt or covered, νεφέληι εἰλυμένος ὤμους, etc., Hom.
Pass., also, = ἰλυσπάομαι, to crawl or wriggle along, of a lame man, Soph.
in Theocr. εἰλυσθείς means rolled up, crouching.

div1.head: εἴλω
div1.sense: to roll up, pack close, Lat. conglobare, κατὰ τείχεα λαὸν ἐέλσαι to roll up the host and force it back to the walls, Il.; Ἀχαιοὺς ἐπὶ πρύμνηισιν ἐείλεον Il.; εἰλεῖν ἐν μέσσοισι to coop up or hem in on all sides, Il.; θῆρας ὁμοῦ εἰλεῖν to drive game together, Od.:—Pass. to be cooped or huddled up, εἰς ἄστυ ἄλεν (for ἄλησαν) Od.; νηυσὶν ἐπὶ γλαφυρῆισιν ἐελμένοι Od.:—metaph., Διὸς βουλῆισιν ἐελμένος straitened, held in check by the counsels of Zeus, Od.
to smite, νῆα κεραυνῶι Ζεὺς ἔλσας having smitten the ship with lightning, Od.
to collect: Pass., ἀλὲν ὕδωρ water collected, ponded, Il.
Pass., also, to draw oneself up, shrink up, ἀλῆναι ὑπʼ ἀσπίδι Il.; Ἀχιλῆα ἀλεὶς μένεν collecting himself he waited the attack of Achilles, Il.
Pass. also, to go to and fro, like Lat. versari, Hdt.
to wind, turn round:— Pass. to turn round, revolve, ἰλλομένων ἀρότρων moving to and fro, Soph.; ἕλιξ εἰλεῖται is twined round, Theocr.

div1.head: Εἵλως
div1.sense: a Helot, name of the Spartan serfs, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: εἱλωτεία
div1.sense: the condition of a Helot, Plat.

div1.head: εἱλωτεύω
div1.sense: to be a Helot or serf, Isocr.

div1.head: εἱλωτικός
div1.sense: of Helots, Plut.

div1.head: εἷμα
div1.sense: a garment, in pl. clothes, clothing, Hom., etc.
a cover, rug, carpet, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: εἶμι
div1.sense: ibo, In Prose εἶμι serves as fut. to ἔρχομαι, I shall go, shall come. to come or go, Hom., etc.; c. acc. cogn., ὁδὸν ἰέναι to go a road, Od.:—in Hom., c. gen., ἰὼν πεδίοιο going across the plain; χροὸς εἴσατο went through the skin.

to go in a ship, Od.; of birds, to fly, Od.: of things, πέλεκυς εἶσι διὰ δουρός the axe goes through the beam, Il.; φάτις εἶσι the report goes, Od.; metaph. usages, ἰέναι ἐς λόγους τινί to enter on a conference with one, Thuc., etc.; ἰέναι ἐς χεῖρας to come to blows, Thuc.; ἰέναι διὰ δίκης πατρί to contest the point with him, Soph.; ἰέναι διὰ μάχης, διὰ φιλίας to live in conflict, in friendship with others, etc.
the Imperat. ἴθι is used like ἄγε, Lat. age, come, come now, mostly followed by 2nd sg. imperat., ἴθι λέξον Ar., etc.; with 1st pl. ἴθι ἐπισκεψώμεθα Xen.
ἴτω let it pass, well then, Soph., Eur.
the part. is added by Trag. to Verbs, φρονείτω ἰών let him go and think, Soph.

div1.head: εἰμί
div1.etym: The whole of the pres. ind. (except 2nd sg. εἶ) may be enclitic when εἰμί is the Copula; but the 3rd sg. is written ἔστι in certain cases of emphasis, e. g. ἔστι μοι, I have: when used as Verb Subst., it retains the accent in all persons.
div1.sense: as Substantive Verb, to be, to exist, οὐκ ἔσθʼ οὗτος ἀνήρ, οὐδʼ ἔσσεται Od.; τεθνηῶτος, μηδʼ ἔτʼ ἐόντος Od.; οὐκέτʼ ἔστι he is no more, Eur.; θεοὶ αἰὲν ἐόντες Il.; ἐσσόμενοι posterity, Il.; ζώντων καὶ ὄντων Ἀθηναίων Dem.:—so of cities, etc., ὄλωλεν, οὐδʼ ἔτʼ ἔστι Τροία (cf. Troja fuit), Eur.
of things, to be, exist, εἰ ἔστιν ἀληθέως ἡ τράπεζα Hdt.; ἕως ἂν ὁ πόλεμος ἦι so long as it last, Thuc.
to be, opp. to appearing to be, as esse to videri, τὸν ἐόντα λόγον the true story, Hdt.; τὰ ὄντα ἀπαγγέλλειν Thuc.; τῶι ὄντι, Lat. revera, in reality, in fact, Plat.

foll. by the Relative, οὐκ ἔστιν ὅς, no one, Il., etc.; εἰσὶν οἵ, Lat. sunt qui, Thuc., etc.; ἐστὶν ἅ some things, Thuc.; also ἔστιν οἵ, for εἰσὶν οἵ, Hdt., etc.:—so withrelat. Particles, ἔστιν ἔνθα, Lat. est ubi, Xen., etc.; ἔστιν ὅπη, ἔσθʼ ὅπου, somewhere, or somehow, Plat., etc.; ἔστιν ὅπως in some manner, Hdt., etc.; ἔστιν ὅτε, ἔσθʼ ὅτε, sometimes, Soph., etc.
ἔστι impers., c. inf., like πάρεστι, it is possible, Hom., Attic
to be, Copula connecting predicate with subject, both being in the same case, Hom., etc.
sometimes εἶναι with Part. represents finite Verb, ἦν τεθνηκώς, for ἐτεθνήκει, Aesch.; πεφυκός ἐστι πέφυκε, Ar.
the Inf. is redundant in some phrases, ἑκὼν εἶναι (v. ἑκών II); τὸ ἐπʼ ἐκείνοις εἶναι quantum in illis esset, Thuc.; τὸ σύμπαν εἶναι Hdt.; τὸ νῦν εἶναι Plat., etc.

div1.head: εἰναετής
div1.sense: of nine years: neut. εἰνάετες, as adv. nine years long, Od.

div1.head: εἰναλίφοιτος
div1.sense: roaming the sea, of nets, Anth.

div1.head: εἰνάνυχες
div1.sense: as adv. nine nights long, Il.

div1.head: εἰνάς
div1.sense: the ninth day of the month, Hes.

div1.head: εἰνάτερες
div1.sense: sisters-in-law, Il.

div1.head: εἴνατος
div1.sense: ninth, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: εἰνοσίφυλλος
div1.sense: with quivering foliage, Il.

div1.head: εἷος
div1.sense: until, Hom.

div1.head: εἴπερ
div1.sense: strengthd. for εἰ, if really, if indeed, Hom., etc.; also, even if, even though, Hom.
in Attic if that is to say, implying doubt of the fact, εἴπερ ἦν πέλας if I had been (but I was not), Soph.

div1.head: εἶπον
div1.etym: pres. in use is φήμι, ἀγορεύω, fut. ἐρέω, ἐρῶ, perf. εἴρηκα
div1.sense: to speak, say, Hom., etc.; in parenthesis, ὡς ἔπος εἰπεῖν so to say, Lat. ut ita dicam, Thuc., etc.; so, ὡς εἰπεῖν, ὡς ἔπος εἰπεῖν Thuc.
c. acc. pers. to speak to, address, accost one, Il.
to name, mention, Il.
to call one so and so, πολλοὶ δέ μιν ἐσθλὸν ἔειπον Od.
c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, to say or tell of one, ἀτάσθαλόν τι εἰπεῖν τινα Od.; κακὰ εἰπεῖν τινα Ar.
at Athens, to propose or move a measure in the ἐκκλησία, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: εἴποτε
div1.sense: if ever, Lat. si-quando, Hom.
indirect, if or whether ever, Hom.

div1.head: εἴπου
div1.sense: if anywhere, if at all, Lat. si-cubi, Hom., etc.; εἴ τί που ἐστίν, if it is any way possible, Od.

div1.head: εἰ
div1.sense: a Conditional Conjunction, Lat. si, if; and in indirect questions, whether.
with a verb in protasis, answered by a similar tense in apodosis:
with pres. and fut. ind., to express mere Possibility, εἰ τοῦτο ποιεῖ (or ποιήσει) , ἁμαρτάνει (or ἁμαρτήσεται) if he is doing (or shall do) this, he is (or will be) wrong.

with imperf. and aor. ind., to express Impossibility, εἰ τοῦτο ἐποίει, ἡμάρτανεν ἄν if he was doing this, he would be wrong; εἰ τοῦτο ἐποίησεν, ἥμαρτεν ἄν if he did (or had done) this, he would be wrong.
with opt. to express a mere Assumption, εἰ τοῦτο ποιοῖ, ἁμαρτάνοι ἄν if he were to do this, he would be wrong.

with Subjunctive, to express Possibility with some degree of Probability: in this case ἄν is always added, and εἰ ἄν becomes ἐάν, ἤν, ἄν, (Epic εἴ κεν) , ἐὰν τοῦτο ποιῇ, ἁμαρτήσεται if he do this, he will be wrong.
sometimes the apodosis is omitted, so that εἰ expresses a wish, εἴ μοι γένοιτο φθόγγος if I had a voice, [I would . . ], i. e. Oh that I had a voice! so εἰ γάρ, εἴθε, Epic αἰ γάρ, αἴθε.
sometimes the protasis is omitted, εἰ δʼ ἄγε come on, = εἰ δὲ βούλει, ἄγε, Od.; εἰ δέ, σὺ μὲν ἄκουσον Il.
εἰ δὲ μή Lat. sin minus, otherwise, for εἰ δὲ μὴ τοῦτό ἐστι, Hdt., etc.
In Indirect Questions, whether, Lat. an, followed by the ind., subj., or opt., according to the principles of oratio obliqua:
with INDIC. or SUBJ. after primary tenses, οὐκ οἶδʼ, εἰ θεός ἐστιν whether he is a god, Il.; οὐκ οἶδʼ εἰ δῶ whether I shall give, Xen.
with OPTAT. after past tenses, ἤρετο εἴ τις ἐμοῦ εἴη σοφώτερος he asked whether any one was wiser than I, Plat.
after Verbs expressive of wonder, indignation, etc., θαυμάζω εἰ μηδεὶς ὀργίζεται, where εἰ nearly = ὅτι, Dem.; ἀγανακτεῖ εἰ μὴ στεφανωθήσεται Aeschin.

div1.head: εἱργμός
div1.sense: a cage, prison, Plat.

div1.head: εἰργμοφύλαξ
div1.sense: a gaoler, Xen.

div1.head: εἵργνυμι
div1.sense: to shut in or up, Epic imperf. ἐέργνυν, Od.

div1.head: εἴρερος
div1.sense: bondage, slavery, Od.

div1.head: εἰρεσία
div1.sense: rowing, Od., Hdt., etc.: —metaph., εἰρ. πτερῶν Luc.
in collective sense, the rowers, oarsmen, Lat. remigium, Eur., Thuc.
a boat-song, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: εἰρεσιώνη
div1.sense: a harvest-wreath of olive or laurel wound round with wool, borne about by singing boys at the Πυανέψια and Θαργήλια and then hung up at the house door, Ar.

div1.head: εἰρηναῖος
div1.sense: peaceful, peaceable, Hdt.: τὰ εἰρηναῖα the fruits of peace, Hdt.: adv. -ως, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰρηνεύω
div1.sense: to bring to peace, reconcile, Babr.
intr. to keep peace, live peaceably, Plat., NTest.

div1.head: εἰρήνη
div1.sense: peace, time of peace, Hom., etc.; ἐπʼ εἰρήνης in peace, Il.; εἰρ. γίγνεται peace is made, Hdt.; εἰρήνην ποιεῖν or ποιεῖσθαι to make a peace; εἰρ. ἄγειν to keep peace, Ar.; λύειν to break it, Dem.

div1.head: εἰρηνικός
div1.sense: of or for peace, peaceful, Plat., etc.: adv. -κῶς, peaceably, Xen.

div1.head: εἰρηνοποιός
div1.sense: a peace-maker, Xen.

div1.head: εἰρηνοφύλαξ
div1.sense: a guardian of peace, Xen.

div1.head: εἴρην
div1.sense: a Lacedaemonian youth who had completed his 20th year, when he was entrusted with authority over his juniors, Plut.

div1.head: εἴρη
div1.sense: a place of assembly, Epic gen. pl. εἰράων Il.

div1.head: εἱρκτέος
div1.sense: one must prevent, Soph.

div1.head: εἱρκτή
div1.sense: an inclosure, prison, Hdt.:—also the inner part of the house, the womenʼs apartments, Xen.

div1.head: εἰροκόμος
div1.sense: dressing wool, Il.

div1.head: εἰροπόκος
div1.sense: wool-fleeced, woolly, Hom.

div1.head: εἶρος
div1.sense: wool, Od.

div1.head: εἰροχαρής
div1.sense: delighting in wool, Anth.

div1.head: εἰρωνεία
div1.sense: dissimulation, i. e. assumed ignorance, irony, Plat., etc.

div1.head: εἰρωνεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dissemble, i. e. feign ignorance, Plat., etc.: generally, to dissemble, shuffle, Ar.

div1.head: εἰρωνικός
div1.sense: dissembling, putting on a feigned ignorance, Plat.: adv. -κῶς, Ar.

div1.head: εἴρων
div1.sense: a dissembler, one who says less than he thinks, Lat. dissimulator, Arist., etc.

div1.head: εἴρω
div1.etym: The Root is prob. !σερ, cf. Lat. sero, serui, σειρά
div1.sense: to fasten together in rows, to string, ἠλέκτροισιν ἐερμένος a necklace strung with pieces of electron, Od.

div1.head: εἰσαγγελεύς
div1.sense: one who announces, a gentleman usher at the Persian court, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσαγγελία
div1.sense: at Athens, an impeachment, Brought before the Senate of 500, or (sometimes) the ἐκκλησία, Xen.

div1.head: εἰσαγγέλλω
div1.sense: to go in and announce a person (cf. εἰσαγγελεύς) , Hdt., Eur., etc.
to announce, report a thing, Thuc.:—Pass., ἐσαγγελθέντων ὅτι . . information having been given that . . , Thuc.
to impeach, Dem., etc.; cf. εἰσαγγελία.

div1.head: εἰσαγγελτικός
div1.sense: of or for impeachment, ap. Dem.

div1.head: εἰσαγείρω
div1.sense: to collect into a place, Hom.:— Mid., νέον δʼ ἐσαγείρατο θυμόν he gathered fresh courage, Il.: but also in pass. sense, θοῶς δʼ ἐσαγείρατο λαὸς εἰς τὰς ναῦς Od.

div1.head: εἰσάγω
div1.sense: to lead in or into, to introduce, c. dupl. acc., αὐτοὺς εἰσῆγον δόμον Od.; also, εἰσάγειν τινὰ ἐς . . , Hdt.; or c. dat., τινὰ δόμοις Eur.:—Mid. to admit forces into a city, Thuc.: also to introduce into a league, Hdt.
ἐσάγειν or ἐσάγεσθαι γυναῖκα to lead a wife into oneʼs house, ducere uxorem, Hdt.
to import foreign wares, Hdt., Attic; so in Mid., Hdt., etc.
ἰατρὸν εἰσάγειν τινί to call in a physician, Xen.
to introduce new customs, Hdt., Eur.
to bring in, bring forward, esp. on the stage, Ar., Plat.
εἰσάγειν τι ἐς τὴν βουλήν to bring before the Council, Xen.
as law-term, εἰσάγειν δίκην or γραφήν to bring a cause into court, Lat. litem intendere, Aesch., Dem.: εἰσ. τινά to bring into court, prosecute, Plat.

div1.head: εἰσαγωγεύς
div1.sense: one who brings cases into court, Dem.

div1.head: εἰσαγωγή
div1.sense: importation of goods, Plat.
as law-term, a bringing causes into court, Plat.

div1.head: εἰσαγώγιμος
div1.sense: that can or may be imported, Plat.
as law-term, within the jurisdiction of the court, δίκη Dem.

div1.head: εἰσαεί
div1.sense: for εἰς ἀεί for ever, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: εἰσαείρομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to take to oneself. Theogn.

div1.head: εἰσαθρέω
div1.sense: to discern, descry, Il.

div1.head: εἰσαίρω
div1.sense: to bring or carry in, Ar.

div1.head: εἰσαΐσσω
div1.sense: to dart in or into, Ar.

div1.head: εἰσαΐω
div1.sense: to listen or hearken to, c. gen., Theocr.

div1.head: εἰσακοντίζω
div1.sense: to throw or hurl javelins at, τινά Hdt.; εἰς τὰ γυμνά Thuc.
absol. to dart or spout, of blood, Eur.

div1.head: εἰσακούω
div1.sense: to hearken or give ear to one, Il.; c. acc. rei, Hhymn.; c. gen. pers., Soph., Eur., etc.
in Poets, simply, to hear, Soph., Eur.
c. dat. pers. to hearken to, give heed to, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσακτέος
div1.sense: one must bring into court (v. εἰσάγω II. 3), Ar., Xen.

div1.head: εἰσάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to spring or rush into, c. acc., Il.; ἐσάλλ. ἐς τὸ πῦρ to leap into it, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσαμείβω
div1.sense: to go into, enter, Aesch.

div1.head: εἰσαναβαίνω
div1.sense: to go up to or into, c. acc., Hom.

div1.head: εἰσαναγκάζω
div1.sense: to force into a thing, to constrain, τινά Aesch.

div1.head: εἰσανάγω
div1.sense: to lead up into, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: εἰσανεῖδον
div1.sense: to look up to, c. acc., Il.

div1.head: εἰσάνειμι
div1.sense: to go up into, c. acc., Il.

div1.head: εἰσάντα
div1.sense: right opposite, ἐσ. ἰδεῖν to look in the face, Hom.

div1.head: εἰσάπαξ
div1.sense: for εἰς ἅπαξ at once, once for all, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: εἰσαράσσω
div1.sense: to drive or force in upon, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσαυγάζω
div1.sense: to look at, view, Anth.

div1.head: εἰσαῦθις
div1.sense: for εἰς αὖθις hereafter, afterwards, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: εἰσαύριον
div1.sense: for εἰς αὔριον on the morrow, Ar.

div1.head: εἰσαφίημι
div1.sense: to let in, admit, Xen.

div1.head: εἰσαφικάνω
div1.sense: to come to, τινά Od.

div1.head: εἰσαφικνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to come into or to, reach or arrive at a place, c. acc., Od., Eur.; ἐσαπ. ἐς τόπον Hdt.; also c. dat., Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσβαίνω
div1.sense: to go into a ship, to go on board ship, embark, Od.; ἐσβ. ἐς ναῦν Hdt.
generally, to go into, enter, δόμους Eur.; εἰσβ. κακά to come into miseries, Soph.
Causal in aor1 ἀνέβησα, to make to go into, put on board, Il.

div1.head: εἰσβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw into, put into, foll. by εἰς, Hdt., Attic:—Mid. to put on board oneʼs ship, Hdt.
intr. to throw oneself into, make an inroad into, εἰς χώραν Hdt., Attic; πρὸς πόλιν εἰσβ. to fall upon it, Thuc.:—poet., c. acc., to come upon, fall in with, Eur.
of rivers, to empty themselves into, fall into, Hdt.

div1.head: εἴσβασις
div1.sense: an entrance, means of entrance, Eur.: embarkation, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσβατός
div1.sense: accessible, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσβιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to force oneʼs way into, εἰς οἶκον Plut.
to force oneself into the citizenship, Ar.

div1.head: εἰσβιβάζω
div1.sense: to put on board ship, τὸν στρατὸν ἐς τὰς νέας Hdt.
generally, to make to go into, ἐς τόπον Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσβλέπω
div1.sense: to look at, look upon, mostly with εἰς, Hdt.; but c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: εἰσβολή
div1.sense: an inroad, invasion, attack, Hdt., Eur.
an entrance, pass, ἡ ἐσβ. ἡ Ὀλυμπική the pass of Mount Olympus, Hdt.: a strait, Eur.:—so in pl., of Thermopylae, Hdt.:—in pl. also, the mouth of a river, Hdt.
an entering into a thing, a beginning, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: εἰσγράφω
div1.sense: to write in, inscribe:—Mid., ἐς τὰς σπονδὰς εἰσγράψασθαι to have oneself written or received into the league, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσδέρκομαι
div1.sense: to look at or upon, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: εἰσδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to take into, admit, ἐς τὸ ἱρόν Hdt.; c. acc., Eur.; c. dat., ἄντροις εἰσδέξασθαί τινα to receive him in the cave, Eur.; εἰσδ. τινα ὑπόστεγον Soph.

div1.head: εἰσδίδωμι
div1.sense: II. 2, of rivers, to flow into, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσδοχή
div1.sense: reception, εἰσδοχαὶ δόμων a hospitable house, Eur.

div1.head: εἰσδρομή
div1.etym: from εἰσδράμεῖν, aor2 inf. of εἰστρέχω
div1.sense: an inroad, onslaught, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσδύνω
div1.sense: to get or go into, with εἰς, Od., Hdt., etc.
c. acc. to enter, Lat. subire, Il., Hdt.:—of feelings, εἰσέδυ με μνήμη κακῶν Soph.; also c. dat., δεινόν τι ἐσέδυνε σφίσι great fear came upon them, Hdt.

div1.head: εἴσειμι
div1.sense: to go into, οὐκ Ἀχιλῆος ὀφθαλμοὺς εἴσειμι I will not come before Achillesʼ eyes, Il.:—more commonly with a prep., εἰσ. μετʼ ἀνέρας Od.; παρὰ βασιλέα Hdt.; εἰς . . or πρός . . , Hdt., Attic; εἰσ. εἰς σπονδάς to enter into a treaty, Thuc.
of the chorus or of actors, to come upon the stage, to enter, Plat.
as Attic law-term, to come into court, Dem.
to enter on an office, ὁ ἐσιών the new king, Hdt.
metaph. to come into oneʼs mind, c. acc., Hdt., Attic, Eur.; also c. dat., Eur.:— impers., εἰσῄει αὐτοὺς ὅπως . . , it came into their minds that . . , Xen.
of things, τὰ εἰσιόντα what enters into one, food, Xen.

div1.head: εἰσελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive in, of a shepherd driving in his flock, Od.
intr. to row or sail in, Od.: to ride in, Xen.:— to enter in triumphal procession, Plut.

div1.head: εἰσέλκω
div1.sense: to draw, haul, drag in or into: aor1 -είλκυσα, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: εἰσεμβαίνω
div1.sense: to go on board, Anth.

div1.head: εἰσέπειτα
div1.sense: for hereafter, Soph.

div1.head: εἰσέργνυμι
div1.sense: to shut up in (a mummy-case), Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσέρπω
div1.sense: to go into, Plut.

div1.head: εἰσέρρω
div1.sense: to go into, get in; aor1 εἰσήρρησα, Ar.

div1.head: εἰσερύω
div1.sense: to draw into, Od.

div1.head: εἰσέρχομαι
div1.note: but Attic fut. is supplied by εἴσειμι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to go in or into, enter, c. acc., Il., etc.; in Prose, εἰσ. εἰς . . , Xen., etc.; εἰσ. εἰς τὰς σπονδάς to come into the treaty, Thuc.; εἰσ. εἰς τοὺς ἐφήβους to enter the Ephebi, Xen.: of money, to come in, Xen.
of the chorus or of actors, to come upon the stage, to enter, Plat., Xen.:— to enter the lists, Soph.
as Attic law-term, of the accuser, to come into court, Plat., Dem.

metaph., μένος ἄνδρας ἐσέρχεται courage enters into the men, Il.; Κροῖσον γέλως εἰσῆλθεalso c. dat., δέος εἰσ. τινι Plat.:—also to come into oneʼs mind, Hdt.; so, impers., εἰσῆλθε αὐτόν, c. inf., it comes into oneʼs head that . . , Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσέτι
div1.sense: still yet, Theocr.

div1.head: εἰσέχω
div1.sense: intr. to stretch into, reach, extend, ἐπὶ Αἰθιοπίης towards Ethiopia, Hdt.; θάλαμος ἐσέχων ἐς τὸν ἀνδρεῶνα a chamber opening into the menʼs apartment, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to bring in, introduce a practice, Hdt.
to propose, Thuc., etc.; εἰσηγουμένου τινός on his motion, Thuc.
εἰσηγεῖσθαί τινι to represent a matter to a person, Thuc.
to relate, narrate, explain, τινί τι Plat.

div1.head: εἰσήγημα
div1.sense: a proposition, motion, Aeschin.

div1.head: εἰσήγησις
div1.sense: a proposing, moving, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσηγητέος
div1.sense: one must move, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσηγητής
div1.sense: one who brings in, a mover, author, κακῶν Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσηθέω
div1.sense: to inject by a syringe, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσήκω
div1.sense: to have come in, Ar.:—in fut. to be about to come in, Aesch.

div1.head: εἰσηλυσία
div1.sense: a coming in, entrance, Anth.

div1.head: εἰσθέω
div1.sense: to run into, run up to him, Ar.

div1.head: εἰσθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to leap into or in, Il.; c. acc., ἐσθορεῖν δόμον Aesch.

div1.head: εἰσιδρύω
div1.sense: to build in, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to sit down in, c. acc., Il.

div1.head: εἰσίημι
div1.sense: to send into, ἐς τὴν λίμνην εἰσ. τὸ ὕδωρ, of rivers, Hdt.; εἰσ. τοὺς Πέρσας ἐς τὸ τεῖχος to let them in, Hdt.:—Mid. to let in Xen.
in Mid. also, to betake oneself into, enter, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: εἰσίθμη
div1.sense: an entrance, Od.

div1.head: εἰσικνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go into, penetrate, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσιτήριος
div1.sense: belonging to entrance:— εἰσιτήρια (sc. ἱερά) , τά, a sacrifice at entrance on an office, Dem.

div1.head: εἰσιτητέος
div1.sense: one must go in, Luc.

div1.head: εἰσκαλαμάομαι
div1.sense: to haul in as an angler the fish which he has hooked, Ar.

div1.head: εἰσκαλέω
div1.sense: to call in, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: εἰσκαταβαίνω
div1.sense: to go down into, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: εἴσκειμαι
div1.sense: to be put on board ship, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσκηρύσσω
div1.sense: to summon by public crier, Soph., Ar.

div1.head: εἰσκομιδή
div1.sense: importation of supplies, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry into the house, carry in, Hes., Aesch., etc.:—Mid. to bring in for oneself, import, Thuc.:—Pass., εἰσκομίζεσθαι εἰς τόπον to get into a place for shelter, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσκυκλέω
div1.sense: in a theatre, to turn a thing inwards by machinery, of changing scenes in a theatre: —metaph., δαίμων πράγματα εἰσκεκύκληκεν εἰς τὴν οἰκίαν some spirit has brought scenes of trouble into the house, Ar.

div1.head: εἰσλεύσσω
div1.sense: to look into, Soph.

div1.head: εἰσμαίομαι
div1.sense: to touch to the quick, affect greatly, Il.
to put in the hand to feel, ἐσεμάξατο χεῖρας (Doric form) Theocr.

div1.head: εἰσνέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go into, Anth.

div1.head: εἰσνέω
div1.sense: to swim into, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσνοέω
div1.sense: to perceive, remark, Hom.

div1.head: ἐΐσκω
div1.etym: Epic Verb, only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to make like (cf. ἴσκω), Od.
to deem like, liken, compare, τινά or τί τινι Hom.
c. acc. et inf. to deem, suppose, Hom.
absol., ὡς σὺ ἐΐσκεις as thou deemest, Od.

div1.head: εἴσοδος
div1.sense: a way in, entrance, i. e., place of entrance, entry, Od., Hdt., etc.
entrance, a right or privilege of entrance, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: εἰσοικειόω
div1.sense: to bring in as a friend, Plut.:— Pass. to become intimate with another, Xen.

div1.head: εἰσοικέω
div1.sense: to settle in, Anth.

div1.head: εἰσοίκησις
div1.sense: a place for dwelling in, a home, Soph.

div1.head: εἰσοικίζω
div1.sense: to bring in as a settler:—Mid. and Pass. to establish oneself in, settle in, εἰς τόπον Hdt.; c. acc., Plut.

div1.head: εἰσοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build into, εἰς τεῖχος Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσοιστέος
div1.sense: to be brought in, Dem.

div1.head: εἰσοιχνέω
div1.sense: to go into, enter, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: εἰσόκε
div1.sense: until, with subj., Il., (in 3. 409, ποιήσεται is Epic for ποιήσηται) .
so long as, Il.

div1.head: εἰσοπίσω
div1.sense: in time to come, hereafter, Hhymn., Soph.

div1.head: εἴσοπτος
div1.sense: visible, Hdt.

div1.head: εἴσοπτρον
div1.sense: a mirror, Pind.

div1.head: εἰσοράω
div1.sense: to look into, look upon, view, behold, c. acc., Hom., etc.:—so in Mid., Il.
to look upon with admiration, Lat. suspicere, θεοὺς ὣς εἰσορόωσιν Il.:—hence to pay regard to, respect, τι Soph., Eur.; so, ἐσ. ἔς τι Hdt.; εἰσορ. πρός τι to look at, eye eagerly, Soph.
to look on with the mindʼs eye, perceive, Soph.
of angry gods, to visit, punish, Soph.
followed by μή, to take care lest . . , Soph.

div1.head: εἰσορμάω
div1.sense: to bring forcibly into, Anth.:— Pass. to force oneʼs way into, c. acc., Soph.

div1.head: εἰσορμίζω
div1.sense: to bring into port:—Pass.and Mid. to run into port, Xen., Plut.

div1.head: ἔϊσος
div1.sense: alike, equal:
of a feast, equal, i. e. equally shared, of which each partakes alike, Il.
of ships, even or well-balanced, Hom.
of a shield, equal all ways, i. e. perfectly round, Il.
of the mind, even, well-balanced, Lat. aequus, Od.

div1.head: εἰσότε
div1.sense: against the time when, Od.

div1.head: εἰσοχή
div1.sense: a hollow, recess, Strab.

div1.head: εἴσοψις
div1.sense: a spectacle, Eur.

div1.head: εἰσπαίω
div1.sense: to burst or rush in, Soph.; c. acc. loci, Eur.

div1.head: εἰσπέμπω
div1.sense: to send in, bring in, let in, Eur., Thuc.: to prompt or suborn agents, Soph.

div1.head: εἰσπεράω
div1.sense: to pass over into, c. acc., Hes.

div1.head: εἰσπέτομαι
div1.sense: to fly into, c. acc., Il.; metaph. of reports, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰσπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap into, c. acc., Hdt.; εἰς τόπον Xen.
to burst in upon, πρός τινα Dem.

div1.head: εἰσπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall into, but generally with a notion of violence, to rush or burst in, ἐς πόλιν Hdt.; ἐς οἴκημα Thuc.:—poet. c. dat., ἐσπίπτει δόμοις Eur.
simply to fall into, ἐς χαράδρας Thuc.; εἰσπ. εἰς εἱρκτήν to be thrown into prison, Thuc.; in Poets, c. acc., Eur.
to fall into a certain condition, ξυμφοράν Eur.
to fall upon, attack, τινά Hdt., Soph.
εἰσπίτνω, poet. form of εἰσπίπτω, v. πίτνω, Eur.

div1.head: εἰσπλέω
div1.sense: to sail into, enter εἰς τόπον Thuc.: poet. c. acc., Soph., Eur.:—absol., ἐπʼ ἀριστερὰ ἐσπλέοντι on the left as one sails in, Hdt.; οὐδὲν εἰσπλεῖ nothing comes into port, Thuc.: of corn, to be imported, Dem.

div1.head: εἴσπλοος
div1.sense: a sailing in of ships, Thuc., Xen.
the entrance of a harbour, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσπνέω
div1.sense: to breathe upon, τινά Ar.

div1.head: εἰσπνήλας
div1.sense: one who inspires love, a lover, Theocr.

div1.head: εἰσποιέω
div1.sense: to give in adoption, εἰσποιεῖν υἱόν τινι Plat.; εἰσπ. ἑαυτὸν Ἀμμῶνι to make himself son to Ammon, Plut.:—Mid. to adopt as oneʼs son, Dem.
generally, εἰσπ. τινας εἰς λειτουργίαν to introduce new persons into the public service, Dem.

div1.head: εἷς
div1.etym: a neut. dat. (ἰῷ κίον ἤματι) also occurs in Il.
The orig. form was prob. !ενς, cf. Lat. unus. The fem. μία points to a second Root, cf. οἶος with μόνος.
div1.sense: one, Hom., etc.; εἷς οἶος, μία οἴη a single one, one alone, Hom.; εἷς μόνος Hdt.
with a Sup., like Lat. unus omnium maxime, εἷς ἀνὴρ πλεῖστον πόνον παρασχών Aesch.; κάλλιστʼ ἀνὴρ εἷς Soph.; πάντων εἷς ἀνὴρ τῶν μεγίστων αἴτιος κακῶν Dem.
in oppos., made emphatic by the Art., ὁ εἷς, ἡ μία Hom., Attic
with a negat., εἷς οὐδείς nullus unus, no single man, Hdt., Thuc.; οὐχ εἷς, i. e. more than one, Aesch.; and more emphatic, οὐδὲ εἷς, μηδὲ εἷς, v. οὐδείς, μηδείς.
εἷς ἕκαστος each one, each by himself, Lat. unusquisque, Hdt., Plat.
often with κατά, καθʼ ἓν ἕκαστον each singly, piece by piece, Hdt., etc.; so, καθʼ ἕνα, καθʼ ἕν one by one, Plat.
with other Preps., ἓν ἀνθʼ ἑνός above all, Plat.: —ἓν πρὸς ἕν, in comparisons, Hdt., Plat.; εἷς πρὸς ἕνα Dem.: —παρ’ ἕνα alternately, Luc.
one, i. e. the same, εἷς καὶ ὅμοιος Plat.: c. dat. one with . . , Eur.
one, as opp. to another; so, ὁ μὲν . . , εἷς δὲ . . , εἷς δʼ αὖ . . , Od.; εἷς μέν . . , ἕτερος δέ . . , Xen.
indefinitely, εἷς τις, some one, Lat. unus aliquis, Soph., Plat.;—then alone, like our indef. Art. a, an, (as faber unus Hor.), Eur.
οὐδὲ εἷς οὐδὲ δύο not one or two only, Dem.

div1.head: εἰσποιητός
div1.sense: adopted, Dem.

div1.head: εἰσπορεύω
div1.sense: to lead into, Eur.:—Pass. with fut. mid. to go into, enter, Xen.

div1.head: εἴσπραξις
div1.sense: a getting in or collection of dues, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: εἰσπράσσω
div1.sense: to get in or exact debts, taxes, dues, Dem.; τινά from a person, Dem.:—Mid. to exact for oneself, have paid one, Eur.:—Pass., of the money, to be exacted, Dem.

div1.head: εἰσρέω
div1.sense: to stream in or into, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: εἰστίθημι
div1.sense: to put into, place in, τινα or τι εἰς χεῖράς τινι Hdt., Thuc.; τινὰ ἐς ἅμαξαν Hdt.
ἐστ. ἐς ναῦν to put on board ship, Lat. navi imponere, Hdt.; τέκνα ἐσθέσθαι (aor2 inf.) to put their children on board, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰστοξεύω
div1.sense: to shoot arrows at, Hdt.

div1.head: εἰστρέχω
div1.sense: to run in, Thuc.; c. acc. to run into, Theocr.

div1.head: εἰσφέρω
div1.sense: to carry into or to, Od., Hdt.
to bring in, contribute, Plat., Xen., etc.:—at Athens, to pay the property-tax (v. εἰσφορά II), Thuc.
to bring (suffering) in or upon, πένθος εἰσφ. δόμοις Eur., etc.
to introduce, bring forward, propose, Hdt.; γνώμην ἐσφ. ἐς τὸν δῆμον Thuc.; εἰσφ. νόμον, Lat. legem rogare, Dem.:—absol., like Lat. referre ad senatum, Thuc.
Mid. with perf. pass. εἰσενήνεγμαι, to carry with one, sweep along, Il.
to bring in for oneself, to import, Hdt., Thuc.
to bring in with one, introduce, Hdt., Eur.
Pass. to be brought in, introduced, Hdt.
to rush in, Thuc.

div1.head: εἰσφοιτάω
div1.sense: to go often to or into, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: εἰς
div1.sense: PREP. WITH ACC. ONLY. Radical sense, into, and then to:

OF PLACE, the commonest usage, εἰς ἅλα into or to the sea, Hom., etc.:—properly opposed to ἐκ, ἐς σφυρὸν ἐκ πτέρνης from head to foot, Il.; εἰς ἔτος ἐξ ἔτεος from year to year, Theocr.:—then, with all Verbs implying motion or direction, ἰδεῖν εἰς οὐρανόν Il.; εἰς ὦπα ἰδέσθαι to look in the face, Il.:—in Hom. and Hdt. also c. acc. pers., where the Attic use ὡς, πρός, παρά.

with Verbs which express rest in a place, when a previous motion into or to it is implied, ἐς μέγαρον κατέθηκε, i. e. he brought it into the house, and put it there, Od.; παρεῖναι ἐς τόπον to go to a place and be there, Hdt.
with Verbs of saying or speaking, λόγους ποιεῖσθαι εἰς τὸ πλῆθος to come before the people and speak, Hdt., etc.

elliptical usage εἰς Ἀΐδαο, Attic εἰς Ἅιδου δόμους, ἐς Ἀθηναίης ἱερόν to the temple of Athena, etc.; as in Lat. ad Apollinis, ad Castoris (sc. aedem); so with appellatives, ἀνδρὸς ἐς ἀφνειοῦ to a rich manʼs, Il.
OF TIME,

to denote a certain point or limit of time, to, up to, until, ἐς ἠῶ (Attic εἰς τὴν ἕω) Od.; ἐς ἠέλιον καταδύντα till sun-set, Od.; ἐς ἐμέ up to my time, Hdt.:—so with Advs., εἰς ὅτε (cf. ἔς τε) against the time when, Od.; so, εἰς πότε; until when? how long? Soph.; ἐς ὃ until, Hdt.

to determine a period, εἰς ἐνιαυτόν for a year, i. e. a whole year, Hom.; ἐς θέρος ἢ ἐς ὀπώρην for the summer, Od.; εἰς ἑσπέραν ἥκειν to come at even, Ar.; εἰς τρίτην ἡμέραν or εἰς τρίτην alone, on the third day, in three days, Plat.; ἐς τέλος at last, Hdt.; οὐκ ἐς ἀναβολάς with no delay, Hdt.;—so with Advs., ἐς αὔριον Il.; ἐς αὖθις or ἐσαῦθις Thuc.; εἰς ἔπειτα Soph., etc.; cf. εἰσάπαξ, εἰσότε.
to express MEASURE OR LIMIT, ἐς δίσκουρα λέλειπτε was left behind as far as a quoitʼs throw, Il.; ἐς δραχμὴν διέδωκε paid them as much as a drachma, Thuc.
with Numerals, ναῦς ἐς τὰς τετρακοσίους to the number of 400, Thuc.; εἰς ἕνα, εἰς δύο, one, two deep, etc., Xen.
to express RELATION, to or towards, ἁμαρτάνειν εἴς τινα Aesch.; ἔχθρα ἔς τινα Hdt.
in regard to, like Lat. quod attinet ad, εὐτυχεῖν ἐς τέκνα Eur.; ἐς τὰ ἄλλα Thuc.; τό γʼ εἰς ἑαυτόν, τὸ εἰς ἐμέ Soph., Eur.
periphr. for Advs., ἐς κοινόν κοινῶς, Aesch.; ἐς τὸ πᾶν πάντως, Aesch.; εἰς τάχος ταχέως, Ar.

of an END, ἔρχεσθαι, τελευτᾶν ἐς . . , to end in . . , Hdt., etc.; καταξαίνειν ἐς φοινικίδα to cut into red rags, Ar.:—also, of a Purpose, εἰς ἀγαθόν for good, for his good, Il.; εἰς κάλλος ζῆν to live for show, Xen.

div1.head: εἰσφορά
div1.sense: a gathering in, Xen.
at Athens, a property-tax levied to supply a deficit in the revenue, to meet the exigencies of war, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: εἰσφρέω
div1.sense: to let in, admit, Lat. admittere, Ar., Dem.:—Mid. to bring in with one, Eur.
div1.etym: The Root φρέω, prob. akin to φέρω, is only found in compos. with δια-, εἰσ-, ἐπεισ-, ἐκ-

div1.head: εἰσχειρίζω
div1.sense: to put into oneʼs hands, entrust, τί τινι Soph.

div1.head: εἰσχέω
div1.sense: to pour in or into, Hdt., Eur.:— Pass. with Epic syncop. aor2 ἐσεχύμην [ῠ], to stream in, ἐσέχυντο ἐς πόλιν Il.

div1.head: εἰσωπός
div1.sense: in sight of, εἰσωποὶ δʼ ἐγένοντο νεῶν [the Greeks] stood facing the ships, Il.

div1.head: εἴσω
div1.sense: to within, into, absol., μή πού τις ἐπαγγείλῃσι καὶ εἴσω lest some one may carry the news into the house, Od.; εἴσω ἀσπίδʼ ἔαξε he brake it even to the inside, Il.
c. acc., δῦναι δόμον Ἄϊδος εἴσω Il., etc.; Ἄϊδος εἴσω (sc. δόμον) Il.
= ἔνδον, inside, within, Od., etc.
c. gen., μένειν εἴσω δόμων Aesch.; εἴσω τῶν ὅπλων within the heavy-armed troops, i. e. encircled by them, Xen.

div1.head: εἰσωθέω
div1.sense: to thrust into:—Mid. to press in, Xen.

div1.head: εἶτα
div1.sense: to denote Sequence of Time, then, next, Lat. deinde, πρῶτα μὲν . . , εἶτα . . , Soph., Plat., etc.: soon, presently, Soph.

to denote Consequence, and so, then, therefore, accordingly, esp. in questions or exclamations to express surprise or sarcasm, and then . . ? and so . . ? κᾆτʼ οὐ δέχονται λιτάς; Soph.; εἴτʼ οὐκ αἰσχύνεσθε; Dem.

div1.head: εἴτε
div1.sense: εἰ, τε generally doubled, εἴτε . . , εἴτε Lat. sive . . , sive, either . . , or . . , whether . . , or . . the first εἴτε is sometimes omitted in Poets:—the first εἴτε is sometimes replaced by εἰ, as εἰ . . , εἴτε . . , Hdt., Trag.
also used, like εἰ, in indirect questions, Od., etc.

div1.head: εἰωθότως
div1.sense: in customary wise, as usual, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: Ἑκάεργος
div1.sense: the far-working: of Apollo, the far-shooting, far-darting, like ἑκηβόλος, Hom.

div1.head: ἕκαθεν
div1.sense: from afar, Il.; c. gen., ἕκαθεν πόλιος Il.
= ἑκάς, far off, far away, Od.

div1.head: ἑκάς
div1.sense: far, afar, far off, Lat. procul, Hom., Trag.; οὐχ ἑκάς Thuc.:—c. gen. far from, far away from, Il.; also, ἑκὰς ἀπὸ τοῦ τείχεος Il.
comp. ἑκαστέρω, farther, Od., etc.:—c. gen., Hdt.; also ἑκαστοτέρω Theocr.:—Sup. ἑκαστάτω, farthest, Il., Hdt.; ἑκαστάτω τινός farthest from . . , Hdt.
of Time, οὐχ ἑκὰς χρόνου in no long time, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑκασταχόθεν
div1.sense: adv. from each side, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἑκασταχόθι
div1.sense: adv. on each side, Plut.

div1.head: ἑκασταχοῖ
div1.sense: adv. to each side, every way, Plut.

div1.head: ἑκασταχόσε
div1.sense: adv. to each side, Thuc.

div1.head: ἑκασταχοῦ
div1.sense: adv. everywhere, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἑκάστοθι
div1.sense: for each or every one, Od.

div1.head: ἕκαστος
div1.sense: every, every one, each, each one, Lat. quisque, Hom., etc.; the sg. is often joined with a pl. Verb, ἔβαν οἴκονδε ἕκαστος they went home every one of them, Il.; ἕκαστος ἐπίστασθε Xen.:—the sg. is also put in apposition with a pl. Noun, Τρῶας ἕκαστον ὑπήλυθε τρόμος (for Τρώων ἕκαστον) fear seized them every one, Il.
in pl. all and each one, Hom.
more definitely, εἷς ἕκαστος, Lat. unusquisque, every single one, Hdt., etc.:— καθʼ ἕκαστον singly, by itself, Lat. singulatim, Plat., etc.
ὡς ἕκαστοι each by himself, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑκάστοτε
div1.sense: adv. each time, on each occasion, Hdt., etc.; ἑκάστοτʼ ἀεί Ar.

div1.head: Ἑκαταῖος
div1.sense: of Hecate: Ἑκάταιον or Ἑκάτειον, ου, τό, a statue or chapel of Hecate, Ar.

div1.head: ἑκατεράκις
div1.sense: at each time, Xen.

div1.head: ἑκάτερθε
div1.sense: on each side, on either hand, Lat. utrinque, Hom.: —c. gen. on each side of, Hom.

div1.head: ἑκάτερος
div1.sense: each of two, either, each singly, Hdt., etc.:—in sg., with a pl. noun, like Lat. uterque, ταῦτα εἰπόντες ἀπῆλθον ἑκάτερος Xen.; except when each party is a pl., Plat.

div1.head: ἑκατέρωθεν
div1.sense: on each side, on either hand, Like the poet. ἑκάτερθεν, Hdt., Thuc.; c. gen., ἑκ. τῆς πόλεως Thuc.

div1.head: ἑκατέρωθι
div1.sense: on each side, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑκατέρωσε
div1.sense: to each side, each way, both ways, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἑκατηβόλος
div1.sense: far-shooting, epith. of Apollo, Hom., Hes.; as Subst. the far-darter, Il.

div1.head: Ἑκάτη
