div1.sense: Hecate, the far-darter, Hes.; later, identified with Artemis.
Ἑκάτης δεῖπνον Hecateʼs dinner, a meal set out by rich persons at the foot of her statue on the 30th of each month for beggars and paupers, Ar.

div1.head: ἑκατογκεφάλας
div1.sense: hundred-headed, Pind.: so ἑκατογ-κέφαλος, ον, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἑκατόγχειρος
div1.sense: hundred-handed, of Briareus, Il.:— ἑκατόγ-χειρ, Plut.

div1.head: ἑκατόζυγος
div1.sense: with 100 benches for rowers, Il.

div1.head: Ἑκατομβαιών
div1.sense: the month Hecatombaeon, the first of the Attic year, answering to the last half of July and the first half of August, Attic

div1.head: ἑκατόμβη
div1.sense: properly an offering of a hundred oxen, — but generally, a great public sacrifice:—thus, in Il. we find a hecatomb of twelve oxen, in Od. of eighty-one.

div1.head: ἑκατόμβοιος
div1.sense: worth a hundred beeves, Il.

div1.head: ἑκατόμπεδος
div1.sense: measuring a hundred feet, Il.

div1.head: ἑκατόμπολις
div1.sense: with a hundred cities, Il.

div1.head: ἑκατόμπους
div1.sense: hundred-footed, Soph.

div1.head: ἑκατόμπυλος
div1.sense: hundred-gated, Il.

div1.head: ἑκατόν
div1.sense: a hundred, Lat. centum, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἑκατονταετηρίς
div1.sense: a term of 100 years, Plat.

div1.head: ἑκατοντάλαντος
div1.sense: rated at 100 talents, Ar.

div1.head: ἑκατονταπλασίων
div1.sense: a hundred times as much or many, Xen.

div1.head: ἑκατοντάρχης
div1.sense: leader of a hundred, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑκατοντάς
div1.sense: the number a hundred, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑκατοντόργυιος
div1.sense: of 100 fathoms, Ar.

div1.head: ἕκατος
div1.sense: far-shooting, epith. of Apollo, Il.

div1.head: ἑκατόστομος
div1.sense: hundred-mouthed, Eur.

div1.head: ἑκατοστός
div1.sense: the hundredth, Lat. centesimus, Hdt., etc.; ἐπʼ ἑκατοστά a hundred-fold, Hdt.
ἑκατοστή, ἡ, the hundredth part, a tax or duty at Athens, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ἐκβάζω
div1.sense: to speak out, declare, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκβαίνω
div1.sense: to step out of or off from a place, c. gen., Il., etc.; ἐκβ. ἐκ . . , Thuc.:—absol. to disembark, dismount, Il., etc.
to go out of a place, c. gen. or ἐκβ. ἐκ . . , Eur., etc.
c. acc. to outstep, overstep, Eur., Plat.
in Poets, the instrument of motion is added in acc., ἐκβὰς πόδα Eur.; cf. βαίνω A. II. 3.
metaph.,
to come out so and so, come to pass, turn out, Hdt., Thuc.:— to be fulfilled, of prophecies, Dem.; κάκιστος ἐκβ. to prove a villain, Eur.:— τὰ ἐκβησόμενα things likely to happen, Hdt., etc.
to go out of due bounds, to go far, ἐς τοῦτʼ ἐκβέβηκʼ Eur.
Causal, in aor1 -έβησα, to make to go out, to put out of a ship, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκβακχεύω
div1.sense: to excite to Bacchic frenzy, to make frantic, Eur., Plat.:—Pass. to be frenzied, Plat.; so in Mid., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw or cast out of a place, c. gen., Il., etc.; or absol. to throw out, throw overboard, Od.: also, like Lat. ejicere, to throw ashore, Od., Hdt.; but, ἐκβ. ἐς τὸ πέλαγος carry out to sea, Hdt.:—Mid. to put ashore, Hdt.
to cast out of a place, banish, Hdt., etc.
to expose on a desert island, Soph.; to expose a dead body, Soph.
to divorce a wife, Dem.
to cast out of his seat, depose a king, Aesch., etc.
to strike out of, Lat. excutere, χειρῶν ἔκβαλλε κύπελλα Od.;—absol., δοῦρα ἐκβ. to fell trees (properly, to cut them out of the forest), Od.
to strike open, break in, πύλας Eur.
to let fall, χειρὸς ἔκβαλεν ἔγχος Il.:—metaph., ἔπος ἐκβ. to let fall a word, Hom., etc.; so, δάκρυα ἔκβ. Od.; ἐκβ. ὀδόντας to cast oneʼs teeth, Eur.
to throw away, reject, Soph., etc.:— to reject a candidate for office, Dem.; to drive an actor from the stage, Lat. explodere, Dem.
to lose, properly by oneʼs own fault, Soph., etc.
to produce, of women, Plut.; so, of wheat, ἐκβ. στάχυν Eur.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) to go out, depart, Eur.; of a river, to empty, discharge itself, Plat.

div1.head: ἔκβασις
div1.sense: a way out, egress, Od., Xen.
a going out of, escape from, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκβάω
div1.sense: ἐκβῶντας, Foed. in Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκβεβαιόομαι
div1.sense: to establish, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκβιάζω
div1.sense: to force out:—Pass., τόξον χειρῶν ἐκβεβιασμένον the bow forced from mine hands, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκβιβάζω
div1.sense: to make to step out, Ar.; ἐκβ. ποταμόν to turn a river out of its channel, Hdt.:—metaph., ἐκβ. τινὰ δικαίων λόγων to stop one from discussing the question of justice, Thuc.
to land one from a ship, disembark, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκβιβρώσκω
div1.sense: to devour, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκβλαστάνω
div1.sense: to sprout out, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκβλητέος
div1.sense: one must cast out, Plat.

div1.head: ἔκβλητος
div1.sense: thrown out or away, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκβλύζω
div1.sense: to gush out, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκβοάω
div1.sense: to call out, cry aloud, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἐκβοήθεια
div1.sense: a going out to aid, a sally of the besieged, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκβοηθέω
div1.sense: to march out to aid, Hdt.: to make a sally, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκβολβίζω
div1.sense: to peel, as one does an onion of its outer coats, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκβολή
div1.sense: a throwing out, ψήφων ἐκβ. turning the votes out of the urn, Aesch.
a throwing the cargo overboard, Aesch.
ejectment, banishment, Aesch., Plat.
a letting fall, δακρύων Eur.
a bringing forth:— ἐκβ. σίτου the time when the corn comes into ear, Thuc.
(from intr. signf. of ἐκβάλλω) a going out, outlet, Lat. exitus, ἐκβ. ποταμοῦ the discharge of a river from between mountains, Hdt.: a mountain-pass, Hdt.: the mouth of a river, Thuc.
ἐκβ. λόγου a digression, Thuc.
(from Pass.), that which is cast out, ἐκβ. δικέλλης earth cast or scraped up by a hoe or mattock, Soph.; οὐρεία ἐκβολή children exposed on the mountains, Eur.
a cargo cast overboard, ἐκβολαὶ νεώς wrecked seamen, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκβολος
div1.sense: cast out of a place, c. gen., Eur.:—as Subst., ἔκβολον, ου, τό, an outcast, Eur.:—but, ναὸς ἔκβολα rags cast out from the ship, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκβράζω
div1.sense: to throw out foam, of the sea:—Pass., of ships, to be cast ashore, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκβροντάω
div1.sense: to strike out by lightning, ἐξεβροντήθη σθένος he had strength struck out of him by lightning, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκβρυχάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bellow forth or aloud, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκβρωμα
div1.sense: anything eaten out, πρίονος ἔκβ. saw- dust, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκγαμίζω
div1.sense: to give in marriage, and Pass. to be given in marriage, NTest.:—so, ἐκγαμίσκομαι, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκγαυρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to exult greatly in, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκγελάω
div1.sense: to laugh out, laugh loud, Od., Xen.: metaph. of a liquid, to rush gurgling out, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκγίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to be born of a father, c. gen., Ἑλένη Διὸς ἐκγεγαυῖα Il.
c. dat. to be born to, Πορθεῖ τρεῖς παῖδες ἐξεγένοντο Il.
in aor2 to have gone by, χρόνου ἐκγεγονότος time having gone by, Hdt.: c. gen., ἐκγενέσθαι τοῦ ζῆν to have departed this life, Xen.

impers., ἐκγίγνεται, like ἔξεστι, it is allowed, it is granted, c. dat. pers. et inf., mostly with a negat., οὐκ ἐξεγένετό τινι ποιεῖν it was not granted him to do, Hdt.: absol., οὐκ ἐξεγένετο it was not in his power, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκγλύφω
div1.sense: to scoop out: irr. perf. pass. ἐξέγλυμμαι Plat.
to hatch, Plut.

div1.head: ἔκγονος
div1.sense: born of, sprung from, τινός Hom.
as Subst. a child, whether son or daughter, Hom.; and in pl. ἔκγονοι, descendants, Hdt., etc.; neut., ἔκγονά τινος oneʼs offspring, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκγράφω
div1.sense: to write out:—Mid. to write out or copy for oneself, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: ἐκγυμνόω
div1.sense: in pass. to be stript utterly, Babr.

div1.head: ἐκδακρύω
div1.sense: to burst into tears, weep aloud, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἔκδεια
div1.sense: a falling short, being in arrear, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to shew forth, exhibit, display, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἔκδεξις
div1.sense: a receiving from another: succession, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκδέρω
div1.sense: to strip off the skin from a person, c. acc., Hdt.: also c. acc. rei, to strip off, βύρσαν ἐκδ. Eur.

div1.head: ἔκδετος
div1.sense: fastened to, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
mostly of persons,
to take or receive from another, τί τινι Il., Aesch.
to take up, of a successor, τὴν ἀρχὴν παρά τινος Hdt., etc.; often also with the acc. omitted, ἐξεδέξατο Σαδυάττης (sc. τὴν βασιληΐην) he succeeded, Hdt.
to take up the argument, ὥσπερ σφαῖραν ἐκδ. τὸν λόγον Plat.
to wait for, expect, Soph.
of events, to await, Lat. excipere, Hdt.
of contiguous countries, to come next, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκδέω
div1.sense: to bind so as to hang from, to fasten to or on, c. gen., Il.: absol., σανίδας ἐκδῆσαι to bind planks (to his back), Od.:—Mid. to bind a thing to oneself, hang it round one, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔκδηλος
div1.sense: conspicuous, Il.:— quite plain, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκδημέω
div1.sense: to be abroad, to be on oneʼs travels, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἐκδημία
div1.sense: a being abroad, exile, Plat.

div1.head: ἔκδημος
div1.sense: from home, gone on a journey, Xen.; ἐκδ. στρατεῖαι service in foreign lands, Thuc.; ἔκδ. φυγή Eur.
c. gen. departed from, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκδιαβαίνω
div1.sense: to pass quite over, c. acc., Il.

div1.head: ἐκδιαιτάω
div1.sense: Act. decide a case as arbiter; Mid. to depart from oneʼs accustomed mode of life, change oneʼs habits, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκδιαίτησις
div1.sense: change of habits, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκδίδαγμα
div1.sense: prentice-work, a sampler, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκδιδάσκω
div1.sense: to teach thoroughly, Lat. edocere, Aesch., etc.; ἐκδ. τινά τι Soph.:—Mid. to have another taught, of the parents, Hdt., Eur.:—Pass., αἰσχρὰ ἐκδιδάσκεται is taught disgraceful things, Soph.; ἐκδιδαχθεὶς τῶν κατʼ οἶκον having learnt of things at home, Soph.
c. acc. pers. et inf. to teach one to be so and so, Soph.; inf. omitted, γενναῖόν τινα ἐκδ. Ar.

div1.head: ἐκδιδράσκω
div1.sense: to run out from, run away, escape, ἐκ τόπου Hdt.; absol., Ar.

div1.head: ἐκδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give up, surrender, esp. something seized unlawfully, Lat. reddere, Il., Hdt.:— ἐκδ. δοῦλον to give up a slave to be examined by torture, Dem.
ἐκδ. θυγατέρα to give oneʼs daughter in marriage, Lat. nuptum dare, Hdt., Attic; so in Mid., ἐκδίδοσθαι θυγατέρα Hdt., Eur.
to give out for money, let out for hire, Hdt.:—c. inf., like Lat. locare aliquid faciendum, Dem.
to lend out money on security, such as the cargo of a ship, ap. Dem.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν or -ούς) of rivers, to empty themselves, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκδικάζω
div1.sense: to decide finally, settle, of a judge, Ar.
to avenge, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκδικαστής
div1.sense: an avenger, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκδικέω
div1.sense: to avenge, punish a crime, NTest.: also to exact vengeance for a crime, NTest.
to avenge a person, NTest.; ἐκδ. τινὰ ἀπό τινος to avenge one on another, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκδίκησις
div1.sense: an avenging, ἐκδίκησιν ποιεῖν τινι to avenge him, NTest.

div1.head: ἔκδικος
div1.sense: without law, lawless, unjust, Lat. exlex, Aesch., etc.:—adv. -κως, Aesch.
maintaining the right, avenging, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκδιφρεύω
div1.sense: to throw from a chariot, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκδιώκω
div1.sense: to chase away, banish, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκδονέω
div1.sense: to shake utterly, confound, Anth.

div1.head: ἔκδοσις
div1.sense: a giving out or up, surrendering, Hdt., Plat.
a giving in marriage, portioning out, Plat.
a lending money on ships or exported goods, bottomry, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκδοτέος
div1.sense: one must give up, Plut.
one must give in marriage, Ar.

div1.head: ἔκδοτος
div1.sense: given up, delivered over, surrendered, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐκδοχή
div1.sense: a receiving from another, succession, Aesch., Eur.
= προσδοκία, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκδόχιον
div1.sense: a reservoir, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκδρακοντόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become a very serpent, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκδρομή
div1.etym: from ἐκδρᾰμεῖν, aor2 inf. of ἐκτρέχω
div1.sense: a running out, sally, charge, Xen.
a party of skirmishers, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔκδρομος
div1.etym: from ἐκδρᾰμεῖν, aor2 inf. of ἐκτρέχω
div1.sense: one that sallies out from the ranks, a skirmisher, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἔκδυμα
div1.sense: that which is stript off, a skin, garment, Anth.

div1.head: ἔκδυσις
div1.sense: a getting out, way out, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκδύω
div1.sense: Causal in pres. ἐκδύω, imperf. ἐξέδυον, fut. ἐκδύσω, aor1 ἐξέδῡσα:— to take off, strip off, Lat. exuere, c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, ἐκ μέν με χλαῖναν ἔδυσαν they stripped me of my cloke, Od.: c. acc. pers. only, to strip him, Xen., etc.
Mid. ἐκδύομαι, aor1 ἐξεδυσάμην:— to strip oneself of a thing, put off, Il., etc.: absol. to put off oneʼs clothes, strip, Ar., Xen.
in pres. ἐκδύνωin same sense as Mid. ἐκδύομαι
to put off, Od., Hdt.
in aor2 ἐξέδυν, perf. ἐκδέδῡκα, to go or get out of, c. gen., ἐκδὺς μεγάροιο Od.; ἐκδ. τῆς θαλάσσης to emerge from the sea, Plat.
c. acc. to escape, ἐκδῦμεν ὄλεθρον Il.

div1.head: ἐκδωριεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become a thorough Dorian, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκεῖθεν
div1.sense: from that place, thence, Lat. illinc, opp. to ἐκεῖσε, Soph., etc.
= ἐκεῖ, Aesch., Thuc.:—c. gen., τοὐκεῖθεν ἄλσους on yon side of the grove, Soph.
thence, from that fact, Isocr., Dem.
of Time, thereafter, next, Il.

div1.head: ἐκεῖνος
div1.sense: Demonstr. Pron.: the person there, that person or thing, Hom., etc.: when οὗτος and ἐκεῖνος refer to two things before mentioned, ἐκεῖνος, ille, belongs to the more remote, i. e. the former, οὗτος, hic, to the nearer, i. e. the latter.
like ille, to denote well-known persons, ἐκεῖνος Θουκυδίδης Ar.
with demonstr. force, Ἶρος ἐκεῖνος ἧσται Irus sits there, Od.

in Attic the Subst. with ἐκεῖνος properly has the Article, and ἐκεῖνος may precede or follow the Subst., ἐκείνῃ τῇ ἡμέρᾳ, τῇ ἡμέρᾳ ἐκείνῃ· when the Art. is omitted in Prose, ἐκεῖνος follows the Subst., νῆες ἐκεῖναι Thuc.
adv. ἐκείνως, in that way, in that case, Thuc.
dat. fem. ἐκείνῃ as adv.,
of Place (sub. ὁδῷ) , there, at that place, on that road, Hdt., Thuc.
of Manner, in that manner, Plat., etc.
with Preps., ἐξ ἐκείνου from that time, Xen.; so, ἀπʼ ἐκείνου Luc.: κατʼ ἐκεῖνα in that place, there, Xen.: μετʼ ἐκεῖνα afterwards, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκεῖ
div1.sense: there, in that place, Lat. illic, Attic
euphem. for ἐν Ἅιδου, in another world, Aesch., etc.; οἱ ἐκεῖ, i. e. the dead, Aesch.
with Verbs of motion, for ἐκεῖσε, as we say there for thither, ἐκεῖ πλέειν Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐκεῖσε
div1.sense: thither, to that place, Lat. illuc, opp. to ἐκεῖθεν, Hom., etc.
to the other world, Eur., Plat.; cf. ἐκεῖ I. 2.
c. gen., ἐκ. τοῦ λόγου from that part of the story, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκεχειρία
div1.sense: a holding of hands, a cessation of hostilities, armistice, truce, Thuc., Xen.
generally, rest from work, vacation, holiday, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκζέω
div1.sense: to boil out or over, break out, of curses, Aesch.
c. gen., εὐλέων ἐξέζεσε boiled over with worms, i. e. bred worms, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκζητέω
div1.sense: to seek out, enquire, NTest.
to demand an account of a thing, c. acc., NTest.

div1.head: ἐκζωπυρέω
div1.sense: to rekindle, Ar., Plut.

div1.head: ἑκηβολία
div1.sense: skill in archery, Il.

div1.head: ἑκηβόλος
div1.sense: far-darting, far-shooting, epith. of Apollo, Il.

div1.head: ἑξηκονταετία
div1.sense: a time of sixty years, Plut.

div1.head: ἕκηλος
div1.sense: at rest, at oneʼs ease, Lat. securus, of persons enjoying themselves, Hom.; ἕκηλοι συλήσετε ye will plunder them at your ease, i. e. without let or hindrance, Il.; ἕκ. εὕδειν Soph.; neut. as adv., Soph.

div1.head: ἕκητι
div1.sense: by means of, by virtue of, by the aid of, Διὸς ἕκητι Od., etc.
= ἕνεκα, on account of, for the sake of, Trag.: also, as to, Lat. quod attinet ad, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκθαμβέω
div1.sense: mid-pass. to be amazed, NTest.

div1.head: ἔκθαμβος
div1.sense: amazed, astounded, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκθαμνίζω
div1.sense: to root out, extirpate, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκθαρρέω
div1.sense: to have full confidence in a person, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: ἐκθεάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to see out, see to the end, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκθεατρίζω
div1.sense: to make a public show of, to expose to public shame, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκθειάζω
div1.sense: to make a god of, deify, Luc.: to worship as a god, Plut.
of things, to make matter of religion, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκθεραπεύω
div1.sense: to gain over entirely, Aeschin., Plut.

div1.head: ἐκθερίζω
div1.sense: to reap or mow completely, Dem.

div1.head: ἔκθεσις
div1.sense: a putting out, exposing, of a child, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἔκθεσμος
div1.sense: out of law, lawless: horrible, Plut.

div1.head: ἔκθετος
div1.sense: exposed, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκθέω
div1.sense: to run out, make a sally, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκθηράομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to hunt out, catch, Xen., Plut., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκθηριόω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to become quite savage, Lat. efferari, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκθλίβω
div1.sense: to squeeze much: to distress greatly, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die away, γέλῳ (for γέλωτι) ἔκθανον were like to die with laughing, Od.
to be in a death-like swoon, be at the point of death, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκθοινάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to feast on, c. acc., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκθρηνέω
div1.sense: to lament aloud, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to leap out of, c. gen., ἔκθορε δίφρου Il.; κραδίη δέ μοι ἔξω στηθέων ἐκθρώσκει of the violent beating of the heart, Il.:— rarely c. acc., Anth.

div1.head: ἐκθυμιάω
div1.sense: to burn as incense, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκθυμος
div1.sense: out of oneʼs mind, senseless, Lat. demens, Aesch.
very spirited, ardent, Plut.

div1.head: ἔκθυσις
div1.sense: atonement, Lat. expiatio, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκθύω
div1.sense: to offer up, sacrifice, slay, Soph., Eur.
Mid. to atone for, expiate by offerings, Lat. lustrare, expiare, c. acc. rei, Hdt.; but c. acc. pers. to propitiate, appease, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκκαγχάζω
div1.sense: to burst into loud laughter, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκκαθαίρω
div1.sense: to cleanse out:
with acc. of the thing cleansed, to clear out ditches, etc., Il.; χθόνα ἐκκαθαίρει κνωδάλων he clears this land of monsters, Aesch.:—Pass. to be purified, Xen.
with acc. of the dirt removed, to clear away, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκκαθεύδω
div1.sense: to sleep out of oneʼs quarters, Xen.

div1.head: ἑκκαιδεκάδωρος
div1.sense: sixteen palms long, Il.

div1.head: ἑκκαιδεκάλινος
div1.sense: consisting of sixteen threads, Xen.

div1.head: ἑκκαίδεκα
div1.sense: indecl. sixteen, Lat. sedecim, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑκκαιδεκάπηχυς
div1.sense: sixteen cubits long or high, Decret. ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἑκκαιδέκατος
div1.sense: sixteenth, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑκκαιδεκέτης
div1.sense: 16 years old, Anth.

div1.head: ἔκκαιρος
div1.sense: out of date, antiquated, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκκαίω
div1.sense: to burn out, Hdt., Eur.
to light up, kindle, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἐκκακέω
div1.sense: to be faint-hearted, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκκαλαμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to pull out with a fishing-rod, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκκαλέω
div1.sense: to call out or forth, summon forth, Hom., Hdt., Eur.
Mid. to call out to oneself, Od., Hdt.
to call forth, elicit, Aesch., etc.
c. inf. to call on one to do, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκκαλύπτω
div1.sense: to uncover, Hdt.: to disclose, Aesch., Soph.:—Mid. to uncover oneʼs head, unveil oneself, Od., Plat.

div1.head: ἐκκάμνω
div1.sense: to grow quite weary of a thing, c. acc., Thuc.; c. part., ἐξέκαμον πολεμοῦντες Plut.; ἐκκ. πληγαῖς to yield to blows, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκκαρπίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to yield as produce, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκκαρπόομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to enjoy the fruit of, ἄλλης γυναικὸς παῖδας ἐκκ. to have children by another wife, Eur.
to derive advantage from being, c. part., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκκατεῖδον
div1.sense: in use, to look down from a place, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἐκκαταπάλλω
div1.sense: Mid. to leap down from a place, c. gen., Il. See LSJ κατεφάλλομαι.

div1.head: ἐκκαυλίζω
div1.sense: to pull out the stalk: metaph. to pull up root and branch, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκκαυχάομαι
div1.sense: to boast loudly, c. inf., Eur.

div1.head: ἔκκειμαι
div1.sense: to be cast out or exposed, Hdt.
of public notices, to be set up in public, posted up, Dem.
c. gen. to fall from out, be left bare of, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκκενόω
div1.sense: to empty out, leave desolate, Aesch.; ἐκκενοῦν θυμὸν ἐς σχεδίαν γέροντος to pour out oneʼs spirit into Charonʼs boat, i. e. give up the ghost, Theocr.; ἐκκ. ἰούς to shoot all oneʼs arrows, Anth.:—Pass. to be left desolate, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκκεραΐζω
div1.sense: to cut off root and branch, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκκεχυμένως
div1.etym: adverb, part. perf. pass. of ἐκχέω
div1.sense: profusely, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκκηραίνω
div1.sense: to enfeeble, exhaust, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκκηρύσσω
div1.sense: to proclaim by voice of herald, Soph.
to banish by proclamation, Hdt.:—Pass., ἐξεκηρύχθην φυγάς Soph.

div1.head: ἐκκινέω
div1.sense: to move out of his lair, to put up, ἔλαφον Soph.: metaph. to stir up, rouse, excite, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκκίω
div1.sense: to go out, Od.

div1.head: ἐκκλάζω
div1.sense: to cry aloud, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκκλείω
div1.sense: to shut out from a place, c. gen., Eur.
metaph. to exclude from a thing, Hdt., Aeschin.:— Pass., ἐκκληϊόμενοι τῇ ὥρῃ being hindered by [want of] time, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκκλέπτω
div1.sense: to steal and bring off secretly, to purloin, Il., Hdt., etc.; ἐκκλ. πόδα to steal away, Eur.: —ἐκκλ. μὴ θανεῖν Eur.
ἐκκλ. τινὰ λόγοις to deceive him, Soph.; μὴ ἐκκλέψῃς λόγον disguise not the matter, speak not falsely, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκκλησιάζω
div1.etym: for the odd appearence of the preverb ἐκ in its full force, cf. ἐγκωμιάζω
div1.sense: to hold an assembly, debate therein, Ar., Thuc., etc.
to be a member of the Assembly, ἐκκλ. ἀπὸ τιμήματος οὐθενός Arist.

div1.head: ἐκκλησία
div1.sense: an assembly of the citizens regularly summoned, the legislative assembly, Thuc., etc.:—at Athens, the ordinary Assemblies were called κύριαι, the extraordinary being σύγκλητοι, ap. Dem.; ἐκκλ. συναγείρειν, συνάγειν, συλλέγειν, ἀθροίζειν to call an assembly, Hdt., etc.; ἐκκλ. ποιεῖν "to make a house, " Ar.; ἐκκλ. γίγνεται, καθίσταται an assembly is held, Thuc.; ἐκκλ. διαλύειν, ἀναστῆσαι to dissolve it, Thuc., etc.; ἀναβάλλειν to adjourn it, Thuc.
in NTest. the Church, either the body, or the place.

div1.head: ἐκκλησιαστής
div1.sense: a member of the ἐκκλησία, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκκλησιαστικός
div1.sense: of or for the ἐκκλησία, Dem.:— τὸ ἐκκλησιαστικὸν ἄργυρον the public pay received by each citizen who sat in the ἐκκλησία, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκκλητεύω
div1.sense: to summon into court, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἔκκλητος
div1.sense: selected to judge or arbitrate on a point, ἐκκλ. πόλις an umpire city, Aeschin.: —οἱ ἔκκλητοι, in Sparta, a committee of citizens chosen for special business, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκκλίνω
div1.sense: to bend out of the regular line: intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) to turn away, give ground, retire, Thuc., Xen.:—also c. acc. to avoid, shun, τι Plat.
to turn aside towards, κατά τι Xen.

div1.head: ἐκκλύζω
div1.sense: to wash out stains, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκκναίω
div1.sense: to wear out: metaph. of troublesome loquacity, like Lat. enecare, Theocr., in Doric fut. 3rd pl. ἐκκναισεῦντι.

div1.head: ἐκκνάω
div1.sense: to scrape off from, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκκοβαλικεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to cheat by juggling tricks, cajole, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκκοκκίζω
div1.sense: to take out the kernel: metaph., ἐκκ. σφυρόν to put out oneʼs ankle, Ar.; ἐκκ. τὰς πόλεις to sack, gut the cities, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκκολάπτω
div1.sense: to scrape out, obliterate, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκκολυμβάω
div1.sense: to swim out of, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκκομιδή
div1.sense: a carrying out, Hdt.: of a corpse, burial, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry out, esp. to a place of safety, Hdt.; ἐκκ. τινὰ ἐκ πρήγματος to keep him out of trouble, Hdt.: so in Mid., Hdt., Thuc.
to carry out a corpse, bury, Lat. efferre, Plut.
to endure to the end, τι Eur.

div1.head: ἐκκομπάζω
div1.sense: to boast loudly, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκκομψεύομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to set forth in fair terms, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκκοπή
div1.sense: a cutting out of an arrow-point from the body, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκκόπτω
div1.sense: to cut out, knock out:—Pass., ἐξεκόπη τὠφθαλμώ he had both his eyes knocked out, Ar.
to cut [trees] out of a wood, to fell (cf. ἐκβάλλω) , Hdt., Xen.; ἐκκ. τὸν παράδεισον cut down all the trees in the park, Xen.
metaph. to cut off, make an end of, Hdt., etc.
as military term, to beat off, repulse, Xen.
to cut off, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκκορέω
div1.sense: to sweep out, to sweep clean, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκκορίζω
div1.sense: to clear of bugs, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκκορυφόω
div1.sense: to tell summarily, sum up, Hes.

div1.head: ἐκκουφίζω
div1.sense: to raise up, exalt, Plut.
to relieve, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκκράζω
div1.sense: to cry out, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκκρεμάννυμι
div1.sense: to hang from or upon a thing; τι ἔκ τινος Ar.
Pass. to hang on by, cling to, c. gen., Thuc.:—metaph. to be devoted to, Eur.
Pass. to hang from, depend upon, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: ἐκκρεμής
div1.sense: hanging from or upon, τινος Anth.

div1.head: ἐκκρήμναμαι
div1.sense: c. gen., Eur.; ῥόπτρων χέρας ἐκκρημνάμεσθα we hang on to the door-handle by the hands, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκκρίνω
div1.sense: to choose or pick out, to single out, Thuc.:—Pass., aor1 part. ἐκκριθείς Soph.
to single out for disgrace, expel, like Lat. tribu movere, Xen.
to secrete, separate, ὅταν ὁ νοῦς ἐκκριθῇ Xen.

div1.head: ἔκκριτος
div1.sense: picked out, select, Aesch., Soph.:—neut. ἔκκριτον, as adv. above all, eminently, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκκρουσις
div1.sense: a beating out, driving away, Xen.

div1.head: ἔκκρουστος
div1.sense: beaten out, embossed, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκκρούω
div1.sense: to knock out, τι ἐκ τῶν χειρῶν Xen.
to drive back, repulse, Thuc., Xen.: metaph. to frustrate one of a thing, c. gen., Plut.
to hiss an actor off the stage, explodere, Dem.
to put off, adjourn by evasions, Dem.; ἐκκρ. τοὺς λόγους to baffle by putting off, elude, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκκυβεύω
div1.sense: mid. to lose at play, c. acc., Plut.

div1.head: ἐκκυβιστάω
div1.sense: to tumble headlong out of a chariot, c. gen., Eur.; ἐκκ. ὑπέρ τινος to throw a somersault over a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκκυέω
div1.sense: to put forth as leaves, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκκυκλέω
div1.sense: to wheel out, esp. by means of the ἐκκύκλημα (q. v.): ἀλλʼ ἐκκυκλήθητι come, wheel yourself out! i. e. shew yourself, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκκύκλημα
div1.sense: a theatrical machine, which served the purpose of drawing back the scenes, and disclosing the interior to the spectators.

div1.head: ἐκκυλίνδω
div1.sense: to roll out, Ar.:— to overthrow, Anth.:—Pass., ἐκ δίφροιο ἐξεκυλίσθη rolled headlong from the chariot, Il.
to extricate:—Pass. to be extricated from, τῆσδʼ ἐκκυλισθήσει τύχης Aesch.; ἐκκυλισθῆναι εἰς ἔρωτας to plunge headlong into intrigues, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκκυμαίνω
div1.sense: to wave from the straight line, of a line of soldiers, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκκυνέω
div1.sense: to keep questing about, of hounds, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκκυνηγετέω
div1.sense: to pursue in the chase, hunt down, τινα Eur.

div1.head: ἔκκυνος
div1.sense: of a hound, questing about, not keeping on one scent, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκκύπτω
div1.sense: to peep out of a place, c. gen., Babr.

div1.head: ἐκκωμάζω
div1.sense: to rush wildly out, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκκωφέω
div1.sense: to make quite deaf, Ar.:—Pass., metaph., ἐκκεκώφηται ξίφη swords are blunted, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκκωφόω
div1.sense: to make quite deaf, Plat.:—Pass. to become so, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκλαγχάνω
div1.sense: to obtain by lot or destiny, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκλακτίζω
div1.sense: to kick out, fling out behind, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκλαλέω
div1.sense: to speak out, blab, divulge, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to receive from others, receive in full, Soph., etc.
ἔργα ἐκλ. ἐργολαβέω, to contract to do work, opp. to ἐκδίδωμι (to let it out), Hdt.
to take in a certain sense, to understand, Lat. accipere, Plat.; ἐκλ. τι ἐπὶ τὸ χεῖρον Arist.

div1.head: ἐκλάμπω
div1.sense: to shine or beam forth, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐκλανθάνω
div1.sense: to escape notice utterly: — Mid., with perf. pass. ἐκλέλησμαι, to forget utterly, c. gen. rei, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκληθάνω
div1.sense: Causal, to make one quite forgetful of a thing, c. gen. rei, Od.: c. acc. rei, ἐκλέλαθον κιθαριστύν made him quite forget his harping, Il.

div1.head: ἐκλαπάζω
div1.sense: to cast out from a place, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκλάπτω
div1.sense: to drink off, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκλέγω
div1.sense: to pick or single out, Thuc., Xen.:—Mid. to pick out for oneself, choose out, Hdt., Plat., etc.
Mid. also, ἐκλέγεσθαι τὰς πολιὰς τρίχας to pull out oneʼs gray hairs, Ar.
to levy taxes or tribute, Thuc.; c. acc. pers., ἐκλ. τέλη τινάς to levy tolls on them, Aeschin.; so c. gen. pers., Xen.

div1.head: ἐκλείπω
div1.sense: to leave out, omit, pass over, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—Pass., ὄνειδος οὐκ ἐκλείπεται fails not to appear, Aesch.
to forsake, desert, abandon, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
in elliptic phrases, ἐκλείπειν τὴν πόλιν εἰς τὰ ἄκρα to abandon the city and go to the heights, Hdt.; εἴ τις ἐξέλιπε τὸν ἀριθμόν (of the Persian immortals) if any one left the number incomplete, Hdt.
intr., of the sun or moon, to suffer an eclipse, Thuc.;—in full, ὁ ἥλιος ἐκλιπὼν τὴν ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ ἕδρην Hdt.; cf. ἔκλειψις.
to die, οἱ ἐκλελοιπότες the deceased, Plat.; in full, ἐκλ. βίον Soph.
generally, to leave off, cease, stop, Hdt., etc.
to fail, be wanting, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκλειψις
div1.sense: abandonment, τῶν νεῶν Hdt.
(from intr.) of sun or moon, an eclipse, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκλεκτός
div1.sense: picked out, select, Thuc., Plat., etc.
οἱ ἐκλεκτοί, the elect, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκλελυμένως
div1.sense: loosely, carelessly, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκλέπω
div1.sense: to bring the young brood out of the shell, to hatch, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἐκλευκαίνω
div1.sense: to make quite white, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκλήγω
div1.sense: to cease utterly, Soph.

div1.head: ἔκλησις
div1.sense: a forgetting and forgiving, Od.

div1.head: ἐκλιμπάνω
div1.sense: to abandon, Eur.
intr. to cease, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκλιπαίνω
div1.sense: to fatten:—Pass. to grow fat, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκλιπής
div1.etym: from ἐκλῐπεῖν aor2 inf. of ἐκλείπω
div1.sense: failing, deficient, ἡλίου ἐκλιπές τι ἐγένετο
omitted, overlooked, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκλογή
div1.sense: a picking out, choice, election, Plat.
that which is chosen out, an extract, choice collection of passages, Hor.

div1.head: ἐκλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to compute, calculate, Plut.
to consider, reflect on, τι Hdt., Eur.; περί τινος Thuc.
to reckon on, οὐδεὶς αὑτοῦ θάνατον ἐκλογίζεται Eur.

div1.head: ἐκλογισμός
div1.sense: a computation, calculation, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκλοχεύω
div1.sense: to bring forth, Eur., in Mid.:—Pass. to be born, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκλυσις
div1.sense: release or deliverance from a thing, c. gen., Aesch., etc.
feebleness, faintness, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκλυτήριος
div1.sense: of or for release:— ἐκλυτήριον, τό, a release, Soph.: an expiatory offering, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκλυτος
div1.sense: easy to let go, light, buoyant, of missiles, Eur.
adv. ἐκλύτως, remissly, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκλύω
div1.sense: to loose, release, set free, from a thing, c. gen., Aesch., Soph.:—Pass. to be set free, Plat.:— Mid. to get one set free, to release from, c. gen., Od., etc.
to unloose, unstring a bow, Hdt.; ἐκλύσων στόμα likely to let loose the tongue, Soph.
to put an end to, Soph., Eur.
to relax, enfeeble:— Pass. to be faint, fail, give way, Dem.
to pay in full, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκλωβάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to sustain grievous injuries, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκλωπίζω
div1.sense: to lay bare, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκμαγεῖον
div1.sense: that on or in which an impression is made: also the impression made, an impress, mould, Plat.:—metaph., ἐκμαγεῖον πέτρης counterfeit of rock, of a fisherman who is always on them, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκμαίνω
div1.sense: to drive mad with passion, Eur., Theocr.; ἐκμῆναί τινα δωμάτων to drive one raving from the house, Eur.:—Pass., with perf. 2 act. ἐκμέμηνα, to go mad with passion, be furious, Hdt.
c. acc. rei, ἐκμῆναι πόθον to kindle mad desire, Soph.

div1.head: ἔκμακτρον
div1.sense: an impress, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκμανθάνω
div1.sense: to learn thoroughly, and, in past tenses, to have learnt thoroughly, to know full well, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
to examine closely, search out, Hdt., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἐκμαραίνω
div1.sense: to make to wither away, Anth.:— Pass. to wither away, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐκμαργόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go raving mad, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκμαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to bear witness to a thing, c. acc., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκμαρτυρία
div1.sense: the deposition of a witness, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκμάσσατο
div1.sense: ἐκ-μάσσατο, 3rd sg. aor1, he devised or invented, τι Hhymn.; v. μαίομαι.

div1.head: ἐκμάσσω
div1.sense: to wipe off, wipe away Soph., Eur.:—Mid. to wipe away oneʼs tears, Anth.
of an artist, to mould or model in wax or plaster, Lat.exprimere, Plat.:—Mid., τοκέων ἐκμάσσεται ἴχνη he impresses anew the footsteps of his fathers, i. e. walks in their steps, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐκμεθύσκω
div1.sense: to make quite drunk, to saturate with a thing, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ἐκμείρομαι
div1.sense: in perf. 2 ἐξέμμορε τιμῆς obtained a chief share of honour, Od.

div1.head: ἐκμελετάω
div1.sense: to train carefully, τινα Plat.
to learn perfectly, con over, practise, τι Plat.

div1.head: ἐκμελής
div1.sense: out of tune, dissonant, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκμετρέω
div1.sense: to measure out, measure, χρόνον Eur.:—Mid. to measure for oneself, take measure of, τι Xen.; ἄστροις ἐκμετρούμενος χθόνα calculating its position by the stars, Soph.

div1.head: ἕκμηνος
div1.sense: of six months, half-yearly, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκμηνύω
div1.sense: to inform of, betray, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκμηρύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to wind out like a ball of thread: of an army, to make it defile out of a place, c. gen., Polyb., Plut.
intr., of the army, to defile, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκμιμέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to imitate faithfully, represent exactly, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἐκμισέω
div1.sense: to hate much, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκμισθόω
div1.sense: to let out for hire, τί τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἐκμολεῖν
div1.sense: to go out, go forth, Il.

div1.head: ἐκμουσόω
div1.sense: to teach fully, τινά τι Eur.

div1.head: ἐκμοχθέω
div1.sense: to work out with toil, Lat. elaborare, Eur.
to struggle through, πόνους Eur.
to win by labour, achieve, Eur.
to struggle out of danger, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκμυζάω
div1.sense: to squeeze out, Il.

div1.head: ἐκμυκτηρίζω
div1.sense: to turn up oneʼs nose at, mock at, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκναρκάω
div1.sense: to become quite torpid, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκνέμω
div1.note: Mostly mid. with aor1 pass. ἐξενεμήθην
div1.sense: to go forth to feed: metaph., ἐκνέμεσθαι πόδα to turn away oneʼs foot, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκνεοττεύω
div1.sense: to hatch, Arist.

div1.head: ἐκνευρίζω
div1.sense: to cut the sinews:—Pass., ἐκνενευρισμένοι unnerved, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκνεύω
div1.sense: to turn the head aside, Xen.
c. acc. to shun, avoid, Orph.
to fall headlong, Eur.
to give one a sign to move away, c. inf., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκνέω
div1.sense: to swim out, swim to land, escape by swimming, Eur., Thuc.: generally, to escape, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκνήφω
div1.sense: to sleep off a drunken fit, become sober again, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκνήχομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to swim out or away, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκνίζω
div1.sense: to wash out, purge away, Eur.:—Mid. to wash off from oneself, Lat. diluere, οὐδέποτε ἐκνίψῃ τὰ πεπραγμένα Dem.
to wash clean, purify, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκνικάω
div1.sense: to achieve by force, Eur.: to carry oneʼs point, Plut.
intr. to win a complete victory: metaph. to gain the upper hand, prevail, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκνόμιος
div1.sense: unusual, marvellous: adv. -ίως, Ar.; Sup. ἐκνομιώτατα Ar.

div1.head: ἔκνομος
div1.sense: outlawed, Lat. exlex, Aesch.:—adv. -μως, out of tune, discordantly, Aesch.

div1.head: ἔκνοος
div1.sense: senseless, Lat. amens, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκνοσφίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to take for oneʼs own, Anth.

div1.head: ἑκοντί
div1.sense: willingly, Plut.

div1.head: ἑκούσιος
div1.sense: of actions, voluntary, Soph., Eur., etc.; τὰ ἑκούσια voluntary acts, opp. to τὰ ἀκούσια, Xen.
rarely, like ἑκών, of persons, willing, acting of free will, Soph., Thuc.
adv. -ίως, Eur., etc.; so, ἐξ ἑκουσίας (sc. γνώμης) Soph.; καθʼ ἑκουσίαν Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπαγλέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be struck with amazement, to wonder greatly, only in part., Hdt.
to wonder at, admire exceedingly, c. acc., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἔκπαγλος
div1.sense: terrible, fearful, of persons; superl. ἐκπαγλότατος Il.:—of things, Od.
as adv. terribly, vehemently, exceedingly, Hom.:—also neut. as adv., ἔκπαγλον and ἔκπαγλα, Il.
in later Poets, marvellous, wondrous, Aesch., Soph.; adv. ἔκπαγλα marvellously, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκπαίδευμα
div1.sense: a nursling, a child, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπαιδεύω
div1.sense: to bring up from childhood, educate completely, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἐκπαιφάσσω
div1.sense: to rush madly to the fray, Il.

div1.head: ἐκπαίω
div1.sense: to throw out of a thing, dash one from it, c. gen., Eur.
Mid. to dash out, escape, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκπάλλω
div1.sense: to shake out:—Pass. to spurt out from, c. gen., ἔκπαλτο (syncop. Epic aor2 mid. as pass.) Il.

div1.head: ἐκπατάσσω
div1.sense: to strike, afflict, Eur.:—Pass., φρένας ἐκπεπαταγμένος stricken in mind, Od.

div1.head: ἐκπάτιος
div1.sense: out of the common path: excessive, vehement, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκπαύω
div1.sense: to set quite at rest, put an end to, Eur.:—Mid. to take oneʼs rest, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπείθω
div1.sense: to over-persuade, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπειράζω
div1.sense: to tempt, c. acc., NTest.

div1.head: ἐκπειράομαι
div1.sense: to make trial of, prove, tempt, c. gen. pers., Hdt.; c. inf., ἐκπειρᾷ λέγειν; art thou tempting me to speak? Soph.
to inquire of another, τί τινος Ar.

div1.head: ἐκπέλει
div1.sense: ʼtis permitted, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκπέμπω
div1.sense: of persons, to send out or forth from a place, c. gen., Hom., Aesch., etc.:—Mid., Od., Soph., etc.
to bring out by calling, call or fetch out, Soph.; so in Mid., Soph.:—Pass. to go forth, depart, Soph.
to send forth, dispatch, Thuc.
to send away, cast out, Hdt., Aesch.; to divorce a wife, Hdt.:—so in Mid., Soph.
of things, to send out, send abroad, Il., Hdt.
to send forth, give out, σέλας Aesch.

div1.head: ἔκπεμψις
div1.sense: a sending out or forth, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπεπαίνω
div1.sense: to make quite ripe or mellow, Theophr.

div1.head: ἐκπεπληγμένως
div1.etym: adverb from perf. pass. of ἐκπλήσσω
div1.sense: in panic fear, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκπεπταμένως
div1.etym: adverb from perf. pass. of ἐκπετάννυμι,
div1.sense: extravagantly, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκπεραίνω
div1.sense: to finish off, Eur.:—Pass. to be accomplished, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἐκπέραμα
div1.sense: a coming out of, δωμάτων Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκπεράω
div1.sense: to go out over, pass beyond, Od., Aesch.; ἐκπ. βίον to go through life, Eur.
absol. of an arrow, to pass through, pierce, Il.
to go or come out of a place, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπερδικίζω
div1.sense: to escape like a partridge, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκπέρθω
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκπερίειμι
div1.sense: to go out and round, go all round, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκπεριπλέω
div1.sense: to sail out round, so as to attack in flank, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκπερισσῶς
div1.sense: more exceedingly, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκπέρυσι
div1.sense: more than a year ago, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκπετάννυμι
div1.sense: to spread out, of a sail, Eur.; of wings, Anth.; of a net, Orac. ap. Hdt.
metaph., ἐπὶ κῶμον ἐκπετασθείς wholly given up to revel, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπετήσιμος
div1.sense: ready to fly out, just fledged, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκπέτομαι
div1.sense: to fly out or away, Hes., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap out, Hdt.
to make a sally, Xen.
to leap up, start up, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκπήδημα
div1.sense: a leap out, ὕψος κρεῖσσον ἐκπηδήματος a height too great for out-leap, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκπηνίζομαι
div1.sense: to spin out:—metaph., of an advocate, αὐτοῦ ἐκπηνιεῖται ταῦτα will wind these things out of him, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκπιδύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to gush forth, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill up a bowl, Eur.; ἐκπ. κρατῆρας δρόσου to fill them full of liquid, Eur.
to satiate, Eur., Thuc.
to fulfil, Hdt.; ἁμαρτάδα ἐξέπλησε paid the full penalty of sin, Hdt.
to accomplish, complete, Trag.

div1.head: ἐκπίνω
div1.sense: to drink out or off, quaff liquor, Od.: so, in perf. pass., ἐκπέποται Od., Hdt.; αἵματʼ ἐκποθένθʼ ὑπὸ χθονός Aesch.
to drain a cup dry, πλῆρες ἐκπ. κέρας Soph.: metaph., ἐκπ. ὄλβον Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπιπράσκω
div1.sense: to sell out, sell off, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall out of a chariot, c. gen., Hom., etc.; c. dat. pers., τόξον δέ οἱ ἔκπεσε χειρός Il.
of seafaring men, to be thrown ashore, Lat. ejici, Od., Hdt., etc.: of things, to suffer shipwreck, Xen.
to fall from a thing, i. e. be deprived of it, Lat. excidere, τινός or ἔκ τινος Aesch., etc.
to be driven out, of persons banished, Hdt., etc.
to go out or forth, sally out, Hdt., Xen.
to come out, of votes, Xen.
to escape, Thuc.
of oracles, to issue from the sanctuary, be imparted, Luc.
to depart from, digress, Xen., Aeschin.
to fall off, come to naught, NTest.
of actors, to be hissed off the stage, Lat. explodi, Dem.

div1.head: ἕκπλεθρος
div1.sense: six plethra long, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκπλεος
div1.sense: quite full of a thing, c. gen., Eur.
complete, of a body of soldiers, Xen.: abundant, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκπλέω
div1.sense: to sail out, sail away, weigh anchor, Hdt., etc.: c. gen. to sail away from, Soph.
metaph., ἐκπλεῖν τοῦ νοῦ, τῶν φρενῶν to go out of oneʼs mind, lose oneʼs senses, Hdt.
ἐκπλ. τὰς ναῦς to outsail the ships, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπληκτικός
div1.sense: striking with consternation, astounding, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔκπληκτος
div1.sense: terror-stricken, amazed, Luc.

div1.head: ἔκπληξις
div1.sense: consternation, Thuc., etc.; ἔκπλ. κακῶν terror caused by misfortunes, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκπληρόω
div1.sense: to fill quite up, Eur.
to make up to a certain number, Hdt., Soph.
to man completely, ναῦς Hdt.
to fulfil, Hdt.
ἐκπλ. λιμένα to make oneʼs way over the harbour, Lat. emetiri, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπλήσσω
div1.sense: to strike out of, drive away from, Aesch.:—absol. to drive away, Thuc.

to drive out of oneʼs senses, to amaze, astound, Od., Eur.:—often in aor2 pass., Epic ἐξεπλήγην, Attic ἐξεπλάγην [ᾰ]; aor1 ἐξεπλήχθην; perf. ἐκπέπληγμαι: — to be panic-struck, amazed, astonied, Il., Soph., etc.; ἐκπλαγῆναί τινι to be astonished at a thing, Hdt., so διά τι, ἐπί τινι, etc.; ἐκπλαγῆναί τινα to be struck with panic fear of . . , Soph., Thuc.
generally, of sudden passion, to be stricken, Aesch., etc.
note also the form ἐκπλήγνυμι, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔκπλοος
div1.sense: a sailing out, leaving port, Aesch., Thuc., etc.
a passage out, entrance of a harbour, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: ἐκπλύνω
div1.sense: to wash out, esp. to wash out colours from cloths, Plat.:—Pass. to be washed out, Hdt.
to wash clean, Ar.

div1.head: ἔκπλυτος
div1.sense: to be washed out, of colours, Plat.:— metaph. washed out, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκπνέω
div1.sense: to breathe out or forth, Plat.; κεραυνὸς ἐκπνέων φλόγα Aesch.
βίον ἐκπν. to breathe oneʼs last, expire, Aesch., Eur.; also, ἐκπν. θυμόν, ψυχήν Eur.
absol. to cease blowing, to become calm, Eur.
to blow outwards, of wind, Hdt., Thuc.: to burst out, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκπνοή
div1.sense: a breathing out, expiring, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκποδών
div1.sense: opp. to ἐμποδών, away from the feet, i. e. out of the way, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:— c. dat., ἐκπ. χωρεῖν τινι to get out of his way, Eur.: —ἐκποδὼν ποιεῖσθαι to put out of the way, Xen.: c. gen., ἐκπ. χθονός far from it, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκποιέω
div1.sense: to put out:
to put out a child, i. e. give him in adoption, Isae.
Mid. to produce, bring forth, Ar.
to make complete, finish, finish off, Hdt.:—c. gen. materiae, Παρίου λίθου τὰ ἔμπροσθε ἐξεποίησαν they made all the front of Parian marble, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκποίησις
div1.sense: a putting forth, emission, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκποίητος
div1.sense: given in adoption, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐκπολεμέω
div1.sense: to excite to war, make hostile, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκπολεμόω
div1.sense: to make hostile, to involve in war, Hdt., Thuc.:—Pass. to become an enemy to, be at feud with, τινι Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκπολέμωσις
div1.sense: a making hostile, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκπολιορκέω
div1.sense: to force a besieged town to surrender, Thuc., Xen.:—Pass. to be forced to surrender, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπομπεύω
div1.sense: to walk in state, to strut, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκπομπή
div1.sense: a sending out or forth, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπονέω
div1.sense: to work out, finish off, Lat. elaborare, Ar.; κἠμὲ μαλθακὸν ἐξεπόνασε σιδαρέω wrought me soft-hearted from iron-hearted, Theocr.; ἐκπ. τινά to deck him out, Eur.:—Pass. to be brought to perfection, Thuc.; ἐκπεπονημένος σῖτος corn fully prepared for use, Xen.; ἐκπεπονῆσθαι τὰ σώματα to be in good training or practice, Xen.
to execute, Eur.; so in Mid., Eur.
to provide by labour, earn, Eur.:—c. acc. et inf. τοὺς θεοὺς ἐκπ. φράζειν to prevail on the gods to tell, Eur.
absol. to work hard, Eur., Xen.
to work out by searching, to search out, Eur.
of food, to digest it by labour, Xen.
to work at, work well, Theocr.
in Pass. to be worn out, Lat. confici, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκπορεύω
div1.sense: to make to go out, fetch out, Eur.: —Mid., with fut. mid. and aor1 pass., to go out or forth, march out, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκπορθέω
div1.sense: to pillage, Eur., etc.:—Pass., of a person, to be undone, Soph., Eur.
to carry off as plunder, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπορθήτωρ
div1.sense: a waster, destroyer, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπορθμεύω
div1.sense: to carry away by sea:—Eur. has perf. pass. ἐκπεπόρθμευται in both pass. and mid. sense.

div1.head: ἐκπορίζω
div1.sense: to invent, contrive, Eur.
to provide, furnish, Soph., Ar., etc.:—Mid. to provide for oneself, procure, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπορνεύω
div1.sense: to commit fornication, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκποτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fly out or forth, of snow-flakes, Il.: metaph., πᾶ τὰς φρένας ἐκπεπότασαι (2nd sg. Doric perf.); = quae te dementia cepit? Theocr.

div1.head: ἐκπράσσω
div1.sense: to do completely, to bring about, achieve, Lat. efficere, Aesch., etc.; τὸν καλλίνικον ἐξεπράξατε ἐς γόον ye have made the hymn of triumph end in wailing, Eur.
to make an end of, kill, destroy, Lat. conficere, Trag.
to exact, levy, Eur.; c. dupl. acc., χρήματα ἐκπρ. τινά to exact money from a person, Thuc.
to exact punishment for a thing, to avenge, Soph., Eur.:—so in Mid., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκπρεπής
div1.sense: distinguished out of all, preeminent, remarkable, Il.; μεγέθει ἐκπρεπεστάτα Aesch.; εἶδος ἐκπρεπεστάτη Eur.
= ἔξω τοῦ πρέποντος, unseemly, monstrous, Thuc.: so adv. -πῶς, without reasonable grounds, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπρέπω
div1.sense: to be excellent in a thing, τινί Eur.

div1.head: ἔκπρησις
div1.sense: a setting on fire, inflaming, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκπρίασθαι
div1.sense: to buy off, Oratt.

div1.head: ἐκπρίω
div1.sense: to saw out, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκπρόθεσμος
div1.sense: beyond the appointed day, too late for a thing, c. gen., Luc.

div1.head: ἐκπροθυμέομαι
div1.sense: to be very zealous, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπροΐημι
div1.sense: to send forth, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπροκαλέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to call to oneself or summon out of, ἐκπροκαλεσσαμένη μεγάρων Od.

div1.head: ἐκπροκρίνω
div1.sense: to choose out, πόλεος ἐκπροκριθεῖσα Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπρολείπω
div1.sense: to forsake, abandon, Od.

div1.head: ἐκπρορέω
div1.sense: to flow forth from, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκπροτιμάω
div1.sense: to honour above all, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκπροφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee away from, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκπροχέω
div1.sense: to pour forth, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκπτερύσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to spread the wings, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκπτήσσω
div1.sense: to scare out of, οἴκων με ἐξέπταξας (Doric) Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπτοέω
div1.sense: = ἐκπτήσσω Tzetz.:—Pass. to bestruck with admiration, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπτύω
div1.sense: to spit out of, c. gen., Od.
to spit in token of disgust, Ar.:— to spit at, abominate, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκπυνθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.: to search out, make enquiry, Il., Eur.
c. acc. to enquire about, hear of, learn, Soph.; ἐκπ. τινος to make inquiry of him, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκπυρόω
div1.sense: to burn to ashes, consume utterly, Eur.: Pass. to catch fire, be burnt up, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκ
div1.etym: ἐξ before a vowel, ἐγ before β γ δ λ μ
div1.sense: prep. governing GEN. only, Lat. e, exRadical sense, from out of, opp. to εἰς:
OF PLACE:
of Motion, out of, forth from, Hom., etc.: ἐκ θυμοῦ φίλεον I loved her from my heart, with all my heart, Il.
to denote change from one place or condition to another, κακὸν ἐκ κακοῦ one evil from (or after) another, Il.; λόγον ἐκ λόγου λέγειν Dem.
to express distinction from a number, ἐκ πόλεων πίσυρες four out of many, Il.
of Position, like ἔξω, outside of, beyond, ἐκ βελέων out of shot, Il.; ἐκ καπνοῦ out of the smoke, Od.

with Verbs of Rest, ἐκ ποταμοῦ χρόα νίζετο washed his body with water from the river, Od.:—with Verbs signifying to hang or fasten, ἐκ πασσαλόφι κρέμασεν φόρμιγγα he hung his lyre from (i. e. on) the peg, Od.; ἐκ τοῦ βραχίονος ἐπέλκουσα leading it [by a rein] upon her arm, Hdt.:—also, sitting or standing, στᾶσʼ ἐξ Οὐλύμποιο from Olympus where she stood, Il.; καθῆσθαι ἐκ πάγων to sit on the heights and look from them, Soph.
OF TIME, ἐξ οὗ or ἐξ οὗτε χρόνου, Lat. ex quo, since, Hom., Attic; ἐκ τοῦ or ἐκ τοῖο from that time, Il.; ἐκ πολλοῦ (sc. χρόνου) for a long time, Thuc.
of particular points of time, ἐκ νέου or ἐκ παιδός from boyhood; ἐξ ἀρχῆς, etc.; so, ἐκ θυσίας γενέσθαι to have just finished sacrifice, Hdt.; ἐκ τοῦ ἀρίστου after breakfast, Xen.
when we say in or by, ἐκ νυκτῶν Od.; ἐκ νυκτός Xen., etc.
OF ORIGIN,
of the Material, out of or of which things are made, ποιεῖσθαι ἐκ ξύλων τὰ πλοῖα Hdt.
of the Father, ἔκ τινος εἶναι, γενέσθαι, φῦναι, etc., Il.; ἀγαθοὶ καὶ ἐξ ἀγαθῶν Plat.
of the Author or Occasion of a thing, ὄναρ ἐκ Διός ἐστιν Il.; θάνατος ἐκ μνηστήρων death by the hand of the suitors, Od.; τὰ ἐξ Ἑλλήνων τείχεα walls built by them, Hdt.
with the agent after Pass. Verbs, where ὑπό is more common, ἐφίληθεν ἐκ Διός they were beloved of (i. e. by) Zeus, Il.

of the Cause, Instrument or Means by which a thing is done, ἐκ πατέρων φιλότητος in consequence of our fatherʼs friendship, Od.; so, ἐκ τίνος; ἐκ τοῦ; wherefore? Eur.; ποιεῖτε ὑμῖν φίλους ἐκ τοῦ Μαμωνᾶ τῆς ἀδικίας make yourselves friends of (i. e. by means of), NTest.
from, i. e. according to, ἐκ τῶν λογίων according to the oracles, Hdt.; ἐκ νόμων Aesch.
periphr. for an adv., (as in Lat. ex consulto, ex composito), ἐκ βίας by force, = βιαίως, Soph.; ἐκ τοῦ φανεροῦ φανερῶς, Thuc., etc.
with numerals, ἐκ τρίτου in the third place, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκπύρωσις
div1.sense: a conflagration, Luc.

div1.head: ἔκπυστος
div1.sense: discovered, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔκπωμα
div1.sense: a drinking-cup, beaker, Hdt., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐκραίνω
div1.sense: to scatter out of, make to fall in drops from, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκρέω
div1.sense: in act. sense:— to flow out or forth, Il., Hdt., Plat.
of feathers, to fall off, Ar.
metaph. to fall away, disappear, Lat. effluere, Plat.
c. acc. cogn. to shed, let fall, χάριν Anth.

div1.head: ἐκρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break off, snap asunder, Il.; c. gen., ὕδωρ ἐξέρρηξεν ὁδοῖο the water broke off a piece of the road, Il.:—Pass. to break or snap asunder, Hdt.

c. acc. cogn. to let break forth, break out with, Plut., Luc.:—Pass. to break out, of an ulcer, Hdt., Aesch.; of a quarrel, ἐς μέσον ἐξερράγη it broke out in public, Hdt.; of persons, to break out into passionate words, Hdt.
sometimes also intr. in Act., οὔ ποτʼ ἐκρήξει μάχη Soph.

div1.head: ἐκριζόω
div1.sense: to root out, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκριπίζω
div1.sense: to fan the flame, stir up, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκρίπτω
div1.sense: to cast forth, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐκροή
div1.sense: = ἔροος, Plat.
an issue, Plat.

div1.head: ἔκροος
div1.sense: a flowing out, outflow, outfall, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκροφέω
div1.sense: to drink out, gulp down, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκρύομαι
div1.sense: to deliver, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκσαλάσσω
div1.sense: to shake violently, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκσείω
div1.sense: to shake out of, τί τινος Hdt.:—Pass., Ar.

div1.head: ἐκσεύομαι
div1.sense: to rush out or burst forth from a place, c. gen., Hom.: absol. to rush out, Hom.

div1.head: ἐκσημαίνω
div1.sense: to disclose, indicate, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκσιγάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be put to utter silence, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκσκεδάννυμι
div1.sense: to scatter to the wind, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκσκευάζω
div1.sense: to disfurnish of tools and implements, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκσμάω
div1.sense: to wipe out, wipe clean, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκσοβέω
div1.sense: to scare away, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκσπάω
div1.sense: to draw out, Il.; so in Mid., ἐκσπασσαμένω ἔγχεα having drawn out their spears, Il.

div1.head: ἐκσπένδω
div1.sense: to pour out as a libation, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκσπονδος
div1.sense: = ἔξω τῶν σπονδῶν, out of the treaty, excluded from it, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἑκστάδιος
div1.sense: six stades long, Luc.

div1.head: ἔκστασις
div1.sense: any displacement: entrancement, astonishment, NTest.; a trance, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκστατικός
div1.sense: inclined to depart from, c. gen., Arist.

div1.head: ἐκστέλλω
div1.sense: to fit out, equip, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκστέφω
div1.sense: to deck with garlands, Eur.; of suppliants, κρᾶτας ἐξεστεμμένοι Eur.; but, ἱκτηρίοις κλάδοισιν ἐξεστεμμένοι with garlands on the suppliant olive-branches, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκστρατεία
div1.sense: a going out on service, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκστρατεύω
div1.sense: to march out, Thuc., Xen.
in Mid., absol. to take the field, Hdt., Thuc.
to have ended the campaign, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκστρατοπεδεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with perf. pass. to encamp outside, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐκστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn out of, root up from a place, c. gen., Il.
to turn inside out, Ar.: metaph. to alter entirely, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκσυρίζω
div1.sense: to hiss off the stage, Lat. explodere, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκσφραγίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be shut out from, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκσῴζω
div1.sense: to preserve from danger, keep safe, Hdt., Soph., etc.; ἐκσ. τινά τινος to save one from another, Eur.; ἐκσ. τινὰ ἐς φάος to bring one safe to light, Eur.:—Mid. to save oneself, Hdt.; or to save for oneself, Aesch.:—Pass. to flee for safety, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκσωρεύω
div1.sense: to heap or pile up, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκτάδην
div1.sense: outstretched, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκτάδιος
div1.sense: outstretched, outspread, Il.

div1.head: ἑκταῖος
div1.sense: on the sixth day, Xen.
= ἕκτος, sixth, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκτανύω
div1.sense: = ἐκτείνω, to stretch out (on the ground), lay low, Il.:—Pass. to lie outstretched, ἐξετανύσθη Il.
to stretch tight, Od.

div1.head: ἐκταράσσω
div1.sense: to throw into great trouble, to agitate, Plut.

div1.head: ἔκτασις
div1.sense: extension, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκτάσσω
div1.sense: to draw out in battle-order, of the officers:—Mid. to draw themselves out, of the soldiers, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out, Hdt., Attic: τὰ γόνατα ἐκτ. to straighten the knees, Ar.: ἐκτ. νέκυν to lay one dead, Eur.:—Pass. to be outstretched, lie at length, Soph.
to stretch or spread out a net, Aesch.: to extend the line of an army, Eur.
to stretch out, prolong, λόγον Hdt., Attic
to put to the full stretch, of a horse put to full speed, Xen.; πᾶσαν προθυμίην ἐκτ. to put forth all oneʼs zeal, Hdt.:—metaph. in Pass. to be on the rack, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκτειχίζω
div1.sense: to fortify completely, Thuc., Xen.; τεῖχος ἐκτ. to build it from the ground, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκτεκνόω
div1.sense: to generate, Eur., in Mid.

div1.head: ἐκτελευτάω
div1.sense: to bring quite to an end, accomplish, Aesch.:—Pass. to be quite the end of, τινός Soph.

div1.head: ἐκτελέω
div1.sense: to bring quite to an end, to accomplish, achieve, Hom., Hdt.: —Pass., fut. inf. ἐκτελέεσθαι, to be accomplished, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἐκτελής
div1.sense: brought to an end, perfect, Aesch.; of corn, ripe, Hes.; of persons, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκτέμνω
div1.sense: to cut out, Il., Hdt.; ὀϊστὸν ἐκτάμνειν μηροῦ to cut an arrow from the thigh, Il.
to cut trees out of a wood, cut down, Il.; of planks, to hew out, hew into shape, ὃς νήϊον ἐκτάμνῃσιν (Epic for -τέμνῃ) Il.
to cut away, sever, Pind., Plat.
to castrate, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκτένεια
div1.sense: intensity, zeal, earnestness, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκτενής
div1.sense: intense, zealous, instant, NTest.

div1.head: ἑκτέος
div1.sense: to be held, Ar.
ἑκτέος one must have, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκτεφρόω
div1.sense: to burn to ashes, calcine, Strab.

div1.head: ἐκτήκω
div1.sense: to melt out, destroy, by melting, Eur., Ar.
metaph. to let melt away, let pine or waste away, Eur.
Pass., with perf. ἐκτέτηκα, aor2 ἐξετάκην [ᾰ], to melt, pine or waste away, Eur.; τόδʼ μήποτʼ ἐκτακείη may it never melt from my remembrance, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑκτημόριοι
div1.sense: those who paid 1/6th of the produce, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκτίθημι
div1.sense: to set out, place outside, Od.: to expose on a desert island or to expose a new-born child, Hdt., Attic:—Mid. to export, Plut.
to set up in public, exhibit publicly, νόμους Dem.

div1.head: ἐκτίλλω
div1.sense: to pluck out hair:—Pass., κόμην ἐκτετιλμένος having oneʼs hair plucked out, Anacr.

div1.head: ἐκτιμάω
div1.sense: to honour highly, Soph.

div1.head: ἔκτιμος
div1.sense: not shewing honour, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκτινάσσω
div1.sense: to shake outPass., ἐκ δʼ ἐτίναχθεν (Epic for -ησαν) ὀδόντες Il.
to shake off dust from oneʼs feet, NTest.: so in Mid., NTest.

div1.head: ἐκτίνω
div1.sense: to pay off, pay in full, Hdt., Attic;— δίκην ἐκτ. to pay full penalty, Eur.; τινός for a thing, Hdt.
Mid. to exact full payment for a thing, avenge, c. acc. rei, Soph., Eur.; to take vengeance on, τινά Eur.

div1.head: ἐκτιτρώσκω
div1.sense: to bring forth untimely: to miscarry, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔκτοθεν
div1.sense: from without, outside, c. gen., ἔκτοθεν ἄλλων μνηστήρων outside their circle, apart from them, Od.; πύργων δʼ ἔκτ. βαλών having struck them from the wall, Aesch.
absol. outside, Trag.; ἔκτ. γαμεῖν to marry from an alien house, Eur.

div1.head: ἔκτοθι
div1.sense: for ἐκ τόθεν, out of, outside, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἐκτολυπεύω
div1.sense: to wind a ball of wool quite off: metaph. to bring quite to an end, Hes., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκτομή
div1.sense: a cutting out, Plut.
castration, Hdt., etc.
a segment, piece, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκτομίας
div1.sense: a eunuch, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκτομίς
div1.sense: fem. adj. cutting down, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκτοξεύω
div1.sense: to shoot out, shoot away, Hdt.:— metaph., ἐξετόξευσεν has shot away all its arrows, i. e. has no resource left, Eur.
absol. to shoot from a place, shoot arrows, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκτοπίζω
div1.sense: to take oneself from a place, go abroad, like ἀποδημέω, Arist.:—metaph. of a speaker, to wander from the point, Arist.

div1.head: ἐκτόπιος
div1.sense: ἠνύσατʼ ἐκτοπίαν φλόγα ye have put away the fire, Soph.

div1.head: ἔκτοπος
div1.sense: away from a place, away from, c. gen., Soph.
absol. distant, Soph.; ἔκτοπος ἔστω let him leave the place, Eur.
foreign, strange, οὐδενὸς πρὸς ἐκτόπου by no strange hand, Soph.
out of the way, strange, extraordinary, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκτορέω
div1.sense: to kill by piercing, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἔκτοσε
div1.sense: outwards: c. gen. out of, Od.

div1.head: ἔκτοσθε
div1.sense: outside, c. gen., Hom.:—absol., Od.

div1.head: ἐκτραγῳδέω
div1.sense: to deck out in tragic phrase, exaggerate, Luc.

div1.head: ἕκτος
div1.sense: sixth, Lat. sextus, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἐκτός
div1.sense: outside, opp. to ἐντός·
as prep. with gen. outside, out of, far from, c. gen., Hom.: outside of, free from, Hdt., Attic; ἐκτὸς ἐλπίδος beyond hope, Lat. praeter spem, Soph.
of Time, beyond, Hdt.
except, ἐκτὸς ὀλίγων Xen.
absol., τὰ ἐκτός external things, Eur.
with Verbs of motion, ῥίπτειν ἐκτός to throw out, Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐκτράπεζος
div1.sense: banished from the table, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκτράπελος
div1.sense: turning from the common course, devious, strange, Theogn.

div1.head: ἐκτραχηλίζω
div1.sense: of a horse, to throw the rider over its head, Xen.:—Pass. to break oneʼs neck, Ar.: metaph. to plunge headlong into destruction, Dem.

div1.head: ἐκτραχύνω
div1.sense: to make rough, Luc.:—metaph. to exasperate, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκτρέπω
div1.sense: to turn out of the course, to turn aside, c. acc., Hdt., Attic:—Pass. and Mid., c. gen. to turn aside from, Soph.: absol. to turn aside, Hdt., Xen.
to turn a person off the road, order him out of the way, Soph.:—Pass. and Mid., ἐκτρέπεσθαί τινα to get out of oneʼs way, avoid him, Dem.
τὴν δρῶσαν ἐκτρέπειν to prevent her from acting, Soph.
ἀσπίδας θύρσοις ἐκτρ. to turn shields and flee before the thyrsus, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκτρέφω
div1.sense: to bring up from childhood, rear up, Hdt., Attic:—Mid. for oneself, Hhymn., Soph.

div1.head: ἐκτρέχω
div1.sense: to run out or forth, make a sally, Il., Thuc.
to run off or away, Ar.
to run beyond bounds, exceed bounds, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκτρίβω
div1.sense: to rub out, πῦρ ἐκτρ. to produce fire by rubbing, Xen.:— to rub hard, Soph.
to rub out, i. e. to destroy root and branch, Hdt., Eur.; βίον ἐκτρ. to bring life to a wretched end, Soph.:—Pass., πρόρριζος ἐκτέτριπται Hdt.
to rub constantly, wear out, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκτροπή
div1.sense: a turning off or aside, Thuc.
(from Mid.) a turning aside, escape, μόχθων from labours, Aesch.
ἐκτρ. ὁδοῦ a place to which one turns from the road, a resting-place, Lat. deverticulum, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκτρυχόω
div1.sense: to wear out, exhaust, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκτρώγω
div1.sense: to eat up, devour, Ar.

div1.head: ἔκτρωμα
div1.sense: a child untimely born, an abortion, NTest.

div1.head: ἔκτυπος
div1.sense: worked in high relief: ἔκτυπος, ὁ, a figure worked in relief, a cameo, Inscr.

div1.head: ἐκτυπόω
div1.sense: to model or work in relief, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκτυφλόω
div1.sense: to make quite blind, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἐκτύφλωσις
div1.sense: a making blind, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑκυρά
div1.sense: a mother-in-law, step-mother, = πενθερά, Il.

div1.head: ἑκυρός
div1.sense: a father-in-law, step-father, = πενθερός, Il.

div1.head: ἐκφαιδρύνω
div1.sense: to make quite bright, clear away, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκφαίνω
div1.sense: to shew forth, bring to light, disclose, reveal, make manifest, Il., Hdt., etc.:—Pass. to shew oneself, shine forth, come forth to view, Il.
to exhibit, κακότητα Hdt.
ἐκφ. πόλεμον to declare war, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκφανής
div1.sense: shewing itself, manifest, Aesch., Plat.

div1.head: ἔκφασις
div1.sense: a declaration, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔκφατος
div1.sense: beyond power of speech: adv. -τως, ineffably, impiously, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκφαυλίζω
div1.sense: to depreciate, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκφέρω
div1.note: fut. mid. ἐξοίσομαι in pass. sense
div1.sense: to carry out of a place, c. gen., or ἐκ τόπου, Il., Hdt.
to carry out a corpse for burial, Lat. efferre, Il., etc.
to carry off as prize or reward, Il.: so in Mid., Hdt., Attic
to carry out of the sea, to throw ashore, Hdt., Eur.:—Pass., with fut. mid., to come to land, be cast ashore, Hdt.
to bring forth,
of women, of the earth, to bring forth, produce, Hdt.
to bring about, accomplish, Il.
to bring out, publish, Ar.: ἐκφ. χρηστήριον to deliver an oracle, Hdt.:—of public measures, to bring forward, ἐκφ. ἐς τὸν δῆμον Hdt., Dem.
generally to disclose, tell, betray, Hdt.:—Mid., ἐκφέρεσθαι γνώμην to declare oneʼs opinion, Hdt.
to put forth, exert, δύνασιν Eur.; and in Mid., Soph.
ἐκφέρειν πόλεμον, Lat. inferre bellum, to begin war, Hdt., Xen.
to bear the marks of a thing, Eur.
Pass. to be carried beyond bounds, be carried away, Soph., Thuc., etc.
to carry to a certain point, Soph., Plat.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) to shoot forth (before the rest), Il.: to run away, Xen.
to come to fulfilment, come to an end, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee out or away, escape, Od., Aesch., etc.:— to be acquitted, Ar.
c. gen. to escape out of, flee from, Hom.
c. acc. to escape, Il., Hdt., etc.
of things, ἐκφεύγει μέ τι something escapes me, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἔκφημι
div1.sense: to speak out or forth, speak loudly: Mid., ἔπος ἐκφάσθαι (aor2 inf.) Od.

div1.head: ἐκφθείρω
div1.sense: to destroy utterlyPass. ἐκφθείρομαι, to be undone, ruined, Eur.: to vanish, pack off, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκφθίνω
div1.sense: ἐξέφθιτο οἶνος νηῶν, the wine had all been consumed out of the ships, had vanished from the ships, Od.; 3rd pl. perf. pass. ἐξέφθινται they have utterly perished, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκφιλέω
div1.sense: to kiss heartily, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκφλέγω
div1.sense: to set on fire, Ar.

div1.head: ἐκφοβέω
div1.sense: to frighten away, affright, Aesch., Plat., etc.; τὸ ἐκφοβῆσαι so as to cause alarm, Thuc.; ἐκφ. τινὰ ἐκ δεμνίων Eur.:—Pass. to be much afraid, to fear greatly, c. acc., Soph.

div1.head: ἔκφοβος
div1.sense: affrighted, NTest.

div1.head: ἐκφοινίσσω
div1.sense: to make all red or bloody, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκφοιτάω
div1.sense: to go out constantly, be in the habit of going out, Hdt., Eur.
of things, to be spread abroad, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκφορά
div1.sense: a carrying out of a corpse to burial, Aesch., Ar.
(from Pass.) of horses, a running away, Xen.

div1.head: ἐκφορέω
div1.sense: to carry out a corpse for burial, Od.:—generally to carry out, Hdt.:—Mid. to take out with one, Eur., etc.:—Pass. to move forth, Il.
to carry quite out, leave none behind, of earth dug from a trench, Hdt.
Pass. to be cast on shore, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκφόριον
div1.sense: payment on produce, rent, tithe, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔκφορος
div1.sense: to be carried out, exportable, Ar.
to be made known or divulged, Eur.
act. prepared to weed out, as a gardener does noxious plants, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐκφορτίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be sold for exportation, to be kidnapped, betrayed, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκφράζω
div1.sense: to tell over, recount, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἔκφρασις
div1.sense: a description, Luc.

div1.head: ἐκφρέω
div1.sense: to let out, bring out, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἐκφροντίζω
div1.sense: to think out, discover, Lat. excogitare, Eur., Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἔκφρων
div1.sense: out of oneʼs mind, senseless, Dem.: also, frenzied, enthusiastic, of poets, Plat.

div1.head: ἐκφυλάσσω
div1.sense: to watch carefully, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκφυλλοφορέω
div1.sense: to condemn by leaves, used of the Athen. βουλή, which gave their votes written on olive-leaves, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἔκφυλος
div1.sense: out of the tribe, alienmetaph. strange, unnatural, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκφυσάω
div1.sense: to blow out, ποταμὸς ἐκφυσᾷ μένος pours forth its strength, Aesch.: metaph., ἐκφ. πόλεμον to blow up a war from a spark, Ar.
to breathe out, ὕπνον ἔκφ. i. e. to snore, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐκφύω
div1.sense: to generate from another, to beget, of the male, Soph., etc.
of the female, to bear, Soph.: also, to produce a plant, Dem.
Pass., with perf. and aor2 act., to be born from another, c. gen., Il., Soph., etc.; λάλημα ἐκπεφυκός a tattler by nature, Soph.

div1.head: ἐκφωνέω
div1.sense: to cry out, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκχαλάω
div1.sense: to let go from, τί τινος Anth.

div1.head: ἐκχαλινόω
div1.sense: to unbridle, Plut.

div1.head: ἐκχαυνόω
div1.sense: to stuff out, to make vain and arrogant, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκχέω
div1.sense: to pour out, properly of liquids, Il., Aesch., etc.: metaph., in Med., ἐκχεύατʼ ὀϊστούς he poured forth his arrows, Od.
of words, Aesch., etc.
to pour out like water, squander, waste, oneʼs substance, Aesch., etc.

Pass., 3rd pl. plup. ἐξεκέχυντο, Epic syncop. aor2 ἐξέχυτο or ἔκχυτο, part. ἐκχύμενος [ῠ]:— to pour out, stream out or forth, properly of liquids, Hom.:—metaph. of persons, Hom.: —generally, to be spread out, Od.
to be poured out like water, forgotten, Theogn., Plat.
to give oneself up to joy, to be overjoyed, Ar.; ἐκχ. γελῶν to burst out laughing, Anth.
to lie languidly, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκχορεύω
div1.sense: to break out of the chorus: Mid. to drive out of the chorus, Eur.

div1.head: ἐκχράω
div1.sense: to declare as an oracle, tell out, Soph.
to suffice, Hdt.:— impers., like ἀποχρᾷ, c. inf., κῶς βασιλέϊ ἐκχρήσει; how will it suffice him? how will he be content to . . ? Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκχρηματίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to squeeze money from, levy contributions on, τινα Thuc.

div1.head: ἐκχύτης
div1.sense: a spendthrift, Luc.

div1.head: ἔκχυτος
div1.sense: poured forth, unconfined, outstretched, Anth.

div1.head: ἐκχώννυμι
div1.sense: Pass. to be raised on a bank or mound, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐκχωρέω
div1.sense: to go out and away, depart, emigrate, Hdt.
to slip out of, ἐξεχώρησεν ἐξ ἄρθρων was dislocated, Hdt.
to give way, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐκψύχω
div1.sense: to give up the ghost, expire, NTest.

div1.head: ἑκών
div1.sense: willing, of free will, readily, Hom., etc.
wittingly, purposely, ἑκὼν ἡμάρτανε φωτός Il., Attic
in Prose, ἑκὼν εἶναι or ἑκών, as far as depends on my will, as far as concerns me, mostly with a negat., Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἐλαία
div1.sense: the olive-tree, Lat. olea, oliva, Hom., etc.; said to have been produced by Athena in her contest with Poseidon, Hdt., Soph.; φέρεσθαι ἐκτὸς τῶν ἐλαῶν to run beyond the olives, which stood at the end of the Athenian race-course, i. e. to go too far, Ar.
the fruit of the olive-tree, an olive, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλαιήεις
div1.sense: planted with olives, Anth.

div1.head: ἐλαιηρός
div1.sense: oily, of oil, Anth.

div1.head: ἐλάϊνος
div1.sense: of olive-wood, Hom.

div1.head: ἐλαιολόγος
div1.sense: an olive-gatherer, Ar.

div1.head: ἔλαιον
div1.sense: olive-oil, Lat. oleum, olivum, Hom.

div1.head: ἐλαιοπώλης
div1.sense: an oil-merchant, Dem.

div1.head: ἔλαιος
div1.sense: the wild olive, Lat. oleaster, Soph.

div1.head: ἐλαιοφόρος
div1.sense: olive-bearing, Eur.

div1.head: ἐλαιοφυής
div1.sense: olive-planted, Eur.

div1.head: ἐλαιόφυτος
div1.sense: olive-planted, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐλαΐς
div1.sense: an olive-tree: Attic pl. ἐλᾷδες Ar.

div1.head: ἐλαιών
div1.sense: an olive-yard, Lat. olivetum: the Mount of Olives, Olivet, NTest.

div1.head: ἕλανδρος
div1.sense: man-destroying, of Helen, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐλασᾶς
div1.sense: an unknown bird, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλασείω
div1.sense: Desiderat. to wish to march, Luc.

div1.head: ἐλασία
div1.sense: riding, Xen.

div1.head: ἐλασίβροντος
div1.sense: hurled like thunder, Ar.

div1.head: ἔλασις
div1.sense: a driving away, banishing, Thuc.
(sub. στρατοῦ , a march, expedition, Hdt.: a procession, Xen.:—(sub. ἵππου) a riding, Xen.

div1.head: ἐλασσόω
div1.sense: to make less or smaller, to lessen, diminish, lower, Oratt.: c. gen. to detract from, Thuc.
Pass.
absol. to become smaller, be lessened, suffer loss, be depreciated, Thuc.: —also to take less than oneʼs due, waive oneʼs rights or privileges, Thuc.
c. dat. rei, to have the worst of it, to be inferior, τινι in a thing, Thuc., Xen.
c. gen. pers. to be at disadvantage with a person, Dem.

div1.head: ἐλάσσων
div1.sense: smaller, less, formed from ἐλαχύς (with Sup. ἐλάχιστος, q. v.), but serving as comp. to μικρός, Il.: ἔλασσον ἔχειν to have the worse, be worse off, τινί in a thing, Hdt., Dem.; so, ἐλάττω γίγνεσθαι Ar.
c. gen. pers. worse than, inferior to, Thuc., etc.; but c. gen. rei, like ἥσσων, subservient to, Xen.
in neut. with Preps., περὶ ἐλάσσονος ποιεῖσθαι to consider of less account, Hdt.; παρʼ ἔλαττον ἡγεῖσθαι Plat.; διʼ ἐλάττονος at less distance, Thuc.
of Number, fewer, οἱ ἐλάσσονες the smaller number, Hdt., Thuc.
neut. ἔλασσον, as adv. less, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐλαστρέω
div1.sense: to drive, Il.; ἐλ. τινα to drive about, of the Furies, Eur.:—Pass., of ships, to be rowed, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐλατέος
div1.sense: one must ride, Xen.

div1.head: ἐλάτη
div1.sense: the silver fir, pinus picea, Il.
an oar, Hom.: also a ship or boat, like Lat. abies, Eur.

div1.head: ἐλατήριος
div1.sense: driving away, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐλατήρ
div1.sense: a driver of horses, a charioteer, Il., Aesch.
a sort of broad, flat cake, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλάτινος
div1.sense: of the fir, Lat. abiegnus, Il., Eur.:— of fir or pine-wood, Od., Eur.

div1.head: ἐλάττωμα
div1.sense: a disadvantage, Dem.

div1.head: ἐλαύνω
div1.sense: Radic. sense : to drive, drive on, set in motion, of driving flocks, Hom.; so aor. mid. ἠλασάμην Il.: often of chariots, to drive, Il., Hdt.; also, ἐλ. ἵππον to ride it, Hdt.; ἐλ. νῆα to row it, Od.:—in this sense the acc. was omitted, and the Verb became intr., to go in a chariot, to drive, μάστιξεν δʼ ἐλάαν (sc. ἵππους) he whipped them on, Il.; βῆ δʼ ἐλάαν ἐπὶ κύματα he drove on over the waves, Il.; διὰ νύκτα ἐλάαν to travel the night through, Od.; — to ride, Hdt., etc.; to march, Hdt.; to row, Od.
in this intr. sense, it sometimes took an acc. loci, γαλήνην ἐλαύνειν to sail the calm sea, i. e. over it, Hdt.; ἐλαύνειν δρόμον to run a course, Ar.
to drive away, like ἀπελαύνω, of stolen cattle, Hom., Xen.: —so in Mid., Hom.
to drive away, expel, Il., Trag.

to drive to extremities, ἄδην ἐλόωσι πολέμοιο will harass him till he has had enough of war, Il.; ἄδην ἐλάαν κακότητος shall persecute him till he has had enough, Od.:—then in Attic to persecute, attack, harass, Soph., etc.
intr. in expressions like ἐς τοσοῦτον ἤλασαν, they drove it so far (where πρᾶγμα must be supplied), Hdt.:—hence, to push on, go on, Eur., Plat.
to strike, ἐλάτηισιν πόντον ἐλαύνοντες, cf. Lat. remis impellere, Il.
to strike with a weapon, but never with a missile, Il.:— c. dupl. acc., τὸν μὲν ἔλασʼ ὦμον him he struck on the shoulder, Il.; χθόνα ἤλασε μετώπωι struck earth with his forehead, Od.
to drive or thrust through, δόρυ διὰ στήθεσφιν ἔλασσε Il.; and in Pass. to go through, Il.
in metaph. senses:
to beat with a hammer, Lat. ducere, to beat out metal, Il.; περὶ δʼ ἕρκος ἔλασσε κασσιτέρου around he made a fence of beaten tin, Il.

to draw a line of wall or a trench, Lat. ducere murum, Hom., etc.; τεῖχος ἐς τὸν ποταμὸν τοὺς ἀγκῶνας ἐλήλαται the wall has its angles carried down to the river, Hdt.; ὄγμον ἐλαύνειν to work oneʼs way down a ridge or swathe in reaping or mowing, Il.; ὄρχον ἀμπελίδος ἐλ. to draw a line of vines, i. e. plant them in line, Ar.
κολωιὸν ἐλαύνειν to prolong the brawl, Il.

div1.head: ἐλάφειος
div1.sense: of a stag, ἐλ. κρέα venison, Xen.

div1.head: ἐλαφηβολία
div1.sense: a shooting of deer, Soph.

div1.head: Ἐλαφηβολιών
div1.sense: Elaphebolion, the ninth month of the Attic year, in which the Elaphebolia were held, answering to the last half of March and first of April, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐλαφηβόλος
div1.sense: shooting deer, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἐλαφοκτόνος
div1.sense: deer-killing, Eur.

div1.head: ἔλαφος
div1.sense: a deer, whether male, a hart or stag, or female, a hind, Il.:— κραδίην ἐλάφοιο ἔχων with heart of deer, i. e. a coward, Il.

div1.head: ἐλαφοσσοΐα
div1.sense: deer-hunting, Anth.

div1.head: ἐλαφρία
div1.sense: lightness: levity, NTest.

div1.head: ἐλαφρός
div1.sense: = Lat. lev-is light in weight, Il., Hdt., Attic:— adv. lightly, buoyantly, Od.
light to bear, not burdensome, easy, Il.; ἐλαφρόν ἐστι ʼtis light, easy, Aesch., etc.; ἐν ἐλαφρῷ ποιεῖσθαί τι to make light of a thing, Hdt.
light in moving, nimble, Lat. agilis, Hom., Aesch.; ἐλαφρὰ ἡλικία the age of active youth, Xen.; οἱ ἐλαφροί light troops, Lat. levis armatura, Xen.
lightminded, thoughtless, Eur.

div1.head: ἐλαφρύνω
div1.sense: to make light, lighten, Babr.

div1.head: ἐλάχιστος
div1.sense: the smallest, least, οὐκ ἐλ. Hhymn., Hdt., etc.; ἐλαχίστου λόγου of least account, Hdt.; περὶ ἐλαχίστου ποιεῖσθαι Plat.
of Time, shortest, διʼ ἐλαχίστου [sc. χρόνου Thuc.; διʼ ἐλαχίστης βουλῆς with shortest deliberation, Thuc.
of Number, fewest, Plat.
τὸ ἐλάχιστον, τοὐλάχιστον, at the least, Hdt., Xen., etc.; also ἐλάχιστα, Thuc., Plat.
there is also a new comp. ἐλαχιστότερος, less than the least, NTest.

div1.head: ἐλαχύς
div1.sense: small, short, little, old Epic Positive, whence ἐλάσσων, ἐλάχιστος are formed, Hhymn.: cf. λάχεια.

div1.head: ἔλδομαι
div1.sense: to wish, long to do a thing, c. inf., Hom: —c. gen. to long for, Hom.: c. acc. to desire, Hom.:—as Pass., νῦν τοι ἐελδέσθω πόλεμος be war now welcome, Il.

div1.head: ἔλδωρ
div1.etym: only found in Epic form ἐέλδωρ, τό,
div1.sense: a wish, longing, desire, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ἐλεαίρω
div1.sense: to take pity on, τινά Hom., Ar.

div1.head: ἐλεᾶς
div1.sense: a kind of owl, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλεγεία
div1.sense: an elegy, Plut.

div1.head: ἐλεγεῖον
div1.sense: a distich consisting of hexameter and pentameter, the metre of the elegy, Thuc.
in pl., ἐλεγεῖα, τά, an elegiac poem, Plat., etc.:—so in sg., Plut.

div1.head: ἐλεγκτήρ
div1.sense: one who convicts or detects, τῶν ἀποκτεινάντων Antipho.

div1.head: ἐλεγκτικός
div1.sense: of persons, fond of cross-questioning or examiningadv. -κῶς, Xen.

div1.head: ἐλεγξίγαμος
div1.sense: proving a wifeʼs fidelity, Anth.

div1.head: ἔλεγξις
div1.sense: a conviction, NTest.

div1.head: ἔλεγος
div1.sense: a song of mourning, a lament: at first without reference to metrical form, later always in alternate hexameters and pentameters, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἐλεγχείη
div1.sense: reproach, disgrace, Il.

div1.head: ἐλεγχής
div1.sense: worthy of reproof; of men, cowardly, Il.: —Irreg. Sup. ἐλέγχιστος, Il.

div1.head: ἔλεγχος
div1.sense: a cross-examining, testing, for purposes of disproof or refutation, ἔχειν ἔλεγχον to admit of disproof, Hdt., Thuc.; ἔλ. διδόναι τοῦ βίου to give an account of oneʼs life, Plat.; εἰς ἔλ. πίπτειν to be convicted, Eur.; οἱ περὶ Παυσανίαν ἔλ. the evidence on which he was convicted, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔλεγχος
div1.sense: a reproach, disgrace, dishonour, Hom.: of men, κάκʼ ἐλέγχεα base reproaches to your name, Il.

div1.head: ἐλέγχω
div1.sense: to disgrace, put to shame, μῦθον ἐλ. to treat a speech with contempt, Il.; ἐλ. τινά to put one to shame, Od.
to cross-examine, question, for the purpose of disproving or reproving, to censure, accuse, Hdt., Attic; c. acc. et inf. to accuse one of doing, Eur.:—Pass. to be convicted, Hdt., Xen., etc.
of arguments, to bring to the proof, to disprove, confute, Aesch., Dem.:—absol. to bring convincing proof, Hdt.: then generally to prove, Lat. arguere, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐλεεινός
div1.sense: finding pity, pitied or moving pity, pitiable, piteous, Hom., etc.; ἐλεινὸς εἰσορᾶν piteous to behold, Aesch.; ἐλεινὸν ὁρᾷς thou lookest piteous, Soph.; ἐσθῆτʼ ἐλεινήν Ar.; ποιῶν ἑαυτὸν ὡς ἐλεεινότατον Dem.
shewing pity, pitying, ἐλ. δάκρυον a tear of pity, Od.; οὐδὲν ἐλεεινόν no feeling of pity, Plat.
adv. ἐλεεινῶς, in Attic Poets ἐλεινῶς, pitiably, Soph.; neut. pl. ἐλεεινά as adv., Il.

div1.head: ἐλεέω
div1.sense: to have pity on, shew mercy upon, c. acc., Od., Attic:—Pass. to be pitied, have pity or mercy shewn one, Plat.
absol. to feel pity, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλεημοσύνη
div1.sense: pity, mercy: a charity, alms (which is a corruption of the word), NTest., etc.

div1.head: ἐλεήμων
div1.sense: pitiful, merciful, compassionate, Od., Dem.

div1.head: ἐλεητύς
div1.sense: pity, mercy, Od.

div1.head: ἑλειοβάτης
div1.sense: walking the marsh, marsh-dwelling, Aesch.

div1.head: ἕλειος
div1.sense: of the marsh or meadow, ἕλ. δάπεδον the surface of the meads, Ar.
growing or dwelling in the marsh, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐλελεῦ
div1.sense: ἐλελεῦ, or doubled ἐλελεῦ ἐλελεῦ, a war-cry, Ar.: generally any cry, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐλελίζω
div1.sense: to whirl round, Od.
to rally soldiers, Il.: Pass., οἱ δʼ ἐλελίχθησαν Il.
generally, to make to tremble or quake, Il.:—Pass. to tremble, quiver, Il.
Mid. and Pass. to move in coils or spires, of a serpent, Il.

div1.head: ἐλελίζω
