div1.sense: to raise the battle-cry, Xen.: generally, to raise a loud cry, Eur.: —in Mid., of the nightingale, to trill her sad lay, Eur.; c. acc., Ἴτυν ἐλελιζομένη trilling her lament for Itys, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλελίχθων
div1.sense: shaking the earth, Soph.

div1.head: ἑλέναυς
div1.sense: ship-destroying, of Helen, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑλεόθρεπτος
div1.sense: marsh-bred, Il.

div1.head: ἐλεόν
div1.sense: piteously, Hes.

div1.head: ἐλεός
div1.sense: a kitchen-table, a board on which meat was cut up, a dresser, Hom.:—also ἐλεόν, τό, Ar.

div1.head: ἔλεος
div1.sense: pity, mercy, compassion, Il., Attic; ἔλ. τινος pity for . . , Eur.:—in NTest. also ἔλεος, τό.
an object of compassion, a piteous thing, Eur.

div1.head: ἑλέπολις
div1.sense: city-destroying, of Helen, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἑλετός
div1.sense: that can be taken or caught, Il.

div1.head: ἐλευθερία
div1.sense: freedom, liberty, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; διʼ ἐλευθερίας μόλις ἐξῆλθες, i. e. μόλις ἐλευθερώθης, Soph.
licence, Plat.

div1.head: ἐλευθέριος
div1.sense: or ος, η, ον, speaking or acting like a freeman, free-spirited, frank, related to ἐλεύθερος, as Lat. liberalis to liber, Plat., Xen.
freely giving, bountiful, liberal, Xen.
of pursuits, fit for a freeman, liberal; τὸ ἐλευθέριον ἐλευθεριότης, Xen.
of appearance, free, noble, Xen.
Ζεὺς Ἐλευθέριος Jove the Deliverer, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐλευθεριότης
div1.sense: the character of an ἐλευθέριος, liberality, Plat.

div1.head: ἐλευθερόπαις
div1.sense: having free children, i. e. a free man, Anth.

div1.head: ἐλευθεροπρεπής
div1.sense: worthy of a freeman, Plat.

div1.head: ἐλεύθερος
div1.sense: free, opp. to δοῦλος: ἐλεύθερον ἦμαρ the day of freedom, i. e. freedom, Il.; κρητὴρ ἐλεύθερος the cup drunk to freedom, Il.:—of persons, Hdt., Attic: —τὸ ἐλ. freedom, Hdt.:—c. gen. free or freed from a thing, Trag.
of things, free, open to all, Xen.
like ἐλευθέριος, fit for a freeman, free, frank, Hdt., Attic:—adv., ἐλευθέρως εἰπεῖν Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἐλευθεροστομέω
div1.sense: to be free of speech, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐλευθερουργός
div1.sense: bearing himself freely or nobly, of the horse, Xen.

div1.head: ἐλευθερόω
div1.sense: to free, set free, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; ἐλ. τὸν ἔσπλουν to set the entrance free, clear it, Thuc.; ἐλευθεροῖ στόμα he keeps his tongue free, i. e. does not commit himself by speech, Soph.: to free from blame, acquit, τινά Xen.:—Pass. to be set free, Hdt.
c. gen. to set free, loose or release from, Eur.; so, ἐλευθεροῦντες ἐκ δρασμῶν πόδα, i. e. ceasing to flee, Eur.

div1.head: ἐλευθέρωσις
div1.sense: a setting free, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐλευθερωτής
div1.sense: a liberator, Luc.

div1.head: Ἐλευσῖνάδε
div1.sense: to Eleusis, (Ἐλευσίς) Xen.

div1.head: Ἐλευσίνιος
div1.sense: of Eleusis, Hhymn., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Ἐλευσῖνι
div1.sense: at Eleusis, Andoc., Xen.

div1.head: Ἐλευσινόθεν
div1.sense: from Eleusis, Lys., etc.

div1.head: Ἐλευσίς
div1.sense: Eleusis, an old city of Attica, sacred to Demeter and Proserpine, Hhymn., etc.

div1.head: ἔλευσις
div1.sense: a coming:—the Advent of our LORD, NTest.

div1.head: ἐλεφαίρομαι
div1.sense: Epic Dep. to cheat with empty hopes, said of the false dreams that come through the ivory gate (ἐλέφας) , Od.: generally, to cheat, overreach, Il.
to destroy, Hes.

div1.head: ἐλεφαντάρχης
div1.sense: the commander of a squadron of elephants, Plut.

div1.head: ἐλεφάντινος
div1.sense: of ivory, ivory, Lat. eburneus, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλεφαντόδετος
div1.sense: inlaid with ivory, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλεφαντόκωπος
div1.sense: ivory-hilted, Luc.

div1.head: ἐλεφαντομαχία
div1.sense: a battle of elephants, Plut.

div1.head: ἐλεφαντόπους
div1.sense: ivory-footed, Luc.

div1.head: ἐλέφας
div1.sense: the elephant, Hdt.
the elephantʼs tusk, ivory, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ἑλίγδην
div1.sense: whirling, rolling, Aesch.

div1.head: ἕλιγμα
div1.sense: a curl, lock of hair, Anth.

div1.head: ἑλιγμός
div1.sense: a winding, convolution, as of the Labyrinth, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἑλικοβλέφαρος
div1.sense: with ever-moving eyelids, quick-glancing, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἑλικοδρόμος
div1.sense: running in curves, circular, Eur.

div1.head: ἑλικοειδής
div1.sense: of winding or spiral form, Plut.

div1.head: ἑλικτός
div1.sense: curved, twisted, wreathed, Hhymn., Soph.; ἑλ. κύτος a wheeled ark, Eur.; σῦριγξ περὶ χεῖλος ἑλικτά moving quickly, Theocr.
metaph. tortuous, Eur.

div1.head: Ἑλικωνιάς
div1.sense: in pl., Ἑλικωνιάδες παρθένοι, αἱ, the dwellers on Helicon, the Muses, Hes.: so, Νύμφαι Ἑλικωνίδες, Soph.

div1.head: Ἑλικών
div1.sense: Helicon, a hill in Boeotia, Hes.

div1.head: ἑλίκωψ
div1.sense: with rolling eyes, quick-glancing, Il.

div1.head: ἐλινύω
div1.sense: to keep holiday, to take rest, be at rest, keep quiet, stand idle, Hdt., Aesch.
c. part. to rest or cease from doing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑλιξόκερως
div1.sense: with crumpled horns, Anth.

div1.head: ἕλιξ
div1.sense: adj. twisted, curved, of oxen, either with twisted, crumpled horns, or rolling as they walk, Hom., etc.:—later, ἕλικα ἀνὰ χλόαν on the tangled grass, Eur.

div1.head: ἕλιξ
div1.sense: anything which assumes a spiral shape:
an armlet or ear-ring, Il.
a twist, whirl, convolution, ἕλικες στεροπῆς flashes of forked lightning, Aesch.
the tendril of the vine, Eur.: of ivy, Eur.
a curl or lock of hair, Anth.
the coil or spire of a serpent, Eur.

div1.head: ἑλίσσω
div1.sense: to turn round, to turn a chariot round the doubling-post, Il.; so of the chariot of Day, Aesch., Eur.; ἑλ. κόνιν to roll the eddying dust, Aesch.; ἑλ. δίνας of the Euripus, Eur.; ἑλ. βλέφαρα Eur.
of any rapid motion, esp. of a circular kind, ἑλ. πλάταν to ply the oar swiftly, Soph.; ἑλ. πόδα to move the swift foot, Eur.: absol. to dance, Eur.
to roll or wind round, as the wool round the distaff, Hdt., Eur.
metaph. to turn in oneʼs mind, revolve, Soph.; ἑλ. λόγους to speak wily words, Eur.
Pass. and Mid. to turn oneself round, turn quick round, turn to bay, Il.; of a serpent, to coil himself, Il.; of a missile, to spin through the air, Il.
to turn hither and thither, go about, Il.:—also, like Lat. versari, to be busy about a thing, Il.
to whirl in the dance, Eur.
Mid. in Act. sense, with a whirl, like a sling, Il.
τὰς κεφαλὰς εἰλίχατο μίτρηισι have their heads rolled round with turbans, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑλίτροχος
div1.sense: whirling the wheel, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑλίχρυσος
div1.sense: a creeping plant with yellow flower or fruit, Theocr.

div1.head: ἑλκαίνω
div1.sense: to fester, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑλκεσίπεπλος
div1.sense: trailing the robe, with long train, Il.

div1.head: ἑλκεσίχειρος
div1.sense: drawing the hand after it, Anth.

div1.head: ἑλκεχίτων
div1.sense: trailing the tunic, with long tunic, Il.

div1.head: ἑλκέω
div1.sense: to drag about, tear asunder, Il.: to attempt violence to one, Od.

div1.head: ἑλκηδόν
div1.sense: by dragging or pulling, Hes.

div1.head: ἑλκηθμός
div1.sense: a being carried off, violence suffered, Il.

div1.head: ἕλκημα
div1.sense: that which is torn in pieces, a prey, Eur.

div1.head: ἑλκητήρ
div1.sense: one that drags, Anth.

div1.head: ἑλκοποιέω
div1.sense: to make wounds or sores: metaph. to rip up old sores, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἑλκοποιός
div1.sense: having power to wound, Aesch.

div1.head: ἕλκος
div1.sense: a wound, Il., Attic
a festering wound, ἕλκος ὕδρου the festering bite of a serpent, Il.: of plague-ulcers, Thuc.
metaph. a wound, loss, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἑλκόω
div1.sense: to wound sorely, lacerate, Eur.:—metaph., ἑλκ. φρένας οἴκους Eur.

div1.head: ἑλκτέος
div1.sense: one must drag, Plat.

div1.head: ἑλκτικός
div1.sense: fit for drawing, attractive, Plat.

div1.head: ἑλκύδριον
div1.sense: Dim. of ἕλκος, a slight sore, Ar.

div1.head: ἑλκυστάζω
div1.sense: Frequentat. of ἕλκω, to drag about, Il.

div1.head: ἑλκυστέος
div1.sense: to be dragged, Xen.

div1.head: ἑλκώδης
div1.sense: like a sore, ulcerated, Eur.

div1.head: ἕλκω
div1.sense: to draw, drag, Lat. traho, with a notion of force, ποδὸς ἕλκε began to drag [the dead body] by the foot, Il.; to draw ships down to the sea, Od.; of mules, to draw a chariot, Od.; to draw the plough through the field, Od.
to draw after one, Il.; πέδας ἕλκ. to trail fetters after one, Hdt.
to tear in pieces, Hdt., Eur.:—Mid., ἕλκεσθαι χαίτας to tear oneʼs hair, Il.
to draw a bow, Hom., etc.
to draw a sword, Soph.; and in Mid., to draw oneʼs sword, Il.
ἕλκ. ἱστία to hoist or haul up the sails, Od.
to hold up scales, so as to poise or balance them, Il.
after Hom., in many ways:
to pull an oar, Hdt.
to drag into court, Ar.: to drag about, esp. with lewd violence, Dem., etc.
to draw or suck up, Hdt.: of persons drinking, to drink in long draughts, quaff, Eur., etc.; ἑλκ. μαστόν to suck the breast, Eur.
ἕλκ. βίοτον, ζόην to drag out a weary life, Eur.: to drag on, prolong tediously, Hdt.: κόρδακα ἑλκύσαι to dance in long, measured steps, Ar.
to draw to oneself, attract, Hdt., etc.
ἕλκ. σταθμόν to draw down the balance, i. e. to weigh so much, Hdt.; absol., τὸ δʼ ἂν ἑλκύσηι whatever it weigh, Hdt.
ἑλκύσαι πλίνθους, like Lat. ducere, to make bricks, Hdt.
Mid. to draw to oneself, amass riches, Theogn.

div1.head: ἕλκωσις
div1.sense: ulceration, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐλλαμπρύνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to gain distinction, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐλλάμπω
div1.sense: to shine upon, to illuminate:— metaph. in Mid. to distinguish oneself, gain glory in or with a thing, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἑλλανοδίκαι
div1.sense: the chief judges at the Olympic games, Pind.
at Sparta, a court-martial to try disputes among the allied troops, Xen.

div1.head: Ἑλλάς
div1.sense: Hellas, a city of Thessaly, founded by Hellen, Il.
that part of Thessaly in which the Myrmidons dwelt, also called Phthiotis, Hom.
Northern Greece, as opp. to Peloponnesus, Od.
later, the name for Greece, from the South to Epirus and Thessaly inclusively, Hes., Hdt., etc.
as adj. with a fem. Subst. Hellenic, Greek, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑλλέβορος
div1.sense: hellebore, Lat. veratrum, a plant used as a specific for madness, πῖθʼ ἑλλέβορον drink hellebore, i. e. you are mad, Ar.

div1.head: ἐλλεδανός
div1.sense: the band for binding corn-sheaves, Il.

div1.head: ἐλλείπω
div1.sense: to leave in, leave behind, Eur.
to leave out, leave undone, Lat. omitto, Soph., etc.
intr. to fall short, fail, Hhymn., Soph.; τὸ ἐλλεῖπον τῆς ἐπιστήμης deficiency of knowledge, Thuc.
c. gen. rei, like δέω, to be in want of, fall short of, lack, Aesch., Thuc.; πολλοῦ ἐλλείπω I am far from it, Aesch.
c. gen. pers. to be inferior to, Plat.
foll. by μή c. inf., τί γὰρ ἐλλ. μὴ παραπαίειν; in what does he fall short of madness? Aesch.
with a part., οὐκ ἐλλείπει εὐχαριστῶν he fails not to give thanks, ap. Dem.
of things, to be wanting or lacking to . . , c. dat., Xen.
Pass. to be left behind in a race, Soph.: to be surpassed, Xen.
to be left wanting, to fail, Xen.

div1.head: ἔλλεσχος
div1.sense: commonly talked of, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑλληνίζω
div1.sense: to speak Greek, Plat.:—Pass., Ἑλληνισθῆναι τὴν γλῶσσαν to be made Greeks in language by another, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἑλληνικός
div1.sense: Hellenic, Greek, Hdt., Attic
τὸ Ἑλληνικόν the Greeks collectively, Hdt.; the Greek soldiery, Xen.
τὰ Ἑλληνικά the history of Grecian affairs, Thuc.
like the Greeks, Eur., Ar.:—adv. -κῶς, in Greek fashion, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἑλλήνιος
div1.sense: Ἑλλήνιον, τό, the temple of the Hellenes in Egypt, Hdt.
= Ἑλλάς, Eur.

div1.head: Ἑλληνίς
div1.sense: fem. of Ἕλλην, Attic.
Ἑλληνίς (v. sub. γυνή) a Grecian woman, Eur.

div1.head: Ἑλληνιστής
div1.sense: one who uses the Greek language; i. e., in NTest., a Hellenist, a Greek-Jew.

div1.head: Ἑλληνιστί
div1.sense: in Greek fashion, Luc.; Ἑλλ. ξυνιέναι to understand Greek, Xen.

div1.head: Ἑλληνοταμίαι
div1.sense: the stewards of Greece, i. e. officers appointed by Athens B. C. 477 to levy the contributions paid by the Greek states towards the Persian war, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἕλλην
div1.sense: Hellen, son of Deucalion, Hes.
the Ἕλληνες of Hom. are the Thessalian tribe of which Hellen was the reputed chief (cf. Ἑλλάς 1), Il.
later, Ἕλληνες was the regul. name for Greeks, opp. to βάρβαροι, Hdt., etc.
later still, of Gentiles, Opp. to Jews, NTest.
as adj. = Ἑλληνικός, Thuc., etc.:—even with a fem. Subst., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: Ἑλλησποντιακός
div1.sense: of the Hellespont, Xen., Ἑλλησπόντιος, α, ον, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: Ἑλλησποντίας
div1.sense: a wind blowing from the Hellespont, i. e. from the N. E., Hdt.

div1.head: Ἑλλήσποντος
div1.sense: the Hellespont or sea of Helle (daughter of Athamas, who was drowned therein), now the Dardanelles, Hom., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐλλιμενιστής
div1.sense: a collector of harbour-dues, Dem.

div1.head: ἐλλιπής
div1.sense: pass. wanting, lacking, defective, Thuc., etc.; also c. dat.; τὸ μὴ ἐπιχειρούμενον ἀεὶ ἐλλιπὲς ἦν τῆς δοκήσεως whatever was not attempted was so much lost of their reckoning, Thuc.; τὸ ἐλλιπές defect, failure, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐλλόβιον
div1.sense: that which is in the lobe of the ear, an earring, Lat. inauris, Luc.

div1.head: ἐλλογέω
div1.sense: to reckon in, to impute, NTest.

div1.head: ἐλλόγιμος
div1.sense: held in account (ἐν λόγῳ) , notable, famous, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἐλλοπιεύω
div1.sense: to fish, Theocr.

div1.head: ἑλλός
div1.sense: a young deer, fawn, Od.

div1.head: ἐλλοχίζω
div1.sense: to lie in ambush, Eur.: c. acc. to lie in wait for, Plut.

div1.head: ἔλλοψ
div1.sense: mute, of fish, Hes.

div1.head: ἐλλύχνιον
div1.sense: a lamp-wick, Hdt.

div1.head: ἕλξις
div1.sense: a drawing, dragging, trailing, Plat.

div1.head: ἕλος
div1.sense: low ground by rivers, a marsh-meadow, Hom., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐλπιδοδώτης
div1.sense: giver of hope, Anth.

div1.head: ἐλπίζω
div1.sense: to hope for, look for, expect, τι Aesch., etc.: c. inf. fut. or aor. to hope or expect that, Hdt., Attic
of evils, to look for, fear, Soph., etc.
with inf. pres. it means little more than to think, deem, suppose, believe that, Hdt., Attic
c. dat. to hope in . . , τῆι τύχηι Thuc.; εἴς τινα, ἐπί τινα NTest.

div1.head: ἐλπίς
div1.sense: hope, expectation, Od.;in pl., πολλῶν ῥαγεισῶν ἐλπίδων after the wreck of many hopes, Aesch.;—with gen. both of subject and object, Πελοποννησίων τὴν ἐλπίδα τοῦ ναυτικοῦ the hope of the P. in their navy, Thuc.
the object of hope, a hope, Ὀρέστης, ἐλπὶς δόμων Aesch.
apprehension, fear, Aesch.

div1.head: ἔλπω
div1.sense: to make to hope, πάντας ἔλπει feeds all with hope, Od.
Mid. to hope or expect, indulge hope, Hom., Hdt.; like Attic ἐλπίζω.
to expect anxiously, to fear, Hom., Hdt.
generally, to think, deem, suppose, Il.

div1.head: ἔλυμα
div1.sense: the tree or stock of the plough, on which the share was fixed, Lat. dentale, Hes.

div1.head: ἔλυτρον
div1.sense: the case of a spear, Ar.
the body as the case of the soul, Plat. ap. Luc.
a place for holding water, a reservoir, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐλύω
div1.sense: to roll round (cf. εἰλύω):— only in aor1 pass. ἐπὶ γαῖαν ἐλύσθη rolled to the ground, Il.; προπάροιθε ποδῶν Ἀχιλῆος ἐλυσθείς rolled up, crouching before Achillesʼ feet, Il.; ὑπὸ γαστέρʼ ἐλυσθείς huddled under [the ramʼs] belly, Od.
= εἰλύω, to wrap up, cover, Apoll.

div1.head: ἕλωρ
div1.etym: only in nom. and acc. sg. and pl.
div1.sense: booty, spoil, prey, of unburied corpses, Hom.
in pl., Πατρόκλοιο ἕλωρα penalty for the slaughter of Patroclus, Il.

div1.head: ἐμαυτοῦ
div1.sense: Reflexive Pronoun of first person, of me, of myself: only used in gen., dat., and acc. sg., Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἐμβαδόν
div1.sense: on foot, by land, Il.

div1.head: ἐμβαδόν2
div1.sense: surface, area.

div1.head: ἐμβαίνω
div1.sense: to step in, μή τις ἐμβήῃ let none step in (to interfere), Il.
to go on, go quickly, ἔμβητον, says Antilochus to his horses, Il.; ἔμβα advance, Eur.
to step into a ship, embark, go on board, Hom., etc.:—perf. to be mounted on, ἐμβεβαὼς ἵπποισι Il.; also c. acc., Ἴλιον ἐμβεβώς Eur.
to step upon, c. dat., Od., Aesch.
to enter upon, εἰς κίνδυνον Xen.; c. acc., ἐμβ. κέλευθον Eur., Plat.
rarely c. gen. to step upon, γῆς ὅρων Soph.
in Poets, with acc. of the instrument of motion (cf. βαίνω II. 3), ἐμβήσει (2nd sg.) πόδα Eur.
Causal in aor1 ἐνέβησα, to make to step in, put in, Od., Eur.; ἐμβῆσαί τινα εἰς φροντίδα to make him anxious, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw in, put in, Il., etc.; ἐμβ. τινὰ εἰς τὸ δεσμωτήριον to throw one into prison, Dem.; ἔμβαλλε χεῖρα δεξιάν, as a pledge of good faith, Soph.
ἐμβ. τινί τι θυμῷ to put it into his mind, Hom.; so, ἐμβ. ἵμερον, μένος τινί Hom.; βουλὴν ἐμβ. περί τινος to give one counsel about a thing, Xen.
to throw at, upon or against, νηῒ κεραυνόν Od.; ἐμβ. πληγάς to inflict stripes, Xen.; ἐμβ. πῦρ to apply it, Thuc.:— metaph., ἐμβ. φόβον τινί to strike fear into him, Lat. incutere timorem, Hdt.
intr. (sub. στρατόν) to make an inroad or invasion, Hdt.
generally to break, burst, rush in, Aeschin.; ἐμβάλωμεν εἰς ἄλλον λόγον Eur.
to strike a ship with the ram, to charge or ram it, c. dat., Hdt., Thuc.
κώπῃ ἐμβάλλειν (sub. χεῖρας) to lay oneself to the oar, Lat. incumbere remis, Od.; and ἐμβάλλειν alone, to lay to, pull hard, Ar.
of a river, to empty itself, Plat.
Mid. to throw in what is oneʼs own, Dem.
metaph., ἐμβάλλεσθαί τι θυμῷ to lay it to heart, consider it, Il.
c. gen., ἐμβάλεσθε τῶν λαγῴων fall upon the hareʼs flesh, Ar.
Pass. of ships, to charge, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔμβαμμα
div1.sense: sauce, soup, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμβάπτω
div1.sense: to dip in, Ar.

div1.head: ἔμβασις
div1.sense: that on which one goes or steps, ἔμβασις ποδός, i. e. a shoe, Aesch.
the foot, hoof, Eur.
a bath, Anth.

div1.head: ἐμβασίχυτρος
div1.sense: pot-visiter, name of a mouse in Batr.

div1.head: ἐμβατεύω
div1.sense: to step in or on, to frequent, haunt a place, c. acc., of tutelary gods, Aesch., etc.:—c. gen., simply, to set foot upon, Soph.
ἐμβατ. κλήρους to enter on, come into possession of, Eur.; so, ἐμβ. εἴς τι Dem.

div1.head: ἐμβάς
div1.sense: a felt-shoe, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἐμβασιλεύω
div1.sense: to be king in or among others, c. dat., Hom.

div1.head: ἐμβατήριος
div1.sense: of or for marching in, ἐμβ. παιάν a march, Plut.

div1.head: ἐμβάτης
div1.sense: a half-boot of felt, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμβάφιον
div1.sense: a flat vessel for sauces, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμβιβάζω
div1.sense: to set in or on, Plat.:— to put on board ship, cause to embark, Thuc., Xen.
to lead to a thing, Eur., Dem.

div1.head: ἔμβλεμμα
div1.sense: a looking straight at, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμβλέπω
div1.sense: to look in the face, look at, τινι or εἴς τινα Plat.; absol., Xen.

div1.head: ἔμβλημα
div1.sense: an insertion, τὸ εἰς τὸν σίδηρον ἔμβλ. the shaft fitted into the spear-head, Plut.

div1.head: ἐμβοάω
div1.sense: to call upon, shout to, τινί Xen.; absol., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμβολεύς
div1.sense: anything put in: a dibble for setting plants, Anth.

div1.head: ἐμβολή
div1.sense: a putting into its place, insertion of a letter, Plat.
intr. a breaking in, inroad into an enemyʼs country, foray, Xen.
an assault, attack, charge, Eur.:—esp. the charge made by one ship upon another, Aesch., Thuc.; ἐμβολαῖς χαλκόστομοις with shocks of brasen beaks, Aesch.
the stroke of a missile, Eur.
a way into, entrance, pass, Hdt., Xen.
the head of a battering-ram, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμβόλιμος
div1.sense: inserted, intercalated, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔμβολος
div1.sense: anything pointed so as to be easily thrust in: τῆς χώρης ἔμβολον a tongue of land, Hdt.
in ships of war, the beak or ram of a ship of war, masc. in Hdt.; neut. in Thuc.
οἱ ἔμβολοι the rostra of the Roman forum, Plut.
the wedge-shaped order of battle, Lat. cuneus, neut. in Xen.
a bolt, bar, neut., Eur.

div1.head: ἐμβραδύνω
div1.sense: to dwell on, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἔμβραχυ
div1.sense: adv. in brief, shortly, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἔμβρεφος
div1.sense: boy-like, Anth.

div1.head: ἐμβριθής
div1.sense: weighty, Hdt., Plat.
metaph., like Lat. gravis, weighty, grave, dignified, Plut.
in bad sense, heavy, grievous, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐμβριμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. c. aor. mid. et pass., to snort in, of horses, Aesch.
of persons, to be deeply moved, NTest.
c. dat. pers. to admonish urgently, rebuke, NTest.

div1.head: ἐμβροντάω
div1.sense: Pass. to be stricken by lightning, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμβρόντητος
div1.sense: thunderstruck, stupefied, stupid, Lat. attonitus, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ἐμβρύοικος
div1.sense: dwelling in sea-weed, Anth.

div1.head: ἔμβρυον
div1.sense: a young one, Od.
an embryo, Lat. foetus, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐμβύθιος
div1.sense: at the bottom of the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἐμβύω
div1.sense: to stuff in, stop with a thing, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμετικός
div1.sense: one who uses emetics, like the Roman gourmands, Plut.

div1.head: ἔμετος
div1.sense: vomiting, Lat. vomitus, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμμαίνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be mad at a thing, c. dat., NTest.

div1.head: ἐμέω
div1.sense: to vomit, throw up, Il., Hdt., etc.: absol. to vomit, to be sick, Hdt., Attic; ἐμ. πτίλωι to make oneself sick with a feather, Ar.

div1.head: ἔμμαλλος
div1.sense: woolly, fleecy, Luc.

div1.head: ἐμμανής
div1.sense: ἐν μανίᾳ ὤν, in madness, frantic, raving, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐμμαπέως
div1.sense: quickly, readily, hastily, Hom.
div1.etym: Perh. from μαπέειν, μάρπτω, to seize eagerly.

div1.head: ἐμμάσσομαι
div1.sense: Att. -ττ-. Dep. to knead bread in, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fight a battle in, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμμειδιάω
div1.sense: to smile or be glad at, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμμέλεια
div1.sense: harmony: a stately Tragic dance, Plat.: the tune of this dance, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμμελετάω
div1.sense: to exercise or train in a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἐμμελέτημα
div1.sense: an exercise, a practice, Anth.

div1.head: ἐμμελής
div1.sense: sounding in unison, in tune or time, harmonious, Plut.
metaph., of persons, in tune or harmony, orderly, suitable, proper, Plat.:— graceful, elegant, Plat.
adv. -λῶς, Ionic -έως, harmoniously, suitably, decorously, Simon. Plat.

div1.head: ἐμμεμαώς
div1.sense: in eager haste, eager, of persons, Il.

div1.head: ἐμμέμονα
div1.sense: to be lost in passion, Soph.

div1.head: ἐμμενής
div1.sense: abiding in: neut. ἐμμενές as adv., ἐμμενὲς αἰεί unceasing ever, Hom.:—so ἐμμενέως, Hes.

div1.head: ἐμμένω
div1.sense: to abide in a place, Thuc.
to abide by, stand by, cleave to, be true to oneʼs word, oath, etc., c. dat., Hdt., Attic: also, ἐμμ. ἐν σπονδαῖς Thuc.:—absol. to stand fast, be faithful, Eur.
of things, to stand fast, hold good, be fixed, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐμμετρία
div1.sense: fit measure, proportion, Plat.

div1.head: ἔμμετρος
div1.sense: in measure, proportioned, suitable, moderate, Plat.
in metre, metrical, Plat.

div1.head: ἐμμετρότης
div1.sense: proportion, fitness, Aristaen.

div1.head: ἔμμηνος
div1.sense: in a month, done or paid every month, monthly, Soph., Theocr.

div1.head: ἔμμητρος
div1.sense: with pith in it, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐμμείγνυμι
div1.sense: mid. ἐμμ(ε)ίγνυμαι to be mixed or mingled in, Aesch.
intr. in Act. to encounter, c. dat., Soph.

div1.head: ἔμμισθος
div1.sense: in pay, in receipt of pay, hired, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμμονή
div1.sense: an abiding by, cleaving to, τινος Plat.

div1.head: ἔμμονος
div1.sense: abiding by, steadfast, Xen.; ἔμμ. τινι abiding by a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἔμμορος
div1.sense: partaking in, endued with a thing, c. gen., Od.
(μόρος) fortunate, Anth.

div1.head: ἔμμορφος
div1.sense: in bodily form, Plut.

div1.head: ἔμμοτος
div1.sense: needing to be stopped with lint: metaph., ἔμμοτον τῶνδʼ ἄκος a cure to heal these wounds, Aesch.

div1.head: ἔμμοχθος
div1.sense: toilsome, βίοτος Eur.

div1.head: ἐμμυέω
div1.sense: to initiate in: Pass., μῶν ἐνεμυήθης δῆτʼ ἐν αὐτῷ τὰ μεγάλα; what, were you initiated at the great mysteries in that shabby coat Ar.

div1.head: ἐμός
div1.sense: possess. Pron. of first pers., mine, Lat. meus, Hom., etc.; by crasis with the Art., οὑμός, τοὐμόν, τοὐμοῦ, τὠμῷ, τἀμάto strengthen the possessive notion, ἐμὸν αὐτοῦ mine own, Il.; τὸν ἐμὸν αὐτοῦ βίον Ar.
objectively, to me, relating to me, against me, ἐμὴ ἀγγελίη Hom.; τὴν ἐμὴν αἰδῶ respect for me, Aesch.; αἱ ἐμαὶ διαβολαί slanders against me, Thuc.; τοὐμὸν αἷμα πατρός his blood shed by me, Soph.

τὸ ἐμόν, τὰ ἐμά my property, Ar., etc.:—but also, τὰ ἐμά or τὸ ἐμόν, my part, my affairs, my interest, οὕτω τὸ ἐμὸν ἔχει things stand thus with me, Hdt.; ἔρρει τἀμά Xen.;—hence periphr. for ἐγώ or ἐμέ, Soph.; or absol., τό γε ἐμόν, τὸ μὲν ἐμόν, for my part, as far as concerns me, Hdt., etc.
ἡ ἐμὴ (sub. γῆ) my country, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμπάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to busy oneself about, take heed of, care for a thing, c.gen., Hom.; once c. acc. pers., Il.

div1.head: ἐμπαθής
div1.sense: in a state of emotion, much affected by or at a thing, Plut.

div1.head: ἔμπαιγμα
div1.sense: mockery, NTest.

div1.head: ἐμπαίζω
div1.sense: to mock at, mock, Lat. illudere, τινί Hdt.: absol., Soph.
to sport in or on a place, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: ἐμπαίκτης
div1.sense: a mocker, deceiver, NTest.

div1.head: ἔμπαιος
div1.sense: possessed of or practised in a thing, c. gen., Od.

div1.head: ἔμπαιος2
div1.sense: bursting in, sudden, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐμπαίω
div1.sense: to strike in, stamp, emboss, Anth.
intr. to burst in upon, c. dat., Soph.

div1.head: ἐμπακτόω
div1.sense: to close by stuffing in or caulking, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμπαλάσσομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be entangled in, Hdt.: absol., ἐμπαλασσόμενοι entangled one with another, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔμπαλιν
div1.sense: adv., in Attic and Prose often with the Art., τὸ ἔμπαλιν or τοὔμπαλιν, τὰ ἔμπαλιν or τἄμπαλιν, backwards, back, Hhymn., Hes., etc.
contrariwise, the opposite way, ἐκ τοὔμπαλιν from the opposite side, Thuc.
c. gen. contrary to, Hdt.; τοὔμπ. οὗ βούλονται Xen.

div1.head: ἐμπανηγυρίζω
div1.sense: to hold assemblies in, Plut.

div1.head: ἐμπαρέχω
div1.sense: to give into anotherʼs hands, put into his power to do, c. inf., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμπαροινέω
div1.sense: to behave like one drunken, Luc.

div1.head: ἔμπας
div1.sense: notwithstanding, nevertheless, Hom.; with a negat., not at all, Hom.; after a part. with περ, like ὅμως, πίνοντά περ ἔμπης, busy though he was with drinking, Il.:—so in Trag., at any rate, yet.

div1.head: ἐμπάσσω
div1.sense: to sprinkle in or on, Plat.: metaph. to weave as patterns in a web of cloth, Il.

div1.head: ἐμπατέω
div1.sense: to walk in or into a place, enter, c. acc., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐμπεδορκέω
div1.sense: to abide by oneʼs oath, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἔμπεδος
div1.sense: in the ground, firm-set, steadfast, Hom.; of events, sure and certain, Od.
of Time, lasting, continual, Hom.

neut. ἔμπεδον as adv., μένειν ἔμπεδον to stand fast, Il.; θέειν ἔμπεδον to run on and on, run without resting, Il.; strenghd., ἔμπεδον αἰέν Il.:—so in pl., τίκτει δʼ ἔμπεδα μῆλα the flocks bring forth without fail, Od.:—also in Attic Poets, of a surety, Soph.; but more often ἐμπέδως, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐμπεδόω
div1.sense: to fix in the earth: generally, to make firm and fast, establish, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἐμπειρία
div1.sense: experience, Eur., Thuc., etc.
c. gen. rei, experience in, acquaintance with, Thuc., etc.; also, ἐμπ. περί τι Xen.

div1.head: ἔμπειρος
div1.sense: experienced or practised in a thing, acquainted with it, c. gen., Hdt., Attic:—absol., οἱ ἔμπειροι the experienced, Soph., Plat., etc.; ναυσὶν ἐμπείροις with ships proved by use, Thuc.:— τὸ ἐμπειρότερον αὐτῶν their greater experience, Thuc.
adv., ἐμπείρως τινὸς ἔχειν to know a thing by experience, by its issue, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμπελαδόν
div1.sense: near, hard by, c. dat., Hes.

div1.head: ἐμπελάζω
div1.sense: to bring near, Hes.:—Pass. to come near, approach, c. gen., Soph.
intr. in Act., like Pass. to approach, c. dat., Hhymn., Soph.

div1.head: ἐμπέραμος
div1.sense: skilled in the use of a thing, c. gen., Anth.; also ἐμπείραμος, Anth.

div1.head: ἐμπεριπατέω
div1.sense: to walk about in, Luc.:— absol. to walk about, Luc.

div1.head: ἐμπερόνημα
div1.sense: a garment fastened with a brooch on the shoulder, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐμπετάννυμι
div1.sense: to unfold and spread in or on, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to fix or plant in, c. dat., Il.:—Pass., with perf. and plup. act. to be fixed or stuck in, to stick in, τινί or ἔν τινι Ar.

div1.head: ἐμπηδάω
div1.sense: to jump upon a person, c. dat., Hdt.
to leap in or into, absol. in aor1 part. ἐμπηδήσας, eagerly, greedily, Luc.

div1.head: ἔμπηρος
div1.sense: crippled, maimed, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμπικραίνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. or Pass. to be bitter against a person, c. dat., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμπίνω
div1.sense: to drink in, drink greedily, Eur., etc.; ἐμπ. τοῦ αἵματος to drink greedily of the blood, Hdt.
absol. to drink oneʼs fill, Theogn., Xen.

div1.head: ἐμπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill quite full, Od., Xen.
c. gen. to fill full of a thing, Hom., etc.
Mid. to fill for oneself or what is oneʼs own, ἐμπλήσατο νηδύν Od.; μένεος ἐμπλήσατο θυμόν he filled his heart with rage, Il.

Pass. to be filled full of a thing, c. gen., Hom.:—metaph., υἷος ἐνιπλησθῆναι to take my fill of my son, i. e. to sate myself with looking on him, Od.; so c. part. to be satiated with doing, Eur., Xen.
c. dat., καρπῷ ἐμπ. to be filled with . . , Hdt.
absol. to eat oneʼs fill, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐμπίμπρημι
div1.etym: inf. ἐμπιπρᾶν as if from ἐμπιπράω
Pass., fut. ἐμπρήσομαι in mid. form
div1.sense: to kindle, burn, set on fire, Il., Hdt., Soph.; also c. gen., πυρὸς νῆας ἐνιπρῆσαι to burn them by force of fire, Il.:—Pass. to be on fire, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall in or upon or into, c. dat., Hom., etc.
to fall upon, attack, Hom.; also ἐμπ. εἰς . . , Hdt., etc.; rarely c. acc., Soph., Eur.
to light or chance upon a thing, to fall in with, τινί Hdt., etc.; more commonly ἐμπ. εἰς . . , Lat. incidere in . . , Soph., etc.
to break in, burst in or into, c. dat., Soph., etc.; aor2 part. ἐμπεσών violently, Hdt.
ἐμπίτνω poet. for ἐμπίπτω
to fall upon, τινί Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐμπίς
div1.sense: a mosquito, gnat, Lat. culex, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμπιστεύω
div1.sense: to entrust, τινί τι Plut.:—Pass. to be entrusted with, τι Luc.

div1.head: ἐμπλάσσω
div1.sense: to plaster up, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμπλέκω
div1.sense: to plait or weave in, Lat. implicare, χεῖρα ἐμπλ. to entwine oneʼs hand in anotherʼs clothes, so as to hold him, Eur.:—Pass. to be entangled in a thing, c. dat., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἔμπλεος
div1.sense: quite full of a thing, Od., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐμπλέω
div1.sense: to sail in, πλοίῳ Hdt.: absol., οἱ ἐμπλέοντες the crews, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμπλήγδην
div1.sense: madly, rashly, Od.

div1.head: ἐμπληκτικός
div1.sense: easily scared, Plut.

div1.head: ἔμπληκτος
div1.sense: stunned, amazed, stupefied, Lat. attonitus, Xen., Plut.
unstable, capricious, Soph., Eur.
adv. -τως, rashly; τὸ ἐμπλήκτως ὀξύ startling rapidity of action, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔμπλην
div1.sense: near, next, close by, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἔμπλην
div1.sense: besides, except, c. gen., Archil.

div1.head: ἐμπληξία
div1.sense: amazement, stupidity, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐμπλήσσω
div1.sense: to strike against, fall upon or into, c. dat., Hom.

div1.head: ἐμπληστέος
div1.sense: to be filled with, τινός Plat.

div1.head: ἐμπνέω
div1.sense: to blow or breathe upon, c. dat., Il., Eur.
absol. to breathe, live, be alive, Aesch., Soph., Plat., etc.; βραχὺν βίοτον ἐμπνέων ἔτι Eur.
c. gen. to breathe of, ἐμπν. φόνου, Lat. caedem spirare, NTest.
trans. to blow into, ἱστίον ἐμπν. to swell the sail, Hhymn.
to breathe into, inspire, μένος or θάρσος τινί Hom.

div1.head: ἔμπνοια
div1.sense: inbreathing, inspiration, Luc.

div1.head: ἔμπνοος
div1.sense: with the breath in one, breathing, alive, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐμποδίζω
div1.sense: to put the feet in bonds, to fetter, Hdt.: —Pass., ἐμπεποδισμένος τοὺς πόδας Hdt.
generally, to hinder, thwart, impede, Lat. impedire, τινά Ar., Xen.; πρός τι in a thing, Isocr.:—Pass., Soph.
ὥσπερ ἐμποδίζων ἰσχάδας like one stringing figs or treading figs flat for packing, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμπόδιος
div1.sense: at oneʼs feet, coming in the way, meeting, ap. Plut.
in the way, impeding, c. dat. pers., Eur.:—c. gen. rei, ἐμπ. εἶναι εἰρήνης Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμποδών
div1.sense: = ἐν ποσὶν ὤν, but formed by anal. to ἐκποδών:— at the feet, in the way, in oneʼs path, Hdt., etc.

in oneʼs way, i. e. presenting an hindrance, ἐμπ. εἶναι to be in the way, Aesch.; ἐμπ. στῆναί τινι Aesch.; κεῖσθαι Eur.:—c. inf., ἐμπ. εἶναι τῷ ποιεῖν Xen.; ἐμπ. εἶναι or γίγνεσθαί τινι μὴ πράττειν to prevent a personʼs doing, Thuc., etc.:— τὸ ἐμπ. the hindrance, obstacle, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμποιέω
div1.sense: to make in, Il.:—Pass., χελιδὼν ἐμπεποιημένη introduced by the poetʼs art, Ar.
to foist in, interpolate, Hdt.
to produce or create in, of states of mind, ἐπιθυμίαν τοῖς Ἀθηναίοις ἐμπ. Thuc.; κακόν τι ἐμπ. ταῖς ψυχαῖς Plat.
of conditions, to introduce, produce, cause, φθόρον, στάσιν Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμπολαῖος
div1.sense: concerned in traffic, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμπολάω
div1.sense: to get by barter or traffic, earn, Soph., Xen.:—Mid., βίοτον πολὺν ἐμπολόωντο they were getting much substance by traffic, Od.
to deal or traffic in a thing, to purchase, buy, Soph.:—metaph., ἐμπ. τὴν ἐμὴν φρένα to make profit of my mind, by dealing with me, Od.
absol. to deal as a merchant, traffic, Ar.:—metaph., ἠμποληκὼς τὰ πλεῖστʼ ἀμείνονα having dealt in most things with success, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐμπολέμιος
div1.sense: pertaining to war, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμπολεύς
div1.sense: a merchant, trafficker, Anth.

div1.head: ἐμπόλημα
div1.sense: matter of traffic, the freight of a ship, merchandise, Soph. (metaph.), Eur.
gain made by traffic, Theophr.

div1.head: ἐμπολή
div1.sense: merchandise, Ar., Xen.
traffic, purchase, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἐμπολητός
div1.sense: bought, οὑμπολητὸς Σισύφου Λαερτίῳ the son of Sisyphus bought by or palmed off upon Laertes, Soph.

div1.head: ἔμπολις
div1.sense: in the city or state: ὁ ἔμπ. τινι oneʼs fellow-citizen, Soph.

div1.head: ἐμπολιτεύω
div1.sense: to be one of a state, to be a citizen, hold civil rights, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμπομπεύω
div1.sense: to swagger in procession, Luc.

div1.head: ἐμπόρευμα
div1.sense: merchandise, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to travel, Soph.
to travel for traffic, to be a merchant, to trade, traffic, Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to import, Luc.
c. acc. pers. to make gain of, to overreach, NTest.

div1.head: ἐμπορευτέα
div1.sense: one must go or tramp, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμπορία
div1.sense: commerce, trade, traffic, Hes., etc.
a trade or business, NTest., Anth.
merchandise, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ἐμπορικός
div1.sense: commercial, mercantile, Stesich.; ἐμπ. τέχνη ἐμπορία, Plat.; ἐμπ. δίκαι mercantile actions, Dem.; τὰ ἐμπ. χρήματα money to be used in trade, Dem.
imported, foreign, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμπόριον
div1.sense: Lat. emporium, a trading-place, mart, factory, such as were formed by the Phoenicians and Carthaginians, Hdt., etc.
τὸ ἐμπ., at Athens, the Exchange, where the merchants resorted, Dem.
ἐμπόρια, τά, merchandise, Xen.

div1.head: ἔμπορος
div1.sense: one who goes on shipboard as a passenger, Lat. vector, Od.
= ὁ ἐν πόρῳ ὤν, any one on a journey, a traveller, wanderer, Trag.
a merchant, trader, Lat. mercator, Hdt., etc.:—metaph., ἔμπορος βίου a trafficker in life, Eur.

div1.head: ἐμπορπάω
div1.sense: to fasten with a broochPass., εἵματα ἐνεπορπέατο (Ionic for -hnto) they wore garments fastened with a brooch, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἔμπουσα
div1.sense: Empusa, a hobgoblin assuming various shapes, Ar.

div1.head: ἔμπρακτος
div1.sense: practicableadv. -τως, Plut.

div1.head: ἐμπρέπω
div1.sense: to be conspicuous in, c. dat., Aesch.; Βάκχαις among them, Ar.
to be conspicuous or famous for a thing, Trag.
to suit, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἐμπρήθω
div1.sense: to blow up, inflate, Il.:—Pass., ἐμπεπρημένη ὗς a bloated sow, Ar.
= ἐμπίπρημι, to burn, Il.

div1.head: ἔμπρησις
div1.sense: a conflagration, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμπρίω
div1.sense: to saw into, to gnash the teeth together, Luc.

div1.head: ἐμπρόθεσμος
div1.sense: within the stated time, Luc.

div1.head: ἔμπροσθεν
div1.sense: adv.:
of Place, before, in front, Hdt., Xen.: τὸ and τὰ ἔμπροσθεν the front, fore-side, Hdt., etc.; εἰς τὸ ἔμπ. forwards, Hdt.; ἐκ τοῦ ἔμπρ. opposite, Xen.
of Time, before, earlier, of old, Plat.
as prep. with gen. before, in front of:
of Place, ἐμπρ. αὐτῆς (sc. τῆς νηός) Hdt.
of Time, ἔμπρ. ταύτης (sc. τῆς γνώμης) Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμπρόσθιος
div1.sense: fore, front, of an animalʼs feet, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐμπτύω
div1.sense: to spit into, ἐς ποταμόν Hdt.
to spit upon, NTest.

div1.head: ἐμπυκάζω
div1.sense: to wrap up inPass., νόος οἱ ἐμπεπύκασται his mind is veiled, dark, Mosch.

div1.head: ἔμπυος
div1.sense: suppurating, Soph.

div1.head: ἐμπυρεύω
div1.sense: to roast in or on the fire, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμπυριβήτης
div1.sense: made for standing on the fire, of a tripod, Il.

div1.head: ἔμπυρος
div1.sense: in the fire, ἡ ἔμπ. τέχνη the work of the fire, the forge, Plat.; also the art of divining by fire, Eur.
exposed to fire or sun, scorched, burnt, Eur.
burning, fiery, of the sun, Anth.
lighted, of a lamp, Anth.
of or for a burnt-offering, Eur.
as Subst., ἔμπυρα (sc. ἱερά) , τά, burnt sacrifices, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐμφαγεῖν
div1.etym: inf. of aor2 ἐνέφαγον, no pres. ἐνεσθίω being in use
div1.sense: to eat hastily, Xen.
to eat in or upon, Luc.

div1.head: ἐμφαίνω
div1.sense: to let a thing be seen in a mirror, Plat.:— to exhibit, display, Plut., etc.
Pass., with fut. mid. to be seen in a mirror, to be reflected, Plat., Xen.
to become visible, Xen.

div1.head: ἐμφανής
div1.sense: shewing in itself, reflecting, of mirrors, Plat.

visible to the eye, manifest, esp. of the gods appearing bodily among men, Soph., etc.; so, ἐμφανῆ τινα ἰδεῖν to see him bodily, Soph.:—of things, τἀμφανῆ κρύπτειν Soph.; ἐμφ. τεκμήρια visible proofs, Soph.; τὰ ἐμφ. κτήματα the actual property, Xen.
ποιεῖν τι ἐμφανές to do it in public, Lat. in propatulo, Hdt.; τὸ ἐμφ. opp. to τὸ μέλλον, Thuc.; εἰς τοὐμφανὲς ἰέναι to come into light, Xen.
open, actual, palpable, Ar., Thuc., etc.
manifest, well-known, τὰ ἐμφανῆ Hdt.
adv. -νῶς, Ionic -νέως, visibly, openly, Lat. palam, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; openly, i. e. not secretly or treacherously, Soph.; οὐ λόγοις, ἀλλʼ ἐμφανῶς but really, Ar.
so in neut. adj., ἐξ ἐμφανέος or ἐκ τοῦ ἐμφ., Hdt.; ἐν τῷ ἐμφανεῖ Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμφανίζω
div1.sense: to make manifest, exhibit, ἐμφ. τινὰ ἐπίορκον, φίλον to represent him as . . , Xen.:— Pass. to become visible, NTest.
to make clear or plain, τινί τι Xen.

div1.head: ἐμφέρβομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to feed in a place, c. dat., Mosch.

div1.head: ἐμφέρεια
div1.sense: likeness, Plut.

div1.head: ἐμφερής
div1.sense: answering to, resembling, τινί, Hdt., Attic: cf. προσφερής.

div1.head: ἐμφέρω
div1.sense: to bear or bring in, cf. ἐμφορέω.
ἐνεφέρετο an account was given, Not. ad Polyb.

div1.head: ἐμφεύγω
div1.sense: to fly in or into, Luc.

div1.head: ἐμφιλοχωρέω
div1.sense: to be fond of dwelling in, to dwell in, τῇ μνήμῃ Luc.

div1.head: ἐμφλέγω
div1.sense: to kindle in, τινί Anth.

div1.head: ἔμφλοξ
div1.sense: with fire in it, πέτρος Anth.

div1.head: ἔμφοβος
div1.sense: terrible, Lat. formidolosus, Soph.

div1.head: ἐμφορβιόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to have the mouth-band on, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμφορέω
div1.sense: Pass. to be borne about in or on, c. dat., Od.
to pour in, ἄκρατον Diod.:— Mid. and Pass. to take oneʼs fill or make much use of a thing, c. gen., Hdt., Plut.
metaph. to put upon, inflict on, ἐμφορεῖν πληγάς τινι Plut.
to object to, throw in oneʼs teeth, Soph.

div1.head: ἐμφράσσω
div1.sense: to block up, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐμφρουρέω
div1.sense: to keep guard in a place, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔμφρουρος
div1.sense: on guard in a place; οἱ ἔμφρουροι the garrison, Xen.
pass. garrisoned, Dem.

div1.head: ἔμφρων
div1.sense: in oneʼs mind or senses, Aesch., Soph.
alive, Soph.
rational, intelligent, Xen., Plat.
sensible, shrewd, prudent, Theogn., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐμφύλιος
div1.sense: ἐμφύλιοι, kinsfolk, Soph.; αἷμʼ ἐμφύλιον Soph.; γῆ ἐμφύλιος oneʼs native land, Soph.
in oneʼs tribe, Ἄρης ἐμφύλιος Aesch.; μάχη Theocr.

div1.head: ἔμφυλος
div1.sense: of the same tribe or race, Od.
in oneʼs tribe, ἔμφ. στάσις civil strife, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐμφυσάω
div1.sense: to blow in: to play the flute, Ar.

div1.head: ἐμφυσιόω
div1.sense: to implant, instil into, Xen.

div1.head: ἔμφυτος
div1.sense: implanted, innate, natural, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐμφύω
div1.sense: to implant, τί τινι Od., Xen.
Pass., with perf. ἐμπέφῡκα and aor2 ἐνέφῡν·

to grow in or on, c. dat., ὅθι τρίχες κρανίῳ ἐμπεφύασι (Epic for ἐμπεφύκασι) Il.:—of qualities, φθόνος ἐμφύεται ἀνθρώπῳ is implanted in him, Hdt.; οὐδεὶς χαρακτὴρ ἐμπέφυκε σώματι no mark is set by nature on the body, Eur.
to be rooted in, cling closely, ὣς ἔχετʼ ἐμπεφυυῖα (Epic for ἐμπεφυκυῖα) she hung on clinging, Il.; ἔφυν ἐν χερσί clung to his hand, Od.; ἐμφὺς ὡς βδέλλα clinging like a leech, Theocr.

div1.head: ἔμφωνος
div1.sense: loud of voice, Xen.

div1.head: ἔμψοφος
div1.sense: sounding, Anth.

div1.head: ἔμψυχος
div1.sense: having life in one, alive, living, Hdt., Attic
of a speech, animated, Luc.

div1.head: ἐμψυχόω
div1.sense: to animate, Anth.

div0.div1:
ἐν
prep;ἐνί; εἰν;εἰνί; in, among. c. dat. Lat. in. PREP. WITH DAT.: OF PLACE in, ἐν νήσῳ, ἐν Τροίῃ, etc., Hom., etc.:—elliptic, ἐν Ἀλκινόοιο (sc. οἴκῳ) Od.; εἰν Ἀΐδαο Il.; ἐν παιδοτρίβου at the school of the training master, Ar. in, upon, ἐν οὔρεσι Hom., etc. in the number of, amongst, ἐν Δαναοῖς, etc., Hom.; and with Verbs of ruling, ἄρχειν, ἀνάσσειν ἐν πολλοῖς to be first or lord among many, i. e. over them, Hom.; cf. ὁ, τό B. III. 3. in oneʼs hands, within oneʼs reach or power, Lat. penes, Hom., etc.; ἐν σοὶ γάρ ἐσμεν Soph.; ἐν τῷ θεῷ τὸ τέλος ἦν Dem. in respect of, ἐν γήρᾳ in point of age, Soph. when ἐν is used with Verbs of motion, where we use the prep. into, the construction is called pregnant, πίπτειν ἐν κονίῃσι to fall [to the dust and lie] in it; οἶνον ἔχευεν ἐν δέπαϊ Od., etc. OF THE STATE, CONDITION, POSITION, in which one is: of outward circumstances, ἐν πολέμῳ, etc., Hom.; ἐν λόγοις εἶναι to be engaged in oratory, Plat.; οἱ ἐν τοῖς πράγμασι ministers of state, Thuc.; οἱ ἐν τέλει the magistrates, Thuc. of inward states, of feeling, etc., ἐν φιλότητι Il.; ἐν φόβῳ εἶναι to be in fear, ἐν αἰσχύνῃ, etc.; also, ἐν ὀργῇ ἔχειν τινά to make him the object of oneʼs anger, Thuc.; ἐν αἰτίᾳ ἔχειν τινά to blame him, Hdt. often with a neut. adj., ἐν βραχεῖ βραχέως, Soph.; ἐν τάχει ταχέως, Soph.; ἐν ἐλαφρῷ ποιεῖσθαι Hdt.; ἐν ἴσῳ ἴσως, Thuc. OF THE INSTRUMENT, MEANS or MANNER, in or with, ἐν πυρὶ πρῆσαι Il.; ἐν ὀφθαλμοῖς or ἐν ὄμμασιν ὁρᾶν have the object in oneʼs eye, Lat. in oculis, Hom.; ἐν λιταῖς by prayers, ἐν δόλῳ by deceit, Aesch., etc. OF TIME, in, in the course of, ὥρῃ ἐν εἰαρινῇ Il.; ἐν ἡμέρᾳ, ἐν νυκτί Hdt., Attic; ἐν ᾧ (sc. χρόνῳ) , while, Hdt.:— ἐν ταῖς σπονδαῖς in the time of the truce, Xen. in, within, ἐν ἔτεσι πεντήκοντα Thuc.; ἐν τρισὶ μησί Xen. WITHOUT CASE, AS ADVERB, in the phrase ἐν δέ . . · and therein, Hom. and among them, Il. and besides, moreover, Hom., Soph. IN COMPOS.: with Verbs, the prep. retains its sense of being in or at a place, etc., c. dat., or foll. by εἰς or ἐν. with Adjs., it qualifies, as in ἔμπικρος, rather better; or expresses the possession of a quality, as in ἔναιμος, with blood in it, ἔμφωνος with a voice. ἐν becomes ἐμ- before the labials β μ π φ ψ; ἐγ- before the gutturals γ κ ξ χ; ἐλ- before λ; and in a few words ἐρ- before ρ.

div1.head: ἐναβρύνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be conceited in or of a thing, τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἐναγής
div1.sense: under a curse, excommunicate, accurst, Lat. piacularis, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐναγίζω
div1.sense: to offer sacrifice to the dead or manes, Lat. parentare, τινί Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐνάγισμα
div1.sense: an offering to the manes, Luc.

div1.head: ἐναγισμός
div1.sense: an offering to the manes, Plut.

div1.head: ἐναγκαλίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to take in oneʼs arms, Anth.

div1.head: ἐναγκυλάω
div1.sense: to fit thongs (ἀγκύλαι) to javelins, for throwing them by, Xen.

div1.head: ἔναγχος
div1.sense: just now, lately, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἐνάγω
div1.sense: to lead in or on, Lat. inducere, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; mostly c. inf., μαίνεσθαι ἐνάγει ἀνθρώπους (sc. Bacchus) Hdt.
c. acc. rei, to urge on, promote, τὸν πόλεμον Thuc.

div1.head: ἐναγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contend or fight among others, c. dat., Hdt.
γῆ εὐμενὴς ἐναγωνίζεσθαι favourable to fight in, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐναγώνιος
div1.sense: of or for a contest, Plut., Luc.:—of gods who presided over games, Simon., etc.

div1.head: ἐναέριος
div1.sense: in the air, Luc.

div1.head: ἔναιμος
div1.sense: with blood in one, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐναίρω
div1.sense: to slay in battle, generally, to kill, slay, Il., Soph.; of things, to destroy, Od.

div1.head: ἐναίσιμος
div1.sense: ominous, boding, fateful, Lat. fatalis, Od.; neut. ἐναίσιμον and -μα as adv. ominously, Hom.: —in good sense, seasonable, Lat. opportunus, of omens, Il.
of persons, righteous, Hom.
of things, fit, proper, Il.:—adv. -ως, fitly, becomingly, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐναιχμάζω
div1.sense: to fight in, Anth.

div1.head: ἐναιωρέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to float or drift about in the sea, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: ἐνάκις
div1.sense: adv. nine times, Od., Plat.

div1.head: ἐνακισχίλιοι
div1.sense: nine thousand, Ionic εἰνακισχίλιοι, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνακόσιοι
div1.sense: nine hundred, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνακούω
div1.sense: to listen to a thing, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἐναλείφω
div1.sense: to anoint with ointment, c. dat., Plat.:—Mid. to anoint oneself, Anth.

div1.head: ἐναλήθης
div1.sense: in accordance with truth: adv. -θως, probably, Luc.

div1.head: ἐναλίγκιος
div1.sense: like, resembling, c. dat., Hom.; θεοῖς ἐναλίγκιος αὐδήν like the gods in voice, Od.

div1.head: ἐνάλιος
div1.sense: in, on, of the sea, Lat. marinus, Od., Aesch., etc.; ἐν. λεώς sea men, Soph.; πόντου εἰναλία φύσις, i. e. fish, Soph.

div1.head: ἐναλλάξ
div1.sense: crosswise, Ar.
alternately, Lat. vicissim, πρήσσειν ἐν. to have alternations of fortune, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐναλλάσσω
div1.sense: to exchange, φόνον θανάτῳ ἐν., i. e. to pay for murder by death, Eur.; ἐνήλλαξεν τὴν ὕβριν diverted his assault, Soph.
Pass. to be changed, τί δʼ ἐνήλλακται τῆς ἡμερίας νὺξ ἥδε βάρος; what heavy change from the day hath this night suffered? Soph.
to have dealings with, τινι Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to leap in or upon, c. dat., Aesch., Soph.
absol. to dance, Ar.

div1.head: ἔναλλος
div1.sense: changed, contrary, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: ἐναμβλύνω
div1.sense: to deaden or discourage besides, Plut.

div1.head: ἐναμέλγω
div1.sense: to milk into, γαυλοῖς Od.

div1.head: ἐνάμιλλος
div1.sense: engaged in equal contest with, a match for, τινι Plat.

div1.head: ἔναντα
div1.sense: opposite, over against, face to face, c. gen., Il.; ἔν. προσβλέπειν νεκρόν Soph.; ἔν. ἐλθεῖν Eur.

div1.head: ἐναντίβιος
div1.sense: set against, hostile, Anth.:—as adv. face to face, against, μαχέσασθαι, πολεμίζειν Il.

div1.head: ἐναντιόομαι
div1.sense: Dep:

to set oneself against, oppose, withstand, τινι Hdt., Thuc., etc.; οὐκ ἐναντιώσομαι τὸ μὴ οὐ γεγωνεῖν I will not refuse to speak, Aesch.; τοῦτό μοι ἐναντιοῦται πράττειν this prevents me from doing, Plat.
to contradict, gainsay, Eur., Thuc., etc.
of the wind, to be adverse, Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐναντίος
div1.sense: opposite, Lat. adversus:
of Place, over against, opposite, c. dat., Hom.: fronting, face to face, Od., Eur.:—with Verbs of motion, in opposite directions, meeting, Il.
in hostile sense, opposing, facing in fight, Il., etc.; c. gen., ἐναντίοι Ἀχαιῶν Il., etc.: also c. dat., Il.:— οἱ ἐν. oneʼs adversaries, Aesch., etc.:—generally, opposed to, τινί Soph., Xen.
of qualities, acts, etc., the opposite, contrary, reverse, Aesch., Soph.; mostly c. gen., τὰ ἐν. τούτων the very reverse of these things, Hdt., etc.; also c. dat., Aesch.
in adv. usages:
neut. ἐναντίον, opposite, face to face, Od., Attic:—as prep. c. gen. in the presence of, before, Lat. coram, c. gen., Soph., Thuc., etc.
in hostile sense, against, c. gen., Il.; also c. dat., Il., Eur.
contrariwise, in Attic τοὐναντίον, on the other hand: so also neut. pl. ἐναντία Hdt., Thuc., etc.
ἐκ τοῦ ἐναντίου, over against, opposite, Lat. ex adverso, e regione, Xen., etc.: so, ἐξ ἐναντίας, Ionic -ίης, Hdt., Thuc.
regul. adv. ἐναντίως, contrariwise, c. dat., Aesch.: —also c. gen., Plat.:— ἐν. ἔχειν to be exactly opposed, Dem.

div1.head: ἐναντιότης
div1.sense: contrariety, opposition, Plat.

div1.head: ἔναντι
div1.sense: in the presence of, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: ἐναντίωμα
div1.sense: an obstacle, hindrance, Thuc., Dem.
a contradiction, discrepancy, Plat.

div1.head: ἐναντίωσις
div1.sense: a contradiction, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐναποδείκνυμαι
div1.sense: Mid. or Pass. to gain distinction among others, ἐναπεδεικνύατο (Ionic 3rd pl. imperf.) Hdt.

div1.head: ἐναποθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die in a place, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐναποθραύω
div1.sense: to break off in a wound, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: ἐναπόκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be stored up in, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: ἐναποκλάω
div1.sense: to break off short in a shield, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐναπόλλυμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to perish in a place, c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: ἐναπολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to defend oneself in, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐναπονίζω
div1.sense: to wash clean in a thing:—Mid., ἐναπονίζεσθαι τοὺς πόδας ἐν τῷ ποδανιπτῆρι to wash oneʼs feet in the foot-pan, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐναποπνέω
div1.sense: to expire in the act of doing a thing, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: ἐναποπνίγω
div1.sense: Usu. pass. -ομαι, to be suffocated in, Luc.

div1.head: ἐναποσημαίνω
div1.sense: to indicate or point out in, Plut.

div1.head: ἐναποτίνω
div1.sense: to spend on law in a place, Ar.

div1.head: ἐναποψύχω
div1.sense: to give up the ghost in a place, Hes., Anth.

div1.head: ἐνάπτω
div1.sense: to bind on or to a person, Eur.:— Pass., perf. ἐνῆμμαι, of persons, to be fitted with, clad in, c. acc., λεοντέας ἐναμμένοι (Ionic for ἐνημμ-) Hdt., Ar.
to kindle, set on fire, Ar.

div0.div1: ἔναρα , τά, the arms and trappings of a slain foe, spoils, booty, Lat. spolia, Il.

div1.head: ἐναραρίσκω
div1.sense: to fit or fasten in, Od.
ἐνάρηρα, intr., to be fitted in, Od.

div1.head: ἐναργής
div1.sense: visible, palpable, in bodily shape, properly of gods appearing in their own forms, Hom.; so of a dream or vision, Od., Hdt., etc.; ἐναργὴς ταῦρος in visible form a bull, a very bull, Soph.
manifest to the mindʼs eye, distinct, Soph., Dem.:— adv. -γῶς, manifestly, Aesch., etc.
of words, etc., distinct, manifest, Aesch., Plat., etc.:—adv., ἐναργέως λέγειν Hdt.

div1.head: Ἐνάρεες
div1.sense: prob. a Scythian word, answering to the Greek ἀνδρόγυνοι, a band who plundered the temple of Aphrodite at Ascalon, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐναρηφόρος
div1.sense: wearing the spoils, Anth.

div1.head: ἐναριθμέω
div1.sense: to reckon in or among: to reckon, account, οὐδέν as nothing, Soph.:—Mid., = ἐν ἀριθμῷ ποιεῖσθαι, to make account of, Eur.

div1.head: ἐναρίζω
div1.sense: to strip a slain foe of his arms (ἔναρα), Lat. spoliare, ἔντεα ἐν, τινά Il.:— hence, to slay in fight, and, generally, to slay, Il., Aesch.:—Pass., νὺξ ἐναριζομένα night when dying, i. e. when yielding to day, Soph.

div1.head: ἐναρίθμιος
div1.sense: in the number, to make up the number, Od.: counted among, i. e. among, c. dat., Theocr.
taken into account, Lat. in numero habitus, Il.

div1.head: ἐναρμόζω
div1.sense: to fit or fix in a thing, c. dat., Eur.
metaph. to fit, adapt, τι εἴς τι Plat.; ἐν. αὑτόν to make himself popular, Plut.:—Mid., τὰν Δωριστὶ (sc. ἁρμονίαν) ἐναρμόττεσθαι τὴν λύραν to have it tuned to the Dorian mode, Ar.
intr. to fit, suit, be convenient, Ar.:—c. dat. pers. to please, Plut.

div1.head: ἐναρμόνιος
div1.sense: in accord or harmony, Luc.

div1.head: ἐνάρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. in sacrifices, to begin the offering, by taking the barley (οὐλοχύται) from the basket (κανοῦν) , Eur.:—perf. in pass. sense, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνασκέω
div1.sense: to train or practise in athing, Plut.: Pass. with fut. mid., to be so practised, Luc.

div1.head: ἐνασπιδόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to fit oneself with a shield, Ar.

div1.head: ἐνασχημονέω
div1.sense: to behave oneself unseemly in, Plut.

div1.head: ἐναταῖος
div1.sense: on the ninth day, Thuc.

div0.div1: ἔνατος , η, ον, εἰν- Ιonic, Epic ἐννέα ninth, Lat. nonus, Il., Hes. in pl. = ἐννέα, Anth.

div1.head: ἐναυλακοφοῖτις
div1.sense: wandering in the fields, Anth.

div1.head: ἐναυλίζω
div1.sense: intr. to dwell or abide in aplace, Soph.
Dep. ἐναυλίζομαι to take up oneʼs quarters in a place during night, to take up nightquarters, bivouac, Hdt., Thuc., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἐναυλιστήριος
div1.sense: habitable, Anth.

div1.head: ἔναυλον
div1.sense: an abode, Anth.

div1.head: ἔναυλος
div1.sense: the bed of a stream, a torrent, mountain-stream, Il.
(αὐλή) in pl. the haunts of the country-gods, Hes., Eur.

div1.head: ἔναυλος2
div1.sense: on or to the flute: metaph., λόγοι ἔν. words ringing in oneʼs ears, Plat.: hence fresh in memory, Aeschin.
(αὐλή) , dwelling in dens, Eur.: in oneʼs den, Soph.

div1.head: ἐναυξάνω
div1.sense: to increase, enlarge, Xen.

div1.head: ἔναυρος
div1.sense: exposed to the air, Theophr.

div1.head: ἔναυσις
div1.sense: a kindling, Plut.

div1.head: ἔναυσμα
div1.sense: a spark, remnant, Plut.

div1.head: ἐναυχένιος
div1.sense: on the neck, Anth.

div1.head: ἐναύω
div1.sense: to kindle, ἐν. πῦρ τινι to light one a fire, give him a light, Xen.:— Mid., πῦρ ἐναύεσθαι to get a light, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐναφάπτω
div1.sense: to fasten up in a thing, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐναφίημι
div1.sense: to let drop into, v. l., Hdt.

div1.head: ἔνδαις
div1.sense: with lighted torch, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐνδαίω
div1.sense: to kindle in: Mid. to burn or glow in, Od.

div1.head: ἐνδάκνω
div1.sense: to bite into, ἐνδ. στόμια γνάθοις to take the bit between the teeth, of runaway horses, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνδακρύω
div1.sense: to weep in: ἐνδ. ὄμμασι to suffuse them with tears, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐνδάπιος
div1.sense: native of the country, Mosch.

div1.head: ἐνδατέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to divide, δὶς τοὔνόμʼ ἐνδατούμενος dividing the name of Polynices (into πολὺ νεῖκος) , Aesch.; ἐνδ. λόγους ὀνειδιστῆρας to distribute or fling about reproaches, Eur.
c. acc. objecti, to speak of in detail, i. e., in bad sense, to reproach, revile, or, in good sense, to tell of, celebrate, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνδεής
div1.sense: in need of a thing, c. gen., Hdt., Attic
absol. in need, indigent, Xen., Plat., etc.
lacking, deficient, mostly in comp., Hdt., Thuc.; τινι in a thing, Thuc.:— τὸ ἐνδεές lack, want, defect, deficiency, Thuc.
inferior to, c. gen., Xen.; τῆς δυνάμεως ἐνδεᾶ πρᾶξαι to act short of your real power, Thuc.; τούτου ἐνδεᾶ ἐφαίνετο (sc. τὰ πράγματα) their power was unequal to the purpose, Thuc.
insufficient, Thuc.:—adv., ἐνδεῶς, defectively, insufficiently, Plat.; μὴ ἐνδεῶς γνῶναι to judge not insufficiently, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔνδεια
div1.sense: want, need, lack, Thuc., etc.
defect, deficiency, Plat.
want of means, need, poverty, Lat. egestas, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ἔνδειγμα
div1.sense: a proof, token, Dem.

div1.head: ἐνδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to mark, point out, Lat. indicare, Soph., etc.
as Attic law-term, to inform against one, Plat.; so in Mid., Plut.:—in Pass., ἐνδεδειγμένος Plat.; ἐνδειχθέντα δεκάζειν being informed against for bribing, Dem.
Mid. to shew forth oneself or what is oneʼs own, Πηλείδῃ ἐνδείξομαι I will declare myself to Achilles, Il.; ἐνδείκνυσθαι τὴν γνώμην Hdt.
with a part. to shew, give proof of doing, Eur., etc.
c. acc. rei, to display, exhibit, Lat. prae se ferre, Aesch., Thuc.
ἐνδείκνυσθαί τινι to display oneself to one, make a set at him, court him, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἔνδειξις
div1.sense: a pointing out as Attic law-term, a laying information against one who discharged public functions for which he was legally disqualified, Dem., etc.
a display of good will, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἑνδεκάπηχυς
div1.sense: eleven cubits long, Il.

div1.head: ἕνδεκα
div1.sense: eleven, Lat. undecim, Hom., etc.
at Athens, οἱ ἕνδεκα, the Eleven, the Police-commissioners, who had charge of the prisons, and the punishment of criminals, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἑνδεκάς
div1.sense: the number Eleven, Plat.

div1.head: ἑνδεκαταῖος
div1.sense: on the eleventh day, Thuc.

div1.head: ἑνδέκατος
div1.sense: the eleventh, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἐνδελεχής
div1.sense: continuous, perpetual, Plat., etc. adv. -χῶς, Plat.

div1.head: ἐνδέμω
div1.sense: to wall up, Hdt.
to build in a place, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐνδεξιόομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to grasp with the right hand, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνδέξιος
div1.sense: towards the right hand, from left to right: neut. pl. as adv., θεοῖς ἐνδέξια ᾠνοχόει he filled for the gods from left to right, Il.:—contrary procedure was avoided as unlucky, hence, ἐνδέξια σήματα propitious omens, Il.
= δεξιός, on the right, Eur.
clever, expert, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἔνδετος
div1.sense: bound to, entangled in, τινι Anth.

div1.head: ἐνδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to take upon oneself, Lat. suscipere, Hdt.
to accept, admit, approve of, Lat. accipere, Hdt., Thuc.
to give ear to, believe, Hdt.: absol. to give ear, attend, Eur.
of things, to admit, allow of, Thuc., Plat.:—c. inf., οὐκ ἐνδέχεται μελετᾶσθαι does not admit of being practised, Thuc.

absol. to be possible, ἐνδέχεται Thuc.: esp. in part. ἐνδεχόμενος, η, ον, possible, ἐκ τῶν ἐνδεχομένων by all possible means, Xen.: —ἐνδέχεται impers., it admits of being, it is possible that, c. acc. et inf., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐνδεχομένως
div1.sense: as far as possible, ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἐνδέω
div1.sense: to bind in, on or to, τι ἔν τινι Od.; τί τινι Ar., etc.; so in Mid., ἐνεδήσατο δεσμῷ bound them fast, Theocr.; ἐνδησάμενος having packed it up, Ar.:—Pass., ἱρὰ ἐνδεδεμένα ἐν καλάμῃ Hdt.; ἐνδεθῆναι εἰς σῶμα or ἐν τῷ σώματι Plat.
metaph., Ζεύς με ἄτῃ ἐνέδησε entangled me in it, Il.:—Pass., ἐνδεδέσθαι ὁρκίοις, etc., Hdt.; ἐνδεδέσθαι τὴν ἀρχήν to have the government secured, Hdt.:—Mid. to bind to oneself, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνδέω
div1.sense: to be in want of a thing, c. gen., Eur., Plat.; c. inf., τίνος ἐνδέομεν μὴ οὐ χωρεῖν; what do we lack of going? Eur.:—so in Mid., Xen.; and in Pass., στρωμάτων ἐνδεηθέντες Xen.
of things, to be wanting or lacking, Hdt.:—impers. ἐνδεῖ, there is need or want, c. gen. rei, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἔνδηλος
div1.sense: visible, manifest, clear, Soph., Thuc.
of persons, manifest, discovered, known, Ar., Thuc.
adv. -λως, Sup. -ότατα, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνδημέω
div1.sense: to live in a place, Lys.

div1.head: ἔνδημος
div1.sense: dwelling in a place, a native, Hes., etc.; ἐνδημότατος the greatest "stay-at-home, " Thuc.
of or belonging to a people, national, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνδιαβάλλω
div1.sense: to calumniate in a matter, Luc.

div1.head: ἐνδιάζω
div1.sense: to pass the noon, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνδιαθρύπτομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to play the prude towards, trifle with, τινι Theocr.

div1.head: ἐνδιαιτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to live or dwell in a place, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐνδιατάσσω
div1.sense: to draw an army up in, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνδιατρίβω
div1.sense: to spend or consume in doing, χρόνον Ar., Thuc.
absol. (sub. χρόνον) , to spend time in a place, Dem.
to waste time by staying in a place, linger there, Thuc., Plat.
to continue in the practice of a thing ἔν τινι Xen.: absol. to dwell upon a point (in speaking), Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐνδιατριπτέος
div1.sense: Verbal Adj. of ἐνδιατρίβω one must dwell upon, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἐνδιάω
div1.sense: to stay in the open air; generally, to linger in or haunt a place, c. dat., Anth.:—in Mid., Hhymn.
trans., ποιμένες μῆλα ἐνδιάασκον shepherds were driving their sheep afield, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐνδιδύσκω
div1.sense: to put on another, τινά τι NTest.:—Mid. to put on oneself, NTest.

div1.head: ἐνδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give in:
to give into oneʼs hands, give up to, τινά or τί τινι Eur., etc.; a city, esp. by treachery, Thuc., Xen.
like Lat. praebere, to give, lend, afford, ἐνδιδόναι τινὶ χέρα to lend him a hand, Eur.; ἐνδ. λαβήν τινι to give one a handle, Ar.:— to cause, excite, Thuc.
to shew, exhibit, Hdt., Eur., etc.
to allow, grant, concede, Eur., Thuc.
intr. to give in, allow, permit, Hdt.: to give in, give way, Thuc.:— ἐνδ. τινι to yield to, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνδιημερεύω
div1.sense: to pass the day in, Theophr.

div1.head: ἐνδίημι
div1.sense: to chase, pursue, 3rd pl. imperf. ἐνδίεσαν, Epic for ἐνεδίεσαν, Il.

div1.head: ἔνδικος
div1.sense: of things, according to right, right, just, legitimate, Trag.:— τὸ μὴ ʼνδικον τὸ ἄδικον, Soph.; μὴ λέγων γε τοὔνδικον not speaking truth, Soph.
of persons, righteous, just, upright, Aesch., etc.; τίς ἐνδικώτερος; who has better right or more reason? Aesch.
adv. -κως, right, with justice, fairly, Aesch.
truly, indeed, Eur.
justly, naturally, as one has a right to expect, Trag.

div1.head: ἔνδινα
div1.sense: the entrails, or rather the body enclosed in armour, Il.

div1.head: ἐνδινέω
div1.sense: to revolve, go about, ἐνδινεῦντι, Doric for ἐνδινοῦσι, Theocr.

div1.head: ἔνδιος
div1.sense: cf. Lat. sub divo, at midday, at noon, Hom., Theocr.
ἔνδιος, in the open air, Anth.: neut. ἔνδιον, an abode, Anth.

div1.head: ἐνδίφριος
div1.sense: sitting on the same seat with another, c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: ἔνδοθεν
div1.sense: adv. from within, Lat. intrinsecus, Od., Trag., etc.:—c. gen., ἔνδοθεν στέγης from inside the tent, Soph.
like οἴκοθεν, of oneself, by oneʼs own doing, Aesch.
within, c. gen., Il., Hes.
absol., Hdt.; οἱ ἔνδοθεν the domestics, Ar.; or the people inside the city, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔνδοθι
div1.sense: adv. within, at home, Lat. intus, Hom.
c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἐνδοιάζω
div1.sense: to be in doubt, at a loss how to do a thing, c. inf., Thuc.: absol., οἱ ἐνδοιάζοντες the waverers, Thuc.:—Pass. to be matter of doubt, ἐνδοιασθῆναι Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνδοιάσιμος
div1.sense: doubtful, Luc.

div1.head: ἐνδοιαστός
div1.sense: doubtful, ambiguous: adv. -τῶς, doubtfully, προθύμως Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἔνδοι
div1.etym: Aeolic and Doric for ἔνδοθι, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐνδόμησις
div1.sense: structure, NTest.

div1.head: ἐνδόμυχος
div1.sense: in the inmost part of a dwelling, lurking within, Soph.

div1.head: ἔνδον
div1.sense: in, within, in the house, at home, Lat. intus, Hom., etc.; τἄνδον as adv. in oneʼs heart, Eur.:—οἱ ἔνδον those of the house, the family, Soph.: τὰ ἔνδον family matters, Soph.
c. gen., Διὸς ἔνδον in the house of Zeus, Il.; σκηνῆς ἔνδον Soph.; φρενῶν ἔνδον in oneʼs senses, Eur.

div1.head: ἔνδοξος
div1.sense: held in esteem or honour, of high repute, Xen., Plat.
of things, notable, Aeschin.: —adv. -ξως, hence Sup., ἐνδοξότατα Dem.

div1.head: ἐνδοτέρω
div1.sense: quite within, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνδουπέω
div1.sense: to fall in with a heavy sound, Od.

div1.head: ἐνδρομίς
div1.sense: a high shoe, worn by Artemis, Anth.
a thick wrapper worn by runners, after exercise, Juven.

div1.head: ἔνδροσος
div1.sense: bedewed, Aesch.

div1.head: ἔνδρυον
div1.sense: the oaken peg or pin by which the yoke is fixed to the pole (ἱστοβοεύς) , Hes.

div1.head: ἐνδυκέως
div1.sense: adv. thoughtfully, carefully, sedulously, Hom.

div1.head: ἔνδυμα
div1.sense: a garment, NTest., Plut.

div1.head: ἐνδυναμόω
div1.sense: to strengthen, NTest.

div1.head: ἐνδυναστεύω
div1.sense: to exercise dominion in or among people, c. dat., Aesch.
to procure by oneʼs authority, Xen.

div1.head: ἔνδυσις
div1.sense: a putting on, NTest.

div1.head: ἐνδυστυχέω
div1.sense: to be unlucky in or with, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: ἐνδυτήρ
div1.sense: for putting on, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνδυτός
div1.sense: put on, Aesch., Eur.
ἔνδυτον (sc. ἔσθημα) , a garment, dress, Eur.:—metaph., ἐνδ. σαρκός, i. e. oneʼs skin, Eur.
clad in, covered with, στέμμασιν Eur.

div1.head: ἐνδύω
div1.sense: c. acc., to go into,
of clothes, to put on, Lat. induere sibi, ἔνδυνε χιτῶνα Il.; πέπλον Soph.:—so in Mid., Il., etc.:—perf. ἐνδέδυκα, to wear κιθῶνας Hdt.:—metaph. to put on, assume the person of . . , NTest.
to enter, to press into, c. acc., Il., etc.:—also, ἐνδ. εἰς . . , Thuc., etc.:—also c. dat., Xen.:—absol. to enter, Hdt.
Causal in pres. ἐνδύω, fut. -δύσω, aor1 -έδυσαLat. induere alicui, to put on another, to clothe in, c. dupl. acc., Xen.
to clothe, τινά Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνέδρα
div1.sense: a sitting in: a lying in wait, ambush, Thuc., Xen.
the men laid in ambush, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνεδρεύω
div1.sense: to lie in wait for, Lat. insidiari, τινά Dem.: —Pass. to be caught in an ambush, to be ensnared, Xen.
absol. to lay or set an ambush, Thuc., Xen.; so in Mid., Xen.:—Pass. to lie in ambush, Xen.

div1.head: ἔνεδρος
div1.sense: an inmate, inhabitant, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνέζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have oneʼs abode in a place, c. acc., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐνεῖδον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, ἐνοράω being used instead
div1.sense: to observe something in a person, τι ἔν τινι Thuc.; τί τινι Xen.: absol. to observe, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνειδοφορέω
div1.sense: of a sculptor, to work into shape, Anth.

div1.head: ἐνειλέω
div1.sense: to wrap in: metaph.in Pass. to be engaged in or with, τοῖς πολεμίοις Plut.
to wrap up in a thing, c. dat., Thuc.

div1.head: ἔνειμι
div1.sense: to be in a place, c. dat., Hom., etc.: c. dat. pl. to be among, Hdt.
absol. to be there, be in abundance, Od., etc.; σίτου οὐκ ἐνόντος as there was no corn there, Thuc.; ἱερῶν τῶν ἐνόντων of the temples that were in the place, Thuc.
to be possible, Trag., etc.
impers. c. dat. pers. et inf. it is in oneʼs power, one may or can, Soph., etc.
part. neut. ἐνόν absol. since it was in them, was possible, Luc.
τὰ ἐνόντα all things possible, Dem.

div1.head: ἐνείρω
div1.sense: to string on a thing, Pass., Hdt.

div1.head: ἕνεκα
div1.sense: prep. with gen., mostly after its case, Il., etc.: on account of, for the sake of, because of, for, Lat. gratia, Il., etc.
as far as regards, as for, ἐμοῦ γε ἕνεκα as far as depends on me, Ar.; εἵνεκέν γε χρημάτων Hdt., etc.
pleon., ἀμφὶ σοὔνεκα Soph.; ὅσον ἀπὸ βοῆς ἕνεκα as far as shouting went, Thuc.
as Conjunct., for οὕνεκα, because, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐνελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive in or into, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: ἐνελίσσω
div1.sense: to roll up in:—Mid. to wrap oneself in, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνεμέω
div1.sense: to vomit in or into, εἴς τι Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνενηκονταετής
div1.sense: ninety years old, Luc.

div1.head: ἐνεορτάζω
div1.sense: to keep holiday in, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνενήκοντα
div1.sense: indecl. ninety, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἐνεός
div1.sense: dumb, deaf and dumb, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνεπάγομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to make an irruption among, Aesop.

div1.head: ἐνεπιορκέω
div1.sense: to forswear oneself by a god, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐνεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make or produce in, c. dat., Xen., etc.:—aor1 ἐνειργάσθην in pass. sense, to be placed in, Xen.
to work for hire in a place, Hdt.; ἐνεργ. τῇ οὐσίᾳ to trade with the property, Dem.

div1.head: ἐνέπω
div1.sense: to tell, tell of, relate, describe, Hom., Trag.:—absol. to tell news or tales, Od.
simply to speak, Hes., Trag.
c. acc. et inf. to bid one do so and so, Soph.
to call so and so, ἐνν. τινὰ δοῦλον Eur.
= προσεννέπω, to address, τινά Soph.

div1.head: ἐνέργεια
div1.sense: action, operation, energy, Arist.

div1.head: ἐνεργέω
div1.sense: to be in action, to operate, Arist.; so in Mid., NTest.

div1.head: ἐνεργής
div1.sense: of land, productive, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνεργολαβέω
div1.sense: to make profit of a thing, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐνεργός
div1.sense: at work, working, active, busy, Hdt., etc.: of soldiers, ships, effective, fit for service, Thuc., Xen.
of land, in work, productive, opp. to ἀργός, Xen.; ἐν. χρήματα capital which brings in a return, Dem.
adv. ἐνεργῶς with activity, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνερείδω
div1.sense: to thrust in, fix in, τί τινι Od.:— Mid., ἐνερεισάμενος πέτρᾳ γόνυ having planted his own knee on the rock, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐνερεύγομαι
div1.sense: to belch on one, c. dat., Ar.

div1.head: ἐνερευθής
div1.sense: somewhat ruddy, Luc.

div1.head: ἔνερθε
div1.sense: adv., from beneath, up from below, Il., Aesch., Eur.
without sense of motion, beneath, below, Hom.; οἱ ἔνερθε θεοί the gods below, Lat. dii inferi, Il.
as prep. with gen. beneath, below, Hom., Trag.
subject to, in the power of, Soph.

div1.head: ἔνεροι
div1.sense: Lat. inferi, those below, those beneath the earth, Il., Hes., Aesch.

div1.head: ἔνερσις
div1.sense: a fitting in, fastening, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνέρτερος
div1.sense: lower, of the world below, Il., Aesch.: c. gen. below, Il. Cf. νέρτερος.

div1.head: ἐνεσία
div1.sense: a suggestion, κείνης ἐννεσίῃσι (Epic dat. pl.) at her suggestion, Il.

div1.head: ἐνετή
div1.sense: a pin, brooch, Il.

div1.head: ἐνευδαιμονέω
div1.sense: to be happy in oneʼs life, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνευδοκιμέω
div1.sense: to gain glory in anotherʼs ill fortune, Dem.

div1.head: ἐνεύδω
div1.sense: to sleep in or on a thing, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: ἐνευλογέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be blessed in one, c. dat., NTest.

div1.head: ἐνεύναιος
div1.sense: on which one sleeps, for sleeping on, Od.; ἐνεύναια, bed-furniture, Od.

div1.head: ἐνεχυράζω
div1.sense: to take a pledge from one, τινός Lex ap. Dem.
c. acc. rei, to take in pledge, Dem., Aeschin.:—Pass. to have oneʼs goods seized for debt, Ar.:—Mid. to have security given one, take it for oneself, Ar.

div1.head: ἐνεχυρασία
div1.sense: a taking in pledge, a security, pledge, Plat.

div1.head: ἐνέχυρον
div1.sense: a pledge, surety, security, Hdt., Xen.; ἐν. τιθέναι τι to make a thing a pledge, put it in pawn, Ar.

div1.head: ἐνέχω
div1.sense: to hold within, χόλον ἐνέχειν τινί to lay up, cherish inward wrath at one, Hdt.
Pass., with fut. and aor. mid., to be held, caught, entangled in a thing, c. dat., Hdt., Xen.: metaph., ἐνέχεσθαι ἀπορίῃσιν Hdt.; ἐν κακῷ Hdt.; ἐν θωύματι ἐνέσχετο was seized with wonder, Hdt.
to be obnoxious, liable or subject to, ζημίᾳ, αἰτίᾳ Plat., etc.
intr. to enter in, pierce, εἴς τι Xen.
to press upon, be urgent against, τινί NTest.

div1.head: ἐνζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to yoke in, bind, involve in misfortune, Aesch.
to bind fast, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνηβητήριον
div1.sense: a place of amusement, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνηείη
div1.sense: kindness, gentleness, Il.

div1.head: ἐνηής
div1.sense: kind, gentle, Hom.

div1.head: ἐνήλατον
div1.sense: anything driven in: as Subst., ἐνήλατα (sc. ξύλα) , τά, the rounds of a ladder, which are fixed in the sides, Eur.
ἀξόνων ἐνήλατα the pins driven into the axle, linchpins, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνήλικος
div1.sense: of age, in the prime of manhood, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνῆμαι
div1.sense: to be seated in, Od.

div1.head: ἐνήνοθε
div1.etym: ἐνήνοθε, 3rd sg. perf. without any pres. ἐνέθω in use: only found in compds.
div1.sense: ἐπενήνοθε, of Thersitesʼ head, ψεδνὴ ἐπ. λάχνη a thin coat of downy hair grew thereon, Il.; of a cloak, οὐλὴ ἐπενήνοθε λάχνη a thick pile was on it, Il.; c. acc., of ambrosial unguent, οἷα θεοὺς ἐπενήνοθε such as is on the gods, Od.
κατενήνοθε, to be over, lie upon, Hes., Hom.

div1.head: ἐνήρης
div1.sense: with oars, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνθάδε
div1.sense: of Place, thither, hither, Lat. illuc, huc, Od., etc.
in Attic like ἔνθα, here or there, Lat. hic, Ar., etc.; οἱ ἐνθάδε those here, opp. to οἱ κάτω, Soph.; also the people of this country, Soph.
of circumstances, in this case or state, Xen.; so, ἐνθάδʼ ἥκων having come to this point, Soph.; c. gen., ἐνθάδε τοῦ πάθους at this stage of my suffering, Soph.
of Time, here, now, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: ἐνθαδί
div1.sense: Attic strengthd. for ἐνθάδε, Ar.

div1.head: ἐνθακέω
div1.sense: to sit in or on a thing, c. dat., Soph.

div1.head: ἐνθάκησις
div1.sense: a sitting in, ἡλίου ἐνθ. a seat in the sun, Soph.

div1.head: ἔνθαπερ
div1.sense: there where, where, stronger form of ἔνθα, Il., etc.: whither, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνθάπτω
div1.sense: to bury in a place: aor2 pass. ἐνετάφην Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐνθεάζω
div1.sense: to be inspired, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔνθα
div1.sense: adv.:
Demonstr.
of Place, there, Lat. ibi, Hom., etc.:—also with Verbs of motion, thither, Lat. illuc, Hom.; ἔνθα καὶ ἔνθα here and there, hither and thither, Lat. hic illic, huc illuc, Hom.
of Time, thereupon, then, just then, Hom., etc.
Relat.,
of Place, where, Lat. ubi, Il., etc.;c. gen., γαίας ἔνθα in that spot of earth in which, Soph.; ἔνθα πημάτων κυρῶ at what point of misery I am, Eur.: —with Verbs of motion, whither, Lat. quo, Soph.
of Time, when, Xen.; ἔστιν ἔνθα, Lat. est ubi, sometimes, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνθένδε
div1.sense: hence, from this quarter, Lat. hinc, Hom., Attic; ἐνθένδʼ αὐτόθεν from this very city, Ar.
of Time or Consequence, from that time, Thuc.; ἐνθένδε or τοὐνθένδε, thereafter, Soph., Eur.; τἀνθένδε what followed, the event, Eur.

div1.head: ἔνθεν
div1.sense: adv.:
Demonstr.,

of Place, Lat. inde, thence, Hom.; ἔνθεν μὲν . . , ἑτέρωθι δέ .. , on the one side and the other, Od.; ἔνθεν καὶ ἔνθεν on this side and on that, Lat. hinc illinc, Hdt., etc.:— c. gen., ἔνθεν καὶ ἔνθεν τῶν τροχῶν on both sides of the wheels, Xen.
of Time, thereupon, thereafter, Il., Aesch.
of occasion, thence, from that point, Od.
Relat., for ὅθεν,
of Place, Lat. unde, whence, from which, Od., Soph.
of occasion, whence, like Lat. unde, Aesch., Eur. Hence

div1.head: ἔνθεος
div1.sense: full of the god, inspired, possessed, Trag., Xen.:—c. gen. rei, ἔνθεος τέχνης gifted of heaven with prophetic art, Aesch.
of divine frenzy, inspired by the god, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐνθερμαίνω
div1.sense: to heat:—Pass., ἐντεθέρμανται πόθῳ is heated by passion, Soph.

div1.head: ἔνθεσις
div1.sense: a putting in: also a piece put in, a mouthful, Ar.

div1.head: ἔνθεσμος
div1.sense: lawful, like ἔννομος, Plut.

div1.head: ἔνθετος
div1.sense: put in, implanted, Theogn.

div1.head: ἔνθηρος
div1.sense: full of wild beasts, infested by them, Eur.
metaph. savage, wild, rough, Aesch.: untended, undressed, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die in a place, Soph., Eur.
of the hand, to grow torpid in, τινί Eur.

div1.head: ἐνθουσιάζω
div1.sense: to be inspired or possessed by the god, be rapt, be in ecstasy, Xen., Plat.:—c. dat., ἐνθουσιᾶν κακοῖς Eur.

div1.head: ἐνθουσιαστικός
div1.sense: inspired, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἐνθουσιώδης
div1.sense: possessed, Plut.

div1.head: ἔνθρυπτος
div1.sense: crumbled and put into liquid: τὰ ἔνθρυπτα sops, Dem.

div1.head: ἐνθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to leap in, on, or among, c. dat., Il., Eur.:— λὰξ ἔνθορεν ἰσχίῳ leapt with his feet against his, Od.

div1.head: ἐνθυμέομαι
div1.sense: to lay to heart, consider well, reflect on, ponder, Aesch., Thuc., etc.
c. gen., ἐνθυμεῖσθαί τινος to think much or deeply of a thing, Thuc., Xen.
foll. by a relative, as by ὅτι, to consider that, Ar., etc.
with part., οὐκ ἐντεθύμηται ἐπαιρόμενος was not conscious that he was becoming excited, Thuc.
to take to heart, be hurt or angry at, τι Aesch., Dem.
to think out a thing, form a plan, Thuc.
to infer, conclude, Dem.

div1.head: ἐνθύμημα
div1.sense: a thought, piece of reasoning, argument, Soph., Aeschin.
an invention, device, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνθύμησις
div1.sense: consideration, esteem, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνθυμητέος
div1.sense: one must consider, Dem.

div1.head: ἐνθυμία
div1.sense: a scruple, misgiving, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνθύμιος
div1.sense: taken to heart, μή σοι ἐνθύμιος ἔστω take not much thought for him, Od.; ἐνθύμιόν οἱ ἐγένετο he had trouble of heart, Hdt.; τί δʼ ἐστί σοι τοῦτʼ ἐνθύμιον; what is ʼt that weighs upon thy heart? Soph.; ἐνθύμιον ποιεῖσθαί τι to have a scruple about it, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνθυμιστός
div1.sense: taken to heart, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνθωρακίζω
div1.sense: to arm, equip with armour: part. perf. pass. ἐντεθωρακισμένος mailed, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνιαύσιος
div1.sense: of a year, one year old, σῦς Od., Dem., etc.
yearly, annual, year by year, Hdt.:—neut. pl. as adv., Hes.
for a year, lasting a year, Eur., Thuc.; κἀνιαύσιος βεβώς gone, absent for a year, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνιαυτός
div1.sense: any long period of time, a cycle, period, περιπλομένων ἐνιαυτῶν as times rolled on, Od.; ἐτῶν ἐνιαυτούς Ar.
= ἔτος, a year, Hom., etc.; ἐνιαυτόν during a year, Od.; τοῦ ἐνιαυτοῦ every year, Xen.; εἰς ἐνιαυτόν for a year, Il.;— κατʼ ἐνιαυτόν for a year, Thuc.; or every year, Attic

div1.head: ἐνιαύω
div1.sense: to sleep among others, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: ἐνιαχῆ
div1.sense: in some places, Hdt.; c. gen. loci, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνιαχοῦ
div1.sense: in some places, here and there, now and then, Plat.

div1.head: ἐνιδρόω
div1.sense: to sweat in, labour hard in, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνιδρύω
div1.sense: to set in a place:—Mid. to found or build for oneself, Hdt.:—Pass. to be placed or settled in a place, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνίζω
div1.sense: to sit in or on a seat, c. acc., Eur.; c. dat., Plat.

div1.head: ἐνίημι
div1.sense: to send in or into, Hom.
to put in, implant, inspire, c. acc. rei et dat. pers., καί οἱ θάρσος ἐνὶ στήθεσσιν ἐνῆκε Il.; ἐνεὶς λύσσαν Eur.
reversely, c. acc. pers. et dat. rei, to plunge into, τὸν Ζεὺς ἐνέηκε πόνοισι Il.
generally, to throw in or upon, c. dat., Hom.:—of ships, to launch them into the sea, Od.:— metaph. to incite one to do a thing, c. inf., Mosch.
to send into the assembly, employ, Thuc.
to inject poison, Xen.
intr. to press on, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνικλάω
div1.sense: to break in, break off: metaph., ἐνικλᾶν ὅττι νοήσω to frustrate what I devise, Il.

div1.head: ἔνιοι
div1.sense: some, Lat. aliqui, = ἔστιν οἵ, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἐνίοτε
div1.sense: for ἔνι ὅτε ἔστιν ὅτε, sometimes, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἐνιπή
div1.sense: a rebuke, reproof; also abuse, contumely, Hom.

div1.head: ἐνιππεύω
div1.sense: to ride in, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνίπτω
div1.sense: to reprove, upbraid, Lat. objurgo, Hom.

div1.head: ἐνίσσω
div1.sense: to attack, reproach, Hom.; Epic inf. ἐνισσέμεν Il.:—Pass., ἐνισσόμενος misused, Il.

div1.head: ἐνίστημι
div1.sense: Causal in pres., fut. and aor1 act., and in aor1 mid.:— to put, set, place in, ἐν λίθοις Xen.; ἐς τὰς χώρας Hdt.
aor1 mid. to begin, Dem.
Pass., with aor2 perf., and plup. act.:— to be set in, to stand in a place, c. dat., Eur.; ἐν τῷ νηῷ Hdt.
to be appointed, βασιλεὺς ἐνίστασθαι Hdt.

to be upon, to threaten, Lat. imminere, c. dat. pers., Hdt.:—absol. to be at hand, begin, arise, Ar., Dem.:—of time, ὁ ἐνεστὼς πόλεμος the present war, Aeschin.; τὰ ἐνεστηκότα πράγματα present circumstances, Xen.
to stand in the way, resist, τινι Thuc.:—absol. to stand in the way, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνίσχω
div1.sense: Mid., ἐνίσχεσθαι τὴν φωνήν to keep in oneʼs voice, Plut.:—Pass. to be held fast, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐνναετηρίς
div1.sense: a period of nine years, Plat.

div1.head: ἐνναέτηρος
div1.sense: nine years old, Hes.

div1.head: ἐνναετήρ
div1.sense: an inmate, inhabitant, Anth.

div1.head: ἐνναέτης
div1.sense: nine years old, Theocr.:—neut. ἐννάετες, as adv. for nine years, Hes.:—fem. ἐνναέτις

div1.head: ἐνναέτης
div1.sense: an inhabitant, Anth.

div1.head: ἐνναίω
div1.sense: to dwell in a place, c. dat., Eur.; ἐνν. ἐκεῖ Soph.:—c. acc. loci, to inhabit, Mosch.

div1.head: ἐννάκις
div1.sense: nine times, Anth.

div1.head: ἐνναυπηγέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to have ships built in it, of a place, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐννεάβοιος
div1.sense: worth nine beeves, Il.

div1.head: ἐννεακαιδεκάμηνος
div1.sense: nineteen months old, Anth.

div1.head: ἐννεακαίδεκα
div1.sense: indecl. nineteen, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἐννεακαιδεκέτης
div1.sense: nineteen years old, Anth.

div1.head: ἐννεάκρουνος
div1.sense: with nine springs, name of a well at Athens, also called Καλλιρρόη, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐννεάλινος
div1.sense: of nine threads, Xen.

div1.head: ἐννεάμηνος
div1.sense: of or in nine months, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐννέα
div1.sense: indecl. nine, Lat. novem, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἐννεάπηχυς
div1.sense: nine cubits broad, or long , Il.

div1.head: ἐννεάς
div1.sense: a body of nine, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐννεάχιλοι
div1.sense: Epic for ἐνάκις χίλιοι nine thousand, Il.

div1.head: ἐννεόργυιος
div1.sense: nine fathoms long, Od.

div1.head: ἐννεοσσεύω
