div1.sense: to hatch young in a place, Ar.
c. acc. to hatch as in a nest, Plat.

div1.head: ἐννεύω
div1.sense: to make signs to, to ask by signs, NTest.

div1.head: ἐννέωρος
div1.sense: of or for nine years, Hom.

div1.head: ἐννῆμαρ
div1.sense: Epic adv. for nine days, Il.

div1.head: ἐννοέω
div1.sense: to have in oneʼs thoughts, to think, consider, reflect, Hdt., Plat.; ἐνν. μή . . , to be anxious lest . . , Xen.
c. acc. to think or reflect upon, consider, Hdt., Soph.; ἐννοεῖν περί τινος Eur.
c. gen. to have thought of a thing, Eur., Xen.
to understand, Trag.
to intend to do, c. inf., Hdt., Soph.
to think of, invent, Lat. excogitare, Soph., Xen.
to have in oneʼs mind, to conceive, form a notion of, τι Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἔννοια
div1.sense: a thought in the mind, notion, conception, Plat.
a thought, intent, design, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἔννομος
div1.sense: within the law, lawful, legal, Trag., etc.; ἔννομα πάσχειν to suffer lawful punishment, Thuc.
of persons, keeping within the law, upright, Aesch., etc.:— subject to law, NTest.

div1.head: Ἐννοσίγαιος
div1.sense: the Earth-shaker, name of Poseidon, Hom.

div1.head: ἔννοος
div1.sense: thoughtful, intelligent, sensible, Aesch., etc.; ἔννους γίγνομαι I come to my senses, Eur.

div1.head: ἐννυχεύω
div1.sense: to sleep in or on a place, Soph.

div1.head: ἕννυμι
div1.etym: The Root was !ϝες, cf. Lat. vestio
div1.sense: to put clothes on another, c. dupl. acc., κεῖνός σε χλαῖνάν τε χιτῶνά τε ἕσσει he will clothe thee in cloak and frock, Od.

Mid. and Pass., c. acc. rei, to clothe oneself in, to be clad in, put on, to wear, Hom.; ἀσπίδας ἑσσάμενοι, of tall shields which covered the whole person, Il.; [ξυστὰ εἱμένα χαλκῶι shafts clad with brass, Il.; and by a strong metaph., λάϊνον ἕσσο χιτῶνα thou hadst been clad in coat of stone, i. e. stoned by the people, Il.:—metaph. also, φρεσὶ εἱμένοι ἀλκήν Il.

div1.head: ἐννύχιος
div1.sense: in the night, by night, nightly, Lat. nocturnus, Hom., Soph.:— ἐννύχιοι dwellers in the realms of Night, the dead, Soph.

div1.head: ἔννυχος
div1.sense: = ἐννύχιος (ῠ), Il., Aesch.:—adv. ἔννυχον or -χα, NTest.
epith. of Hades, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνόδιος
div1.sense: in or on the way, by the way-side, Il., Aesch.:—epith. of gods, who had their statues by the way-side, Lat. triviales, as of Hecate, Soph., Eur.; Ἐνοδία, Lat. Trivia, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνοικέω
div1.sense: to dwell in a place, c. dat., Eur.; ἐν τόπῳ Xen.; Θυρέαν ἔδοσαν ἐνοικεῖν gave it them to dwell in, Thuc.
c. acc. loci, to inhabit, Hdt., Soph., etc.; οἱ ἐνοικοῦντες the inhabitants, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐνοίκησις
div1.sense: a dwelling in a place, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνοικίζω
div1.sense: to settle in a place:—Pass. to be settled in a place, to take up oneʼs abode there, Hdt.; so in Mid., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνοίκιος
div1.sense: in the house, keeping at home, ἐν. ὄρνις a dunghill cock, Aesch.
as Subst., ἐνοίκιον, ου, τό, house-rent, Dem., Anth.

div1.head: ἐνοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build in a place, Thuc.:—Mid., ἐν. τεῖχος to build themselves a fort there, Thuc.
to build up, block up, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔνοικος
div1.sense: in-dwelling: an inhabitant, Trag., Thuc., etc.
pass. dwelt in, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνοικουρέω
div1.sense: to keep house, dwell in a place, Luc.

div1.head: ἐνοινοχοέω
div1.sense: to pour in wine, Hom.

div1.head: ἐνολισθάνω
div1.sense: to fall in, of the ground, Plut.: to slip and fall, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνομιλέω
div1.sense: to be well acquainted with a thing, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: ἐνομόργνυμαι
div1.sense: Mid. to impress, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνοπή
div1.sense: a crying, screaming, as of birds, Il.: a war-cry, Il.
generally, a voice, Od., Eur.
of things, a sound, Il., Eur.

div1.head: ἐνόπλιος
div1.sense: ἐνόπλιος (sc. ῥυθμός), ὁ a war-tune, march, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ἔνοπλος
div1.sense: in arms, armed, Soph., Eur.
with armed men within, of the Trojan horse, Eur.

div1.head: ἔνοπτρον
div1.sense: a mirror, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνοράω
div1.sense: to see, remark, observe something in a person or thing, τί τινι Thuc., etc.; τι ἔν τινι Hdt., etc.; c. acc. et part. fut., ἐνεώρα τιμωρίην ἐσομένην he saw that vengeance would come, Hdt.
to look at or upon, Xen.

div1.head: ἔνορκος
div1.sense: bound by oath, Lat. juratus, Soph., Thuc.: c. dat. pers., Lat. addictus, Soph.
that whereto one is sworn, Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐνορμίζω
div1.sense: to bring a ship to harbour:—Pass. to come to anchor, Theogn.

div1.head: ἐνορμίτης
div1.sense: in harbour, Anth.

div1.head: ἐνόρνυμι
div1.sense: to arouse, stir up in a person, Il.:—Pass. to arise in or among, ἐνῶρτο γέλως θεοῖσιν Il.

div1.head: ἐνορούω
div1.sense: to leap in or upon another, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: ἐνόρχης
div1.sense: a he-goat, Theocr.

div1.head: ἔνορχος
div1.sense: uncastrated, entire, ἔνορχα μῆλα rams, Il.

div1.head: ἔνοσις
div1.sense: a shaking, quake, Hes., Eur.
div1.etym: From an obsol. Root *ἐνόθω to shake.

div1.head: Ἐνοσίχθων
div1.sense: Earth-shaker, of Poseidon, Hom.

div1.head: ἔνος
div1.sense: = the Lat. annus, a year, hence ἐνιαυτός, cf. ἄφ-ενος, Lat. bi-ennis, etc.

div1.head: ἕνος
div1.sense: the day after to-morrow, Lat. perendie, only in oblique cases of fem., gen. ἔνης Epic ἔννηφι (sub. ἡμέρας) Hes.; Doric ἔνας Theocr.; εἰς ἕνην Ar.

div1.head: ἕνος
div1.sense: belonging to the former of two periods, last yearʼs, ἕναι ἀρχαί last yearʼs magistrates, Dem.:— dat. ἕνῃ as adv., long ago, Ar.
ἕνη καὶ νέα (sc. ἡμέρα) , the old and new day, i. e. the last day of the month, which consisted of two halves, one belonging to the old, the other to the new moon, Ar.

div1.head: ἐνουράνιος
div1.sense: in heaven, heavenly, Anth.

div1.head: ἐνοχλέω
div1.sense: to trouble, disquiet, annoy, τινά Plat., Xen., etc.:—Pass. to be troubled or annoyed, Xen.
c. dat. to give trouble or annoyance to, Xen., Dem., etc.
absol. to be a nuisance, Ar.

div1.head: ἔνοχος
div1.sense: held in, i. e. liable to, subject to, c. dat., Plat.; ἔν. θανάτου (sc. ζημίᾳ) liable to the penalty of death, NTest.

div1.head: ἐνράπτω
div1.sense: to sew up in, τι εἴς τι; so Mid., Hdt.: —Pass. to be sewed up in, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: ἐνριγόω
div1.sense: to shiver or freeze in a garment, Ar.

div1.head: ἐνσείω
div1.sense: to shake in or at, Soph.; κέλαδον ἐνσ. πώλοις to drive a sound into their ears, Soph.
c. acc. pers. to drive into, ἐνσ. τινὰ ἀγρίαις ὁδοῖς Soph.

div1.head: ἐνσημαίνω
div1.sense: Mid. to intimate, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνσκέλλω
div1.sense: to be dry, withered, Anth.

div1.head: ἐνσκευάζω
div1.sense: to get ready, prepare, Ar.
to dress in a garment, Plut.; Ἡρακλέα ʼνεσκεύασα dressed you up as Hercules, Ar.:—Mid. to dress oneself up in other clothes, Ar.: to arm oneself, Xen.: —Pass to be equipped, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνσκήπτω
div1.sense: to hurl, dart in or upon, τί τινι Hdt.
intr. to fall in or on, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἐνσκίμπτω
div1.sense: to let fall upon, οὔδει ἐνισκίμψαντε καρήατα, of horses hanging their heads in grief for their masterʼs loss, Il.:—Pass. to stick in the ground, Il.

div1.head: ἐνσκιρρόω
div1.sense: to harden:—Pass. to become inveterate, of diseases, Xen.

div1.head: ἔνσοφος
div1.sense: wise in a thing, Anth.

div1.head: ἔνσπονδος
div1.sense: included in a truce or treaty, Thuc.; ἔνσπ. τινί in alliance with one, Eur., Thuc.; and as Subst. an ally, Thuc.
under truce or safe-conduct, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνστάζω
div1.sense: to drop in or into a thing, c. dat., Ar.: —Pass. to be instilled into, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνσταλάζω
div1.etym: fut. ξω, ἐνστάζω, εἴς τι, Ar.

div1.head: ἔνστασις
div1.sense: a beginning, plan, management, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐνστάτης
div1.sense: an adversary, Soph.

div1.head: ἐνστέλλω
div1.sense: to dress in:—Pass., στολὴν ἐνεσταλμένος clad in a dress, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνστηρίζω
div1.sense: to fix in:—Pass., γαίῃ ἐνεστήρικτο it stuck fast in earth, Il.

div1.head: ἐνστρατοπεδεύω
div1.sense: Mid. to encamp in, Hdt.;—so in Act., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐνστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn inPass. to turn or move in a place, c. dat., Il.
c. acc. loci, σηκοὺς ἐνστρέφειν to visit them, Eur.

div1.head: ἐνσφραγίζω
div1.sense: to impress on a thing, c. dat., Anth.

div1.head: ἐντανύω
div1.sense: to stretch or strain tight with cords or straps, Hom.; ἐντανύσας τὸν θρόνον ἱμᾶσιν to cover it with stretched straps, Hdt.
to stretch a cord tight, of the bow-string, Od.: also to stretch a bow tight, i. e. to string it, Od.: —Mid., δυνήσεται ἐντανύσασθαι to string oneʼs bow, Od.

div1.head: ἔντασις
div1.sense: tension; limitation, Plat.

div1.head: ἐντάσσω
div1.sense: to place or post in:—Pass., σφενδονᾶν ἐντεταγμένος posted to use the sling, Xen.

div1.head: ἐνταῦθα
div1.sense: of Place, here, there, Lat. hic, illic, Hdt., etc.; ἐνταῦθά που here-abouts, Ar.
like ἐνταυθοῖ, with sense of motion towards, hither, thither, Lat. huc, illuc, Il., Attic
c. gen., ἐντ. τῆς ἠπείρου Thuc.; ἔντ. τῆς πολιτείας in that department of government, Dem.
of Time, at the very time, then, Aesch., etc.
c. gen., ἐντ. ἡλικίας, Lat. ad hoc aetatis, Plat.
of Sequence, = Lat. deinde, thereupon, then, Hdt.
generally, herein, Soph., Plat., etc.: in this state of things, in this position, Dem.

div1.head: ἐνταυθοῖ
div1.sense: hither, here, Hom.

div1.head: ἐνταφιάζω
div1.sense: to prepare for burial, NTest.

div1.head: ἐνταφιασμός
div1.sense: burial, NTest.

div1.head: ἐντάφιος
div1.sense: of or used in burial: hence as Subst., ἐντάφιον, ου, τό, a shroud, winding-sheet, Simon., Anth.
ἐντάφια, τά, offerings to the dead, obsequies, Soph.

div1.head: ἔντεα
div1.sense: fighting gear, arms, armour, Hom.
furniture, appliances, ἔντεα δαιτός Od.; ἔντεα νηός rigging, tackle, Hhymn.; ἔντη δίφρου the harness, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐντείνω
div1.sense: to stretch or strain tightPass., δίφρος ἱμᾶσιν ἐντέταται is hung on tight-stretched straps, Il.; γέφυραι ἐντεταμέναι a bridge with the mooring-cables made taught, Hdt.; ἐντεταμένου τοῦ σώματος being braced up, Plat.
to stretch a bow tight, i. e. string it for shooting (cf. ἐντανύω) , Eur.; so in Mid. to string oneʼs bow, Eur.:—Pass., τόξα ἐντεταμένα bows ready strung, Hdt.
ἐντείνειν ναῦν ποδί to keep a shipʼs sail taught by the sheet, Eur.
to tie tight, Eur.
metaph. to strain, exert:—so in Mid., φωνὴν ἐντεινάμενος Aeschin.; ἐντεινάμενοι τὴν ἁρμονίαν pitching the tune high, Ar.:—and in Pass., ἐντεινόμενος, on the stretch, eager, Xen.
to carry on vigorously, Plut.
so intr. in Act. to exert oneself, be vehement, Eur.
to stretch out at or against, πληγὴν ἐντείνειν τινί, Lat. plagam intendere, to lay a blow on him, Xen.
to put into verse, Plat.

div1.head: ἐντειχίζω
div1.sense: to build or fortify in a place, Xen.
in Mid. to wall in, i. e. blockade, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐντεκνόομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to beget children in, Plut.

div1.head: ἔντεκνος
div1.sense: having children, Luc.

div1.head: ἐντελευτάω
div1.sense: to end oneʼs life in a place, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐντελής
div1.sense: complete, full, Ar., Thuc.
of victims, perfect, unblemished, Soph.
of soldiers and their equipments, in good condition, effective, Thuc.
of men, full-grown, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐντέλλω
div1.sense: to enjoin, command, τί τινι Hdt., etc.; ἐντέλλεσθαι ἀπὸ γλώσσης to command by word of mouth, Hdt.:—Pass., τὰ ἐντεταλμένα commands, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐντέμνω
div1.sense: to cut in, engrave upon, ἐν τοῖσι λίθοισι γράμματα Hdt.
to cut up,
to cut up the victim, sacrifice, Thuc.
to cut in, shred in, as herbs in a medical mixture, ἄκος ἐντ. Aesch.
to cut in two, Luc.

div1.head: ἐντερόνεια
div1.sense: the timber of a ship, belly-timber, Ar.

div1.head: ἔντερον
div1.sense: an intestine, piece of gut, ἔντερον οἰός a string of sheepʼs gut, Od.:—mostly in pl. ἔντερα, the guts, bowels, Il., Attic

div1.head: ἐντεσιεργός
div1.sense: working in harness, ἡμίονοι ἐντ. draught- mules, Il.

div1.head: ἐντεταμένως
div1.sense: vehemently, vigorously, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐντεῦθεν
div1.sense: of Place, hence or thence, Lat. hinc or illinc, Od., etc.
of Time, henceforth, thenceforth, thereupon, Hdt., etc.; τοὐντεῦθεν Eur.; τἀντεῦθεν what remains, Aesch.
Causal, from that source, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐντευκτικός
div1.sense: affable, Plut.

div1.head: ἔντευξις
div1.sense: a lighting upon, meeting with, converse, intercourse, τινος with a person, Aeschin.
a petition, Plut.: intercession for a person, NTest.

div1.head: ἐντευτλανόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be stewed in beet (τεῦτλον) , Ar.

div1.head: ἔντεχνος
div1.sense: within the province of art, artificial, artistic, Plat.

div1.head: ἐντήκω
div1.sense: to pour in while molten, μόλιβδον Plut.
Pass., with perf. act. ἐντέτηκα,
of feelings, to sink deep in, Soph.
of persons, to be absorbed by a thing, Soph.

div1.head: ἐντίθημι
div1.sense: to put in or into a ship, Od., Attic; so in Mid., Od.:—then, generally, to put in or into, Hes., Hdt., etc.
metaph. to put into a person, inspire, Theogn., Xen.;— Mid., χόλον ἔνθεο θυμῷ thou didst store up wrath in thy heart, Il.; πατέρας ἔνθεο τιμῇ hold our fathers in honour, Il.
to put in the mouth, τί τινι Ar.; and in Mid., ἐνθοῦ, put in, i. e. eat, Ar.

div1.head: ἐντίκτω
div1.sense: to bear or produce in a place, c. dat., Eur.; ᾠὰ ἐντ. ἐς τὴν ἰλύν to drop eggs into the mud, Hdt.
to create or cause in a person, τί τινι Eur.
perf. part. ἐντετοκώς intr., inborn, innate, Ar.

div1.head: ἐντιλάω
div1.sense: Lat. incacare, to squirt upon, τί τινι Ar.

div1.head: ἐντιμάω
div1.sense: to value in or among, Dem.

div1.head: ἔντιμος
div1.sense: of persons, in honour, honoured, prized, Soph., etc.:—c. dat. rei, honoured with or in a thing, Eur.:— οἱ ἔντιμοι men in office, men of rank, Xen.
of things, honoured, held in honour, Soph.
adv., ἐντίμως ἔχειν to be in honour, Xen.

div1.head: ἔντμημα
div1.sense: an incision, notch, Xen.

div1.head: ἐντολή
div1.sense: an injunction, order, command, behest, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἔντομος
div1.sense: cut in pieces, cut up: neut. pl., ἔντομα victims, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔντονος
div1.sense: of persons, well-strung, sinewy: metaph. intense, earnest, eager, vehement, Hdt., Attic: —adv. ἐντόνως, eagerly, violently, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἔντοπος
div1.sense: in or of a place, Soph.

div1.head: ἐντορεύω
div1.sense: to carve in relief on a thing, Plut.

div1.head: ἔντοσθε
div1.sense: from within, Od.: —also = ἐντός, within, absol. or c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἐντραγῳδέω
div1.sense: to strut among, τισί Luc.

div1.head: ἐντρέπω
div1.sense: to turn about τὰ νῶτα Hdt.: to alter, Luc.
Mid. or Pass., aor2 ἐνετράπην [ᾰ], to turn about, linger, hesitate, Soph.
c. gen. pers. to turn towards, give heed to, pay regard to, to respect or reverence, Hom., Trag.
c. inf. to take care that, Theogn.
absol. to feel shame or fear, NTest.

div1.head: ἐντρέφω
div1.sense: to bring up in the house, Eur.:— so in Mid., Hes.:—Pass. to be reared in a place, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: ἐντρέχω
div1.sense: to run in, εἰ ἐντρέχοι ἀγλαὰ γυῖα, if his limbs moved freely in [the armour], Il.
to slip in, enter, Anth.

div1.head: ἐντός
div1.sense: within, inside, Lat. intus, opp. to ἐκτός:
as prep. with gen., τείχεος ἐντός Il.; ἐντὸς Ὀλύμπου Hes., etc.; ἐντὸς ἐμαυτοῦ in my senses, Hdt.; so absol., ἐντὸς ὤν Dem.:—also with Verbs of motion, τείχεος ἐντὸς ἰέναι Il.
within, i. e. on this side, Lat. citra, ἐντὸς τοῦ Ἄλυος ποταμοῦ Hdt., etc.
of Time, within, ἐντὸς εἴκοσιν ἡμερῶν Thuc.; ἐντὸς ἑσπέρας short of, i. e. before, evening, Xen.
absol. within, ἐντὸς ἐέργειν Hom.; ἐντὸς ἔχειν Thuc.; τὰ ἐντός the inner parts, inwards, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐντριβής
div1.sense: metaph. from the touchstone, proved by rubbing, versed in a thing, c. dat., Soph.

div1.head: ἐντρίβω
div1.sense: to rub in or into a thing, c. dat., Luc.
metaph., ἐντρ. κόνδυλόν τινι to give him a drubbing, Plut.; so in Mid., Luc.
c. acc. pers. to rub one with cosmetics, Xen.:—Pass. to have cosmetics rubbed in, to be anointed, painted, Xen.
to wear away by rubbing, Ar.

div1.head: ἔντριμμα
div1.sense: a cosmetic, Plut.

div1.head: ἐντριτωνίζω
div1.sense: to third with water, i. e. to mix three parts of water with two of wine, —with a pun on ἡ Τριτογενής, Ar.

div1.head: ἔντριχος
div1.sense: hairy, Anth.

div1.head: ἔντριψις
div1.sense: a rubbing in, Xen.

div1.head: ἔντρομος
div1.sense: trembling, Plut., NTest.

div1.head: ἐντροπαλίζομαι
div1.sense: to keep turning round, of men retreating, Il.

div1.head: ἐντροπή
div1.sense: a turning towards, ἐντροπήν τινος ἔχειν respect or reverence for one, Soph.: shame, reproach, NTest.

div1.head: ἐντροπία
div1.sense: a trick, dodge, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἔντροφος
div1.sense: living in or acquainted with a thing, c. dat., Soph.
as Subst., nursling, Anth.

div1.head: ἐντρυφάω
div1.sense: to revel in a thing, c. dat., Menand.: —absol. to be luxurious, Xen.
to mock at, τινί Eur.

div1.head: ἐντραγεῖν
div1.sense: to eat greedily, to gobble up, Ar.:—c. gen. to eat greedily of, Luc.

div1.head: ἐντυγχάνω
div1.sense: in act. sense:— to light upon, fall in with, meet with a person or thing, c. dat., Hdt., etc.:—absol., ὁ ἐντυχών the first who meets us, any chance person, Thuc.; of thunder, to fall upon, c. dat., Xen.; so of misfortunes, Aesch.
rarely, like τυγχάνω c. gen., λελυμένης τῆς γεφύρης ἐντυχόντες having found the bridge broken up, Hdt.; ἐντυχὼν Ἀσκληπιδῶν having fallen in with them, Soph.
to converse with, talk to, τινί Plat.
to intercede with, intreat, τινί NTest., Plut.:—c. inf. to intreat one to do, Plut.
of books, to meet with, Plat.: hence, to read, Luc.

div1.head: ἐντυλίσσω
div1.sense: to wrap up, Ar.

div1.head: ἐντύνω
div1.sense: to equip, deck out, get ready, Hom.; δέπας δʼ ἔντυνον (aor1 imperat.) prepare the cup, i. e. mix the wine, Il.; εὖ ἐντύνασαν ἓ αὐτήν having decked herself well out, Il.:—Mid., ὄφρα τάχιστα ἐντύνεαι (Epic for ἐντύνῃ) mayʼst get thee ready, Od.:—Mid., c. acc., to prepare for oneself, ἐντύνεσθαι δαῖτα, δεῖπνον Hom.

div1.head: ἐντυπάς
div1.sense: adv., ἐντυπὰς ἐν χλαίνῃ κεκαλυμμένος (of Priam in his grief), wrapt up in his mantle so closely as to shew his limbs, Il.

div1.head: ἐντυπόω
div1.sense: to cut in intaglio, Plut.

div1.head: ἐντύφω
div1.sense: to smoke as one does wasps, Ar.

div1.head: Ἐνυάλιος
div1.sense: the Warlike, name of Ares (Mars), Il., Soph., etc.
as appellat. war, battle, Eur.
as adj. warlike, furious, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐνυβρίζω
div1.sense: to insult or mock one in a thing, c. dat., Soph.; τινὰ ἐν κακοῖς Eur.

div1.head: ἔνυδρις
div1.sense: an otter, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνυδρόβιος
div1.sense: living in the water, Anth.

div1.head: ἔνυδρος
div1.sense: with water in it, holding water, ἔν. τεῦχος, i. e. a bath, Aesch.; of countries, well watered, Hdt.; ἔν. φρούριον provided with water, Xen.
of water, watery, Eur.
living in or by water, of Nymphs, Soph.; of plants, Ar.

div1.head: ἐνύπνιον
div1.sense: a thing seen in sleep, ἐνύπνιον ἦλθεν ὄνειρος a dream or vision in sleep came to me, Od.:—hence as adv., ἐνύπνιον ἑστιᾶσθαι "to feast with the Barmecide," Ar.
simply a dream, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐνύπνιος
div1.sense: in dreams appearing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐνυφαίνω
div1.sense: to weave in as a pattern:—Pass. to be inwoven, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐνυφαντός
div1.sense: inwoven, Theocr.

div0.div1: Ἐνυώ , -οῦς, ἡ, Enyo, goddess of war, answering to the Roman Bellona, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐνωθέω
div1.sense: to thrust in or upon, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐνωμοτάρχης
div1.sense: leader of an ἐνωμοτία, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐνωμοτία
div1.sense: a band of sworn soldiers, a company in the Spartan army, the λόχος contained 4 πεντηκοστύες, each πεντηκοστύς 4 ἐνωμοτίαι, and each ἐνωμοτία 32 men, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐνώμοτος
div1.sense: bound by oath, Soph.:—adv. -τως, on oath, Plut.
a conspirator, Plut.

div1.head: ἐνωπαδίως
div1.sense: in oneʼs face, to oneʼs face, Od.

div1.head: ἐνωπή
div1.sense: the face, countenance, dat. ἐνωπῇ as adv., before the face, openly, Il.

div1.head: ἐνώπια
div1.sense: the inner wall fronting those who enter a building or the side-walls of the entrance, Hom.

div1.head: ἐνώπιος
div1.sense: face to face, Theocr.
neut. ἐνώπιον, prep. with gen., like Lat. coram, NTest.

div1.head: ἐνωτίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to hearken to a thing, τι NTest.

div1.head: ἐξαγγελία
div1.sense: information sent out to the enemy, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαγγέλλω
div1.sense: to send out tidings, report, of traitors and the like, Il., Attic:—Mid. to cause to be proclaimed, Hdt., Soph.; c. inf. to promise to do, Eur.: —Pass. to be reported, Hdt.; impers., ἐξαγγέλλεται it is reported, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξάγγελος
div1.sense: a messenger who brings out news from within, an informer, Thuc., etc.
on the Greek stage, ἄγγελοι told news from a distance, ἐξάγγελοι what was a-doing behind the scenes, as in Soph.

div1.head: ἐξάγγελτος
div1.sense: told of, denounced, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξαγίζω
div1.sense: to drive out as accursed:—Pass., aor1 part. ἐξαγισθείς, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξαγινέω
div1.sense: to lead forth, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξάγιστος
div1.sense: devoted to evil, accursed, abominable, Dem., Aeschin.
ἐξάγιστα holy things, matters of religion, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξάγνυμι
div1.sense: to break and tear away, to rend, Il.

div1.head: ἐξαγοράζω
div1.sense: to buy up, Plut.
to redeem, NTest.; so in Mid., NTest.

div1.head: ἐξαγορευτικός
div1.sense: fit to explain, τινος Luc.

div1.head: ἐξαγορεύω
div1.etym: the aor. is supplied by ἐξεῖπον, the fut. and perf. by ἐξερῶ, ἐξείρηκα
div1.sense: to tell out, make known, declare, Od.: to betray a secret or mystery, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαγριαίνω
div1.sense: to make savage, Plat.:—Pass. to be or become savage, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξαγριόω
div1.sense: to make wild or waste:—Pass. to be or be made so, Aeschin.
like ἐξ-αγριαίνω to make savage, exasperate, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξάγω
div1.sense: to lead out:
of persons, to lead or carry out from a place, Hom., etc.: to bring forth into the world, Il.: to lead out to execution, Hdt.
to march out (sub. στρατόν) , Xen.: generally, to go out, Xen.
to eject a claimant from property, Dem., etc.
of merchandise, to carry out, export, Ar., etc.:—Pass., τὰ ἐξαγόμενα exports, Xen.
to draw off water, Xen.
of building, to carry further out, Thuc.
to call forth, excite, δάκρυ Eur.:—Mid., γέλωτα ἐξάγεσθαι Xen.
to lead on, carry away, excite, τινά Eur., Thuc.; and in bad sense, to lead on, tempt, Thuc.:—Pass. to be led on, c. inf., Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαγωγή
div1.sense: a leading out of soldiers, Xen.
a drawing out of a ship to sea, Hdt.
a carrying out, exportation, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐξαγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to struggle hard, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαγώνιος
div1.sense: beside the mark, irrelevant, Luc.

div1.head: ἑξάδαρχος
div1.sense: leader of a body of six, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξᾴδω
div1.sense: to sing out, sing oneʼs last song, of the swan, Plat.
trans. to sing of, laud, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαερόω
div1.sense: to make into air, volatilise, Luc.

div1.head: ἑξαετής
div1.sense: six years old: fem. ἑξαέτις, Theocr.
of six years, χρόνος Plut.:—adv., ἑξάετες, for six years, Od.

div1.head: ἐξαθροίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to seek out and collect, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαθυμέω
div1.sense: to be quite disheartened, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξαιάζω
div1.sense: to wail loudly, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαιμάσσω
div1.sense: to make quite bloody, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαίνυμαι
div1.sense: Epic Dep. to carry off, Od.; c. dupl. acc., ἐξαίνυτο θυμὸν ἀμφοτέρω took away life from both, Il.

div1.head: ἐξαίρεσις
div1.sense: a taking out, Hdt.:— a way of taking out, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαιρετέος
div1.sense: to be taken out or removed, Xen.
ἐξαιρετέον, one must take out: one must pick out, select, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαιρετός
div1.sense: that can be taken out, removable, Hdt.
ἐξαίρετος, ον taken out, picked out, chosen, Lat. eximius, Hom., etc.
excepted, Eur., Thuc., etc.: special, remarkable, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξαιρέω
div1.sense: to take out of a thing, τί τινος Hom., etc.; ἔκ τινος Hdt., etc.:—simply to take out, νηδύν Hdt.:—Mid. to take out for oneself, Il.; ἐξ. τὰ φορτία to discharge their cargoes, Hdt.

to take from among others, to pick out, choose, Hom., etc.:—Mid. to choose for oneself, carry off as booty, Hom.:—Pass. to be given as a special honour, τινι to one, Thuc.; ἐξαραιρημένος Ποσειδέωνι dedicated to him, Hdt.
to take out of a number, to except, Hdt., Attic
to expel people from their seats, Hdt., Thuc.
to take out, remove, Hdt., Attic

in Mid. to bereave a person of life, c. dupl. acc., μιν ἐξείλετο θυμόν Il., Attic; or c. gen. pers., μευ φρένας ἐξέλετο Il.; rarely c. dat. pers., Il.:—Mid. to take away from one, Soph.:—Pass., ἐξαιρεθέντες τὸν Δημοκήδεα having had him taken out of their hands, Hdt.
in Mid. to set free, deliver, Aesch., Dem.
to make away with, annul, Soph.: to demolish a city, Hdt., etc.
to bring to an end, accomplish, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαείρω
div1.sense: to lift up, lift off the earth, Hom., Hdt.; ἐξάραντες having bade me rise (from suppliant posture), Soph.
to raise in dignity, exalt, Hdt., Aeschin.
to raise, arouse, stir up, Theogn., Soph.; ἐξ. σε θανεῖν excites thy wish to die, Eur.
Mid., 3rd sg. aor1 ἐξήρατο, to carry off for oneself, earn, win, gain, Od.
to take on oneself, Soph.
Pass. to be raised, Hdt.: to rise up, rise, Eur.:— to be excited, agitated, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαίσιος
div1.sense: beyond what is ordained or fated: hence,
lawless, Od.
extraordinary, violent, Hdt., Xen.; ἐξ. φυγή headlong flight, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαΐσσω
div1.sense: to rush forth, start out from, c. gen., Il.; ἐκ τοῦ νεώ Ar.:—so in Pass., Il.

div1.head: ἐξαϊστόω
div1.sense: to utterly destroy, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξαιτέω
div1.sense: to demand or ask for from another, c. dupl. acc., τήνδε μʼ ἐξαιτεῖ χάριν Soph.; ἐξ. τινα πατρός to ask her in marriage from . . , Soph.:— ἐξ. τινα to demand the surrender of a person, Hdt., Dem.;— σμικρὸν ἐξ. to beg for little, Soph.
Mid. to ask for oneself, demand, Hdt., Soph., etc.
in Mid. also, = παραιτοῦμαι, to beg off, gain his pardon or release, Lat. exorare, Aesch., Xen.; c. inf. to beg that one may obtain, Eur.:—c. acc. rei, to avert by begging, Lat. deprecari, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαίτησις
div1.sense: a demanding one for punishment, Dem.
intercession, Dem.

div1.head: ἔξαιτος
div1.sense: much asked for, much desired, choice, excellent, Hom.

div1.head: ἐξαίφνης
div1.sense: adv. on a sudden, Il., Attic; ἐξ. ἀποθανόντος, the moment he is dead, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξακέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to heal completely, heal the wound, make amends, Il.
c. acc. to appease, Hom.; to make up for, Xen.
to mend clothes, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξάκεσις
div1.sense: a thorough cure, Ar.

div1.head: ἑξακισμύριοι
div1.sense: sixty thousand, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἑξάκις
div1.sense: six times, Lat. sexies, Plat., etc.: poet. ἑξάκι, Anth.

div1.head: ἑξακισχίλιοι
div1.sense: six thousand, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐξακοντίζω
div1.sense: to dart or hurl forth, Xen.; φάσγανον πρὸς ἧπαρ ἐξ. to strike it home, Eur.
metaph., ἐξ. κῶλον τῆς γῆς i. e. to flee precipitately, Eur.; τοὺς πόνους ἐξ. to proclaim loudly, Eur.

div1.head: ἑξακόσιοι
div1.sense: six hundred, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξακούω
div1.sense: to hear a sound, esp. from a distance, Aesch., Soph.; c. gen. pers., Xen.; rei, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξακριβόω
div1.sense: to make exact, ἐξ. λόγον to make a distinct or precise statement, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξακρίζω
div1.sense: to reach the top of, ἐξ. αἰθέρα to skim the upper air, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξακτέος
div1.sense: one must march out, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαλαόω
div1.sense: to blind utterly, Od.
to put an eye quite out, Od.

div1.head: ἐξαλαπάζω
div1.sense: to sack a city, Il., etc.:—also, to empty a city of its inhabitants, clear it out, so as to plant new settlers in it, μίαν πόλιν ἐξαλαπάξας Od.: generally, to destroy utterly, Il.

div1.head: ἐξάλειπτρον
div1.sense: an unguent-box, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξαλείφω
div1.sense: to plaster or wash over, Hdt., Thuc.
to wipe out, obliterate, Eur.:— ἐξ. τινά to strike his name off the roll, Ar., etc.
metaph., like Lat. delere, to wipe out, destroy utterly, Aesch., Eur.:—Mid., ἐξαλείψασθαι φρενός to blot it out of oneʼs mind, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαλέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to beware of, avoid, escape, Il.; Epic aor1 inf. ἐξαλέασθαι, Hes., Ar., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαλίνδω
div1.sense: to roll out or thoroughly, ἄπαγε τὸν ἵππον ἐξαλίσας take him away when you have given him a good roll on the ἀλινδήθρα, Ar.; ἐξήλικας ἐμέ γʼ ἐκ τῶν ἐμῶν you have rolled me out of house and home, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξαλλαγή
div1.sense: a complete change, alteration, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξαλλάσσω
div1.sense: to change utterly or completely, Eur.:—Mid., μηδὲν ἐξαλλάσσεται he sees no change take place, Soph.
to withdraw from a place, c. acc., Eur.
ἐξαλλάσσειν τί τινος to remove from, c. gen., Thuc.
intr. to change, turn another way, move back and forward, Eur.; ποίαν ἐξαλλάξω; which other way shall I take? Eur.; ἐξαλλάσσουσα χάρις unusual grace, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to leap out of or forth from a place, c. gen., Il.; προμάχων ἐξάλμενος springing out from the front rank, Il.; ἐξάλατο ναός (Doric for ἐξήλατο νηός) Theocr.:—absol. to jump off, hop off, Ar.; ἵνʼ ἐξήλλου; to what point didst thou leap forth, i. e. to what misery hast thou come? Soph.; of wheels, to start from the axle, Xen.
to leap up. Xen.: of horses, to rear, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαλύσκω
div1.sense: to flee from, c. acc., Eur.; absol. to escape, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to err from the mark, fail, Xen.: to miss oneʼs aim, Soph.
to err, do wrong, sin, Hdt., Attic; c. acc. cogn., ἐξ. τι to commit a fault, Hdt., Soph., etc.
in Pass. to be mismanaged, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξαμαρτία
div1.sense: an error, transgression, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαμάω
div1.sense: to mow or reap out, to finish mowing or reaping, Trag.:—metaph. to cut out, in Mid., Eur.:—Pass., γένους ῥίζαν ἐξημημένος (part. perf.) having the race cut off root and branch, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαμάω
div1.sense: = ἐξαφύσσω.

div1.head: ἐξαμβλόω
div1.sense: to make to miscarry, Eur.
to make abortive, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξαμβλύνω
div1.sense: to blunt, weaken, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξαμείβω
div1.sense: to exchange, alter, ἐξαμείψασαι τρόμον having put away fear from one, Eur.:—Mid. to take the place of, c. gen., Eur.; so intr. in Act., c. dat., φόνῳ φόνος ἐξαμείβων murder following after murder, Eur.
of Place, to change one for another, pass over, c. acc., Aesch., Eur.: absol. to withdraw, depart, Eur.
in Mid. also to requite, repay, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξαμέλγω
div1.sense: to milk out, suck out, Aesch.
to press out, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαμελέω
div1.sense: to be utterly careless of a thing, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: ἑξάμετρος
div1.sense: of six metres, hexameter, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑξάμηνος
div1.sense: of, lasting six months: ἑξάμ. (sc. χρόνος) , a half-year, Xen.; ἡ ἑξάμ. (sc. ὥρη) , Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαμηχανέω
div1.sense: to get out of a difficulty, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαμιλλάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to struggle vehemently, c. acc. cogn., τὰς τεθρίππους ἁμίλλας ἐξαμιλληθείς having contested the chariot-race, Eur.
to drive out of a place, c. gen., Eur.: to drive out of his wits, Eur.
aor1 in pass. sense, to be forced out, of the Cyclopsʼ eye, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαμύνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to ward off from oneself, drive away, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαναβρύω
div1.sense: to gush or cause to gush forth, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξαναγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to read through, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξαναγκάζω
div1.sense: to force or compel utterly, τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Soph., Eur., etc.; c. acc. only, Soph.
to drive away, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξανάγω
div1.sense: to bring out of or up from, c.gen., Eur.:—Pass. to put out to sea, set sail, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐξαναδύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. , to rise out of, emerge from water, c. gen., Od.
to escape from, c. gen., Theogn., Plut.

div1.head: ἐξαναζέω
div1.sense: to boil up with, c. acc. cogn., ἐξαναζέσει χόλον will let fury boil forth, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξαναιρέω
div1.sense: to take out of, c. gen., Hhymn.; Mid., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανακρούομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to retreat out of a place by backing water, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαναλίσκω
div1.sense: to spend entirely, Dem.:— to exhaust, Plut.
to destroy utterly, Aesch.:—Pass., Dem.

div1.head: ἐξαναλύω
div1.sense: to set quite free from, c.gen., Il.

div1.head: ἐξανάλωσις
div1.sense: entire consumption, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξανάπτω
div1.sense: to hang from or by a thing, c. gen., Eur.:—Mid. to attach to oneself, τι Eur.
to rekindle, Anth.

div1.head: ἐξαναρπάζω
div1.sense: to snatch away, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανασπάω
div1.sense: to tear away from, Hdt., Eur.: to tear up from, χθονός Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανάστασις
div1.sense: a rising up from, resurrection from the dead, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξαναστέφω
div1.sense: to crown with wreaths, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαναστρέφω
div1.sense: to hurl headlong from a place, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξανατέλλω
div1.sense: intr. to spring up from a place, c. gen., Mosch.

div1.head: ἐξαναφανδόν
div1.sense: all openly, Od.

div1.head: ἐξαναφέρω
div1.sense: to bear up out of the water, Plut.
intr. to recover from an illness, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξαναχωρέω
div1.sense: to go out of the way, withdraw, retreat, Hdt.
c. acc. to evade, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξανδραποδίζω
div1.sense: to reduce to utter slavery, Hdt., Xen., etc.
also as Pass., Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: ἐξανδραπόδισις
div1.sense: a selling for slaves, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξανδρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to come to manʼs years, Hdt., Eur.
ὀδόντων ὄφεος ἐξηνδρωμένος having grown to men from serpentʼs teeth, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανεγείρω
div1.sense: to excite, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξάνειμι
div1.sense: to rise from the horizon, of stars, Theocr.
to come back from, ἄγρης Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐξανεμόω
div1.sense: to blow out with wind, inflate, Eur.: —metaph., ἐξηνεμώθην I was puffed up, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανέρχομαι
div1.sense: to come forth from, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανευρίσκω
div1.sense: to find out, invent, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξανέχω
div1.sense: to hold up from: but mostly intr. to jut out from, c. gen., Theocr.

Mid., imperf. and aor2 with double augm. ἐξηνειχόμην, ἐξηνεσχόμην, to bear up against, endure, with part., ἐξανασχοίμην κλύων Soph.; ταῦτα παῖδας ἐξανέξεται πάσχοντας Eur.; ταῦτα δόξαντʼ ἐξηνέσχετο endured that these things should be decreed, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανθέω
div1.sense: to put out flowers, Xen.
metaph. to burst forth, like an efflorescence, bloom forth, Aesch., Eur.:—of ulcers, to break out, Thuc., Luc.

div1.head: ἐξανίημι
div1.sense: to send forth, let loose, Il., Soph.:—c. gen. to send forth from, Eur.
to let go, Eur.
to slacken, undo, Eur.:—and intr. to slacken, relax, Soph.; c. gen., ὀργῆς ἐξανείς Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανίστημι
div1.sense: Causal in pres., imperf., fut. and aor 1,
to raise up: to make one rise from his seat, bid one rise from suppliant posture, Eur.; ἐξ. τὴν ἐνέδραν to order the men in ambush to rise, Xen.
to make a tribe emigrate, to remove or expel, Hdt., Soph.
to depopulate, destroy, πόλιν Hdt., Eur., etc.
ἐξ. θηρία to rouse them from their lair, Xen.
intr. in Pass., with aor2, perf. and plup. act.:
to stand up from oneʼs seat, Hdt., etc.; to rise to speak, Soph.; from ambush, Eur., Thuc.; from bed, Eur.
c. gen. to arise and depart from, emigrate from, Hdt.:—absol. to break up, depart, Thuc., etc.
to be driven out from oneʼs home, to be forced to emigrate, Hdt., Aesch.
of places, to be depopulated, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξανοίγω
div1.sense: to lay open, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξαντλέω
div1.sense: to draw out water:—metaph. to endure to the end, see out, Lat. exantlare, exhaurire, Eur.
metaph. also to rob, plunder, Luc.

div1.head: ἐξανύω
div1.sense: to accomplish, fulfil, make effectual, Il., Soph.:—Mid. to accomplish or finish for oneself, Eur.
to finish or dispatch, i. e. kill, Lat. conficere, Il.
of Time and Distance, to bring to an end, finish, accomplish, βίοτον Soph.; δρόμον Eur.:—absol. to finish oneʼs way to a place, arrive at it, ἐς or ἐπὶ τόπον Hdt.; also c. acc. loci, Soph., Eur.
c. inf. to manage to do, Eur.
Mid. to obtain, τι παρά τινος Eur.

div1.head: ἑξαπάλαστος
div1.sense: of six hands-breadth, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαπαλλάσσω
div1.sense: to set free from, remove from, κακῶν Eur.:—Pass. to ged rid of, escape from, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξαπαρτάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to hang from or on, c. gen., Luc.

div1.head: ἐξαπατάω
div1.sense: to deceive or beguile thoroughly, Hom., Hdt., etc.:— also, ἐξ. τινά τι in a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαπάτη
div1.sense: gross deceit, Hes., Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαπατητέος
div1.sense: one must deceive, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξαπατητικός
div1.sense: calculated to deceive, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαπατύλλω
div1.sense: to cheat a little, humbug, Ar.

div1.head: ἑξάπεδος
div1.sense: six feet long, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαπεῖδον
div1.sense: in use, to observe from afar, Soph.

div1.head: ἑξάπηχυς
div1.sense: six cubits long, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἑξαπλάσιος
div1.sense: six times as large as, τινος Hdt.

div1.head: ἑξάπλεθρος
div1.sense: six πλέθρα long, i. e. about 1200 feet, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαποβαίνω
div1.sense: to step out of, νηός Od.

div1.head: ἐξαποδύνω
div1.sense: to put off, εἵματα Od.

div1.head: Ἑξάπολις
div1.sense: a League of six cities, of the Asiatic Dorians, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαπόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, Trag., etc.
Mid., with perf. 2 ἐξαπόλωλα, aor2 ἐξαπωλόμην:— to perish utterly out of a place, c. gen., Hom., Aesch.:—absol. to perish utterly, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαπονέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to return out of, Il.

div1.head: ἐξαπονίζω
div1.sense: to wash thoroughly, Od.

div1.head: ἐξαποξύνω
div1.sense: to sharpen well, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαπορέω
div1.sense: to be in great doubt or difficulty: so in Mid. and Pass., NTest., Plut.

div1.head: ἐξαποστέλλω
div1.sense: to send quite away:—Pass. to be dispatched, Philipp. ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἐξαποτίνω
div1.sense: to satisfy in full, Il.

div1.head: ἐξαποφθείρω
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξάπτω
div1.sense: to fasten from, i. e. to, a thing, c. gen., Hom., Eur.; τι ἔκ τινος Hdt.
metaph., ἐξ. στόματος λιτάς to let prayers fall from oneʼs mouth, Eur.
ἐξ. τί τινι to place upon, Eur.
Mid. to hang on, Il.
to hang a thing to oneself, carry it about one, wear, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαπωθέω
div1.sense: to thrust away, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαράομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to utter curses, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαράσσω
div1.sense: to dash out, shatter, Od., Ar.
c. acc. pers. to assail furiously, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξαργέω
div1.sense: to be quite torpidPass. to be quite neglected, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαργυρίζω
div1.sense: to turn into money, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἐξαρέσκομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make oneself acceptable, Xen.
c. acc. pers. to win over, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξαριθμέω
div1.sense: to count throughout, number, Lat. enumerare, Hdt., Attic
to count out, pay in ready money, Lat. numeratim solvere, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξαρκέω
div1.sense: of objects, to be quite enough for, suffice for, τινί Soph., Plat., etc.; πρός τι Xen.: absol. to suffice, be sufficient, Eur., Dem.
impers., ἐξαρκεῖ it is enough for, suffices for, c. dat. pers., Hdt., Attic
of persons, to be satisfied with, to be a match for, c. dat., Eur.:—c. part. to be content with having, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαρκής
div1.sense: enough, sufficient, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαρκούντως
div1.etym: adverb from part. pres. of ἐξαρκέω,
div1.sense: enough, sufficiently, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξαρνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to deny utterly, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξάρνησις
div1.sense: a denying, denial, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξαρνητικός
div1.sense: apt at denying, negative, Ar.

div1.head: ἔξαρνος
div1.sense: denying; ἔξαρνός εἰμι or γίγνομαι = ἐξαρνέομαι, Ar., etc.; foll. by μή c. inf., ἔξ. ἦν μὴ ἀποκτεῖναι he denied that he had killed, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐξαρπάζω
div1.sense: to snatch away from a place, c. gen., Od.; τι παρά τινος Hdt.; τι ἐκ χερῶν τινος Eur.:— to rescue, Il.:—Pass., οἱ ἐξηρπασμένοι the captured ones, Soph.
to tear out, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξαρτάω
div1.sense: to hang upon, to make dependent upon, c. gen., Plut.: also in Mid., Eur.
Pass., fut. in mid. form -αρτήσομαι, perf. -ήρτημαι:— to be hung upon, hang upon, χειρός Eur.
to depend upon, be dependent upon, be attached to, σοῦ γὰρ ἐξηρτήμεθα Eur.
of countries, to border upon, τινος Plut.
to be hung up or exposed to view, Thuc.
perf. pass. part., c. acc. rei, having a thing hung on one, be furnished with, Ar., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐξαρτίζω
div1.sense: to complete, finish, τὰς ἡμέρας NTest.:—Pass. to be thoroughly prepared or furnished, NTest.:—Mid. to provide oneself with, τι Luc.

div1.head: ἐξαρτύω
div1.sense: to get ready, equip thoroughly, fit out, Eur., Thuc.:—Mid. to get ready for oneself, fit out, Thuc.: c. inf., ἐξαρτύεται γαμεῖν Aesch.:— Pass. to be got ready, πάντα σφι ἐξήρτυτο Hdt.:—in perf. pass. part., equipt, harnessed, Eur.; c. dat. rei, furnished or provided with, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἔξαρχος
div1.sense: a leader, beginner, Lat. auctor, Il.
the leader of a chorus, Lat. coryphaeus, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξάρχω
div1.sense: to begin with, make a beginning of, Lat. auctor esse, c. gen., ἐξῆρχε γόοιο Il., etc.:—so in Mid., ἐξήρχετο βουλῆς Od.
c. acc., βουλὰς ἐξάρχων Il.;—also ἐξάρχειν or ἐξάρχεσθαι παιᾶνά τινι to begin a hymn to one, address it to him, Xen.

div1.head: ἑξάς
div1.sense: the number six, Plut., etc.

div1.head: ἐξασκέω
div1.sense: to adorn, deck out, equip, Soph.;c. dupl. acc., ἁγώ νιν ἐξήσκησα with which I equipped him, Eur.
to train or teach thoroughly, τινά Plat.
to practise, τι Plut.

div1.head: ἐξαστράπτω
div1.sense: to flash as with lightning, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξατιμάζω
div1.sense: to dishonour utterly, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαυαίνω
div1.sense: to dry quite up, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξαυγής
div1.sense: dazzling white, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαυδάω
div1.sense: to speak out, Il., Soph.:—so in Mid., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξαυλίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to leave oneʼs quarters, to go out of camp into villages, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξαυτῆς
div1.sense: for ἐξ αὐτῆς τῆς ὥρας, at the very point of time, at once, Theogn.

div1.head: ἐξαῦτις
div1.sense: over again, once more, anew, Il.
of place, back again, backwards, Il.

div1.head: ἐξαυτομολέω
div1.sense: to desert from a place, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξαυχέω
div1.sense: to boast loudly, profess, Trag.

div1.head: ἐξαύω
div1.sense: to heat.

div1.head: ἐξαύω
div1.sense: to cry out, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαφαιρέω
div1.sense: to take right away: in Mid., aor. 2 -αφειλόμην Od.

div1.head: ἐξαφίημι
div1.sense: to send forth, discharge, Xen.
to set free from labour, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξαφίστημι
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass.ἐξαφίσταμαι, with aor2, perf., and plup. act., to depart or withdraw from, τινος Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξαφρίζω
div1.sense: Mid. to throw off by foaming:—metaph. from a horse, ἐξαφρίζεσθαι μένος Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξαφύω
div1.sense: to draw forth liquor, Od.

div1.head: ἑξάχειρ
div1.sense: six-handed, Luc.

div1.head: ἑξάχοος
div1.sense: holding six χόες, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξεγγυάω
div1.sense: to free a person by giving bail, Dem.:—Pass. to be bailed, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξεγγύησις
div1.sense: a giving of bail, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξεγείρω
div1.sense: to awaken, Soph.:—Pass. to be awaked, wake up, Hdt., etc.; syncop. aor2 ἐξηγρόμην Ar.; Epic 3rd pl. ἐξέγροντο Theocr.; perf. 2 ἐξεγρήγορα Ar.
to raise from the dead, Aesch.
metaph. to awake, arouse, bring on, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξέδρα
div1.sense: Lat. exhedra, a hall or arcade in the gymnasia, a sort of cloister, Eur.

div1.head: ἔξεδρος
div1.sense: away from home, Soph.
c. gen. out of, away from, Eur.: metaph., ἔξεδροι φρενῶν λόγοι insensate words, Eur.
of birds of omen, ἔξ. χώραν ἔχειν to be in an unlucky quarter, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξεῖδον
div1.note: aor2 in use of the pres. ἐξοράω
div1.sense: to look out, see far, Il.: also imperat. mid., ἐξιδοῦ see well to it, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξεικάζω
div1.sense: to make like, to adapt, Xen.:—Pass., ἐξείκαστό τινι was like it, Xen.; part. perf., οὐδὲν ἐξῃκασμένα not mere semblances, but the things themselves, Aesch.; στέρνα ἐξῃκασμένα portrayed, Eur.; οὐκ ἐξῃκασμένος not represented by a portrait-mask, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξείλλω
div1.sense: to disentangle, Xen.
to keep forcibly from, debar from, τινά τινος Dem.
ἐξειλέω
to unfold, Luc.

div1.head: ἐξειλύω
div1.sense: to unwrap:—Pass. to glide along, aor1 ἐξειλύσθην, Theocr.

div1.head: ἔξειμι
div1.etym: serving as Attic fut. of ἐξέρχομαι, but with imperf. ἐξῄειν, Ionic ἐξήϊα
div1.sense: to go out, come out of the house, Hom.; c. gen. loci, Od., Soph.; ἐξ. ἐκ τῶν ἱππέων to leave the knights, Hdt.; εἰς ἔλεγχον ἐξιέναι to come forth to the trial, Soph.
to march out with an army, Thuc., Xen.:—c. acc. cogn. to go out on an expedition or enterprise, Soph., Eur., etc.
to come forward on the stage, Ar.
of Time or incidents, to come to an end, expire, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξεῖπον
div1.note: aor2 in use of ἐξαγορεύω, ἐξερέω
div1.sense: to speak out, tell out, declare, Lat. effari, Hom., Thuc.
c. dupl. acc. to tell something of a person, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξειργασμένως
div1.etym: adverb part. perf. pass. of ἐξεργάζομαι,
div1.sense: carefully, accurately, fully, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξείρω
div1.sense: to put forth, Lat. exsero, τὴν χεῖρα Hdt.; τὸ κέντρον Ar.
to pull out, τὴν γλῶσσαν Ar.

div1.head: ἐξέλασις
div1.sense: a driving out, expulsion, Hdt.
intr. a marching out, expedition, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐξελαύνω
div1.sense: occurs in Hom.:— to drive out from, ἄντρου ἐξήλασε μῆλα Od.; absol. to drive afield, of a shepherd, Od.:—esp. to drive out or expel from a place, Od., Aesch., etc.
to drive out horses or chariots, Il.: Mid. to drive out oneʼs horses, Theocr.; so, ἐξελαύνειν στρατόν to lead out an army, Hdt.: hence
intr. to march out, Hdt.: to drive or ride out, Thuc.
to knock out, Od.
to beat out metals, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξελεγκτέος
div1.sense: to be refuted, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξελέγχω
div1.sense: to convict, confute, refute, Soph., Ar., etc.
c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, to convict one of a thing, Plat.: Pass. to be so convicted of, Dem.
with predicate added in part. to convict one of being . . , Plat.:—Pass., κἀξελέγχεται κάκιστος ὤν Eur.
to search out, put to the proof, Aesch.: —Pass., ἦσαν ἐξεληλεγμένοι all had had their sentiments well ascertained, Dem.; ἐξηλέγχθη ἐς τὸ ἀληθές was fully proved to be true, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξελευθερικός
div1.sense: of the class of freedmen or their offspring, Lat. libertinus, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξελεύθερος
div1.sense: set at liberty, a freedman, Lat. libertus, libertinus, Cic.

div1.head: ἐξελευθεροστομέω
div1.sense: to be very free of speech, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξελίσσω
div1.sense: to unroll, Eur.:metaph. to unfold, Lat. explicare, Eur.
of any rapid motion, ἴχνος ἐξ. ποδός to evolve the mazy dance, Eur.:—hence intr. to wheel about, Plut.
as military term, = ἀναπτύσσειν, Lat. explicare, to extend the front by bringing up the rear men, to deploy, Xen.
to draw off, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξελκτέος
div1.sense: one must drag along, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξέλκω
div1.sense: to draw or drag out, Il.
to drag out from a place, c. gen., Od., Eur.
to drag along, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξελληνίζω
div1.sense: to turn into Greek, to trace to a Greek origin, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξεμέω
div1.sense: to vomit forth, disgorge, Od.:—metaph. to disgorge ill-gotten gear, Ar.
absol. to vomit, be sick, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξεμπεδόω
div1.sense: to keep quite firm, strictly observe, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξεμπολάω
div1.sense: to traffic, κέρδος ἐξ. to drive a gainful trade, Soph.; ἐξημπόλημαι I am bought and sold, betrayed, Soph.
to sell off, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξεναίρω
div1.sense: to kill outright, aor2 inf. ἐξεναρεῖν Hes.

div1.head: ἐξεναρίζω
div1.sense: to strip or spoil a foe slain in fight, Il.; τεύχεα ἐξ. to strip off his arms, Il.
to kill, slay, Hom.

div1.head: ἐξεπᾴδω
div1.sense: to charm away, Plat.:—Pass., ἐξεπᾴδεσθαι φύσιν to be charmed out of their nature, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξεπεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to boast loudly that, c. inf., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξεπίσταμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to know thoroughly, know well, Hdt., Attic; c. inf. to know well how to do, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξεπίτηδες
div1.sense: of set purpose, Ar., Plat.: with malice prepense, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξέραμα
div1.sense: a vomit, thing vomited, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξεράω
div1.sense: to disgorge, Ar.; φέρʼ ἐξεράσω τὰς ψήφους let me disgorge the ballots from the urn (in order to count them), Ar.; ἐξέρα τὸ ὕδωρ pour it out, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξεργάζομαι
div1.etym: both in act. and pass. sense
div1.sense: to work out, make completely, finish off, bring to perfection, Hdt., Attic
to accomplish, perform, achieve a work, Soph.; κακὸν ἐξ. τινα to work him mischief, Hdt.:—as Pass., ἔργον ἐστὶν ἐξειργασμένον Aesch.; ἐπʼ ἐξεργασμένοισι after the deed had been done, Hdt.
to work at: as Pass., ἀγροὶ εὖ ἐξεργασμένοι well cultivated lands, Hdt.; ἡ γῆ ἐξείργασται Thuc.
to undo, destroy, overwhelm, ruin, Hdt., Eur.:—as Pass., ἐξειργάσμεθα we are undone, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξεργαστικός
div1.sense: able to accomplish, τινος Xen.

div1.head: ἐξέργω
div1.sense: to shut out from a place, debar, Hdt., etc.; ἐξείργειν τινα χθονός Eur.; ἐκ τοῦ θεάτρου Dem.:—Pass., ἐξείργεσθαι πάντων Thuc.
to debar, hinder, prevent, preclude, Soph., Eur.
to force:—Pass. to be constrained, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξερεείνω
div1.sense: Epic Verb,
c. acc. rei, to inquire into, Od.
c. acc. pers. to inquire after, Od.: absol. to make inquiry, Il.; so in Mid., Il.
to search thoroughly, Od.

div1.head: ἐξερέθω
div1.sense: to irritate greatly, Anth.

div1.head: ἐξερείπω
div1.sense: to strike off: intr. in aor, 2 ἐξήριπον, inf. ἐξεριπεῖν, to fall to earth, Il.; χαίτη ζεύγλης ἐξεριποῦσα the mane streaming downwards from the yoke, Il.

div1.head: ἐξερεύγομαι
div1.sense: Pass., of rivers, to empty themselves, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξερευνάω
div1.sense: to search out, examine, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξερέω
div1.sense: I will speak out, tell out, utter aloud, Hom., Soph.: so in perf. act. ἐξείρηκα Soph.; 3rd sg. plup. pass. ἐξείρητο Soph.; fut. pass. ἐξειρήσεται Soph.

div1.head: ἐξερέω
div1.sense: to inquire into a thing, Od.; so in Mid., Od.
to inquire of a person, Od.; and in Mid., Od.
to search through, Od.
Dep.: ἐξέρομαι
to inquire into a thing, Od., Soph.
to inquire of a person, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξερημόω
div1.sense: to make quite desolate, leave destitute, abandon, Soph., Eur.; ἐξ. γένυν δράκοντος making it destitute of teeth, Eur.:—Pass. to be left destitute, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξερίζω
div1.sense: to be contumacious, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξεριστής
div1.sense: a stubborn disputant, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξερμηνεύω
div1.sense: to interpret accurately, Luc.

div1.head: ἐξέρπω
div1.sense: to creep out of, ἔκ τινος Ar.
absol. to creep out or forth, Soph., Ar.; of an army, οὐ ταχὺ ἐξέρπει Xen.

div1.head: ἐξέρρω
div1.sense: only in imperat., ἔξερρε γαίας away out of the land! Eur.

div1.head: ἐξερύκω
div1.sense: to ward off, repel, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξερύω
div1.sense: to draw out of, c. gen., Il.; ἰχθύας ἔκτοσθε θαλάσσης ἐξέρυσαν Od.:—also, to snatch out of, ἐξείρυσε χειρὸς τόξον Il.: to tear out, Od.

div1.head: ἐξέρχομαι
div1.etym: in Attic ἔξειμι supplies the fut., as also the imperf. ἐξῄειν
div1.sense: Dep.:— to go or come out of, c. gen. loci, Hom., Hdt., etc.; of an actor, to come out on the stage, Ar.:—also c. acc., ἐξ. τὴν χώρην Hdt.:—absol. to go away, march off, Il.: also, to march out, go forth, ἐπί τινα Hdt.:—c. acc. cogn. to go out on an expedition, Xen.: to go through a work, Soph.
ἐξ. εἰς ἔλεγχον to stand forth and come to the trial, Eur.: to turn out so and so, Soph.
c. acc. rei, to execute, Thuc.
of Time, to come to an end, expire, Hdt., Soph.
of prophecies, dreams, events, to be accomplished, come true, Hdt.; ὀρθὸν ἐξ. to come out right, Soph.; μὴ ἐξέλθῃ σαφής lest he turn out a true prophet, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξερωέω
div1.sense: to swerve from the course, Il.

div1.head: ἐξεσθίω
div1.sense: to eat away, eat up, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξεσία
div1.sense: a sending out, mission, embassy, Hom.

div1.head: ἔξεσις
div1.sense: a dismissal, divorce, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔξεστι
div1.etym: impers., the only forms in use of ἔξ-ειμι
div1.sense: it is allowed, it is in oneʼs power, is possible, c. inf., Hdt.: c. dat. pers. et inf., Hdt., Attic; ἔξ. σοι ἀνδρὶ γενέσθαι Xen.:— c. acc. pers. et inf., Ar.:—part. neut. absol., ἐξόν since it was possible, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐξετάζω
div1.sense: to examine well or closely, inquire into, scrutinise, review, Theogn., Attic
of troops, to inspect, review, Thuc., etc.:—generally, to pass in review, enumerate, Dem.
to examine or question a person closely, Hdt., Soph., etc.
to estimate, compare, τι πρός τι one thing by or with another, Soph.

to prove by testing, of gold, Soph.:—in Pass. with part., ἐξετάζεται παρών he is proved to have been present, Plat.; ἐξετάζεσθαι φίλος (sc. ὤν) Eur.; c. gen., τῶν ἐχθρῶν ἐξετάζεσθαι to be found in the number of the enemies, Dem.
to present oneself, appear, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξέτασις
div1.sense: a close examination, scrutiny, review, Thuc., Plat., etc.
a military inspection or review, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐξεταστέος
div1.sense: one must scrutinise, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξεταστής
div1.sense: an examiner, inquirer, Plut.: at Athens, a paymaster, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐξεταστικός
div1.sense: capable of examining into, τινός Xen.:—absol. inquiring, Xen.:—adv. -κῶς, Dem.
ἐξ. (sc. ἀργύριον) , the salary of an ἐξεταστής, Dem.

div1.head: ἑξέτης
div1.sense: six years old, Il., Ar.

div1.head: ἐξέτι
div1.sense: prep. with gen., even from, ἐξέτι πατρῶν even from the fathersʼ time, Od.

div1.head: ἐξευλαβέομαι
div1.sense: to guard carefully against, τι Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἐξευμαρίζω
div1.sense: to make light or easy, Eur.
Mid. to prepare, Lat. expedire, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξευμενίζω
div1.sense: to propitiate:—Mid., Plut.

div1.head: ἐξεύρεσις
div1.sense: a searching out, search, Hdt.
a finding out, invention, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξευρετέος
div1.sense: to be discovered, Ar.
ἐξευρετέον, one must find out, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξεύρημα
div1.sense: a thing found out, an invention, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξευρίσκω
div1.sense: to find out, discover, Il., Thuc., etc.
to invent, Hdt., Aesch.
simply to find, Soph.
to seek out, search after, Hdt.
to find out, win, get, procure, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξευτελίζω
div1.sense: to disparage greatly, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξευτρεπίζω
div1.sense: to make quite ready, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to boast aloud, proclaim, Aesch.
to pray earnestly, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξεφίημι
div1.sense: to enjoin, command, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξέχω
div1.sense: to stand out or project from, τινός Ar.
absol. to stand out, appear, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξέψω
div1.sense: to boil thoroughly, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔξηβος
div1.sense: past oneʼs youth, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to be leader of others, c. gen., Il.:—also c. acc. pers. to lead, direct, govern, Thuc.
to go first, lead the way, Hhymn., Hdt.
c. dat. pers. to shew one the way, go before, lead, Hdt., Soph., etc.
c. gen. rei, to conduct a business, Xen.
ἐξ. εἰς τὴν Ἑλλάδα to lead an army into Greece, Xen.

like Lat. praeire verbis, to prescribe or dictate a form of words, Eur., Dem.:—generally to prescribe, order, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:— to prescribe or expound the form to be observed in religious ceremonies, Hdt., Attic
to tell at length, relate in full, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐξήγησις
div1.sense: a statement, narrative, Thuc.
explanation, interpretation, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξηγητής
div1.sense: one who leads on, an adviser, Lat. auctor, Hdt., Dem.
an expounder, interpreter, of oracles, dreams, omens, and sacred customs, Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἐξηγητικός
div1.sense: of or for interpretation, Plut.

div1.head: ἑξηκονταέτης
div1.sense: sixty years old, Mimnerm.

div1.head: ἑξήκοντα
div1.sense: indecl. sixty, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἑξηκονταταλαντία
div1.sense: a company contributing a sum of 60 talents to the state, Dem.

div1.head: ἑξηκοστός
div1.sense: sixtieth, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐξήκω
div1.sense: to have reached a certain point, Soph., Plat.
of Time, to have run out or expired, to be over, Hdt., Soph., etc.
of prophecies, dreams, etc. to turn out true, Soph., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξήλατος
div1.sense: beaten out, of metal, Il.

div1.head: ἐξήλυσις
div1.sense: a way out, outlet, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑξῆμαρ
div1.sense: for six days, six days long, Od.

div1.head: ἐξημερόω
div1.sense: to tame or reclaim quite, Hdt., Eur.:—metaph. to soften, humanise, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξημέρωσις
div1.sense: a reclaiming, humanising, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξημοιβός
div1.sense: serving for change, εἵματα δʼ ἐξημοιβά changes of raiment, Od.

div1.head: ἑξήρετμος
div1.sense: of six banks of oars, Anth.

div1.head: ἑξήρης
div1.sense: with six banks of oars, ναῦς, Plut.

div1.head: ἑξῆς
div1.sense: one after another, in order, in a row, Hom.: in order, in a regular manner, Plat.
of Time, thereafter, next, Aesch., etc.; ἡ ἑξῆς ἡμέρα the next day, NTest.
c. gen. next to, Ar.; τούτων ἑξῆς next after this, Dem.; c. dat. next to, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξηχέω
div1.sense: to sound forth:—Pass. to be made known, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to cure thoroughly, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἐξιδιόομαι
div1.sense: to appropriate, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξιδίω
div1.sense: to exsude, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξιδρύω
div1.sense: to make to sit down, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξίημι
div1.sense: to send out, let one go out, Od.; γόου ἐξ ἔρον εἵην had dismissed, satisfied the desire of lamentation, Il.; ἐξιέναι πάντα κάλων (v. sub κάλως) :— to take out, Hdt.
intr. of rivers, to discharge themselves, Hdt., Thuc.
Mid. to put off from oneself, get rid of, πόσιος καὶ ἐδητύος ἐξ ἔρον ἕντο Hom.
to send from oneself, divorce, γυναῖκα Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξιθύνω
div1.sense: to make straight, Il.

div1.head: ἐξικετεύω
div1.sense: to intreat earnestly, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξικνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to reach, arrive at a place, c. acc., Hom., Trag.
c. acc. pers. to come to as a suppliant, Od.
c. acc. rei, to arrive at or reach an object, to complete, accomplish, Thuc.; so c. gen., Eur.
absol. to reach, Hdt., Xen.:—of mental operations, ὅσον δυνατός εἰμι ἐξικέσθαι so far as I can get by inquiry, Hdt.
of things, to be sufficient, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξιλάσκομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to propitiate, Orac. ap. Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐξιππάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to ride out or away, Plut.

div1.head: ἕξις
div1.sense: a having, possession, Plat.
(intr.) a habit of body, esp. a good habit, Xen., Plat.
a habit of mind, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξισόω
div1.sense: to make equal or even bring to a level with, Lat. exaequare, τινά or τί τινι Soph., Thuc.:— Mid. to make oneself equal, Babr.:—Pass. to be or become equal, τινι Plat., etc.; to be a match for, to rival, τινι Thuc.
to put on a level, τοὺς πολίτας Ar.
intr. to be equal or like, μητρὶ δʼ οὐδὲν ἐξισοῖ acts in no way like a mother, Soph.; ἐξ. τοῖς ἄλλοις Thuc.: so in Pass., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξίστημι
div1.sense: Causal in pres., imperf., fut., aor1: to put out of its place, to change or alter utterly, Arist., Plut.
metaph., ἐξιστάναι τινὰ φρενῶν to drive one out of his senses, Eur.; τοῦ φρονεῖν Xen.; absol. to derange, Dem.
intr. in Pass. and Mid., with aor2, perf., and plup. act.:
of Place, to stand aside from, ἐκστάντες τῆς ὁδοῦ out of the way, Hdt.; so, ἐκστῆναί τινι Soph., etc.:—metaph., ἐξ, ἕδρας ἐξέστηκε is displaced, disordered, Eur.
c. acc. to shrink from, shun, Soph., Dem.
c. gen. to retire from, give up possession of, τῆς ἀρχῆς Thuc.: — to cease from, abandon, τῶν μαθημάτων Xen.
ἐκστῆναι πατρός to lose oneʼs father, give him up, Ar.
φρενῶν ἐξεστάναι to lose oneʼs senses, Eur.: —then, absol. to be out of oneʼs wits, to be astonished, amazed, NTest.
to degenerate, οἶνος ἐξεστηκώς changed, sour wine, Dem.; πρόσωπα ἐξεστηκότα disfigured faces, Xen.
absol. to change oneʼs position, oneʼs opinion, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξιστορέω
div1.sense: to search out, inquire into, Aesch.
to inquire of, τινά τι Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξισχύω
div1.sense: to have strength enough, to be quite able to do, c. inf., NTest.

div1.head: ἐξίσχω
div1.sense: to put forth, Od.

div1.head: ἐξίσωσις
div1.sense: equalisation, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξισωτέος
div1.sense: one must make equal, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξίτηλος
div1.sense: going out, losing colour, fading, evanescent, Xen.:—metaph., ἐξ. γενέσθαι, of a family, to become extinct, Hdt.; of things, lost to memory, forgotten, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξιτητέος
div1.sense: one must go forth, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξιτός
div1.sense: to be come out of, τοῖς οὐκ ἐξιτόν ἐστι for whom there is no coming out, Hes.

div1.head: ἐξιχνευτέος
div1.sense: one must trace out, Luc.

div1.head: ἐξιχνεύω
div1.sense: to trace out, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξιχνοσκοπέω
div1.sense: to seek by tracking, Soph.; so in Mid., Soph.

div1.head: ἑξμέδιμνος
div1.sense: of, holding six medimni, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξογκόω
div1.sense: to make to swell: metaph., μητέρα τάφῳ ἐξογκοῦν to honour her by raising a tomb, Eur.: Pass. to be swelled out, πάντα ἐξώγκωτο he had all his garments stuffed out, Hdt.:—metaph. to be puffed up, elated, Hdt., Eur.; τὰ ἐξωγκωμένα full-sailed prosperity, Eur.; so in fut. mid., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξόγκωμα
div1.sense: anything swollen, ἐξ. λάϊνον a mound of stones, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξοδάω
div1.sense: to sell, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξόδιος
div1.sense: of or belonging to an exit:—as Subst., ἐξόδιον (sc. μέλος) , the finale of a tragedy, Plut.: metaph. a catastrophe, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξοδοιπορέω
div1.sense: to get out of, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἔξοδος
div1.sense: a going out, Hdt., Attic
a marching out, military expedition, Hdt., Attic
a solemn procession, Hdt., Dem.
a way out, outlet, Lat. exitus, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
like Lat. exitus, an end, close, Thuc., Xen.: the end or issue of an argument, Plat.: absol. departure, death, NTest.
the end of a tragedy, or music played at its close, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξοδυνάω
div1.sense: to pain greatly, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξόζω
div1.sense: intr. to smell, κακὸν ἐξόσδειν (Doric) to smell foully, Theocr.

div1.head: ἔξοιδα
div1.note: ἔξ-οιδα perf. in pres. sense, plup. ἐξῄδη as impf.,
div1.sense: to know thoroughly, know well, Il., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐξοιδέω
div1.sense: to swell or be swollen up, Eur., Luc.

div1.head: ἐξοικέω
div1.sense: to emigrate, Dem.
Pass. to be completely inhabited, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξοικήσιμος
div1.sense: habitable, inhabited, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξοικίζω
div1.sense: to remove one from his home, eject, banish, Eur., Thuc.:—Pass. and Mid. to go from home, remove, emigrate, Ar., Aeschin.
to dispeople, empty, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build completely, finish a building, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἐξοιμώζω
div1.sense: to wail aloud, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξοινόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be drunk, perf. part. ἐξῳνωμένος drunken, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξοιστέος
div1.sense: to be brought out: ἐξοιστέον, one must bring out, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξοιστράω
div1.sense: to make wild, madden, Luc.

div1.head: ἐξοιχνέω
div1.sense: to go out or forth, ἐξοιχνεῦσι (Ionic for -οῦσι) , Il.

div1.head: ἐξοίχομαι
div1.sense: to have gone out, to be quite gone, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἐξοιωνίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to avoid as ill-omened, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξοκέλλω
div1.sense: intr., of a ship, to run aground or ashore, Hdt., Aesch.
trans. to run (a ship) aground:—metaph. to drive headlong, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξολισθάνω
div1.sense: to glide off, slip away, Il.: to glance off, as a spear from a hard substance, Eur.: to slip out, escape, Ar.:—c. acc. to elude, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, Od., Eur., etc.
Mid., with perf. 2 ἐξόλωλα, to perish utterly, Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐξολεθρεύω
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξολολύζω
div1.sense: to howl aloud, Batr.

div1.head: ἐξομαλίζω
div1.sense: to smooth away, Babr.

div1.head: ἐξομήρευσις
div1.sense: a demand of hostages, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξομηρεύω
div1.sense: Mid. to take as hostages, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξομιλέω
div1.sense: to have intercourse, live with, τινί Xen.: to bear one company, Eur.
Mid. to be away from oneʼs friends, be alone in the crowd, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξόμιλος
div1.sense: out of oneʼs own society, alien, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξομματόω
div1.sense: to open the eyes of: Pass. to be restored to sight, Soph. ap. Ar.
metaph. to make clear or plain, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξόμνυμι
div1.sense: to swear in excuse, Dem.: to swear in the negative, ἐξ. τὸ μὴ εἰδέναι Soph.:—mostly in Mid., to deny or disown upon oath, swear formally that one does not know a thing, Dem., etc.
to decline an office by oath that one cannot perform it, Aeschin., etc.

div1.head: ἐξομοιόω
div1.sense: to make quite like, to assimilate, Hdt., Plat.:—Pass. to become or be like, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξομοίωσις
div1.sense: a becoming like, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξομολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to confess in full, Plut., NTest.
to make full acknowledgments, give thanks, NTest.
in Act. to agree, promise, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξομόργνυμι
div1.sense: to wipe off from, Eur.:— Mid. to wipe off from oneself, purge away a pollution, Eur.
metaph., ἐξομόρξασθαί τινι μωρίαν to wipe off oneʼs folly on another, i. e. give him part of it, Eur.
to stamp or imprint upon, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξονειδίζω
div1.sense: c. acc. rei, to cast in oneʼs teeth, Soph., Eur.; ἐξονειδισθεὶς κακά having foul reproaches cast upon one, Soph.:—simply, to bring forward, Lat. objicere, Eur.
c. acc. pers. to reproach, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξονομάζω
div1.sense: to utter aloud, announce, Hom.
to call by name, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξονομαίνω
div1.sense: to name, speak of by name, Hom.

div1.head: ἐξονομακλήδην
div1.sense: by name, calling by name, Hom.

div1.head: ἐξόπιθεν
div1.sense: behind, in rear, Il.
as prep. with gen. behind, ἐξ. κεράων Il.

div1.head: ἐξόπισθεν
div1.sense: Attic for ἐξόπιθεν, Ar.
as prep. with gen., Ar.

div1.head: ἐξοπίσω
div1.sense: of Place, backwards, back again, Il.
as prep. with gen. behind, Il.
of Time, hereafter, Od.

div1.head: ἐξοπλίζω
div1.sense: to arm completely, accoutre, Hdt., Xen.: —Mid. and Pass. to arm or accoutre oneself, Eur.: to get under arms, stand in armed array, Eur., Xen.:— generally, ἐξωπλισμένος fully prepared, all ready, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξοπλισία
div1.sense: a being under arms, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξόπλισις
div1.sense: a getting under arms, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξοπτάω
div1.sense: to bake thoroughly, Hdt., Eur.
to heat violently, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξοράω
div1.sense: to see from afar: Pass., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξοργίζω
div1.sense: to enrage, Xen., Aeschin.:—Pass. to be furious, Batr.

div1.head: ἐξορθιάζω
div1.sense: to lift up the voice, to cry aloud, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξορθόω
div1.sense: to set upright: metaph. to set right, secure, restore, Soph.: Pass., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξορίζω
div1.sense: to send beyond the frontier, banish, Lat. exterminare, Eur., etc.
to expose a child, Eur.
to get rid of a thing, Plat.
c. acc. loci only, ἄλλην ἀπʼ ἄλλης ἐξ. πόλιν to pass from one to another, Eur.
in Pass. to come forth from, τινος Eur.

div1.head: ἐξορίνω
div1.sense: to exasperate, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐξόριστος
div1.sense: expelled, banished, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξορκίζω
div1.sense: to adjure, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξορκιστής
div1.sense: an exorcist, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξορκόω
div1.sense: to swear a person, administer an oath to one, c. acc. pers., or absol., ἐξορκούντων οἱ πρυτάνεις Foed. ap. Thuc., Dem.; followed by ἦ μήν (Ionic ἦ μέν) c. inf. fut., Hdt., etc.: c. acc. rei, to make one swear by a thing, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξόρκωσις
div1.sense: a binding by oath, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξορμάω
div1.sense: to send forth, send to war, Aesch., Eur.; ἐξ. τὴν ναῦν to start the ship, set it agoing, Thuc.:—Pass. to set out, start, Hdt., Eur., etc.; of arrows, to spring from the bow, Eur.
to excite to action, urge on, Eur., Thuc.
intr., like Pass., to set out, start, of a ship, Od., Xen.: c. gen. to set out from, Eur.:—metaph. to break out, of a disease, Soph.; σφοδρὸς ἐφʼ ὅ τι ἐφορμήσειε eager in all that he attempted, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξορμέω
div1.sense: to be out of harbour, run out, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐξορμίζω
div1.sense: to bring out of harbour, Dem.
to let down, Eur.: perf. pass. in mid. sense, ἐξώρμισαι σὸν πόδα thou hast come forth, Eur.

div1.head: ἔξορμος
div1.sense: sailing from a harbour, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξορούω
div1.sense: to leap forth, Hom.

div1.head: ἐξορύσσω
div1.sense: to dig out the earth from a trench, Hdt.
to dig out of the ground, dig up, Hdt., Ar.: metaph., ἐξ. αὐτῶν τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to dance away, hop off, Dem.
c. acc. rei, to dance out, i. e. to let out, betray secrets, Luc.

div1.head: ἐξοσιόω
div1.sense: to dedicate, devote, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξοστρακίζω
div1.sense: to banish by ostracism, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἐξοστρακισμός
div1.sense: banishment by ostracism, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξότε
div1.sense: from the time when, Ar.

div1.head: ἐξοτρύνω
div1.sense: to stir up, urge on, excite, τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Aesch., Eur.; τινὰ ἐπί τι Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξουδενόω
div1.sense: to set at naught, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξούλης
div1.sense: ἐξούλης δίκη, an action against exclusion, brought by one who was excluded from property by the defendant in a suit, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξουσία
div1.sense: power or authority to do a thing, c. inf., Thuc., Xen.; c. gen. power over, licence in a thing, Thuc., Plat.
absol. power, authority, might, as opp. to right, Thuc.: also licence, Dem.
an office, magistracy, Lat. potestas, Plat.
as concrete, also like Lat. potestas, the body of the magistrates, in pl., the authorities, NTest.
abundance of means, resources, Thuc.
pomp, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξουσιάζω
div1.sense: to exercise over, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: ἐξοφέλλω
div1.sense: to increase exceedingly, ἐξώφελλεν ἔεδνα offered still higher dowry, Od.

div1.head: ἐξόφθαλμος
div1.sense: with prominent eyes, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξοχή
div1.sense: prominence: οἱ κατʼ ἐξοχήν the chiefmen, NTest.

div1.head: ἔξοχος
div1.sense: standing out: metaph. eminent, excellent, Hom.

c. gen. standing out from, most eminent, greatest, mightiest, used like a superl., ἔξοχος ἡρώων, ἔξ. ἄλλων Il.; but a real Sup. ἐξοχώτατος Aesch., Eur.:—also c. dat., μέγʼ ἔξοχοι αἰπολίοισιν eminent among the herds, Od.; so, ἐν πολλοῖσι ἔξοχος ἡρώεσσιν Il.
neut. pl. ἔξοχα as adv., especially, above others, Hom.; ἐμοὶ δόσαν ἔξοχα gave me as a high honour, Od.; ἔξοχʼ ἄριστοι beyond compare the best, Hom.
c. gen., ἔξοχα πάντων far above all, Hom.

div1.head: ἐξοχυρόω
div1.sense: to fortify strongly, Plut.

div1.head: ἐξυβρίζω
div1.sense: to break out into insolence, to run riot, wax wanton, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; ἐξ. ἐς τόδε to come to this pitch of insolence, Thuc.: with an adj. neut., παντοῖα ἐξ. to commit all kinds of violence, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξυπανίστημι
div1.sense: σμῶδιξ μεταφρένου ἐξυπανέστη a weal started up from under the skin of the back, Il.

div1.head: ἐξυπειπεῖν
div1.sense: to advise, Eur.

div1.head: ἕξ
div1.sense: six, Hom., etc.—In composition, before δ κ π, it becomes ἑκ, as ἕκδραχμος, ἑκκαίδεκα, ἕκπλεθρος; or has α inserted, as ἑξάκλινος, etc.

div1.head: ἐξ
div1.sense: Lat. ex, the form of the prep. ἐκ, before a vowel and before some consonants, as ῥ σ.

div1.head: ἐξύπερθε
div1.sense: from above, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξυπηρετέω
div1.sense: to assist to the utmost, Soph.

div1.head: ἐξυπνίζω
div1.sense: to awaken from sleep, NTest.: —Pass. to wake up, Plut.

div1.head: ἔξυπνος
div1.sense: awakened out of sleep, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξυπτιάζω
div1.sense: to turn upside down, Lat. resupinare, Aesch.; ἐξ. ἑαυτόν throwing back his head haughtily, Luc.

div1.head: ἐξυφαίνω
div1.sense: to finish weaving, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξύφασμα
div1.sense: a finished web, Eur.

div1.head: ἐξυφηγέομαι
div1.sense: to lead the way, Soph.

div1.head: ἔξωθεν
div1.sense: from without, Trag., Plat., etc.:— c. gen., ἔξ. δόμων from without the house, Eur.
= ἔξω, Hdt., Plat., etc.; οἱ ἔξωθεν foreigners, Hdt.; τὰ ἔξωθεν matters outside the house, Aesch., etc.:—c. gen. without, free from, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξωθέω
div1.sense: to thrust out, force out, wrench out, Il.: to expel, eject, banish, Soph.:— to thrust back, Soph., Thuc.:—Pass., ἐξωθέεσθαι ἐκ τῆς χώρης Hdt.; πατρίδος ἐξωθούμενος Soph.
ἐξ. γλώσσας ὀδύναν to put forth painful words, to break forth into cruel words, Soph.
to drive out of the sea, drive on shore, Lat. ejicere, Thuc.: metaph., ἐξωσθῆναι ἐς χειμῶνα Thuc.

div1.head: ἐξώλεια
div1.sense: utter destruction, κατʼ ἐξωλείας ὀμόσαι to swear with deadly imprecations against oneself, Dem.; ἐπαρᾶσθαι ἐξώλειαν αὑτῷ Dem.

div1.head: ἐξώλης
div1.sense: utterly destroyed, Hdt., Dem.: in imprecations, ἐξ. ἀπόλοιο Ar.; cf. προώλης.

div1.head: ἐξωμίας
div1.sense: one with arms bare to the shoulder, Luc.

div1.head: ἐξωμιδοποιΐα
div1.sense: the making of an ἐξωμίς, Xen.

div1.head: ἐξωμίς
div1.sense: a manʼs vest without sleeves, leaving both shoulders bare, or with one sleeve, leaving one shoulder bare, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ἐξωμοσία
div1.sense: denial on oath that one knows anything of a matter, Ar., Dem.
a declining an office on oath, in case of ill health, Dem.

div1.head: ἐξωνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to buy off, redeem:—generally, to buy, Hdt., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐξώπιος
div1.sense: out of sight of, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐξωριάζω
div1.sense: to leave out of thought, Aesch.

div1.head: ἔξω
div1.etym: adverb of ἐξ, as εἴσω of εἰς
div1.sense: of Place
with Verbs of motion, out, ἔξω ἰών Od.; χωρεῖν ἔξω Hdt., etc.:—c. gen. out of, Hom., etc.:—c. acc., ἔξω τὸν Ἑλλήσποντον outside the H., Hdt.

without any sense of motion, like ἐκτός, outside, without, Od.: τὸ ἔξω the outside, Thuc.; τὰ ἔξω things outside the walls, Thuc.; τὰ ἔξω πράγματα foreign affairs, Thuc.;— οἱ ἔξω those outside, Thuc. (in NTest. the heathen); —ἡ ἔξω θάλασσα, the Ocean, opp. to ἡ ἐντός (the Mediterranean sea), Hdt.:—c. gen., οἱ ἔξω γένους Soph.; ἔξω τοξεύματος, ἔξω βελῶν out of shot, Thuc., Xen.; ἔξω τινὸς εἶναι to have nothing to do with it, Thuc.; ἔξω τοῦ φρονεῖν out of oneʼs senses, Eur.:—proverb., ἔξω τοῦ πηλοῦ αἴρειν πόδα to keep clear of difficulties, Aesch.; πημάτων ἔξω πόδα ἔχειν Aesch.
of Time, beyond, over, ἔξω μέσου ἡμέρας Xen.
without, but, except, c. gen., , Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἔξωρος
div1.sense: untimely, out of season, unfitting, Soph.:— superannuated, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐξώστης
div1.sense: one who drives out, Eur.:— ἐξ. ἄνεμοι violent winds which drive ships ashore, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐξωτάτω
div1.sense: outermost, Plat.

div1.head: ἐξώτερος
div1.sense: outer, utter, NTest.

div1.head: ἐξωτέρω
div1.sense: more outside, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἔοικα
div1.etym: from εἴκω, of which we have 3rd sg. imperf. εἶκε, it seemed good, Il.; fut. εἴξω, will be like, Ar.
div1.sense: to be like:

to be like, look like, τινι Hom., etc.:—with the part., where we use the inf., αἰεὶ γὰρ δίφρου ἐπιβησομένοισι ἐΐκτην seemed always just about to set foot upon the chariot, Il.; ἔοικε σπεύδοντι seems anxious, Plat.

to seem likely, c. inf., in phrases which we render by making the Verb impersonal, as in the Lat. videor videre, methinks I see, χλιδᾶν ἔοικας methinks thou art delicate, Aesch.; ἔοικα οὐκ εἰδέναι Soph.
impers., ἔοικε it seems; ὡς ἔοικε as it seems, Soph., etc.; ὡς ἔοικε used to modify a statement, probably, I believe, Plat.:—so also personal, ὡς ἔοικας Soph.
to beseem, befit, c. dat. pers., Xen.
impers., ἔοικε it is fitting, right, seemly, reasonable, mostly with a negat. and foll. by inf., οὐκ ἔστʼ, οὐδὲ ἔοικε, ἀρνήσασθαι it is not possible, nor is it seemly, to deny, Hom.
part. ἐοικώς, εἰκώς, Ionic οἰκώς, υῖα, ός,
seeming like, like, Hom., etc.
fitting, seemly, meet, Hom.
likely, probable, εἰκός ἐστι, for ἔοικε, Soph.; also ὡς εἰκός, Ionic ὡς οἰκός, for ὡς ἔοικε, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐοικότως
div1.sense: similarly, like, Aesch.
reasonably, fairly, naturally, Hdt.; οὐκ εἰκότως unfairly, Thuc.

div1.head: ἑορτάζω
div1.sense: to keep festival or holiday, Hdt., Eur.
to celebrate as or by a festival, Plut.

div1.head: ἑορτάσιμος
div1.sense: of or for a festival, Luc.

div1.head: ἑορτή
div1.sense: a feast or festival, holiday, Od., Hdt., etc.; ὁρτὴν or ἑορτὴν ἄγειν to keep a feast, Hdt., Thuc.; ἑορτὴν ἑορτάζειν Xen.
generally, holidaymaking, amusement, pastime, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: ἑός
div1.sense: possessive adj. of 3 pers. sg. his, her own, Lat. suus, Hom., etc.; never in Attic Prose.

div1.head: ἐπαγάλλομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to glory in, exult in a thing, c. dat., Il.; ἐπί τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαγανακτέω
div1.sense: to be indignant at, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαγγελία
div1.sense: a public denunciation of one who, being subject to ἀτιμία, yet takes partin public affairs, Aeschin., Dem.
an offer, promise, profession, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπαγγέλλω
div1.sense: to tell, proclaim, announce, Od., Hdt., etc.:— Mid. to let proclamation be made, Hdt.
to give orders, command, Hdt., Thuc.; c. acc., στρατιὰν ἐπ., like Lat. milites imperare, to order an army to be furnished, Thuc.:—also in Mid., Hdt.
as Attic law-term, to denounce one who, having incurred ἀτιμία, yet takes part in public affairs, Aeschin., etc.
to promise, τί τινι Aesch.:—so in Mid., Hdt., Attic:—absol. to make offers, Hdt.
to profess, make profession of, τι Dem.:—so in Mid., like Lat. profiteri, Xen., Plat.
to demand, require, Foed. ap. Thuc.; so in Mid., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπάγγελμα
div1.sense: a promise, profession, Dem.:— oneʼs profession, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαγείρω
div1.sense: to gather together, collect, of things, Il.:—Pass., of men, to assemble, Od.

div1.head: ἐπάγερσις
div1.sense: a mustering of forces, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαγινέω
div1.sense: to bring to, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαγλαΐζω
div1.sense: to honour still more:—Pass. to pride oneself on a thing, glory or exult in it, Il.

div1.head: ἐπάγνυμι
div1.sense: to break: perf. ἐπέᾱγα intr., Hes.

div1.head: ἐπαγρυπνέω
div1.sense: to keep awake and brood over, τινί Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπάγω
div1.sense: to bring on, Od., Aesch.: to bring upon, τί τινι Hes., Attic
to set on, urge on, as hunters do dogs, Od., Xen.
to lead on an army against the enemy, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
to lead on by persuasion, influence, Od., Eur.; c. inf. to induce him to do, Eur.
to bring in, invite as aiders or allies, Hdt., Dem.
to bring to a place, bring in, Hdt., etc.:— to bring in, supply, Thuc.
to lay on or apply to one, ἐπ. κέντρον ἵπποις, of a charioteer, Eur.; ἔπαγε γνάθον lay your jaws to it, Ar.
to bring forward, propose a measure, Thuc., Xen.; so, ἐπ. δίκην, γραφήν τινι, Lat. intendere litem alicui, Plat., etc.
to bring in over and above, to add, τι Aesch., Ar.:— to intercalate days in the year, Hdt.
Mid. to procure or provide for oneself, Thuc.:—metaph., Ἅιδα φεῦξιν ἐπ. to devise, invent a means of shunning death, Soph.
of persons, to bring into oneʼs country, bring in or introduce as allies, Hdt., Thuc.
to call in as witnesses, adduce, Plat., etc.
to bring upon oneself, φθόνον Xen.; δουλείαν Dem.
to bring with one, Xen.
to bring over to oneself, win over, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπαγωγή
div1.sense: a bringing in, supplying, Thuc.
a bringing in to oneʼs aid, introduction, Thuc.
a drawing on, alluring, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπαγώγιμος
div1.sense: imported, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαγωγός
div1.sense: attractive, tempting, alluring, seductive, Hdt., Thuc.:— ἐπαγωγόν ἐστι, c. inf., it is a temptation, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contend with, τινι Plut.
c. dat. rei, to contend for a thing, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπαγώνιος
div1.sense: helping in the contest, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπαείδω
div1.sense: to sing to or in accompaniment, Hdt., Eur.
to sing as an incantation, Xen., Plat.;—absol., ἐπαείδων by means of charms, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπαέξω
div1.sense: to make to grow or prosper, Od.

div1.head: ἔπαθλον
div1.sense: the prize of a contest, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαθροίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to assemble besides, NTest., Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαιάζω
div1.sense: to cry αἰαῖ over, mourn over, τινί Luc.
to join in wailing, Bion.

div1.head: ἐπαιγιαλῖτις
div1.sense: on the beach, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπαιγίζω
div1.sense: to rush furiously upon, of a stormy wind, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπαιδέομαι
