div1.sense: Dep., to be ashamed, c. inf., Eur.; σὺ δʼ οὐκ ἐπαιδεῖ, εἰ .. , te non pudet, si . . , Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαίθω
div1.sense: to kindle, set on fire, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπαίνεσις
div1.sense: praise, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπαινετέος
div1.sense: one must praise, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαινέτης
div1.sense: a commender, admirer, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπαινετός
div1.sense: to be praised, laudable, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαινέω
div1.etym: poetic but not Attic are ἐπ-αινήσω, ἐπ-ῄνησα
div1.sense: to approve, applaud, commend, Lat. laudare, Hom., etc.; ἐπ. τινά τι to commend one for a thing, Aesch.
to compliment publicly, panegyrize, Thuc.
to undertake to do, c. inf., Eur.
the aor. ἐπῄνεσα is in Attic used in a pres. sense, ἐπῄνεσʼ ἔργον I commend it, Soph.: and absol., well done! Ar.
to recommend, exhort, advise, c. inf., Soph.
as a civil form of declining an offer, I thank you, I am much obliged, κάλλιστʼ, ἐπαινῶ Ar.; so, ἐπ. τὴν κλῆσιν to decline it, Xen.
of Rhapsodists, to declaim, Plat.

div1.head: ἔπαινος
div1.sense: approval, praise, commendation, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐπαινός
div1.sense: dread, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπαίρω
div1.sense: to lift up and set on a car or stand, c. gen., Il.
to lift, raise, Il., Soph., etc.: Mid., ὅπλα ἐπαίρεσθαι Eur.
to exalt, magnify, Xen.
intr. to lift up oneʼs leg or rise up, Hdt.
to stir up, excite, Hdt., Soph., etc.: — to induce or persuade one to do, c. inf., Hdt., Ar.: —Pass. to be led on, excited, Hdt., etc.
Pass., also, to be elated at a thing, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—absol. to be conceited or proud, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπαισθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to have a perception or feeling of, c. gen., Soph.
c. acc. to perceive, hear, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαΐσσω
div1.sense: to rush at or upon, c. gen., Il.
c. dat. pers. to rush upon her, Od.
c. acc. to assail, assault, Ἕκτορα Il.:—Mid., ἐπαΐξασθαι ἄεθλον to rush at (i. e. seize upon) the prize, Il.
absol., of a hawk, ταρφέʼ ἐπαΐσσει makes frequent swoops, Il.; of the wind, Il., Attic
later, ἐπ. πόδα to move with hasty step, Eur.:—Pass., χεῖρες ἐπαΐσσονται they move lightly, Il.

div1.head: ἐπάϊστος
div1.sense: heard of, detected, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαισχύνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to be ashamed at or of, τινι Hdt.; τινι Hdt.; τινα or τι Xen.:—c. inf. to be ashamed to do, Aesch.; c. part. to be ashamed of doing or having done a thing, Hdt., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐπαιτέω
div1.sense: to ask besides, Il., Soph.:—so in Mid., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαιτιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to bring a charge against, accuse, τινα Hdt., Attic; ἐπ. τινά τινος to accuse one of a thing, Thuc., Dem.; c. inf. to accuse one of doing a thing, Soph., etc.:—c. acc. rei, to lay the blame upon, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαίτιος
div1.sense: blamed for a thing, blameable, blameworthy, Il., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐπαΐω
div1.sense: to give ear to, c. gen., Aesch., Eur.
to perceive, feel, c. gen., Hdt.
to understand, c. acc., Soph., Ar.
to profess knowledge, to be a professor in any subject, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαιωρέω
div1.sense: to keep hovering over, keep in suspense, Anth.
Pass. to hover over, to buoy up, Luc.
to overhang, threaten, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἐπακμάζω
div1.sense: to come to its bloom, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπακολουθέω
div1.sense: to follow close upon, follow after, τινί Ar., Plat.;—absol., Thuc., etc.
to pursue as an enemy, Thuc., etc.
to follow mentally, τῷ λόγῳ Plat.
to follow, i. e. comply with, τοῖς πάθεσι Dem.

div1.head: ἐπακολούθημα
div1.sense: a consequence, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπακουός
div1.sense: attentive to, c. gen., Hes.

div1.head: ἐπακούω
div1.sense: to listen or hearken to, to hear, c. acc., Hom., Attic: also c. gen., Hdt., Eur.:— c. acc. rei et gen. pers. to hear a thing from a person, Od.
absol. to give ear, hearken, Aesch., etc.
to obey, τινός Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπακρίζω
div1.sense: to reach the top of a thing, αἱμάτων ἐπήκρισε he reached the highest point in deeds of blood, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπακτέος
div1.sense: one must apply, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπακτήρ
div1.sense: a hunter, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπάκτιος
div1.sense: on the shore, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπακτός
div1.sense: brought in, imported, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
of persons, alien, Eur.;—of foreign allies or mercenaries, Aesch., Soph.;—also, ἐπακτὸς ἀνήρ, i. e. an adulterer, Soph.; ἐπ. πατήρ a false father, Eur.
brought upon oneself, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπακτρίς
div1.sense: a light vessel, skiff, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπακτροκέλης
div1.sense: a light piratical skiff, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπαλαλάζω
div1.sense: to raise the war-cry, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαλάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor1 pass. to wander about or over, πόλλʼ ἐπαληθείς Od.

div1.head: ἐπαλαστέω
div1.sense: to be full of wrath at a thing, Od.

div1.head: ἐπαλγέω
div1.sense: to grieve over, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπαλείφω
div1.sense: to smear over, plaster up, Od.

div1.head: ἐπαλέξω
div1.sense: to defend, aid, help, τινί Il.
to ward off, keep off, c. acc., Il.

div1.head: ἐπαληθεύω
div1.sense: to prove true, verify, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπαλής
div1.sense: open to the sun, sunny, Hes.

div1.head: ἐπαλκής
div1.sense: strong, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπαλλαγή
div1.sense: an interchange, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαλλάσσω
div1.sense: to interchange, πολέμοιο πεῖραρ ἐπαλλάξαντες making the rope-end of war go now this way, now that, i. e. fighting with doubtful victory, (metaph. from a game like "soldiers and sailors"), Il.:—Pass. to cross one another, Xen.; ποὺς ἐπαλλαχθεὶς ποδί closely joined, Eur.: to be entangled, perplexed, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπάλληλος
div1.sense: one after another, ἐπαλλήλοιν χεροῖν by one anotherʼs hands, Soph.

div1.head: ἔπαλξις
div1.sense: a means of defence: in pl. battlements, Il., Hdt., etc.:—in sg. the battlements, parapet, Il., Thuc.
generally, a defence, protection, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπαμαξεύω
div1.sense: to traverse with cars, γῆ ἐπημαξευμένη τροχοῖσι marked with the tracks of wheels, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαμάομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to scrape together for oneself, εὐνὴν ἐπαμήσατο heaped him up a bed (of leaves), Od.; γῆν ἐπαμησάμενος having heaped up a grave, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαμβατήρ
div1.sense: one who mounts upon, an assailant, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπαμείβω
div1.sense: to exchange, barter, Il.:—Mid. to come one after another, come in turn to, Il.

div1.head: ἐπαμοιβαδίς
div1.sense: interchangeably, Od.

div1.head: ἐπαμοίβιμος
div1.sense: in exchange, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπαμπέχω
div1.sense: to put on over, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπαμύντωρ
div1.sense: a helper, defender, Od.

div1.head: ἐπαμύνω
div1.sense: to come to aid, defend, assist, τινί Il., Thuc., etc.:—absol., Il., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐπαμφοτερίζω
div1.sense: of words, to admit a double sense, Plat.; of persons, to play a double game, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπαναβληδόν
div1.sense: thrown over, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαναβοάω
div1.sense: to cry out, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπαναγκάζω
div1.sense: to compel by force, constrain to do a thing, c. inf., Aesch., Ar.

div1.head: ἐπανάγκης
div1.sense: ἐπάναγκες ἐστί it is necessary, c. inf., etc.: as adv. by compulsion, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαναγορεύω
div1.sense: to proclaim publicly:—impers. in Pass., ἐπαναγορεύεται proclamation is made, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπανάγω
div1.sense: to bring up: to stir up, excite, Hdt.
to draw back an army, Thuc.
to bring back to the point, Xen., Dem.
intr. to withdraw, retreat, Xen.
to put out to sea, ναῦς Xen.; and without ναῦς, NTest.: so in Pass. to put to sea against, τινι Hdt.; absol., Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπαναθεάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contemplate again, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαναιρέω
div1.sense: Mid. to take upon one, enter into, Lat. suscipere, Plat.
to withdraw, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαναίρω
div1.sense: to lift up, Xen.:—Mid. to raise one against another, Soph., Thuc.:—Pass. to rise up, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπανακαλέω
div1.sense: to recall.

div1.head: ἐπανάκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be imposed upon as punishment, τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἐπανακλαγγάνω
div1.sense: to give tongue again and again, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπανακύπτω
div1.sense: to have an upward tendency, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαναλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take up again, resume, repeat, Plat.
to revise, correct, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαναλίσκω
div1.sense: to consume still more, χρόνον Dem.

div1.head: ἐπαναμένω
div1.sense: to wait longer, Hdt.
to wait for one, τινά Ar.:—impers., τί μʼ ἐπαμμένει παθεῖν; what is there in store for me to suffer? Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπαναμιμνῄσκω
div1.sense: to remind one of, τινά τι Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανανεόομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to renew, revive, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαναπαύω
div1.sense: Mid. to rest upon, depend upon, τινι and ἐπί τινα NTest.

div1.head: ἐπαναπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap upon, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπαναπλέω
div1.sense: to put to sea against, ἐπί τινα Hdt.; ἐπί τι for a purpose, Xen.
to sail back again, Xen.
metaph., ἐπαναπλώει ὑμῖν ἔπεα κακά ill language floats upwards, rises, to your tongue, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαναρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to tear open again, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαναρρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw up in the air: intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) to spring high in the air, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπανάσεισις
div1.sense: a brandishing against, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπανασκοπέω
div1.sense: to consider yet again, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανάστασις
div1.sense: a rising up against, an insurrection, Hdt., Thuc.; ἐπαναστάσεις θρόνων rebellions (i. e. rebels) against the throne, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαναστρέφω
div1.sense: intr. to turn back upon one, wheel round and return to the charge, Ar., Thuc.:— so in Pass., Ar.

div1.head: ἐπανατείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out and hold up, Xen.; ἐπ. ἐλπίδας to hold out hopes, Xen.
Mid. to hold over as a threat, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπανατέλλω
div1.sense: to lift up, raise, Eur.
intr. to rise, of the sun, Hdt.; to rise from bed, Aesch.:— to appear, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπανατίθημι
div1.sense: to lay upon, τί τινι Ar.

div1.head: ἐπανατρέχω
div1.sense: to recur, πρός τι Luc.

div1.head: ἐπαναφέρω
div1.sense: to throw back upon, ascribe, refer, τι τίνι or εἴς τινα Solon., Ar., etc.
to put into the account, Dem.
to bring back a message, in Mid., Xen.
intr. to come back, return, ἐπί τι Plat.
Pass. to rise, as an exhalation, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαναχωρέω
div1.sense: to go back again, to retreat, return, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐπαναχώρησις
div1.sense: a return, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπανδιπλάζω
div1.sense: to reiterate questions, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπάνειμι
div1.sense: to go back, return, Thuc.:—in writing or speaking, to return to a point, Hdt., etc.
c. acc. rei, to recapitulate, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανειπεῖν
div1.sense: aor2 with no pres. in use, to offer by public proclamation, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπανέρομαι
div1.sense: Mid., to question again and again, Hdt.:—Attic aor2 ἐπανηρόμην Aesch., Ar.; τὸν θεὸν ἐπανήροντο εἰ . . Thuc.
to ask again, ἐπ. τινά τι Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor2 and perf. act.:— to go back, return, ἐκ τόπου Thuc.:—in writing or speaking, to return to a point, Eur., Xen., Dem.
c. acc. rei, to recapitulate, Xen.
to go up, ascend, Xen.: to go up or pass from one place to another, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπανερωτάω
div1.sense: of persons, to question again, Xen.
of things, to ask over again, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανέχω
div1.sense: to hold up, support, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπανήκω
div1.sense: to have come back, to return, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπανηλογέω
div1.sense: to recount, recapitulate, Hdt.: but perh. ἐπαλιλλόγησα is the true form: v. παλιλ-λογέω.

div1.head: ἐπανθέω
div1.sense: to bloom, be in flower, Theocr.
metaph. of any thing that forms on the surface, as a salt crust, Hdt.; the down on fruit, Ar., etc.: generally, to be upon the surface, shew itself, appear plainly, Ar.
to be bright, Babr.

div1.head: ἐπανθίζω
div1.sense: to deck as with flowers, to make bright-coloured, Luc.:—metaph. to decorate, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπανθοπλοκέω
div1.sense: to plait of or with flowers, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπανθρακίδες
div1.sense: small fish for frying, small fry, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπανίημι
div1.sense: to let loose at, τινά τινι Il.
to let go back, relax, Dem.
intr. to relax, leave off doing, c. part., Plat.: absol., ἐπανῆκεν ὁ σῖτος corn fell in price, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπανισόω
div1.sense: to make quite equal, to balance evenly, equalise, τινα πρός τινα Thuc.: absol. to provide compensation, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανίστημι
div1.sense: to set up again, Plat.
to make to rise against, Plut.
Pass., with fut. mid., aor2 and perf. act. to stand up after another or at his word, Il.: to rise from bed, Ar.: to rise to speak, Dem.:—of buildings, to be raised, Ar.
to rise up against, rise in insurrection against, τινι Hdt., Thuc.: absol. to rise in insurrection, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπανιτέος
div1.sense: one must return to a point, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπάνοδος
div1.sense: a rising up, Plat.
in speaking, recapitulation, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανορθόω
div1.sense: to set up again, restore, Thuc., etc.
to correct, amend, revise, Plat.; so in Mid., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανόρθωμα
div1.sense: a correction, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπανόρθωσις
div1.sense: a correcting, revisal, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπαναβαίνω
div1.sense: to get up on, mount, Ar.; ἐπαναβεβηκότες mounted on horseback, Hdt.
to go up inland, Thuc.:— to go up, ascend, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαναβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw back over: in Mid. to throw back, defer, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαναβιβάζω
div1.sense: to make to mount upon, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπάντης
div1.sense: steep, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπαντιάζω
div1.sense: to fall in with others, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπαντλέω
div1.sense: to pump over or upon, pour over, Plat.:—Pass. to be filled, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπανύω
div1.sense: to complete, accomplish, Hes.:— Mid. to procure, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπάνωθεν
div1.sense: from above, above, Eur., Thuc.
οἱ ἐπ. men of former time, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπάνω
div1.sense: above, atop, on the upper side or part, Plat.; ὁ ἐπάνω πύργος the upper tower, Hdt.
c. gen. above, Hdt., Plat.
above, in a book, Lat. supra, Xen.
of Number, above, more than, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπάξιος
div1.sense: worthy, deserving of, τινος Aesch., Eur.:—c. inf., Soph.
of things, deserved, meet, Aesch., Soph., etc.; κυρεῖν τῶν ἐπαξίων to meet with oneʼs deserts, Aesch.:—so, adv. -ίως, Soph.
worth mentioning, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπαξιόω
div1.sense: to think right, deem right to do a thing, c. inf., Soph.
to expect, believe, c. acc. et inf., Soph.; ἐπ. τινά to deem one worthy of honour, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαξόνιος
div1.sense: upon an axle, δίφρος Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπαπειλέω
div1.sense: to hold out as a threat to one, τί τινι Hom., Hdt., Soph.:—c. dat. only, to threaten, Il.:—c. inf. to threaten to do, Hdt., Soph.; inf. omitted, ὡς ἐπαπείλησεν as he threatened, Il.:—Pass. to be threatened, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαποδύω
div1.sense: to strip for combat against, τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαποθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die after, τινί Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαποπνίγω
div1.sense: to choke besides:—Pass. aor2 opt., ἐπαποπνιγείης, may you be choked besides, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπαρά
div1.sense: an imprecation, Il.

div1.head: ἐπαράομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to imprecate curses upon, τινι Hdt.; ἐπ. λόγον to utter an imprecation, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαραρίσκω
div1.sense: to fit to or upon, fasten to, τί τινι Il.
intr. in Ionic perf. ἐπάρηρα, plup. ἐπαρήρειν, to fit tight or exactly, to be fitted therein, Il.: ἐπάρμενος, η, ον, Epic aor2 pass. part. prepared, Hes.

div1.head: ἐπαράσσω
div1.sense: to dash to, θύραν Plat.

div1.head: ἐπάρατος
div1.sense: accursed, laid under a curse, Thuc.; ἐπάρατον ἦν μὴ οἰκεῖν there was an imprecation against inhabiting it, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπάργεμος
div1.sense: having a film over the eye: metaph. dim, obscure, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπάργυρος
div1.sense: overlaid with silver, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπάρδω
div1.sense: to irrigate, refresh, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπαρήγω
div1.sense: to come to aid, help, τινί Hom., Eur.: absol., aor1 imperat. ἐπαρῆξον Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπαρίστερος
div1.sense: towards the left, on the left hand, τὰ ἐπαρίστερα as adv., Hdt.
metaph. lefthanded, awkward, French gauche, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπάρκεσις
div1.sense: aid, succour, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπαρκέω
div1.sense: to ward off a thing from a person, τί τινι Il.
c. acc. rei only, to ward off, prevent, Od.; ἐπ. μὴ πεσεῖν, prohibere quominus, Aesch.
c. dat. pers. only, to help, assist, Hdt., Ar.:—rarely c. acc. pers., like ὠφελεῖν, Eur.:—absol., τίς ἄρʼ ἐπαρκέσει; who will aid? Aesch.
to supply, furnish, τι Aesch.; ἐπ. τινί τινος to impart to him a share of, Xen.; c. dat. rei, to supply with a thing, Eur.
absol. to be sufficient, to prevail, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπάρκιος
div1.sense: sufficient, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπαρκούντως
div1.sense: sufficiently, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπάρουρος
div1.sense: attached to the soil as a serf, ascriptus glebae, Od.

div1.head: ἐπαρτάω
div1.sense: to hang on or over, ἐπ. φόβον τινί Aeschin.: —Pass. to hang over, impend, Lat. imminere, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπαρτής
div1.sense: ready for work, equipt, Od.

div1.head: ἐπαρτύω
div1.sense: to fit on, Od.
to prepare, Od.:—Mid. to prepare for oneself, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπαρχία
div1.sense: the government of a province, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαρχικός
div1.sense: provincial, Plut.

div1.head: ἔπαρχος
div1.sense: a commander, Aesch.
the Roman praefectus, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπάρχω
div1.sense: to be governor of, τῆς χώρας Xen.; of consular authority, Plut.
to rule in addition to oneʼs own dominions, Xen.
Mid. in the phrase δεπάεσσιν ἐπάρχεσθαι, to begin with the cups, i. e. by offering libations to the gods before the wine was served, Hom.
generally, to offer, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπαρωγή
div1.sense: help, aid, against a thing, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπαρωγός
div1.sense: a helper, aider, Od., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπασκέω
div1.sense: to labour or toil at, finish carefully, Od., etc.
to practise, τέχνην Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἐπασσύτερος
div1.sense: one upon another, one after another, mostly in pl., Hom.; in sg., κῦμα ὄρνυτʼ ἐπασσύτερον wave upon wave, Il.

div1.head: ἐπασσυτεροτριβής
div1.sense: following close one upon another, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπᾳστέος
div1.sense: one must enchant, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαστράπτω
div1.sense: to lighten upon, Anth.; ἐπ. πῦρ to flash fire, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπαυγάζω
div1.sense: Mid. to look at by the light, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπαυδάω
div1.sense: Mid. to call upon, invoke, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαυλέω
div1.sense: to accompany on the flute, c. dat., Luc.
Pass. to be played on the flute, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπαυλίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor. mid., to encamp on the field, Thuc.
to encamp near, τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἔπαυλις
div1.sense: a fold, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔπαυλος
div1.sense: a fold for cattle at night, ἔπαυλοι Od.; heterog. pl. ἔπαυλα Soph.
generally, a dwelling, home, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαυξάνω
div1.sense: to increase, enlarge, augment, Thuc., Dem.:—Pass. to grow, increase, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαύξησις
div1.sense: increase, increment, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπαύρεσις
div1.sense: fruition, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπαϋτέω
div1.sense: to creak besides, Hes.
to shout in applause, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπαυρέω
div1.sense: Act. to partake of, share, c. gen. rei, Il.
of physical contact, to touch, graze, c. acc., esp. of slight wounds, Il.; also c. gen. to touch, Il.
Mid. to reap the fruits of a thing, whether good or bad:
c. gen., in good sense, Il., Eur.

in bad sense, ἵνα πάντες ἐπαύρωνται βασιλῆος that all may enjoy their king, i. e. feel what it is to have such a king, Il.; c. acc. et gen., τοιαῦτʼ ἐπηύρω τοῦ φιλανθρώπου τρόπου such profit didst thou gain from . . , Aesch.; and absol., μιν ἐπαυρήσεσθαι ὀΐω I doubt not he will feel the consequences, Il.

div1.head: ἐπαυχένιος
div1.sense: on or for the neck, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπαυχέω
div1.sense: to exult in or at a thing, c. dat., Soph.
c. inf. to be confident that, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπαύω
div1.sense: to shout over a thing, c. dat., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπαφαυαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be withered, ἐπαφαυάνθην γελῶν I was quite spent with laughing, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπαφάω
div1.sense: to touch on the surface, stroke, Aesch.:—Mid., c. gen., Mosch.

div1.head: ἐπαφή
div1.sense: touch, touching, handling, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπαφίημι
div1.sense: to discharge at, c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπαφρίζω
div1.sense: to foam up or on the surface, Mosch.

div1.head: ἐπαφρόδιτος
div1.sense: lovely, charming, Lat. venustus, of persons, Hdt., etc.
used to translate Sullaʼs epithet Felix, favoured by Venus, i. e. fortuneʼs favourite, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπαφύσσω
div1.sense: to pour over, Od.

div1.head: ἐπαχθής
div1.sense: heavy, ponderous, Ar.
metaph. burdensome, annoying, grievous, Aesch., Plat.
of persons, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπάχθομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be annoyed at a thing, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπαχνίδιος
div1.sense: lying like dust upon, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπεγγελάω
div1.sense: to laugh at, exult over a person, c. dat., Soph., Xen.; κατά τινος Soph.

div1.head: ἐπεγείρω
div1.sense: to awaken, rouse up, τινά Od., Hdt., etc.:—Pass. to be roused, wake up, Hom., in forms ἐπέγρετο, ἐπεγρόμενος (which are from an Epic aor. ἐπ-ηγρόμην) .
metaph. to awaken, excite, Solon., Soph.;—Pass., ἐπηγέρθη μῆνις Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπεγκάπτω
div1.sense: to snap up besides, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπεγκελεύω
div1.sense: to give an order to others, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπεγχέω
div1.sense: to pour in besides, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἒ
div1.sense: ἒ ἔ, or ἒ ἒ ἒ ἔ, an exclamation, woe! woe! Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἕ
div1.sense: Lat. se, v. sub οὗ, sui.

div1.head: ἐπείγω
div1.sense: to press down, weigh down, Il.
to press in pursuit, to press hard, press upon, absol. and c. acc., Hom.
to drive on, urge forward, ἐρετμὰ χερσὶν ἔπειγον Od.; of a fair wind, Od., Soph.

to urge on, hurry on a thing, Od., Soph.: —Pass., of a ship, Il.:—Mid. to urge on for oneself, τὸν ἐμὸν γάμον Od.; τὴν παρασκευήν Thuc.:—absol., ἐπειγομένων ἀνέμων by the force of winds, Il.; ὀπὸς γάλα ἐπειγόμενος συνέπηξεν the fig-juice by its force curdled the milk, Il.

Pass. to hurry oneself, haste to do, c. inf., Il.:—absol. to hasten, hurry, speed, make haste, Il., etc.: part., ἐπειγόμενος in eager haste, eagerly, Il.; c. inf., δῦναι ἐπειγόμενος eager for its setting, Od.; c. gen., ἐπειγόμενός περ ὁδοῖο longing for the journey, Od.
intr. in Act., = Pass. to hasten to a place, Soph., Eur.:— τὰ ἐπείγοντα necessary matters, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπειδάν
div1.sense: i. e. ἐπειδὴ ἄν, ἐπεάν, ἐπήν whenever.

div1.head: ἐπεῖδον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, ἐφοράω being used instead.
div1.sense: to look upon, behold, Il.; also in Mid., Eur., Ar.:—of the gods, to look upon human affairs, Aesch.
to continue to see, i. e. to live to see, Hdt.: to experience, χαλεπά Xen.

div1.head: ἐπειή
div1.sense: Really ἐπεὶ ἦ, since in truth, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπεικάζω
div1.sense: to make like or liken, δάμαρτα τήνδʼ ἐπεικάζων κυρῶ; am I right in identifying her with his wife, i. e. in conjecturing that she is so? Soph.
to conjecture, ὡς ἐπεικάσαι as far as one may guess, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἔπειμι
div1.sense: to be upon, c. dat., Il., Aesch.; but in Prose with prep., ἐπὶ τοῦ καταστρώματος Hdt.; ἐπὶ ταῖς οἰκίαις Xen.
to be set upon, Hdt.:—of rewards and penalties, to be affixed or attached, Aesch., etc.
of Time, to be hereafter, remain, Od.; ἐπεσσόμενοι ἄνθρωποι generations to come, Orac. ap. Hdt.:—also to be at hand, Soph., Xen.
to be set over, Lat. praeesse, τισι Hdt.
to be added, be over and above, of numbers, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔπειμι
div1.etym: serving in Attic as fut. of ἐπέρχομαι
div1.sense: to come upon:
come near, approach, Od.

mostly in hostile sense, to come or go against, attack, assault, c. acc., Il.; c. dat., Il., Hdt., Attic; absol., Hom.; οἱ ἐπιόντες the invaders, assailants, Hdt.; but ὁ ἐπιών ὁ τυχών, the first comer, Soph.
to get on the βῆμα to speak, Thuc.: to come on the stage, Xen.
of events, etc., to come upon one, overtake, c. acc., Il., Aesch.: c. dat. to come near, threaten, Il., etc.
c. dat. pers. to come into oneʼs head, occur to one, Plat., Xen.;—absol., τοὐπιόν what occurs to one, Plat.

of Time, to come on or after: mostly in part. ἐπιών, οῦσα, όν, following, succeeding, instant, ἡ ἐπιοῦσα ἡμέρα the coming day, Hdt.; ὁ ἐπιὼν βίοτος Eur.; τὰ ἐπιόντα the consequences, Dem.; ὁ ἐπιών the successor, Soph.
to go over a space, to traverse, visit, c. acc., Od., Hdt., etc.
to go over, i. e. count over, Od.

div1.head: ἔπειξις
div1.sense: haste, hurry, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπεί
div1.sense: conjunct., temporal and causal, like Lat. quum:

OF TIME, after that, after (postquam), since, when (quum), with aor. to express a complete action, or imperf. to express one not yet complete, ἐπεὶ ὑπηντίαζεν ἡ φάλαγξ καὶ ἡ σάλπιγξ ἐφθέγξατο after the phalanx began to advance and the trumpet had sounded, Xen.
= ἐξ οὗ, from the time when, ever since, ἐπείτε παρέλαβον τὸν θρόνον since I came to the throne, Hdt.

with Subjunct., ἄν or κε being added, so that ἐπεί becomes ἐπάν, ἐπήν, Ionic ἐπεάν, or ἐπεί κε: — referring to future time, ἐπὴν ἕλωμεν when we shall have taken the city, Il.:—also whenever, ἐπεί κε λίπῃ ὀστέα θυμός Od.
with Opt. without ἄν, referring to future time, ἐπειδὴ πρὸς τὸ φῶς ἔλθοι after he had come into the light, Plat.:—also whenever, ἐπεὶ πύθοιτο Xen.
in oratione obl. after past tenses, representing a subj. in orat. rect., ἐπεὶ διαβαίης, the direct form being ἐπὴν διαβῶ, Xen.
with other words, ἐπεὶ τάχιστα, as soon as, Lat. quum primum, Xen.; ἐπεὶ εὐθέως Xen.; ἐπειδὴ τάχιστα Plat.; ἐπειδὴ θᾶττον Dem.

CAUSAL, since, seeing that, with Ind. or Opt. with ἄν, Hom., etc.; with Imp., ἐπεὶ δίδαξον for teach me, Soph.; ἐπεὶ πῶς ἂν καλέσειας; for how would you call him? Ar.:—sometimes it may be rendered by although, or by else, otherwise.
with other Particles, ἐπεὶ ἄρα, ἐπεὶ ἂρ δή since then, Od.; ἐπεί γε, Lat. quandoquidem, since indeed, Hdt.; ἐπείπερ seeing that, Aesch., etc.; ἐπεί τοι since surely, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπείπερ
div1.sense: ἐπεί περ, Conj. seeing that, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐπεῖπον
div1.sense: to say besides, Hdt., Thuc.
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use

div1.head: ἐπεισάγω
div1.sense: to bring in besides, to bring in something new, Aeschin.:—Mid. to introduce besides, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπεισαγωγή
div1.sense: a bringing in besides, a means of bringing or letting in, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεισαγώγιμος
div1.sense: brought in besides the products of the country; τὰ ἐπ. imported wares, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπείσακτος
div1.sense: brought in besides: brought in from abroad, imported, alien, foreign, Eur., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπεισβαίνω
div1.sense: to go into upon, ἵππῳ εἰς θάλασσαν Xen.; ἐπ. ἐς τὴν θάλασσαν to go into the sea so as to board ships, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεισβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw into besides, τί τινι Eur.
intr. to invade again, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεισβάτης
div1.sense: an additional passenger, supernumerary on board ship, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπείσειμι
div1.sense: to come in or besides, in battle, Hdt.: to come next upon the stage, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπεισέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor. and perf. act.:— to come in besides, Thuc.; as stepmother, Hdt.
to come in after, Hdt.
to come into beside, c. acc., or dat., Eur.: of things, to be imported, Thuc.
to come into oneʼs head, occur to one, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπεισκυκλέω
div1.sense: to roll or bring in one upon another, Luc.:—Pass. to come in one upon another, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπεισκωμάζω
div1.sense: to rush in like revellers, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπεισόδιος
div1.sense: coming in besides, adventitious, Plut.
as Subst., an addition, episode, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπείσοδος
div1.sense: a coming in besides, entrance, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπεισπαίω
div1.sense: to burst in, εἰς τὴν οἰκίαν Ar.

div1.head: ἐπεισπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap in upon, εἴς τι Xen.; absol., Ar.

div1.head: ἐπεισπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall in upon, c. dat., Eur., Xen.; c. acc., Eur.:—absol. to burst in, Soph.
to fall upon, of lightning, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπεισπλέω
div1.sense: to sail in after, Thuc., Xen.
to sail against, attack, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεισρέω
div1.sense: to flow in upon or besides, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπεισφέρω
div1.sense: to bring in besides or next, Aesch., Ar.:—Mid. to bring in for oneself, Thuc.:— Pass., τὸ ἐπεσφερόμενον πρῆγμα whatever comes upon us, occurs, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπεισφρέω
div1.sense: to introduce besides, Eur.

div1.head: ἔπειτα
div1.sense: marks sequence, thereupon, Lat. deinde, when strongly opposed to the former act or state, with past tenses, thereafter, afterwards, with future, hereafter, Hom., etc.; in narrative, πρῶτον μέν . . , followed by ἔπειτα δέ . . , Lat. primum . . , deinde . . , Thuc., etc.; πρὶν μὲν . . , ἔπ. δὲ . . Soph.:—with the Article, τὸ ἔπ. what follows, Soph.; οἱ ἔπ. future generations, Aesch.; ὁ ἔπ. βίος Plat.; ἐν τῷ ἔπ. (sc. χρόνῳ) Plat.

like εἶτα, with a Verb after a part., μειδήσασα δʼ ἐπ. ἑῷ ἐγκάτθετο κόλπῳ she smiled and then placed it in her bosom, Il.; often to mark surprise or the like, and then, and yet, τὸ μητρὸς αἷμα ἐκχέας ἔπ. δώματʼ οἰκήσεις πατρός; after shedding thy motherʼs blood, wilt thou yet dwell in thy fatherʼs house? Aesch.
after a Temporal Conjunct. then, thereafter ἐπειδὴ σφαίρῃ πειρήσαντο, ὠρχείσθην δὴ ἔπ. when they had done playing at ball, then they danced, Od.

after εἰ or ἤν, then surely, εἰ δʼ ἐτεὸν ἀγορεύεις, ἐξ ἄρα δή τοι ἔπ. θεοὶ φρένας ὤλεσαν if thou speakest sooth, then of a surety have the gods infatuated thee, Il.; so when the apodosis is a question, εἰ κελεύετε, πῶς ἂν ἔπειτʼ Ὀδυσῆος λαθοίμην; how can I in such a case? Il.
of Consequence or Inference, why then, therefore, οὐ σύγʼ ἔπειτα Τύδεος ἔκγονός ἐσσι Il.
to begin a story, well then, Od.

in Attic to introduce emphatic questions, why then . . ? ἔπ. τοῦ δέει; Ar.; to express surprise, and so forsooth? and so really? ἔπειτʼ οὐκ οἴει φροντίζειν τοὺς θεοὺς τῶν ἀνθρώπων; Xen.; ἔπειτα δῆτα δοῦλος ὢν κόμην ἔχεις; Ar.

div1.head: ἐπεκβαίνω
div1.sense: to go out upon, disembark, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεκβοηθέω
div1.sense: to rush out to aid, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεκδιδάσκω
div1.sense: to teach or explain besides, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπεκδιηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to explain besides, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπεκδρομή
div1.sense: an excursion, expedition, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπέκεινα
div1.sense: ἐπ-έκεινα for ἐπʼ ἐκεῖνα, on yonder side, beyond, Lat. ultra, c. gen., Plat., Xen.:—with Article, τὸ ἐπέκεινα, Attic τοὐπ., or τὰ ἐπ., Attic τἀπ., the part beyond, the far side, τὰ ἐπ. τῆς Εὐρώπης Hdt.; τοὐπ. τῆσδε γῆς beyond it, Eur.: absol., ἐν τῷ ἐπ. on the far side, Thuc.; εἰς τὸ ἐπ. Plat.

div1.head: ἐπεκπίνω
div1.sense: to drink off after, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπέκπλοος
div1.sense: a sailing out against, an attack by sea, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεκτείνω
div1.sense: to extend:—Pass. to be extended, reach out towards, τινί NTest.

div1.head: ἐπεκτρέχω
div1.sense: to sally out upon or against, τινί Xen.

div1.head: ἐπεκφέρω
div1.sense: to carry out far, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπεκχωρέω
div1.sense: to advance next or after, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπέλασις
div1.sense: a charge, of cavalry, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive upon, τὰς ἁμάξας ἐπελαύνουσι, i. e. upon the ice, Hdt.
to lay metal beaten out into plates over a surface (cf. ἐλαύνω III. 1), ἐπὶ δʼ ὄγδοον ἤλασε χαλκόν Il.
metaph., ὅρκον ἐπελαύνειν τινί to force an oath upon one, Hdt.
to ride or lead against, ἵππον στρατιήν τινι Xen., Hdt.
intr. to march against, Hdt.; to charge, Hdt.: of ships, to drive upon a rock, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπελπίζω
div1.sense: to buoy up with hope, to cheat with false hopes, Thuc.
intr. = ἐλπίζω, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπέλπομαι
div1.sense: to have hopes of, to hope that . . , c. inf. fut., Hom., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπεμβαδόν
div1.sense: step upon step, ascending, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπεμβαίνω
div1.sense: to step or tread upon, and in perf. to stand upon, c. gen., Il., Soph.: also c. dat., Aesch., etc.; sometimes c. acc., Eur.
to embark on ship-board, Dem.
c. dat. pers. to trample upon, Lat. insultare, Soph., Eur.
τῷ καιρῷ ἐπ. to take advantage of the opportunity, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπεμβάλλω
div1.sense: to put on, τί τινι Eur.: to throw down upon, δόμους Eur.
to throw against, c. acc., Eur.
to put in besides, insert, Hdt.:— metaph., σωτῆρα σαυτὸν ἐπεμβάλλεις thou intrudest thyself as saviour, Soph.
intr. to flow in besides, of rivers, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπεμβάτης
div1.sense: one mounted, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπεμπηδάω
div1.sense: to trample upon, τινί Ar.

div1.head: ἐπεμπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall upon besides, attack furiously, τινί Soph.
to fall to, set to work, Lat. incumbere, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπεναρίζω
div1.sense: to kill one over another, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπενδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give over and above, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπένδυμα
div1.sense: an upper garment, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπενδύνω
div1.sense: to put on one garment over another, Hdt.:—Pass. to have on over, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπενθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to leap upon a thing, c. dat., Aesch.; ἐπ. ἐπί τινα to leap upon one, as an enemy, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπεντανύω
div1.sense: to make fast, Od.

div1.head: ἐπεντείνω
div1.sense: to stretch tight upon: Pass., ἐπενταθείς stretched upon his sword, Soph.
intr. to press on amain, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπεντέλλω
div1.sense: to command besides, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπεντύω
div1.sense: to set right, get ready, Il.; χεῖρα ἐπεντύνειν ἐπί τινι to arm it for the fight, Soph.: —Mid. to prepare or train oneself for, ἄεθλα Od.

div1.head: ἐπεξάγω
div1.sense: to lead out an army against the enemy, Thuc.
intr. (sub. τάξιν) to extend the line of battle (by taking ground to right or left), Thuc.; so of ships, to extend their line, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεξαγωγή
div1.sense: extension of a line of battle, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεξαμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to err yet more, one must err yet more, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπέξειμι
div1.etym: serving as Attic fut. to ἐπεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go out against an enemy, c. dat., Hdt., Thuc.
to proceed against, take vengeance on, Hdt.: in legal sense, to prosecute, τινι Dem.:—also c. acc. pers., Eur., Dem.
to go over, traverse, go through in detail, c. acc., Hdt., Ar.
to go through with, execute, παρασκευάς, τιμωρίας Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεξελαύνω
div1.sense: to send on to the attack, ἱππεῖς Xen.

div1.head: ἐπεξεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to effect besides, Dem.
to slay over again, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go out against, make a sally against, τινι Hdt., Thuc., etc.; of a message, ἐπ. τινι to reach him, Hdt.
to proceed against, prosecute, τινι Thuc., etc.:—c. acc. pers. to punish, Eur.
to proceed to an extremity, Soph., Eur.
c. acc. loci, to go through or over, traverse, Hdt.
to carry out, accomplish, execute, Thuc.; πᾶν ἐπεξ. to try every course.
to discuss, relate or examine accurately or fully, Aesch., Thuc.; ἀκριβείᾳ περὶ ἑκάστου ἐπ. Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεξέτασις
div1.sense: a fresh review or muster, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεξευρίσκω
div1.sense: to invent besides, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπεξηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to recount in detail, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπεξιακχάζω
div1.sense: to shout in triumph over another, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπεξόδιος
div1.sense: of a march: ἐπεξόδια (sc. ἱερά) , τά sacrifices before the march of an army, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπέξοδος
div1.sense: a march out against an enemy, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπέοικα
div1.etym: perf. with no pres. in use.
div1.sense: to be like, to suit, c. dat. pers., ὅστις οἵ τʼ ἐπέοικε Il.

mostly impers. it is fit, proper, c. dat. pers. et inf., Il.; νέῳ ἐπέοικε κεῖσθαι ʼtis a seemly thing for a young man to lie dead, Il.:—c. acc. pers. et inf., λαοὺς δʼ οὐκ ἐπέοικε ἐπαγείρειν Il.:—c. inf. alone, ἀποδώσομαι ὅσσʼ ἐπέοικε ἀποδόσθαι Il.:—part. pl. ἐπεικότα, seemly, fit, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπέραστος
div1.sense: lovely, amiable, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to cultivate besides, encroach upon ground consecrated to a god, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπεργασία
div1.sense: cultivation of anotherʼs land, encroachment upon sacred ground, Thuc.
the right of mutual tillage on each otherʼs ground, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπερεθίζω
div1.sense: to stimulate, urge on, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπερείδω
div1.sense: to drive against, drive home, ἔγχος Il.; ἐπέρεισε δὲ ἶνʼ ἀπέλεθρον put vast strength to it, Hom.:— ἐπ. τὴν φάλαγγά τινι to bring the whole force of the phalanx against, Plut.:—Mid., λαίφη προτόνοις ἐπερειδόμεναι staying their sails on ropes, Eur.:—Pass. to lean or bear upon, τινι Ar.: absol. to resist with all oneʼs force, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπερέφω
div1.sense: to put a cover upon, deck, Il.

div1.head: ἐπέρομαι
div1.sense: to ask besides or again, Xen.
to question a person besides about a thing, consult him about, τινά τι Hdt.; to enquire of a god, θεόν Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπερύω
div1.sense: to pull to a door, Od.: to drag to a place, Od.:—Mid. to draw on oneʼs clothes, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.,
to come upon, come near, come suddenly upon, τινι Hom., Hdt.:— to come to for advice, Lat. adire aliquem, Eur.
in hostile sense, to go or come against, to attack, assault, absol. or c. dat., Il., Eur., etc.; c. acc., τὴν τῶν πέλας ἐπ. to invade it, Thuc.; hence, to visit, reprove, τινα Eur.
to come forward to speak, Eur., Thuc.; also, ἐπ. ἐπὶ τὸν δῆμον Hdt.
of conditions, events, etc., to come suddenly upon, ὕπνος ἐπήλυθέ τινα or τινι Od.
c. dat. pers. to come into oneʼs head, occur to one, ἵμερος ἐπῆλθέ μοι ἐπείρεσθαι Hdt.; or impers. c. inf., καί οἱ ἐπῆλθε πταρεῖν it happened to him to sneeze, Hdt.
of Time, to come on, return, of the seasons, Od.; so, νὺξ ἐπῆλθε Od.
to come in after or over another, of a second wife, Hdt.
to go over or on a space, to traverse, Lat. obire, c. acc., Od.:— of water, to overflow, Hdt.:—so in Attic to go the round of, visit, Soph., Eur.
to go through, treat of, recount, Eur., Ar.
to go through, execute, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπερωτάω
div1.sense: to inquire of, question, consult, τὸν θεόν Hdt., Thuc., etc.; τινὰ περί τινος Hdt.:—Pass. to be questioned, asked a question, Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to ask a thing or about a thing, Hdt.:—c. acc. pers. et rei, ἐπ. τοὺς προφήτας τὸ αἴτιον Hdt.:—absol. to put the question, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπερώτημα
div1.sense: a question, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπερώτησις
div1.sense: a questioning, consulting, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπεσβολία
div1.sense: hasty speech, scurrility, Od.

div1.head: ἐπεσβόλος
div1.sense: throwing words about, rash-talking, abusive, scurrilous, Il.

div1.head: ἐπεσθίω
div1.sense: to eat after or with other food, Xen.
to eat up, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπεσχάριος
div1.sense: on the hearth, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπέτειος
div1.sense: annual, yearly, Hdt.: ἐπέτειοι τὴν φύσιν changeful as the seasons, Ar.
annual, lasting for a year, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπετήσιος
div1.sense: from year to year, yearly, Od.

div1.head: ἐπευθύνω
div1.sense: to guide to a point: to administer, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπευκλεΐζω
div1.sense: to make illustrious, Simon.

div1.head: ἐπευφημέω
div1.sense: to shout assent, Il.
c. acc. rei, to sing over or with a thing, c. dat., Aesch., Eur.
c. dupl. acc., ἐπ. παιᾶνα Ἄρτεμιν to sing a paean in praise of her, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to pray or make a vow to a deity, c. dat., Hom., Hdt., etc.:—c. inf. to pray to one that . . , Od., etc. :—c. acc. rei, to pray for, Aesch.: also, c. acc. cogn., ἐπ. λιτάς Soph.
to imprecate a curse upon, τί τινι Aesch.; c. inf., ἐπεύχομαι αὐτῷ παθεῖν Soph.: absol. to utter imprecations, Soph.
to glory over, τινι Il.
to boast that, c. inf., Hhymn., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐπευωνίζω
div1.sense: to lower the price of a thing, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπέχω
div1.sense: to have or hold upon, πόδας θρόνῳ Il.
to hold out to, present, offer, οἶνον Il., Eur.; so c. inf., πιεῖν ἐπέσχον Ar.:— Mid., ἐπισχόμενος (sc. τὴν κύλικα) having put it to his lips, Plat.
to direct towards, τόξα ἐπ. τινί Eur.:—intr. to aim at, attack, τινί Od.; ἐπί τινα Hdt.; ἐπί τινι Thuc.:—aor2 mid. part. ἐπισχόμενος having aimed at him, Od.
ἐπέχειν (sc. τὸν νοῦν) , to intend, purpose, c. inf., Hdt.
to stand facing, to face in a line of battle, τινάς Hdt.
to keep in, hold back, check, Lat. inhibere, Il., Soph., etc.
ἐπέχειν τινά τινος to stop him, hinder him from it, Soph., Eur.: so c. inf., ἐπ. τινὰ μὴ πράσσειν τι Soph.:—absol. to stay proceedings, Thuc.
absol. also to stay, stop, wait, pause, Od., Hdt.; ἐπίσχες ἔστʼ ἂν προσμάθῃς Aesch.; ἐπ. ἕως . . Dem.
c. gen. rei, to stop or cease from, ἐπίσχες τοῦ δρόμου Ar.; τῆς πορείας Xen.:—so c. inf. to leave off doing, Xen.
to reach or extend over a space, ἑπτὰ δʼ ἐπέσχε πέλεθρα Il.; ὁπόσσον ἐπέσχε πῦρ so far as the fire reached, Il.; aor2 mid., ἐπέσχετο he lay outstretched, Hes.
to occupy a country, τὴν Ἀσίην Hdt., etc.:—of things, ἡ ὀπώρη ἐπέσχεν αὐτούς occupied or engaged them, Hdt.
absol. to prevail, predominate, of a wind, Hdt.; of an earthquake, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπήβολος
div1.sense: having achieved or gained a thing, c. gen., Od., Hdt., Aesch.; ἐπ. φρενῶν compos mentis, Aesch.
of things, pertaining to, befitting, c. dat., Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπηγκενίδες
div1.sense: the long side-planks bolted to the ribs (σταμίνες) of the ship, Od.

div1.head: ἐπηγορεύω
div1.sense: to state objections against, τί τινι Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπηετανός
div1.etym: Deriv. uncertain: that from ἔτος, sufficient the whole year through, will not suit all passages and is not necessary in any.
div1.sense: abundant, ample, sufficient, Od.; πλυνοὶ ἐπ. troughs always full, Od.; ἐπηετανὸν γὰρ ἔχεσκον for they had great store, Od.; ἐπηεταναὶ τρίχες thick, full fleeces, Hes.; ἐπηεταναὶ πλατάνιστοι Theocr.: —neut. as adv. abundantly, Od.

div1.head: ἐπήκοος
div1.sense: listening or giving ear to a thing, c. gen., Aesch., Plat.; also c. dat., Plat.
within hearing, within ear-shot, εἰς ἐπήκοον Xen.

div1.head: ἐπηλυγάζω
div1.sense: to overshadow:—Mid., τῷ κοινῷ φόβῳ τὸν σφέτερον ἐπηλυγάζεσθαι to throw a shade over (i. e. conceal) oneʼs own fear by that of others, Thuc.; ἐπηλυγάζεσθαί τινα to put him as a screen before one, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπῆλυξ
div1.sense: overshadowing, sheltering, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπηλυσία
div1.sense: a coming over one by spells, a bewitching, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπήλυσις
div1.sense: an approach, assault, Anth.

div1.head: ἔπηλυς
div1.sense: one who comes to a place, ἐπήλυδες αὖθις coming back to me, Soph.
an incomer, stranger, foreigner, Lat. advena, opp. to αὐτόχθων, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπημοιβός
div1.sense: alternating, crossing, of door-bolts, Il.
serving for change, χιτῶνες Od.

div1.head: ἐπημύω
div1.sense: to bend or bow down, of a corn-field, Il.

div1.head: ἐπήν
div1.sense: Conj. = ἐπεὶ ἄν

div1.head: ἐπῃόνιος
div1.sense: on the beach or shore, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπηπύω
div1.sense: to shout in applause, Il.

div1.head: ἐπήρατος
div1.sense: lovely, charming, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπηρεάζω
div1.sense: to threaten abusively, Hdt.
to deal despitefully with, act despitefully towards, τινί Xen., Dem.:—absol. to be insolent, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπήρεια
div1.sense: despiteful treatment, spiteful abuse, Lat. contumelia, Dem., etc.; κατʼ ἐπήρειαν by way of insult, Thuc.; ἐν ἐπηρείας τάξει Dem.

div1.head: ἐπήρετμος
div1.sense: at the oar, Od.
equipt with oars, νῆες Od.

div1.head: ἐπηρεφής
div1.sense: overhanging, beetling, of cliffs, Hom.
pass. covered, sheltered, Hes.

div1.head: ἐπητής
div1.sense: affable, gentle, Od.

div1.head: ἐπήτριμος
div1.sense: properly, woven upon, closely woven: then, close-thronged, one upon another, Il.

div1.head: ἐπητύς
div1.sense: courtesy, kindness, Od.

div1.head: ἐπηχέω
div1.sense: to resound, re-echo, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιβάθρα
div1.sense: a ladder or steps: metaph. a means of approach, τινός towards . . , Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίβαθρον
div1.sense: a passengerʼs fare, Lat. naulum, Od.
a roosting-place, perch, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιβαίνω
div1.etym: Hom. always uses the Ionic aor1 form ἐπεβήσετο
div1.sense: in fut. and aor. mid., perf. act., and athematic aor., intr., to go upon:
c. gen. to set foot on, tread or walk upon, Hom., Attic:—also, ἐπ. ἐπί τινος Hdt.
to get upon, mount on, νεῶν ἵππων Hom., Hdt.;—also, ἐπ. ἐπὶ νηός Hdt.
of Time, to arrive at, Plat.
metaph., ἐπʼ ἀναιδείης ἐπ. to indulge in impudence, Od.; εὐσεβίας ἐπ. to observe piety, Soph.
c. dat. to mount upon, get upon, ναυσί Thuc.:—also, ἐπ. ἐπὶ πύργῳ Hdt.
c. dat. pers. to set upon, attack, assault, τινί Xen.
c. acc. loci, to light upon, Hom.: simply, to go on to a place, to enter it, Hdt.
c. acc. to attack, like ἐπέρχομαι, Soph. :dnum [3.] to mount, νῶθʼ ἵππων Hes.; ἵππον Hdt.
absol. to get a footing, Od.
to step onwards, advance, Hes., Soph.
to mount on a chariot or on horseback, be mounted, Il., Hdt.: to go or be on board ship, Il., Soph., etc.
Causal in aor1 act. (ἐπιβιβάζω serves as pres.), to make one mount, set him upon, ἵππων ἐπέβησε Il.; πυρῆς ἐπέβησε Il.
metaph., εὐκλεΐης ἐπίβησον bring to great glory, Il.; σαοφροσύνης ἐπέβησαν they bring him to sobriety, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιβάλλω
div1.sense: trans. to throw or cast upon, Lat. injicere, τρίχας ἐπ. (sc. πυρί) Il.; ἐπ. ἑωυτὸν ἐς τὸ πῦρ Hdt.
to lay on, Lat. applicare, ἵπποις ἐπέβαλλεν ἱμάσθλην Od.; ἐπιβ. πληγάς τινι Xen.:— to lay on as a tax, tribute, fine or penalty, τί τινι Hdt., Attic
ἐπιβ. σφραγῖδα to affix a seal, Hdt.
to add, ἐπ. (sc. χοῦν) to throw on more and more earth, Thuc.:—metaph. to mention, Lat. mentionem injicere rei, τι Soph.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) , to throw oneself upon, go straight towards, c. acc., Od.
to fall upon or against, τινί Plat.
(sub. τὸν νοῦν) to apply oneself to a thing, devote oneself to it, c. dat., Plut.: to give oneʼs attention to, think on, NTest.
to follow, come next, Plut.

to belong to, fall to, τινί Hdt., Dem.:—also impers. c. acc. et inf. it falls to oneʼs very lot, it concerns one to do a thing, Hdt.:— τὸ ἐπιβάλλον (sc. μέρος) the portion that falls to one, Hdt., NTest.
Mid., c. gen., to throw oneself upon, desire eagerly, Il.
c. acc. to put upon oneself, Eur.: metaph. to take possession of, take upon oneself, Thuc.
in Pass. to be put upon, ἐπιβεβλημένοι τοξόται archers with their arrows on the string, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίβασις
div1.sense: a stepping upon, approaching: a means of approach, access, Plat.; εἴς τινα ποιεῖσθαι ἐπ. to find a means of attacking one, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιβάσκω
div1.sense: c. gen., κακῶν ἐπιβασκέμεν υἷας Ἀχαιῶν to lead them into misery, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιβαστάζω
div1.sense: to weigh in the hand, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιβατεύω
div1.sense: to set one foot upon a place, c. gen., Plut.:—metaph. to take oneʼs stand upon, οὐνόματος ἐπ. to usurp a name, Hdt.; ῥήματος ἐπ. to rely upon a word, Hdt.
to be a soldier on board ship, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιβάτης
div1.sense: ἐπιβάται, οἱ, the soldiers on board ship, the fighting men, as opp. to the rowers and seamen, Hdt.
a merchant on board ship, supercargo, Dem.
the fighting man in a chariot, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιβατός
div1.sense: that can be climbed, accessible, Hdt.; χρυσίῳ ἐπ. accessible to a bribe, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιβήσσω
div1.sense: to cough after or besides, Hipp.

div1.head: ἐπιβήτωρ
div1.sense: one who mounts, ἐπ. ἵππων a mounted horseman, Od.
of male animals, e. g. a boar, Od.; a bull, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιβιβάζω
div1.sense: to put one upon, τοὺς ὁπλίτας ἐπὶ τὰς ναῦς Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιβιόω
div1.sense: to live over or after, survive, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιβλέπω
div1.sense: to look upon, look attentively, εἴς τινα Plat.; τινί Luc.
c. acc. to look well at, observe, Plat.
to eye with envy, Lat. invidere, c. dat., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπίβλεψις
div1.sense: a looking at, gazing, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίβλημα
div1.sense: that which is thrown over, tapestry, hangings, Plut.
that which is put on, a patch, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιβλής
div1.sense: a bar fitting into a socket, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιβλύζω
div1.sense: to well or gush forth, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιβοάω
div1.sense: to call upon or to, cry out to, ἐπ. τινὶ ὅτι . . , or c. inf., Thuc.
to utter or sing aloud over, τί τινι Ar.:—so in Mid., Ar.
to cry out against, τινά· Pass. ἐπιβοώμενος cried out against, Ar.
to invoke, call upon, θεούς Od.; so in Mid., ἐπιβοᾶσθαι Θέμιν Eur.:— to call to aid, τὴν στρατιὴν ἐπεβώσαντο Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιβοήθεια
div1.sense: a coming to aid, succour, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιβοηθέω
div1.sense: to come to aid, to succour, τινί Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιβόημα
div1.sense: a call or cry to one, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιβόητος
div1.sense: cried out against, ill spoken of, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιβολή
div1.sense: a throwing or laying on, ἱματίων Thuc.; χειρῶν σιδηρῶν of grappling-irons, Thuc.
a hostile attempt, Plut.
that which is laid on, ἐπιβολαὶ πλίνθων layers or courses of bricks, Thuc.
a penalty, fine, Ar., Xen.:— an impost, public burden, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιβομβέω
div1.sense: to roar in answer to or after, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιβόσκομαι
div1.sense: Mid., of cattle, to graze or feed upon, τινι Batr.
to feed among the herd, c. dat., Mosch.

div1.head: ἐπιβουκόλος
div1.sense: an over-herdsman, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιβούλευμα
div1.sense: a plot, attempt, scheme, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιβουλευτής
div1.sense: one who plots against, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιβουλεύω
div1.sense: to plan or contrive against, κακὸν πόλει Tyrtae.; θάνατόν τινι Hdt.:—c. dat. pers. only, to plot against, lay snares for, τῇ πόλει Aesch.; τῷ πλήθει Ar.;—absol., οὑπιβουλεύων the conspirer, Soph.: —c. acc. rei only, to plan secretly, scheme, plot, τὸν ἔκπλουν Thuc.
c. dat. rei, to form designs upon, aim at, πρήγμασι μεγάλοισι Hdt.; τυραννίδι Plat.
c. inf. to purpose or design to do, Hdt., Thuc.
Pass., with fut. mid. -εύσομαι: aor1 -εβουλεύθην:— to have plots formed against one, to be the object of plots, Thuc.
of things, to be designed against, πρᾶγμα, ὃ τοῖς θεοῖς ἐπιβουλεύεται Ar.; τὰ ἐπιβουλευόμενα plots, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιβουλή
div1.sense: a plan against another, a plot, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίβουλος
div1.sense: plotting against, τινι Plat.: treacherous, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιβρέμω
div1.sense: to make to roar, Il.:—Mid. to roar, Ar.
c. acc. cogn. to roar out, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιβριθής
div1.sense: falling heavy upon, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιβρίθω
div1.sense: to fall heavy upon, fall heavily, of rain, Il.; in good sense, ὁππότε δὴ Διὸς ὧραι ἐπιβρίσειαν when the seasons produce heavy crops, Od.: —metaph., of war, Il.; of persons, ἐπέβρισαν ἀμφὶ ἄνακτα pressed closely round him, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιβροντάω
div1.sense: to thunder in response, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιβρόντητος
div1.sense: frantic, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιβρύκω
div1.sense: to gnash, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιβρύω
div1.sense: to burst forth, of flowers, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιβύω
div1.sense: to stop up, τὸ στόμα τινός Ar.:— Mid., ἐπιβύσασθαι τὰ ὦτα to stop oneʼs ears, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιβώμιος
div1.sense: on or at the altar, Eur.; ἐπιβώμια ῥέζειν Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιβωμιοστατέω
div1.etym: as if from a Subst. ἐπιβωμιοστάτης
div1.sense: to stand suppliant at the altar, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιβωστρέω
div1.sense: to shout to, call upon, τινά Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιβώτωρ
div1.sense: an over-shepherd, Od.

div1.head: ἐπίγαιος
div1.sense: upon the earth, τὰ ἐπίγαια the parts on or near the ground, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιγαμβρεύω
div1.sense: to marry as the next of kin, γυναῖκα NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιγαμέω
div1.sense: to marry besides, ἐπ. πόσει πόσιν to wed one husband after another, Eur.; ἐπ. τέκνοις μητρυιάν to marry and set a step-mother over oneʼs children, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιγαμία
div1.sense: = Lat. connubium, the right of intermarriage between states, Xen.:—generally, intermarriage, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίγαμος
div1.sense: marriageable, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιγαυρόω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to exult in, τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιγδουπέω
div1.sense: to shout in applause, Il.

div1.head: ἐπίγειος
div1.sense: terrestrial, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιγελάω
div1.sense: to laugh approvingly, Lat. arrideo, Il., Attic
= ἐπεγγελάω, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιγεραίρω
div1.sense: to give honour to, τινά Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιγηθέω
div1.sense: to rejoice or triumph over, τινί Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιγίγνομαι
div1.sense: of Time, to be born after, come into being after, ἔαρος δʼ ἐπιγίγνεται ὥρῃ other [leaves] come on in spring time, Il.; οἱ ἐπιγιγνόμενοι ἄνθρωποι posterity, Hdt.; οἱ ἐπιγενόμενοι τούτῳ σοφισταί who came after him, Hdt.; τῇ ἐπιγενομένῃ ἡμέρᾳ the following day, Thuc.; χρόνου ἐπιγιγνομένου as time went on, Hdt., Thuc.
of events, to come upon, be incident to, Lat. supervenire, χειμών, νὺξ ἐπεγένετο Hdt.; ἄνεμος ἐπεγένετο τῇ φλογί seconded the flame, Thuc.; τὰ ἐπιγιγνόμενα each in succession, Thuc.
to come in after, ἐπὶ τῇ ναυμαχίῃ Hdt.: to come upon, assault, attack, τινι Thuc.
to befall, come to pass, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to look upon, witness, observe, Od., Xen.
to recognise, know again, Od., Soph.: to acknowledge or approve a thing, NTest.
of things, also to find out, discover, detect, Aesch., Thuc.
to come to a decision, to resolve, decide, τι περί τινος Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιγλωσσάομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to throw forth ill language, utter abuse, Aesch.: c. gen. to vent reproaches against a person, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιγναμπτός
div1.sense: curved, twisted, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπιγνάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend towards one, Il.:—metaph. to bow or bend to oneʼs purpose, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιγνάπτω
div1.sense: to clean clothes: to vamp up, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιγνώμων
div1.sense: an arbiter, umpire, judge, c. gen. rei, Plat.; ἐπ. τῆς τιμῆς an appraiser, Dem.
= συγγνώμων, pardoning, τινί Mosch.

div1.head: ἐπι-γνωρίζω
div1.sense: to make known, announce, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίγνωσις
div1.sense: full knowledge, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιγονή
div1.sense: increase, growth, produce, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίγονος
div1.sense: born besides:—as Subst., ἐπίγονοι, οἱ, offspring, posterity, Aesch.: a breed [of bees], Xen.
οἱ Ἐπίγονοι the afterborn, sons of the chiefs who fell in the first war against Thebes, Hdt.
the Successors to Alexanderʼs dominions.

div1.head: ἐπιγουνίς
div1.sense: the part above the knee, the great muscle of the thigh, μεγάλην ἐπιγουνίδα θεῖτο he would grow a stout thigh-muscle, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιγράβδην
div1.sense: scraping the surface, grazing, Lat. strictim, Il.

div1.head: ἐπίγραμμα
div1.sense: an inscription, Hdt., Thuc.:—esp. in verse, an epigram, commonly in Elegiacs.
a written estimate of damages, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιγραφή
div1.sense: an inscription, στηλῶν on stones, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιγράφω
div1.sense: to mark the surface, just pierce, graze, ὀϊστὸς ἐπέγραψε χρόα Il.
to mark, put a mark on the lot, Il.—In Hom. the word has not any notion of writing.
to write upon, inscribe, Hdt.:—Pass., of the inscription, to be inscribed upon, Hdt.; also, ἐπεγράφου τὴν Γοργόνα hadst the Gorgon painted on thy shield, Ar.
in Attic law phrases:
to set down the penalty or damages in the title of an indictment, Ar.; τὰ ἐπιγεγραμμένα the damages claimed, Dem.:—so in Mid., Aeschin.
to register, Oratt.:—Mid. to have oneʼs name registered, Thuc.; also, ἐπεγράψαντο πολίτας had them registered as citizens, Thuc.
προστάτην ἐπιγράψασθαι to choose a patron, and have his name entered in the public register, as all μέτοικοι at Athens were obliged to do, Ar.;—so, ἐπιγράψασθαί τινα κύριον Dem.
ἐπιγράψαι ἑαυτὸν ἐπί τι to lend oneʼs name to a thing, to endorse it, Aeschin.;—so in Pass. and Mid., to inscribe oneʼs name on, Aeschin.
Mid. to assume a name, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίγρυπος
div1.sense: somewhat hooked, of the beak of the ibis, Hdt.; of men, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιδαίομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to kindle at, metaph., delight greatly at.

div1.head: ἐπιδαίομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to distribute, Hhymn.:— Pass., perf. δέδασμαι, Hes.

div1.head: ἐπιδακρύω
div1.sense: to weep over, absol., Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιδάμναμαι
div1.sense: Mid. to subdue, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιδανείζω
div1.sense: to lend money on property already mortgaged, Dem.:—Mid. to borrow on such property, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιδαψιλεύω
div1.sense: Usu. mid. to lavish upon a person, bestow freely, τί τινι Hdt.; ἐπιδ. τινί τινος to give him freely of it, Xen.:—metaph. to illustrate more richly, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιδεής
div1.sense: in want of, τινος Plat., Xen.:— comp., ἐπιδεέστερος ἐκείνων inferior to them, Plat.: Sup. έστατος Plat.

div1.head: ἐπίδειγμα
div1.sense: a specimen, pattern, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιδείελος
div1.sense: at even, about evening; neut. ἐπιδείελα as adv., Hes.

div1.head: ἐπιδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to exhibit as a specimen, Ar.: generally, to shew forth, display, exhibit, Plat., Xen., etc.

Mid. to shew off or display for oneself or what is oneʼs own, Hdt., Plat., etc.; ἐπιδείξασθαι λόγον to exhibit oneʼs eloquence, Plat.:—absol. to shew off, make a display of oneʼs powers, Ar., Plat., etc.
to shew, point out, τί τινι Plat.:—c. part. to shew that a thing is, Hdt., etc.; also in Mid., Xen.; ἐπ. τινὰ δωροδοκήσαντα to prove that one took bribes, Ar.
absol. to lay informations, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιδεικτέος
div1.sense: one must display, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιδεικτικός
div1.sense: fit for displaying, c. gen., Luc.; ἡ ἐπιδεικτική display, Lat. ostentatio, Plat.
ἐπιδ. λόγοι speeches for display, declamations, Dem., etc.:—adv. -κῶς, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίδειξις
div1.sense: a shewing forth, making known, ἐς ἐπίδεξιν ἀνθρώπων ἀπίκετο became notorious, Hdt.
an exhibition, display, Thuc.; ἐπ. ποιεῖσθαι to make a demonstration, in military sense, Thuc.; ἐλθεῖν εἰς ἐπίδειξίν τινι to come to display oneself to one, Ar.
a show-off speech, declamation, Thuc., Plat., etc.
an example, Lat. specimen, Eur., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπιδειπνέω
div1.sense: to eat at second course, eat as a dainty, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιδέκατος
div1.sense: one in ten: τὸ ἐπιδέκατον the tenth, tithe, Xen., Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιδέμνιος
div1.sense: on the bed or bed-clothes, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιδέξιος
div1.sense: towards the right, i. e. from left to right:
neut. pl. as adv., ὄρνυσθʼ ἑξείης ἐπιδέξια rise in order beginning with the left hand man, Od.: —hence auspicious, lucky, ἀστράπτων ἐπιδέξια Il.
after Hom., on the right hand, Xen.; τἀπιδέξια the right side, Ar.
as adj., of persons, dexterous, capable, clever, Aeschin., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιδεξιότης
div1.sense: dexterity, cleverness, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπιδέρκομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to look upon, behold, τινα Hes.

div1.head: ἐπιδεσμεύω
div1.sense: to bind up, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπίδεσμος
div1.sense: an upper or outer bandage, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιδεσπόζω
div1.sense: to be lord over, στρατοῦ Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιδευής
div1.sense: in need or want of, c. gen., Hom., Hdt.: absol. in want, Il.
lacking, failing in a thing, c. gen., Od.; βίης ἐπιδευέες Ὀδυσῆος inferior to U. in strength, Od.; absol., ἐπιδευέες ἦμεν too weak were we, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιδεύομαι
div1.sense: to be in want of, to lack a thing, c. gen., Hom., Hdt.: to need the help of, c. gen. pers., Il.
to be lacking in, fall short of a thing, c. gen., Il.: also c. gen. pers., κείνων ἐπιδεύεαι ἀνδρῶν fallest short of them, Il.; or both together, μάχης ἐπιδεύετʼ Ἀχαιῶν Il.

div1.head: ἐπιδεύω
div1.sense: to moisten, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to admit besides or in addition, Hdt.: to allow of, admit of, Lat. recipere, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιδέω
div1.sense: to bind or fasten on, τὸν λόφον Ar.; and in Mid., λόφους ἐπιδέεσθαι to have crests fastened on, Hdt.
to bind up, bandage: — Pass., ἐπιδεδεμένος τὰ τραύματα with oneʼs wounds bound up, Xen.; ἐπιδεδεμένοι τὴν χεῖρα Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιδέω
div1.sense: to want or lack of a number, τετρακοσίας μυριάδας, ἐπιδεούσας ἑπτὰ χιλιαδέων 4, 000, 000 lacking 7000, Hdt.
Mid., like Epic ἐπιδεύομαι, to be in want of, τινος Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίδηλος
div1.sense: seen clearly, manifest, Hdt.
distinguished, remarkable, Xen.
like, resembling, τινι Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιδημεύω
div1.sense: to live among the people, live in the throng, opp. to living in the country, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιδημέω
div1.sense: to be at home, live at home, opp. to ἀποδημέω, Thuc., Xen.
to come home from foreign parts, Xen., Aeschin.
of foreigners, to stay in a place, ἐν τόπῳ Xen.; ἐπ. τοῖς μυστηρίοις to attend them, Dem.:—absol. to be in town, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιδημία
div1.sense: a stay in a place, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιδήμιος
div1.sense: among the people, ἐπιδήμιοι ἁρπακτῆρες plunderers of oneʼs own countrymen, Il.; πόλεμος ἐπ. civil war, Il.; ἐπιδήμιον εἶναι to be at home, Od.; ἐπ. ἔμποροι resident merchants, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιδημιουργοί
div1.sense: magistrates sent annually by Doric states to their colonies, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίδημος
div1.sense: ἐπίδᾱμος φάτις, Doric popular, current report, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιδιαβαίνω
div1.sense: to cross over after another, Hdt.; ἐπ. τάφρον Thuc.; ποταμόν Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιδιαγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to consider anew, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιδιαιρέω
div1.sense: to divide anew:—Mid. to distribute among themselves, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιδιακρίνω
div1.sense: to decide as umpire, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιδιαρρήγνυμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to burst at or because of a thing, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιδιατάσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to add an order, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιδιατίθημι
div1.sense: Mid., to deposit as security, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιδιαφέρομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go across after, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιδιδάσκω
div1.sense: to teach besides, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give besides, τί τινι Il., Hdt., Attic
to give in dowry, Il., Xen.
to give freely, Thuc., Ar.:—esp. to contribute as a "benevolence, " for state necessities, opp. to εἰσφέρειν (which was compulsory), Xen., Dem.; cf. ἐπίδοσις.
Mid. to take as witness, θεοὺς ἐπιδώμεθα Il.; (others take it to be ἐπ-ιδώμεθα let us look to the gods).
intr. to increase, advance, ἐς ὕψος Hdt.; ἐπὶ τὸ μεῖζον Thuc., etc.; absol. to grow, wax, advance, improve, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιδίζημαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to inquire besides, to go on to inquire, Hdt.
to seek for or demand besides, Hdt.; so, ἐπιδίζομαι, Mosch.

div1.head: ἐπιδικάζω
div1.sense: to adjudge property to one, of the judge, Dem.:—Pass., ἐπιδεδικασμένου τὸν κλῆρον having had it adjudged to one, Dem.
Mid., of the claimant, to go to law to establish oneʼs claim, Plat.
c. gen. to sue for, claim at law, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἐπίδικος
div1.sense: disputed at law:— ἐπίδικος, an heiress, whose hand is claimed by her next of kin, Oratt.
generally, disputed, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιδινέω
div1.sense: to whirl or swing round before throwing, Hom.:—Mid. to turn over in oneʼs mind, revolve, Od.:—Pass., aor1 ἐπεδινήθην, to wheel about, as birds in the air, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιδιορθόω
div1.sense: Mid. to set in order also, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιδιπλοΐζω
div1.sense: to redouble, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιδιφριάς
div1.sense: the rail upon the car, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιδίφριος
div1.sense: on the car, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιδιώκω
div1.sense: to pursue after, τινά Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίδοξος
div1.sense: of persons, likely or expected to do or be so and so, c. inf., ἐπίδοξοι πείσεσθαι likely to suffer, Hdt.
of things, likely, probable, c. inf., ἐπ. γενέσθαι Hdt.: absol., κακὰ ἐπίδοξα such as might be expected, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιδόρπιος
div1.sense: for use after dinner, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπίδοσις
div1.sense: a giving over and above, a voluntary contribution to the state, a "benevolence, " Dem.
(ἐπιδίδωμι intr.) increase, growth, advance, progress, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιδουπέω
div1.sense: to make a noise or clashing, τινι with a thing, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιδοχή
div1.sense: the reception of something new, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιδράσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to lay hold of, τινος Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιδρομή
div1.sense: a sudden inroad, a raid, attack, Thuc.; ἐξ ἐπιδρομῆς ἁρπαγή plundering by means of an inroad, i. e. a plundering inroad, Hdt.; hence, ἐξ ἐπιδρομῆς on the sudden, off-hand, Dem.
a place to which ships run in, a landing-place, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπίδρομος
div1.sense: that may be overrun, τεῖχος ἐπ. a wall that may be scaled, Il.; ἐπίδρ. Ζεφύροισι overrun by the W. winds, Anth.
ἐπίδρομος, ὁ, a cord which runs along the upper edge of a net, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιδύω
div1.sense: to set upon an action, so as to interrupt it, Il., NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιείκεια
div1.sense: reasonableness, fairness, equity, Thuc., Plat., etc.: clemency, goodness, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιείκελος
div1.sense: like, resembling, τινι Hom.

div1.head: ἐπιεικής
div1.sense: fitting, meet, suitable, τύμβον ἐπιεικέα meet in size, Il.; ἐπιεικέʼ ἀμοιβήν a fair recompence, Od.; ὡς ἐπιεικές as is meet, Hom.; c. inf., ὅν κʼ ἐπιεικὲς ἀκούειν which word it is meet to hear, Il.
after Hom.,
of statements, rights, etc.,
reasonable, specious, plausible, Hdt., Thuc.
fair, equitable, τῶν δικαίων τὰ ἐπιεικέστερα προτιθέασι Hdt.; πρὸς τὸ ἐπ. ἐπιεικῶς 3, Thuc.
of persons, able, capable, Hdt., Xen.
in moral sense, reasonable, fair, kind, gentle, good, Thuc., Plat., etc.: τοὐπιεικές goodness, Soph.
adv. -κῶς, Ionic -κέως, fairly, tolerably, moderately, Lat. satis, Hdt., Ar.; τέως μὲν ἐπ. for some little time, Plat.
probably, reasonably, Plat.
with moderation, kindly, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιεικτός
div1.sense: yielding: with negat. unyielding, unflinching, Hom.; ἔργα οὐκ ἐπιεικτά not yielding, harsh, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιέννυμι
div1.sense: to put on besides or over, Od.: Pass., perf. part. metaph., ἐπιειμένος ἀλκήν clad in strength, Il., etc.; χαλκὸν ἐπιέσται has brass upon or over it, Orac. ap. Hdt.:—Mid. to put on oneself besides, put on as an upper garment or covering, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιζάφελος
div1.sense: vehement, violent, Il.:—adv. ἐπιζαφελῶς (as if from ἐπιζαφελής), vehemently, furiously, Hom.
div1.etym: The simple ζάφελος never occurs: it is connected with the Prefix ζα-.

div1.head: ἐπιζάω
div1.sense: to overlive, survive, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to join at top, Hdt., Plut.: simply to bind fast, Theocr.
to join to, Lat. adjungere, Aesch.:—metaph. in Pass., μηδʼ ἐπιζευχθῇς στόμα φήμαις πονηραῖς nor let thy mouth be given to evil sayings, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιζέφυρος
div1.sense: towards the west:—the Italian Locrians were called Ἐπιζεφύριοι, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιζέω
div1.sense: to boil overmetaph., ἡ νεότης ἐπέζεσε my youthful spirit boiled over, Hdt.; κέντρʼ ἐπιζέσαντα, of the poison working out of the skin, Soph.; πῆμα Πριαμίδαις ἐπέζεσε Eur.
Causal, to make to boil, heat, c. acc., ἐπιζεῖν λέβητα Eur.

div1.head: ἐπίζηλος
div1.sense: enviable, happy, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιζήμιος
div1.sense: bringing loss upon, hurtful, prejudicial, Thuc., Xen.
penal: —ἐπιζήμια, τά, penalties, Dem.
liable to punishment, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπιζημιόω
div1.sense: to mulct, στατῆρι κατὰ τὸν ἄνδρα every man a stater, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιζητέω
div1.sense: to seek after, wish for, miss, Lat. desiderare, τινά Hdt.; ἐπ. τινά to make further search for him, Dem.:—absol., οἱ ἐπιζητοῦντες the beaters for game, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιζώννυμι
div1.sense: to gird on:—Pass., ἐπεζωσμέναι with their clothes girt on so as to leave the breast bare, Hdt.; ἐπεζωσμένος ἐγχειρίδιον girt with a dagger, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιήρανος
div1.sense: pleasing, acceptable, Od.
assisting against, c. gen., Anth.: defending, governing, also c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ἐπίηρα
div1.sense: acceptable gifts, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιθαλάμιος
div1.sense: nuptial, Luc.: as Subst., ἐπιθαλάμιος, ὁ or ἡ (sub. ὕμνος or ᾠδή) , the bridal song, Theocr., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιθαλάσσιος
div1.sense: lying or dwelling on the coast, Lat. maritimus, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιθάνατος
div1.sense: sick to death, at deathʼs door, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιθαρσέω
div1.sense: to put trust in, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιθαρσύνω
div1.sense: to cheer on, encourage, τινά Il., Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιθαυμάζω
div1.sense: to pay honour to, τινά Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιθεάζω
div1.sense: ἐπιθεάζων with imprecations, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιθειάζω
div1.sense: to call upon in the name of the gods, to adjure, conjure, Lat. obtestari per deos, Thuc.
to lend inspiration, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιθειασμός
div1.sense: an appeal to the gods, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιθεραπεύω
div1.sense: to serve diligently, work zealously for, τι Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίθεσις
div1.sense: a laying on, τῶν χειρῶν NTest.
(from Mid.) a setting upon, attack, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιθεσπίζω
div1.sense: of the Pythian Priestess, to prophesy or divine upon, τῷ τρίποδι Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιθετέος
div1.sense: one must impose, δίκην Plat.
one must set to work at, τινί Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιθετικός
div1.sense: ready to attack, θηρίοις Xen.: enterprising, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίθετος
div1.sense: added, assumed, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιθέω
div1.sense: to run at or after, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιθήκη
div1.sense: an addition, increase, Hes.: acc. as adv., κἀπιθήκην τέτταρας and 4 drachmas into the bargain, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπίθημα
div1.sense: something put on, a lid, cover, Il., Hdt.
a sepulchral figure, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιθιγγάνω
div1.sense: to touch on the surface, touch lightly, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιθοάζω
div1.sense: to sit as a suppliant at an altar, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιθορυβέω
div1.sense: to shout to, Lat. acclamare, in token either of approval or of displeasure, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιθραύω
div1.sense: to break besides, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιθρηνέω
div1.sense: to lament over, c. acc., Babr.

div1.head: ἐπιθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to leap upon a ship, c. gen., Il.: also c. dat. to leap (contemptously) upon, Lat. insultare, τύμβῳ ἐπιθρώσκων Μενελάου Il.
to leap over, τόσσον ἐπιθρώσκουσι so far do [the horses] spring at a bound, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιθυμέω
div1.sense: to set oneʼs heart upon a thing, lust after, long for, covet, desire, c. gen., Hdt., Aesch., etc.; also c. gen. pers., Xen.:—c. inf. to desire to do, Hdt., Soph.:—absol. to desire, covet, Thuc., etc.; τὸ ἐπιθυμοῦν τοῦ πλοῦ ἐπιθυμία, eagerness for it, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιθύμημα
div1.sense: an object of desire, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιθυμητής
div1.sense: one who longs for or desires a thing, c. gen., Hdt., etc.
absol. a lover, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιθυμητικός
div1.sense: desiring, coveting, lusting after a thing, c. gen., Plat., etc.:—adv., ἐπιθυμητικῶς ἔχειν τινός ἐπιθυμεῖν, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιθυμίαμα
div1.sense: an incense-offering, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιθυμιάω
div1.sense: to offer incense, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιθύνω
div1.sense: to guide straight, direct, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιθύω
div1.sense: to sacrifice besides or after, Aesch., Eur.:—so in Mid., Plut.
to offer incense on the altar; generally to offer, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιθύω
div1.sense: to rush eagerly at, Od.
c. inf. to strive vehemently to do a thing, Il., Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπιθυμία
div1.sense: desire, yearning, longing, Hdt., Plat., etc.; ἐπιθυμίᾳ by passion, opp. to προνοίᾳ, Thuc.
c. gen. a longing after a thing, desire of or for it, Thuc., etc.; so, ἐπ. πρός τι Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιθωρακίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to put on oneʼs armour, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιθωΰσσω
div1.sense: to shout aloud, give loud commands, Aesch.; ἐπεθώϋξας τοῦτο didst urge this upon us, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιίστωρ
div1.sense: privy to a thing, c. gen., Od.
acquainted with, practised in a thing, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ἐπικαθαιρέω
div1.sense: to pull down or destroy besides, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικαθεύδω
div1.sense: to sleep upon, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικάθημαι
div1.sense: Pass. to sit upon, τινι Hdt., Ar.: to press upon, be heavy upon, ἐπί τινι Ar.
ἐπ. ἐπὶ τῆς τραπέζης to sit at his counter, of a money-changer, Dem.
to sit down against a place, besiege it, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικαθίζω
div1.sense: to set upon, τινὰ ἐπί τι Hipp.:—Mid., aor. 2 -καθέζομην, φυλακὴν ἐπεκαθίσαντο had a guard set, Thuc.
intr. to sit upon, light upon, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικαινόω
div1.sense: to innovate upon, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπικαίνυμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to surpass, excel, c. acc., Il.
as Pass. to be adorned or furnished with a thing, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: ἐπικαίριος
div1.sense: = ἐπίκαιρος, Xen.
important, οἱ ἐπικαιριώτατοι the most important officers, Xen.; c. inf., οἱ θεραπεύεσθαι ἐπικαίριοι those whose cure is all-important, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίκαιρος
div1.sense: in fit time or place, in season, seasonable, opportune, convenient, Soph., Thuc.; of places, ἐπικαιρότατον χωρίον ἀποχρῆσθαι most convenient to use, Thuc.; τοὺς ἐπικαίρους τῶν τόπων Dem.:—also c. gen., λουτρῶν ἐπίκαιρος convenient for . . , Soph.
of parts of the body, vital, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικαίω
div1.sense: to light up a place, πῦρ Hhymn.: to burn on an altar, μηρία Hom.

div1.head: ἐπικαλαμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to glean after the reapers, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικαλέω
div1.sense: to call upon a god, invoke, appeal to, Hdt., Dem.; ἐπ. θεόν τινι to invoke a god, to watch over him, Hdt.:—so in Mid., Hdt., Xen.
to invite, Od.; in Mid., Hdt.
Mid. to call in as a helper or ally, Hdt., Thuc.
Mid. to call before one, summon, of the Ephors, Hdt.
Mid. to challenge, Hdt.
Pass. to be called by surname, Hdt.: to be nicknamed, Xen.
to bring as an accusation against, τί τινι Thuc.; ταῦτʼ ἐπικαλεῖς; is this your charge? Ar.:—Pass., τὰ ἐπικαλεύμενα χρήματα the money he was charged with having, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικαλύπτω
div1.sense: to cover over, cover up, shroud, Hes., Plat.
to put as a covering over, βλεφάρων ἐπ. φᾶρος Eur.

div1.head: ἐπικαμπή
div1.sense: the bend, return or angle of a building, Hdt.; ἐπ. ποιεῖσθαι to draw up their army angular-wise, i. e. with the wings advanced at angles with the centre, so as to take the enemy in flank, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικαμπής
div1.sense: curved, curling, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend into an angle:—Pass. to move the wings of an army forward, so as to form angles with the centre and take the enemy in flank, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικαμπύλος
div1.sense: crooked, curved, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπίκαρ
div1.sense: head-foremost, v. κάρ II.

div1.head: ἐπικαρπία
div1.sense: the usufruct of a property, revenue, profit, opp. to the principal (τὰ ἀρχαῖα) , Dem.

div1.head: ἐπικαρπίδιος
div1.sense: on fruit, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπικάρσιος
div1.sense: athwart, cross-wise, at an angle, esp. at a right angle, Od., Hdt.; τὰ ἐπικάρσια the country measured along the coast, opp. to τὰ ὄρθια (at right angles to the coast), Hdt.:—c. gen., τριήρεας τοῦ Πόντου ἐπικαρσίας forming an angle with the current of the Pontus, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικαταβαίνω
div1.sense: to go down to a place, Hdt., Thuc.
to go down against an enemy, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικαταβάλλω
div1.sense: to let fall down at a thing, τὰ ὦτα Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικατάγω
div1.sense: in Mid-Pass. to come to land along with or afterwards, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικαταδαρθάνω
div1.sense: to fall asleep afterwards, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπικαταίρω
div1.sense: intr. to sink down upon, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικατακλύζω
div1.sense: to overflow besides, τὴν Ἀσίην Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικατακοιμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sleep upon, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικαταλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to catch up, overtake, τινά Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπικαταλλαγή
div1.sense: money paid for exchange, discount, Theophr.

div1.head: ἐπικαταμένω
div1.sense: to tarry longer, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικαταπίπτω
div1.sense: to throw oneself upon, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικατάρατος
div1.sense: yet more accursed, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπικαταρρέω
div1.sense: to fall down upon, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικαταρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to fall violently down, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικαταρριπτέω
div1.sense: to throw down after, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικατασφάζω
div1.sense: to slay upon or over, τινὰ τῷ νεκρῷ, ἑαυτὸν τῷ τύμβῳ Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικατατέμνω
div1.sense: to carry the workings of a mine beyond oneʼs boundaries, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπικαταψεύδομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to tell lies besides, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικάτειμι
div1.sense: to go down into, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικατέχω
div1.sense: to detain still, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίκαυτος
div1.sense: burnt at the end, Lat. praeustus, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίκειμαι
div1.sense: serving as Pass. to ἐπιτίθημι, to be laid upon:
of doors, to be put to or closed, Od., Theogn.
to be placed in or on, c. dat., Hes., Theocr.
of islands, νῆσοι ἐπὶ Λήμνου ἐπικείμεναι lying off Lemnos, Hdt.; so, ἐπ. τῇ Θρηΐκῃ Hdt.; αἱ νῆσοι αἱ ἐπικείμεναι the islands off the coast, Thuc.
to press upon, be urgent in intreaty, Hdt.: to press upon a retreating enemy, c. dat., Hdt., Ar., etc.
to hang over, Lat. imminere, c. dat., Xen.; of penalties, θάνατος ἡ ζημίη ἐπικέαται the penalty imposed is death, Hdt.; ζημία ἐπέκειτο στατήρ Thuc.
c. acc. rei, ἐπικείμεναι κάρα κυνέας having their heads covered with helmets, Eur.; πρόσωπον ἐπικείμενος under an assumed character, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικείρω
div1.sense: to cut off, cut down, Il.
metaph. to cut short, Lat. praecidere, Il.

div1.head: ἐπικελαδέω
div1.sense: to shout to, shout in applause, Il.

div1.head: ἐπικέλευσις
div1.sense: a cheering on, exhortation, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικελεύω
div1.sense: to encourage besides, to cheer on again, absol. or c. dat., Eur.; also c. acc. pers., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικέλλω
div1.sense: to bring to shore, Lat. appellere, Od.
absol. to run ashore, Od.

div1.head: ἐπικέλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to call upon, τινα Il.

div1.head: ἐπικεντρίζω
div1.sense: to apply the spur, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπικεράννυμι
div1.sense: to mix in addition, Od.

div1.head: ἐπικερδαίνω
div1.sense: to gain in addition, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικέρδια
div1.sense: profit on traffic or business, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικερτομέω
div1.sense: to mock, ἐπικερτομέων in mockery, Hom.; in milder sense, laughingly, Il.
c. acc. to reproach one, Hdt.:— to teaze, plague, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπικεύθω
div1.sense: to conceal, hide, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπικήδειος
div1.sense: of or at a burial, funeral, Eur.; ἐπικήδειον, ου, τό, a dirge, elegy, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίκηρος
div1.sense: subject to death, perishable, Arist.

div1.head: ἐπικηρυκεία
div1.sense: the sending an embassy to treat for peace, entering into negotiation, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπικηρύκευμα
div1.sense: a demand by herald, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπικηρυκεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to send a message by a herald, τινι or πρός τινα Hdt.; ὥς τινα Thuc.:— c. dat. et inf. to send a message calling on them to do a thing, Thuc.; ἐπικηρυκευομένων messages being sent, Thuc.
to send ambassadors to treat for peace, to make proposals for a treaty of peace, Hdt., Thuc.
of private affairs, to negociate, τινι with one, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπικηρύσσω
div1.sense: to announce by proclamation, Aesch., in Pass.
of penalties, ἐπ. θάνατον τὴν ζημίαν to proclaim death as the penalty, Xen.; ἐπ. ἀργύριον ἐπί τινι to set a price on his head, Hdt.
to offer as a reward, Plut.
to put up to public sale, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικίδνημι
div1.sense: to spread over, Orac. ap. Hdt.:—Pass., ὕδωρ ἐπικίδναται αἶαν is spread over the earth, Il.; ὅσον τʼ ἐπικίδναται ἠώς far as the morning light is spread, Il.

div1.head: ἐπικινδυνεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be risked, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπικίνδυνος
div1.sense: in danger, dangerous, insecure, precarious, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; of a person, ἐπικίνδυνος ἦν μὴ λαμφθείη was in danger of being taken, Hdt.:— adv. -νως, in a precarious or critical state, Soph.: at oneʼs risk, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικίχρημι
div1.sense: to lend, τί τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίκλαυτος
div1.sense: tearful, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπικλάω
div1.sense: to bend to or besides:—Pass. to be bent double, Luc.
metaph. to bow down, τινα Plut.:—Pass., ἐπικλασθῆναι τῇ γνώμῃ to be broken in spirit, Thuc.; but also, to be bent or turned to pity, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικλείω
div1.sense: to shut to, close, as a door, Ar.:—Mid., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικλείω
div1.sense: to extol or praise the more, Od.

div1.head: ἐπίκλημα
div1.sense: an accusation, charge, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπίκλην
div1.sense: by surname, by name, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπίκληρος
div1.sense: an heiress, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἐπικληρόω
div1.sense: to assign by lot, τί τινι Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἐπίκλησις
div1.sense: a surname or additional name; the acc. being used absol. as adv., by surname, Ἀστυάναξ, ὃν Τρῶες ἐπίκλησιν καλέουσι Astyanax, as they call him by surname (his name being Scamandrius), Il., etc.
generally, a name, Thuc.
an imputation, Thuc.
a calling upon, invocation, appeal, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίκλητος
div1.sense: called upon, called in as allies, Hdt., Thuc.
specially summoned, Hdt.; ἐπίκλητοι privy-councillors, among the Persians, Hdt.
a supernumerary guest, Lat. umbra, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπικλινής
div1.sense: sloping, Thuc., Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικλίνω
