div1.sense: to put a door to: Pass., perf. part. ἐπικεκλιμέναι σανίδες closed doors, Il.
to bend towards, τὰ ὦτα ἐπ. to prick the ears, Xen.:— Pass., κεραῖαι ἐπικεκλιμέναι spars inclined at an angle to the wall, Thuc.
intr. to incline towards, πρός τι Dem.
Pass. to lie over against a place, c. dat., Eur.
in Pass., also, to lie down at table, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπίκλοπος
div1.sense: thievish, wily, Od., Aesch.
c. gen., ἐπίκλοπος μύθων cunning in speech, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπικλύζω
div1.sense: to overflow, Il., Thuc.
metaph. to deluge, swamp, Eur.; ἐπ. τινὰ κακοῖς Luc.
metaph., also, to sweep away, liquidate the expenses, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπίκλυσις
div1.sense: an overflow, flood, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικλύω
div1.etym: = ἐπακούω, c. acc., Il.; c. gen., Od.

div1.head: ἐπικλώθω
div1.sense: to spin to one, of the Fates who spun the thread of destiny: then, generally, to assign as oneʼs lot or destiny, Od., Aesch.:—so in Mid., Hom.:—Pass., aor1 part., τὰ ἐπικλωσθέντα oneʼs destinies, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπικνάω
div1.etym: Epic 3rd sg. imperf. ἐπικνῆ for ἐπέκναε
div1.sense: to scrape or grate over, Il., Ar.

div1.head: ἐπικνίζω
div1.sense: to cut on the surface, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπικοιμάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to fall asleep over a thing, c. dat., Plat., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικοινόω
div1.sense: Mid. to consult with, τινι περί τινος Plat.

div1.head: ἐπίκοινος
div1.sense: common to many, promiscuous, Hdt.: — sharing equally in a thing, c. gen., Eur.:—neut. pl. ἐπίκοινα as adv. in common, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικοινωνέω
div1.sense: to communicate with a person, c. dat., Plat., etc.
to have a share of a thing in common with another, τινός τινι Plat.

div1.head: ἐπικομπάζω
div1.sense: to add boastingly, Eur., Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικομπέω
div1.sense: = ἐπι-κομπάζω, Thuc.
to boast of, τι Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίκοπος
div1.sense: fit for cutting: as Subst., ἐπίκοπον, ου, τό, a chopping-block, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικόπτω
div1.sense: to strike upon (i. e. from above), to fell, Od.
metaph. to cut short, reprove, Plut.
in Mid. to smite oneʼs breast, mourn for another, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπικορύσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to arm oneself against, τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικοσμέω
div1.sense: to add ornaments to, to decorate after or besides, Hdt.; θεὰν ἐπ. to honour, celebrate, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίκοτος
div1.sense: wrathful, vengeful, Aesch.; ἐπίκοτος τροφᾶς in wrath at the sons he had bred, Aesch.—adv. -τως, wrathfully, Aesch.

div1.head: Ἐπικούρειος
div1.sense: Epicurean, Anth.; οἱ Ἐπ. the Epicureans, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικουρέω
div1.sense: to act as an ally, Il., Hdt., etc.; τινι to one, Thuc., etc.

generally, to aid or help at need, τινί Eur., Ar.: c. dat. rei, νόσοις ἐπικουρεῖν to aid one against them, Xen.; ἐσθὴς ἐπικουρεῖ τινι does him good service, Xen.; ἐπ. τροφῆι to make provision for it, Aeschin.
c. acc. rei, ἐπικουρεῖν τινι χειμῶνα to keep it off from one, Lat. defendere, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικούρημα
div1.sense: protection, χιόνος against snow, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικούρησις
div1.sense: protection, κακῶν against evils, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπικουρία
div1.sense: aid, succour, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
an auxiliary or mercenary force, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικουρικός
div1.sense: serving for help, assistant, Plat.
of troops, auxiliary, allied, Thuc.: τὸ ἐπικουρικόν, ἐπικουρία II, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίκουρος
div1.sense: an assister, ally, Il., Hdt.; of the allies of Troy, Τρῶες ἠδʼ ἐπίκουροι Il.
in Attic, ἐπίκουροι were mercenary troops, opp. to the citizen-soldiers (πολῖται) , Thuc., Xen.
= δορυφόροι, the bodyguards of kings, Hdt.
as adj. assisting, aiding, c. dat. pers., Il., Ar., etc.
c. gen. rei, defending or protecting against, Soph., Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικουφίζω
div1.sense: to lighten a ship by throwing out part of its cargo, Hdt.: metaph., ἐπ. τοὺς πόνους to lighten oneʼs labours, Xen.:—c. gen. rei, to relieve of a burden, Eur.
to lift up, support, Soph.: metaph. to lift up, encourage, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικράζω
div1.sense: to shout to or at, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικραίνω
div1.sense: to bring to pass, accomplish, fulfil, Il.; νῦν μοι τόδʼ ἐπικρήηνον ἐέλδωρ grant me now this prayer, fulfil it, Il.:—Pass., χρυσῷ δʼ ἐπὶ χείλεα κεκράαντο were finished off with gold, Od.

div1.head: ἐπίκρανον
div1.sense: that which is put on the head, a head-dress, cap, Eur.
the capital of a column, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπικράτεια
div1.sense: mastery, dominion, possession, Xen.
of a country, a realm, dominion, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικρατέω
div1.sense: to rule over, c. dat., Hom.: absol. to have or hold power, Od.
to prevail in battle, be victorious, conquer, Il., Hdt.
c. gen. to prevail over, get the mastery of an enemy, Hdt., Attic:—also to become master of, Lat. potiri, τῆς θαλάσσης, τῶν Ἑλλήνων Hdt., etc.
generally, to be superior, τῷ ναυτικῷ Thuc.; κατὰ θάλασσαν Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικράτησις
div1.sense: victory over, τινος Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικρεμάννυμι
div1.sense: to hang over, τί τινι Theogn.
Pass., to overhang, of a rock, Hhymn., Plut.: —metaph. to hang over, Lat. imminere, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικρίνω
div1.sense: to decide, determine, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἐπικρατής
div1.sense: master of a thing: only in comp., ἐπικρατέστερος superior, Thuc.:—adv., ἐπικρατέως, with overwhelming might, impetuously, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ἐπίκριον
div1.sense: the yard-arm of a ship, Od.

div1.head: ἐπικροτέω
div1.sense: to rattle over the ground, Hes.

div1.head: ἐπίκροτος
div1.sense: trodden hard, of ground, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικρούω
div1.sense: to strike upon, ἐπ. χθόνα βάκτροις to strike the earth with staffs, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπικρύπτω
div1.sense: to throw a cloak over, conceal, Aesch., Plat.:—Mid. to disguise, Plat., Dem.:— to disguise oneself, conceal oneʼs purpose, Thuc., Plut.; ἐπικρυπτόμενος with concealment or secrecy, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίκρυφος
div1.sense: unknown, inglorious, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίκρυψις
div1.sense: concealment, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικρώζω
div1.sense: to caw or croak at, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπικτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to gain or win besides, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐπικτείνω
div1.sense: to kill besides or again, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπίκτησις
div1.sense: further acquisition, fresh gain, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπίκτητος
div1.sense: gained besides or in addition, newly acquired, Hdt., Attic; ἐπ. γῆ, of the Delta of Egypt, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικτυπέω
div1.sense: to make a noise after, re-echo, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπικυδής
div1.sense: glorious, brilliant, successful, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπικυΐσκομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become doubly pregnant, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπικυκλέω
div1.sense: intr. to come round in turn upon, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπικυμαίνω
div1.sense: to flow in waves over, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικύπτω
div1.sense: to bend oneself or stoop over, ἐπ. ἐπί τι to stoop down to ge something, Xen.:— to lean upon, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἐπικυρόω
div1.sense: to confirm, sanction, ratify, Thuc., Xen., etc.; c. inf., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπικυρτόω
div1.sense: to bend forward, Hes.

div1.head: ἐπικύρω
div1.sense: to light upon, fall in with, c. dat., Il., Hes.
c. gen. to have a share, of, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπικυψέλιος
div1.sense: a guard of beehives, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπικωκύω
div1.sense: to lament over a person orthing, c. acc., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπικωλύω
div1.sense: to hinder, check, Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπικωμάζω
div1.sense: to rush in like revellers, to make a riotous assault. Ar.; εἰς τὰς πόλεις Plat.:—Pass. to be grossly maltreated, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπικωμῳδέω
div1.sense: to satirize in comedy, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπίκωπος
div1.sense: up to the hilt, through and through, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιλαγχάνω
div1.sense: to obtain the lot, to succeed another, Aeschin.
perf. ἐπι-λέλογχα, to fall to oneʼs lot next, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιλάζυμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to hold tight, close, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to lay hold of, seize, attack, as a disease, Hdt., Thuc.:—Pass., τὴν αἴσθησιν ἐπιληφθείς Lat. sensibus captus, Plut.
of events, to overtake, surprise, interrupt, Thuc.
to attain to, reach, Xen.; ἔτη ὀκτὼ ἐπ. to live over eight years, Thuc.
to seize, stop, esp. by pressure, Ar., etc.; ἐπ. τινὰ τῆς ὀπίσω ὁδοῦ to stop him from getting back, Hdt.
metaph., πολὺν χῶρον ἐπ. to get over much ground, traverse it rapidly, as in Virgil corripere campum, Theocr.
Mid., with perf. pass., to hold oneself on by, lay hold of, catch, c. gen., Hdt., Thuc.
to attack, τινος Xen.
to make a seizure of, τινος Dem.
to lay hold of, get, obtain, προστάτεω a chief, προφάσιος a pretext, Hdt.
of place, to gain, reach, τῶν ὀρῶν Plut.
to attempt a thing, c. gen., Plut.
to take up, interrupt in speaking (cf. ὑπολαμβάνω) , Plat.: to object to, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιλαμπρύνω
div1.sense: to make splendid, adorn, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιλάμπω
div1.sense: to shine after or thereupon, Il., etc.; ἐπιλαμψάσης ἡμέρης when day had fully come, Hdt.
to shine upon, c. dat., Plut., Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιλανθάνομαι
div1.sense: to forget, v. sub ἐπιλήθω.

div1.head: ἐπιλεαίνω
div1.sense: to smoothe over, ἐπιλεήνας τὴν Ξέρξεω γνώμην, i. e. making it plausible, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιλέγω
div1.sense: to choose, pick out, select, Hdt.:— Mid., τῶν Βαβυλωνίων ἐπελέξατο he chose him certain of the Babylonians, Hdt.; so in Attic:—Pass., ἐπιλελεγμένοι or ἐπειλεγμένοι chosen men, Xen.
to say in addition, add further, Hdt.
to call by name, Hdt.
in Ionic Gr. also, in Mid.
to think upon, think over, τι Hdt.; οὐκ ἐπ., nihil curare, Hdt.; c. inf. to deem or expect that, Hdt.; so also in Aesch.
to con over, read, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιλείβω
div1.sense: to pour wine over a thing, Il.; to pour a libation, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιλείπω
div1.sense: to leave behind, Od., Xen.
to leave untouched, Plat.
of things, to fail one, Lat. deficere, c. acc. pers., ὕδωρ μιν ἐπέλιπε the water failed him, Hdt.; ἐπιλείψει με λέγοντα ἡ ἡμέρα Dem.
in Hdt., often of rivers, ἐπ. τὸ ῥέεθρον to leave their stream empty, run dry, Hdt.; and so without ῥέεθρον, to fail, run dry, Hdt.
generally, to fail, be wanting, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἐπίλειψις
div1.sense: a deficiency, lack, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίλεκτος
div1.sense: chosen, picked, of soldiers, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιλέπω
div1.sense: to strip of bark, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπιλεύσσω
div1.sense: to look towards or at, τόσσον τίς τʼ ἐπιλεύσσει one can only see so far before one, Il.

div1.head: ἐπίληθος
div1.sense: causing to forget, τινος Od.

div1.head: ἐπιλήθω
div1.sense: to cause to forget a thing, c. gen., Od.: —Pass. to be forgotten, perf. part. ἐπιλελησμένος NTest.

Mid. ἐπι-λήθομαι and -λανθάνομαι, fut. -λήσομαι· aor2 -ελαθόμην· with perf. act. -λέληθα and pass. -λέλησμαι· plup. -ἐλελήσμην:— to let a thing escape one, to forget, lose thought of, c. gen., ὅπως Ἰθάκης ἐπιλήσεται (Epic for -htai) Od.; so Hdt., Attic:—also c. acc., Hdt., Eur., etc.:—c. inf., Ar., Plat.
to forget wilfully, ἑκὼν ἐπιλήθομαι Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιληΐς
div1.sense: obtained as booty, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιληκέω
div1.sense: to beat time to dancers, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιληκυθίστρια
div1.sense: nickname of the Tragic muse, the bombastical, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπίληπτος
div1.sense: caught or detected in anything, Soph.; c. part., ἐπίλαμπτος ἀφάσσουσα caught in the act of feeling, Hdt.
suffering, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιλήπτωρ
div1.sense: a censurer, Timo ap. Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιλησμονή
div1.sense: forgetfulness, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιλήσμων
div1.sense: apt to forget, forgetful, Ar., Plat., etc.; c. gen. rei, Xen., in comp. ἐπιλησμονέστερος, whereas Ar. has ἐπιλησμότατος (as if from ἐπίλησμος).

div1.head: ἐπίληψις
div1.sense: a seizing, seizure, Plat.
epilepsy, Lat. morbus comitialis.

div1.head: ἐπιλίγδην
div1.sense: grazing, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιλιμνάζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be overflowed, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιλιπαίνω
div1.sense: to make fat or sleek, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιλλίζω
div1.sense: to make signs to one by winking, Od.: to wink roguishly, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπιλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to reckon over, conclude, ὅτι . . Hdt.; ἐπ. τι to take account of a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίλογος
div1.sense: a conclusion, inference, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίλογχος
div1.sense: barbed, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπίλοιπος
div1.sense: still left, remaining, Hdt., Attic
of Time, to come, future, χρόνος Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιλυπέω
div1.sense: to annoy or offend besides, τινα Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίλυσις
div1.sense: release from a thing, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιλύω
div1.sense: to loose, untie, Theocr.: to set free, release, Luc.: so in Mid., Plat.; ἐπιλύεσθαι ἐπιστολάς to open letters, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιλωβεύω
div1.sense: to mock at a thing, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιμαίνω
div1.sense: to be mad after, dote upon, c. dat., Il., Ar.:—absol. to be mad, to rage, Aesch.
to attack furiously, τινι Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιμαίομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to strive after, seek to obtain, aim at, c. gen., σκοπέλου ἐπιμαίεο make for (i. e. steer for) the rock, Od.; metaph., ἐπιμαίεο νόστου strive after a return, Od.
c. acc. to lay hold of, grasp, ἐπεμαίετο κώπην he clutched his sword-hilt, Od.; χείρʼ (i. e. χειρὶ) ἐπιμασσάμενος having clutched [the sword] with my hand, Od.
to handle, feel, Od.; ἕλκος ἰητὴρ ἐπιμάσσεται will probe the wound, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιμανθάνω
div1.sense: to learn besides or after, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to bear witness to a thing, to depose, Plat., etc.
in Mid. to adjure, τινὶ μὴ ποιεῖν τι Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιμαρτυρία
div1.sense: a witness, testimony, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμαρτύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to call to witness, appeal to, τοὺς θεούς Xen.:—also, to call a person as oneʼs witness, Lat. antestari, Ar.
to call on earnestly, to conjure, Lat. obtestari, Hdt.; ἐπιμ. τινα μὴ ποιεῖν τι to call on one not to do, Hdt.
to affirm or declare before witnesses that . . , Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιμάρτυρος
div1.sense: a witness to oneʼs word, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπιμάσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to knead again, stroke, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιμαστίδιος
div1.sense: at the breast, not yet weaned, Trag.

div1.head: ἐπίμαστος
div1.sense: seeking for help, begging, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιμαχέω
div1.sense: to help one in war, τῇ ἀλλήλων ἐπιμαχεῖν to make a league for the mutual defence of their countries, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμαχία
div1.sense: a defensive alliance, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπίμαχος
div1.sense: easily attacked, assailable, Hdt., Thuc., etc.: of a country, open to attack, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμειδάω
div1.sense: to smile at, ἐπιμειδήσας προσέφη addressed him with a smile, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιμειδιάω
div1.sense: to smile upon, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιμείζων
div1.sense: still larger or greater, Democr.

div1.head: ἐπιμέλεια
div1.sense: care, attention, Attic Prose; also in Hdt.; pl. cares, pains, Xen., etc.:—c. gen. care for a thing, attention paid to it, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; also, περί τινος Thuc.; πρός τινα or τι Dem.
a public charge or commission, Lat. procuratio, Aeschin.: any pursuit, Lat. studium, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιμελέομαι
div1.sense: to take care of, have charge of, have the management of a thing, c. gen., Hdt., Attic; περί τινος, ὑπέρ τινος Xen.:—c. acc. et inf. to take care that . . , Thuc., etc.; so, ἐπ. ὅπως Plat.:—absol. to give heed, attend, Hdt.
in public offices, to be curator of, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιμέλημα
div1.sense: a care, anxiety, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιμελής
div1.sense: careful or anxious about, put in charge of a thing, c. gen., Plat., Xen.:— τὸ ἐπιμελές τινος ἐπιμέλεια, Thuc.
absol. careful, attentive, Ar., Xen.
Pass. cared for, an object of care, Hdt.; ἐπιμελές μοι ἦν it was my business, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐπιμελητέος
div1.sense: one must take care, pay attention, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιμελητής
div1.sense: one who has charge of a thing, a governor, manager, curator, superintendent, Ar., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιμελητικός
div1.sense: able to take charge, managing, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιμέλπω
div1.sense: to sing to, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιμέμονα
div1.sense: to desire to do a thing, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιμέμφομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to cast blame upon a person, c. dat., Od., Hdt., etc.; rarely c. acc. pers., Soph.:—c. gen. rei, to find fault for or because of a thing, complain of it, εὐχωλῆς ἐπιμέμφεται complains of the vow [neglected], Il.:—absol. to find fault, complain, Hdt., etc.
to impute as matter of blame, τί τινι Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιμένω
div1.sense: to stay on, tarry or abide still, Hom., Attic; ἐπίμεινον wait, Il.
absol. to remain in place, continue as they are, of things, Thuc., Plat.:— to keep his seat, of a horseman, Xen.
to continue in a pursuit, ἐπί τινι Plat., etc.
to abide by, ταῖς σπονδαῖς Xen.
c. acc. to await, Eur., Plat.; so c. inf., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμεταπέμπομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to send for a reinforcement, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμετρέω
div1.sense: to measure out besides, Hes.:— Pass., ὁ ἐπιμετρούμενος σῖτος the corn paid by measure to the Persians, Hdt.
to add to the measure, give over and above, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίμετρον
div1.sense: over-measure, excess, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιμήδομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contrive against one, τί τινι Od.

div1.head: Ἐπιμηθεύς
div1.sense: Epi-metheus, after-thought, brother of Pro-metheus, fore-thought, Hes.

div1.head: ἐπιμηθής
div1.sense: thoughtful, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιμηθικῶς
div1.sense: like Epimetheus, Eust.

div1.head: ἐπιμήκης
div1.sense: longish, oblong, Luc.

div1.head: Ἐπιμηλίδες
div1.sense: flock-protectors, Nymphs, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιμήνιος
div1.sense: monthly: as Subst., ἐπιμήνια, τά, (sub. ἱερά) , monthly offerings, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιμηνίω
div1.sense: to be angry with, Πριάμῳ ἐπεμήνιε Il.

div1.head: ἐπιμηχανάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to devise plans against, take precautions, Hdt., Luc.
to devise besides, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιμήχανος
div1.sense: craftily devising, κακῶν ἐπιμήχανος ἔργων contriver of ill deeds, Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιμείγνυμι
div1.sense: to add to by mixing, mix with, τί τινι Plat.
intr. to mingle with others, to have intercourse or dealings with them, τισί Thuc.; πρός τινας Xen.:—so also in Pass., ἐπιμίγνυσθαι ἀλλήλοις Xen.; παρʼ ἀλλήλους Thuc.
ἐπιμίσγω,older form of ἐπιμίγνυμι

intr. to have intercourse, παρʼ ἀλλήλους Thuc.:—so Pass. in same sense, c. dat. pers., Od., Hdt., etc.; αἰεὶ Τρώεσσʼ ἐπιμίσγομαι I have always to be dealing with the Trojans, am always clashing with them, Il.: absol. to associate together, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμιμνήσκομαι
div1.sense: Pass.:— to bethink oneself of, to remember, think of a person or thing, c. gen., Hom.
to make mention of, τινος Od., Hdt., etc.; περί τινος Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιμίμνω
div1.sense: to continue in a work, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: ἐπιμειξία
div1.sense: a mixing with others, intercourse, dealings, Lat. commercium, πρός τινας Hdt., Xen.; παρʼ ἀλλήλους Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμίξ
div1.sense: confusedly, promiscuously, pele-mele, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπιμοίριος
div1.sense: fated, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιμολεῖν
div1.sense: to come upon, befall, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπίμολος
div1.sense: an invader, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπίμομφος
div1.sense: inclined to blame, Eur.
blameable, unlucky, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιμονή
div1.sense: a staying on, tarrying, delay, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιμύζω
div1.sense: to murmur at oneʼs words, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιμυθέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to say besides, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιμύθιος
div1.sense: coming after the fable: τὸ ἐπ. the moral, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίμυκτος
div1.sense: scoffed at, Theogn.

div1.head: ἐπιμύω
div1.sense: to wink in token of assent, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιμωμητός
div1.sense: blameworthy, Hes., Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπίνειον
div1.sense: the sea-port where the navy lies, the state harbour, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπινέμησις
div1.sense: a spreading, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπινέμω
div1.sense: to allot, distribute, Hom.

to turn oneʼs cattle to graze over the boundaries, Plat.:—in Mid., of cattle, to feed over the boundaries, trespass on oneʼs neighbourʼs lands: metaph., of fire, to spread over a place, Hdt.:—so of an infectious disease, Thuc.; in Pass., ὅρος ἐπινέμεται the boundary is exposed to encroachment, Aesch.: cf. ἐπινομία.

div1.head: ἐπινεύω
div1.sense: to nod, in token of approval, to nod assent, Il.; ἐπ. τι to approve, sanction, promise, Eur.; ἐπένευσεν ἀληθὲς εἶναι he nodded in sign that it was true, Aeschin.
to make a sign to another to do a thing, to order him to do, Hom.
to nod forwards, κόρυθι ἐπένευε he nodded with his helmet, i. e. it nodded, Il.
to incline towards, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπινέφελος
div1.sense: clouded, overcast, ἐπινεφέλων ὄντων (gen. absol.) the weather being cloudy, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπινεφρίδιος
div1.sense: upon the kidneys, Il.

div1.head: ἐπινέω
div1.sense: to allot by spinning, of the Fates, Il.

div1.head: ἐπινέω
div1.sense: to heap up or load with a thing, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπινέω
div1.sense: to float on the top.

div1.head: ἐπινήϊος
div1.sense: on board ship, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπινηνέω
div1.sense: to heap or pile upon a thing, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἐπινήχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to swim upon, Batr.; ἐπενάχετο φωνά the voice came up to earth, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπινίκιος
div1.sense: of victory, triumphal, Pind., etc.
as Subst., ἐπινίκιον (sc. μέλος) , a song of victory, triumphal ode, Aesch.
ἐπινίκια (sc. ἱερά) , τά, a sacrifice for a victory or feast in honour of it, Plat., etc.
(sc. ἆθλα) the prize of victory, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπινίσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go over, c. gen., Soph.
to visit, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπινίφω
div1.sense: to snow upon: impers., ἐπινίφει fresh snow falls, or it keeps snowing, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπινοέω
div1.sense: to think on or of, contrive, Hdt., Attic: —c. inf., Ar.:—absol. to form plans, to plan, invent, Thuc.
to have in oneʼs mind, intend, purpose, Thuc., etc.: c. inf., Hdt., Xen.
aor1 pass. ἐπινοήθην is used like Act., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίνοια
div1.sense: a thinking on or of a thing, a thought, notion, Thuc.
power of thought, inventiveness, invention, Ar.
a purpose, design, Eur.
after-thought, second thoughts, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπινομή
div1.sense: a grazing over the boundaries: — metaph., ἐπ. πυρός the spreading of fire, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπινομία
div1.sense: a grazing over the boundaries: a mutual right of pasture, vested in the citizens of two neighbouring states, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπινύκτιος
div1.sense: by night, nightly, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπινυμφίδιος
div1.sense: of or for a bride, bridal, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπινυστάζω
div1.sense: to drop asleep over, c. dat., Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπινωμάω
div1.sense: to bring or apply to, Soph., Eur.
to distribute, apportion, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπινωτίδιος
div1.sense: on the back, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπινωτίζω
div1.sense: to set on the back, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπινώτιος
div1.sense: on the back, Batr.

div1.head: ἐπίξανθος
div1.sense: inclining to yellow, tawny, of hares, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιξενόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to have hospitable relations with, be intimate with, Dem.
as Mid. to claim friendly services, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπίξηνον
div1.sense: a chopping-block: the executionerʼs block, Aesch., Ar.

div1.head: ἐπίξυνος
div1.sense: a common, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιοίνιος
div1.sense: at or over wine, Theogn.

div1.head: ἐπιοινοχοεύω
div1.sense: to pour out wine for others, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπιορκέω
div1.sense: to swear falsely, forswear oneself, πρὸς δαίμονος by a deity, Il.; c. acc., τοὺς θεούς by the gods, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιορκία
div1.sense: a false oath, Lat. perjuria, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπίορκος
div1.sense: sworn falsely, of oaths, Il.: as Subst., ἐπίορκον ὀμνύναι to take a false oath, swear falsely, Il., Hes.: but also, ἐπ. ἐπώμοσε he swore a bootless oath, Il.
of persons, forsworn, perjured, Hes., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιόσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have before oneʼs eyes, Il.

div1.head: ἐπίουρος
div1.sense: an over-keeper, a guardian, watcher, ward, c. gen., ὑῶν ἐπίουρος Od., etc.; c. dat., Κρήτῃ ἐπ. guardian over Crete, of Minos, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιούσιος
div1.sense: for the coming day, sufficient for the day, NTest. (From ἡ ἐπιοῦσα ἡμέρα the coming day.)

div1.head: ἐπίπαγχυ
div1.sense: altogether, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιπαιανίζω
div1.sense: to sing a paean over, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιπάλλω
div1.sense: to brandish at or against, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπίπαν
div1.sense: ἐπὶ, πᾶν, adv. upon the whole, in general, on the average, Hdt., Thuc.; ὡς ἐπίπαν, also τὸ ἐπ. and ὡς τὸ ἐπ. Hdt.
altogether, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιπαρανέω
div1.sense: to heap up still more, to heap up, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιπαρασκευάζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to provide oneself with besides, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιπάρειμι
div1.sense: to be present besides or in addition, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιπάρειμι
div1.sense: to march on high ground parallel with one below, Xen., etc.:— to assail in flank, c. dat., Thuc.
to come to oneʼs assistance, Thuc., Xen.
to come to the front of an army, so as to address it, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιπάσσω
div1.sense: to sprinkle upon or over, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίπαστος
div1.sense: sprinkled overas Subst. ἐπίπαστον, τό, a kind of cake with comfits (or the like) upon it, Ar.
a plaster, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπίπεδος
div1.sense: to the level of the ground, level, Xen., etc.:—irreg. comp. -πεδέστερος, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιπείθομαι
div1.sense: to be persuaded to a certain end, Hom.
to trust to, put faith in, c. dat., Aesch.
to comply with, obey, Hes., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιπελάζω
div1.sense: to bring near to, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιπέλομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to come to or upon a person, c. dat., Od.; Epic syncop. part. aor2 ἐπιπλόμενος, coming on, approaching, ἐπιπλόμενον ἔτος the coming year, Od.; of a storm, like Lat. ingruens, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιπέμπω
div1.sense: to send besides or again, of messages, Hdt.
of the gods, to send upon or to, Hdt.; esp.by way of punishment, to send upon or against, let loose upon, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπίπεμψις
div1.sense: a sending to a place, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιπερκάζω
div1.sense: to turn dark, of grapes ripening; ἐπιπερκάζειν τριχί to begin to get a dark beard, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπίπερκνος
div1.sense: somewhat dark, of the colour of certain hares, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιπετάννυμι
div1.sense: to spread over, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιπέτομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to fly to or towards, Hom., etc.
c. acc. to fly over, πεδία Eur., Ar.
ἐφίπταμαι, late pres. of ἐπιπέτομαι, Mosch.

div1.head: ἐπιπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to freeze at top, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap upon, assault, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιπιέζω
div1.sense: to press upon, press down, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιπίλναμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to come near, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill full of, τί τινος Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιπίνω
div1.sense: to drink afterwards or besides, esp. to drink after eating, Od., Attic

div1.head: ἐπιπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall upon or over another, c. dat., Thuc.
to fall upon, attack, assail, τινί Hdt., Thuc., etc.; of storms, Hdt., Plat.: of disease and accidents, Thuc., Eur.

div1.head: ἔπιπλα
div1.etym: from ἐπί, as δίπλα from δίς
div1.sense: implements, utensils, furniture, moveable property, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἐπιπλάζομαι
div1.sense: Pass.:— to wander about over, πόντον ἐπιπλαγχθείς Od.

div1.head: ἐπιπλάσσω
div1.sense: to spread as a plaster over, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίπλαστος
div1.sense: plastered over:—metaph. feigned, false, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιπλαταγέω
div1.sense: to applaud loudly, τινί Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιπλέκω
div1.sense: to wreathe into a chaplet, Anth.
Pass. to be interwoven with, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίπλεος
div1.sense: quite full of a thing, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίπλευσις
div1.sense: a sailing against, ἐπ. ἔχειν to have the power of attacking, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιπλέω
div1.sense: to sail upon or over, πόντον Hom.
to sail against, to attack by sea, c. dat., Hdt., Thuc.
to sail on board, Thuc.
to float on the surface, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίπληξις
div1.sense: rebuke, reproof, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπιπληρόω
div1.sense: to fill up again:—Mid., ἐπιπληρωσόμεθα τὰς ναῦς we shall man our ships afresh, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιπλήσσω
div1.sense: to strike at, strike smartly, Il.
to chastise with words, to rebuke, reprove, c. acc., Il., Plat.; also c. dat., Il.
ἐπ. τί τινι to cast a thing in oneʼs teeth, Hdt., Aesch.:— c. acc. rei only, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπίπλοος
div1.sense: the membrane enclosing the entrails, the caul, Lat. omentum, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίπλοος2
div1.sense: a sailing against, bearing down upon, Thuc., Xen.
of friends, a sailing towards, approach, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιπνέω
div1.sense: to breathe upon, to blow freshly upon, Il.; τινί on one, Ar.:— to blow fairly for one, τινί Od.
to blow furiously upon, τινί Hdt., Aesch.
c. acc. to blow over, Hes.
metaph. to excite, inflame, τινά τινι one against another, Eur.; τινὰ αἵματι one to slaughter, Eur.
to inspire into, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπίπνοια
div1.sense: a breathing upon, inspiration, Lat. afflatus, Aesch., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπίπνοος
div1.sense: breathed upon, inspired, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιπόδιος
div1.sense: upon the feet, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιποθέω
div1.sense: to yearn after, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιπόθησις
div1.sense: a longing after, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιπόθητος
div1.sense: longed for, desired, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιποιμήν
div1.sense: a chief shepherd, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιπολάζω
div1.sense: to come to the surface, float, Xen.
to be uppermost, to be prevalent, Xen.
to be forward; c. dat. pers. to behave insolently to, Luc.
to be engaged upon a thing, c. dat., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιπόλαιος
div1.sense: on the surface, superficial, Luc.:— metaph. superficial, common-place, Dem.
prominent, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιπολή
div1.sense: a surface: mostly in gen. ἐπιπολῆς as adv. on the surface, a-top, Hdt., Xen.
ἐπιπολῆς also as prep. c. gen. on the top of, above, Hdt., Ar.
Ἐπιπολαί, αἱ, an eminence near Syracuse, with a flat surface, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίπολος
div1.sense: a companion, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιπολύ
div1.sense: adverb for ἐπὶ πολύ, to a great extent, generally, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιπομπεύω
div1.sense: to triumph over, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιπονέω
div1.sense: to toil on, persevere, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίπονος
div1.sense: painful, toilsome, laborious, Soph., Thuc., etc.:—rarely in good sense, Xen.: —ἐπίπονόν [ἐστι] ʼtis a hard task, Thuc.
of persons, laborious, patient of toil, Ar.
of omens, portending distress, Xen.
adv. -νως, Lat. aegre, Thuc., Xen.:—Sup. -ώτατα, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep, to travel, march to, march over, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιπόρπημα
div1.sense: any garment buckled over the shoulders, a mantle, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιποτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to fly or hover over, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιπρεπής
div1.sense: becoming:— τὸ ἐπιπρεπές, propriety, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιπρέπω
div1.sense: to be manifest on the surface, to be conspicuous, Od., Theocr.
to beseem, fit, suit, τινί Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιπρεσβεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to send an embassy, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιπρίω
div1.sense: to grind the teeth with rage at a thing, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιπροβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw forward, ap. Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιπροϊάλλω
div1.sense: to set out or place before one, τί τινι Il.
to send on one after another, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπιπροΐημι
div1.sense: to send forth, Il.; Μενελάῳ ἐπιπροέμεν ταχὺν ἰόν to shoot an arrow at him, Il.
νήσοισιν ἐπιπροέηκε (sc. τὴν ναῦν) he steered straight for them, Od.

div1.head: ἐπί

trans.i: on, upon with gen., dat., and acc.

div1.sense: prep. with gen., dat., and acc.: Radic. signf. upon.
WITH GEN.:
of Place,

with Verbs of Rest, upon or on, κεῖσθαι ἐπὶ χθονός Il.; ἐφʼ ἵππου on horse-back, etc.; ἐπὶ γῆς upon earth, Soph.; ἐπʼ ἀγροῦ in the country, Od.; also at or near, ἐπὶ Λήμνου off Lemnos, Hdt., etc.:—with Verbs of motion, the sense is pregnant, ἐπʼ ἠπείροιο ἔρυσσαν drew the ship upon the land and left it there, Il., etc.; ἀναβῆναι ἐπὶ τῶν πύργων Xen.

not strictly of Place, μένειν ἐπὶ τῆς ἀρχῆς to remain in the command, Xen.; ἐπὶ τῶν πραγμάτων engaged in business, Dem.: —of ships, ὁρμεῖν ἐπʼ ἀγκύρας to ride at (i. e. in dependence on an) anchor, Hdt.
with the person. and reflex. Pron., ἐφʼ ὑμείων by yourselves, Il.; ἐφʼ αὑτοῦ by himself, Thuc.; αὐτὸς ἐφʼ ἑαυτοῦ Xen.
with numerals, to denote the depth of a body of soldiers, ἐπὶ τεττάρων four deep, Xen.; ἐπʼ ὀλίγων i. e. in a long thin file, Xen.; ἐφʼ ἑνός in single file, Xen.
c.gen. pers. before, in presence of, Lat. coram, ἐπὶ πάντων Dem.
with Verbs of observing, in, ὁρᾶν τι ἐπί τινος Xen.
of motion towards, προτρέποντο ἐπὶ νηῶν Il.; πλεῖν ἐπὶ Χίου to sail for Chios, Hdt.; ἡ ἐπὶ Βαβυλῶνος ὁδός the road leading to B., Xen.
of Time, in the time of, ἐπὶ προτέρων ἀνθρώπων Il.; ἐπὶ Κύρου Hdt.; ἐπʼ ἐμοῦ in my time, Hdt.
in various Causal senses:
over, of persons in authority, ὁ ἐπὶ τῶν ὁπλιτῶν, ὁ ἐπὶ τῶν ἱππέων Dem.; ὁ ἐπὶ τῆς διοικήσεως the paymaster, Dem.
κεκλῆσθαι ἐπί τινος to be called after him, Hdt.; ἡ ἐπʼ Ἀνταλκίδου εἰρήνη καλουμένη Xen.
of occasions, and the like, ἐπὶ πάντων on all occasions, Dem.; so in phrases which became adverbial, ἐπʼ ἴσης (sc. μοίρας) equally, Soph.
WITH DAT.:

of Place, upon, ἕξεσθαι ἐπὶ δίφρῳ Il.:—with Verbs of Motion, Il.; in pregnant construction, πέτονται ἐπʼ ἄνθεσιν fly on to the flowers and settle there, Il.:— at or near, ἐπὶ θύρῃσι Il.:— on or over, ἐπʼ Ἰφιδάμαντι over the body of Iphidamas, Il.
in hostile sense, against, Hdt.
towards, in reference to, ἐπὶ πᾶσι Il.; νόμον τίθεσθαι ἐπί τινι to make a law for his case, whether for or against, Plat.
of accumulation, upon, after, ὄγχνη ἐπʼ ὄγχνῃ one pear after another, Od.
in addition to, ἐπὶ τοῖσι besides, ἐπὶ τούτοις Attic
of position, after, behind, of soldiers, Xen.
in dependence upon, in the power of, Lat. penes, ἐπί τινί ἐστι ʼtis in his power to do, c. inf., Hdt.; τὸ ἐπʼ ἐμοί as far as is in my power, Xen.
of condition or circumstances, Il., etc.; ἐπὶ τῷ παρόντι Thuc.
of Time, ἐπὶ νυκτί by night, Il.; αἰεὶ ἐπʼ ἤματι every day, Od.
after, ἕκτῃ ἐπὶ δεκάτῃ or τῇ ἕκτῃ ἐπὶ δέκα, on the 16th of the month, ap. Dem.; τὰ ἐπὶ τούτοις, Lat. quod superest, Thuc.; τοὐπὶ τῷδε Eur.
in various Causal senses:
of the occasion or cause, ἐπὶ σοί for thee, Il.; μέγα φρονεῖν ἐπί τινι to be proud at or of a thing, Plat.; ἀγανακτεῖν ἐπί τινι Xen.
of an end or purpose, ἐπὶ δόρπῳ for supper, Od.; ἐπὶ κακῷ for mischief, Hdt.; δῆσαι ἐπὶ θανάτῳ Hdt., Xen.; ἐπʼ ἐξαγωγῇ for exportation, Hdt.

of the condition upon which a thing is done, ἐπὶ τούτοις on these terms, Hdt.; ἐφʼ ᾧ or ἐφʼ ᾧτε on condition that, Hdt.; ἐπὶ οὐδενί on no account, Hdt.; ἐπʼ ἴσῃ καὶ ὁμοίᾳ on fair and equal terms, Thuc.
of price, ἔργον τελέσαι μεγάλῳ ἐπὶ δώρῳ Il.; ἐπὶ πόσῳ; Plat.; ἐπʼ ἀργυρίῳ Dem.; of the interest payable on money, δανείζεσθαι ἐπὶ τοῖς μεγάλοις τόκοις Dem.
κεκλῆσθαι ἐπί τινι to be called after, Plat.
of persons in authority, ἐπὶ βουσίν over the kine, Od.; ἐπὶ ταῖς ναυσίν Xen.; οἱ ἐπὶ τοῖς πράγμασιν Dem.
WITH ACC.:

of Place, upon or on to a height, ἐπὶ πύργον ἔβη Il.; προελθεῖν ἐπὶ τὸ βῆμα Thuc.; ἀναβαίνειν ἐπὶ τὸν ἵππον Xen.: simply to, ἦλθε θοὰς ἐπὶ νῆας Il., etc.:—metaph., ἐπὶ ἔργα τρέπεσθαι Il.; ἐπὶ τὴν τράπεζαν ὀφείλειν to owe to the bank, Dem.

up to, as far as, ἐπὶ θάλασσαν Thuc.:—in measurements, πλέον ἢ ἐπὶ δύο στάδια Xen.; with a neut. adj., ὅσον τʼ ἔπι as far as, Il.; ἐπὶ πᾶν ἐλθεῖν Xen.; ἐπὶ σμικρόν, a little way, a little, Soph.; ἐπʼ ἔλαττον, ἐπʼ ἐλάχιστον Plat., etc.
ἐπὶ πλέον still more, Hdt.; before, Lat. coram, ἦγον αὐτὸν ἐπὶ τὰ κοινά Hdt.
in Military phrases, ἐπʼ ἀσπίδας πέντε καὶ εἴκοσιν, i. e. 25 in file, Thuc.

towards, to, ἐπὶ δεξιά, ἐπʼ ἀριστερά Hom., etc.:—also in Military phrases, ἐπὶ δόρυ ἀναστρέψαι, ἐπὶ ἀσπίδα μεταβαλέσθαι, to the spear or shield side, i. e. to right or left, Xen.; ἐπὶ πόδα ἀναχωρεῖν to retire on the foot, i. e. facing the enemy, Xen.; ἐπὶ τὸ μεῖζον, with exaggeration, Thuc.; ἐπὶ τὰ γελοιότερα so as to provoke laughter, Plat.
in hostile sense, against, Il., etc.

of extension over a space, ἐπʼ ἐννέα κεῖτο πέλεθρα over nine acres he lay stretched, Il.; ἐπὶ πολύ over a large space, Thuc.:—so in many cases, where we say on, rather than over, δράκων ἐπὶ νῶτα δαφοινός Il.; ἵππους ἐπὶ νῶτον ἐΐσας Il.
of Time, for or during a certain time, πολλὸν ἐπὶ χρόνον Il.; ἐπὶ δέκα ἔτη Thuc.
up to or till a certain time, ἐπʼ ἠῶ καὶ μέσον ἦμαρ Od.
in various Causal senses:

of the object or purpose for which one goes, ἐπὶ Τυδῆ for (i. e. to bring) tidings of Tydeus, Il.; ἐλθεῖν ἐπʼ ἀργύριον Xen.:—with neut. Pron., ἐπὶ τοῦτο ἐλθεῖν for this purpose, Xen.; ἐπὶ τί; to what end? Lat. quorsum? Ar.; ἐπὶ τόκον for (i. e. to gain) interest, Dem.
as regards, τοὐπʼ ἐμέ, τοὐπί σε Eur.
of persons set over others, ἐπὶ τοὺς πεζοὺς καθιστάναι ἄρχοντα Xen.
according to, by, ἐπὶ στάθμην by the rule, Od.
POSITION:— ἐπί may follow its case, when it becomes ἔπι by anastrophe.
ABSOL., ἐπί without anastrophe, esp. ἐπὶ δέ, and besides, Hdt.
ἔπι, for ἔπεστι, ʼtis here, Hom.
IN COMPOS.:

of Place, denoting Rest upon, as in ἐπίκειμαι, or Motion, upon or over, as in ἐπιβαίνω; to or towards, as in ἐπαρίστερος, ἐπιδέξιος; against, as in ἐπαΐσσω, ἐπιστρατεύω; up to a point, as in ἐπιτελέω; over or beyond boundaries, as in ἐπινέμομαι, ἐπεργασία.
Extension over a surface, as in ἐπαλείφω, ἐπάργυρος, ἐπίχρυσος.
Accumulation or addition, as in ἐπιβάλλω, ἐπίκτητος.
Accompaniment, to, with, as in ἐπᾴδω, ἐπαυλέω.
Interest, ἐπίτριτος one and 1/3 more, 1+1/3, Lat. sesquitertius; so ἐπιτέταρτος, etc.
of Time and Sequence, after, as in ἐπιγίγνομαι.

in Causal senses, of Superiority felt over or at, as in ἐπιχαίρω, ἐπιγελάω; of Authority, over, as in ἐπικρατέω, ἐπιβούκολος; of Motive, for, as in ἐπιθυμέω, ἐπιθάνατος; to give force or intensity to the Verb, as in ἐπαινέω, ἐπιμέμφομαι.

div1.head: ἐπιάλλω
div1.sense: to send upon, lay upon, ἑτάροις ἐπὶ χεῖρας ἴαλλεν laid hands upon them, Od.; ἐπίηλεν τάδε ἔργα brought these deeds to pass, Od.; ἐπιαλῶ (sc. τὸ κέντρον) I will lay it on, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιαύω
div1.sense: to sleep among, c. dat., Od.
to sleep upon, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιάχω
div1.sense: to shout out, to shout applause after a speech, Il.: also simply to shout aloud, Il.

div1.head: ἐπίπροσθεν
div1.sense: of Place, before, Eur., Xen.; γεωλόφους ἐπ. ποιεῖσθαι to make the hills cover one, Xen.
of Degree, ἐπ. εἶναί τινος to be better than another, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιπροσθέω
div1.sense: to be before, ἐπ. τοῖς πύργοις to be in a line with them, so as to cover one with the other, Polyb.

div1.head: ἐπιπροχέω
div1.sense: to pour forth, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπιπταίρω
div1.sense: to sneeze at, ἐπέπταρε ἔπεσσιν he sneezed as I spoke the words, a good omen, Od.:—metaph. of the gods, to be gracious to, τινί Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιπτυχή
div1.sense: an over-fold, a flap, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιπωλέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go about, go through, Lat. obire, c. acc., ἐπεπωλεῖτο στίχας ἀνδρῶν, of the general inspecting his troops, Il.;—but also to reconnoitre an enemy, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιπώλησις
div1.sense: a going round, inspection, name given to the latter half of Il. 4.

div1.head: ἐπιρραβδοφορέω
div1.sense: to urge a horse by the whip, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιρρᾳθυμέω
div1.sense: to be careless about a thing, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιρραίνω
div1.sense: to sprinkle upon or over, τί τινι Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιρράπτω
div1.sense: to sew or stitch on, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιρραψῳδέω
div1.sense: to recite in accompaniment, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιρρέζω
div1.sense: to offer sacrifices at a place, Od.
to sacrifice besides, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιρρεπής
div1.sense: leaning towards, Lat. proclivis, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιρρέπω
div1.sense: to lean towards, fall to oneʼs lot, Il.; c. inf., ἐπιρρέπει τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Aesch.
trans., ἐπ. τάλαντον to force down one scale, Theogn.: metaph. to weigh out to one, allot, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιρρέω
div1.note: aor2 pass. also in act. sense ἐπερρύην
div1.sense: to flow upon the surface, float a-top, like oil on water, Il.

to flow in besides, flow fresh and fresh, Ar.:—metaph. of large bodies of men, to stream on and on, Il., Hdt.; also, οὑπιρρέων χρόνος onward-streaming time, i. e. the future, Aesch.; ὄλβου ἐπιρρυέντος if wealth flows on and on, increases continually, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: ἐπιρρήγνυμι to rend, Aesch.
to dash to, slam to, πύλας Soph.
intr. to break or burst upon one, Soph.
ἐπιρρήσσω, Ionic for ἐπιρράσσω
to dash to, shut violently, θύρην Il.

div1.head: ἐπιρρητορεύω
div1.sense: to declaim over, τί τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίρρητος
div1.sense: exclaimed against, infamous, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίρρικνος
div1.sense: shrunk up, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιρρίπτω
div1.sense: to cast at another, c. dat., Od.; χεῖρα ἐπ. to lay hand upon, Anth.:—metaph. to throw upon one, τί τινι Aesch.
= ἐπιρ-ρίπτω, only in pres. and imperf., Xen.
intr. to throw oneself upon the track, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιρροή
div1.sense: afflux, influx, Aesch.:—metaph., ἐπ. κακῶν Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιρροθέω
div1.sense: to shout in answer or in approval (cf. ἐπευφημέω) , Trag.; ἐπ. κτύπῳ to answer to, ring with the sound, Aesch.
c. acc., λόγοις ἐπιρροθεῖν to inveigh against him, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπίρροθος
div1.sense: hasting to the rescue, a helper, Il., Hes.: —c. gen. giving aid against, Aesch.
ἐπ. κακά reproaches bandied backwards and forwards, abusive language, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιρροίβδην
div1.sense: adv. with noisy fury, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιρροιζέω
div1.sense: to shriek at one, c. acc. cogn., ἐπ. φυγάς τινι to shriek or forebode flight at him, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιρροφέω
div1.sense: to swallow besides, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιρρύζω
div1.sense: to set a dog on one, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιρρυθμίζω
div1.sense: to bring into form, arrange, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιρρύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to save, preserve, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπίρρυτος
div1.sense: flowing in or to: metaph. overflowing, Aesch.
pass. overflowed, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιρρώννυμι
div1.sense: to add strength to, strengthen or encourage for an enterprise, Hdt., Thuc.

Pass., perf. ἐπέρρωμαι, plup. ἐπερρώμην used as pres. and imperf.: fut. ἐπιρρωσθήσομαι: aor1 ἐπερρώσθην:— to recover strength, pluck up courage, Thuc., Xen.; κείνοις ἐπερρώσθη λέγειν (impers.) they took courage to speak, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιρρώομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to flow or stream upon, χαῖται ἐπερρώσαντο ἀπὸ κρατός his locks flowed waving from his head, Il.
to move nimbly, Hes.: c. acc. cogn., ἐπίρρωσαι χορείην urge the rapid dance, Anth.
to apply oneʼs strength to a thing, work lustily at it, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: ἐπίσαγμα
div1.sense: a load on a beastʼs back:—metaph., τοὐπίσαγμα τοῦ νοσήματος the burden of the disease, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπισάττω
div1.sense: to pile a load upon a beastʼs back, Hdt.; ἵππον ἐπ. to saddle it, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίσειστος
div1.sense: waving over the forehead, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπισείω
div1.sense: to shake at or against, with the view of scaring, τί τινι Il., Eur.; Πέρσας ἐπ. to hold them out as a threat, Plut.; but, ἐπ. τὴν χεῖρα, in token of assent, Luc.
to set upon one, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπισεύω
div1.sense: to put in motion against, set upon one, c. dat., Od.
Pass. to hurry or hasten to or towards, Hom.; in hostile sense, to rush upon or at, c. dat., Il.

part. perf. pass. ἐπεσσύμενος, with 3rd sg. perf. and plup. ἐπέσσυται, -το mostly in hostile sense, to rush on, Il.; c. dat., αὐτῷ μοι ἐπέσσυτο Il.; c. acc. to assault, Il.; c. gen., ἐπεσσύμενος πεδίοιο rushing, hurrying over the plain, Il.:—also, without hostile sense, to express rapid motion, ἐπέσσυτο δέμνια swept over the clothes, Od.; c. inf., ἐπέσσυτο διώκειν he hasted on to follow, Il.:—metaph. to be excited, eager, θυμὸς ἐπέσσυται Il.

div1.head: ἐπισημαίνω
div1.sense: to set a mark upon a person, of a disease, Thuc., Xen.: Pass. to have a mark set on one, Eur.
to indicate, Plut.
Mid. to mark for oneself, signify, indicate, Plat.
to set oneʼs seal to a thing, approve it, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπίσημον
div1.sense: any distinguishing mark, a device or badge, the bearing on a shield, the ensign of a ship, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίσημος
div1.sense: having a mark on it, of money, stamped, coined, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; ἀναθήματα οὐκ ἐπ. offerings with no inscription on them, Hdt.
notable, remarkable, Lat. insignis, Hdt., Attic: in bad sense, notorious, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπίσης
div1.sense: for ἐπʼ ἴσης, (sc. μοίρας) v. sub ἴσος

div1.head: ἐπισίζω
div1.sense: to set on a dog, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπισιμόω
div1.sense: to bend inwards: intr. to turn aside oneʼs course, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισιτίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid.
to furnish oneself with food or provender, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
c. acc. rei, ἐπ. ἄριστον to provide oneself with breakfast, Thuc.; ἐπις. ἀργύριον Xen.
c. acc. pers. to supply with provisions, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισιτισμός
div1.sense: a furnishing oneself with provisions, foraging, Xen.
a stock or store of provisions, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισκάπτω
div1.sense: to dig superficially, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισκεδάννυμι
div1.sense: to scatter or sprinkle over:—Pass. to be sprinkled over, τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἐπισκέλισις
div1.sense: the first bound, in a horseʼs gallop, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισκεπτέος
div1.sense: to be considered or examined, Thuc., Plat.
neut. ἐπισκεπτέον, one must consider, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπισκέπτομαι
div1.etym: a pres., which furnishes its tenses to ἐπισκοπέω, v. σκέπτομαι

div1.head: ἐπισκέπω
div1.sense: to cover over, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισκευάζω
div1.sense: to get ready, to equip, fit out, Thuc., Xen.:—Mid., ἐπισκευάζεσθαι ναῦν to have a ship equipped, Thuc.
τὰ χρήματα ἐφʼ ἁμαξῶν ἐπισκευάσαι to pack them upon wagons, Xen.
to make afresh, to repair, Lat. reficere, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισκευαστής
div1.sense: one who equips or repairs, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπισκευαστός
div1.sense: repaired, restored, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπισκευή
div1.sense: repair, restoration, Hdt., Dem.
materials for repair or equipment, stores, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπίσκεψις
div1.sense: inspection, visitation, Xen., Plut.
investigation, inquiry, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίσκηνος
div1.sense: at or before the tent, i. e. public, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπισκηνόω
div1.sense: to be quartered in a place: metaph. to dwell upon, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπισκήπτω
div1.sense: to make to lean upon, make to fall upon, Aesch.: impose on, τί τινι Soph.
intr. to fall upon, like lightning: metaph., δεῦρʼ ἐπέσκηψεν it came to this point, Aesch.
to lay it upon one to do a thing, to enjoin, lay a strict charge upon, c. dat. pers. et inf., Aesch., Soph.; c. acc. et inf., Hdt., Eur.
as Attic law-term, generally in Mid. to denounce a person, so as to begin a prosecution, Plut., etc.:—Pass. to be denounced as guilty of a crime, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπίσκηψις
div1.sense: an injunction, Plut.
as law-term, a denunciation, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπισκιάζω
div1.sense: to throw a shade upon, overshadow, Hdt., NTest.:—Pass., λαθραῖον ὄμμʼ ἐπεσκιασμένη keeping a hidden watch, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπίσκιος
div1.sense: shaded, dark, obscure, Plat.
act. shading, c. gen., χεὶρ ὀμμάτων ἐπίσκιος Soph.

div1.head: ἐπισκοπέω
div1.sense: to look upon or at, inspect, observe, examine, regard, Hdt., Eur.: to watch over, of tutelary gods, Soph., Eur.
to visit, Soph., Xen., etc.:—Pass., εὐνὴν ὀνείροις οὐκ ἐπισκοπουμένην visited not by dreams, i. e. sleepless, Aesch.
of a general, to inspect, review, Xen.
to consider, reflect, Soph., Xen.:—Mid. to examine with oneself, meditate, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπισκοπή
div1.sense: a watching over, visitation, NTest.
the office of ἐπίσκοπος, NTest.: generally, an office, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπισκοπία
div1.sense: a looking at, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπίσκοπος
div1.sense: one who watches over, an overseer, guardian, Hom., Soph.:—of tutelary gods, Solon., etc.
c. dat., ἐπ. Τρώεσσι one set to watch them, Il.
a public officer, intendant, sent to the subject states, Ar.
a bishop, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπίσκοπος2
div1.sense: hitting the mark: metaph. reaching, touching a point, c. gen., Aesch., Soph.:—neut. pl. ἐπίσκοπα, as adv. successfully, with good aim, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπισκοτέω
div1.sense: to throw a shadow over, c. dat., Dem.; ἐπ. τινὶ τῆς θέας to be in the way of oneʼs seeing, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπισκότησις
div1.sense: a darkening, obscurity, of the sun or moon in eclipse, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίσκοτος
div1.sense: in the dark, darkened, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπισκύζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be indignant at a thing, Il.; ἐπισκύσσαιτο (Epic aor1 opt.) Od.

div1.head: ἐπισκυθίζω
div1.sense: to ply with drink in Scythian fashion, i. e. with unmixed wine, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπισκυθρωπάζω
div1.sense: to look gloomy or stern, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισκύνιον
div1.sense: the skin of the brows which is knitted in frowning, Il., Ar.
superciliousness, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισκώπτω
div1.sense: to laugh at, quiz, make game of, τινά Plat., Xen.:—absol. to joke, make fun, Ar.; ἐπισκώπτων jestingly, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίσκωψις
div1.sense: mocking, raillery, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπισμυγερός
div1.sense: gloomy, Hes.:—adv., ἐπισμυγερῶς ἀπέτισεν sadly did he pay for it, Od.; ἐπισμυγερῶς ναυτίλλεται to his cost doth he sail, Od.

div1.head: ἐπισπαστήρ
div1.sense: the latch or handle by which a door is pulled to, Hdt.
the anglerʼs rod or line, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισπαστός
div1.sense: drawn upon oneself, Od.
tight-drawn, of a noose, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπισπάω
div1.sense: to draw or drag after one, Hdt.; and in Mid., Xen.; ἐπισπάσας κόμης by the hair, having dragged her by the hair, Eur.:—metaph. to bring on, cause, πλῆθος πημάτων Aesch.
to pull to, τὴν θύραν Xen.; ἐπισπασθέντος τοῦ βρόχου the noose being drawn tight, Dem.
to attract, gain, win, Soph.:—so in Mid., ἐπισπᾶσθαι κέρδος Hdt.

in Mid. to draw on, allure, persuade, Thuc.: —c. inf., ἐπισπάσασθαι ἂν αὐτοὺς ἡγεῖτο προθυμήσεσθαι he thought it would induce them to make the venture, Thuc.:—Pass., φοβοῦμαι μὴ πάντες ἐπισπασθῶσιν πολεμῆσαι Dem.
Pass., of the sea, ἐπισπωμένη returning with a rush, Thuc.
in Mid. to become uncircumcised, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπισπείρω
div1.sense: to sow with seed, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίσπεισις
div1.sense: a libation over a sacrifice, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπισπένδω
div1.sense: to pour upon or over the head of a victim, at a sacrifice, Hdt., Aesch.:—absol. to make a libation, Hdt.:—metaph., ἐπ. δάκρυ Theocr.
in Mid. to make a fresh treaty, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπισπερχής
div1.sense: hasty, hurried: adv. -χῶς, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισπέρχω
div1.sense: to urge on horses, Il.; generally, to urge on, press forward, Aesch., Thuc.
intr. to rage furiously, of storms, Od.

div1.head: ἐπισπεύδω
div1.sense: to urge on, further or promote an object, Hdt., Soph.: of persons, to urge on, Xen.
intr. to hasten onward, Eur.; ἐπισπ. εἴς τι to be zealous for, aim at an object, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισπονδή
div1.sense: a renewed or renewable truce, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίσπορος
div1.sense: sown afterwards, οἱ ἐπ. posterity, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπισπουδάζω
div1.sense: intr. to make haste in a thing, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίσσυτος
div1.sense: rushing, gushing, of tears, Aesch.: violent, sudden, of misfortunes, Aesch.: c. acc. rushing upon, τὰς φρένας Eur.

div1.head: ἐπισταδόν
div1.sense: standing over each in turn, i. e. one after another, successively, Od.

div1.head: ἐπισταθμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to weigh well, ponder, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπισταθμεύω
div1.sense: to be quartered upon others, Plut.
Pass. to be assigned as quarters, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπισταθμεία
div1.sense: a liability to have persons quartered on one, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίσταθμος
div1.sense: at the door, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισταλάζω
div1.sense: to drop over, τί τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἐπισταλάω
div1.sense: to fall in drops over, c. acc., Anth.

div1.head: ἐπίσταλμα
div1.sense: a commission, Theophr.

div1.head: ἐπίσταμαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
c. inf. to know how to do, to be able to do, capable of doing, Hom., Attic
to be assured or believe that a thing is, Hdt.
c. acc. to understand a matter, know, be versed in or acquainted with, Hom., etc.:—after Hom. to know as a fact, know for certain, know well, Hdt., Attic
rarely, to know a person, Eur.
c. part., to know that one is, has, etc., Hdt., Attic
part. pres. ἐπιστάμενος, η, ον, is often also used as an adj. knowing, understanding, skilful, Hom.:—c. gen. skilled or versed in a thing, Hom.:—adv. ἐπισταμένως, skilfully, expertly, Hdt., Hes.

div1.head: ἐπιστασία
div1.sense: authority, dominion, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιστάσιος
div1.sense: ἐπ. Ζεύς, ὁ, Jupiter Stator, Plut.
div1.etym: From ἐφίστημι, he that makes to stand firm.

div1.head: ἐπίστασις
div1.sense: a stopping, halting, a halt, Xen.; φροντίδων ἐπιστάσεις haltings of thought, Soph.
attention, care, anxiety, NTest.
superintendence of works, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιστατέω
div1.sense: to be set over, c. dat., Soph., Plat.: also to stand by, to support, second, Aesch.
c. gen. to be in charge of, have the care of, Hdt., Xen.
at Athens, to be Ἐπιστάτης or President of the βουλή and ἐκκλησία, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιστάτης
div1.sense: one who stands near or by, a suppliant, Od.
in battle-order, oneʼs rear-rank man (as παραστάτης is the right- or left-hand man, προστάτης the front-rank man), Xen.
one who stands or is mounted upon a chariot, c. gen., Soph., Eur.
one who is set over, a commander, Trag.; ἐπιστ. Κολωνοῦ, of a tutelary god, Soph.; ἐπ. ἄθλων president, steward of the games, a training- master, Xen.
at Athens the President of the βουλή and ἐκκλησία, Aeschin., Dem.
an overseer, superintendent, in charge of any public works, Dem.
the caldron for the hot bath which stood over the fire, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιστατητέος
div1.sense: one must superintend, c. dat., Plat.; c. gen., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιστείβω
div1.sense: to tread upon, stand upon a place, c. acc., Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιστείχω
div1.sense: to approach, c. acc., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιστέλλω
div1.sense: to send to, send as a message or letter, Hdt., Attic:—absol. to send a message, write word, Eur., Thuc.

to enjoin, command, τινί τι Thuc.; τινά τι Xen.; also, ἐπ. τινὶ or τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Soph., Xen.:—so, in Pass., ἐπέσταλτό οἱ . . c. inf., he had received orders to do, Hdt.; ἐπέσταλται τί τινι a matter has been committed to one, Aesch.; τὰ ἐπεσταλμένα orders given, Aesch.
to order by will, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιστενάζω
div1.sense: to groan over, τινί Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιστενάχω
div1.sense: = ἐπι-στενάζω τινί Aesch.:—absol., Soph.
Mid. to groan in answer, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιστένω
div1.sense: to groan or sigh in answer, Il.
to lament over, τινί Eur.
c. acc. to lament, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιστεφής
div1.sense: of bowls, ἐπιστεφέες οἴνοιο crowned (i. e. brimming high) with wine, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπιστέφω
div1.sense: to surround with or as with a chaplet: metaph. in Mid., κρητῆρας ἐπιστέψαντο ποτοῖο crowned them to the brim, filled them brimming high, with wine, Hom.
χοὰς ἐπιστέφειν to offer libations as an honour to the dead, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιστηλόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be set up as a column upon, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιστήμη
div1.sense: acquaintance with a matter, skill, experience, as in archery, Soph.; in war, Thuc., etc.
generally, knowledge, Soph.: esp. scientific knowledge, science, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιστήμων
div1.sense: knowing, wise, prudent, ἐπ. βουλῇ τε νόῳ τε Od.
acquainted with a thing, skilled or versed in, c. gen., Thuc., etc.
c. inf. knowing how to do, Plat., etc.— adv., ἐπιστημόνως with knowledge: comp. -έστερον, Xen.; Sup. -έστατα, Plat.
possessed of perfect knowledge, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιστηρίζω
div1.sense: to make to lean on:—Pass. to lean upon, τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιστίλβω
div1.sense: to glisten on the surface, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίστιον
div1.sense: in Od. means a shed in which a ship is laid up.

div1.head: ἐπιστολάδην
div1.sense: girt up, neatly, of dress, Hes.

div1.head: ἐπιστολεύς
div1.sense: secretary: also a courier, Xen.
among the Spartans, a vice-admiral, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιστολή
div1.sense: a message, command, commission, whether verbal or in writing, Hdt., Attic; ἐξ ἐπιστολῆς by command, Hdt.
a letter, Lat. epistola, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιστολιμαῖος
div1.sense: commanded:— δυνάμεις ἐπ. forces decreed, but never sent, paper-armies, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιστομίζω
div1.sense: to curb in a horse: metaph. to curb, bridle, τινά Ar., Dem.
to put on the mouth-piece of a flute; and of a flute, to stop the voice, Plut.
to throw on his face, τινά Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιστορέννυμι
div1.sense: to strew or spread upon, Od.
to saddle, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιστρατεία
div1.sense: a march or expedition against, Hdt.; c. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιστρατεύω
div1.sense: to march against, make war upon, τινί Eur., etc.:— to make an expedition, εἰς Θετταλίαν Aesch.; c. acc., Soph.:—absol., Aesch.:—so in Mid., with perf. pass., ἐπιστρατεύεσθαι ἐπʼ Αἴγυπτον Hdt.; c. dat., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἐπίστρεπτος
div1.sense: to be turned towards, to be looked at, conspicuous, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιστρεφής
div1.sense: turning oneʼs eyes or mind to a thing, attentive, Xen.
earnest, vehement: adv. -φῶς, Ionic -φέως, earnestly, sharply, Hdt., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἐπιστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn about, turn round, Eur.; ἐπ. τὰς ναῦς to make a sudden tack, Thuc.; but also to put an enemy to flight, Xen.
intr. to turn about, turn round, Il., Hdt., Attic:— to return, NTest.
to turn towards, τὸ νόημα Theogn.; πρός τι, εἴς τινα Plut.:— ἐπ. πίστιν to press a pledge upon one, Soph.
intr. to turn towards, Xen.
to turn from an error, to correct, make to repent, Luc.
intr. to repent, NTest.
to curve, twist, torment, Ar.

Mid. and Pass., esp. in aor2 pass. ἐπεστράφην [ᾰ]:— to turn oneself round, turn about, ἐπιστρεφόμενος constantly turning, to look behind one, Hdt.; with acc., θάλαμον ἐπεστράφη turned to gaze on it, Eur.; δόξα ἐπεστράφη turned about, changed, Soph.
to go back-and for-wards, wander over the earth, Hes.:—c. acc. loci, to turn to a place, Eur.
to turn the mind towards, to pay attention to, c. gen., Theogn., Soph.: —absol. to recover oneself, pay attention, Hdt., Dem.
c. acc. to visit, Eur.
part. perf. pass. ἐπεστραμμένος, ἐπιστρεφής, earnest, vehement, Hdt. Hence

div1.head: ἐπιστροφάδην
div1.sense: turning this way and that way, right and left, Hom.: also, ἐπ. βαδίζειν back- and for-wards, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπιστροφή
div1.sense: a turning about, twisting, Plat.
intr. a turning or wheeling about, of men turning to bay, Soph.; ἐπιστροφαὶ κακῶν renewed assaults of ills, Soph.:—of ships, a putting about, tacking, Thuc.
a turn of affairs, reaction, Thuc.
attention paid to a person or thing, regard, Soph., etc.
a moving up and down in a place, δωμάτων ἐπιστροφαί occupation of them, Aesch.; ξενοτίμους ἐπ. δωμάτων, of the duties of hospitality, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπίστροφος
div1.sense: having dealings with, conversant with, c. gen., Od., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιστρωφάω
div1.sense: to visit or frequent a place, c. acc. loci, Od.:—Mid. to go in and out of, frequent, visit, occupy, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιστύλιον
div1.sense: the lintel on the top of pillars, the epistyle, architrave, Plut.

trans.i: to harass yet more with frivolous accusations.

div1.head: ἐπισυνάγω
div1.sense: to collect and bring to a place, to gather together, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπισυναγωγή
div1.sense: a gathering or being gathered together, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπισυνάπτω
div1.sense: to renew a war, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπισυνδίδωμι
div1.sense: to push forward together, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπισυντρέχω
div1.sense: to run together to a place, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπίσυρμα
div1.sense: the trail or track made by dragging a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισύρω
div1.sense: to drag or trail after one, in Mid., Luc.: —Pass. to crawl along, Xen.
to do anything in a slovenly way, to slur over, Lys.; ἐπισύροντες confusedly, Dem.; often in part. perf. pass. slovenly, careless, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπισύστασις
div1.sense: a gathering together against, a riotous meeting, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπισφάζω
div1.sense: to slaughter over or upon, of sacrifices offered at a tomb, Eur., Xen.
to kill after or besides, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπισφαλής
div1.sense: prone to fall, unstable, precarious, Plat., Dem.:—adv., ἐπισφαλῶς διακεῖσθαι to be in danger, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπισφίγγω
div1.sense: to bind, clasp tight, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισφραγίζω
div1.sense: to put a seal on, to confirm, ratify, Anth.
as Dep. to put as a seal upon, impress upon, Plat.; also as Pass. to be impressed, marked, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισφραγιστής
div1.sense: one who seals or signs, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπισφύρια
div1.sense: bands, clasps or hooks, which fastened the greaves (κνημῖδες) over the ankle, Il.
the ankle, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισφύριος
div1.sense: on the ankle, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπισχεδόν
div1.sense: near at hand, hard by, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπισχεθεῖν
div1.sense: to hold in, check, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπισχερώ
div1.sense: in a row, one after another, Il.
of Time, by degrees, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπισχεσία
div1.sense: a thing held out, a pretext, Od.

div1.head: ἐπίσχεσις
div1.sense: a checking, hindrance, delay, reluctance, lingering, Od., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπισχύω
div1.sense: to make strong or powerful, Xen.
intr. to prevail, be urgent, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπίσχω
div1.sense: to hold or direct towards, Il.; τινί against one, Hes.
to restrain, withhold, check, Hes., Attic:—c. gen. to restrain from a thing, Od.
intr. to leave off, stop, wait, Thuc.; imperat. ἔπισχε, hold, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπίσωτρον
div1.sense: the metal hoop round the felloe (σῶτρον) , the tire of a wheel, Il.

div1.head: ἐπίταγμα
div1.sense: an injunction, command, Plat., Aeschin.
a reserve force, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιτακτήρ
div1.sense: a commander, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίτακτος
div1.sense: drawn up behind, οἱ ἐπίτακτοι the reserve of an army, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιταλαιπωρέω
div1.sense: to labour yet more, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτανύω
div1.sense: to push home a bolt, Od.

div1.head: ἐπίταξις
div1.sense: an injunction, ἡ ἐπ. τοῦ φόρου the assessment of the tribute, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιτάραξις
div1.sense: disturbance, confusion, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιταράσσω
div1.sense: to trouble or disquiet yet more, Hdt., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτάρροθος
div1.sense: a helper, defender, ally, Hom.; μάχης ἐπ. in fight, Il.
a master, lord, Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίτασις
div1.sense: a stretching of strings, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιτάσσω
div1.sense: to put upon one as a duty, to enjoin, τί τινι Hdt., etc.:—c. dat. pers. et inf. to order one to do, Hdt., Attic:—absol. to impose commands, Thuc.; τινί on one, Soph.:—Pass. with fut. mid. -τάξομαι, aor1 -ετάχθην, perf. -τέταγμαι:— to accept orders, submit to commands, Eur., Ar.; c. acc. rei, Thuc.:—of things, to be ordered, ὁ στρατὸς ὁ ἐπιταχθεὶς ἑκάστοισι Hdt.; τὰ ἐπιτασσόμενα orders given, Hdt.
to place next or beside, Hdt., Xen.:— Mid., τοὺς ἱππέας ἐπετάξαντο they had the cavalry placed next, Thuc.
to place behind, c. gen., Hdt.: absol. to place in reserve, Plut.:—Mid., Xen.
to set in command over, οἱ ἐπιτεταγμένοι set as guards over the waggons, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτάφιος
div1.sense: over a tomb, λόγος ἐπ. a funeral oration, spoken over citizens who had fallen in battle, such as that of Pericles in Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιταχύνω
div1.sense: to hasten on, urge forward, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch upon or over a place, Hdt.:—Pass., in tmesi, ἐπὶ νὺξ τέταται βροτοῖσι Od.
to stretch as on a frame, tighten, of musical strings, Plat.: metaph. to increase in intensity, to increase, augment, Plat.
to urge on, incite, τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Xen.; ἐπ. ἑαυτόν to exert himself, Plut.
Pass. to be stretched as on the rack, Plat.
to be on the stretch, to be strained or contracted, Plat.; ἐπ. βιβλίοις to devote oneself to books, Luc.
to hold out, endure, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιτειχίζω
div1.sense: to build a fort on the frontier as a basis of operations against the enemy, Thuc., Xen.:—metaph., ἐπ. τυράννους to plant them like such forts, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιτείχισις
div1.sense: the building a fort on the enemyʼs frontier, the occupation of it, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτείχισμα
div1.sense: a fort placed on the enemyʼs frontier, Thuc., Xen., etc.; c. gen., ἐπιτειχίσματα τῆς αὐτοῦ χώρας fortresses which command his country, Dem.
metaph., ἐπ. πρός τι a barrier or obstacle to a thing, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιτελειόω
div1.sense: to complete a sacrifice, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιτελείωσις
div1.sense: accomplishment, completion, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιτελέω
div1.sense: to complete, finish, accomplish, Hdt., Thuc.: esp. of the fulfilment of oracles, visions, vows or promises, Thuc.
to discharge a religious service, Hdt.
to pay in full, Hdt.:—metaph. in Mid., ἐπιτελεῖσθαι τὰ τοῦ γήρως to have to pay, be subject to, the burdens of old age, Xen.; ἐπ. θάνατον to have to pay the debt of death, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιτελής
div1.sense: brought to an end, completed, accomplished, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιτέλλω
div1.sense: to lay upon, enjoin, prescribe, ordain, command, τι or τί τινι Hom.:—c. dat. pers. only, to give orders to, Il.:—c. dat. pers. et inf. to order him to do. Il.:—also in Mid., just like the Act., Il.
Pass. to rise, of stars, Hes.:—metaph., of love, Theogn.

div1.head: ἐπιτέμνω
div1.sense: to cut on the surface, make an incision into, gash, Lat. incidere, Hdt., Aeschin.:—Mid., ἐπιτάμνεσθαι τοὺς βραχίονας to gash their arms, Hdt.
to cut short, to abridge, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπίτεξ
div1.sense: at the birth, about to bring forth, Hdt., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτερπής
div1.sense: pleasing, delightful, Hhymn., Plut.:—adv. -πῶς, Plut.
devoted to pleasure, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιτέρπομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to rejoice or delight in a thing, c. dat., Od., Hes.

div1.head: ἐπιτεχνάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to contrive for a purpose or to meet an emergency, to invent, Hdt.
to contrive against, τί τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτέχνησις
div1.sense: contrivance for a purpose, invention, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτεχνητός
div1.sense: artificially made, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτήδειος
div1.sense: made for an end or purpose, fit or adapted for it, suitable, convenient, ἔς τι, πρός τι Hdt., Plat.; c. inf., χωρίον ἐπ. ἐνιππεῦσαι fit to ride in, Hdt.; ἐπ. ὑπεξαιρεθῆναι convenient to be put out of the way, Thuc.; ἐπ. ξυνεῖναι a pleasant person to live with, Eur.; ἐπ. παθεῖν deserving to suffer, Dem., also, ἐπιτήδεόν ἐστί μοι, c. inf., Hdt.
useful, serviceable, necessary,

of things, fit or serviceable for, c. dat., Thuc.; ἐστὸ ἐπ. to their advantage, Thuc.; of treaties, omens, favourable, Hdt.:—esp. as Subst., τὰ ἐπιτήδεια necessaries, provisions, Lat. commeatus, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
of persons, serviceable, friendly, Hdt., Thuc.; τῷ πατρί conformable to his will, Hdt.: as Subst., c. gen., a close friend, Lat. necessarius, Thuc.
adv. -είως, Ionic -έως, studiously, carefully, Hdt.
suitably, conveniently, fitly, Hdt.;—comp. -ειότερον, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιτηδειότης
div1.sense: fitness, suitableness, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιτηδές
div1.sense: such as may serve the purpose, enough, or of set purpose, advisedly, studiously, Lat. consulto, de industria, Hom.;—in Hdt. and Attic written proparox., ἐπίτηδες Hdt., ἐπίτᾱδες Theocr.:—also designedly, deceitfully, Eur. deriv. uncertain

div1.head: ἐπιτήδευμα
div1.sense: a pursuit, business, practice, Lat. studium, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιτήδευσις
div1.sense: devotion or attention to a pursuit, Thuc., Plat., etc.; βιότου ἐπιτηδεύσεις refinements of life, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιτηδεύω
div1.etym: conjugated as if it were a compd. of ἐπί, τηδεύω, but there is no such Verb; and ἐπιτηδεύω must be formed directly from ἐπιτηδές
div1.sense: to pursue or practise a thing, make a practice of, make it oneʼs business, Lat. studere rei, c. acc., Hdt., Attic:—also, ἐπ. τι πρός τι to invent for a purpose, Hdt.:—Pass. to be done with pains and practice, to be made so and so by art, Hdt.; of dogs, to be trained, Xen.
c. inf. to take care to do, use to do, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιτηδέως
div1.etym: adverb of ἐπιτήδεος, Ionic for ἐπιτήδειος.

div1.head: ἐπίτηκτος
div1.sense: overlaid with gold: metaph. counterfeit, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιτήκω
div1.sense: to melt upon, pour when melted over a thing, Hdt., Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιτηρέω
div1.sense: to look out for, Ar., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιτίθημι
div1.etym: the Pass.is mostly furnished by ἐπίκειμαι
div1.sense: Act. to lay, put or place upon, of offerings laid on the altar, meats on the table, etc., c. dat., Od., Attic; also c. gen., Il., Hdt.:—c. acc. only, ἐπ. φάρμακα to apply salves, Il.; ἐπ. στήλην to set it up, Hdt.
to put on a covering or lid, Od.; λίθον ἐπέθηκε θύρῃσιν, i. e. put a stone as a door to the cave, put it before the door, Od.: to put a door to, shut it, Il., Hom.
to put to, grant or give besides, Il.
of Time, to add, bring on, Od.
μύθῳ or μύθοις τέλος ἐπιθεῖναι to put an end to them, Il.
to put on as a finish, ἐπέθηκε κορώνην Il.; ἐπ. κεφαλαῖον (v. sub κεφαλαῖον) Dem.
to impose or inflict a penalty, θωήν σοι ἐπιθήσομεν Od.; δίκην, ζημίαν ἐπ. τινί Hdt.
like ἐπιστέλλω, to dispatch a letter, Hdt., Dem.
to give a name, Hdt., Plat.
Mid. to put on oneself or for oneself, Il., Eur.
to set oneself to, apply oneself to, employ oneself on or in, c. dat., Hdt., Thuc., etc.
to make an attempt upon, attack, τῇ Εὐβοίῃ Hdt., Thuc., etc.
absol., δικαιοσύνην ἐπιθέμενος ἤσκεε he practised justice with assiduity, Hdt.
to bring on oneself, ἀράς Aesch.: also to cause a penalty to be imposed, Thuc.
to lay commands on, τί τινι Hdt.
to give a name, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιτιμάω
div1.sense: to lay a value upon, Lat. aestimare: hence,
to shew honour to, τινά Hdt.
to raise in price:—Pass. to rise in price, Dem.
of judges, to lay a penalty on a person, Hdt.
c. acc. to censure, Dem.; also c. dat., Dem.: absol., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτίμησις
div1.sense: censure, criticism, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτιμητής
div1.sense: a chastiser, censurer, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιτιμήτωρ
div1.sense: an avenger, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιτιμία
div1.sense: the condition of an ἐπίτιμος, the enjoyment of civil rights, opp. to ἀτιμία, Aeschin., Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιτίμιον
div1.sense: mostly in pl. ἐπιτίμια, τά, the value, price, or estimate of a thing, i. e.,
the honours paid to a person, Soph.
assessment of damages or penalties, Hdt., Eur.; τῶνδε for these things, Aesch.; ἐπ. δυσσεβείας the wages of ungodliness, Soph.; in sg., τοὐπιτίμιον λαβεῖν to exact the penalty, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπίτιμος
div1.sense: of a citizen, in possession of his rights and franchises (τιμαί) , opp. to ἄτιμος, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτίτθιος
div1.sense: at the breast, a suckling, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιτιτρώσκω
div1.sense: to wound on the surface, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιτλῆναι
div1.sense: to bear patiently, be patient, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιτολή
div1.sense: the rising of a star, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτολμάω
div1.sense: to submit or endure to do, c. inf., Od.: absol., ἐπετόλμησε he stood firm, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιτομή
div1.sense: a cutting on the surface, incision, Aeschin.
an epitome, abridgment, Cic.

div1.head: ἐπίτονος
div1.sense: on the stretch, strained: —ἐπίτονος (sc. ἱμάς) , a rope for stretching or tightening, the back-stay of a mast (opp. to πρότονος) , Od.
ἐπίτονοι, οἱ, the sinews of the shoulder and arm, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιτοξάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to shoot at, c. dat., Il., Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτραγῳδέω
div1.sense: to make into a tragic story, exaggerate, Luc.: to add in exaggeration, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιτραπέζιος
div1.sense: on or at table, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτρεπτέος
div1.sense: one must permit, Xen.; so in pl. ἐπιτρεπτέα Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιτρέπω
div1.sense: properly to turn towards, in aor2 mid., θυμὸς ἐπετράπετο εἴρεσθαι thy mind inclined itself to ask, Od.
to turn over to, to commit or entrust to another as trustee, guardian, or vicegerent, Hom., Hdt., Attic; c. inf., σοὶ ἐπέτρεψεν πονέεσθαι he left it to you to work, Il.
c. dat. only, to trust to, rely upon, Hom., Hdt.: to refer the matter to a person, leave it to his judgment, Ar., Thuc.:—so in Mid. to entrust oneself, leave oneʼs case to, τινι Hdt.

Pass. to be entrusted, ᾧ λαοί τʼ ἐπιτετράφαται (3rd pl. perf. for ἐπιτετραμμένοι εἰσί) Il.; τῇς (sc. Ὥραις) ἐπιτέτραπται οὐρανός heavenʼs gate is committed to them (to open and to shut), Il.;—also c. acc. rei, ἐπιτρέπομαί τι I am entrusted with a thing, Hdt., Thuc.
to give up, yield, Ποσειδάωνι νίκην ἐπέτρεψας Il.; ἐπ. τινί c. inf. to permit, suffer, Hdt., Attic
intr. to yield, give way, Il., Hdt.
to command, τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιτρέφω
div1.sense: to rear upon:—generally, to support, maintain, Hdt.
Pass. to grow up after, as posterity, Lat. succrescere, Hdt.; to grow up as a successor, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιτρέχω
div1.sense: to run upon or at, for the purpose of attack, Il.; of dogs, Od.; so in Attic to make an assault upon, τινί Thuc., Xen.
to run after, ἐπιδραμών in haste, eagerly, Hdt., Plat.
to run over a space, Il.: to run over or graze the surface, Il.
to be spread over, of a mist, Od.:—c. acc., οἶδμα ὅταν ἔρεβος ἐπιδράμῃ when the billow runs over the deep, Soph.
to overrun, as an army does a country, Hdt., Thuc.
to run over, to treat lightly of, Lat. percurrere, Xen.
to run close after, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιτρίβω
div1.sense: to rub on the surface, to crush, Ar.:—Pass. to be galled, Ar.
metaph. to afflict, distress, destroy, ruin, Hdt., Ar.; of an actor, to murder a character, Dem.: —Pass. to be utterly destroyed or undone, Solon., Ar.; ἐπιτριβείης be hung! Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιτριηραρχέω
div1.sense: to be trierarch beyond the legal time, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιτριηράρχημα
div1.sense: the burden of a trierarchy continued beyond the legal term, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπίτριπτος
div1.sense: rubbed down, well worn: metaph. of persons, practised, cunning, Soph.; οὑπίτριπτος the rogue, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπίτριτος
div1.sense: one and a third, i. e. 1 + 1/3, or 4/3, Plat.
ἐπίτριτον (sc. δάνεισμα) , a loan of which 1/3 is paid as interest, i. e. 33 1/3 p. cent., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιτροπαῖος
div1.sense: delegated, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιτροπεύω
div1.sense: to be a trustee, administrator, guardian, governor, Hdt., Xen.
c. acc. to govern, administer, πατρίδα Hdt., Ar., etc.; ἐπ. τινά to be his guardian, Thuc.:—Pass., κακῶς ἐπιτροπευθῆναι to be ill treated by oneʼs guardians, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιτροπή
div1.sense: a reference to an arbiter, Thuc., Dem.
an action against a guardian, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπίτροπος
div1.sense: one to whom a charge is entrusted, a trustee, administrator, Hdt.: a governor, viceroy, Hdt., Dem.
a guardian, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιτροχάδην
div1.sense: adv. trippingly, fluently, glibly, Hom.

div1.head: ἐπίτροχος
div1.sense: voluble, glib, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτρύζω
div1.sense: to murmur beside or over, τινί Babr.

div1.head: ἐπιτρώγω
div1.sense: to eat with or after, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτυγχάνω
div1.sense: properly, to hit the mark: hence to light or fall upon, meet with,
c. dat., Hdt., Thuc., etc.
c. gen., Ar., Thuc.
absol., ὁ ἐπιτυχών, like ὁ τυχών, the first person one meets, any one, Hdt., Plat.
to attain to, reach, gain oneʼs end, c. gen. rei, Xen., Dem.
c. part. to succeed in doing, Hdt.
c. dat. modi, to be successful in a thing, μάχῃ Aeschin.: absol. to succeed, be successful, Plat., Xen.
ἐπ. βιβλίῳ to read it, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιτυμβίδιος
div1.sense: at or over a tomb, Aesch.
crested, a name given to larks, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιτύφομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be inflamed; ἐπιτεθυμμένος furious, rabid, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιφαίνω
div1.sense: to shew forth, display, shew off, Theogn.:—Pass. to come into light, come suddenly into view, Il., Hdt.: — to present oneself, shew oneself, appear, Hdt.
intr. to shew light, shine upon, c. dat., NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιφάνεια
div1.sense: manifestation, Plut.
visible surface: outward show, distinction, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιφανής
div1.sense: coming to light, appearing, of gods, Hdt., etc.
in full view, πόλις ἐπ. ἔξωθεν, of a place commanded by another, Thuc.
manifest, evident, of proofs, Thuc.
of men, conspicuous, famous, distinguished by rank, Hdt.; notable, for well or ill, Thuc., Xen.
of things, remarkable, Hdt.
adv. -νῶς, openly, Thuc.: Sup. -έστατα, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίφαντος
div1.sense: in the light, alive, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιφατνίδιος
div1.sense: at the manger, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιφαύσκω
div1.sense: to shine upon, τινί NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιφέρω
div1.sense: to bring, put or lay upon, τί τινι Il., etc.; ἐπιφέρειν τινὶ πόλεμον, Lat. bellum inferre, to make war upon him, Hdt., Attic; so, ἐπ. δόρυ Aesch., etc.:— absol. to attack, assail, Ar.
to bring offerings to the grave, Thuc.
to bring as a charge against, Hdt., Attic; so, ἐπ. μωρίην, μανίην τινί to impute it to him, Hdt., etc.
to confer or impose upon, in good or bad sense, Thuc.
to add to, increase, Thuc.
Mid. to bring with or upon oneself, bring as dowry, Dem.
Pass. to rush upon or after, attack, assault, Il., Hdt., Attic
to be borne onwards, Hdt.
to come after or next, ensue, τὰ ἐπιφερόμενα coming events, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιφημίζω
div1.sense: to utter words ominous of the event, in Mid., Hdt.
to promise according to an omen, c. inf., Eur.
to assign as authority to a thing, τοὺς θεούς Dem.
c. acc. et inf. to allege that, Plut.
to dedicate or devote to a god, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιφήμισμα
div1.sense: a word of ominous import, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιφθάνω
div1.sense: to reach first, part. aor2 ἐπιφθάς, Batr.

div1.head: ἐπιφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to utter after or in accordance, Lat. accinere, Aesch., Plat.
to utter, pronounce, Plat.
to call to, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιφθονέω
div1.sense: to bear grudge against, τινί Od., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπίφθονος
div1.sense: liable to envy or jealousy, regarded with jealousy, odious, Hdt., Attic:— ἐπίφθονόν ἐστι, c. inf. ʼtis invidious, hateful to . . , Hdt., Ar.:— τὸ ἐπίφθονον jealousy, odium, Thuc.
act. bearing a grudge against, τινι Aesch.: absol. injurious, Aesch.
adv., ἐπιφθόνως διακεῖσθαί τινι to be liable to his hatred, Thuc.; ἐπ. ἔχειν πρός τινα Xen.; ἐπ. διαπράξασθαί τι in an odious manner, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιφθύζω
div1.sense: to spit at, so as to avert a spell, ἐπιφθύζοισα (Doric part.) Theocr.:—also to mutter, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐπιφιλοπονέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to labour earnestly at, τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιφλέγω
div1.sense: to burn up, consume, Il., Hdt.; ἐπ. τὴν πόλιν to set fire to it, Thuc.
metaph. to inflame, excite, Aesch., Plut.
intr. to be scorching hot, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίφοβος
div1.sense: frightful, terrible, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιφοιτάω
div1.sense: to come habitually to, visit again and again, τὸ ἐπιφοιτέον or οἱ ἐπιφοιτέοντες the visitors, Hdt.; ὁ ἐπιφοιτέων κέραμος the wine-jars which are regularly imported, Hdt.; ἐπ. ἐς . . to go about to different places, Thuc.
c. dat., σπάνιος ἐπ. σφι visits them rarely, of the Phoenix, Hdt.
c. acc. pers., of visions, to haunt, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιφορά
div1.sense: a bringing to or besides: a donative, addition made to oneʼs pay, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιφορέω
div1.sense: to put upon, lay over, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιφόρημα
div1.sense: in pl. dishes served up besides or after, dessert, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐπίφορος
div1.sense: carrying towards, Thuc.: favourable, Aesch.
of ground, sloping, Plut.
near the time of bringing forth, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιφράζω
div1.sense: to say besides, Hdt.
Mid., with aor1 mid. ἐπεφρασάμην and pass. ἐπεφράσθην:
c. inf. to think of doing, take into oneʼs head to do, Hom.
c. acc. to think on, devise, contrive, Od., Hdt.:—absol., ὧδε ἐπιφρασθείς having come to this conclusion, Hdt.; ἐπιφρασθεῖσα αὐτή by her own mother wit, Hdt.
to notice, observe, Hom.:— to recognise, Od.:— to acquaint oneself with, take cognisance of, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιφράσσω
div1.sense: to block up, Theophr.: —Mid., ἐπ. τὰ ὦτα to stop oneʼs ears, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιφρονέω
div1.sense: to be shrewd, prudent; in part. fem. ἐπιφρονέουσα, carefully, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιφροσύνη
div1.sense: thoughtfulness, Od.

div1.head: ἐπίφρουρος
div1.sense: keeping watch over, τινι Eur.

div1.head: ἐπίφρων
div1.sense: thoughtful, sage, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιφύλιος
div1.sense: distributed to the tribes, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπιφυλλίς
div1.sense: the small grapes left for gleaners, Anth.: hence, Ar. calls poetasters ἐπιφυλλίδες, mere gleanings.

div1.head: ἐπιφυτεύω
div1.sense: to plant over or upon a thing, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιφύω
div1.sense: to produce on or besides, Theophr.
Pass., with aor2 and perf. act. ἐπέφῡν, ἐπιπέφῡκα, to grow upon, c. dat., Hdt.:— of dogs, to stick close to, Plut.
to be born after, Plut.
