div1.head: ἐπιφωνέω
div1.sense: to mention by name, tell of, Soph.
to say upon or with respect to, τινί or εἴς τι Plut.
to call out or address to, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιφώνημα
div1.sense: a witty saying, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιφώνησις
div1.sense: acclamation, a cry, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιφώσκω
div1.sense: to draw towards dawn, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιχαίρω
div1.sense: to rejoice over, exult over, mostly of malignant joy, c. dat., Soph., Dem.; absol., Ar., etc.
rarely in good sense, to rejoice in anotherʼs joy, c. acc., σὲ μὲν εὖ πράσσοντʼ ἐπιχαίρω Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιχαλαζάω
div1.sense: to shower hail upon, τινά Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιχαλάω
div1.sense: to loosen, slacken, Luc.
intr. to give way, relax, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιχαλκεύω
div1.sense: to forge upon an anvil: metaph., ἐπ. τινά to forge or mould to oneʼs purpose, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπίχαλκος
div1.sense: covered with copper or brass, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιχαράσσω
div1.sense: to engrave upon, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιχαρής
div1.sense: gratifying, agreeable, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιχαριεντίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to quote as a good joke, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιχαρίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make a present of a thing, c. acc., Xen.
intr., ἐπιχάριτται (Boeot. for ἐπιχάρισαι, aor1 imperat.) τῷ ξένῳ be civil to him, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπίχαρις
div1.sense: pleasing, agreeable, charming, Aesch., Xen.:— τὸ ἐπίχαρι pleasantness of manner, Xen.—The comp. and Sup. are ἐπιχαριτώτερος, -τατος (as if from ἐπιχάριτος), Xen.: adv. is also ἐπιχαρίτως, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπίχαρμα
div1.sense: an object of malignant joy, Eur., Theocr.
malignant joy, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπίχαρτος
div1.sense: wherein one feels joy, delightsome, Aesch., Soph.
wherein one feels malignant joy, ἐχθροῖς ἐπίχαρτα sufferings that afford triumph to my enemies, Aesch.; οἱ δικαίως τι πάσχοντες ἐπίχαρτοι to see people justly punished is a satisfaction, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιχειλής
div1.sense: full to the brim, brim-full, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιχειμάζω
div1.sense: to pass the winter at a place, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιχειρέω
div1.sense: to put oneʼs hand on a thing, c. dat., Od., Ar.
to put oneʼs hand to a work, set to work at, attempt, c. dat., Hdt., Attic:—rarely c. acc., Theogn., Plat.:—Pass. to be attempted, Thuc.
c. inf. to endeavour or attempt to do, Hdt., Attic
to make an attempt on, to set upon, attack, τινί Hdt., Attic; πρός τινα Thuc.;—absol., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐπιχείρημα
div1.sense: an attempt, enterprise, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιχείρησις
div1.sense: an attempt, attack, Hdt., Thuc.; ἐπ. ποιεῖσθαί τινος to attempt a thing, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιχειρητέος
div1.sense: one must attempt or attack, τινί Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιχειρητής
div1.sense: an enterprising person, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπίχειρον
div1.sense: wages of manual labour: generally wages, pay, guerdon, reward, Ar., Plat.:—also in bad sense, τῆς ὑψηγόρου γλώσσης ἐπ. rewards for proud speech, Aesch.; ξιφέων ἐπ. the wages of the sword, i. e. slaughter by it, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπιχειροτονέω
div1.sense: to vote in favour of a proposed decree, to sanction by vote, Dem.
of magistrates, to admit one elected to office, ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιχειροτονία
div1.sense: a voting by show of hands, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπιχέω
div1.sense: to pour water over the hands, Hom., Attic:—metaph. to pour or shed over, ὕπνον τινί, etc., Hom.
of solids, like χώννυμι, Hom.
Mid. to pour or throw over oneself or for himself, Od.
to have poured out for one to drink, ἐπ. ἄκρατόν τινος to drink it to any oneʼs health, Theocr.
Pass. to be poured over, Xen.: aor1 ἐπεχύθην [ῠ], perf. -κέχυμαι:—metaph., of a crowd of persons, to stream to a place, ἐπέχυντο (Epic aor2 pass.), Il.:— to come like a stream over, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιχθόνιος
div1.sense: upon the earth, earthly, as epith. of mortals, Hom.; absol., ἐπιχθόνιοι earthly ones, men on earth, Il.

div1.head: ἐπιχλευάζω
div1.sense: to make a mock of, τι Plut.: to say scornfully, Babr.

div1.head: ἐπιχλιαίνω
div1.sense: to warm slightly, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίχολος
div1.sense: act. producing bile, ποίη ἐπιχολωτάτη Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπιχορεύω
div1.sense: to dance to or in honour of a thing, Ar.
to come dancing on, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιχορηγέω
div1.sense: to supply besides, τί τινι NTest.: —Pass., NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιχορηγία
div1.sense: additional help, NTest.

div1.head: ἐπιχράω
div1.etym: only in imperf. or aor2 ἐπέχραον,
div1.sense: to attack, assault, c. dat., Il.; μητέρι μοι μνηστῆρες ἐπέχραον beset her, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιχράω
div1.sense: to lend besides, cf. ἐπικίχρημι.

div1.head: ἐπιχράομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make use of besides, c. dat., Eur.
c. dat. pers., Lat. uti, to have dealings with, be friends with, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπιχρέμπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to spit upon, τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίχριστος
div1.sense: smeared over:—metaph. spurious, Lat. fucatus, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιχρίω
div1.sense: to anoint, besmear, Od.:—Mid. to anoint oneself, Od.
to plaster over, τι ἐπί τι NTest.; τινί with a thing, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίχρυσος
div1.sense: overlaid with gold, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιχρωματίζω
div1.sense: to lay on like colour, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιχρώννυμι
div1.sense: to smear over, colour on the surface, tinge, τινί with a thing, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιχωρέω
div1.sense: to give way, yield, τινί to one, Soph.
to forgive, Plut.
to come towards, join as an ally, Lat. accedere alicui, Thuc., Xen.
to go against the enemy, Xen.

div1.head: ἐπιχωριάζω
div1.sense: to be in the habit of visiting, Plat.; ἐπ. τοῖς ἄνω πράγμασι to be occupied with, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπιχώριος
div1.note: ἐπι-χώριος, α, ον or ος, ον
div1.sense: in or of the country:
of persons, οἱ ἐπ. the people of the country, natives, Hdt., al.; οἱ ἐπιχώριοι χθονός Soph., Eur.

of things, of or used in the country, Hdt., Ar.;—often, τὸ ἐπιχώριον, τοὐπιχώριον the custom of the country, custom, fashion, Ar., Thuc., etc.; ἐπιχώριον ὂν ἡμῖν, c. inf., as is the custom of our country, Thuc.
adv. -ίως, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιψαύω
div1.sense: to touch on the surface, touch lightly, handle, c. gen., Hes., Hdt., Attic; κἂν ὀλίγον νυκτός τις ἐπιψαύσῃσι, i. e. if one gets ever so little of the night, i. e. sleeps ever so little, Theocr.:—metaph. to touch lightly upon, Lat. strictim attingere, Hdt.
intr., ὅστʼ ὀλίγον περ ἐπιψαύῃ πραπίδεσσιν who can reach ever so little way by his wits, Od.

div1.head: ἐπιψεκάζω
div1.sense: to keep dropping, ὁ θεὸς ἐπιψακάζει, of small rain, ʼtis drizzling, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπιψέλιον
div1.sense: a curb-chain, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπιψεύδομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to lie still more, Xen.
to attribute falsehood to, τί τινι Luc.
to falsify a number, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιψηλαφάω
div1.sense: to feel by passing the hand over the surface, Plat.; ἐπ. τινός to feel for it, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπιψηφίζω
div1.sense: to put a question to the vote (the office of the President) in the Athenian Senate or Assembly, ἐπ. τὰς γνώμας Aeschin., Dem.; c. inf. to put it to the vote that . . , Thuc.
absol. to put the question, Thuc., Xen.
ἐπ. τινί to put the question for or at the instance of any one, Hdt.
ἐπ. τοὺς παρόντας to put the question to them, take their votes, Plat.
Pass. to be put to the vote, Aeschin.
Mid., of the voters, to vote, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπίψογος
div1.sense: exposed to blame, blameworthy, Xen.: —adv. -γως, Plut.
act. censorious, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπιψύχω
div1.sense: to cool, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπιωγαί
div1.sense: places of shelter for ships, roadsteads, Od.

div1.head: ἐπόγμιος
div1.sense: presiding over the furrows, Anth.

div1.head: ἐποδύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to lament over a thing, Anth.

div1.head: ἐποικέω
div1.sense: to go as settler or colonist to a place, to settle in a place, c. acc., Eur.; ἐν τόπῳ Xen.
to be settled with hostile views against, ὑμῖν Thuc.: Pass., ἡ Δεκέλεια τῇ χώρᾳ ἐποικεῖται Deceleia is occupied as a base of operations against the country, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐποικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build up, Thuc.
to build upon, Xen.
to rebuild, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ἔποικος
div1.sense: one who has settled among strangers, a settler, alien, Soph., Plat.
a colonist, Ar., Thuc.
as adj. neighbouring, Aesch.: hence again as Subst. a neighbour, one near, Soph.

div1.head: ἐποικτείρω
div1.sense: to have compassion on, τινά Soph.; absol., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐποικτίζω
div1.sense: to compassionate, c. acc., Soph.

div1.head: ἐποίκτιστος
div1.sense: pitiable, piteous, Aesch.

div1.head: ἔποικτος
div1.sense: piteous, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐποιμώζω
div1.sense: to lament over, πάθει Aesch.

div1.head: ἐποίχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to go towards, approach, c. acc., Od., Theogn.
to approach with hostile purpose, set on, attack, c. acc., Il.
to go over, traverse, Il.
to go round, visit in succession (cf. ἔπειμι (εἶμι ibo) III), of one who hands round wine, ἐπῴχετο οἰνοχοεύων Od.; of a general, to go round, inspect, στίχας Hom.; and absol. to go the rounds, Il.
of Apollo and Artemis to visit with death, Hom.
to go over or ply oneʼs work, Hom.; ἱστὸν ἐπ. to ply the loom, Lat. percurrere telam, Hom.:—absol. in partic., busily, Il.

div1.head: ἐποκέλλω
div1.sense: to run a ship ashore, Hdt., Thuc.
of the ship, to run aground, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐποκριόεις
div1.sense: uneven, projecting, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπολισθάνω
div1.sense: to slip or glide upon, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπολολύζω
div1.sense: to shout for joy, τινί at or to one, Aesch.; τι over or at a thing, Aesch.;—also in Mid., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπομβρέω
div1.sense: to pour rain upon, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπομβρία
div1.sense: heavy rain, abundance of wet, wet weather, Ar.

div1.head: ἔπομβρος
div1.sense: very rainy, Arist.

div1.head: ἐπόμνυμι
div1.sense: to swear after, swear accordingly, Od.: to take an oath besides, Thuc.
c. acc. pers., to swear by, Hdt., Eur., etc.: so in Mid., ap. Dem.
c. acc. rei, to swear to a thing, Xen.
c. inf. to swear that, Hdt., Eur.; so in Mid., Dem.
absol. in aor1 part., ἐπομόσας upon oath, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἐπομφάλιος
div1.sense: on the navel or central point, on the boss of the shield (Lat. umbo), Il.

div1.head: ἐπονείδιστος
div1.sense: to be reproached, shameful, ignominious, Eur., Plat.; ἐπονείδιστόν ἐστι is matter of reproach, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπονομάζω
div1.sense: to give a surname: to name or call so and so, Thuc., Plat.:—Pass. to be named, ἀπό τινος or τινος after one, Thuc., Eur.:— to be surnamed, Thuc.
to pronounce a name, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐποπίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to regard with awe, to reverence, Od., Theogn.

div1.head: ἐποποιία
div1.sense: Epic poetry or an Epic poem, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐποποιός
div1.sense: an Epic poet, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐποπτάω
div1.sense: to roast besides or after, Od.

div1.head: ἐποπτεύω
div1.sense: to look over, overlook, watch, of an overseer, Od., Aesch., etc.:—also, to visit, punish, Aesch., Plat.
to become an ἐπόπτης, be admitted to the highest mysteries, Epic Plat.; proverb. to attain to the highest earthly happiness, Ar.

div1.head: ἐποποῖ
div1.sense: a cry to mimic that of the hoopoe (ἔποψ) , Ar.

div1.head: ἐποπτήρ
div1.sense: of tutelary gods, λιτῶν Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπόπτης
div1.sense: an overseer, watcher, ἐπ. πόνων a spectator, Aesch.; ἐπ. τῶν στρατηγουμένων Dem.
one admitted to the highest mysteries, Plut.

div1.head: ἐποπτικός
div1.sense: of or for an ἐπόπτης, τὰ τέλεα καὶ ἐπ. the highest mysteries, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπορέγω
div1.sense: to hold out to, give yet more, Il.; so in Mid., Solon.
Mid. to stretch oneself towards, ἐπορεξάμενος reaching forward to strike, Il.
metaph. to rise in oneʼs demands, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπορθιάζω
div1.sense: to set upright, of the voice, to lift up, Aesch.; absol., ἐπορθ. γόοις to lift up the voice in wailing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπορθοβοάω
div1.sense: to lift up a cry, Eur. El. (s.v.l.) LSJ supp

div1.head: ἐπόρνυμι
div1.sense: to stir up, arouse, excite, Il.
to rouse and send against, c. dat., ὕπνον ἐπῶρσε sent sleep upon her, Od.
Pass. ἐπόρνυμαι, with perf2 act. ἐπόρωρα, 3rd sg. Epic aor2 pass. ἐπῶρτο:— to rise against, assault, fly upon one, c. dat., Il.; absol., Il.:—of things, c. inf., Od.

div1.head: ἐπορούω
div1.sense: to rush violently at or upon, c.dat., Il.; absol., Il.: to rush after, i. e. to seek him, Il.; of sleep, to overtake, Od.

div1.head: ἐπορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dance to the tune of, c. gen., Dem.

div1.head: ἔπος
div1.sense: a word, Od., etc.:— a tale, story, lay, Od.
a pledged word, promise, Il., etc.
a word of advice, counsel, Il.
the word of a deity, a prophecy, oracle, Od., Hdt., Trag.:—later also, a saying, saw, proverb, Hdt.
the meaning, substance, subject of a speech, a thing or matter, Il.
Phrases:— ἅμα ἔπος τε καὶ ἔργον ἐποίεε no sooner said than done," Hdt.
κατʼ ἔπος word by word, exactly, Ar.
οὐδὲν πρὸς ἔπος nothing to the purpose, Plat.
ὡς ἔπος εἰπεῖν or ὡς εἰπεῖν ἔπος, so to say, as the saying is, Eur., etc.
ἑνὶ ἔπει in one word, briefly, Hdt.
in pl. poetry in heroic verse, Epic poetry, opp. to μέλη (lyric poetry), etc., Hdt., Attic: also, generally, poetry, Pind.
in sg. a verse or line of poetry, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἐποτοτύζω
div1.sense: to yell out, utter lamentably, Eur.

div1.head: ἐποτρύνω
div1.sense: to stir up, excite, urge on, Hom., Hdt., etc.; c. inf., Il., etc.; c. dat. et inf., ἑτάροισιν ἐποτρῦναι κατακῆαι to urge them to burn, Od.

c. acc. rei, to stir up against, Od.; ἀγγελίας ἐπ. sends urgent messages, Od.; ξύνοδον ἐπώτρυνον τοῖς ὁπλίταις gave the signal for engagement to the men-at-arms, Thuc.:—Mid., ἐποτρυνώμεθα πομπήν let us urge on our escort, Od.:—Pass. to press on, hasten, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπουραῖος
div1.sense: on the tail, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπουράνιος
div1.sense: in heaven, heavenly, Hom.
οἱ ἐπουράνιοι the gods above, Theocr.:— τὰ ἐπ. the phenomena of the heavens, Plat.

div1.head: ἐπουριάζω
div1.sense: to waft onwards, Luc.

div1.head: ἐπουρίζω
div1.sense: to blow favourably upon, of a fair wind (οὖρος) , ἐπ. τὴν ὀθόνην to fill the sail, Luc.:— metaph., φρόνημα ἐπ. to turn oneʼs mind successfully to a thing, Eur.: c. acc. cogn., πνεῦμα αἱματηρὸν ἐπ. τινί (of the Erinyes) to send after him a gale of murderous breath, Aesch.

div1.head: ἔπουρος
div1.sense: blowing favourably, Soph.

div1.head: ἐποφείλω
div1.sense: to owe besides or still, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐποφθαλμιάω
div1.sense: to cast longing glances at, c. dat., or πρός τι Plut.

div1.head: ἐποχέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. with fut. mid., to be carried upon, ride upon, c. dat., Il.; absol., κάμηλον ὥστε ἐποχεῖσθαι a camel to ride on, Xen.

div1.head: ἐποχετεύω
div1.sense: to carry water by sluices or courses, Lat. derivare, Plat.

div1.head: ἐποχή
div1.sense: a check, cessation: the epoch of a star, i. e. the point at which it seems to halt after reaching the zenith, Plut.

div1.head: ἐποχθίδιος
div1.sense: on or of the mountains, Anth.

div1.head: ἔποχον
div1.sense: the saddle-cloth, housing, Xen.

div1.head: ἔποχος
div1.sense: mounted upon a horse, chariot, ship, c. gen. vel dat., ναῶν ἔποχοι, ἅρμασιν ἔποχοι Aesch.: metaph., λόγος μανίας ἔπ. words borne on madness, i. e. frantic words, Eur.
absol. having a good seat on horseback, Xen.
pass., ποταμὸς ναυσὶ ἔπ. navigable by ships, Plut.

div1.head: ἐποψίδιος
div1.sense: for eating with bread, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπόψιμος
div1.sense: that can be looked on, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπόψιος
div1.sense: full in view, conspicuous, Soph.
act. overlooking all things, of gods, Soph.

div1.head: ἔποψις
div1.sense: a view over, ἐπʼ ὅσον ἔπ. τοῦ ἱροῦ εἶχε so far as the view from the temple reached, Hdt.; τὴν ἔποψιν τῆς ναυμαχίας ἔχειν to view the sea-fight, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔποψ
div1.sense: the hoopoe, Lat. upupa, Ar.

div1.head: ἑπταβόειος
div1.sense: of seven bullsʼ-hides, Il.

div1.head: ἑπτάδραχμος
div1.sense: worth seven δραχμαί, Theocr.

div1.head: ἑπταέτης
div1.sense: of seven years: neut. ἑπτάετες as adv. for seven years, Od.

div1.head: ἑπταετής
div1.sense: seven years old, Plat.:—fem. -έτις, ιδος, Anth.

div1.head: ἑπτακαίδεκα
div1.sense: seventeen, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑπτακαιδεκάπους
div1.sense: 17 feet long, Plat.

div1.head: ἑπτακαιδέκατος
div1.sense: seventeenth, Thuc.

div1.head: ἑπτακαιεικοσέτης
div1.sense: twenty-seven years old, Anth.

div1.head: ἑπτακισμύριοι
div1.sense: seventy-thousand, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑπτάκις
div1.sense: seven times, Lat. septies, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἑπτακισχίλιοι
div1.sense: seven-thousand, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑπτάκλινος
div1.sense: with seven couches or beds, Xen.

div1.head: ἑπτακόσιοι
div1.sense: seven hundred, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑπτάλογχος
div1.sense: of seven lances, i. e. seven bodies of spearmen, Soph.

div1.head: ἑπτάλοφος
div1.sense: on seven hills, of Rome, Anth.

div1.head: ἑπτάμηνος
div1.sense: born in the seventh month, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑπτάμιτος
div1.sense: seven-stringed, Luc., Anth.

div1.head: ἑπταμόριον
div1.sense: the seven districts, Plut.

div1.head: ἑπτά
div1.sense: seven, Lat. septem, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἑπτάπηχυς
div1.sense: seven cubits long, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑπταπόδης
div1.sense: seven feet long, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ἑπτάπορος
div1.sense: with seven paths, of the Pleiads, Eur.

div1.head: ἑπτάπυλος
div1.sense: with seven gates, epith. of Boeotian Thebes, Hom., etc.;—Egyptian Thebes being ἑκατόμπυλοι.

div1.head: ἑπτάπυργος
div1.sense: seven-towered, of Thebes, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἑπτάστομος
div1.sense: seven-mouthed, with seven portals, of Thebes, Eur.

div1.head: ἑπτατειχής
div1.sense: with seven walls, of Thebes, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑπτάτονος
div1.sense: seven-toned, Eur.

div1.head: ἑπτάφθογγος
div1.sense: seven-toned, Eur.

div1.head: ἑπτάφωνος
div1.sense: seven-voiced, Luc.

div1.head: ἕπταχα
div1.sense: adv. in seven parts, Od.

div1.head: ἑπτέτης
div1.sense: seven years old, Ar.; nom. pl. ἑπτέτεις Plat.

div1.head: ἐπύλλιον
div1.sense: a versicle, scrap of poetry, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπωβελία
div1.sense: an assessment of an obol in the drachma, to be paid by the plaintiff, in case he failed to gain 1/5 of the votes, Dem.

div1.head: ἐπῳδή
div1.sense: a song sung to or over: an enchantment, charm, spell, Od., Hdt., Attic: c. gen. objecti, a charm for or against a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπῳδός
div1.sense: singing to or over: as Subst. an enchanter, Eur.: c. gen. acting as a charm for or against, Aesch., Plat.
pass. sung or said after, μορφῆς ἐπῳδόν called after this form, Eur.
in metre, ἐπῳδός, ὁ, a verse or passage returning at intervals, a chorus, burden, refrain, as in Theocr. 1.

div1.head: ἐπῴζω
div1.sense: to cluck, like a sitting bird, Ar.

div1.head: ἐπωθέω
div1.sense: to push on, thrust in, Plut.

div1.head: ἐπωλένιος
div1.sense: upon the arm, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐπωμάδιος
div1.sense: on the shoulders, Theocr. 1.

div1.head: ἐπωμαδόν
div1.sense: on the shoulder, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπωμίς
div1.sense: the point of the shoulder, where it joins the collar-bone, the acromion, Xen.:— the shoulder, Anth.
the front or the uppermost part of a ship, Anth.
the shoulder-strap of a tunic, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπώμοτος
div1.sense: on oath, sworn, Soph.
pass. witness of oaths, Soph.

div1.head: ἐπωνυμία
div1.sense: a surname, name given after some person or thing, Lat. cognomen, as Polynices, (from πολύς, νεῖκος), Aesch.; ἐπ. ποιεῖσθαι, θέσθαι to take a surname, Hdt.; καλεῖσθαι ἐπωνυμίην ἐπί τινος after some one, Hdt.; ἔχειν ἐπ. ἀπό τινος Hdt., Thuc.; ἐπ. σχεῖν χώρας to have the naming of it, i. e. have it named after one, Thuc.; with inf. added, ἐπ. ἔχει εἶναί τι he has a name for being, may be said to be, Plat.
generally, a name, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπωνύμιος
div1.sense: called by the name of, τινός Hdt.

div1.head: ἐπώνυμος
div1.sense: given as a name, τῷ Ὀδυσεὺς ὄνομʼ ἐπώνυμος Odysseus is the name given him, Od.; Ἀλκυόνην καλέεσκον ἐπώνυμον Alcyone they called her by name, Il.; Ἀρήτη δʼ ὄνομʼ ἐστὶν ἐπώνυμον Arete (the Desired) is the name given her, Od.
named besides, surnamed, Hdt.
named after a person or thing, c. gen., Hdt., Trag.; also, ἐπ. ἐπί τινος Hdt.
act. giving oneʼs name to a thing or person, ἐπώνυμον (sc. τὸ σάκος) , which gives thee thy name (of Eurysaces), Soph.
at Athens, οἱ ἐπώνυμοι (sc. ἥρωες) , the heroes after whom the Attic φυλαί had their names, Dem.
ἄρχων ἐπ. the first Archon, who gave his name to the current year.

div1.head: ἐπωπάω
div1.sense: to observe, watch, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐπωρύω
div1.sense: to howl at, Anth.

div1.head: ἕπω
div1.sense: to be about, be busy with, τεύχεʼ ἕποντα busy with his armour, Il.: cf. ἀμφι-έπω, δι-έπω, ἐφ-έπω, μεθέπω, περι-έπω.

div1.head: ἕπομαι
div1.sense: Mid. onlyἕπομαι to follow, whether after or in company with, Hom.; c. dat. pers., Hom.:—also ἕπεσθαι ἅμα τινί Il., etc.; μετά τινι or τινα Il., etc.
to follow, as attendants, Od.:— also to escort, attend, by way of honour, Lat. prosequi, Il.
in hostile sense, to pursue, τινι Il.
to keep pace with, ἕπεθʼ ἵπποις Hom.: metaph. of a manʼs limbs, they do his bidding, Hom.
to follow the motions of another, τρυφάλεια ἕσπετο χειρί the helm went with his hand, i. e. came off in his hand, Il.
to follow, obey, submit to, τῶι νόμωι Hdt., Attic
simply, to come near, approach, only in imperat., ἕπεο προτέρω come on nearer, Hom.
to follow up, esp. in mind, to understand, Plat.
of Things, as of honour, glory, etc., τούτωι κῦδος ἅμʼ ἕψεται Il., etc.
to follow upon, τῆι ἀχαριστίαι ἡ ἀναισχυντία ἕπ. Xen.

div1.head: ἔπω
div1.etym: prob. made up by Nicander as present of εἶπον.
div1.sense: to say, Nicander.

div1.head: ἐπωτίδες
div1.sense: beams projecting like ears on each side of a shipʼs bows, whence the anchors were let down, cat-heads, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐπωφελέω
div1.sense: to aid or succour one in a thing, τινά τι Soph., etc.; ἐπ. τινα to aid or succour, Soph.; also τινι Soph., Eur.
δῶρον, ὃ μήποτʼ ἐπωφέλησα ἐξελέσθαι a gift, which would that I never had received, Eur.

div1.head: ἐπωφέλημα
div1.sense: a help, store, βορᾶς Soph.

div1.head: ἐπωφελία
div1.sense: help, succour, Anth.

div1.head: ἐπώχατο
div1.sense: πᾶσαι γὰρ πύλαι ἐπώχατο all the gates were kept shut, Il.

div1.head: ἔρα
div1.sense: the Lat. terra, earth.

div1.head: ἔραζε
div1.sense: to earth, to the ground, Hom.; Doric ἔρασδε Theocr.

div1.head: ἔραμαι
div1.sense: to love, to be in love with, c. gen. pers., Hom., Eur.
of things, to love passionately, long for, lust after, Il., Hdt., Attic
c. inf. to desire eagerly, Theogn., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐρανίζω
div1.sense: lay under contribution, τινά Dem.
c. acc. rei, to collect by contributions, to beg, borrow, Aeschin.: metaph. to combine, Anth.:— Mid. to collect for oneself, borrow, Luc.
to assist by contribution, τινί Dem.

div1.head: ἐραννός
div1.sense: lovely, of places, Hom., Theocr.

div1.head: ἔρανος
div1.sense: a meal to which each contributed his share, Lat. coena collaticia, a pic-nic, Od., Eur.

any contribution, Lat. symbola, such as Athenians paid to pay for the support of the poor or state necessities, Ar.; ἐράνους λέλοιπε he has left his subscriptions unpaid, Dem.; ἔρανον φέρειν, simply, to contribute freely, Dem.
a kindness, service, favour, Eur., Thuc., etc.
a society of subscribers to a common fund, a club, Dem.

div1.head: ἐρασιχρήματος
div1.sense: loving money, Xen.

div1.head: ἐράσμιος
div1.sense: lovely, Xen.:— beloved, desired, Aesch., Xen.: neut. as adv., Anth.

div1.head: ἐραστεύω
div1.sense: to long for, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐραστής
div1.sense: a lover, properly of persons, Ar., etc.:—metaph. of things, τυραννίδος Hdt.; πολέμων Eur.; ἐρ. πραγμάτων πολυπράγμων, Ar.; ἐρ. τοῦ πονεῖν fond of work, Ar.; ἐρ. ἐπαίνου Xen.

div1.head: ἐραστός
div1.sense: beloved, lovely, Plat.

div1.head: ἐρατεινός
div1.sense: lovely, charming, Hom.; of a man, ἑτάροις ἐρατεινός welcome to his comrades, Od.

div1.head: ἐρατίζω
div1.sense: Epic form of ἐράω, κρειῶν ἐρατίζων greedy after meat, Hom.

div1.head: ἐρατός
div1.sense: lovely, charming, Il., Hes., etc.: —neut. as adv., ἐρατὸν κιθαρίζειν Hhymn.
beloved, Tyrtae.

div1.head: ἐρατόχροος
div1.sense: fair of face, Anth.

div1.head: Ἐρατώ
div1.sense: Erato, the lovely, one of the Muses, Hes.
one of the Oceanides, Hes.

div1.head: ἐράω
div1.sense: to love, to be in love with, c. gen. pers., Xen., etc.: c. acc. cogn., ἐρᾶν ἔρωτα Eur.:—absol., ἐρῶν a lover, opp. to ἡ ἐρωμένη the beloved one, Hdt.
of things, to love or desire passionately, τυραννίδος Archil.; μάχης Aesch.; and c. inf. to desire to do, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐράω
div1.sense: to pour out, vomit forth, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐργάζομαι
div1.sense: to work, labour, properly of husbandry, Hes., Thuc., etc.; but also of all manual labour, Od., Hdt.:—also of things, as Vulcanʼs bellows, Il.
trans. to work at, make, build, Od., Attic
to do, perform, accomplish, Hom., Attic:—c. dupl. acc. to do something to another, Hdt., etc.; κακὰ ἐργάζεσθαί τινα Soph., Thuc.
to work a material, χρυσὸν εἰργάζετο Od.; ἐργ. γῆν to work the land, Hdt.
to earn by working, χρήματα Hdt., Attic
to work at, practise, Lat. exercere, τέχνην Plat.
absol. to work at a trade or business, to traffic, trade, Dem.
the perf. pass. εἴργασμαι is used in act. sense, as Hdt., Soph.; but also in pass. sense,
to be made or built, ἔργαστο τὸ τεῖχος Hdt.; ἐκ πέτρας εἰργασμένος Aesch., etc.
to be done, Aesch. —The fut. ἐργασθήσομαι always in pass. sense, Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἐργαθεῖν
div1.sense: to sever, cut off, Il.
to hold back, check, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐργαλεῖον
div1.sense: a tool, instrument, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐργασείω
div1.sense: Desiderat. of ἐργάζομαι, to be about to do, Soph.

div1.head: ἐργασία
div1.sense: work, daily labour, business, Lat. labor, Hhymn., Attic; δὸς ἐργασίαν, c. inf., Lat. da operam ut . . , NTest.
a working at, making, building, τειχῶν Thuc.; ἱματίων, ὑποδημάτων Plat., etc.
a working of a material, τοῦ σιδήρου Hdt.; τῶν χρυσείων μετάλλων Thuc., Ar., etc.
generally, trade, commerce, Xen., Dem.
a practising, exercising, τῶν τεχνῶν Plat.
a work of art, production, τετράγωνος ἐργ., of the Hermae, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐργάσιμος
div1.sense: of land, arable, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἐργαστέος
div1.sense: one must work the land, Xen.
τοὖργον ἔστʼ ἐργ. it must be done or one must do it, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐργαστήριον
div1.sense: any place in which work is done: a workshop, manufactory, Hdt., Attic: a mine, quarry, Dem.:— a butcherʼs shop, Ar.

div1.head: ἐργαστήρ
div1.sense: a workman, husbandman, Xen.

div1.head: ἐργαστικός
div1.sense: able to work, working, industrious, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἐργατήσιος
div1.sense: producing an income, Plut.

div1.head: ἐργάτης
div1.sense: a workman: esp. one who works the soil, a husbandman, Hdt., Attic; οὑργάτης λεώς the country- folk, Ar.
as adj. hard-working, strenuous, Xen.
one who practises an art, c. gen., Xen.
a doer, worker, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: ἐργατικός
div1.sense: given to labour, diligent, active, Plat.; of the Nile, from its activity in depositing silt, Hdt.: adv. -κῶς τι advantageously, Plut.

div1.head: ἐργατίνης
div1.sense: a husbandman, Theocr.
as adj., active, laborious, Anth.
c. gen. making a thing or practising an art, Anth.

div1.head: ἐργάτις
div1.sense: a workwoman: as adj. laborious, industrious, active, Hdt., Soph.
c. gen. working at or producing a thing, Aesch.; νέκταρος ἐργ., of bees, Anth.

div1.head: ἔργμα
div1.sense: a work, deed, business, Theogn., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐργοδότης
div1.sense: one who lets out work, opp. to ἐργολάβος, Xen.

div1.head: ἐργολαβέω
div1.sense: to contract for the execution of work, ἐργ. ἀνδριάντας, Lat. statuas conducere faciendas, Xen.:—absol. to work for hire, ply a trade, Dem.

div1.head: ἐργολάβος
div1.sense: one who contracts for the execution of work, a contractor, Lat. conductor, redemptor, opp. to ἐργοδότης, Plat.

div1.head: ἔργον
div1.sense: work, Hom., etc.; τὰ σαυτῆς ἔργα κόμιζε mind your own business, Hom.:
in Il. mostly of deeds of war, πολεμήϊα ἔργα Il., etc.; so, ἐν τῷ ἔργῳ during the action, Thuc.; ἔργου ἔχεσθαι to engage in battle, Thuc.

of works of industry, tilled lands, fields, farms, Hom.; οὔτε βοῶν οὔτʼ ἀνδρῶν ἔργα (cf. Virgilʼs hominumque boumque labores), Il.; ἔργα Ἰθάκης the tilled lands of Ithaca, Od.; so in Attic, τὰ κατʼ ἀγροὺς ἔργα, etc.:—then, generally, property, wealth, possessions, ἔργον ἀέξειν Od.
of womenʼs work, weaving, Hom.

of other occupations, θαλάσσια ἔργα fishing, as a way of life, Od.; periphr., ἔργα δαιτός works of feasting, Il.; so, ἔργα θήρας, etc. Xen., etc.:—in Attic also of all kinds of works, such as mines, iron- works, Il., Dem.
a hard piece of work, a hard task, Il.: also, a shocking deed or act, Lat. facinus, Od.:— also, χερμάδιον λάβε Τυδείδης, μέγα ἔργον a huge mass, Il.
a deed, action, often, as opp. to ἔπος, deed, not word, Hom.
a thing, matter, πᾶν ἔργον in every point, Il.; ἄκουε τοὔργον Soph., etc.
Pass. that which is wrought, a work, of the arms of Achilles, Il.; metal-work is called ἔργον Ἡφαίστοιο Od., etc.
the result of work, ἔργον χρημάτων profit on money, Dem.
the following pecul. Attic phrases arise from signf. I:
ἔργον ἐστί,
c. gen. pers. his business, his proper work, ἔργον ἀγαθοῦ πολίτου Plat.; so, σὸν ἔργον ἐστί it is your business, Aesch.
c. gen. rei, there is need of, use of a thing, Eur.
c. inf. it is hard work, difficult to do, πολὺ ἔργον ἂν εἴη διεξελθεῖν Xen., etc.; οὐκ ἔργον θρηνεῖσθαι ʼtis no use to lament, Soph.
ἔργα παρέχειν τινί to give one trouble, Ar.; ἔργον ἔχειν to take trouble, Xen.

div1.head: ἐργοπόνος
div1.sense: a husbandman, Anth.

div1.head: ἔργω
div1.etym: for aor2 εἴργαθον v. sub ἐργαθεῖν
Mid. and Pass., fut. ἔρξομαι, Attic εἴρξομαι
div1.sense: to bar oneʼs way either by shutting in or shutting out:

to shut in, shut up, Lat. includere, Hom.; ἐντὸς ἐέργειν to enclose, bound, Il.; ἂψ ἐπὶ νῆας ἔεργε drove them to the ships and shut them up there, Il.:—of things, δόμον ἐέργειν to shut it up, Od.: —Pass., ἔρχατο were fenced in, Il.; γέφυραι ἐεργμέναι well-secured, strong-built, Il.
to shut out, Lat. excludere, Hom.; ἐκτὸς ἐέργειν Od.

c. gen. to shut out or keep away from, Il., Hdt., Attic; and with Preps., ἔργ. τι ἀπό τινος Il.; c. dat. pers., εἴργειν μητρὶ δόρυ to keep it off from her, Aesch.:— Pass., εἰργόμενον θανάτου short of death, Aeschin.:— Mid. to keep oneself or abstain from, Hdt., Soph.

to hinder, prevent from doing, Theogn.:—Pass., οὐδὲν εἴργεται nothing is barred, i. e. all things are permitted, Soph.:—c. inf., mostly with μή added; εἴργει τόνδε μὴ θανεῖν νόμος Eur.; c. inf. only, οὐδὲν εἴργει τελειοῦσθαι τάδε Soph.

div1.head: ἔργω
div1.sense: to do work, obsol. Root, for which ἔρδω, ῥέζω, ἐργάζομαι are used in the pres.: for the fut., aor1 and perf., v. ἔρδω.

div1.head: ἐργώδης
div1.sense: irksome, troublesome, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἔρδω
div1.sense: to do, Hom., etc.; often c. dupl. acc., to do something to a person, κακὰ πολλὰ ἔοργεν Τρῶας Il.; also, εὖ or κακῶς ἔρδειν τινά Theogn., etc.; simply, ἔρδ. τινά to do one harm, Soph.; ἔρδ. πήματα to work mischief, Aesch.; ἔρδοι τις ἣν ἕκαστος εἰδείη τέχνην let each man practise the art he knows, Ar.
to make or offer a sacrifice (v. ῥέζω), Hom., Hdt.:— absol., like Lat. facere, operari, Hes.

div1.head: ἐρεβεννός
div1.sense: dark, gloomy, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ἐρέβινθος
div1.sense: a kind of pulse, chick-pea, Lat. cicer, Il., Ar. Cf. ὄροβος.

div1.head: ἐρεβοδιφάω
div1.sense: to grope about in darkness, Ar.

div1.head: ἐρεβόθεν
div1.sense: from nether gloom, Eur.

div1.head: Ἔρεβόσδε
div1.sense: to or into Erebus, Od.

div1.head: Ἔρεβος
div1.sense: Erebus, a place of nether darkness, above Hades, Hom., etc.:—metaph., ἔρεβος ὕφαλον the darkness of the deep, Soph.

div1.head: ἐρεείνω
div1.sense: to ask, c. acc. pers. to ask of one, Od.; c. acc. rei, to ask a thing, Hom.; c. dupl. acc., ἐρ. τινά τι to ask one a thing, Od.:—so in Med. Od.

div1.head: ἐρεθίζω
div1.sense: to rouse to anger, rouse to fight, irritate, Hom., Hdt., etc.: to provoke to curiosity, Od.; metaph., ἐρ. χορούς to stir them, Eur.:—Pass. to be provoked, excited, Hdt., Ar.; of fire, φέψαλος ἐρεθιζόμενος ῥιπίδι a spark kindled by the bellows, Ar.; αἰθὴρ ἐρεθιζέσθω βροντῆι Aesch.; of one who is out of breath, Eur.

div1.head: ἐρέθισμα
div1.sense: a stirring up, exciting, Ar.

div1.head: ἐρέθω
div1.sense: to stir to anger, provoke, irritate, Hom.: c. acc. rei, ἤρεθον ᾠδάν they raised a song, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρείδω
div1.sense: to make one thing lean against another, τι πρός τι or τι ἐπί τινι Hom.; of Atlas supporting heaven, Aesch., Eur., etc.:—generally, to fix firmly, ἐρ. ὄμμα, Lat. figere oculos, εἴς τι Eur.
to prop, stay, support, ἀσπὶς ἄρʼ ἀσπίδʼ ἔρειδε, κόρυς κόρυν, ἀνέρα δʼ ἀνήρ, of close ranks of men-at-arms, Il.
to hurl forth, Ar.; and in Mid., Ar.
to infix, plant in, τί τινι Soph.; ἐρ. πληγήν to inflict a blow, Eur.
of wagers or matches, to set one pledge against another, Theocr.
intr. to lean against, jostle, c. dat., Od.
to set upon, press hard, c. dat., Il.; εἴς τινα Ar.; absol., of an illness, Aesch.
generally, to go to work, fall to, of eating, Ar.
Mid. and Pass. to lean upon, c. dat., Il.; ἐπί τινος and τινος, Il.: absol. to plant oneself firmly, take a firm stand, Il.; οὔδεϊ χαῖται ἐρηρέδαται their hair rests on the ground, Il.
to be fixed firm, planted, ἔγχος διὰ θώρηκος ἠρήρειστο had been fixed, Il., etc.; λᾶε ἐρηρέδαται the stones are firmly set, Il.
Mid.,
in recipr. sense, to strive one with another, contend, Il.
c. acc. to support for oneself, βάκτρωι ἐρείδου στίβον Eur.; ἐρ. ἐπὶ τοίχωι λίθον Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρείκη
div1.sense: heath, heather, Lat. erica, Aesch., Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρείκω
div1.sense: to rend, Hes., Aesch.: Pass., ἐρεικόμενος περὶ δουρί Il.
to bruise, pound, shatter, Aesch.
intr. only in aor2 ἤρικον, to be rent, to shiver, Il.

div1.head: ἐρείπιον
div1.sense: a fallen ruin, wreck, mostly in pl., ναυτικὰ ἐρ. pieces of wreck, Aesch., Eur.; also, οἰκημάτων ἐρ. ruins of houses, Hdt.; ἐρ. πέπλων fragments, Eur.; cf. ἐρείπω.

div1.head: ἐρείπω
div1.sense: to throw or dash down, tear down, Il., Hdt.: metaph., ἐρείπει γένος θεῶν τις some god brings the family to ruin, Soph.:—Pass. to be thrown down, fall in ruins, Il.; ἐν ἐρειπίοις νεκρῶν ἐρειφθείς a ruin amid the ruins of the dead, Soph.; ἐρείπεται κτύπος the thunder comes crashing down, Soph.
intr., in aor2 ἤριπον, Epic ἔριπον, to fall down, tumble, fall headlong, Hom.

div1.head: ἔρεισμα
div1.sense: a prop, stay, support, Lat. columen, Soph., Eur.:—in pl. the props to keep a boat on shore upright, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρείψιμος
div1.sense: thrown down, in ruins, Eur.

div1.head: ἐρειψίτοιχος
div1.sense: overthrowing walls, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐρεμνός
div1.sense: black, swart, dark, Hom., Aesch., etc.:—metaph., ἐρεμνὴ φάτις a dark, obscure rumour, Soph.

div1.head: ἐρέπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to feed on, c. acc., λωτόν, κρῖ λευκόν, πυρὸν ἐρεπτόμενοι Hom.

div1.head: ἐρέσσω
div1.sense: to row, Hom., Soph.; of birds flying, πτεροῖς ἐρ. Eur.

trans. to speed by rowing; metaph., γόων ἐρέσσετʼ πίτυλον ply the measured stroke of lamentation, Aesch.:—Pass. to be rowed, Eur.; of birds, πτερύγων ἐρετμοῖσιν ἐρεσσόμενοι with the oarage of wings (cf. Virgilʼs remigio alarum), Eur.
generally, to put in quick motion, ply, τὸν πόδα Eur.: —metaph., ἐρ. ἀπειλάς to set threats in motion, Soph.; ἐρ. μῆτιν Soph.:—Pass., of a bow, to be plied, handled, Soph.
to row through the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρεσχηλέω
div1.sense: only in pres. to talk lightly, to be jocular, Plat.
trans. to jest upon, quiz, banter, τινά Plat.

div1.head: ἐρέτης
div1.sense: a rower, Od., Hdt., Attic
in pl., also, oars, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρετικός
div1.sense: of or for rowers, ἐρ. πληρώματα crews of rowers, Plut.

div1.head: ἐρετμόν
div1.sense: Lat. remus, an oar, Od., Eur.: —of wings, v. ἐρέσσω II. 1.

div1.head: ἐρετμόω
div1.sense: to furnish with oars, set to row, Eur.

div1.head: Ἐρετριεύς
div1.sense: an Eretrian, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐρεύγομαι
div1.sense: to spit or spew out, to disgorge, Lat. eructare, c. acc. Il.:—absol. to belch, Lat. ructare, Od.
metaph. of the sea, to surge, break in foam against the land, Hom.
in aor2 act., to bellow, roar, properly of oxen (cf. ἐρύγμηλος) , ἤρυγεν ὡς ὅτε ταῦρος ἤρυγεν Il.

div1.head: ἐρευθέδανον
div1.sense: madder, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐρευθέω
div1.sense: to be red, Luc.

div1.head: ἐρεύθω
div1.sense: to make red, stain red, Il.:—Pass. to be or become red, Theocr.

div1.head: ἔρευνα
div1.sense: inquiry, search, ἔρ. ἔχειν τινός to make search for one, Soph.; ᾄσσειν εἰς ἔρευναν Eur.

div1.head: ἐρευνάω
div1.sense: to seek or search for, search after, track, Hom., Attic; ὧν χρείαν ἐρευνᾶι the things whereof he seeks after the use, i. e. whatever things he finds serviceable, Soph.
to search a place, Hdt., Theocr.
to enquire after, examine, Eur., Plat.
c. inf. to seek to do, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρευνητέος
div1.sense: one must seek out, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρέφω
div1.sense: to cover with a roof, ἔρεψαν ὄροφον made a roof, Il.: θάλαμον ἐρ. Od.
to cover with a crown, to crown, Soph.: —Mid. to crown oneself, Eur.

div1.head: Ἐρεχθεῖδαι
div1.sense: from Ἐρεχθεύς as a name of the Athenians, Trag.

div1.head: Ἐρεχθεύς
div1.sense: an ancient hero of Attica, the render (from ἐρέχθω).

div1.head: ἐρέχθω
div1.sense: to rend, break, Od.:—Pass., of a ship, to be shattered by the winds, Il.

div1.head: ἔρεψις
div1.sense: a roofing, roof, Plut.

div1.head: ἐρέω
div1.etym: Epic Verb, = ἐρεείνω, ἔρομαι, ἐρωτάω, not to be confounded with ἐρέω, future of ἐρῶ
div1.sense: to ask, enquire, τι about a thing, Hom.
c. acc. pers. to question, μάντιν ἐρείομεν (Epic for ἐρέωμεν) Il.; ἀλλήλους ἐρέοιμεν Od.

div1.head: ἐρημάζω
div1.sense: to be left lonely, go alone, ἐρημάζεσκον (Ionic imperf.) Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρημαῖος
div1.sense: desolate, solitary, Mosch.: c. gen. bereft of, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρημία
div1.sense: of places, a solitude, desert, wilderness, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
as a state or condition, solitude, loneliness, ἐρημίαν ἄγειν, ἔχειν to keep alone, Eur.; of persons, isolation, desolation, Soph.; διʼ ἐρημίαν from being left alone, Thuc.
c. gen. want of, absence, Eur., Thuc., etc.; τὴν ἐρ. ὁρῶν τῶν κωλυσόντων seeing that there would be none to hinder him, Dem.; ἐρ. κακῶν freedom from evil, Eur.

div1.head: ἐρημιάς
div1.sense: a solitary devotee, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρημοκόμης
div1.sense: void of hair, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρημολάλος
div1.sense: chattering in the desert, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρημονόμος
div1.sense: haunting the wilds, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρημόπολις
div1.sense: reft of oneʼs city, Eur.

div1.head: ἐρῆμος
div1.sense: desolate, lone, lonely, lonesome, solitary:
of places, Hdt., Attic; τὰ ἐρ. desert parts, Hdt., etc.; ἡ ἐρῆμος (sc. χώρα) , Hdt.
of persons or animals, Il., Aesch., etc.: desolate, helpless, Soph., Dem.:—neut. pl. as adv., ἔρημα κλαίω I weep in solitude, Eur.
of conditions, Soph.
c. gen. reft of, void or destitute of, Hdt., Attic
of persons, with no bad sense, wanting, without, ἐρῆμος ὅπλων Hdt.

ἐρήμη δίκη, ἡ, an undefended action, in which one party does not appear, and judgment goes against him by default, Thuc., etc.: so ἐρήμη or ἔρημος (without δίκη) , ἐρήμην εἷλον I got judgment by default, Dem.; ἔρημον ὦφλε he let it go by default, Dem.; ἐρήμην κατηγορεῖν to accuse in a case where there was no defence, Plat.

div1.head: ἐρημοσύνη
div1.sense: solitude, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρημοφίλης
div1.sense: loving solitude, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρημόω
div1.sense: to strip bare, to desolate, lay waste, ἱερά Thuc.:—Pass., Hdt., etc.
to bereave one of a thing, c. gen., ἐρ. ναυβατῶν ἐρετμά to leave the oars without men, Eur.:—Pass. to be bereft of, c. gen., Hdt., Aesch.
to set free or deliver from, c. gen., Eur.
to abandon, desert, c. acc., Aesch., Eur.; ἐρ. Συρακούσας to evacuate it, Thuc.
to keep in solitude, isolate, Eur.: —Pass. to be isolated from, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐρημωτής
div1.sense: a desolator, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρητύω
div1.sense: to keep back, restrain, check, Hom.; πολλὰ κέλευθος ἐρατύοι let a long distance bar thy approach, Soph.
c. gen. to keep away from, Eur.

div1.head: ἐριαύχην
div1.sense: with high-arching neck, of horses, Il.

div1.head: ἐριβόας
div1.sense: loud-shouting, Anth.

div1.head: ἐριβρεμέτης
div1.sense: of Zeus, loud-thundering, Il.: loud-sounding, αὐλός Anth.

div1.head: ἐρίβρομος
div1.sense: loud-shouting, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐρίβρυχος
div1.sense: loud-bellowing, Hhymn.: loud-braying, of the trumpet, Anth.

div1.head: ἐριβῶλαξ
div1.sense: with large clods, very fertile, Od.:—so, ἐρί-βωλος, Hom.

div1.head: ἐρίγδουπος
div1.sense: loud-thundering, Hom.

div1.head: ἐριδαίνω
div1.sense: to wrangle, quarrel, dispute, Hom.; c. dat., ἐριδαίνετον ἀλλήλοιϊν Il.; and in Mid., ποσσὶν ἐριδδήσασθαι Ἀχαιοῖς to contend with them in the foot-race, Il.

div1.head: ἐριδμαίνω
div1.sense: to provoke to strife, irritate, Il.
intr. = ἐριδαίνω, to contend, Theocr., Mosch.

div1.head: ἐρίδματος
div1.sense: strongly-built, i. e. unconquerable, or (from δαμάω) all-subduing.

div1.head: ἐρίζω
div1.sense: to strive, wrangle, quarrel, τινί with one, Hom., Attic; πρός τινα Hdt., Plat.
to rival, vie with, be a match for, τινί Hom.:—c. acc. rei, to contend with one in a thing, Hom.;—also, c. dat. rei, Od., Attic
absol. to engage in a contest, keep the contest up, Il.
Hom. sometimes uses the Mid., like the Act.

div1.head: ἐρίηρος
div1.sense: fitting exactly: as epith. of ἑταῖρος, faithful, trusty, Il.; pl. in heterocl. form, ἐρίηρες ἑταῖροι, ἐριήρας ἑταίρους Hom.

div1.head: ἐριθηλής
div1.sense: very flourishing, luxuriant, of plants, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ἔριθος
div1.sense: a day-labourer, hired servant of any sort; in Il., ἔριθοι are mowers or reapers: later, ἔριθοι, αἱ, spinsters, workers in wool, Dem., Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρίκλαυτος
div1.sense: (or -κλαυστος)much-weeping, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρίκτυπος
div1.sense: loud-sounding, Hes.

div1.head: ἐρικυδής
div1.sense: very famous, glorious, splendid, Hom.

div1.head: ἐρικύμων
div1.sense: big with young, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐρίμυκος
div1.sense: loud-bellowing, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ἐρίνεος
div1.sense: of wool, woollen, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐρινεός
div1.sense: the wild fig-tree, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: Ἐρινύς
div1.sense: the Erinys or Fury, an avenging deity, in sg. and pl., Hom., Trag.:—the number Three first in Eur.; the names Tisiphone, Megaera, Alecto only in late writers. At Athens they were called Εὐμενίδες, Σεμναί.

as appellat., μητρὸς Ἐρινύες curses from oneʼs mother, Hom.; but Ἐρινῦς πατρός the blood-guiltiness of his sire, Hes.; φρενῶν Ἐρινύς distraction, Soph.:—in Trag. persons sent to be curses to men are called Ἐρινύες.

div1.head: ἔριον
div1.sense: wool, in sg. and pl., Hom., Attic:— εἴρια ἀπὸ ξύλου cotton (Germ. Baumwolle, tree-wool), Hdt.

div1.head: ἐριοπωλικῶς
div1.sense: adv., like a wool-dealer, roguishly, Ar.

div1.head: ἐριούνης
div1.sense: Homeric epith. of Hermes the ready helper, luckbringer, Il.

div1.head: ἐριουργέω
div1.sense: to work in wool, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρι-
div1.sense: insepar. prefix, like ἀρι-, to strengthen the sense of a word, very, much.

div1.head: ἐρίπνη
div1.sense: a broken cliff, crag, scaur, Eur.: a steep side, sheer ascent, Eur.

div1.head: ἐρισθενής
div1.sense: very mighty, of Zeus, Hom., Hes.: of the Furies, Orph.

div1.head: ἔρισμα
div1.sense: a cause of quarrel, Il.

div1.head: ἐρισμάραγος
div1.sense: loud-thundering, of Zeus, Hes.

div1.head: ἔρις
div1.sense: strife, quarrel, debate, contention:
in Il. mostly of battle-strife, ἔριδι or ἐξ ἔριδος μάχεσθαι; ἔριδι ξυνιέναι to meet in battle; θεοὺς ἔριδι ξυνελάσσαι to set them a-fighting, etc.
in Od. mostly of contention, rivalry, ἔργοιο in work; ἀέθλων for prizes, etc.:—later much like ἀγών, a contest, ἔριν ἔχειν ἀμφὶ μουσικῇ Hdt.; ἔρις ἀγαθῶν zeal for good, Aesch.
after Hom. of political or domestic strife, discord, quarrel, wrangling, disputation, Hdt., Attic
as pr. nom. Eris, a goddess who excites to war, sister and companion of Ares, Il.

div1.head: ἐριστάφυλος
div1.sense: of wine, made of fine grapes, Od.
rich in grapes, of Bacchus, Anth.

div1.head: ἐριστός
div1.sense: matter for contest, Soph.

div1.head: ἐρισφάραγος
div1.sense: loud-roaring, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐρίτιμος
div1.sense: highly-prized, precious, Il., Ar.

div1.head: ἐρίφειος
div1.sense: of a kid, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρίφιον
div1.sense: Dim. of ἔριφος, a kid, NTest.

div1.head: ἔριφος
div1.sense: a young goat, kid, Hom.
ἔριφοι, οἱ, Lat. hoedi, a constellation (rising in Oct.) which brought storms, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐρίχρυσος
div1.sense: rich in gold, Anth.

div1.head: ἐριώλη
div1.sense: a hurricane, applied to Cleon by Ar.:— deriv. uncertain; for the deriv. in Ar. from ἔριον ὀλλύναι, wool-consumption, is a mere pun.

div1.head: ἑρκεῖος
div1.sense: of or in the ἕρκος or front court, Ζεὺς Ἑρκεῖος, the household god, because his statue stood in the ἕρκος, Od., Hdt., etc.
πύλαι, θύρα ἕρκ. the gates, door of the court, Aesch.; ἑρκεῖος στέγη the court itself, Soph.

div1.head: ἑρκίον
div1.sense: a fence, inclosure, Hom.

div1.head: ἕρκος
div1.sense: a fence, hedge, wall, Hom.; esp. round the court-yards of houses, Od.:— also the place enclosed, the court-yard, Hom.; Κίσσινον ἕρκος, i. e. Susa, Aesch.; γαίας ἕρκος a fenced city, Eur.; ἕρκος ἱρόν, i. e. the altar, Soph.; ἕρκος ὀδόντων the ring or wall which the teeth make round the gums, i. e. the teeth, Hom.; σφραγῖδος ἕρκος, i. e. a seal, Soph.
metaph. any fence, ἕρκος ἀκόντων a defence against javelins, Il.; ἕρκος βελέων Il.:—of persons, ἕρκος Ἀχαιῶν, of Ajax, ἕρκος Ἀχαιοῖσιν πολέμοιο, of Achilles, Il.
a net, toils, snare for birds, Od.; mostly in pl., Ar.:—metaph., τῆς Δίκης ἐν ἕρκεσιν Aesch.

div1.head: ἑρκοῦρος
div1.sense: watching an enclosure, Anth.

div1.head: ἕρμα
div1.sense: a prop, support, used to keep ships upright when ashore, Il.: metaph. of men, ἕρμα πόληος prop or stay of the city, Lat. columen, Hom.; μελαινέων ἕρμʼ ὀδυνάων, of a sharp arrow, the foundation, i. e. the cause, of pangs, Il.
a sunken rock, reef, on which a vessel may strike, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
a mound, cairn, barrow, Soph.
that which keeps a ship steady, ballast, Plut.

div1.head: ἕρμα
div1.sense: earrings, Hom.

div1.head: ἑρμαγέλη
div1.sense: a herd of Hermae, Anth.

div1.head: ἕρμαιον
div1.sense: a god-send, wind-fall, reputed to be a gift of the god Hermes, as in Latin of Hercules, Soph., Plat.; Ἕρμαια, (sc. ἱερά), τά, a feast of Hermes, Aeschin.

div1.head: Ἑρμαῖος
div1.sense: called after Hermes Od., Aesch.
of or from Hermes, gainful, Aesch.

div1.head: Ἑρμαφρόδιτος
div1.sense: an hermaphrodite, a person partaking of the attributes of both sexes, so called from Hermaphroditus, son of Hermes and Aphrodite, Luc.

div1.head: ἑρμηνεία
div1.sense: interpretation, explanation, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἑρμήνευμα
div1.sense: an interpretation, explanation, Eur.
a symbol, monument, Eur.

div1.head: ἑρμηνεύς
div1.etym: Ἑρμῆς, the messenger of the gods
div1.sense: an interpreter, esp. of foreign tongues, a dragoman, Hdt., Xen.
an interpreter, expounder, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑρμηνευτικός
div1.sense: of or for interpreting, Luc.

div1.head: ἑρμηνεύω
div1.sense: to interpret foreign tongues, Xen.
to interpret, put into words, give utterance to, Thuc., etc.
to explain, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: Ἑρμῆς
div1.sense: Hermes, the Lat. Mercurius, son of Maia and Zeus; messenger of the gods (διάκτορος) ; giver of good luck (ἐριούνιος, ἀκάκητα) ; god of all secret dealings, cunning, and stratagem (δόλιος) ; bearing a golden rod (χρυσόρραπις) ; conductor of defunct spirits (ψυχοπομπός, πομπαῖος) ; tutelary god of all arts, of traffic, markets, roads (ἀγοραῖος, ἐμπολαῖος, ὅδιος, ἐνόδιος) , and of heralds. His bust, mounted on a four-cornered pillar, was used to mark boundaries. —Proverb., κοινὸς Ἑρμῆς shares in your luck! Theophr.: cf. ἕρμαιον.

div1.head: Ἑρμίδιον
div1.sense: Dim. of Ἑρμῆς, a little Hermes, Ar.

div1.head: ἑρμίς
div1.sense: a bed-post, Od.

div1.head: ἑρμογλυφεῖον
div1.sense: a statuaryʼs shop, Plat.

div1.head: ἑρμογλυφεύς
div1.sense: a carver of Hermae: generally, a statuary, Luc.

div1.head: ἑρμογλυφικός
div1.sense: of or for a statuary: ἡ -κη (sc. τέχνη) , the art of statuary, Luc.

div1.head: Ἑρμοκοπίδης
div1.sense: a Hermes-mutilator, Plut.

div1.head: ἔρνος
div1.sense: a young sprout, shoot, scion, Hom.; ἀνέδραμεν ἔρνεϊ ἶσος shot up like a young plant, Il.
metaph. of a child, a scion, Trag.

div1.head: Ἐρξείης
div1.etym: from ἔργω, ἔρδω or ἔργω, εἴργω
div1.sense: in Hdt., as a translation of the Persian name Darius: either from ἔργω, ἔρδω the worker, doer; or from ἔργω, εἴργω, Lat. coercitor

div1.head: ἐρόεις
div1.sense: poet., lovely, charming, Hes., etc.

div1.head: ἔρομαι
div1.sense: to ask, enquire, Od., Thuc.
c. acc. objecti, to learn by enquiry, Od.: to ask after or for, Il.
c. acc. pers. to enquire of, question, Il., Hdt.,
c. dupl. acc. to ask one about a thing, Od.

div1.head: ἔρος
div1.sense: love, desire, Hom., etc.
as nom. pr. Eros, the god of love, Hes.

div1.head: ἔρος2
div1.sense: wool, only occurs in the Ionic for εἶρος.

div1.head: ἑρπετόν
div1.sense: a walking animal, quadruped, Od.; ἑρπετά, opp. to πετεινά, Hdt.
a creeping thing, reptile, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἑρπηστής
div1.sense: = ἑρπετόν, of a mouse, Anth.
adj. creeping, Anth.

div1.head: ἑρπύζω
div1.sense: to creep, crawl, of persons weighed down by age or distress.

div1.head: ἕρπυλλος
div1.sense: creeping thyme, Lat. serpyllum, Ar., Theocr.

div1.head: ἑρπυστής
div1.sense: a crawling child, Anth.

div1.head: ἕρπω
div1.etym: Attic aor1 εἵρπυσα, inf. ἑρπύσαι supplied by ἑρπύζω
div1.sense: to creep, crawl, Lat. serpo, repo, and generally to move slowly, walk, Hom., Trag.:—also simply, to go or come, Trag.
variously, of a tear, to steal from the eye, Soph.; of reports, to creep on, spread, like Lat. serpit rumor, Soph.; ὁ πόλεμος ἑρπέτω let it take its course, Ar.; of calamities, Soph.

div1.head: ἐρρωμένος
div1.etym: part. perf. pass. of ῥώννυμι, used as adj.
div1.sense: in good health, stout, vigorous, opp. to ἄρρωστος, Plat., Dem.; irreg. comp., ἐρρωμενέστερος, Hdt., Xen.: —Sup. -έστατος, Plat.:—adv. ἐρρωμένως, stoutly, manfully, vigorously, Aesch., Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἔρρω
div1.sense: to go slowly, wander about, Od.; of slow, halting gait, whence Hephaestus is called ἔρρων, limping, Il.
to go or come to oneʼs own loss or harm, Il.; ἔρρων ἐκ ναός gone, fallen from a ship, Aesch.

imperat. ἔρρε, Lat. abi in malam rem, away! begone! Il., etc.; so, ἔρροις Eur.; in pl. ἔρρετε Il.; and in 3rd sg. ἐρρέτω, away with him, Hom.; ἐρρέτω Ἴλιον perish Troy! Soph.; ἔρρʼ ἐς κόρακας, Lat. pasce corvos, be thou hung, Ar.; so, οὐκ ἐρρήσετε; οὐκ ἐς κόρακας ἐρρήσετε; Ar.

in Attic of persons and things, to be clean gone, to be lost, perish, disappear, Trag.; ἐξ οἵων καλῶν ἔρρεις from what fortunes hast thou fallen, Eur.; ἔρρει τὰ ἐμὰ πράγματα, Lat. actum est de me! Xen.

div1.head: ἕρση
div1.sense: dew, Lat. ros, Hom., etc.:—in pl. rain-drops, Il.
metaph. of young and tender animals, Od.; cf. δρόσος.

div1.head: ἑρσήεις
div1.sense: dewy, dew-besprent, Il.: metaph. of a corpse, fresh, Il.

div1.head: ἐρυγγάνω
div1.sense: = ἐρεύγομαι vomit, eructare, οἶνον ἐρυγγ. Eur.

div1.head: ἐρύγμηλος
div1.sense: loud-bellowing, Il.

div1.head: ἐρυθαίνω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to become red with blood, Il.

div1.head: ἐρύθημα
div1.sense: a redness on the skin, Thuc.; ἐρ. προσώπου a blush, Eur.:—absol. redness, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρυθραίνω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to become red, to blush, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρυθριάω
div1.sense: to be apt to blush, to colour up, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἐρυθρόπους
div1.sense: red-footed:—name of a bird, the redshank, Ar.

div1.head: ἐρυθρός
div1.etym: υ by nature, so that the correct forms of the comp. and Sup. are -ώτερος, -ώτατος
div1.sense: red, Lat. ruber, of the colour of nectar and wine, Hom.; of copper, Il.; of gold, Theogn.; of minium, Hdt.; of blood, Aesch.
Ἐρυθρὴ θάλασσα in Hdt. the Erythraean sea, including not only the Red Sea or Arabian Gulf, but also the Indian Ocean:—Later also of the Persian Gulf, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρυκανάω
div1.sense: to restrain, withhold, Epic part. fem. ἐρυκανόωσʼ Od.

div1.head: ἐρύκω
div1.sense: to keep in, hold back, keep in check, curb, restrain, Hom.:—c. gen., μή με ἔρυκε μάχης keep me not from fight, Il.:—c. inf. to hinder from doing, Eur.:—absol. to hinder, Il.
to detain a guest, Hom.:—but also, to detain by force, to withhold, confine, Hom.
to ward off, Lat. arcere, ἄκοντα, λιμόν Hom.
to keep apart, separate, Il.
Pass. to be held back, detained, Od.:— to hold back, keep back, Od.
to be kept away, Hdt.
ἀνέδην χῶρος ἐρύκεται the place is remissly guarded, i. e. is open to all, Soph.

div1.head: ἔρυμα
div1.sense: a fence, guard, ἔρυμα χροός, of defensive armour, Il., Xen.; τὸ ἔρ. τοῦ τείχεος the defence given by it, Hdt.: absol. a bulwark, breastwork, Thuc.
a safeguard, of the Areopagus, Aesch.; παῖδας ἔρ. δώμασι Eur.

div1.head: ἐρυμνόνωτος
div1.sense: with fenced back, of a crab, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρυμνός
div1.sense: fenced, fortified, by art or nature, Eur., Thuc.; τὰ ἐρυμνά strong positions, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρυμνότης
div1.sense: strength or security of a place, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρυσάρματες
div1.sense: chariot-drawing, of horses, Il.

div1.head: ἐρυσίβη
div1.sense: red blight, Lat. robigo, Plat.

div1.head: ἐρυσίθριξ
div1.sense: ἐρυσίθριξ ψήκτρα, a comb for drawing through the hair, a small-tooth comb, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρυσινηΐς
div1.sense: preserving ships, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρυσίπτολις
div1.sense: protecting the city, Il.

div1.head: ἐρυσμός
div1.sense: a safeguard against witchcraft, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἐρυστός
div1.sense: drawn, Soph.

div1.head: ἐρύω
div1.sense: to drag along the ground, drag, draw, a ship in to the sea or on to land, Hom.; νεκρὸν ἐρ., to drag a body away, rescue, Il.; or to drag off for plunder, Il.; of dogs and birds of prey, to drag and tear, Il.:—also, to tear away battlements, Il.
without any sense of violence, φᾶρος κὰκ κεφαλῆς εἴρυσσε drew it over his head, Od.; χλαίνης ἐρύων plucking him by the cloak, Il.; τόξον Hdt.; πλίνθους εἰρύειν, Lat. ducere lateres, Hdt.
Mid. ἐρύομαι to draw for oneself, Hom.; ἐρύσασθαι νῆας to launch us ships, Il.; ξίφος ἐρύεσθαι to draw oneʼs sword, Il.; ἐρύσσεσθαι τόξον to prepare to draw oneʼs bow, i. e. to string it, Od.
to draw towards oneself, Od.
to draw out of the press, ἐρύσασθαί τινα μάχης Il.; hence, to rescue, deliver, of captives, to redeem, ransom, Il.
simply to protect, guard, of armour, Il.
c. acc. rei, to keep off, ward off, Il.
to thwart, check, curb, Il.
to keep guard upon, watch over, νῆας, δῶμα Od.; εἰρύαται οἴκαδʼ ἰόντα lie in wait for me, Od.; φρεσὶν ἐρύσασθαι to keep in oneʼs heart, to conceal, Od.
to support, hold in honour, with notion of obedience, Od.
Pass. to be drawn ashore, drawn up in line, of ships, Il.; νῆες δʼ ὁδὸν εἰρύαται are drawn up along the road, Od.

div1.head: ἐρχατάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be kept or shut up, Epic 3rd pl. ἐρχατόωντο Od.

div1.head: ἔρχομαι
div1.sense: to come or go, Hom., etc.
to come or go back, return, Od.; in full, αὖτις, ἄψ, πάλιν ἐλθεῖν Od.
c. acc. cogn., ὁδόν or κέλευθον ἐλθεῖν to go a journey, Hom., Aesch.; ἀγγελίην ἐλθεῖν to go a message, Il.
c. gen. loci, πεδίοιο ἐλθεῖν over or across the plain, Il.

c. part. fut., to denote the object, ἔρχομαι οἰσόμενος I go to fetch, Il.; μαρτυρήσων ἦλθον Aesch., etc.:—like an auxiliary Verb, ἔρχομαι λέξων I am going to tell, I intend to say (as in French je vais dire), Hdt.
the aor. part. ἐλθών is often added to another Verb, κάθηρον ἐλθών come and cleanse, Il., etc.
Post-Homeric phrases:
εἰς λόγους ἔρχεσθαί τινι to come to speech with, Hdt., Soph.
εἰς χεῖρας, so, ἐς μάχην ἐλθεῖν τινι to come to blows with one, Aesch., Hdt.
ἐπὶ μεῖζον ἔρχ. to increase, Soph.; εἰς πᾶν ἐλθεῖν to try everything, Xen.
ἐς τὸ δεινόν, ἐς τὰ ἀλγεινὰ ἐλθεῖν to come into danger, etc., Thuc., etc.
παρὰ μικρὸν ἐλθεῖν, c. inf. to come within a little of, be near a thing, Eur.; παρὰ τοσοῦτον ἦλθε κινδύνου so narrow was her escape, Thuc.
with διά and gen., periphr. for a Verb, διὰ μάχης τινὶ ἔρχεσθαι, for μάχεσθαί τινι, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἐρῳδιός
div1.sense: the heron or hern, Lat. ardea, Il., Ar.

div1.head: ἐρωέω
div1.sense: to rush, rush forth, Hom.; ἠρώησαν ὀπίσσω, of horses, they started back, Il.
c. gen. rei, to draw back or rest from, πολέμοιο, χάρμης Il.; νέφος οὔποτʼ ἐρωεῖ the cloud never fails from (the rock), Od.:—c. acc. to leave, quit, Theocr.
trans. to drive or force back, Il.

div1.head: ἐρωή
div1.sense: any quick motion, rush, force, Il.; mostly of things, δουρός, βελέων ἐρ. Il.; λείπετο δουρὸς ἐρωήν war left a spearʼs throw behind, Il.; λικμητῆρος ἐρωή the force or swing of the winnowerʼs (shovel), Il.
c. gen. rei, a drawing back from, rest from, πολέμου Il.

div1.head: ἐρωμένιον
div1.sense: a little love, darling, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρώμενος
div1.sense: oneʼs love: v. ἐράω.

div1.head: ἐρῶ
div1.etym: the place of the pres. εἴρω (rare even in Epic and never in Attic) is supplied by φημί, λέγω or ἀγορεύω; and εἶπον serves as the aor.
div1.sense: I will say or speak, Attic: c. acc. pers. to speak of, κακῶς ἐρεῖν τινα Theogn., Eur.; c. dupl. acc., ἐρεῖν τινά τι Eur., etc.
I will tell, proclaim, Il., etc.; φόως ἐρέουσα to announce the dawn, Il.; ἐπὶ ῥηθέντι δικαίωι upon clear right, Od.
εἰρημένος promised, μισθός Hes., Hdt.; εἰρημένον, absol., when it had been agreed, Thuc.
to tell, order one to do, c. dat. et inf., Xen.; c. acc. et inf., Xen.:—so in Pass., εἴρητό οἱ, c. inf., orders had been given him to do, Hdt.
in Pass. to be mentioned, Hdt.
simple εἴρω in Ionic and Epic, to say, speak, tell, Od.: so in Mid., Hom.: but in Ionic Prose, the Mid. means to cause to be told one, i. e. to ask, like Attic ἐροῦμαι.

div1.head: ἔρως
div1.sense: love, Trag.:— love of a thing, desire for it, τινός Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—in pl. loves, amours, Eur.; in Soph., of passionate joy, cf. φρίσσω II. 3.
as prop. n. the god of love, Eros, Amor, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: Ἐρωτάριον
div1.sense: Dim. of ἔρως, a little Cupid, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρωτάω
div1.sense: to ask, τινά τι something of one, Od., Soph., etc.:—Pass. to be asked, τι Xen.
ἐρ. τι to ask about a thing, Aesch.:— Pass., τὸ ἐρωτηθέν, τὸ ἐρωτώμενον the question, Thuc., Xen.
to enquire of a person, question him, Od., Eur., etc.:—Pass. to be questioned, Eur.
= αἰτέω, to ask, i. e. to beg, solicit, NTest.

div1.head: ἐρώτημα
div1.sense: that which is asked, a question, Thuc.; τὰ ἐρ. τοῦ ξυνθήματος asking for the watchword, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐρώτησις
div1.sense: a questioning, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἐρωτικός
div1.sense: amatory, Thuc., etc.
of persons, amorous, Plat., Xen.:—adv. -κῶς, Thuc.; ἐρ. ἔχειν τινός to be eager for, Xen.

div1.head: ἐρωτίς
div1.sense: a loved one, darling, Theocr.
as adj., of love, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρωτογράφος
div1.sense: for writing of love, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρωτοπλάνος
div1.sense: beguiling love, Anth.

div1.head: ἐρωτύλος
div1.sense: Doric word, a darling, sweetheart, Theocr.
as adj., ἐρωτύλα ἀείδειν to sing love-songs, Bion.

div1.head: ἐσθέω
div1.sense: to clothe:—only used in perf. and plup. pass., ἤσθημαι, Ionic ἔσθημαι, clothed or clad, τι in a thing, ἐσθῆτα ἐσθημένος Hdt.; ῥάκεσι ἐσθημένος Hdt.; ἠσθημένοι πέπλοισι Eur.

div1.head: ἔσθημα
div1.sense: a garment, in pl., clothes, raiment, Trag., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἔσθησις
div1.sense: clothing, raiment, NTest.

div1.head: ἐσθής
div1.sense: dress, clothing, raiment, Hom., Hdt., Attic; in pl., of the clothes of several persons, Aesch.
collectively, clothes, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: ἐσθίω
div1.sense: to eat, Lat. edo (cf. ἔδω), Hom., etc.; ἐσθ. τινός to eat of a thing (partitive gen.), Xen.:—Pass., οἶκος ἐσθίεται the house is eaten up, we are eaten out of house and home, Od.
metaph., πάντας πῦρ ἐσθίει the fire devours all, Il.; ἐσθ. ἑαυτόν to vex oneself (like Homerʼs ὃν θυμὸν κατέδων), Ar.; ἐσθ. τὴν χελύνην to bite the lip, Ar.

div1.head: ἐσθλός
div1.sense: good of his kind, good, brave, Hom., esp. in Il.;—also, rich, wealthy, Hes.: noble, opp. to κακός (v. ἀγαθός 1), εἴτʼ εὐγενὴς πέφυκας εἴτʼ ἐσθλῶν κακή Soph.
of things, Hom., etc.
good, fortunate, lucky, Od., Trag.
as Subst., ἐσθλά, τά, goods, Od.:—but ἐσθλόν, good luck, Hom.
ἐσθλόν ἐστι, c. inf. it is good, expedient to do, Il.

div1.head: ἔσθʼ ὅτε
div1.sense: for ἐστὶν ὅτε, Lat. est quum, there is a time when, i. e. now and then, sometimes, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: ἔσθω
div1.sense: to eat, Hom.: to eat up, consume oneʼs substance, Hom.

div1.head: ἕσις
div1.sense: an impulse, tendency, only in Plat.: but the compd. ἔφεσις is found.
(ἕζω) a sitting. v. εἰσ-.

div1.head: ἐσκεμμένως
div1.etym: adverb from perf. pass. part. of σκέπτω
div1.sense: deliberately, Dem.

div1.head: ἑσμός
div1.sense: anything let out, Lat. scaturigo: esp. a swarm of bees or wasps, Hdt., Ar.:—of things, ἑσμοὶ γάλακτος streams of milk, Eur.

div1.head: ἑσμοτόκος
div1.sense: producing swarms of bees, Anth.

div1.head: ἑσπέρα
div1.sense: Lat. vespera, properly fem. of ἕσπερος·
(sub. ὥρα) , evening, eventide, eve, Hdt.; ἑσπέρας at eve, Plat., etc.; ἀπὸ ἑσπέρας εὐθύς just at nightfall, Thuc.; πρὸς ἑσπέρᾳ Ar.; ἐπεὶ πρὸς ἑσπέραν ἦν Xen.; ἑσπέρας γιγνομένης Plat.
(sub. χώρα) , the west, Lat. occidens, Eur.; ἡ πρὸς ἑσπέρην χώρη the country to the west, Hdt.; τὸ πρὸς ἑσπέρης Hdt.; τὰ πρὸς ἑσπέραν Thuc.

div1.head: ἑσπέριος
div1.sense: of Time, at even, at eventide, Hom.; ἑσπέριος ἦλθεν Od., etc.
of Place, western, Lat. occidentalis, Od., Eur.; τὰ ἑσπ. the western parts, Thuc.

div1.head: ἑσπερίς
div1.sense: in nom. pr., Ἐσπερίδες, αἱ, the Hesperides, daughters of Night, who dwelt in an island in the west, and guarded a garden with golden apples, Hes.

div1.head: ἕσπερος
div1.sense: of or at evening, ἕ. ἀστήρ the evening star, Il.; as Subst., without ἀστήρ, Hesperus, esp. of the planet Venus, Eur., Bion.; but, ἕσπ. θεός the god of darkness, i. e. Hades, death, Soph.
as Subst. evening (v. ἑσπέρα), ἐπὶ ἕσπερος ἦλθε Od.; ποτὶ ἕσπερον at eventide, Hes.; also heterog. pl., ποτὶ ἕσπερα Od.
western, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἔσπον
div1.etym: an aor2 used by Hom. only in 2nd pl.
div1.sense: ἔσπετε νῦν μοι, Μοῦσαι tell me now, ye Muses, Il.

div1.head: ἐσσύμενος
div1.sense: hurrying, vehement, eager, impetuous, Il.:— eager, yearning for a thing, c. gen., Hom.; also c. inf., Hom.
adv. ἐσσῠμένως, hurriedly, furiously, Hom.

div1.head: ἑσταότως
div1.sense: on oneʼs feet, Il.

div1.head: ἔστε
div1.sense: CONJUNCTION, = ἕως:
up to the time that, until, with ind. or opt., etc.; ἔστʼ ἄν, with subj., Aesch., etc.
so long as, while, with same tenses, etc.
ADVERB, even to, up to, ἔστε ἐπί, Lat. usque ad, Xen.:—also of Time, ἔστε ἐπὶ κνέφας Xen.

div1.head: ἑστίαμα
div1.sense: an entertainment, banquet, Eur.

div1.head: Ἑστία
div1.sense: Vesta, daughter of Kronos and Rhea, guardian of the hearth, Hhymn., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἑστία
div1.sense: the hearth of a house, fireside, Hom., Aesch., etc.; the shrine of the household gods, and a sanctuary for suppliants ἐφέστιοι, ἐπὶ τὴν ἑστίαν καθίζεσθαι Thuc.
the house itself, a dwelling, home (as we say fireside), Hdt., Trag.: metaph. of the last home, the grave, Soph.
a household, family, Hdt.
an altar, shrine, Trag.; γᾶς μεσόμφαλος ἑστ., of the Delphic shrine, Eur.
as nom. pr.

div1.head: ἑστίασις
div1.sense: a feasting, banqueting, entertainment, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: Ἑστιάς
div1.sense: a Vestal virgin, Plut.

div1.head: ἑστιάτωρ
div1.sense: one who gives a banquet, a host, Plat.:—at Athens, the citizen whose turn it was to give a dinner to his tribe, Dem.

div1.head: ἑστιάω
div1.sense: to receive at oneʼs hearth or in oneʼs house: to entertain, feast, regale, Hdt., Attic:—absol. to give a feast, Plat.
c. acc. cogn., γάμους ἑστιᾶν to give a marriage feast, Eur., Ar.; ἑστ. νικητήρια Xen.

Pass., with fut. mid. ἑστιάσομαι, aor1 εἱστιάθην: perf. εἱστίᾱμαι, Ionic inf. ἱστιῆσθαι:— to be a guest, be feasted, feast, Hdt., Plat.; ἑστ. ἐνύπνιον to have a visionary feast, "feast with the Barmecide," Ar.

div1.head: ἑστιόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be founded or established (by children), Eur.

div1.head: ἑστιοῦχος
div1.sense: guarding the house, a guardian, Eur.
having an altar or hearth, Trag.

div1.head: ἕστωρ
div1.sense: a peg at the end of the pole, passing through the yoke and having a ring (κρίκος) affixed, Il.

div1.head: ἐσφαλμένως
div1.sense: erringly, amiss, Anth.

div1.head: ἐσχάρα
div1.sense: the hearth, fire-place, Hom.; the sanctuary of suppliants, καθέζετο ἐπʼ ἐσχάρῃ ἐν κονίῃσιν Od.:— a pan of coals, a brasier, Ar.
πυρὸς ἐσχάραι the watch-fires of the camp, Il.
an altar for burnt-offerings, Od., Soph.

div1.head: ἐσχάριος
div1.sense: of or on the hearth, Anth.

div1.head: ἐσχαρίς
div1.sense: a pan of coals, Plut.

div1.head: ἐσχατάω
div1.sense: to be at the edge, on the border, Il.; Epic part. ἐσχατόων straying about the edge of the camp, Il.

div1.head: ἐσχατιά
div1.sense: the furthest part, edge, border, verge, Hom., Hdt., Attic: in pl. the borders, Hdt.; the extremities of the world, Hdt.

div1.head: ἔσχατος
div1.etym: prob. from ἐκ, ἐξ, as if ἔξατος,
div1.sense: of Space, as always in Hom. the furthest, uttermost, extreme, Hom., Hdt., Attic; ἔσχατοι ἄλλων, of the Thracians who were the last in the Trojan lines, Il.; ἔσχατοι ἀνδρῶν, of the Aethiopians, Od.: ἔσχατα, τά, extremities, ἐσχ. γαίης Hes.; τὰ ἔσχ. τοῦ στρατοπέδου Thuc.
the furthest in each direction.
the uppermost, Soph.
lowest, deepest, Lat. imus, ἀΐδας Theocr.
innermost, Lat. intimus, Soph.
the last, hindmost, Soph.

of Degree, the uttermost, utmost, last, worst, πόνος, κίνδυνος Plat.:—as Subst., τὸ ἔσχατον, τὰ ἔσχατα, the utmost, Hdt.; of suffering, pain, etc., Hdt., Attic; ἐπʼ ἔσχατα βαίνεις Soph.; ἔσχατʼ ἐσχάτων κακά worst of possible evils, Soph.; so in Sup., τὰ πάντων ἐσχατώτατα the extremest of all, Xen.
of Time, last, ἐς τὸ ἔσχ. to the end, Hdt., Thuc.; ἐσχάτας ὑπὲρ ῥίζας over the last scion of the race, Soph.: —neut. ἔσχατον as adv., for the last time, Soph.
adv. -τως, to the uttermost, exceedingly, Xen.:—so, ἐς τὸ ἔσχ. Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἔσωθεν
div1.sense: from within, Hdt., Attic
within, Hdt., Aesch.:—c. gen., ἔσωθεν ἄντρων Eur.

div1.head: ἔσω
div1.etym: older form of εἴσω, cf. ἐς, εἰς
div1.sense: comp., ἐσωτέρω τῆς Ἑλλάδος to the interior of Greece, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐσώτατος
div1.sense: innermost, Lat. intimus

div1.head: ἐσώτερος
div1.sense: interior, NTest. comp. of ἔσω.

div1.head: ἐτάζω
div1.sense: to examine, test, Anth.

div1.head: ἑταίρα
div1.sense: a companion, Il.; φόρμιγξ, ἣν δαιτὶ θεοὶ ποίησαν ἑταίρην Od.; πενία σφιν ἑταίρα Theocr.
opp. to a lawful wife, a concubine, a courtesan, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἑταιρεία
div1.sense: companionship, association, brotherhood, Hdt., Attic
at Athens, a political club or union for party purposes, Thuc., etc.
generally, friendly connexion, friendship, Dem.

div1.head: ἑταιρεῖος
div1.sense: of or belonging to companions, Ζεὺς ἑτ. presiding over fellowship, Hdt.; φόνος ἑτ. the murder of a comrade, Anth.

div1.head: ἑταιρέω
div1.sense: to keep company, of courtesans, Aeschin., etc.

div1.head: ἑταίρησις
div1.sense: unchastity, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἑταιρίζω
div1.sense: to be a comrade to any one, c. dat., Il.
trans. in Mid. to associate with oneself, choose for oneʼs comrade, ἤ τινά που Τρώων ἑταρίσσαιτο (Epic for ἑταιρίσαιτο) Il.

div1.head: ἑταιρικός
div1.sense: of or befitting a companion: τὸ ἑταιρικόν = ἑταιρεία I.2, Thuc.: hence the ties of party, Thuc.
of or like an ἑταίρα, meretricious Plut.:— adv. -κῶς, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἑταῖρος
div1.sense: a comrade, companion, mate, Hom.; a common way of addressing people, ὦ ʼταῖρε my good friend, Ar.; φίλʼ ἑταῖρε Theogn.; pupils or disciples were the ἑταῖροι of their masters, as those of Socrates, Xen.:—c. gen., δαιτὸς ἑταῖρε partner of my feast, Hhymn.; πόσιος καὶ βρώσιος ἑταῖροι mess mates, Theogn.
metaph. of things, ἐσθλὸς ἑταῖρος, of a fair wind, Od.; c. dat., βίος ὁ σοφοῖς ἕταρος Anth.: as adj. associate in a thing, c. gen., Plat.: Sup., ἑταιρότατος Plat.

div1.head: ἑταιρόσυνος
div1.sense: friendly, a friend, Anth.

div1.head: ἔτειος
div1.sense: yearly, from year to year, Lat. annuus, Aesch., Eur.
of one year, yearling, Xen.

div1.head: Ἐτεοβουτάδης
div1.sense: a genuine son of Butes (one of the hereditary priests of Athena Polias), Dem.

div1.head: Ἐτεόκρητες
div1.sense: true Cretans, of the old stock, Od.

div1.head: ἐτεός
div1.sense: true, real, genuine, Hom.; ἐτεὸν μαντεύεται prophesies truth, Il.; ὡς ἐτεόν περ as the truth is, Hom.
ἐτεόν as adv., in truth, really, verily, Lat. revera, Hom.; rightly, Theocr.:—Attic as an interrog., often in iron. sense, really? indeed? so? Lat. itane? Ar.

div1.head: ἑτεραλκής
div1.sense: giving strength to one of two, Δαναοῖσι μάχης ἑτεραλκέα νίκην δοῦναι to give victory in battle inclining to the side of the Danai, Il.; ἑτ. σῆμα a sign that victory was changing sides, Il.; so without μάχης, δίδου ἑτεραλκέα νίκην Hom.
act., δῆμος ἑτ. a body of men which decides the victory, Il.
inclining first to one side then to the other, doubtful, Lat. anceps, Hdt.; so in adv., ἑτεραλκέως ἀγωνίζεσθαι, ancipiti Marte pugnare, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑτερήμερος
div1.sense: on alternate days, day and day about, of the Dioscuri, Od.

div1.head: ἑτερόγλωσσος
div1.sense: of other tongue, ἐν ἑτερογλώσσοις by men of foreign tongue, NTest.

div1.head: ἑτερόγναθος
div1.sense: with one side of the mouth harder than the other, ἵππος Xen.

div1.head: ἑτεροδιδασκαλέω
div1.sense: to teach differently, to teach errors, NTest.

div1.head: ἑτερόζηλος
div1.sense: zealous for one side, leaning to one side, of the balance:—adv. -λως, unfairly, Hes.
zealous in another pursuit, Anth.

div1.head: ἑτεροζυγέω
div1.sense: to be yoked in unequal partnership with another, NTest.

div1.head: ἑτερόζυγος
div1.sense: coupled with an animal of diverse kind, Lxx.

div1.head: ἑτερόζυξ
div1.sense: yoked singly, without its yokefellow, metaph., Ion ap. Plut.

div1.head: ἑτεροῖος
div1.sense: of a different kind, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑτεροιόω
div1.sense: to make of different kind:—Pass. to be changed or altered, to alter, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑτεροκλινής
div1.sense: leaning to one side, sloping, Xen.

div1.head: ἑτερομήκης
div1.sense: with sides of uneven length, i. e. oblong, rectangular, Xen.

div1.head: ἑτερόπλοος
div1.sense: of money lent on a ship and cargo with the risk of the outward, but not of the homeward, voyage, Dem.

div1.head: ἕτερος
div1.etym: crasis for ὁ ἕτερος, Ionic οὕτερος, Doric ὥτερος; neut. θάτερον Attic, Ionic τοὔτερον· pl. ἅτεροι, θάτερα, for οἱ ἕτεροι, τὰ ἕτερα· gen. θατέρου· dat. θατέρῳ· fem. nom. ἁτέρα, dat. θἀτέρᾳ
div1.sense: Lat. alter, the other, one of two, χειρὶ ἑτέρῃ Hom., v. infr. IV; χωλὸς ἕτερον πόδα, etc.:—then of all persons or things of which there are two, Lat. alteruter, Il.; τὴν ἑτ. πύλην one of the two gates, Hdt.; δυοῖν ἀγαθοῖν τὸ ἕτ. Thuc., etc.:—in pl. one of two parties, each of which is pl., Lat. alterutri, Hom.
in double clauses, ἕτερος (in Prose ὁ ἕτερος) is repeated, ἕτερον μὲν ἔδωκε, ἕτερον δʼ ἀνένευσε Il., etc.
often repeated in the same clause, ἐξ ἑτέρων ἕτερʼ ἐστίν one depends upon the other, Od.; ἕτεροι ἑτέρων ἄρχουσι the one rule the other, Thuc.

like Lat. alter, = δεύτερος, second, ἡ μὲν . . , ἡ δʼ ἑτέρη . . , ἡ δὲ τρίτη . . , Od., etc.; ἡ ἑτέρα (sc. ἡμέρα) , the second day, i. e. day after to-morrow, Xen.:—so with Pronouns of quantity, ἕτερον τοσοῦτο another of the same size, Hdt.
put loosely for ἄλλος, Lat. alius, another, Hom., Attic
other than usual, different, Od., etc.; ἕτ. καὶ οὐχ ὁ αὐτός Dem.:—c. gen. other than, different from, ἑτέρους τῶν νῦν ὄντων Thuc.; so, ἕτερον ἢ . . , Eur.
other than should be, other than good, euphem. for κακός, as Lat. sequior for malus, ἀγαθὰ ἢ θάτερα Dem.; and alone, ἑτ. θυσία Aesch., etc.
Special Phrases:
elliptical, τῇ ἑτέρᾳ (sc. χειρί) , Epic τῇ ἑτέρῃ or ἑτέρῃφι with one hand, Il.; esp. with the left hand, Hom.
(sub. ἡμέρᾳ) on the next day, Soph., Xen.
(sub. ὁδῷ) 2n another or a different way, Soph., Ar.
Adverbial with Preps.,
ἐπὶ θάτερα to or on the other side, Thuc., etc.
κατὰ θάτερα on the one or other side, Dem.
adv.

div1.head: ἑτερότροπος
div1.sense: of different sort or fashion, Ar.
turning the other way, uncertain, Anth.

div1.head: ἑτερόφθαλμος
div1.sense: one-eyed, Lat. unoculus, luscus, Dem.

div1.head: ἑτερόφρων
div1.sense: of other mind, raving, Anth.

div1.head: ἑτερόφωνος
div1.sense: of different voice: foreign, Aesch.

div1.head: ἑτέρωθεν
div1.sense: adv.
from the other side, Il.
in pregnant sense with Verbs of rest, as if for ἑτέρωθι, on the other side, opposite, Il.

div1.head: ἑτέρωθι
div1.sense: adv.
on the other side, Od., Hdt.
= ἄλλοθι, elsewhere, Hom., etc.:—c. gen., ἑτ. τοῦ λόγου in another part of my story, Hdt.
at another time, Hom.

div1.head: ἑτέρωσε
div1.sense: adv. to the other side, Hom.:— on one side, Hom.
in pregnant sense with Verbs of Rest, as if for ἑτέρωθι, on the other side, Il., Dem.
= ἄλλοσε, elsewhither, Il., Hom.

div1.head: ἑτέρως
div1.sense: in one or the other way, Plat.
differently, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: ἐτησίαι
div1.sense: with or without ἄνεμοι, periodic winds: of the Egyptian monsoons, which blow from the North-west during the summer, Hdt.; of northerly winds, which blow in the Aegean for 40 days from the rising of the dog-star, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: ἐτήσιος
div1.sense: lasting a year, a year long, πένθος Eur., Thuc.
every year, annual, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔτης
div1.sense: the ἔται were clansmen, i. e. the kinsmen of a great house, cousins, παῖδές τε κασίγνητοί τε ἔται τε Hom.; ἔται καὶ ἀνεψιοί Il.
later, = δημότης, a townsman, neighbour, Thuc.:—in sg. a private citizen, Aesch.
for ὦ τάν or ὦ ʼτάν, v. sub τάν.

div1.head: ἐτητυμία
div1.sense: truth, Anth.

div1.head: ἐτήτυμος
div1.sense: true, Hom.; τοῦτʼ ἀγόρευσον ἐτήτυμον tell me this true, Od.; εἰ λέγεις ἐτήτυμα Soph.
of persons, truthful, Eur.
true, genuine, real, Lat. sincerus, κείνῳ δʼ οὐκέτι νόστος ἐτ. for him there remains no true, real return, Od.; ἐτ. Διὸς κόρα Aesch.; παῖς χρυσός Theocr.
as adv., in neut. ἐτήτυμον, truly, really, in truth and in deed, Hom.:—regul. adv. -μως, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἔτι
div1.sense: of Time,
of the Present, yet, as yet, still, Lat. adhuc, Il., Attic; cf. οὐκέτι.
of the Past, mostly with imperf., ἀήθεσσον γὰρ ἔτι they were yet unaccustomed, Il.; προορωμένοις ἔτι Thuc.
of the Future, yet, further, ἄλγεʼ ἔδωκεν, ἠδʼ ἔτι δώσει Il.:—also hereafter, Aesch., Soph.
of Degree, yet, still, besides, further, moreover, Lat. praeterea, insuper, Hom., etc.; ἔτι δέ and besides, nay more, Thuc.
often to strengthen a comp., ἔτι μᾶλλον yet more, Il.; μᾶλλον ἔτι Od.; ἔτι πλέον Hdt., etc.
with the posit., ἔτι ἄνω yet higher up, Xen.

div1.head: ἐτνήρυσις
div1.sense: a soup-ladle, Ar.

div1.head: ἐτνοδόνος
div1.sense: soup-stirring, τορύνη Anth.

div1.head: ἔτνος
div1.sense: a thick soup of pulse, pea-soup, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἑτοιμάζω
div1.sense: to make or get ready, prepare, provide, Il., Hdt., Attic; c. inf., κάπρον ἑτοιμασάτω ταμέειν Il.
Mid. to cause to be prepared, Il.
with perf. pass. ἡτοίμασμαι, to prepare for oneself, τἄλλα ἡτοιμάζετο made his other arrangements, Thuc.; ἡτοιμασμένοι Xen.
to prepare oneself, c. inf., Xen.

div1.head: ἑτοῖμος
div1.sense: at hand, ready, prepared, of food, Od., Hdt.; ἑτ. χρήματα ready money, money in hand, Hdt.; ἑτ. ποιεῖσθαι to make ready, Hdt.; ἐξ ἑτοίμου off-hand, forthwith, Xen.:— τὰ ἑτοῖμα what comes to hand, Thuc.
of the future, sure to come, certain, Il.:—also easy to be done, feasible, Il.
of the past, carried into effect, made good, Hom.
of persons or the will, ready, active, zealous, Lat. paratus, promptus, Hdt., Aesch.; εἴς or πρός τι Hdt., Xen.:—c. inf. ready to do, Hdt., Attic: τὸ ἕτοιμον readiness, Eur.
adv. -μως, readily, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἑτοιμότης
div1.sense: a state of preparation, readiness, Plut.

div1.head: ἑτοιμοτόμος
div1.sense: ready for cutting, Anth.

div1.head: ἔτος
div1.sense: a year, Hom., etc.; τῶν προτέρων ἐτέων in bygone years, Il.; ἑκάστου ἔτους every year, Plat.; ἀνὰ πᾶν ἔτος Anth.; ἀνὰ πέντε ἔτεα every five years, Hdt.; διʼ ἔτους πέμπτου every fifth year, Ar.; κατὰ ἔτος every year, Thuc.; ἔτος εἰς ἔτος year after year, Soph.; in acc., ἔτος τόδʼ ἤδη δέκατον now for these ten years, Soph.

div1.head: ἐτός
div1.sense: without reason, for nothing, only with negat. οὐκ ἐτός, Lat. non temere, Ar., Plat.; οὐκ ἐτὸς ἄρʼ ἦλθεν it was not for nothing then that he came? Ar.

div1.head: ἔτυμος
div1.sense: true, real, actual, ψεύσομαι ἢ ἔτυμον ἐρέω; shall I lie or speak truth? Hom.; οἵ ῥʼ ἔτυμα κραίνουσι those [dreams] have true issues, Od.; ἔτ. ἄγγελος, φήμη Aesch., Eur.
neut. ἔτυμον as adv., like ἐτεόν, truly, really, Hom.; also pl., ἔτυμα Anth.; the regular adv. -μως, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἐτωσιοεργός
div1.sense: working fruitlessly, Hes.

div1.head: ἐτώσιος
div1.sense: fruitless, useless, unprofitable, Lat. irritus, ἐτώσιον ἄχθος ἀρούρης Il., etc.

div1.head: εὐαγγελίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bring good news, announce them, Ar., Dem., etc.
to proclaim as glad tidings, τὴν βασιλείαν τοῦ Θεοῦ NTest.

absol. to preach the gospel, NTest.:—c. acc. pers. to preach the gospel to persons, NTest.;—so also in Act., NTest.:— Pass. to have the gospel preached to one, NTest.; of the gospel, to be preached, NTest.

div1.head: εὐαγγέλιον
div1.sense: the reward of good tidings, given to the messenger, Od.; in pl., εὐαγγέλια θύειν to make a thankoffering for good tidings, Xen., etc.; εὐαγγελίων θυσίαι Aeschin.; εὐαγγέλια στεφανοῦν τινα to crown one for good news, Ar.
in Christian sense, the Glad Tidings, i. e. the Gospel (Saxon gode-spell), NTest.

div1.head: εὐαγγελιστής
div1.sense: the bringer of good tidings, an evangelist, preacher of the gospel, NTest.

div1.head: εὐάγγελος
div1.sense: bringing good news, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐαγέω
div1.sense: to be pure, holy, Theocr.

div1.head: εὐαγής
div1.sense: free from pollution, guiltless, pure, undefiled, ὅσιος καὶ εὐαγής Lex_solonis; of snow, Eur.
of actions, holy, righteous, Soph., Dem.; —so Epic adv. εὐαγέως, Hhymn.
in act. sense, purificatory, Soph.

div1.head: εὐαγής2
div1.sense: moving well, nimble, Anth.

div1.head: εὐαγής3
div1.sense: bright, far-seen, conspicuous, ἕδραν εὐαγῆ στρατοῦ a seat in full view of the army, Aesch.; πύργον εὐαγῆ a lofty town, Eur.

div1.head: εὐάγητος
div1.sense: bright, of clouds, Ar.

div1.head: εὐάγκαλος
div1.sense: easy to bear in the arms, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐαγρέω
div1.sense: to have good sport, Anth.

div1.head: εὐαγρία
div1.sense: good sport, Anth.

div1.head: εὔαγρος
div1.sense: lucky in the chase, blessed with success, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: εὐαγωγία
div1.sense: good education, Aeschin.

div1.head: εὐάγωγος
div1.sense: easy to lead, easily led, ductile, ἐπί τι, εἴς τι, πρός τι Plat., Xen.

div1.head: εὐάζω
div1.sense: to cry evoe to Bacchus, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: εὐαής
div1.sense: well ventilated, fresh, airy, Hes.
act., of a wind, favourably blowing, fair, Hdt., Eur.: —metaph. favourable, Soph.

div1.head: εὔαθλος
div1.sense: happily won, Anth.

div1.head: εὐαίρετος
div1.sense: easy to be taken, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐαίων
div1.sense: happy in life, Eur.; of life itself, happy, fortunate, blessed, Aesch., Soph.; ὕπνος εὐ. blessed sleep, Soph.

div1.head: εὐαλδής
div1.sense: well-grown, luxuriant, Anth.

div1.head: εὐάλφιτος
div1.sense: of good meal, Anth.

div1.head: εὐάλωτος
div1.sense: easy to be taken or caught, Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὐάμπελος
div1.sense: with fine vines, Anth.

div1.head: εὐανάκλητος
div1.sense: easy to call out, of the names of dogs, Xen.
easy to recall, Plut.:—adv., εὐανακλήτως ἔχειν πρός τινα Plut.

div1.head: εὐανδρέω
div1.sense: to abound in men, Plut.
to be in full vigour, Plut.

div1.head: εὐανδρία
div1.sense: abundance of men, store of goodly men, Xen.; in pl., πληρωμάτων εὐανδρίαις by the crews being able-bodied men, Plut.
manhood, manliness, manly spirit, Eur.

div1.head: εὔανδρος
div1.sense: abounding in good men, Tyrtae., Eur., etc.
prosperous to men, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐάνθεμος
div1.sense: flowery, blooming, Anth.

div1.head: εὐανθέω
div1.sense: to be flowery or blooming, Luc.

div1.head: εὐανθής
