div1.sense: blooming, budding, Od.
rich in flowers, flowery, Theogn., Ar.
flowered, gay-coloured, gay, bright, Plat., Anth.
metaph. blooming, fresh, goodly, Ar.

div1.head: εὐάν
div1.sense: evan, a cry of the Bacchanals, like εὐοῖ, Eur.

div1.head: εὐάντητος
div1.sense: accessible, gracious, Anth.

div1.head: εὐάντυξ
div1.sense: finely vaulted, Anth.

div1.head: εὐαπάλλακτος
div1.sense: easy to part with, Xen.

div1.head: εὐαπάτητος
div1.sense: easy to cheat, Plat.

div1.head: εὐαπόβατος
div1.sense: easy to disembark on, convenient for landing, Thuc.

div1.head: εὐαπολόγητος
div1.sense: easy to excuse, Plut.

div1.head: εὐαποτείχιστος
div1.sense: easy to wall off, easy to blockade by circumvallation, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: εὐάρεστος
div1.sense: well-pleasing, acceptable, NTest.:—adv., εὐαρεστοτέρως διακεῖσθαί τινι to be more popular with one, Xen.

div1.head: εὐαρίθμητος
div1.sense: easy to count, i. e. few in number, Plat.

div1.head: εὔαρκτος
div1.sense: easy to govern, manageable, of a horseʼs mouth, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐάρματος
div1.sense: with beauteous car, Soph.

div1.head: εὐαρμοστία
div1.sense: easiness of temper, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: εὐάρμοστος
div1.sense: well-joined, harmonious, Eur., Plat.
of men, accommodating, Plat.

div1.head: εὔαρνος
div1.sense: rich in sheep or lambs, Anth.

div1.head: εὐάροτος
div1.sense: well-ploughed or easy to be ploughed, Anth.

div1.head: εὔαρχος
div1.sense: beginning well, making a good beginning, Anth.

div1.head: εὔασμα
div1.sense: a Bacchanalian shout, Eur.

div1.head: εὐασμός
div1.sense: a shout of revelry, Plut.

div1.head: εὔας
div1.sense: the Roman ovatio, Plut.

div1.head: εὐαστής
div1.sense: a Bacchanal, Anth.

div1.head: εὐαφήγητος
div1.sense: easy to describe, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐαφής
div1.sense: touching gently: metaph., εὐ.μετάβασις an easy, unforced transition, Luc.:— τὸ εὐαφές delicate touch, Luc.:—adv. -φῶς, Luc.

div1.head: εὐβάστακτος
div1.sense: easy to carry or move, Hdt.

div1.head: εὔβατος
div1.sense: accessible, passable, Aesch.; comp. -ώτερος, Xen.

div1.head: εὐβλέφαρος
div1.sense: with beautiful eyes, Anth.

div1.head: Εὐβοεύς
div1.sense: an Euboean, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Εὔβοια
div1.sense: Euboea, now Negropont (i. e. Egripo or Evripo, from Euripus), an island lying along the coast of Boeotia and Attica, Hom., etc.

div1.head: Εὐβοϊκός
div1.sense: Euboean, Hdt., etc.; fem. Εὐβοΐς, Hdt.; lengthd. Εὐβοιΐς, Soph.

div1.head: εὔβολος
div1.sense: throwing luckily (with the dice): adv., ἦν γὰρ εὐβόλως ἔχων he was in luck, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔβοτος
div1.sense: with good pasture, Od.
well-fed, thriving, Theocr.

div1.head: εὔβοτρυς
div1.sense: rich in grapes, Soph.

div1.head: εὐβουλία
div1.sense: good counsel, prudence, Aesch., Soph., etc.

div1.head: εὔβουλος
div1.sense: well-advised, prudent, Theogn., Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: εὔβους
div1.sense: rich in cattle, Hhymn. Αp. 54.

div1.head: ἐΰβροχος
div1.sense: well-noosed, well-knit, Anth.

div1.head: εὐγένεια
div1.sense: nobility of birth, high descent, Aesch., Eur.; εὐγένεια παίδων εὐγενεῖς παῖδες, Eur.

div1.head: εὐγένειος
div1.sense: of a lion, well-maned, Hom.; of men, well-bearded, Plat.

div1.head: εὐγενής
div1.sense: well-born, of noble race, of high descent, Lat. generosus, Trag.; εὐγενές ἐστι is a mark of nobility, Hdt.
noble-minded, generous, Soph., Plat.
of animals, high-bred, noble, generous, Theogn., Aesch., etc.; of a country, fertile, Plut.
of outward form, noble, Eur.
adv. -νῶς, nobly, bravely, Eur.

div1.head: εὖγε
div1.sense: adv. well, rightly, to confirm or approve what has been said, Ar., Plat.:—ironically, Eur., Ar.
without a Verb, good! well said! well done! bravo! Lat. euge! Ar.

div1.head: εὐγηθής
div1.sense: joyous, cheerful, Eur.

div1.head: εὔγηρυς
div1.sense: sweet-sounding, Ar.

div1.head: εὐγλαγής
div1.sense: abounding in milk:—a metapl. dat. εὔγλαγι, as if from εὖγλαξ, Anth.

div1.head: εὔγλυπτος
div1.sense: well-carved, well-engraved, Anth.

div1.head: εὐγλωσσία
div1.sense: glibness of tongue, Ar.

div1.head: εὔγλωσσος
div1.sense: good of tongue, eloquent, Aesch.: glib of tongue, voluble, Ar.
sweet sounding, Anth.
act. loosing the tongue, making eloquent, Anth.

div1.head: εὖγμα
div1.sense: like εὖχος, a boast, vaunt, Od.
like εὐχή, but always in pl. prayers, wishes, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: εὔγναμπτος
div1.sense: well-bent, Od.

div1.head: εὐγνωμονέω
div1.sense: to be fair and honest, shew good feeling, Plut.

div1.head: εὐγνωμοσύνη
div1.sense: kindness of heart, considerateness, indulgence, Aeschin.
prudence, Plut.

div1.head: εὐγνώμων
div1.sense: of good feeling, kindhearted, considerate, reasonable, indulgent, Xen., etc.
wise, prudent, thoughtful, Anth.
adv. -μόνως, indulgently, fairly, candidly, Luc.
prudently, Xen.

div1.head: εὔγνωστος
div1.sense: well-known, familiar, Soph., Eur.
easy to discern, Dem.

div1.head: εὔγομφος
div1.sense: well-nailed, well-fastened, Eur.

div1.head: εὐγονία
div1.sense: fruitfulness, Xen.

div1.head: εὔγραμμος
div1.sense: well-drawn, Luc.; τῶν ὀφρύων τὸ εὔγραμμον their fine lines, Luc.

div1.head: εὐγραφής
div1.sense: well-painted, Anth.
act. writing well, Anth.

div1.head: εὔγυρος
div1.sense: well-circling, Anth.

div1.head: εὐγωνία
div1.sense: regularity of angels, Eur.

div1.head: εὐγώνιος
div1.sense: with regular angles, Xen.

div1.head: εὐδαίδαλος
div1.sense: beautifully wrought, Anth.

div1.head: εὐδαιμονέω
div1.sense: to be prosperous, well off, happy, Hdt., Attic:— εὐδαιμονοίης, as a form of blessing, Eur.

div1.head: εὐδαιμονία
div1.sense: prosperity, good fortune, wealth, weal, happiness, Hhymn., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: εὐδαιμονίζω
div1.sense: to call or account happy, Eur., Xen., etc.; c. gen., μοίρας for his fortune, Soph.; ὑπέρ τινος Xen.; ἐπί τινι Dem.

div1.head: εὐδαιμονικός
div1.sense: conducive to happiness, Plat.; τὰ εὐδ. the constituents thereof, Xen.

div1.head: εὐδαίμων
div1.sense: blessed with a good genius; hence fortunate, happy, blest, Lat. felix, Hes., Theogn., Trag., etc.:— τὸ εὔδαιμον εὐδαιμονία, Thuc.:—adv. -μόνως, Eur., etc.
of outward prosperity, well off, wealthy, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: εὐδάκρυτος
div1.sense: tearful, lamentable, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐδάπανος
div1.sense: of much expense, liberal, Plut.

div1.head: εὐδείελος
div1.sense: very clear, distinct, far-seen, epith. of Ithaca and other islands, Od.

div1.head: εὔδειπνος
div1.sense: with goodly feasts, Eur.

div1.head: εὔδενδρος
div1.sense: well-wooded, abounding in fair trees, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: εὔδηλος
div1.sense: quite clear, manifest, Aesch., etc.: εὔδηλός ἐστι ποιῶν all may see him doing, Ar.

div1.head: εὐδιάβατος
div1.sense: easy to cross, ποταμός Xen.

div1.head: εὐδιάβολος
div1.sense: easy to misrepresent, Plat.

div1.head: εὐδίαιτος
div1.sense: living temperately, Xen.

div1.head: εὐδιάλλακτος
div1.sense: easy to reconcile, placable: adv. -τως, Plut.

div1.head: εὐδιάναξ
div1.sense: ruler of the calm, Luc.

div1.head: εὐδία
div1.sense: fair weather, Xen.
metaph. tranquillity, calm, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: εὐδιεινός
div1.sense: Plat.; ἐν εὐδιεινοῖς in sheltered spots, Xen.

div1.head: εὐδικία
div1.sense: righteous dealing, Od.

div1.head: εὐδίνητος
div1.sense: easily-turning, Anth.

div1.head: εὔδιος
div1.sense: calm, fine, clear, of weather, sea, etc., Xen., Theocr.:—neut. εὔδιον, εὔδια, as adv., Anth.:—irreg. comp. εὐδιαίτερος, Xen.

div1.head: εὔδμητος
div1.sense: well-built, Hom.

div1.head: εὐδοκέω
div1.sense: to be well pleased, ἔν τινι with a person or thing, NTest.
c. inf. to consent to do, be glad to do, NTest.

div1.head: εὐδοκία
div1.sense: satisfaction, approval, NTest.

div1.head: εὐδοκιμέω
div1.etym: the augm. is omitted in Ionic
div1.sense: to be of good repute, to be held in esteem, honoured, famous, popular, Theogn., Eur., Ar., etc.: —Εὐδ. ἔν τινι to be distinguished in a thing, Hdt., Thuc.; ἐπί τινι Plat.:— εὐδ. παρὰ τῷ βασιλέϊ to have influence with him, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐδοκίμησις
div1.sense: good repute, credit, Plat.

div1.head: εὐδόκιμος
div1.sense: in good repute, honoured, famous, glorious, Aesch., Eur.; πρός τι in a thing, Plat.

div1.head: εὐδοξέω
div1.sense: to be in good repute, to be honoured, famous, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: εὐδοξία
div1.sense: good repute, credit, honour, glory, Simon., Dem.
approval, τοῦ πλήθους Plat.
good judgment, Plat.

div1.head: εὔδοξος
div1.sense: of good repute, honoured, famous, glorious, Theogn., Thuc., etc.; νέες εὐδοξόταται ships of best repute, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐδρακής
div1.sense: sharp-sighted, Soph.

div1.head: εὔδρομος
div1.sense: running well, swift of foot, Anth.
ἐΰδρ. πόλις a city with fair race-courses, Anth.

div1.head: εὔδροσος
div1.sense: with plenteous dew, abounding in water, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: εὕδω
div1.sense: to sleep, lie down to sleep, Hom., etc.; c. acc. cogn., εὕδειν ὕπνον Od., Eur., Theocr.; also, ὕπνωι εὕδειν Soph.; βραδὺς εὕδει, i. e. sleep detains him, Soph.
of the sleep of death, Il., Soph.
metaph. to be still, be hushed, of wind, sea, etc., Il., Aesch.; of the mind, to be at ease, content, Plat., Theocr.

div1.head: εὐέανος
div1.sense: richly-robed, Mosch.

div1.head: εὔεδρος
div1.sense: with beautiful seat, on stately throne, of gods, Aesch.
of a ship, = ἐΰσσελμος, Theocr.
pass. easy to sit, ἵππος Xen.

div1.head: εὐειδής
div1.sense: well-shaped, goodly, beautiful, beauteous, Il., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: εὔειλος
div1.sense: sunny, warm, Lat. apricus, Eur.

div1.head: εὐείμων
div1.sense: well-robed, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔειρος
div1.sense: with or of good wool, fleecy, Anth.:—Attic εὔερος, Soph.

div1.head: εὐέλεγκτος
div1.sense: easy to refute: easy to test, Plat.

div1.head: εὔελπις
div1.sense: of good hope, hopeful, cheerful, sanguine, Thuc., Xen., etc.:—c. inf. fut., εὔελπις ἰσχύσειν Aesch.; εὔελπις σωθήσεσθαι in good hope to be saved, Thuc.

div1.head: εὐεξάλειπτος
div1.sense: easy to wipe out, Xen.

div1.head: εὐεξαπάτητος
div1.sense: easily deceived, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: εὐεξία
div1.sense: a good habit of body, good state of health, high health, Plat.:—generally, vigour, Plat.

div1.head: εὐέξοδος
div1.sense: easy to get out of or escape from, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐέπεια
div1.sense: beauty of language, eloquence, Plat.
kind words, Soph.

div1.head: εὐεπής
div1.sense: well-speaking, eloquent, melodious, Xen.
making eloquent, of Helicon, Anth.
pass. well-spoken, acceptable, λόγος Hdt.

div1.head: εὐεπίβατος
div1.sense: easy of attack, Luc.

div1.head: εὐεπιβούλευτος
div1.sense: exposed to treachery or stratagem, Xen.

div1.head: εὐεπίθετος
div1.sense: easy to set upon or attack, Thuc.; εὐεπίθετον τοῖς πολεμίοις easy for them to make an attack, Xen.

div1.head: εὐεπίτακτος
div1.sense: easily put in order, docile, Anth.

div1.head: εὐεργεσία
div1.sense: well-doing, Od., Theogn., etc.
good service, a good deed, kindness, bounty, benefit, Od., Hdt.; εὐ. καταθέσθαι ἔς τινα Thuc.; εὐ. ὀφείλεταί μοι Thuc., etc.

div1.head: εὐεργετέω
div1.sense: to do well, do good, Soph.
c. acc. pers. to do good services or shew kindness to one, Aesch., Eur.; εὐεργεσίαν εὐεργ. τινά to do one a kindness, Plat.:—Pass. to have a kindness done one, εὐεργεσίαν εὐεργετηθείς Eur.

div1.head: εὐεργέτημα
div1.sense: a service done, kindness, Xen.

div1.head: εὐεργέτης
div1.sense: a well-doer, benefactor, Soph.; τινί to one, Hdt., Eur.; more commonly, τινός Eur., etc.
a title of honour of such persons as had "done the state some service," εὐ. βασιλέος ἀνεγράφη was registered as the Kingʼs benefactor, Eur.; so Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὐεργετητέος
div1.sense: one must shew kindness to, τοὺς φίλους Xen.

div1.head: εὐεργής
div1.sense: well-wrought, well-made, of chariots, ships, etc., Hom.; of gold, wrought, Od.
well-done: pl. εὐεργέα εὐεργεσίαι, benefits, services, Od.

div1.head: εὐεργός
div1.sense: doing good or well, upright, Od.
pass. well-wrought, well-tilled, Theocr.
easy to work, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐερκής
div1.sense: well-fenced, well-walled, Hom., Aesch.
act. fencing well, well-closed, of doors, Od.

div1.head: εὐερνής
div1.sense: sprouting well, flourishing, Eur.

div1.head: εὐεστώ
div1.sense: well-being, tranquillity, prosperity, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: εὐετηρία
div1.sense: goodness of season, a good season (for the fruits of the earth), Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὐεύρετος
div1.sense: easy to find, χώρα εὐεύρετος a place in which it will be easy to find things, Xen.

div1.head: εὐέφοδος
div1.sense: easy to come at, assailable, accessible, of places, Xen.

div1.head: εὔζηλος
div1.sense: emulous in good: adv. -λως, Anth.

div1.head: εὔζυγος
div1.sense: of ships, well-benched, Od.

div1.head: εὔζωνος
div1.sense: well-girdled, of women, Il.
of men, girt up for exercise, dressed for walking, active, Hor.ʼs alte praecinctus, Hdt., Thuc.; of light troops, unincumbered, Lat. expeditus, Xen.
metaph. unincumbered, πενία Plut.

div1.head: εὔζωρος
div1.sense: quite pure, unmixed, of wine, Eur.; comp. -ότερος and -έστερος.

div1.head: εὐηγεσία
div1.sense: good government, Od.

div1.head: εὐήθεια
div1.sense: goodness of heart, good nature, guilelessness, simplicity, honesty, Hdt., Attic
in bad sense, simplicity, silliness, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: εὐήθης
div1.sense: good-hearted, open-hearted, simpleminded, guileless, Plat.; τὸ εὔηθες εὐήθεια, Thuc.
in bad sense, simple, silly, Hdt., Attic: —as Subst. a simpleton, Xen.
adv. -θως, Plat.:—comp. -έστερα, Plat.; Sup. -έστατα, Eur.

div1.head: εὐηθίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to play the fool, Plat.

div1.head: εὐηθικός
div1.sense: good-natured, Plat.:—adv. -κῶς, Ar.

div1.head: εὐήκης
div1.sense: well-pointed, Il.

div1.head: εὐήκοος
div1.sense: inclined to give ear, of gods, Anth.

div1.head: εὐηλάκατος
div1.sense: spinning well, Theocr.

div1.head: εὐήλατος
div1.sense: easy to drive or ride over, πεδίον εὐ. a plain fit for cavalry, Xen.

div1.head: εὐήλιος
div1.sense: well-sunned, sunny, genial, Lat. apricus, Eur., Ar.; εὐήλιον πῦρ the sunʼs heat, Eur.:—adv. -ίως, with bright sunshine, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐημερέω
div1.sense: to spend the day cheerfully, live happily from day to day, Soph.; ταῖσι Θήβαις εὐημερεῖ τὰ πρὸς σέ ʼtis fair weather for Thebes in relation to thee, Soph.
to be successful in a thing, gain oneʼs point, Aeschin.

div1.head: εὐημερία
div1.sense: fineness of the day, good weather, εὐημερίας οὔσης Xen.
good times, health and happiness, health and wealth, Eur.

div1.head: εὐήμερος
div1.sense: of a fine day, εὐ. φάος a happy day, Soph.
enjoying a lucky day, cheerful, happy, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: εὐήνεμος
div1.sense: well as to the winds, i. e.,
sheltered from the wind, calm, Eur.
open to the wind, Soph.

div1.head: εὐήνιος
div1.sense: obedient to the rein, tractable, Plat.

div1.head: εὐηνορία
div1.sense: manliness, manly virtue, Eur.

div1.head: εὐήνωρ
div1.sense: man-exalting, glorious, Od.

div1.head: εὐήρετμος
div1.sense: well fitted to the oar, Aesch.
well-rowed, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: εὐήρης
div1.sense: well-fitted, of the oar, well-poised, easy to handle, Od., Eur.

div1.head: εὐήρυτος
div1.sense: easy to draw out, Hhymn.

div1.head: εὐήτριος
div1.sense: with good thread, well-woven, Plat.
act. well-weaving, Anth.

div1.head: εὐήχητος
div1.sense: well-sounding, tuneful, Eur.: loud-sounding, Eur.

div1.head: εὐθάλασσος
div1.sense: prosperous by sea, δῶρον εὐθ. the gift of seamanship, Soph.

div1.head: εὐθαλής
div1.sense: blooming, flourishing, Mosch.

div1.head: εὐθαρσής
div1.sense: of good courage, Hhymn., Aesch., etc.
giving courage, secure, Xen.

div1.head: εὐθεράπευτος
div1.sense: easily won by kindness or attention, Xen.

div1.head: εὐθετίζω
div1.sense: to set in order, arrange well, Hes., Luc.

div1.head: εὔθετος
div1.sense: well-arranged or easily stowed, Aesch.; εὔθ. σάκος well-fitting, ready for use, Lat. habilis, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐθηγής
div1.sense: sharpening well, Anth.

div1.head: εὐθηλής
div1.sense: well-nurtured, thriving, goodly, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: εὔθηλος
div1.sense: with distended udder, Eur.

div1.head: εὐθημοσύνη
div1.sense: good management, Hes.
a habit of good order, tidiness, Xen.

div1.head: εὐθήμων
div1.sense: setting in order, c. gen., δωμάτων εὔθ. Aesch.

div1.head: εὐθηνέω
div1.sense: to thrive, flourish, prosper, Lat. florere, vigere, Hdt., Aesch., Dem.:—c. dat. to abound in a thing, Hhymn.
Pass. in same sense, οἱ Λακεδαιμόνιοι εὐθηνήθησαν Hdt.; τὴν πόλιν εὐθενεῖσθαι Dem.

div1.head: εὐθήρατος
div1.sense: easy to catch or win, Anth.

div1.head: εὔθηρος
div1.sense: lucky or successful in the chase, Eur.; εὐθ. ἄγρη successful sport, Anth.; εὔθ. κάλαμοι unerring arrows, Anth.
(θήρ) abounding in game, good for hunting, Anth.

div1.head: εὐθήσαυρος
div1.sense: well-stored, precious, Anth.

div1.head: εὔθικτος
div1.sense: touching the point, clever, Anth.

div1.head: εὐθνήσιμος
div1.sense: in or with easy death, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔθοινος
div1.sense: with rich banquet: sumptuous, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔθριγκος
div1.sense: well-coped, of high walls, Eur.

div1.head: εὖθριξ
div1.sense: with beautiful hair: in Il. always of horses, with flowing mane; of dogs, Xen.; of birds, well-plumed, Theocr.
made of good hair, of a fishing line, Anth.

div1.head: εὔθρονος
div1.sense: with beautiful throne, Hom.

div1.head: εὔθροος
div1.sense: loud-sounding, Anth.

div1.head: εὔθρυπτος
div1.sense: easily broken, crumbling, Plut.

div1.head: εὐθυβολία
div1.sense: a direct throw, Plut.

div1.head: εὐθυδικία
div1.sense: an open, direct trial, on the merits of the case, Dem.

div1.head: εὐθύδικος
div1.sense: righteous-judging, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: εὐθυεργής
div1.sense: accurately wrought, Luc.

div1.head: εὐθυθάνατος
div1.sense: quick-killing, mortal, Plut.

div1.head: εὐθυμάχης
div1.sense: fighting openly, Pind.

div1.head: εὐθυμαχία
div1.sense: a fair fight, Plut.

div1.head: εὐθυμέω
div1.sense: to be of good cheer, Eur., Anth.:— to be gracious, Theocr.
trans. to make cheerful, cheer, delight, τινά Aesch.:—Pass. to be cheerful, Xen.

div1.head: εὐθυμητέος
div1.sense: one must be cheerful, Xen.

div1.head: εὐθυμία
div1.sense: cheerfulness, tranquillity, Xen.

div1.head: εὔθυμος
div1.sense: bountiful, generous, Od.
of good cheer, cheerful, in good spirits, Xen.:—of horses, spirited, Xen.;—adv. -μως, cheerfully, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: εὔθυνα
div1.sense: a setting straight, correction, chastisement, Plat.

at Athens, an examination of accounts, audit, Ar., etc.; in pl., Ar., etc.; εὔθυναι τῆς πρεσβείας an account of oneʼs embassage, Dem.; εὐθύνας ἀπαιτεῖν to call for oneʼs accounts, Dem.; εὐθύνας διδόναι to give them in, Ar.; εὐθύνας ὀφλεῖν Lys., etc.

div1.head: εὔθυνος
div1.sense: a corrector, chastiser, judge, Aesch.
at Athens, an examiner, auditor, Plat.

div1.head: εὐθυντήριος
div1.sense: directing, ruling, Aesch.
εὐθυντηρία, ἡ, the part of a ship wherein the rudder was fixed, Eur.

div1.head: εὐθυντήρ
div1.sense: a corrector, chastiser, Theogn.

div1.head: εὐθυντής
div1.sense: a ruler, Eur.

div1.head: εὐθύνω
div1.sense: to guide straight, direct, Aesch., Ar.; εὐθ. δόρυ to steer the bark straight, Eur.; εὐθ. πλάταν Eur.; εὐθ. χερσί to manage or guide him, Soph.
metaph. to direct, govern, Trag.
to make or put straight, Plat.; εὐθ. δίκας σκολιάς to make crooked judgments straight, Solon.
at Athens, to audit the accounts (cf. εὐθύνα) of a magistrate, call him to account, Plat.
c. gen. to call to account for an offence, εὐθ. τινὰ κλοπῆς Plut.:—Pass., τῶν ἀδικημάτων εὐθύνθη Thuc.

div1.head: εὐθυπορέω
div1.sense: to go straight forward, πότμος εὐθυπορῶν (metaph. from a ship), unswerving destiny, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐθύπορος
div1.sense: going straight: metaph. straightforward, Plat.

div1.head: εὐθυρρημονέω
div1.sense: to speak in a straightforward manner, Cic.: to speak off-hand, Plut.

div1.head: εὐθυρρήμων
div1.sense: plain-spoken, Cic.

div1.head: εὔθυρσος
div1.sense: with beautiful shaft, Eur.

div1.head: εὐθύς
div1.sense: straight, direct, Thuc., etc.:— εὐθείᾳ (sc. ὁδῷ) by the straight road, Plat.; so, τὴν εὐθεῖαν Eur.
in moral sense, straightforward, open, frank, Tyrtae., Aesch., etc.; ἀπὸ τοῦ εὐθέος, ἐκ τοῦ εὐθέος openly, without reserve, Thuc.

div1.head: εὐθύς2
div1.sense: as adv., εὐθύς properly of Time, εὐθύ of Place:
εὐθύ, of Place, straight, εὐθὺ Πύλονδε straight to P., Hhymn.; εὐθὺ πρὸς τὰ λέχη Soph.; εὐθὺ ἐπὶ Βαβυλῶνος straight towards B., Xen.; so c. gen., εὐθὺ Πελλήνης Ar., etc.
εὐθύς,
of Time, straightway, forthwith, at once, Aesch., etc.; εὐθὺς ἐκ παιδίου Xen.; with a part., εὐθὺς νέοι ὄντες Thuc.; τοῦ θέρους εὐθὺς ἀρχομένου just at the beginning of summer, Thuc.
rarely, like εὐθύ, of Place, ὑπὲρ τῆς πόλεως εὐθύς just above the city, Thuc.; τὴν εὐθὺς Ἄργους ὁδόν the road leading straight to Argos, Eur.
of Manner, directly, simply, Plat.
εὐθέως, adv., is used just as the adv. εὐθύς, Soph., etc.; ἐπεὶ εὐθέως as soon as, Xen.

div1.head: εὐθύσανος
div1.sense: well-fringed, Anth.

div1.head: εὐθύφρων
div1.sense: right-minded, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐθύωρος
div1.sense: in a straight direction: in neut. εὐθύωρον as adv. = εὐθύς, Xen.

div1.head: εὐθώρηξ
div1.sense: well-mailed, Anth.

div1.head: εὐιακός
div1.sense: Bacchic, Anth.: fem. εὐιάς Anth.

div1.head: εὐίατος
div1.sense: easy to heal, Xen.

div1.head: εὐίερος
div1.sense: very holy, Lat. sacrosanctus, Anth.

div1.head: Εὔιος
div1.sense: Euios, Evius, name of Bacchus, from the cry, εὐοῖ, Soph., Eur.: Εὔιος Βάκχος, Eur.
εὔιος, ον, as adj. Bacchic, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: εὔιππος
div1.sense: of persons, well-horsed, delighting in horses, Hhymn.: Sup., Xen.
of places, famed for horses, Soph.

div1.head: εὔιστος
div1.sense: for good knowledge, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκαθαίρετος
div1.sense: easy to conquer, Thuc.

div1.head: εὐκάθεκτος
div1.sense: easy to keep under, Xen.

div1.head: εὐκαιρέω
div1.sense: to devote oneʼs leisure, εἴς τι NTest.

div1.head: εὐκαιρία
div1.sense: good season, opportunity, Plat.

div1.head: εὔκαιρος
div1.sense: well-timed, in season, seasonable, Soph.: neut. εὔκαιρον in season, Anth.:—adv. -ρως, seasonably, opportunely, -ότερον, Plat.

div1.head: εὐκάματος
div1.sense: of easy labour, easy, Eur.; εὐκ. ἔργα well-wrought works, Anth.; εὐκ. στέφανος a crown won by noble toils, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκαμπής
div1.sense: well-curved, curved, Od., Mosch., etc.
easy to bend, flexible, Plut.

div1.head: εὐκάρδιος
div1.sense: good of heart, stout-hearted, Lat. egregie cordatus, Soph., etc.; of a horse, spirited, Xen.:—adv. -ίως, with stout heart, Eur.

div1.head: εὔκαρπος
div1.sense: rich in fruit, fruitful, Hhymn., Soph.; of Demeter, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκατάλυτος
div1.sense: easy to overthrow, Xen.

div1.head: εὐκαταφρόνητος
div1.sense: easy to be despised, contemptible, despicable, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: εὐκατέργαστος
div1.sense: easy to work: of food, easy of digestion, Xen.
easy of accomplishment, Xen.
easy to subdue, Plut.

div1.head: εὐκατηγόρητος
div1.sense: easy to blame, open to accusation, Thuc.

div1.head: εὐκέατος
div1.sense: easy to cleave or split, Od.

div1.head: εὐκέλαδος
div1.sense: well-sounding, melodious, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: εὔκεντρος
div1.sense: pointed, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκέραος
div1.sense: with beautiful horns, Mosch.: —contr. εὔκερως, ων, Soph.

div1.head: εὐκηλήτειρα
div1.sense: she that lulls or soothes, Hes.

div1.head: εὔκηλος
div1.sense: free from care, at oneʼs ease, Lat. securus, Hom., Soph.; εὔκηλοι πολέμιζον were fighting undisturbed, Il.
of night, still, silent, Theocr.

div1.head: εὐκίνητος
div1.sense: easily moved, εἴς τι Anth.

div1.head: εὔκισσος
div1.sense: ivied, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκίων
div1.sense: with beautiful pillars, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: εὐκλεής
div1.sense: of good report, famous, glorious, Hom., etc.; εὐκλεέστατος βίος Eur. adv. -εῶς, Epic -ειῶς, Il.; κατθανεῖν Aesch.; Sup. εὐκλεέστατα, Xen.

div1.head: εὔκλεια
div1.sense: good repute, glory, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: εὐκλεΐζω
div1.sense: to praise, laud, Tyrtae.

div1.head: εὔκλεινος
div1.sense: much-famed, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκληρέω
div1.sense: to have a good lot, Anth.

div1.head: εὔκληρος
div1.sense: fortunate, happy, Anth.

div1.head: ἐΰκλωστος
div1.sense: well-spun, Hhymn., Anth.

div1.head: ἐϋκνήμις
div1.sense: well-equipped with greaves, well-greaved, Epic nom. and acc. pl. ἐϋκνημῖδες, -ῖδας, Hom.

div1.head: εὔκνημος
div1.sense: with beautiful legs, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκοινώνητος
div1.sense: easy to deal with, Arist.

div1.head: εὐκολία
div1.sense: contentedness, good temper, Plat., etc.
of the body, agility, facility, Plut.

div1.head: εὔκολλος
div1.sense: gluing well, sticky, Anth.

div1.head: εὔκολος
div1.sense: of persons, easily satisfied, contented with oneʼs food, Anth., Plut.
easily satisfied, contented, good-natured, peaceable, Lat. facilis, comis, Ar.; c. dat., εὔκολος πολίταις friendly to them, at peace with them, Ar.:—adv. -λως, tranquilly, calmly, Plat., Xen.
willing, agile, Anth.
in bad sense, easily led, prone, πρὸς ἀδικίαν Luc.
of things, easy, Plat.

div1.head: εὔκολπος
div1.sense: with fair bosom, Anth.
in goodly folds, of a net, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκομιδής
div1.sense: well cared for, Hdt.

div1.head: εὔκομος
div1.sense: fair-haired, Hom., Hes.: of sheep, well-fleeced, Anth.

div1.head: εὔκομπος
div1.sense: loud-sounding, Eur.

div1.head: εὔκοπος
div1.sense: with easy labour, easy, εὐκοπώτερόν ἐστι, c. inf., NTest.

div1.head: εὐκόσμητος
div1.sense: well-adorned, Hhymn.

div1.head: εὐκοσμία
div1.sense: orderly behaviour, good conduct, decency, Eur., Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὔκοσμος
div1.sense: behaving well, orderly, decorous, Solon., Attic, Thuc.; τὸ εὔκοσμον εὐκοσμία, Thuc.
well, adorned, graceful, Eur.
adv. -μως, in good order, Od.; Sup. -ότατα, Xen.
gracefully, Plut.

div1.head: εὔκραιρος
div1.sense: with fine horns, esp. of oxen, Hhymn.

div1.head: εὐκρασία
div1.sense: a good temperature, mildness, Plat.

div1.head: εὐκράς
div1.sense: = εὔκρατος, Plat.
of persons, mixing readily with others, Anth.

div1.head: εὔκρατος
div1.sense: well-mixed, temperate, Plat.

div1.head: εὔκρεκτος
div1.sense: well-struck, well-woven, of the threads of the warp, Anth.

div1.head: εὔκρηνος
div1.sense: well-watered, Anth.

div1.head: εὔκριθος
div1.sense: rich in barley, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: εὐκρινέω
div1.sense: to keep distinct, keep in order, Xen.

div1.head: εὐκρινής
div1.sense: well-separated, Xen.
well-arranged, in good order, Hdt., Xen.:— regular, steady, of winds, Hes.

div1.head: εὐκρόταλος
div1.sense: accompanied by castanets, Anth.: rattling, πλατάγη Anth.

div1.head: εὐκρότητος
div1.sense: well-hammered, well-wrought, of metal, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: εὔκρυπτος
div1.sense: easy to hide, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐκταῖος
div1.sense: of or for prayer, votive, Aesch., Ar.: devoted, Eur.:— εὐκταῖα, τά, votive offerings, vows, prayers, Aesch., Soph.
of gods, invoked by prayer, Aesch., Eur.
prayed for, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκτέανος
div1.sense: wealthy, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: εὐκτέανος2
div1.sense: with straight fibres, slender, tall, Plut.

div1.head: ἐϋκτήμων
div1.sense: wealthy, Pind.

div1.head: εὔκτητος
div1.sense: easily gotten, Anth.

div1.head: εὐκτικός
div1.sense: expressing a wish, votive, Anth.

div1.head: ἐϋκτίμενος
div1.sense: well-built, Il.; νῆσος ἐϋκτιμένη furnished with goodly buildings, Od.; ἐϋκτ. ἐν ἀλῳή on well-made threshing-floor, Il.; of a garden, well-wrought, Od.

div1.head: εὐκτός
div1.sense: wished for, ὄφρʼ εὐκτὰ γένηται that what they wish for may happen, Il.
to be wished for, εὐκτὸν ἀνθρώποις Eur.:— εὐκτόν ἐστι, c. inf., Eur., Xen.
vowed, dedicated, Anth.

div1.head: εὔκυκλος
div1.sense: well-rounded, round, of a shield, Il., Aesch.; of a chariot, well-wheeled, Aesch., Od.

div1.head: εὐκύλικος
div1.sense: suited to the wine-cup, Anth.

div1.head: εὐλάβεια
div1.sense: discretion, caution, circumspection, Theogn., Soph., etc.; εὐλάβειαν ἔχειν μή . . εὐλαβεῖσθαι μή . . , Plat.; εὐλαβείας δεῖται it requires caution, Dem.; ἐπʼ εὐλαβείᾳ by way of caution, Plat.
c. gen. caution or discretion in a thing, Soph.
reverence, piety, περὶ τὸ θεῖον Plut.: absol. godly fear, NTest.
in bad sense, over-caution, timidity, Plut.

div1.head: εὐλαβέομαι
div1.sense: to behave like the εὐλαβής, have a care, to be discreet, cautious, circumspect, to beware, Lat. cavere, foll. by μή or ὅπως μή with subj., Soph., Eur., etc.; c. inf., with or without μή, Soph., Eur.:— absol., εὐλαβήθητι Soph.; μηδὲν εὐλαβηθέντα without reserve, Dem.
c. acc. to have a care of, beware of, Aesch., Plat., etc.
to reverence, pay honour to, Plat.
to watch for, await quietly, Eur.

div1.head: εὐλαβής
div1.sense: taking hold well, holding fast: — then metaph. undertaking prudently, discreet, cautions, circumspect, Plat.
in bad sense, over-cautious, timid, Plut.:—adv. εὐλαβῶς, comp. -εστέρως, Eur.
reverent, pious, religious, devout, NTest.
pass. easy to get hold of, Luc.

div1.head: εὐλαβητέος
div1.sense: one must beware, c. inf., Plat.
one must beware of, c. acc., Plat.

div1.head: εὐλάζω
div1.etym: Old Lacon. form, prob. akin to αὖλαξ
div1.sense: to plough, Orac. ap. Thuc.

div1.head: εὐλάκα
div1.sense: a ploughshare, Orac. ap. Thuc.
div1.etym: Old Lacon. form, prob. akin to αὖλαξ

div1.head: εὔλαλος
div1.sense: sweetly-speaking, Anth.
= εὔγλωσσος II, Anth.

div1.head: εὐλάχανος
div1.sense: fruitful in herbs, Anth.

div1.head: εὐλείμων
div1.sense: with goodly meadows, Od., Hhymn.

div1.head: εὔλεκτρος
div1.sense: bringing wedded happiness, blessing marriage, Soph.

div1.head: εὐλή
div1.sense: a worm or maggot, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: εὔληπτος
div1.sense: easily taken hold of: adv. -τως so that one can easily take hold, Sup. εὐληπτότατα Xen.
easy to be taken or reduced, Thuc.:— easy to gain or obtain, Luc.

div1.head: εὔληρα
div1.sense: reins, Il.

div1.head: εὐλίμενος
div1.sense: with good harbours, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: εὐλογέω
div1.sense: to speak well of, praise, honour, Trag.; δίκαια εὐλ. τινα to praise him justly, Ar.:—Pass. to be honoured, Soph.
to bless, NTest.

div1.head: εὐλογητός
div1.sense: blessed, NTest.

div1.head: εὐλογία
div1.sense: good or fine language, Plat.: a fair speech, specious talk, NTest.
eulogy, panegyric, Pind.; blessing (as an act) or a blessing (as an effect) Pind.:— of the alms collected for poor brethren, Pind.

div1.head: εὐλόγιστος
div1.sense: rightly reckoning, thoughtful, Arist.

div1.head: εὔλογος
div1.sense: having good reason, reasonable, sensible, Aesch.; εὔλογόν ἐστι, c. inf., it is reasonable that, Ar.
reasonable, fair, Thuc., etc.: τὸ εὔλ. a fair reason, Thuc.
adv. -γως, with good reason, reasonably, Aesch., Thuc.; εὐλ. ἔχειν to be reasonable, Plat.

div1.head: εὔλογχος
div1.sense: propitious, Plut.

div1.head: εὐλοέτειρα
div1.sense: with fine baths, Anth.

div1.head: εὔλοφος
div1.sense: well-plumed, Soph.

div1.head: εὔλοχος
div1.sense: helping in childbirth, Eur.

div1.head: εὔλυρος
div1.sense: playing well on the lyre, skilled in the lyre, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: εὔλυτος
div1.sense: easy to untie or loose, Xen.; εὔλ. πρὸς λοιδορίαν easily breaking into abuse, Theophr.
metaph. easily dissolved or broken, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: εὐμάθεια
div1.sense: readiness in learning, docility, Plat., Anth.

div1.head: εὐμαθής
div1.sense: ready or quick at learning, Lat. docilis, Plat., Dem.:—adv. -θῶς, Aeschin.
pass. easy to learn or discern, intelligible, Aesch.: well-known, Soph.

div1.head: εὔμαλλος
div1.sense: of fine wool, Pind.

div1.head: εὐμάραθος
div1.sense: abounding in fennel, Anth.

div1.head: εὐμάρεια
div1.sense: easiness, ease, opportunity, τινος for doing a thing, Soph.
ease of movement, dexterity, Eur.

of condition, ease, comfort, εὐμαρείᾳ χρῆσθαι to be at ease, in comfort, Soph.; but also, εὐμαρίῃ χρᾶσθαι euphem. for alvum exonerare, to ease oneself, Hdt.; εὐμ. πρός τι provision for, protection against, Plat.

div1.head: εὐμαρής
div1.sense: easy, convenient, without trouble, Theogn.; εὐμ. χείρωμα an easy prey, Aesch.:— εὐμαρές ἐστι, c. inf., ʼtis easy, Pind., Eur.; so, ἐν εὐμαρεῖ ἐστι Eur.
adv. -ρῶς, Epic -ρέως, mildly, Theogn.
easily, Plat.

div1.head: εὔμαρις
div1.sense: an Asiatic shoe or slipper, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: εὐμεγέθης
div1.sense: of good size, very large, Ar.

div1.head: εὐμέλανος
div1.sense: well-blackened, inky, Anth.

div1.head: εὐμελής
div1.sense: musical, rhythmical, Arist.

div1.head: εὐμένεια
div1.sense: the character of the εὐμενής, goodwill, favour, grace, Hdt., Soph., etc.

div1.head: εὐμενέτης
div1.sense: a well-wisher, εὐμενέτῃσι (Epic dat. pl.) Od.

div1.head: εὐμενέω
div1.sense: to be gracious, Theocr.
c. acc. to deal kindly with, Pind.

div1.head: εὐμενής
div1.sense: well-disposed, favourable, gracious, kindly, Hhymn., Attic
of places, γῆ εὐμ. ἐναγωνίσασθαι favourable to fight in, Thuc.; of a river, kindly, bounteous, Aesch.; of a road, easy, Xen.
adv. -νῶς, Ionic -έως, Aesch., Plat., etc.:—comp. -έστερον, Eur.

div1.head: Εὐμενίδες
div1.sense: Εὐμενίδες sc. θεαί the gracious goddesses, euphem. name of the Ἐρινύες or Furies, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: εὐμενίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to propitiate, ἥρωας Xen.

div1.head: εὐμετάβλητος
div1.sense: easily changed, Arist.

div1.head: εὐμετάβολος
div1.sense: changeable, Plat., Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὐμετάδοτος
div1.sense: readily imparting, generous, NTest.

div1.head: εὐμετάπειστος
div1.sense: easy to persuade, Arist.

div1.head: εὐμεταχείριστος
div1.sense: easy to handle or manage, manageable, Plat., Xen.
easy to deal with or master, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: εὔμετρος
div1.sense: well-measured, well-calculated, Aesch.: well-proportioned, Theocr.

div1.head: εὐμήκης
div1.sense: of a good length, tall, Plat., Theocr.

div1.head: εὔμηλος
div1.sense: rich in sheep, Od., Pind.

div1.head: εὐμήρυτος
div1.sense: easy to spin out, Luc.

div1.head: εὔμητις
div1.sense: of good counsel, prudent, Anth.

div1.head: εὐμηχανία
div1.sense: inventive skill, Pind., Plut.

div1.head: εὐμήχανος
div1.sense: of persons, skilful in contriving, ingenious, inventive, Aesch., Plat.
pass., of things, skillfully contrived, ingenious, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: εὐμίμητος
div1.sense: easily imitated, Plat.

div1.head: εὐμίσητος
div1.sense: exposed to hatred, Xen.

div1.head: εὔμιτος
div1.sense: with fine threads, εὐμίτοις πλοκαῖς τὸν μίτον εὖ πλέκουσα, Eur.

div1.head: εὔμιτρος
div1.sense: with beautiful μίτρα, Mosch.

div1.head: ἐϋμμελίης
div1.sense: armed with good ashen spear, Hom.; ἐϋμμελίω Epic gen., Il.

div1.head: εὐμνημόνευτος
div1.sense: easy to remember, Dem.; comp. -ότερος, Arist.

div1.head: εὐμνήμων
div1.sense: easy to remember:—comp. adv. εὐμνημονέστερως ἔχειν to be easier to remember, Xen.

div1.head: εὔμνηστος
div1.sense: well-remembering, mindful of a thing, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: εὐμοιρία
div1.sense: happy possession of a thing, wealth or weal, Luc.

div1.head: εὔμοιρος
div1.sense: blest with possessions, Plat.

div1.head: εὐμολπέω
div1.sense: to sing well, Hhymn.

div1.head: εὔμολπος
div1.sense: sweetly singing, Anth.

div1.head: εὐμορφία
div1.sense: beauty of form, symmetry, Eur., Plat., etc.; symmetry in the σπλάγχνα, which was required for good omens, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔμορφος
div1.sense: fair of form, comely, goodly, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: εὔμουσος
div1.sense: skilled in the arts, esp. in poetry and music: hence musical, melodious, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: εὔμοχθος
div1.sense: laborious, Anth.

div1.head: εὔμυθος
div1.sense: eloquent, Anth.

div1.head: εὔμυκος
div1.sense: loud-bellowing, Anth.

div1.head: εὐνάζω
div1.sense: to lay or place in ambush, Od.
to put to bed: of animals, to lay their young in a form, Xen.: metaph. of death, to lay asleep, Soph.:—Pass. to go to bed, sleep, Od., Attic; of fowls, Od.:—of pain, εὐνασθέντος κακοῦ Soph.
intr., like Pass., to sleep, Soph.

div1.head: εὐναιετάων
div1.sense: well-situated, of cities and houses, Hom.:—so also εὐ-ναιόμενος, Il.

div1.head: εὐναῖος
div1.sense: in oneʼs bed, εὐν. λαγώς a hare in its form, Xen.
wedded, Aesch., Eur.
λύπη εὐν. making one keep oneʼs bed (cf. δεμνιοτήρης) , Eur.; εὐν. πτέρυγες brooding, of a bird on the nest, Anth.
(εὐνή II) of or for anchorage: generally, steadying, guiding a ship, of the rudder, Eur.

div1.head: εὐνάσιμος
div1.sense: good for sleeping in: εὐνάσιμα, τά, convenient sleeping places, Xen.

div1.head: εὐνατήριον
div1.sense: a sleeping-place, bed-chamber, Trag.

div1.head: εὐνάω
div1.sense: to lay or place in ambush, Od.
to lay asleep, lull to sleep, metaph., εὔνησε γόον Od.:—Pass. to lie asleep, of a dog, to lie kennelled, Soph.: of the winds, Od.

div1.head: εὔνεως
div1.sense: well furnished with ships, Max.

div1.head: εὐνῆθεν
div1.sense: from or out of bed, Od.

div1.head: εὔνημα
div1.sense: marriage, Eur.

div1.head: εὐνή
div1.sense: a bed, Hom.; εὐνῆς ἐπιβήμεναι Il.; ἐξ εὐνῆς ἀναστᾶσα Il., etc.
the bedding, as opp. to λέχος (the bedstead), Od.
εὐναὶ Νυμφάων their abode, Il.: —of animals, the lair of a deer, Hom.; the seat of a hare, Xen.; the nest of a bird, Soph.
the marriage-bed, Hom., etc.
oneʼs last bed, the grave, Aesch., Soph.
pl. εὐναί, stones used as anchors in the times of Hom. and Hes., and thrown out from the prow, while the stern was made fast to land, ἐκ δʼ εὐνὰς ἔβαλον κατὰ δὲ πρυμνήσιʼ ἔδησαν Hom.

div1.head: εὐνητήρ
div1.sense: a bedfellow, husband, Aesch.:—Doric fem. εὐνάτειρα, θεοῦ μὲν εὐν. partner of his bed, Aesch.; εὐν. Διὸς λεχέων Aesch.

div1.head: εὖνις
div1.sense: reft of, bereaved of, c. gen., Hom., Aesch.:—absol. bereaved of children, Aesch.

div1.head: εὖνις2
div1.sense: a bedfellow, wife, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἐΰννητος
div1.sense: well-spun, Hom.

div1.head: εὐνοέω
div1.sense: to be well-inclined, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: εὔνοια
div1.sense: good-will, favour, kindness, κατʼ εὔνοιαν out of kindness or good-will, Hdt.; διʼ εὐνοίας Thuc.; διʼ εὔνοιαν Plat.; εὐνοίας ἕνεκα Dem.; μετʼ or ὑπʼ εὐνοίας Dem.; ἐπʼ εὐνοίᾳ χθονός for love of fatherland, Aesch.; εὔνοιαν ἔχειν εἴς τινα ap. Dem.:—in pl. feelings of kindness, favours, Aesch.
a gift in token of good-will, esp. of presents to the Athenian commanders from the subject states, Dem.

div1.head: εὐνοϊκός
div1.sense: well-disposed, kindly, favourable, Dem.: —adv., εὐνοϊκῶς ἔχειν τινί or πρός τινα to be kindly disposed to . . , Xen.

div1.head: εὐνομέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to have good laws, to be orderly, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: εὐνομία
div1.sense: good order, order, Od., Hdt., Attic
personified by Hes. as daughter of Themis.

div1.head: εὔνομος
div1.sense: under good laws, well-ordered, Pind., Plat.

div1.head: εὔνοος
div1.sense: well-minded, well-disposed, kindly, friendly, Hdt., Attic; τινι to one, Hdt., etc.; οἱ ἐμοὶ εὖνοι my well-wishers, Xen.; τὸ εὔνουν εὔνοια, Soph., etc.—comp. εὐνούστερος Soph., Ionic εὐνοέστερος Hdt.; Sup. εὐνούστατος Ar.

div1.head: εὐνοῦχος
div1.sense: a eunuch, employed to take charge of the women and act as chamberlains (whence the name, οἱ τὴν εὐνὴν ἔχοντες) , Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: εὐνώμας
div1.sense: moving well or regularly, εὐνώμᾳ χρόνῳ by the steady march of time, Soph.

div1.head: εὔξαντος
div1.sense: well-carded, of wool, Anth.

div1.head: εὔξενος
div1.sense: kind to strangers, hospitable, ἀνδρῶνας εὐξένους δόμων the guest- chambers, Aesch.; λιμὴν εὐξεινότατος ναύταις Eur.
πόντος εὔξεινος the Euxine, now the Black sea, Hdt., etc.:—anciently called ἄξενος, the inhospitable (dictus ab antiquis Axenus ille fuit, Ovid.).

div1.head: εὔξεστος
div1.sense: well-planed, well-polished, of carpentersʼ work, Hom.

div1.head: εὔξοος
div1.sense: just like εὔξεστος, often in Hom.; σκέπαρνον ἐΰξοον an axe with polished haft, Od.

div1.head: εὐοδέω
div1.sense: to have a free course or passage, of running water, Dem.

div1.head: εὐοδία
div1.sense: a good journey, wishes for a good journey, Aesch. ap. Ar.

div1.head: εὔοδος
div1.sense: easy to pass, of mountains, Xen.; of a road, easy to travel, Xen.

div1.head: εὐοδόω
div1.sense: to help on the way, c. dat. pers., Soph.
Pass. to have a prosperous journey, NTest.:—metaph. to prosper, be successful, Hdt., NTest.

div1.head: εὔοινος
div1.sense: producing good wine, Anth.

div1.head: εὐοῖ
div1.sense: Bacchanalian exclamation, Lat. evoe, Soph., etc.

div1.head: εὔολβος
div1.sense: wealthy, prosperous, Eur.

div1.head: εὐομολόγητος
div1.sense: easy to concede, indisputable, Plat.

div1.head: εὐοπλέω
div1.sense: to be well-equipt, Anth.

div1.head: εὐοπλία
div1.sense: a good state of arms and equipments, Xen.

div1.head: εὔοπλος
div1.sense: well-armed, well-equipt, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: εὐοργησία
div1.sense: gentleness of temper, Eur.

div1.head: εὐόργητος
div1.sense: good-tempered:—adv. -τως, with good temper, Thuc.

div1.head: εὐορκέω
div1.sense: to be faithful to oneʼs oath, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: εὐορκία
div1.sense: fidelity to oneʼs oath, Pind.

div1.head: εὔορκος
div1.sense: keeping oneʼs oath, faithful to oneʼs oath, Hes., Attic
of oaths, εὔορκα ὀμνύναι to swear faithfully, Attic; εὔορκόν ἐστι it is in accordance with oneʼs oath, no breach of oath, Thuc.; εὔορκα ταῦθʼ ὑμῖν ἐστι Dem.; so in adv., τάδʼ εὐόρκως ἔχει Aesch.

div1.head: εὐόρκωμα
div1.sense: a faithful oath, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔορμος
div1.sense: with good mooring-places, Hom., Soph.
well-moored, of ships, Anth.

div1.head: εὔορνις
div1.sense: abounding in birds, Anth.

div1.head: εὐόροφος
div1.sense: well-roofed, Anth.

div1.head: εὔοσμος
div1.sense: sweet-smelling, fragrant, Theocr.

div1.head: εὐόφθαλμος
div1.sense: with beautiful eyes, Xen.: keen-eyes, Xen.

div1.head: εὔοφρυς
div1.sense: with fine eyebrows, Anth.

div1.head: εὐοχθέω
div1.sense: to be in good case, Hes.

div1.head: εὔοχθος
div1.sense: with goodly banks, fertile, Epic Hom.:— generally abundant, rich, Eur.

div1.head: εὐπαγής
div1.sense: of the body, compact, firm, strong, Xen., Theocr.

div1.head: εὐπάθεια
div1.sense: the enjoyment of good things, comfort, ease, Xen.:—esp. in pl. enjoyments, luxuries, ἐν εὐπαθίῃσι εἶναι to enjoy oneself, Hdt.; also delicacies, dainties, Xen.

div1.head: εὐπαθέω
div1.sense: to be well off, enjoy oneself, make merry, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: εὐπαθής
div1.sense: easily affected, Plut.

div1.head: εὐπαιδία
div1.sense: a goodly race of children, Eur.; εὐπαιδίαν ἔχων blest in his children, Eur.

div1.head: εὔπαις
div1.sense: blest in oneʼs children, i. e. with many or good children, Hhymn., Hdt., Attic; γόνος εὔπαις noble offspring, Eur.

div1.head: εὐπάλαμος
div1.sense: handy, skilful, ingenious, inventive, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: εὐπαράγωγος
div1.sense: easy to lead astray, Ar.

div1.head: εὐπαραίτητος
div1.sense: placable, Plut.

div1.head: εὐπαρακολούθητος
div1.sense: easy to follow, of an argument, Arist.

div1.head: εὐπαρακόμιστος
div1.sense: easy to convey, Plut.

div1.head: εὐπάραος
div1.sense: with beauteous cheeks, Pind.

div1.head: εὐπαράπειστος
div1.sense: easily led away, Xen.

div1.head: εὐπάρεδρος
div1.sense: constantly attending, τὸ εὐπ. τῷ Κυρίῳ constant waiting on the Lord, NTest.

div1.head: εὐπαρόξυντος
div1.sense: rendered irritable, Plut.

div1.head: εὐπαρόρμητος
div1.sense: easily excited, Arist.

div1.head: εὐπάρυφος
div1.sense: with fine purple border, Plut.
of persons, wearing such a garment, Lat. praetextatus, a grandee, Luc.

div1.head: εὐπατέρεια
div1.sense: daughter of a noble sire, Hom.
of places, of a noble father, Eur.

div1.head: εὐπατρίδης
div1.sense: of good or noble sire, of noble family, of persons, Soph., Eur., etc.; εὐπατρίδαι οἶκοι Eur.
at Athens in the old time, the εὐπατρίδαι formed the first class (the Nobles), the γεωμόροι the second, the δημιουργοί the third, Xen.
at Rome, the Patricians, Xen.

div1.head: εὔπατρις
div1.sense: born of a noble sire, Eur.; τίς ἂν εὔπατρις ὧδε βλάστοι; who could be born so worthy of a noble sire? Soph.; ἐλπίδων εὐπατρίδων of hopes derived from those of noble birth, Soph.

div1.head: εὐπάτωρ
div1.sense: born of a noble sire, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐπειθής
div1.sense: ready to obey, obedient, τινι Aesch., Plat.; also τινος, Plat.
act. persuasive, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔπειστος
div1.sense: easily persuaded, Arist.

div1.head: εὐπέμπελος
div1.sense: a word of uncertain meaning in Aesch., either tranquil, placable, as if it were εὐπέμφελον (cf. δυσπέμφελος) , or easy to be sent away (cf. δύσπεμπτος) .

div1.head: εὐπένθερος
div1.sense: with a good father-in-law, Theocr.

div1.head: εὔπεπλος
div1.sense: beautifully robed, Hom.

div1.head: εὔπεπτος
div1.sense: easy of digestion, Arist.

div1.head: εὐπεριάγωγος
div1.sense: easily turned round, Luc.

div1.head: εὐπερίγραφος
div1.sense: easy to sketch out, with a good outline, Luc.

div1.head: εὐπερίσπαστος
div1.sense: easy to pull away, Xen.

div1.head: εὐπερίστατος
div1.sense: easily besetting, NTest.

div1.head: εὐπέταλος
div1.sense: with beautiful leaves, Anth.

div1.head: εὐπέτεια
div1.sense: ease, διʼ εὐπετείας easily, Eur.:—pl., εὐπετείας διδόναι to give facilities, Plat.
easiness of getting or having a thing, c. gen., Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: εὐπετής
div1.sense: of the dice, falling well; metaph. favourable, Aesch.; so in adv., εὐπετῶς ἔχειν Aesch.

easy, without trouble, Lat. facilis, Hdt., Attic:—adv. εὐπετῶς, Ionic -έως, easily, Hdt., Attic; with numerals, ἑξακοσίους ἀμφορέας εὐπ. χωρέει it easily holds 600 amphorae, i. e. full 600, Hdt.:—comp. -εστέρως Hdt.
of persons, easy-tempered, accommodating, Eur.

div1.head: εὔπετρος
div1.sense: of good hard stone, Anth.

div1.head: εὐπηγής
div1.sense: well-built, stout, Od.

div1.head: εὔπηκτος
div1.sense: well-built, Hom.

div1.head: εὐπήληξ
div1.sense: with beautiful helmet, Anth.

div1.head: εὔπηνος
div1.sense: of fine texture, Eur.

div1.head: εὔπηχυς
div1.sense: with beautiful arms, Eur.

div1.head: εὐπῖδαξ
div1.sense: abounding in fountains, Anth.

div1.head: εὔπιστος
div1.sense: trustworthy, trusty, Xen.; εὔπιστα things easy to believe, Soph.
act. easily believing, credulous, Arist.

div1.head: εὐπίων
div1.sense: very fat: very rich, Anth.

div1.head: εὐπλατής
div1.sense: of a good breadth, Xen.

div1.head: ἐΰπλειος
div1.sense: well filled, Od.

div1.head: εὔπλεκτος
div1.sense: well-plaited, well-twisted, of wicker-work and ropes, Il.; of nets, Eur.

div1.head: εὔπλοια
div1.sense: a fair voyage, Il., Soph.

div1.head: εὐπλόκαμος
div1.sense: with goodly locks, fairhaired, Hom.; εὐπλ. κόμαι goodly tresses, Eur.

div1.head: εὔπλοος
div1.sense: good for sailing, εὔπλοον ὅρμον ἵκοιτο may he reach a friendly port, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐϋπλυνής
div1.sense: well-washed, well-cleansed, Od.

div1.head: εὔπλωτος
div1.sense: favourable to sailing, Anth.

div1.head: εὔπνοια
div1.sense: fragrance, Anth.

div1.head: εὔπνοος
div1.sense: breathing well, breathing a sweet smell, sweet-smelling, Mosch., Anth.
affording a free passage to the air, Lat. perflabilis, Xen.

div1.head: εὐποδία
div1.sense: goodness of foot, Xen.

div1.head: εὐποιητικός
div1.sense: beneficent, Arist.

div1.head: εὐποίητος
div1.sense: well-made, well-wrought, Od., Hes.

div1.head: εὐποιΐα
div1.sense: beneficence, Luc.

div1.head: εὐποίκιλος
div1.sense: much varied, variegated, Anth.

div1.head: εὔποκος
div1.sense: rich in wool, fleecy, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐπόλεμος
div1.sense: good at war, successful in war, Hhymn., Xen.

div1.head: εὔπομπος
div1.sense: conducting to a happy issue, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: εὐπορέω
div1.sense: to prosper, thrive, be well off, Xen.; ὅθεν ὁ πόλεμος εὐπορεῖ from which sources war is successfully maintained, Thuc.
c. gen. rei, to have plenty of, to have store of, to abound in a thing, c. gen., Xen., etc.
to find a way, find means, Thuc.: c. inf. to be able to do, Plat.
c. acc. rei, to supply, furnish, Thuc., Dem., etc.

div1.head: εὐπορία
div1.sense: an easy way of doing a thing, facility or faculty for doing, c. inf., Thuc.; absol., Xen.:—c. gen. rei, easy means of providing, Thuc., etc.
plenty, store, abundance, wealth, Xen.:— in pl. advantages, Isocr., Dem.
the solution of doubts or difficulties, Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὐπόριστος
div1.sense: easy to procure;— εὐπόριστα (sc. φάρμακα) , τά, common medicines, Plut.

div1.head: εὔπορος
div1.sense: easy to pass or travel through, Aesch.; τὰ εὔπορα open ground, Xen.; εὔπορόν ἐστι διϊέναι Thuc.
easily gotten, easily done, easy, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:— τὸ εὔπορον εὐπορία, Thuc.; εὔπορόν ἐστι it is easy, c. inf., Thuc.
going easily, ready, glib, γλῶττα Ar.
of persons, full of resources or devices, ingenious, inventive, ready, opp. to ἄπορος, Ar., Plat.
εὔπ. τινι well-provided with, rich in a thing, Thuc.:—absol. well off, wealthy, Dem.
adv. -ρως, easily, Xen.; comp. -ώτερον, Plat.
in abundance, εὐπ. ἔχειν πάντα Thuc.

div1.head: εὐποτμέω
div1.sense: to be lucky, fortunate, Plut.

div1.head: εὐποτμία
div1.sense: good fortune, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: εὔποτμος
div1.sense: happy, prosperous, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔποτος
div1.sense: easy to drink, pleasant to the taste, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔπους
div1.sense: with good feet, Xen.
of verses, with good feet, flowing, Anth.

div1.head: εὐπραγέω
div1.sense: to do well, be well off, flourish, Thuc., Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὐπραγία
div1.sense: well-doing, well-being, welfare, success, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: εὔπρακτος
div1.sense: easy to be done, Xen.

div1.head: εὐπραξία
div1.sense: = εὐπραγία, Hdt., Trag.
good conduct, Xen.

div1.head: εὔπρεμνος
div1.sense: with good stem, Anth.

div1.head: εὐπρέπεια
div1.sense: goodly appearance, dignity, comeliness, Thuc.
colourable appearance, speciousness, plausibility, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: εὐπρεπής
div1.sense: well-looking, goodly, comely, of outward appearance, Hdt., Attic; εὐπρ. ἰδεῖν fair to look on, Xen.; εἶδος εὐπρεπής Eur.
decent, seemly, fitting, becoming, Hdt., Aesch., Eur.; τελευτὴ εὐπρεπεστάτη a most glorious end, Thuc.
specious, plausible, Hdt., Thuc.; ἐκ τοῦ εὐπρεποῦς in pretence, Thuc.
adv. -πῶς, Ionic πέως, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; comp. -πέστερον, Eur.; Sup. -πέστατα, Thuc.

div1.head: εὔπρηστος
div1.sense: well-blowing, strong-blowing, Il.

div1.head: εὐπροσήγορος
div1.sense: easy of address, i. e. affable, courteous, Eur.; οὐκ εὐπρ. ἆται miseries that forbid my being spoken to, Eur.

div1.head: εὐπρόσιτος
div1.sense: easy of access, of places, Luc.

div1.head: εὐπρόσοδος
div1.sense: of persons, accessible, affable, Lat. qui faciles aditus habet, Thuc., Xen.
of places, easily accessible, Xen.

div1.head: εὐπρόσοιστος
div1.sense: easy of approach: generally, easy, Eur.

div1.head: εὐπροσωπέω
div1.sense: to make a fair show, NTest.

div1.head: εὐπροσωποκοίτης
div1.sense: lying so as to present a fair face, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐπρόσωπος
div1.sense: fair of face, Ar., Xen.: with glad countenance, Soph.
metaph. fair in outward show, specious, Hdt., Eur., etc.

div1.head: εὐπροφάσιστος
div1.sense: with good pretext, plausible, Thuc.

div1.head: εὔπρυμνος
div1.sense: with goodly stern, Il., Eur.

div1.head: εὔπρῳρος
div1.sense: with goodly prow, Eur.

div1.head: εὔπτερος
div1.sense: well-winged, well-plumed, Soph., Eur.; metaph., of high-plumed dames, Ar.

div1.head: εὔπτορθος
div1.sense: finely branching, of horns, Anth.

div1.head: εὔπυργος
div1.sense: well-towered, of fortified towns, Il.

div1.head: εὖ
div1.sense: well, Lat. bene, opp. to κακῶς, Hom., etc.; with another adv., εὖ καὶ ἐπισταμένως well and workmanlike, Hom.; so, εὖ κατὰ κόσμον well and in order, Il.:—also, luckily, happily, well off, Od.:—in Prose, εὖ ἔχειν to be well off, Attic;c. gen., εὖ ἥκειν τοῦ βίου to be well off for livelihood, Hdt.
εὖ γε, oft. in answers, v. εὖγε.
with Adjectives or Adverbs, to add to their force, εὖ πάντες, like μάλα πάντες, Od.; εὖ μάλα Od.; εὖ πάνυ Ar.; εὖ σαφῶς Aesch.
as Subst., τὸ εὖ the right, the good cause, τὸ δʼ εὖ νικάτω Aesch.
as the Predicate of a propos., τί τῶνδʼ εὖ; which of these things is well? Aesch.; εὖ εἴη may it be well, Aesch.

in Compos., it has all the senses of the adv., but commonly implies greatness, abundance, prosperity, easiness, opp. to δυσ-. (Like α- privat., Lat. in-, δυσ-, it is properly compounded with Nouns only, Verbs beginning with εὖ being derived from a compd. Noun, as, εὐπαθέω from εὐπαθής. εὐ-δοκέω is an exception.)

div1.head: εὐπώγων
div1.sense: well-bearded, Anth.

div1.head: εὔπωλος
div1.sense: abounding in foals or horses, Il.: breeding noble horses, Soph.

div1.head: εὐράξ
div1.sense: on one side, sideways, Il.
εὐρὰξ πατάξ, an exclamation to frighten away birds, Ar.

div1.head: εὕρεσις
div1.sense: a finding, discovery, Plat.

div1.head: εὑρετέος
div1.sense: to be discovered, found out, Thuc.

div1.head: εὑρετής
div1.sense: an inventor, discoverer, Plat.

div1.head: εὑρετικός
div1.sense: inventive, ingenious, Plat.

div1.head: εὑρετός
div1.sense: discoverable, Xen.

div1.head: εὕρημα
div1.sense: an invention, discovery, Eur., Ar., etc.
c. gen. an invention, for or against a thing, a remedy, Eur., Dem.
that which is found unexpectedly, i. e., much like Ἕρμαιον, a piece of good luck, godsend, windfall, prize, Hdt., Eur., etc.
of a child, a foundling, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: εὑρησιεπής
div1.sense: inventive of words, fluent, Pind.: wordy, sophistical, Ar.

div1.head: εὔρινος2
div1.sense: of good leather, Anth.

div1.head: Εὐριπίδειος
div1.sense: of or like Euripides, Plat.

div1.head: Εὐριπίδιον
div1.sense: little Euripides, term of endearment, Ar.

div1.head: εὔριπος
div1.sense: a place where the flux and reflux is strong, esp. the strait which separates Euboea from Boeotia, where the current was said to change seven times a day, Xen.:—proverb of an unstable man, Aeschin.
generally, a canal, ditch, Anth.

div1.head: εὑρίσκω
div1.sense: to find, Hom., etc.:—c. part. to find that, Hdt.; and in Pass., ἢν εὑρεθῆις δίκαιος ὤν Soph.
c. inf., εὕρισκε πρῆγμά οἱ εἶναι found that the thing for him was, Hdt.
to find out, discover, Hom., etc.; cf. εὕρημα II:—so in Mid. to find out for oneself, Od.
to devise, invent, Aesch., etc.:—Mid., τὰ δʼ ἔργα τοὺς λόγους εὑρίσκεται deeds make themselves words, i. e. speak for themselves, Soph.
to find, get, gain, procure, Pind., Soph., etc.:—Mid. to get for oneself, bring on oneself, κακὸν εὕρετο Od.; αὐτὸς εὑρόμην πόνους Aesch.
of merchandise, to find a purchaser, to fetch, earn, πολλὸν χρυσίον εὑροῦσα having fetched a large sum, Hdt.; ἀποδίδοται τοῦ εὑρόντος sells for what it will fetch, Xen.

div1.head: εὔρις
div1.sense: with a good nose, i. e. keen-scented, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: εὐροέω
div1.sense: to flow well or abundantly; metaph. to go on well, be favourable, Eur.
to be fluent, speak successfully, Plut.

div1.head: εὔροια
div1.sense: a good flow, free passage, Plat.
fluency, Plat.
successful progress, Plat.

div1.head: εὐροίζητος
div1.sense: loud-whizzing, Anth.

div1.head: εὐροκλύδων
div1.sense: in Act. Ap., probably a storm from the East; but the prob. reading is εὐρ-ακύλων, Euro-aquilo, a N. E. wind.

div1.head: εὔροπος
div1.sense: easily inclining, easy-sliding, Anth.

div1.head: Εὖρος
div1.sense: the East wind, or more exactly E. S. E., Lat. Eurus, Il. (Probably akin to ἠώς, ἕως, the morning-wind, as Ζέφυρος is to ζόφος, the evening-wind.)

div1.head: εὖρος
div1.sense: breadth, width, absol., εὖρος in breadth, Od., Hdt., etc.; so, τὸ εὖρος Xen.; εἰς εὖρος Eur.

div1.head: ἐϋρραφής
div1.sense: well-stitched, Od.

div1.head: ἐϋρρεής
div1.sense: fair-flowing, Epic gen. ἐϋρρεῖος ποταμοῖο, contr. for ἐϋρρεέος, Il.

div1.head: ἐΰρρηνος
div1.sense: of a good sheep, Anth.

div1.head: εὔροος
div1.note: Ep. ἐΰρ-ροος, ον, contr. εὔρους, ουν.
div1.sense: flowing well or plentifully, fair-flowing, Il., Soph., Eur.
of words, flowing, fluent, glib, Eur.

div1.head: εὐρυάγυια
div1.etym: fem. adj. used only in nom. and acc.
div1.sense: with wide streets, in epith. of great cities, Hom.

div1.head: εὐρύαλος
div1.sense: with wide threshing-floor, generally, broad, Anth.

div1.head: εὐρυθμία
div1.sense: rhythmical order or movement, Plat., etc.

div1.head: εὔρυθμος
div1.sense: rhythmical, of musical time or cadence, Ar., etc.
well-proportioned, Xen.; of armour, fitting well, Xen.

div1.head: εὐρυκρείων
div1.sense: wide-ruling, of Agamemnon, Hom.

div1.head: εὐρυλείμων
div1.sense: with broad meadows, Pind.

div1.head: εὐρυμέτωπος
div1.sense: broad-fronted, of oxen, Hom.

div1.head: εὐρύνω
div1.sense: to broaden, εὐρῦναι ἀγῶνα to clear the arena (for dancing), Od.; τὸ μέσον εὐρύνειν to leave a wide space in the middle, Hdt.
metaph. to extend, Anth.:—Pass. to be spread abroad, Luc.

div1.head: εὐρύνωτος
div1.sense: broad-backed, Soph.

div1.head: εὐρυόδεια
div1.sense: fem. adj. with broad, open ways, only used in gen. fem., χθονὸς εὐρυοδείης Hom.

div1.head: εὐρύοπα
div1.sense: the far-seeing, of Zeus, εὐρύοπα Ζεύς Hom.; also in voc., εὐρύοπα Ζεῦ Il.;—in Il. there is also an acc. (as if from a nom. εὐρύοψ) εὐρύοπα Ζῆνα.

div1.head: εὐρύπεδος
div1.sense: with broad surface, Anth.

div1.head: εὐρύπορος
div1.sense: with broad ways, of the sea, where all may roam at will, Hom., etc.

div1.head: εὐρυπρωκτία
div1.sense: lewdness, Ar.

div1.head: εὐρύπρωκτος
div1.sense: lewd, filthy, Ar.

div1.head: εὐρυπυλής
div1.sense: with broad gates, Hom.

div1.head: εὐρυρέεθρος
div1.sense: with broad channel, broadflowing, Il.

div1.head: εὐρυρέων
div1.sense: broad-flowing, Il. —there is no such verb as εὐρυρέω, v. εὖ fin.

div1.head: εὐρυσάκης
div1.sense: with broad shield, name of Ajaxʼ son, Soph.

div1.head: εὐρυσθενής
div1.sense: of far-extended might, mighty, Hom., Pind.

div1.head: εὐρύσορος
div1.sense: with wide bier or tomb, Anth.

div1.head: εὐρύς
div1.sense: wide, broad, Hom., etc.
far-reaching, far-spread, κλέος εὐρύ Od.; ἐλπίδες Anth.
as adv. the neut. εὐρύ is mostly used, Il., etc.

div1.head: εὐρύστερνος
div1.sense: broad-breasted, Hes.

div1.head: εὐρύστομος
div1.sense: wide-mouthed, Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὐρύτιμος
div1.sense: wide, far-honoured, Pind.

div1.head: εὐρυφαρέτρης
div1.sense: with wide quiver, Pind.

div1.head: εὐρυφυής
div1.sense: broad-growing, of the manner in which the grains of barley are set on the stalk, Od.

div1.head: εὐρυχαδής
div1.sense: wide-mouthed, of cups, Anth.

div1.head: εὐρυχαίτης
div1.sense: with wide-streaming hair, Pind.

div1.head: εὐρύχορος
div1.sense: with broad places, spacious, of cities, Hom., etc.: cf. καλλίχορος.

div1.head: εὐρυχωρία
div1.sense: open space, free room, Hdt., Dem.
of an open field for battle, Xen.; ἐν εὐρυχωρίῃ ναυμαχέειν to fight with plenty of sea-room, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐρύχωρος
div1.sense: roomy, wide, Arist.

div1.head: εὐρώγης
div1.sense: abounding in grapes, Anth.

div1.head: εὐρώεις
div1.sense: mouldy, dank, οἰκία εὐρώεντα (Virgilʼs loca senta situ), of the world below, Hom.; τάφον εὐρώεντα Soph.

div1.head: Εὐρώπη
div1.sense: Europa, Europe, as a geograph. name, first in the Hhymn. to Apollo.

div1.head: εὐρώς
div1.sense: mould, dank decay, Lat. situs, squalor, Theogn., Eur., etc.

div1.head: εὐρωστία
div1.sense: stoutness, strength, Plut.

div1.head: εὔρωστος
div1.sense: stout, strong, Xen. adv. -τως, Xen.

div1.head: εὐρωτιάω
div1.sense: to be or become mouldy, βίος εὐρωτιῶν the life of the unwashed, Ar.

div1.head: εὔσαρκος
div1.sense: fleshy, in good case, plump, Xen.

div1.head: εὐσέβεια
div1.sense: reverence towards the gods, piety, religion, Trag.; εὐσ. Ζηνός towards him, Soph.; πρὸς εὐσέβειαν εὐσεβῶς, Soph.:—also, like Lat. pietas, reverence towards parents, filial respect, Plat.
credit or character for piety, Soph.

div1.head: εὐσεβέω
div1.sense: to live or act piously and religiously, Theogn., Soph., etc.; εἴς τινα towards one, Soph.; εὐσ. τὰ πρὸς θεούς in matters that respect the gods, Soph.:—also, εὐσ. θεούς to reverence Them, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐσεβής
div1.sense: Lat. pius, pious, religious, Theogn., Hdt., Attic; εὐσεβὴς χεῖρα righteous in act, Aesch.
of acts, things, etc., holy, hallowed, held sacred, Aesch., Eur.:— εὐσεβές ἐστι, c. inf., Anth.; so, ἐν εὐσεβεῖ ἐστι Eur.:— τὸ εὐσ. εὐσέβεια, Soph., etc.
adv. εὐσεβέως, Attic -βῶς, Pind., etc.; εὐσεβῶς ἔχει, for εὐσεβές ἐστι, Soph.:—comp. -έστερον, Xen.: Sup. -έστατα, Isocr.

div1.head: εὔσελμος
div1.sense: well-benched, with good banks of oars, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: εὔσεπτος
div1.sense: much reverenced, holy, Soph.

div1.head: εὔσημος
div1.sense: of good signs or omens, Eur.
easily known by signs, clear to be seen, Aesch.
clear to understand, distinct, Soph.

div1.head: εὐσθενέω
div1.sense: to be strong, healthy, Eur.

div1.head: εὐσθενής
div1.sense: stout, lively, Anth.

div1.head: εὐσίπυος
div1.sense: with full bread-basket, Anth.

div1.head: εὐσκάνδιξ
div1.sense: abounding in chervil, Anth.

div1.head: εὔσκαρθμος
div1.sense: swift-springing, bounding, Il.

div1.head: εὐσκέπαστος
div1.sense: well-protected, Thuc.

div1.head: εὐσκευέω
div1.sense: to be well equipt, Soph.

div1.head: εὐσκίαστος
div1.sense: well-shaded, shadowy, Soph.

div1.head: εὔσκοπος
div1.sense: sharp-seeing, keen-sighted, watchful, Hom.
far-seen or commanding a wide view, Xen.
(σκοπός) shooting well, of unerring aim, Orac. ap. Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: εὔσοια
div1.sense: happiness, prosperity, Soph.

div1.head: εὔσοος
div1.sense: safe and well, happy, Theocr.

div1.head: εὐσπειρής
div1.sense: well-turned, wreathing, winding, Anth.

div1.head: εὐσπλαγχνία
div1.sense: good heart, firmness, Eur.

div1.head: εὔσπλαγχνος
div1.sense: with healthy bowels, Medic.
metaph. compassionate, NTest.

div1.head: εὔσπορος
div1.sense: well-sown, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: ἐΰς
div1.etym: Epic neut. ἠΰ (εὖ being used only as adv.)
div1.sense: good, brave, noble, Hom.:—Epic gen. pl. ἐάων, of good things, good fortune, Hom.

div1.head: εὐστάθεια
div1.sense: stability: good health, vigour, Anth.

div1.head: εὐσταθέω
div1.sense: to be steady, favourable, Eur.:— to be calm, tranquil, of the sea, Luc.

div1.head: εὐσταθής
div1.sense: well-based, well-built, Hom.

div1.head: εὐστάλεια
div1.sense: light equipment, Plut.

div1.head: εὐσταλής
div1.sense: well-equipt, Aesch.; of troops, light-armed, Lat. expeditus, Thuc., Xen.
well-conducted, favourable, Soph.
well-packed, compact, Plut.
well-behaved, mannerly, Plat.: —in dress, neat, trim, Luc.

div1.head: εὔσταχυς
div1.sense: rich in corn, Anth.: metaph. blooming, fruitful, Anth.

div1.head: εὐστέφανος
div1.sense: well-crowned or well-girdled, Hom., Hes.
crowned with walls and towers, Od., Pind.

div1.head: εὐστιβής
div1.sense: well-trodden, Anth.

div1.head: εὐστόμαχος
div1.sense: with good stomach: adv., -χως, Anth.

div1.head: εὐστομέω
div1.sense: to sing sweetly, Soph.
generally, = εὐφημέω, to refrain from speech, Aesch., Ar.

div1.head: εὔστομος
div1.sense: with mouth of good size, of dogs, Xen.
speaking well, eloquent, Anth.; of the cup, making eloquent, Anth.
like εὔφημος, avoiding words of ill omen, περὶ τούτων εὔστομα κείσθω on these things let me keep a religious silence, Hdt.; εὔστομʼ ἔχε peace, be still! Soph.

div1.head: εὐστόρθυγξ
div1.sense: from a good trunk, Anth.

div1.head: εὔστοος
div1.sense: with goodly colonnades, Anth.

div1.head: εὐστοχία
div1.sense: skill in shooting at a mark, good aim, Eur.; χερὸς εὐστ., periphr. for a bow, Eur.
metaph. quickness in guessing, sagacity, Arist.

div1.head: εὔστοχος
div1.sense: well-aimed, Eur., Xen.
aiming well, Xen.:—adv., εὐστόχως βάλλειν Xen.
metaph. guessing well, sagacious, Arist.

div1.head: εὕστρα
div1.sense: the place for singeing slaughtered swine, Ar.

div1.head: εὔστρεπτος
div1.sense: well-twisted, of ropes, Od.
well-plied, nimble, πόδες Anth.

div1.head: ἐϋστρεφής
div1.sense: well-twisted, of cords, Hom.

div1.head: εὐστροφάλιγξ
div1.sense: curly, of hair, Anth.

div1.head: εὔστροφος
div1.sense: well-twisted, Il.
easily turning, active, nimble, Eur.

div1.head: εὔστρωτος
div1.sense: well spread with clothes, Hhymn.

div1.head: εὔστυλος
div1.sense: with goodly pillars, Eur.

div1.head: εὐσύμβολος
div1.sense: easy to divine or understand (cf. συμβάλλω III), Aesch.
easy to deal with, honest, upright, Xen.
(σύμβολον) affording a good omen, auspicious, Plut.

div1.head: εὐσυνεσία
div1.sense: shrewdness, Arist.

div1.head: εὐσύνετος
div1.sense: quick of apprehension, Arist.:—adv. -τως, with intelligence, comp. -τώτερον, Thuc.
easily understood, Eur.

div1.head: εὐσύνθετος
div1.sense: well-compounded, Arist.

div1.head: εὐσύνοπτος
div1.sense: easily taken in at a glance, seen at once, Aeschin., etc.

div1.head: εὔσφυρος
div1.sense: with beautiful ankles, Hes., Eur.

div1.head: εὔσχημος
div1.sense: adv. -μως, with decency, Eur.

div1.head: εὐσχημοσύνη
div1.sense: gracefulness, decorum, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: εὐσχήμων
div1.sense: elegant in figure, mien and bearing, graceful, Plat.; comp. -έστερος; Sup. -έστατος, Plat., Xen.
in bad sense, with an outside show of goodness, specious, Eur.
of things, decent, becoming, Eur., etc.; τὸ εὔσχημον, Lat. decorum, Plat.:—adv. -μόνως, with grace and dignity, like a gentleman, Ar., Xen.
noble, honourable, in rank, NTest.

div1.head: εὔσχιστος
div1.sense: easily split, Anth.

div1.head: εὐσωματέω
div1.sense: to be well-grown, to be strong and lusty, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: εὔσωτρος
div1.sense: with good felloes (σῶτρα) , i. e. with good wheels, Hes.

div1.head: εὐτακής
div1.sense: easy to soften by heat, Luc.

div1.head: εὐτακτέω
div1.sense: to be orderly, behave well, Thuc., Xen., etc.: of soldiers, to obey discipline, Xen.

div1.head: εὔτακτος
div1.sense: well-ordered, orderly, Ar.
of soldiers, orderly, well-disciplined, Ar., Thuc., etc.
adv. -τως, in order, Aesch., Ar.: comp. -ότερον Dem., -τέρως Xen.

div1.head: εὐταξία
div1.sense: good arrangement, good condition, Xen.
good order, discipline, Thuc.

div1.head: εὔταρσος
div1.sense: delicate-footed, Anth.

div1.head: εὐτείχεος
div1.sense: well-walled, Il.

div1.head: εὐτειχής
div1.etym: in Il. the acc. is εὐτείχεα, not εὐτειχέα.

div1.head: εὐτεκνία
div1.sense: the blessing of children, a breed of goodly children, Eur.

div1.head: εὔτεκνος
div1.sense: blest with children, Eur., etc.; εὔτ. χρησμός an oracle that gives promise of fair children, Eur.; εὔτ. ξυνωρίς a pair of fair children, Eur.: —Sup. -ώτατος Eur.

div1.head: εὐτέλεια
div1.sense: cheapness, Hdt.; εἰς εὐτέλειαν cheaply, i. e. vilely, Ar.
thrift, economy, ἐπʼ εὐτελείᾳ economically, Ar.; μετʼ εὐτελείας Thuc.; εἰς εὐτ. συντέμνειν to cut down to an economical standard, Thuc.

div1.head: εὐτελής
div1.sense: easily paid for, cheap, Hdt., Plat., etc.; εὐτελέστερα δὲ τὰ δεινά the danger would be more cheaply met, Thuc.:—adv. -λῶς, at a cheap rate, Xen.
mean, paltry, worthless, Aesch.; εὐτελεστέρα ἄσκησις paltry, requiring no exertion, Xen.
thrifty, frugal, Xen.

div1.head: εὖτε
div1.sense: relat. adv.:
of Time, poet. for ὅτε, when, at the time when:
with Opt., whenever, referring to instances in past time, Hes., Aesch.
with Subj., εὖτʼ ἄν, like ὅταν, whenever, so often as, Od.
Causal, since, seeing that, Soph.
as adv. of Comparison, for ἠΰτε, as, even as, twice in Hom.

div1.head: εὐτερπής
div1.sense: delightful, Pind., Anth.

div1.head: εὐτέχνητος
div1.sense: artificially wrought, Anth.

div1.head: εὐτεχνία
div1.sense: skill in art, Luc., Anth.

div1.head: εὔτεχνος
div1.sense: ingenious, Anth.

div1.head: εὐτλήμων
div1.sense: much-enduring, steadfast, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: εὔτμητος
div1.sense: well-cut, of leatherwork, Il.

div1.head: εὐτοκία
div1.sense: happy child-birth, Anth.

div1.head: εὔτοκος
div1.sense: bringing forth easily, Arist.

div1.head: εὐτολμία
div1.sense: courage, boldness, Eur.

div1.head: εὔτολμος
div1.sense: brave-spirited, courageous, Aesch., Xen. adv. -μως, Tyrtae., Aesch.

div1.head: εὔτονος
div1.sense: well-strung, vigorous, Plat.:—adv. -νως, vigorously, Ar.

div1.head: εὔτορνος
div1.sense: well-turned, rounded, circular, Eur.

div1.head: εὐτράπεζος
div1.sense: hospitable, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐτραπελία
div1.sense: wit, liveliness, Lat. urbanitas, Arist., Plut.
in bad sense, jesting, ribaldry, NTest.

div1.head: εὐτράπελος
div1.sense: easily turning or changing, λόγος εὐτρ. a dexterous, ready plea, Ar.:—adv. -λως, dexterously, without awkwardness, Thuc.
ready with an answer, witty, Lat. lepidus, Arist.
in bad sense, jesting, ribald, Isocr.
tricky, dishonest, Pind.

div1.head: εὐτραφής
div1.sense: well-fed, well-grown, thriving, fat, Eur., etc.
act. nourishing, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐτρεπής
div1.sense: readily turning: generally, ready, Eur.; εὐτρεπὲς ποιεῖσθαί τι Eur.:—adv., εὐτρεπῶς ἔχειν to be in a state of preparation, Dem.

div1.head: εὐτρεπίζω
div1.sense: to make ready, get ready, ξίφος Aesch., Eur., etc.; εὐτρ. τὰ τείχη to restore them, Xen.:—Pass. to be made ready, Eur.:—Mid. to get ready for oneself, or something of oneʼs own, Thuc.
to win over, conciliate, τινά τινι Xen.; so in Mid., Xen.; in perf. pass., ἅπαντας ηὐτρέπισται Dem.

div1.head: εὔτρεπτος
div1.sense: easily changing, Plut.

div1.head: εὐτρεφής
div1.sense: well-fed, Od., Eur.

div1.head: εὔτρητος
div1.sense: well-pierced, of ears for earrings, Il.: porous, Anth.

div1.head: εὐτρίαινα
div1.sense: with goodly trident, Pind.

div1.head: εὔτροπος
div1.sense: versatile, Arist.

div1.head: εὐτροφία
div1.sense: good nurture, thriving condition, Plat.

div1.head: εὐτρόχαλος
div1.sense: running well, quick-moving, Anth.
well-rounded, Hes.

div1.head: εὔτροχος
div1.sense: well-wheeled, Hom., Eur.
quick-running, running easily, of a running cord, Xen.; εὔτροχος γλῶσσα a ready, glib tongue, Eur.
well-rounded, round, Anth.

div1.head: εὐτυκάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make ready, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔτυκος
div1.sense: ready, Aesch., Theocr.

div1.head: εὔτυκτος
div1.sense: well-made, well-wrought, Hom.
ready, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐτυχέω
div1.sense: to be well off, successful, prosperous, Hdt., etc.; c. part. to succeed in doing, Eur., etc.:— εὐτύχει, like Lat. vale, at the close of letters, etc.; so, ἀλλʼ εὐτυχοίης Trag.:—Pass., ἱκανὰ τοῖς πολεμίοις εὐτύχηται (impers.) they have had success enough, Thuc.
of things, to turn out well, prosper, Aesch., Soph., etc.

div1.head: εὐτύχημα
div1.sense: a piece of good luck, a happy issue, a success, Eur., Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὐτυχής
div1.sense: well off, successful, lucky, fortunate, prosperous, Hdt., Attic; εὐτ. ἱκέσθαι τινί to come with blessings to him, Soph.:— τὸ εὐτυχές, εὐτυχία, Thuc.
adv. -χῶς, Pind., Trag., etc.; Ionic -χέως, Hdt.: comp. -έστερον, Eur., etc.; Sup. -έστατα, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐτυχία
div1.sense: good luck, success, prosperity, Hdt., Trag., etc.; εὐτυχίᾳ χρῆσθαι Plat.:—in pl. successes, Thuc.

div1.head: εὔυδρος
div1.sense: well-watered, abounding in water, Pind., Hdt.
of a river, with beautiful water, Eur.

div1.head: εὔυμνος
div1.sense: celebrated in hymns, Hhymn.

div1.head: εὐυπέρβλητος
div1.sense: easily overcome, Arist.

div1.head: εὐυφής
div1.sense: well-woven, Anth.

div1.head: εὐφαρέτρης
div1.sense: with beautiful quiver, Soph.

div1.head: εὐφεγγής
div1.sense: bright, brilliant, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐφημέω
div1.sense: to use words of good omen, opp. to δυσφημέω:
to avoid all unlucky words, Horaceʼs male ominatis parcere verbis: hence, to keep a religious silence, Il., Hdt., etc.; Imperat., εὐφήμει, εὐφημεῖτε hush! be still! Lat. favete linguis, Ar., Plat.
to shout in praise or honour of any one, or in triumph, Aesch., Ar.
c. acc. to honour by praise, speak well of, Xen.
to sound triumphantly, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐφημία
div1.sense: the use of words of good omen, opp. to δυσφημία:
abstinence from inauspicious language, religious silence, Trag.; εὐφημίαν ἴσχε = εὐφήμει, Soph.; εὐφημία ʼστω, a proclamation of silence before a prayer, Ar.
div1.etym: :dnum [II.] in positive sense, auspiciousness, fairness, Aeschin.:—esp. a fair name for a bad thing, euphemism, Aeschin.
div1.sense: prayer and praise, worship, honour, Eur.; in pl. songs of praise, lauds, Pind.

div1.head: εὔφημος
div1.sense: uttering sounds of good omen, or abstaining from inauspicious words, i. e. religiously silent, opp. to δύσφημος, Aesch., etc.; εὐφήμου στόμα φροντίδος ἱέντες uttering words of religious thought, i. e. keeping a holy silence, Soph.; so, ὑπʼ εὐφήμου βοῆς, i. e. in silence, Soph.; εὔφημα φώνει, like εὐφήμει, Soph.
in positive sense, auspicious, Aesch., Eur., etc.:—so adv. -μως, with or in words of good omen, Hhymn., Aesch.

div1.head: εὔφθογγος
div1.sense: well-sounding, cheerful, Theogn., Aesch.

div1.head: εὐφιλής
div1.sense: well-loved, Aesch.
act. loving well, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: εὐφίλητος
div1.sense: well-beloved, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐφιλόπαις
div1.sense: the childrenʼs darling, of a lionʼs whelp, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐφιλοτίμητος
div1.sense: ambitious, Arist.

div1.head: εὔφλεκτος
div1.sense: easily set on fire, Xen.

div1.head: εὐφόρητος
div1.sense: easily borne, endurable, τινι Aesch.

div1.head: εὐφόρμιγξ
div1.sense: with beautiful lyre or playing beautifully on it, Anth.

div1.head: εὔφορος
div1.sense: well or patiently borne, Pind.
easy to bear or wear, manageable, light, ὅπλα Xen.
spreading rapidly, of diseases, Luc.
act. bearing well; of a breeze, favourable, Xen.
of the body, active, vigorous, Xen.
able to endure, patient; adv., εὐφόρως Soph.

div1.head: εὔφορτος
div1.sense: well-freighted, well-ballasted, Anth.

div1.head: εὐφραδής
div1.sense: well-expressed: adv., εὐφραδέως ἀγορεύειν to speak in set terms, eloquently, Od.

div1.head: εὐφραδίη
div1.etym: Ionic and poet. for εὐφράδεια, Anth.

div1.head: εὐφραίνω
div1.sense: to cheer, delight, gladden, Hom., Trag., etc.
Pass. to make merry, enjoy oneself, be happy, Od., Hdt.; ἐπί τινι Ar.; ἔν τινι, διά τινος, ἀπό τινος Xen.; c. part., εὐφράνθη ἰδών was rejoiced at seeing, Pind.

div1.head: εὔφραστος
div1.sense: easy to speak or utter, Arist.

div1.head: εὐφρονέων
div1.sense: well-meaning, well-judging, Hom. No Verb εὐφρονέω occurs.

div1.head: εὐφρόνη
div1.sense: the kindly time, euphem. for νύξ, night, Hes., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: εὐφροσύνη
div1.sense: mirth, merriment, Od.:—of a banquet, good cheer, festivity, Od.:—in pl. glad thoughts, Od.; festivities, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: εὐφρόσυνος
div1.sense: adv. -νως, in good cheer, Theogn.

div1.head: εὔφρων
div1.sense: cheerful, gladsome, merry, of persons making merry, Hom., etc.: adv. εὐφρόνως, with good cheer, Pind., etc.
act. cheering, making glad or merry, Il., Aesch., etc.
later, well-minded, favourable, gracious, Pind., Aesch., etc.:—adv., in this sense, Aesch.
= εὔφημος, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐφυής
div1.sense: well-grown, shapely, goodly, Il., Eur.
of good natural disposition, Xen.; of horses and dogs, Xen.
naturally suited or adapted, εἴς or πρός τι Plat.; c. inf., εὐφυὴς λέγειν Aeschin.:— adv. εὐφυῶς Dem.
of good natural parts, clever, Arist.:—adv. εὐφυῶς, Plat.

div1.head: εὐφυΐα
div1.sense: natural goodness of shape, shapeliness, Plut.
good natural parts, cleverness, genius, and morally, goodness of disposition, Arist.

div1.head: εὐφύλακτος
div1.sense: easy to keep or guard, Aesch.:— ἐν εὐφυλάκτῳ εἶναι to be on oneʼs guard, Eur.; εὐφυλακτότερα αὐτοῖς ἐγίγνετο it was easier for them to keep a look-out, Thuc.

div1.head: εὔφυλλος
div1.sense: well-leafed, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: εὐφωνία
div1.sense: goodness of voice, Xen.

div1.head: εὔφωνος
div1.sense: sweet-voiced, musical, Pind., Aesch.
loud-voiced, of a herald, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: εὐχαίτης
div1.sense: with beautiful hair: of trees, with beautiful leaves, Anth.

div1.head: εὔχαλκος
div1.sense: wrought of fine brass or well-wrought in brass, Hom., Aesch.

div1.head: εὔχαρις
div1.sense: pleasing, engaging, winning, gracious, popular, Eur., Plat.:— τὸ εὔχαρι popularity, urbanity, Xen.

div1.head: εὐχαριστέω
div1.sense: to be thankful, return thanks, ap. Dem.

div1.head: εὐχαριστία
div1.sense: thankfulness, gratitude, Decret. ap. Dem.

div1.head: εὐχάριστος
div1.sense: = εὔχαρις, winning, Xen.: of things, agreeable, pleasant, elegant, Xen.:—adv., τελευτᾶν τὸν βίον εὐχαρίστως to die happily, Hdt.
grateful, thankful, Lat. gratus, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: εὔχειρ
div1.sense: quick or ready of hand, expert, dexterous, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: εὐχείρωτος
div1.sense: easy to master or overcome, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: εὐχέρεια
div1.sense: dexterity, Plat., etc.
readiness, proneness, εὐχ. πονηρίας proclivity to evil, Plat.
licentiousness, recklessness, Aesch.

div1.head: εὐχερής
div1.sense: easily handled, easy to deal with, easy, εὐχερές ἐστι, c. inf., Batr.; πάντα ταῦτʼ ἐν εὐχερεῖ ἔθου didst make light of them, Soph.:—adv. -ρῶς, Soph.
of persons, manageable, accommodating, kind, yielding, Soph.:—adv., εὐχερῶς φέρειν Plat., etc.; comp. -έστερον, Xen.
in bad sense, unscrupulous, reckless, Dem.:—adv. -ρῶς, Dem.

div1.head: εὐχετάομαι
div1.etym: only in Epic pres. and imperf. εὐχετόωνται, -όωντο, inf. -άασθαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to pray, Il.; to make vows, Hom.
to boast oneself, profess, brag, boast, c. inf., τίνες ἔμμεναι εὐχετόωνται; Od., etc.; ἐπʼ ἀνδράσιν εὐχ. to glory over them, Od.

div1.head: εὐχή
div1.sense: a prayer, vow, Od., etc.: (but the common Homeric words are εὖχος and εὐχωλή) ; εὐχὴν ἐπιτελέσαι, Lat. vota persolvere, Hdt.; ἀποδιδόναι Xen.; κατὰ χιλίων εὐχὴν ποιήσασθαι χιμάρων to make a vow of a thousand goats, Ar.
a mere wish, an aspiration, as opp. to reality, εὐχαῖς ὅμοια λέγειν to build castles in the air, Plat.
a prayer for evil, i. e. an imprecation, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: εὔχιλος
div1.sense: of a horse, feeding well, Xen.

div1.head: εὐχίμαρος
div1.sense: rich in goats, Anth.

div1.head: εὔχλοος
div1.sense: verdant, Soph.

div1.head: εὔχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to pray, offer prayers, pay oneʼs vows, make a vow, Lat. precari, vota facere, θεῶι or θεοῖς Hom., etc.; πρὸς τοὺς θεούς Xen., etc.:—c. dat. commodi, to pray for one, Il.
c. inf. to pray that, Hom., etc.; also, εὔχ. τοὺς θεοὺς δοῦναι to pray them to give, Xen.
c. acc. objecti, to pray for a thing, long or wish for, Pind., Attic; εὔχ. τινί τι to pray for something for a person, as Soph.
to vow or promise to do, c. inf., Hom., Attic
c. acc. rei, like Lat. vovere, to vow a thing, Aesch., Ar.
to profess loudly, to boast, vaunt, Il.; mostly of something of which one has a right to be proud, πατρὸς ἐξ ἀγαθοῦ γένος εὔχομαι εἶναι Il.
simply to profess or declare, Od.
as a Pass., ἐμοὶ μετρίως εὖκται I have prayed sufficiently, Plat.:—but Soph. uses plup. ηὔγμην in act. sense.

div1.head: εὔχορδος
div1.sense: well-strung, Pind.

div1.head: εὖχος
div1.sense: the thing prayed for, object of prayer, εὖχος δοῦναι, πορεῖν to grant oneʼs prayer, Hom.; εὖχος ἀρέσθαι to obtain it, Il.
a boast, vaunt, Il., Pind.
a vow, votive offering, Anth.

div1.head: εὔχρηστος
div1.sense: easy to make use of, useful, serviceable, Xen., etc.

div1.head: εὔχροος
div1.sense: well-coloured, of good complexion, fresh-looking, healthy, Xen., etc.:—comp. -οώτερος, Xen.

div1.head: εὔχρυσος
div1.sense: rich in gold, of the Pactolus, Soph.

div1.head: εὐχωλή
div1.sense: a prayer, vow, Hom.
a boast, vaunt, Il.: a shout of triumph, Il.
an object of boasting, a boast, glory, κὰδ δέ κεν εὐχωλὴν Πριάμῳ λίποιεν Ἑλένην Il.

div1.head: εὐχωλιμαῖος
div1.sense: bound by a vow, Hdt.

div1.head: εὐψάμαθος
div1.sense: sandy, Anth.

div1.head: εὐψυχέω
div1.sense: to be of good courage, NTest.
imperat. εὐψύχει farewell, Inscr. on tombs, Anth.

div1.head: εὐψυχία
div1.sense: good courage, high spirit, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: εὔψυχος
div1.sense: of good courage, stout of heart, courageous, Lat. animosus, Aesch., etc.; τὸ ἐς τὰ ἔργα εὔψυχον Thuc.; εὐψυχότατοι πρὸς τὸ ἐπιέναι Thuc.:— adv. -χως, Xen.

div1.head: εὐώδης
div1.sense: sweet-smelling, fragrant, Hom., etc.; εὐωδέστατος Hdt.

div1.head: εὐωδία
div1.sense: a sweet smell, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: εὐώδιν
div1.sense: happy as a parent, fruitful, Anth.

div1.head: εὐώλενος
div1.sense: fair-armed, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: εὔωνος
div1.sense: of fair price, cheap (Fr. à bon marché) , Xen., Dem., etc.

div1.head: εὐώνυμος
div1.sense: of good name, honoured, Hes., Pind., etc.
of good omen, prosperous, fortunate, Pind., Plat.
euphemistic for ἀριστερός (which was a word of ill omen), left, on the left hand, Hdt., Soph., etc.; ἐξ εὐωνύμου χειρός or ἐξ εὐωνύμου, on the left, Hdt.

div1.head: εὕω
div1.sense: to singe, of singeing off swineʼs bristles, Hom.

div1.head: εὐῶπις
div1.sense: fair to look on, Od., Pind.

div1.head: εὐωπός
div1.sense: εὐ. πύλαι friendly gates, Eur.

div1.head: εὐωριάζω
div1.sense: to be negligent, Aesch.

div1.head: εὔωρος
div1.sense: careless, τινος about a thing.

div1.head: εὐωχέω
