div1.sense: to treat or feed well, entertain sumptuously, Hdt., Attic: —Mid. to fare sumptuously, feast, Hdt.; κρέα εὐωχ. to feast upon, enjoy, Xen.; of animals, to eat their fill, Ar., Xen.
metaph., εὐωχεῖν τινα καινῶν λόγων to entertain him with novelties, Theophr.: —Mid. to relish, enjoy, c. gen., τοῦ λόγου Plat.

div1.head: εὐωχία
div1.sense: good cheer, feasting, Ar., etc.:—metaph., λόγων εὐωχίαι feasts of reason, Anth.

div1.head: εὐώψ
div1.sense: fair to look on, Soph.

div1.head: ἐφαγιστεύω
div1.sense: to perform obsequies over the grave, Soph.

div1.head: ἐφαγνίζω
div1.sense: τὰ πάντʼ ἐφαγνίσαι to perform all the obsequies, Soph.

div1.head: ἐφαιρέω
div1.sense: Mid. choose as successor, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐφάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to spring upon, assail, c. dat., Τρώεσσιν ἐπάλμενος Il.:—also, without hostile sense, c. gen., ἐπιάλμενος ἵππων having leaped upon the chariot, Il.

div1.head: ἔφαλος
div1.sense: on the sea, of seaports, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἐφάμιλλος
div1.sense: a match for, equal to, rivalling, ἐφ. γίγνεσθαί τινι Xen.
pass. regarded as an object of rivalry or contention, Dem.

div1.head: ἐφανδάνω
div1.sense: to please, be grateful to, c. dat., ἐμοὶ δʼ ἐπιανδάνει οὕτως Il.; τοῖσιν δʼ ἐπιήνδανε μῦθος Od.

div1.head: ἐφάπαξ
div1.sense: once for all, NTest., etc.
at once, at the same time, NTest.

div1.head: ἐφαπλόω
div1.sense: to spread or fold over, Babr.

div1.head: ἐφάπτω
div1.sense: to bind on or to, λύουσα ἢ ʼφάπτουσα undoing or making fast, Soph.; τοὖργον ὡς ἐφάψειεν τόδε that she had made fast (i. e. perpetrated) the deed, Soph.:—Pass., 3rd sg. perf. and plup. ἐφῆπται, -το, is or was hung over one, impends over, is fixed as oneʼs doom, c. dat., Τρώεσσι κήδεʼ ἐφῆπται Il.
Mid. to lay hold of, grasp, reach, c. gen., Od., Theogn., Soph.
to lay hold of with the mind, attain to, Lat. assequi, c. gen., Plat.
in Pind. also c. dat. (like θιγγάνω, ψαύω) , to apply oneself to.
Hdt. uses part. perf. pass. with gen., εἴδεος ἐπαμμένος possessed of a certain degree of beauty.
to follow, come next, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐφαρμόζω
div1.sense: intr. to fit on or to, to fit one, c. dat., Il.
to be adapted to, τινί Arist.
trans. to fit one thing to another, fit on, put on, τί τινι Hes., Theocr.:— Mid. to put on oneself, Anth.
to suit, accommodate, Xen.; πίστιν ἐφαρμόσαι to add fitting assurance, Soph.

div1.head: ἐφαρμοστέος
div1.sense: one must adapt, τί τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἐφέδρα
div1.sense: a sitting by or before a place: a siege, blockade, Lat. obsessio, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐφεδρεία
div1.sense: a sitting by, waiting for oneʼs turn, of pugilists, Plat.: a lying in wait, Plut.

div1.head: ἐφεδρεύω
div1.sense: to sit upon, rest upon, Eur.
to lie by or near, lie in wait, of an enemy waiting to attack, Thuc.; ἐφ. τινί to keep watch over, Eur.: generally, to watch for, Dem.
to halt, Plut.

div1.head: ἐφεδρήσσω
div1.sense: poet. for ἐφεδρεύω to sit by, τινί Anth.

div1.head: ἔφεδρος
div1.sense: sitting or seated upon, c. gen., λεόντων ἔφεδρε, of Cybele, Soph.; ἔφ. ἵππου Eur.
sitting by, at, or near, τῶν πηδαλίων, of a pilot, Plat.; also c. dat., Eur.: absol. close at hand, Soph.
posted in support or reserve, Eur.

lying by, of a third combatant (pugilist or wrestler), who sits by to fight the conqueror, Pind., Ar., Xen.:— μόνος ὢν ἔφεδρος δισσοῖς, i. e. one against two, with no one to take his place if beaten, Aesch.
a successor, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐφέζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to sit upon, c. dat., Hom., Ar.;—also c. gen., Pind.; and c. acc., Aesch., Eur.
to sit by or near, Od., Aesch.

div1.head: ἔφεκτος
div1.sense: containing 1+1/6: τόκος ἔφ. when 1/6 of the principal was paid as interest, = 16 2/3 p. cent., Dem.

div1.head: ἐφέλκω
div1.sense: to draw on, drag or trail after one, ἐπ. τὰς οὐράς, of long-tailed sheep, Hdt.; ἵππον ἐκ τοῦ βραχίονος ἐπ. to lead a horse by a rein upon the arm, Hdt.; ναῦς ὡς ἐφέλξω will take in tow, Eur.
to bring on, bring in its train, Eur.
to drink off, Eur.

Pass., ἐφελκομένοισι πόδεσσι with feet trailing after him, of one who is dragged lifeless away, Il.; ἐφέλκετο ἔγχος, i. e. sticking in his hand, Il.; ἐπελκόμενος trailing behind, of a boat, Hdt.; οἱ ἐπελκόμενοι the stragglers of an army, Hdt.
to be attracted, Hhymn., Thuc.
Mid. to draw to oneself, attract, αὐτὸς γὰρ ἐφέλκεται ἄνδρα σίδηρος the very sight of arms attracts men, i. e. tempts them to use it, Od.
to draw or pull over, Plut.; ἐφ. ὀφρῦς to frown, Anth.
to bring on consequences, Eur., Xen.
to assume, Plat., Theocr.

div1.head: ἐφεξῆς
div1.sense: in order, in a row, one after another, Hdt., Eur., Xen.
c. dat. next to, Plat.
in succession, without exception, πᾶσαν τὴν γῆν ἐφ. Xen.; τὴν Ἑλλάδα πᾶσαν ἐφ. Dem.
of Time, τρεῖς ἡμέρας ἐπεξῆς Hdt.; τέσσαρες ἐφ. Ar.
thereupon, after, εὐθὺς ἐφ. Dem.

div1.head: ἔφεξις
div1.sense: an excuse, pretext, τοῦ ἔφεξιν; = τίνος χάριν; Ar.

div1.head: ἐφέπω
div1.sense: to go after, follow, pursue, c. acc., Il.
to drive on, urge on, ἵππους ἐφέπων μάστιγι Il.; and c. dat. pers., Πατρόκλῳ ἔφεπε ἵππους drove them against him, Il.
to follow a pursuit, busy oneself about it, c. acc., Hom.; ἐφ. Θήβας to administer, govern it, Aesch.
c. acc. loci, to search, explore, traverse, Lat. obire, Hom., Hes.
to come suddenly upon, encounter, incur, πότμον ἐπισπεῖν Hom.; ὀλέθριον ἦμαρ ἐπ. Il.
Mid. to follow, pursue, c. dat., Od., Hdt., etc.
to follow, accompany, attend, Il., Hdt.; ἐπισπέσθαι ποσίν to follow on foot, i. e. keep up with, Hdt.; εἴ οἱ τύχη ἐπίσποιτο if fortune attend him, Hdt.:—absol., Thuc.

to obey, attend to, θεοῦ ὀμφῇ Od.; ἐπισπόμενοι μένεϊ σφῷ giving the reins to their passion, Od.; βουλῇ ἐπισπέσθαι πατρός Aesch., etc.:—absol., ὁ ἐπισπόμενος, opp. to ὁ πείσας, Thuc.:—also to agree, approve, in tmesi, ἐπὶ δʼ ἕσπωνται θεοὶ ἄλλοι Od.
to follow an argument, Plat.

div1.head: ἐφέρπω
div1.note: but the aor1 in use is ἐφείρπυσα
div1.sense: to creep upon, Ar.
poet. to come on or over, come gradually or stealthily upon, τινά Aesch.; ἐπʼ ὄσσοισι νὺξ ἐφέρπει Eur.
absol. to go forth, proceed, Aesch.; in part. advancing, future, Pind.

div1.head: Ἐφέσια
div1.sense: the feast of Ephesian Artemis, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐφέσιμος
div1.sense: δίκη, a suit in which there was the right of appeal, Dem.

div1.head: ἔφεσις
div1.sense: a throwing or hurling at, a shooting, Plat.
as Attic law-term, an appeal to another court, Dem.
(ἐφίεμαι) appetite, desire, Arist.

div1.head: ἐφέσπερος
div1.sense: western, Soph.

div1.head: ἐφέστιος
div1.sense: at oneʼs own fireside, at home, Od.; ἐφέστιοι ὅσσοι ἔασιν as many as have a home of their own, Il.; ἐφέστιον πῆξαι σκῆπτρον (i. e. ἐπὶ τῇ ἑστίᾳ) Soph.:—of suppliants who claim protection by sitting by the fireside, Hdt.; δόμων ἐφ. an inmate of the temple, Aesch.; also merely of guests, Soph.

generally, of or in the house or family, Lat. domesticus, πόνοι δόμων ἐφέστιοι Aesch.; ἐφ. δόμοι the chambers of the house, Aesch.:—Ionic ἐπίστιον, ου, τό, a household, family, Hdt.: — θεοὶ ἐφ. the household gods, Lat. Lares or Penates, Ζεὺς ἐπίστιος, ἐφέστιος, as presiding over hospitality, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἐφεστρίς
div1.sense: an upper garment, wrapper, Xen., Plut.

div1.head: ἐφέτης
div1.sense: a commander, Aesch.
ἐφέται, οἱ, at Athens, the Ephetae, a court of Eupatridae, created by Draco to try cases of homicide, Plut.

div1.head: ἐφετμή
div1.sense: a command, behest, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἐφευρετής
div1.sense: an inventor, contriver, NTest.

div1.head: ἐφευρίσκω
div1.sense: to light upon, discover, Od.; with a partic. to find one doing so and so, Hom., Soph.:—so in Pass., μὴ ἐπευρεθῇ πρήσσων Hdt.
to invent or bring in besides, generally to invent, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: ἐφεψιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to mock or scoff at, τινι, Lat. illudere, Epic 3rd pl. ἐφεψιόωνται Od.

div1.head: ἐφηβάω
div1.sense: to come to manʼs estate, grow up to manhood, Hdt., Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: ἐφηβεία
div1.sense: puberty, manʼs estate, Anth.

div1.head: ἐφήβειος
div1.sense: youthful, Anth.

div1.head: ἐφηβικός
div1.sense: of or for an ἔφηβος, Theocr.

div1.head: ἔφηβος
div1.sense: one arrived at puberty (ἥβη) a youth of 18 years when the Athen. youth underwent his δοκιμασία and was registered as a citizen, Xen., etc.
a throw on the dice, Anth.

div1.head: ἐφηβοσύνη
div1.sense: the age of an ἔφηβος, puberty, Anth.

div1.head: ἐφηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to lead to a place: esp. to lead the magistrate to a house where a criminal lay concealed, Dem.

div1.head: ἐφήδομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to exult over a person, τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἐφήκω
div1.sense: to have arrived, Soph., Thuc.
ὅσον ἂν ἡ μόρα ἐφήκῃ so far as the division reaches, so much space as it occupies, Xen.

div1.head: ἔφημαι
div1.etym: perf. pass. used as a pres.
div1.sense: to be set or seated on, to sit on, θρόνῳ Od.; also c. gen., θινὸς ἐφήμενος Soph.:— to be seated at or in, δόμοις Aesch.: —also c. acc., βρέτας ἐφήμενος Aesch.
to act as assessor (cf. ἔφεδρος) , Παλλὰς οἵ τ’ ἐφήμενοι Aesch.

div1.head: ἐφημερία
div1.sense: ἐφʼ ἡμέραν, for the daily service of the temple, NTest.

div1.head: ἐφημέριος
div1.sense: on, for or during the day, the day through, Od.; by day, Pind.
for a day only, for the day, ἐφημέρια φρονέοντες taking thought for the day only, Od.:—often of men, ἐφημέριοι creatures of a day, Aesch., etc.
hired for the day, Theogn.

div1.head: ἐφημερίς
div1.sense: a diary, journal, such as Caesarʼs Commentarii, Plut.

div1.head: ἐφήμερος
div1.sense: living but a day, short-lived, Pind., Eur., etc.
of men, ἐφήμεροι creatures of a day, Pind., Aesch.
for the day, daily, Plut., etc.
φάρμακον ἐφ. killing on the same day, Plut.

div1.head: ἑφθημιμερής
div1.sense: containing seven halves, i. e. 3 1/2, of the first 3 1/2 feet of a Hexameter or Iambic Trimeter.

div1.head: ἑφθός
div1.sense: boiled, dressed, Hdt., Eur., etc.
ἑφθὸς χρυσός refined gold, Simon.

div1.head: ἐφίδρωσις
div1.sense: superficial perspiration, Plut.

div1.head: ἐφιζάνω
div1.sense: to sit at or in a place, c. dat., Il.; ὕπνος ἐπὶ βλεφάροισιν ἐφίζανεν sleep sate upon, Il.

div1.head: ἐφίζω
div1.sense: Causal, in Epic aor1, to set upon, ἐφέσσαι to set me ashore, Od.:—Mid., γούνασιν οἷσιν ἐφεσσάμενος having set [me] on his knees, Od.; imperat., ἔφεσσαί με νηός set me on board the ship, Od.
intr. in pres. and imperf. ἐφῖζον, Ionic ἐφίζεσκον, to sit at or by, Od., Pind., etc.

div1.head: ἐφίημι
div1.etym: 3rd sg. imperf. ἐφίει as if from ἐφιέω
div1.sense: to send to one, Il.
c. inf. to set on or incite to do, ἐφέηκε ἀεῖσαι Od.; ἐφ. τινὰ χαλεπῆναι, etc., Il.
of things, to throw or launch at one, ὅς τοι ἐφῆκε βέλος Il., etc.; ἐφ. οἰστὸν ἐπί τινι Eur.; ἐφ. χεῖράς τινι to lay hands on him, Od.
of events, destinies, etc., to send upon one, τοῖσιν πότμον ἐφῆκεν Il., etc.
to send against, in hostile sense, Hdt., etc.:— ἐφ. τὸν ποταμὸν ἐπὶ τὴν χώρην Hdt.; ἐφῆκας γλῶσσαν didʼst let loose, Eur.
to throw into, ἐς λέβητʼ ἐφῆκεν μέλη Eur.
to let go, loosen, esp. the rein, Plat.:—hence to give up, yield, Lat. concedere, τινὶ τὴν ἡγεμονίαν Thuc.:—c. inf. to permit, allow, τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Hdt., Soph., etc.
to give up, leave as a prey, Soph.:—then, seemingly, intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) , to give oneself up to, οὐρίᾳ a fair wind, Plat.
to put the male to the female, Hdt.
as law-term, to leave to another to decide, δίκας ἐφ. εἴς τινα Dem.:—and absol. to appeal, εἰς τοὺς δικαστάς Dem.
Mid. to lay oneʼs command or behest upon, Hom., Aesch., etc.:—c. inf., ἐφ. τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Soph., Ar.; ἐς Λακεδαίμονα to send orders to L., Thuc.
to allow or permit one to do, Soph., etc.
c. gen. to aim at, Arist.:— to long after, desire, Soph., Eur., etc.; c. inf. to desire to do, Eur.

div1.head: ἐφικνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to reach at, aim at, c. gen., Il., Plat., etc.
to reach or extend, ἐφʼ ὅσον μνήμη ἐφ. Xen., etc.
metaph. to hit or touch the right points, Lat. rem acu tangere, τῷ λόγῳ ἐφ. τῶν ἐκεῖ κακῶν Dem.;—so, ἐς τὰ ἄλλα ἐπίκεο Hdt.
to reach, gain, attain to, ἀνδραγαθίας Aeschin., etc.
c. acc. to come upon, εἴ σε μοῖρʼ ἐφίκοιτο Pind.; dupl. acc., ἐπικέσθαι πληγὰς τὸν Ἑλλήσποντον to visit it with blows, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐφικτός
div1.sense: easy to reach, accessible, Plut.

div1.head: ἐφιμείρω
div1.sense: c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ἐφίμερος
div1.sense: longed for, desired, charming, Hes., Aesch.; c. inf., ἐφ. προσλεύσσειν Soph.

div1.head: ἐφιππάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to ride upon, Luc.

div1.head: ἐφιππεύω
div1.sense: to ride upon, Babr.

div1.head: ἐφίππιος
div1.sense: for putting on a horse, Xen.:— ἐφίππιον (sc. στρῶμα) a saddle-cloth, Xen.

div1.head: ἔφιππος
div1.sense: on horseback, riding: ἀνδριὰς ἔφ. an equestrian statue, Plut.
κλύδων ἔφιππος a rushing wave of horses, Soph.

div1.head: ἐφίστημι
div1.sense: Causal in pres., imperf., fut., and aor1:
to set or place upon, τί τινι Thuc.; τι ἐπί τινι Xen.: metaph., ἐφ. μοῖραν βίῳ Plat.
to set over, Lat. praeficere, ἐφ. τινὰ ὕπαρχόν τισι Hdt., etc.
to set up, establish, institute games, Hdt.
to set by or near to, ἱππέας ἐπιστήσαντες κύκλῳ τὸ σῆμα ( = περὶ τὸ σ.) Hdt.
to stop, make halt, Lat. inhibere, Xen.: —absol., ἐπιστήσας (sc. ἑαυτόν, τὸν ἵππον) having halted, Xen.
ἐφίστημι τὴν γνώμην κατά τι to fix oneʼs mind upon it, attend to it, and then absol. to give attention, Arist.
c. acc. pers. to arrest the attention of, Plut.
intr. in Mid. and Pass., ἐφίσταμαι, aor1 ἐπεστάθην, with perf., plup. and aor2 act.:— to stand upon, πύργῳ, δίφρῳ, ἐπὶ βηλῷ Il.
to be imposed upon, τινι Soph.
to stand on the top or surface, τὸ ἐπιστάμενον τοῦ γάλακτος, i. e. cream, Hdt.
to be set over, Lat. praeesse, c. dat., Aesch., etc.; also c. gen., Hdt., Eur.:—absol. to be in authority, Hdt., etc.
to stand by or near, ἀλλήλοισι Il., etc.: of dreams or visions, to appear to, εὕδοντι ἐπέστη ὄνειρος Hdt.
in hostile sense, to stand against, oppose, Hom.: to come upon by surprise, Thuc.
of events, to impend, be at hand, Lat. instare, Κῆρες ἐφεστᾶσιν θανάτοιο Il.; πρίν μοι τύχη ἐπέστη Soph.
to halt, stop, as in a march, Xen.:— c. gen., ἐπ. τοῦ πλοῦ Thuc.
to fix oneʼs mind on, give oneʼs attention to, τινι Eur., Dem.
the aor1 mid. is used in causal sense, to set up, τὰς θύρας Xen.: to set, post, φρουρούς Xen.

div1.head: ἐφοδεύω
div1.sense: to visit, go the rounds, patrol, Xen.:—Pass., ἐφοδεύεται the rounds are made, Ar.
c. dat. to watch over, ἀγῶσιν Aesch.

div1.head: ἐφοδιάζω
div1.sense: to furnish with supplies for a journey, Lat. viaticum dare, Hdt.
Mid., πενταδραχμίαν ἑκάστῳ ἐφοδιασάμενος having seen that five drachms were paid to each, Xen.:—metaph. to maintain, ἀργίαν Plut.

div1.head: ἐφόδιον
div1.sense: , like Lat. viaticum, supplies for travelling, money and provisions, Hdt., Dem.:—of an ambassadorʼs travelling-allowance, Ar.; sometimes in sg., Thuc., Xen.
generally, ways and means, maintenance, support, ἐφόδια τῷ γήρᾳ Dem.; of public money, μιᾶς ἡμέρας ἐφόδια ἐν τῷ κοινῷ Dem.

div1.head: ἔφοδος
div1.sense: accessible, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔφοδος2
div1.sense: one who goes the rounds, Xen.

div1.head: ἔφοδος3
div1.sense: a way towards, approach, Thuc., Xen.:— access for traffic and intercourse, communication, παρʼ ἀλλήλους Thuc.
importation, Xen.
an onset, attack, assault, Aesch., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἐφόλκαιον
div1.sense: a rudder, Od.

div1.head: ἐφόλκιον
div1.sense: a tow-boat: metaph an appendage, Anth., Plut.

div1.head: ἐφολκίς
div1.sense: a burdensome appendage, Eur.

div1.head: ἐφολκός
div1.sense: drawing on or towards, enticing, alluring, Thuc.
requiring to be drawn on, a laggard, Ar.

div1.head: ἐφομαρτέω
div1.sense: to follow close after, Il.

div1.head: ἐφοπλίζω
div1.sense: to equip, get ready, prepare, Hom.; so in Mid., δόρπα τʼ ἐφοπλισόμεσθα we will get ready our suppers, Il.
to arm against, τινά τινι, so in Mid., Anth.

div1.head: ἐφορατικός
div1.sense: fit for overlooking, ἔργων Xen.

div1.head: ἐφοράω
div1.sense: to oversee, observe, survey, of the sun, Hom.:—then of the gods, to watch over, observe, take notice of, Od., Hdt., etc.; of a general going his rounds, Thuc.; to visit the sick, Xen.
simply, to look upon, view, behold, Od., etc.:—Pass., ὅσον ἐφεωρᾶτο τῆς νήσου as much of it as was in view, Thuc.
to look out, choose, ἐπιόψομαι ἥτις ἀρίστη Od., etc.

div1.head: ἐφορεία
div1.sense: the ephoralty, Xen.

div1.head: ἐφορεῖον
div1.sense: the court of the ephors, Xen.

div1.head: ἐφορεύω
div1.sense: = ἐφοράω, c. acc., Aesch.; c. gen., Aesch.
to be ephor, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἐφορικός
div1.sense: of or for the ephori, Xen.

div1.head: ἐφόριος
div1.sense: on the border or frontier, ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἐφορμαίνω
div1.sense: to rush on, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐφορμάω
div1.sense: to stir up, rouse against one, Hom.; ἐπορμῆσαι τοὺς λύκους to set them on, Hdt.; ναύτας ἐφορμήσαντα τὸ πλεῖν having urged them on to sail, Soph.
intr. to rush upon, attack, τινί Eur.

Pass. and Mid. to be stirred up; c. inf. to be eager or desire to do, Hom.:—absol. to rush furiously on, ἔγχει ἐφορμᾶσθαι Il.; ἐφορμηθείς Il.; and, without hostile sense, to spring forward, Od.:— c. acc. to rush upon, make a dash at, Il.

div1.head: ἐφορμέω
div1.sense: to lie moored at or over against a place, to blockade it, λαθὼν τοὺς ἐπορμέοντας having escaped the blockading fleet, Hdt.; ἐφ. τῷ λιμένι Thuc.
generally, to lie by and watch, Soph., Dem.

div1.head: ἐφορμή
div1.sense: a way of attack, μία δʼ οἴη γίγνετʼ ἐφορμή only room for one to attack, Od.
an assault, attack, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐφόρμησις
div1.sense: a lying at anchor so as to watch an enemy, blockading, Thuc.: a means of so doing, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐφορμίζω
div1.sense: to bring a ship to its moorings (ὅρμος) :—Mid. and Pass. to come to anchor, Thuc.
intr. in Act. to seek refuge in a place, c. dat., Anth.

div1.head: ἔφορμος
div1.sense: at anchor, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔφορος
div1.sense: an overseer, guardian, ruler, Aesch., Soph.
at Sparta, ἔφοροι, οἱ, the Ephors, a body of five magistrates, who controlled even the kings, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἐφυβρίζω
div1.sense: to insult over one, Il.; c. dat., Soph.; c. acc., in Mid., μὴ ʼφυβρίζεσθαι νεκρούς Eur.; ἐφύβριζον ἄλλα τε καὶ εἰ they used insulting language, asking especially whether, Thuc.
to exult maliciously over, Soph.

div1.head: ἐφυδριάς
div1.sense: of the water, Νύμφη Anth.

div1.head: ἔφυδρος
div1.sense: wet, moist, rainy, of the west wind, Od.
well-watered, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐφυμνέω
div1.sense: to sing or chant after or over, τί τινι Aesch., Soph.
to sing a dirge besides, Soph.
to sing of, descant on, c. acc., Soph.

div1.head: ἐφύπερθε
div1.sense: above, atop, above, Hom.:— from above, Od.:—c. gen., Theocr.

div1.head: ἐφυπνόω
div1.sense: to sleep meantime, Aesop.

div1.head: Ἐφύρα
div1.sense: Ephyra, old name of Corinth, Il.

div1.head: ἐφυστερίζω
div1.sense: to come later, τὰ ἐφυστερίζοντα αἱ ὑστεροῦσαι πόλεις, Thuc.

div1.head: ἐφύω
div1.sense: to rain upon:—perf. pass. part. ἐφυσμένος rained upon, exposed to the rain, Xen.

div1.head: ἐφώριος
div1.sense: mature, Anth.

div1.head: ἐχέγγυος
div1.sense: having given or able to give security, trust-worthy, secure, Eur.; ζημία ἐχ. a penalty to be relied on (for the prevention of crime), Thuc.: τὸ ἐχέγγυον security, Hdt.: c. inf. sufficiently strong to do, Plut.
pass. having received a pledge, secured against danger, Soph.

div1.head: ἐχέθυμος
div1.sense: master of oneʼs passion, Od.

div1.head: ἐχεμυθέω
div1.sense: to hold oneʼs peace, Luc.

div1.head: ἐχεμυθία
div1.sense: silence, reserve, Plut.

div1.head: ἐχενηΐς
div1.sense: ship-detaining, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: ἐχεπευκής
div1.sense: Homeric epith. of a dart, bitter, or rather sharp-pointed, piercing, Il.

div1.head: ἐχέστονος
div1.sense: bringing sorrows, Theocr.

div1.head: ἐχέτης
div1.sense: = ὁ ἔχων, a man of substance, Pind.

div1.head: ἐχετλήεις
div1.sense: of or belonging to a ploughhandle, Anth.

div1.head: ἐχεφρονέω
div1.sense: to be prudent, Anth.

div1.head: ἐχέτλη
div1.sense: a plough-handle, Lat. stiva, Hes.

div1.head: ἐχεφροσύνη
div1.sense: prudence, good sense, Anth.

div1.head: ἐχέφρων
div1.sense: sensible, prudent, discreet, Hom.

div1.head: ἐχθαίρω
div1.sense: to hate, detest, Hom., Trag.; c. acc. cogn., ἔχθος ἐχθήρας μέγα hating with great hatred, Soph.:—Pass. to be hated, hateful, Trag.; so in fut. mid., ἐχθαρεῖ μὲν ἐξ ἐμοῦ Soph.

div1.head: ἐχθαρτέος
div1.sense: to be hated, Soph.

div1.head: ἐχθεσινός
div1.sense: yesterdayʼs, Anth.

div1.head: ἐχθές
div1.sense: yesterday, Ar.; ἀπʼ ἐχθές Anth.; νῦν τε κἀχθές to-day or yesterday, Soph.; cf. πρώην.

div1.head: ἔχθιστος
div1.sense: most hated, most hateful, Il., Trag.
most hostile, Thuc.; c. gen., as if a Subst., οἱ ἐκείνου ἔχθ. his bitterest enemies, Xen.

div1.head: ἐχθίων
div1.sense: more hated, more hateful, Trag. adv., ἐχθιόνως ἔχειν to be more hostile, Xen.

div1.head: ἐχθοδοπέω
div1.sense: in hostility with another, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: ἐχθοδοπός
div1.sense: hateful, detestable, Soph., Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἔχθος
div1.sense: hate, hatred, Hom., etc.; ἔχθος τινός hatred for one, Hdt., Thuc.; ἐς ἔχθος ἀπικέσθαι τινί to incur his hatred or enmity, Hdt.; εἰς ἔχθος ἐλθεῖν τινί Eur.
of persons, ὦ πλεῖστον ἔχθος object of direst hate, Aesch.

div1.head: ἐχθραίνω
div1.sense: to hate, Xen., Plut.

div1.head: ἔχθρα
div1.sense: hatred, enmity, Hdt., Attic; ἔχθρα τινός hatred for, enmity to one, Thuc.; κατʼ ἔχθραν τινός Ar.; ἔχθρα ἔς τινα Hdt.; ἔχθρα πρός τινα Aesch.; διʼ ἔχθρας ἀφικέσθαι, ἐλθεῖν τινί to be at feud with one, Eur., etc.; ἔχθραν συμβάλλειν, συνάπτειν τινί to engage in hostility with . . , Eur.; ἔχθραν λύειν, διαλύεσθαι Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἐχθροδαίμων
div1.sense: hated of the gods, Soph.

div1.head: ἐχθρόξενος
div1.sense: hostile to guests, inhospitable, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἐχθρός
div1.sense: hated, hateful, Hom., etc.; ἐχθρόν μοί ἐστιν, c. inf., ʼtis hateful to me to . . , Il.
act. hostile, at enmity with, τινι Thuc., etc.
as Subst., ἐχθρός, ὁ, oneʼs enemy, Hes., etc.; ὁ Διὸς ἐχθρός Aesch.; οἱ ἐμοὶ ἐχθροί Thuc.
the regul. comp. and Sup. ἐχθρότερος, -τατος are rare: the irreg. ἐχθίων, ἔχθιστος being more used.
adv. ἐχθρῶς, Plat., etc.; comp. ἐχθροτέρως, Dem.

div1.head: ἔχθω
div1.sense: to hate, Soph., Eur.:—Pass. to be hated, detested, Hom., Aesch.

div1.head: ἐχιδναῖος
div1.sense: of or like a viper, Anth.

div1.head: ἔχιδνα
div1.sense: an adder, viper, Hdt., Trag., etc.; metaph. of a treacherous wife or friend, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: Ἐχῖναι
div1.sense: the islands in the Ionian sea, Il., Eur., etc.; commonly called Ἐχινάδες.

div1.head: ἐχινέες
div1.sense: a kind of mouse with bristly hair, in Libya, Hdt.

div1.head: ἐχῖνος
div1.sense: the urchin, hedgehog, Ar., etc.
the sea-urchin, Plat.
the shell of the sea-urchin, often used as a cup: then like Lat. testa, a pot, jug, pitcher, Lat. echinus, Ar., etc.:— the vase in which the notes of evidence were deposited, Dem.
in pl. sharp points at each end of a bit, Xen.

div1.head: ἔχις
div1.sense: an adder, viper, Plat.; metaph., συκοφάντης καὶ ἔχις τὴν φύσιν Dem.

div1.head: ἔχμα
div1.sense: that which holds; and so,
a hindrance, obstacle, Il.
c. gen. a bulwark, defence against a thing, c. gen., Hhymn.
a hold-fast, stay, ἔχματα πέτρης bands of rock, Il.; ἔχματα πύργων stays of the towers, Il.; ἔχματα νηῶν props for the ships, to keep them upright, Il.

div1.head: ἐχυρός
div1.sense: strong, secure, of Places, Thuc., etc.; ἐν ἐχυρῷ εἶναι to be in safety, Thuc.; ἐν ἐχυρωτάτῳ ποιεῖσθαί τι Xen.
of reasons, etc., trustworthy, Thuc.
adv. -ρῶς, Thuc.; comp. -ώτερον, Thuc.

div1.head: ἔχω
div1.etym: for the poet. form ἔσχεθον v. *σχέθω
the aor2 mid. is also used in pass. sense.
div1.sense: Trans., in two senses, to have or to hold:
to have, possess, Hom., etc.; ὁ ἔχων a wealthy man, Soph.; οἱ οὐκ ἔχοντες the poor, Eur.:—c. gen. partit., μαντικῆς ἔχ. τέχνης Soph.:—Pass. to be possessed by, belong to, τινι Il.
to have charge of, keep, πύλας Il.; φυλακὰς ἔχον kept watch, Il., etc.
c. acc. loci, to dwell in, inhabit, haunt, Hom., etc.
to have to wife, Hom., etc.
to have in oneʼs house, to entertain, Od.
the pres. part. is joined with a Verb, ἔχων ἀτίταλλε kept and made much of, i. e. kept with special care, Il.; ὃς ἂν ἥκηι ἔχων στρατόν whoever may have come with an army, Hdt.
of Habits or Conditions, γῆρας ἔχ., periphr. for γηράσκειν, Od.
like Lat. teneo, to know, understand, Il., Aesch.; ἔχεις τι; tenes? dʼ ye understand? Ar.
to involve, imply, give cause for, ἀγανάκτησιν Thuc.
ἔχειν σταθμόν to weigh so much, Hdt.
to hold, Hom., etc.; ἔχ. ἐν χερσίν Hdt.; μετὰ χερσίν Il.; διὰ χειρός Soph., etc.
to hold fast, ἔχειν τινὰ χειρός, ποδός to hold him by the hand, by the foot, Il.; ἔχειν τινὰ μέσον to grip one by the middle, of wrestlers, Ar.
of a woman, to be pregnant, Lat. utero gestare, Hdt.; ἐν γαστρὶ ἔχειν Hdt.
to hold out, bear up against, support, sustain an attack, Lat. sustinere; in which sense Hom. uses fut. σχήσω, σχήσομαι.
to hold fast, keep close, as bars do a gate, Il.: to enclose, Hom.

to hold or keep in a certain direction, like ἐπέχω, ὀϊστὸν ἔχε he aimed it, Il.; of horses or ships, to guide, drive, steer, Il.; then absol., τῆι ῥʼ ἔχε that way he held his course, Il.:—also to put in, land, εἰς or πρὸς τόπον Hdt.; δεῦρο νοῦν ἔχε attend to this, Eur.; πρός τι τὸν νοῦν ἔχ. Thuc.
to hold in, stay, keep back, ἵππους Il., etc.; οὐ σχήσει χεῖρας will not withhold his hands, Od.; ὀδύνας ἔχ. to allay, assuage them, Il., etc.
to keep away from, c. gen. rei, τινὰ ἀγοράων, νεῶν Il.:—in Attic to stop or hinder from doing, τοῦ μὴ καταδῦναι Xen.; ἔσχον μὴ κατανεῖν Eur.
to keep back, withhold a thing, χρήματα Od., etc.
to hold in guard, keep safe, protect, Il.
c. inf. to have means or power to do, to be able, c. inf., Hom., etc.:—with inf. omitted, οὔπως εἶχε he could not, Il.
after Hom., οὐκ ἔχω ὅπως I know not how, etc., Soph., etc.; οὐκ ἔχω ὅ τι χρὴ λέγειν Xen.

intr. to hold oneself, to keep so and so, ἕξω, ὡς ὅτε τις λίθος . . I will hold fast, as a stone . . , Od.; σχὲς οὗπερ εἶ keep where thou art, Soph.; ἔχειν κατὰ χώραν to keep in oneʼs place, Ar., etc.; διὰ φυλακῆς ἔχειν to keep on oneʼs guard, Thuc.
c. gen. to keep from, πολέμου Thuc.
c. gen., also, to take part in, have to do with, τέχνης Soph.: to be engaged or busy, ἀμφί τι Aesch.; περί τι Xen.

simply to be, often with Advs. of manner, εὖ ἔχει Od.; καλῶς ἔχει, κακῶς ἔχει, Lat. bene habet, male habet, it is going on well, Attic; οὕτως ἔχει so the case stands, Ar., etc.:—a gen. modi is often added, εὖ ἔχειν τινός to be well off for a thing, abound in it, Hdt.; ὡς ποδῶν εἶχον as fast as they could go, Hdt.; ὥς τις εὐνοίας ἢ μνήμης ἔχοι as each man felt disposed or remembered, Thuc.
to lead towards, ἐπὶ τὸν ποταμόν Hdt.; ἔχ. εἴς τι, to point towards, tend towards, Hdt.; τὸ ἐς Ἀργείους ἔχον what concerns them, Hdt.; also, ἔπʼ ὅσον ἔποψις εἶχε so far as the view extended, Hdt.
ἐπί τινι ἔχειν to have hostile feelings towards . . , Hdt., Soph.

after Hom., ἔχω is joined with aor. part. of another Verb, κρύψαντες ἔχουσι for κεκρύφασι, Hes.; ἀποκληΐσας ἔχεις for ἀποκέκλεικας, Hdt.;—sometimes it gives a pres. sense to the aor., as, θαυμάσας ἔχω I am in a state of wonderment, Soph.; ὅς σφε νῦν ἀτιμάσας ἔχει who now treats her with dishonour, Eur.
the part. ἔχων, with the pres., adds a notion of duration, as, τί κυπτάζεις ἔχων; why do you keep poking about there? Ar.; φλυαρεῖς, ληρεῖς ἔχων you keep chattering, trifling, Plat.
pleonast., ἐστὶν ἔχον ἔχει, Hdt.; εστὶν ἀναγκαίως ἔχον ἔχει ἀναγκαίως, Aesch.
Mid. to hold on by, cling to, c. gen., Hom., etc.
metaph. to cleave or cling to, ἔργου Hdt.; ἐλπίδος Eur.; τῆς αὐτῆς γνώμης Thuc.: to lay claim to a thing, Hdt.; to be zealous for, μάχης Soph.

to come next to, follow closely, Xen.; τῆς πληγῆς ἔχεται follows up the blow, Dem.:—of peoples or places, to be close, touch, border on, τινος Hdt., etc.; οἱ ἐχόμενοι the neighbouring people, Hdt.: of Time, τὸ ἐχόμενον ἔτος the next year, Thuc.
to depend on, τινος or ἔκ τινος Hom.
to pertain to, τινος Hdt.
to bear or hold for oneself, Hom.
to maintain oneself, hold oneʼs ground, Il.
c. acc. to keep off from oneself, repel, Il.
to stop oneself, stop, Il.:— to keep oneself back, abstain or refrain from, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἑψάνδρα
div1.sense: cooking men, of Medea, Anth.

div1.head: ἕψημα
div1.sense: anything boiled: pl. vegetables for kitchen use, Plat.

div1.head: ἕψησις
div1.sense: a boiling, Hdt.

div1.head: ἑψητήρ
div1.sense: a pan for boiling, Anth.

div1.head: ἑψητός
div1.sense: boiled, Xen.: ἑψητοί, ῶν, οἱ, boiled fish, Ar.

div1.head: ἑψιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to play with pebbles, generally, to amuse oneself, ἑψιαάσθων (Epic 3rd dual imperat.), Od.; ἑψιάασθαι μολπῇ καὶ φόρμιγγι (Epic inf.) Od.

div1.head: ε
div1.sense: Ε, ε, fifth letter of the Gr. alphabet: as numeral εʹ = πέντε and πέμπτος, but ͵ε 5000. The ancients called this vowel εἶ ( as they called ο, οὖ). When in the archonship of Euclides ( B. C. 403) the Athenians adopted long e (Η η) from the Samian alphabet, the Gramm. gave to short e the name of ἒ ψιλόν, i. e. ε without the aspirate, because Η had been used for the aspirate. In Ionic, ε sometimes stood for α, βέρεθρον ἔρσην τέσσερες for βάραθρον ἄρσην τέσσαρες, and in contr. Verbs in -άω, as ὁρέω φοιτέω.

div1.head: ἕψω
div1.sense: to boil, seethe, Hdt., Attic: proverb. of useless labour, λίθον ἕψεις Ar.; c. gen. partit., ἥψομεν τοῦ κορκόρου we boiled some pimpernel, Ar.:—Pass. to be boiled, Hdt.
of metals, to smelt, refine, Pind.
metaph., γῆρας ἀνώνυμον ἕψειν to cherish an inglorious age, Pind.

div1.head: ἕωθεν
div1.sense: from morn, i. e. at earliest dawn, early in the morning, Plat.; ἕ. εὐθύς Ar.
αὔριον ἕ. to-morrow early, Xen.; so ἕωθεν alone, Ar.

div1.head: ἑωθινός
div1.sense: in the morning, early, Hdt., Ar.: —τὸ ἑωθινόν, as adv., early in the morning, Hdt.; so, ἐξ ἑωθινοῦ ἕωθεν, Xen.

div1.head: ἑωλοκρασία
div1.sense: a mixture of the dregs and heel-taps, with which the drunken were dosed at the end of a revel; metaph., ἑωλοκρασίαν μου τῆς πονηρίας κατασκεδάσας having discharged the stale dregs of his rascality over me, Dem.

div1.head: ἕωλος
div1.sense: a day old, kept till the morrow, stale, Comici; ἕωλος θρυαλλίς a stinking wick (after the lamp has been blown out), Luc.
of actions or events, stale, out of date, Dem.
of men, coming a day too late, Plut.

div0.div1: ἕωμενἐπεί κʼ ἔωμεν πολέμοιο when we have enough of war:—, 1st pl. subj. of ἄω , II. to take oneʼs fill of a thing.

div1.head: ἑῷος
div1.sense: in or of the morning, at morn, early, πάχνη ἑῴα the morning rime, Aesch.; ἑῷος ἐξαναστῆναι to get up early, Eur.
eastern, Xen.

div1.head: ἐώρα
div1.sense: collat. form of αἰώρα, a halter, Soph.

div1.head: ἕως
div1.sense: until, till, Lat. donec, dum, Hom.:—in Hom. sometimes used = τέως, for a time:—to express a fact, ἕως is foll. by Ind., εἷος φίλον ὤλεσε θυμόν Il.; when the event is uncertain, by the opt., ἕως ὅ γε μιγείη till he should reach, Od.
ἕως ἄν or κε with Subj., relating to an uncertain event in future time, μαχήσομαι, εἵως κε κιχείω till I find, Il.
while, so long as, εἵως πολεμίζομεν Od.; ἕως ἔτι ἐλπίς ἦν Thuc.

as adv., Lat. usque, mostly with Advs. of Time, ἕως ὅτε, Lat. usque dum, till the time when, Xen.; so, ἕως οὗ Hdt.; ἕως ὀψέ till late, Thuc.:—c. gen., ἕως τοῦ ἀποτῖσαι till he made payment, ap. Aeschin.

div1.head: ἕωσπερ
div1.sense: even until, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἑωσφόρος
div1.sense: bringer of morn, Lat. Lucifer, the Morning-star.
